  6384     memcpy (gc_ext->clip_rects, rectangles, sizeof (XRectangle) * n);
  6385   }
  6386 #endif
  6387 }
  6388 
  6389 static void
  6390 x_reset_clip_rectangles (struct frame *f, GC gc)
  6391 {
  6392   XSetClipMask (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc, None);
  6393 #if defined USE_CAIRO || defined HAVE_XRENDER
  6394   {
  6395     struct x_gc_ext_data *gc_ext = x_gc_get_ext_data (f, gc, 0);
  6396 
  6397     if (gc_ext)
  6398       gc_ext->n_clip_rects = 0;
  6399   }
  6400 #endif
  6401 }
  6402 
  6403 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
  6404 # if !defined USE_CAIRO && (RENDER_MAJOR > 0 || RENDER_MINOR >= 2)
  6405 static void
  6406 x_xrender_color_from_gc_foreground (struct frame *f, GC gc, XRenderColor *color,
  6407                                     bool apply_alpha_background)
  6408 {
  6409   XGCValues xgcv;
  6410   XColor xc;
  6411 
  6412   XGetGCValues (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc, GCForeground, &xgcv);
  6413   xc.pixel = xgcv.foreground;
  6414   x_query_colors (f, &xc, 1);
  6415 
  6416   color->alpha = (apply_alpha_background
  6417                   ? 65535 * f->alpha_background
  6418                   : 65535);
  6419 
  6420   if (color->alpha == 65535)
  6421     {
  6422       color->red = xc.red;
  6423       color->blue = xc.blue;
  6424       color->green = xc.green;
  6425     }
  6426   else
  6427     {
  6428       color->red = (xc.red * color->alpha) / 65535;
  6429       color->blue = (xc.blue * color->alpha) / 65535;
  6430       color->green = (xc.green * color->alpha) / 65535;
  6431     }
  6432 }
  6433 # endif
  6434 
  6435 void
  6436 x_xrender_color_from_gc_background (struct frame *f, GC gc, XRenderColor *color,
  6437                                     bool apply_alpha_background)
  6438 {
  6439   XGCValues xgcv;
  6440   XColor xc;
  6441 
  6442   XGetGCValues (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc, GCBackground, &xgcv);
  6443   xc.pixel = xgcv.background;
  6444   x_query_colors (f, &xc, 1);
  6445 
  6446   color->alpha = (apply_alpha_background
  6447                   ? 65535 * f->alpha_background
  6448                   : 65535);
  6449 
  6450   if (color->alpha == 65535)
  6451     {
  6452       color->red = xc.red;
  6453       color->blue = xc.blue;
  6454       color->green = xc.green;
  6455     }
  6456   else
  6457     {
  6458       color->red = (xc.red * color->alpha) / 65535;
  6459       color->blue = (xc.blue * color->alpha) / 65535;
  6460       color->green = (xc.green * color->alpha) / 65535;
  6461     }
  6462 }
  6463 #endif
  6464 
  6465 static void
  6466 x_fill_rectangle (struct frame *f, GC gc, int x, int y, int width, int height,
  6467                   bool respect_alpha_background)
  6468 {
  6469 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  6470   Display *dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  6471   cairo_t *cr;
  6472   XGCValues xgcv;
  6473 
  6474   cr = x_begin_cr_clip (f, gc);
  6475   XGetGCValues (dpy, gc, GCFillStyle | GCStipple, &xgcv);
  6476   if (xgcv.fill_style == FillSolid
  6477       /* Invalid resource ID (one or more of the three most
  6478          significant bits set to 1) is obtained if the GCStipple
  6479          component has never been explicitly set.  It should be
  6480          regarded as Pixmap of unspecified size filled with ones.  */
  6481       || (xgcv.stipple & ((Pixmap) 7 << (sizeof (Pixmap) * CHAR_BIT - 3))))
  6482     {
  6483       x_set_cr_source_with_gc_foreground (f, gc, respect_alpha_background);
  6484       cairo_rectangle (cr, x, y, width, height);
  6485       cairo_fill (cr);
  6486     }
  6487   else
  6488     {
  6489       eassert (xgcv.fill_style == FillOpaqueStippled);
  6490       eassert (xgcv.stipple != None);
  6491       x_set_cr_source_with_gc_background (f, gc, respect_alpha_background);
  6492       cairo_rectangle (cr, x, y, width, height);
  6493       cairo_fill_preserve (cr);
  6494 
  6495       cairo_pattern_t *pattern = x_bitmap_stipple (f, xgcv.stipple);
  6496       if (pattern)
  6497         {
  6498           x_set_cr_source_with_gc_foreground (f, gc, respect_alpha_background);
  6499           cairo_clip (cr);
  6500           cairo_mask (cr, pattern);
  6501         }
  6502     }
  6503   x_end_cr_clip (f);
  6504 #else
  6505 #if defined HAVE_XRENDER && (RENDER_MAJOR > 0 || (RENDER_MINOR >= 2))
  6506   if (respect_alpha_background
  6507       && f->alpha_background != 1.0
  6508       && FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->alpha_bits
  6509       && FRAME_CHECK_XR_VERSION (f, 0, 2))
  6510     {
  6511       x_xr_ensure_picture (f);
  6512 
  6513       if (FRAME_X_PICTURE (f) != None)
  6514         {
  6515           XRenderColor xc;
  6516 
  6517 #if RENDER_MAJOR > 0 || (RENDER_MINOR >= 10)
  6518           XGCValues xgcv;
  6519           XRenderPictureAttributes attrs;
  6520           XRenderColor alpha;
  6521           Picture stipple, fill;
  6522 #endif
  6523 
  6524           x_xr_apply_ext_clip (f, gc);
  6525 
  6526 #if RENDER_MAJOR > 0 || (RENDER_MINOR >= 10)
  6527           XGetGCValues (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  6528                         gc, GCFillStyle | GCStipple, &xgcv);
  6529 
  6530           if (xgcv.fill_style == FillOpaqueStippled
  6531               && FRAME_CHECK_XR_VERSION (f, 0, 10))
  6532             {
  6533               x_xrender_color_from_gc_background (f, gc, &alpha, true);
  6534               x_xrender_color_from_gc_foreground (f, gc, &xc, true);
  6535               attrs.repeat = RepeatNormal;
  6536 
  6537               stipple = XRenderCreatePicture (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  6538                                               xgcv.stipple,
  6539                                               XRenderFindStandardFormat (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  6540                                                                          PictStandardA1),
  6541                                               CPRepeat, &attrs);
  6542 
  6543               XRenderFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), PictOpSrc,
  6544                                     FRAME_X_PICTURE (f),
  6545                                     &alpha, x, y, width, height);
  6546 
  6547               fill = XRenderCreateSolidFill (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), &xc);
  6548 
  6549               XRenderComposite (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), PictOpOver, fill, stipple,
  6550                                 FRAME_X_PICTURE (f), 0, 0, x, y, x, y, width, height);
  6551 
  6552               XRenderFreePicture (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), stipple);
  6553               XRenderFreePicture (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), fill);
  6554             }
  6555           else
  6556 #endif
  6557             {
  6558               x_xrender_color_from_gc_foreground (f, gc, &xc, true);
  6559               XRenderFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  6560                                     PictOpSrc, FRAME_X_PICTURE (f),
  6561                                     &xc, x, y, width, height);
  6562             }
  6563           x_xr_reset_ext_clip (f);
  6564           x_mark_frame_dirty (f);
  6565 
  6566           return;
  6567         }
  6568     }
  6569 #endif
  6570   XFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
  6571                   gc, x, y, width, height);
  6572 #endif
  6573 }
  6574 
  6575 
  6576 static void
  6577 x_clear_rectangle (struct frame *f, GC gc, int x, int y, int width, int height,
  6578                    bool respect_alpha_background)
  6579 {
  6580 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  6581   cairo_t *cr;
  6582 
  6583   cr = x_begin_cr_clip (f, gc);
  6584   x_set_cr_source_with_gc_background (f, gc, respect_alpha_background);
  6585   cairo_rectangle (cr, x, y, width, height);
  6586   cairo_fill (cr);
  6587   x_end_cr_clip (f);
  6588 #else
  6589 #if defined HAVE_XRENDER && (RENDER_MAJOR > 0 || (RENDER_MINOR >= 2))
  6590   if (respect_alpha_background
  6591       && f->alpha_background != 1.0
  6592       && FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->alpha_bits
  6593       && FRAME_CHECK_XR_VERSION (f, 0, 2))
  6594     {
  6595       x_xr_ensure_picture (f);
  6596 
  6597       if (FRAME_X_PICTURE (f) != None)
  6598         {
  6599           XRenderColor xc;
  6600 
  6601           x_xr_apply_ext_clip (f, gc);
  6602           x_xrender_color_from_gc_background (f, gc, &xc, true);
  6603           XRenderFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  6604                                 PictOpSrc, FRAME_X_PICTURE (f),
  6605                                 &xc, x, y, width, height);
  6606           x_xr_reset_ext_clip (f);
  6607           x_mark_frame_dirty (f);
  6608 
  6609           return;
  6610         }
  6611     }
  6612 #endif
  6613 
  6614   XGCValues xgcv;
  6615   Display *dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  6616   XGetGCValues (dpy, gc, GCBackground | GCForeground, &xgcv);
  6617   XSetForeground (dpy, gc, xgcv.background);
  6618   XFillRectangle (dpy, FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
  6619                   gc, x, y, width, height);
  6620   XSetForeground (dpy, gc, xgcv.foreground);
  6621 #endif
  6622 }
  6623 
  6624 static void
  6625 x_draw_rectangle (struct frame *f, GC gc, int x, int y, int width, int height)
  6626 {
  6627 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  6628   cairo_t *cr;
  6629 
  6630   cr = x_begin_cr_clip (f, gc);
  6631   x_set_cr_source_with_gc_foreground (f, gc, false);
  6632   cairo_rectangle (cr, x + 0.5, y + 0.5, width, height);
  6633   cairo_set_line_width (cr, 1);
  6634   cairo_stroke (cr);
  6635   x_end_cr_clip (f);
  6636 #else
  6637   XDrawRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
  6638                   gc, x, y, width, height);
  6639 #endif
  6640 }
  6641 
  6642 static void
  6643 x_clear_window (struct frame *f)
  6644 {
  6645 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  6646   cairo_t *cr;
  6647 
  6648   cr = x_begin_cr_clip (f, NULL);
  6649   x_set_cr_source_with_gc_background (f, f->output_data.x->normal_gc, true);
  6650   cairo_paint (cr);
  6651   x_end_cr_clip (f);
  6652 #else
  6653 #ifndef USE_GTK
  6654   if (f->alpha_background != 1.0
  6655 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
  6656       || FRAME_X_DOUBLE_BUFFERED_P (f)
  6657 #endif
  6658       )
  6659 #endif
  6660     x_clear_area (f, 0, 0, FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f),
  6661                   FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f));
  6662 #ifndef USE_GTK
  6663   else
  6664     XClearWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f));
  6665 #endif
  6666 #endif
  6667 }
  6668 
  6669 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  6670 static void
  6671 x_fill_trapezoid_for_relief (struct frame *f, GC gc, int x, int y,
  6672                              int width, int height, int top_p)
  6673 {
  6674   cairo_t *cr;
  6675 
  6676   cr = x_begin_cr_clip (f, gc);
  6677   x_set_cr_source_with_gc_foreground (f, gc, false);
  6678   cairo_move_to (cr, top_p ? x : x + height, y);
  6679   cairo_line_to (cr, x, y + height);
  6680   cairo_line_to (cr, top_p ? x + width - height : x + width, y + height);
  6681   cairo_line_to (cr, x + width, y);
  6682   cairo_fill (cr);
  6683   x_end_cr_clip (f);
  6684 }
  6685 
  6686 enum corners
  6687   {
  6688     CORNER_BOTTOM_RIGHT,        /* 0 -> pi/2 */
  6689     CORNER_BOTTOM_LEFT,         /* pi/2 -> pi */
  6690     CORNER_TOP_LEFT,            /* pi -> 3pi/2 */
  6691     CORNER_TOP_RIGHT,           /* 3pi/2 -> 2pi */
  6692     CORNER_LAST
  6693   };
  6694 
  6695 static void
  6696 x_erase_corners_for_relief (struct frame *f, GC gc, int x, int y,
  6697                             int width, int height,
  6698                             double radius, double margin, int corners)
  6699 {
  6700   cairo_t *cr;
  6701   int i;
  6702 
  6703   cr = x_begin_cr_clip (f, gc);
  6704   x_set_cr_source_with_gc_background (f, gc, false);
  6705   for (i = 0; i < CORNER_LAST; i++)
  6706     if (corners & (1 << i))
  6707       {
  6708         double xm, ym, xc, yc;
  6709 
  6710         if (i == CORNER_TOP_LEFT || i == CORNER_BOTTOM_LEFT)
  6711           xm = x - margin, xc = xm + radius;
  6712         else
  6713           xm = x + width + margin, xc = xm - radius;
  6714         if (i == CORNER_TOP_LEFT || i == CORNER_TOP_RIGHT)
  6715           ym = y - margin, yc = ym + radius;
  6716         else
  6717           ym = y + height + margin, yc = ym - radius;
  6718 
  6719         cairo_move_to (cr, xm, ym);
  6720         cairo_arc (cr, xc, yc, radius, i * M_PI_2, (i + 1) * M_PI_2);
  6721       }
  6722   cairo_clip (cr);
  6723   cairo_rectangle (cr, x, y, width, height);
  6724   cairo_fill (cr);
  6725   x_end_cr_clip (f);
  6726 }
  6727 
  6728 static void
  6729 x_draw_horizontal_wave (struct frame *f, GC gc, int x, int y,
  6730                         int width, int height, int wave_length)
  6731 {
  6732   cairo_t *cr;
  6733   double dx = wave_length, dy = height - 1;
  6734   int xoffset, n;
  6735 
  6736   cr = x_begin_cr_clip (f, gc);
  6737   x_set_cr_source_with_gc_foreground (f, gc, false);
  6738   cairo_rectangle (cr, x, y, width, height);
  6739   cairo_clip (cr);
  6740 
  6741   if (x >= 0)
  6742     {
  6743       xoffset = x % (wave_length * 2);
  6744       if (xoffset == 0)
  6745         xoffset = wave_length * 2;
  6746     }
  6747   else
  6748     xoffset = x % (wave_length * 2) + wave_length * 2;
  6749   n = (width + xoffset) / wave_length + 1;
  6750   if (xoffset > wave_length)
  6751     {
  6752       xoffset -= wave_length;
  6753       --n;
  6754       y += height - 1;
  6755       dy = -dy;
  6756     }
  6757 
  6758   cairo_move_to (cr, x - xoffset + 0.5, y + 0.5);
  6759   while (--n >= 0)
  6760     {
  6761       cairo_rel_line_to (cr, dx, dy);
  6762       dy = -dy;
  6763     }
  6764   cairo_set_line_width (cr, 1);
  6765   cairo_stroke (cr);
  6766   x_end_cr_clip (f);
  6767 }
  6768 #endif
  6769 
  6770 
  6771 /* Return the struct x_display_info corresponding to DPY.  */
  6772 
  6773 struct x_display_info *
  6774 x_display_info_for_display (Display *dpy)
  6775 {
  6776   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
  6777 
  6778   for (dpyinfo = x_display_list; dpyinfo; dpyinfo = dpyinfo->next)
  6779     if (dpyinfo->display == dpy)
  6780       return dpyinfo;
  6781 
  6782   return 0;
  6783 }
  6784 
  6785 static Window
  6786 x_find_topmost_parent (struct frame *f)
  6787 {
  6788   struct x_output *x = f->output_data.x;
  6789   Window win = None, wi = x->parent_desc;
  6790   Display *dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  6791 
  6792   while (wi != FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window)
  6793     {
  6794       Window root;
  6795       Window *children;
  6796       unsigned int nchildren;
  6797 
  6798       win = wi;
  6799       if (XQueryTree (dpy, win, &root, &wi, &children, &nchildren))
  6800         XFree (children);
  6801       else
  6802         break;
  6803     }
  6804 
  6805   return win;
  6806 }
  6807 
  6808 #define OPAQUE  0xffffffff
  6809 
  6810 static void
  6811 x_set_frame_alpha (struct frame *f)
  6812 {
  6813   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  6814   Display *dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  6815   Window win = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
  6816   double alpha = 1.0;
  6817   double alpha_min = 1.0;
  6818   unsigned long opac;
  6819   Window parent;
  6820 
  6821   if (dpyinfo->highlight_frame == f)
  6822     alpha = f->alpha[0];
  6823   else
  6824     alpha = f->alpha[1];
  6825 
  6826   if (alpha < 0.0)
  6827     return;
  6828 
  6829   if (FLOATP (Vframe_alpha_lower_limit))
  6830     alpha_min = XFLOAT_DATA (Vframe_alpha_lower_limit);
  6831   else if (FIXNUMP (Vframe_alpha_lower_limit))
  6832     alpha_min = (XFIXNUM (Vframe_alpha_lower_limit)) / 100.0;
  6833 
  6834   if (alpha > 1.0)
  6835     alpha = 1.0;
  6836   else if (alpha < alpha_min && alpha_min <= 1.0)
  6837     alpha = alpha_min;
  6838 
  6839   opac = alpha * OPAQUE;
  6840 
  6841   /* If there is a parent from the window manager, put the property there
  6842      also, to work around broken window managers that fail to do that.
  6843      Do this unconditionally as this function is called on reparent when
  6844      alpha has not changed on the frame.  */
  6845 
  6846   x_ignore_errors_for_next_request (dpyinfo, 0);
  6847 
  6848   if (!FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))
  6849     {
  6850       parent = x_find_topmost_parent (f);
  6851 
  6852       if (parent != None)
  6853         {
  6854           XChangeProperty (dpy, parent,
  6855                            dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_window_opacity,
  6856                            XA_CARDINAL, 32, PropModeReplace,
  6857                            (unsigned char *) &opac, 1);
  6858         }
  6859     }
  6860 
  6861   XChangeProperty (dpy, win, dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_window_opacity,
  6862                    XA_CARDINAL, 32, PropModeReplace,
  6863                    (unsigned char *) &opac, 1);
  6864   x_stop_ignoring_errors (dpyinfo);
  6865 }
  6866 
  6867 /***********************************************************************
  6868                     Starting and ending an update
  6869  ***********************************************************************/
  6870 
  6871 #if defined HAVE_XSYNC && !defined USE_GTK && defined HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME
  6872 
  6873 /* Wait for an event matching PREDICATE to show up in the event
  6874    queue, or TIMEOUT to elapse.
  6875 
  6876    If TIMEOUT passes without an event being found, return 1.
  6877    Otherwise, return 0 and behave as XIfEvent would.  */
  6878 
  6879 static int
  6880 x_if_event (Display *dpy, XEvent *event_return,
  6881             Bool (*predicate) (Display *, XEvent *, XPointer),
  6882             XPointer arg, struct timespec timeout)
  6883 {
  6884   struct timespec current_time, target;
  6885   int fd;
  6886   fd_set fds;
  6887 
  6888   fd = ConnectionNumber (dpy);
  6889   current_time = current_timespec ();
  6890   target = timespec_add (current_time, timeout);
  6891 
  6892   /* Check if an event is already in the queue.  If it is, avoid
  6893      syncing.  */
  6894   if (XCheckIfEvent (dpy, event_return, predicate, arg))
  6895     return 0;
  6896 
  6897   while (true)
  6898     {
  6899       /* Get events into the queue.  */
  6900       XSync (dpy, False);
  6901 
  6902       /* Look for an event again.  */
  6903       if (XCheckIfEvent (dpy, event_return, predicate, arg))
  6904         return 0;
  6905 
  6906       /* Calculate the timeout.  */
  6907       current_time = current_timespec ();
  6908       timeout = timespec_sub (target, current_time);
  6909 
  6910       /* If not, wait for some input to show up on the X connection,
  6911          or for the timeout to elapse.  */
  6912       FD_ZERO (&fds);
  6913       FD_SET (fd, &fds);
  6914 
  6915       /* If this fails due to an IO error, XSync will call the IO
  6916          error handler.  */
  6917       pselect (fd + 1, &fds, NULL, NULL, &timeout, NULL);
  6918 
  6919       /* Timeout elapsed.  */
  6920       current_time = current_timespec ();
  6921       if (timespec_cmp (target, current_time) < 0)
  6922         return 1;
  6923     }
  6924 }
  6925 
  6926 /* Return the monotonic time corresponding to the high-resolution
  6927    server timestamp TIMESTAMP.  Return 0 if the necessary information
  6928    is not available.  */
  6929 
  6930 static uint_fast64_t
  6931 x_sync_get_monotonic_time (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
  6932                            uint_fast64_t timestamp)
  6933 {
  6934   if (dpyinfo->server_time_monotonic_p)
  6935     return timestamp;
  6936 
  6937   /* This means we haven't yet initialized the server time offset.  */
  6938   if (!dpyinfo->server_time_offset)
  6939     return 0;
  6940 
  6941   uint_fast64_t t;
  6942   return ckd_sub (&t, timestamp, dpyinfo->server_time_offset) ? 0 : t;
  6943 }
  6944 
  6945 # ifndef CLOCK_MONOTONIC
  6946 #  define CLOCK_MONOTONIC CLOCK_REALTIME
  6947 # endif
  6948 
  6949 /* Return the current monotonic time in the same format as a
  6950    high-resolution server timestamp, or 0 if not available.  */
  6951 
  6952 static uint_fast64_t
  6953 x_sync_current_monotonic_time (void)
  6954 {
  6955   struct timespec time;
  6956   uint_fast64_t t;
  6957   return (((clock_gettime (CLOCK_MONOTONIC, &time) != 0
  6958             && (CLOCK_MONOTONIC == CLOCK_REALTIME
  6959                 || clock_gettime (CLOCK_REALTIME, &time) != 0))
  6960            || ckd_mul (&t, time.tv_sec, 1000000)
  6961            || ckd_add (&t, t, time.tv_nsec / 1000))
  6962           ? 0 : t);
  6963 }
  6964 
  6965 /* Decode a _NET_WM_FRAME_DRAWN message and calculate the time it took
  6966    to draw the last frame.  */
  6967 
  6968 static void
  6969 x_sync_note_frame_times (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
  6970                          struct frame *f, XEvent *event)
  6971 {
  6972   uint_fast64_t low, high, time;
  6973   struct x_output *output;
  6974 
  6975   low = event->xclient.data.l[2];
  6976   high = event->xclient.data.l[3];
  6977   output = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f);
  6978 
  6979   time = x_sync_get_monotonic_time (dpyinfo, low | (high << 32));
  6980 
  6981   if (!time || !output->temp_frame_time
  6982       || ckd_sub (&output->last_frame_time, time, output->temp_frame_time))
  6983     output->last_frame_time = 0;
  6984 
  6985 #ifdef FRAME_DEBUG
  6986   uint_fast64_t last_frame_ms = output->last_frame_time / 1000;
  6987   fprintf (stderr,
  6988            "Drawing the last frame took: %"PRIuFAST64" ms (%"PRIuFAST64")\n",
  6989            last_frame_ms, time);
  6990 #endif
  6991 }
  6992 
  6993 static Bool
  6994 x_sync_is_frame_drawn_event (Display *dpy, XEvent *event,
  6995                              XPointer user_data)
  6996 {
  6997   struct frame *f;
  6998   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
  6999 
  7000   f = (struct frame *) user_data;
  7001   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  7002 
  7003   if (event->type == ClientMessage
  7004       && (event->xclient.message_type
  7005           == dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_frame_drawn)
  7006       && event->xclient.window == FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f))
  7007     return True;
  7008 
  7009   return False;
  7010 }
  7011 
  7012 /* Wait for the compositing manager to finish drawing the last frame.
  7013    If the compositing manager has already drawn everything, do
  7014    nothing.  */
  7015 
  7016 static void
  7017 x_sync_wait_for_frame_drawn_event (struct frame *f)
  7018 {
  7019   XEvent event;
  7020   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
  7021 
  7022   if (!FRAME_X_WAITING_FOR_DRAW (f)
  7023       /* The compositing manager can't draw a frame if it is
  7024          unmapped.  */
  7025       || !FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
  7026     return;
  7027 
  7028   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  7029 
  7030   /* Wait for the frame drawn message to arrive.  */
  7031   if (x_if_event (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), &event,
  7032                   x_sync_is_frame_drawn_event, (XPointer) f,
  7033                   make_timespec (1, 0)))
  7034     {
  7035       /* The first time a draw hangs, treat it as a random fluctuation
  7036          on the part of the compositor.  If the next draw continues to
  7037          hang, disable frame synchronization.  */
  7038       if (FRAME_X_DRAW_JUST_HUNG (f))
  7039         {
  7040           fprintf (stderr, "Warning: compositing manager spent more than 1 "
  7041                    "second drawing a frame.  Frame synchronization has "
  7042                    "been disabled\n");
  7043           FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->use_vsync_p = false;
  7044 
  7045           /* Remove the compositor bypass property from the outer
  7046              window.  */
  7047           XDeleteProperty (dpyinfo->display, FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
  7048                            dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_bypass_compositor);
  7049 
  7050           /* Also change the frame parameter to reflect the new
  7051              state.  */
  7052           store_frame_param (f, Quse_frame_synchronization, Qnil);
  7053         }
  7054       else
  7055         {
  7056           fprintf (stderr, "Warning: compositing manager spent more than 1 "
  7057                    "second drawing a frame.  Frame synchronization will be "
  7058                    "disabled if this happens again\n");
  7059           FRAME_X_DRAW_JUST_HUNG (f) = true;
  7060         }
  7061     }
  7062   else
  7063     x_sync_note_frame_times (dpyinfo, f, &event);
  7064 
  7065   FRAME_X_WAITING_FOR_DRAW (f) = false;
  7066 }
  7067 
  7068 /* Tell the compositing manager to postpone updates of F until a frame
  7069    has finished drawing.  */
  7070 
  7071 static void
  7072 x_sync_update_begin (struct frame *f)
  7073 {
  7074   XSyncValue value, add;
  7075   Bool overflow;
  7076 
  7077   if (FRAME_X_EXTENDED_COUNTER (f) == None)
  7078     return;
  7079 
  7080   value = FRAME_X_COUNTER_VALUE (f);
  7081 
  7082   if (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->ext_sync_end_pending_p)
  7083     {
  7084       FRAME_X_COUNTER_VALUE (f)
  7085         = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->resize_counter_value;
  7086 
  7087       value = FRAME_X_COUNTER_VALUE (f);
  7088 
  7089       if (XSyncValueLow32 (value) % 2)
  7090         {
  7091           XSyncIntToValue (&add, 1);
  7092           XSyncValueAdd (&value, value, add, &overflow);
  7093 
  7094           if (overflow)
  7095             XSyncIntToValue (&value, 0);
  7096         }
  7097 
  7098       FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->ext_sync_end_pending_p = false;
  7099     }
  7100 
  7101   /* Since a frame is already in progress, there is no point in
  7102      continuing.  */
  7103   if (XSyncValueLow32 (value) % 2)
  7104     return;
  7105 
  7106   /* Wait for the last frame to be drawn before drawing this one.  */
  7107   x_sync_wait_for_frame_drawn_event (f);
  7108 
  7109   /* Make a note of the time at which we started to draw this
  7110      frame.  */
  7111   FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->temp_frame_time = x_sync_current_monotonic_time ();
  7112 
  7113   /* Since Emacs needs a non-urgent redraw, ensure that value % 4 ==
  7114      1.  Later, add 3 to create the even counter value.  */
  7115   if (XSyncValueLow32 (value) % 4 == 2)
  7116     XSyncIntToValue (&add, 3);
  7117   else
  7118     XSyncIntToValue (&add, 1);
  7119 
  7120   XSyncValueAdd (&FRAME_X_COUNTER_VALUE (f),
  7121                  value, add, &overflow);
  7122 
  7123   if (overflow)
  7124     XSyncIntToValue (&FRAME_X_COUNTER_VALUE (f), 3);
  7125 
  7126   eassert (XSyncValueLow32 (FRAME_X_COUNTER_VALUE (f)) % 4 == 1);
  7127 
  7128   XSyncSetCounter (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  7129                    FRAME_X_EXTENDED_COUNTER (f),
  7130                    FRAME_X_COUNTER_VALUE (f));
  7131 }
  7132 
  7133 #ifdef HAVE_XSYNCTRIGGERFENCE
  7134 
  7135 /* Trigger the sync fence for counter VALUE immediately before a frame
  7136    finishes.  */
  7137 
  7138 static void
  7139 x_sync_trigger_fence (struct frame *f, XSyncValue value)
  7140 {
  7141   uint_fast64_t n, low, high, idx;
  7142 
  7143   /* Sync fences aren't supported by the X server.  */
  7144   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xsync_major < 3
  7145       || (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xsync_major == 3
  7146           && FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xsync_minor < 1))
  7147     return;
  7148 
  7149   low = XSyncValueLow32 (value);
  7150   high = XSyncValueHigh32 (value);
  7151 
  7152   n = low | (high << 32);
  7153   idx = (n / 4) % 2;
  7154 
  7155 #ifdef FRAME_DEBUG
  7156   fprintf (stderr, "Triggering synchronization fence: %lu\n", idx);
  7157 #endif
  7158 
  7159   XSyncTriggerFence (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  7160                      FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->sync_fences[idx]);
  7161 }
  7162 
  7163 /* Initialize the sync fences on F.  */
  7164 
  7165 void
  7166 x_sync_init_fences (struct frame *f)
  7167 {
  7168   struct x_output *output;
  7169   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
  7170 
  7171   output = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f);
  7172   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  7173 
  7174   /* Sync fences aren't supported by the X server.  */
  7175   if (dpyinfo->xsync_major < 3
  7176       || (dpyinfo->xsync_major == 3
  7177           && dpyinfo->xsync_minor < 1))
  7178     return;
  7179 
  7180   output->sync_fences[0]
  7181     = XSyncCreateFence (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  7182                         /* The drawable given below is only used to
  7183                            determine the screen on which the fence is
  7184                            created.  */
  7185                         FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
  7186                         False);
  7187   output->sync_fences[1]
  7188     = XSyncCreateFence (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  7189                         FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
  7190                         False);
  7191 
  7192   XChangeProperty (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
  7193                    dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_sync_fences, XA_CARDINAL,
  7194                    32, PropModeReplace,
  7195                    (unsigned char *) &output->sync_fences, 2);
  7196 }
  7197 
  7198 static void
  7199 x_sync_free_fences (struct frame *f)
  7200 {
  7201   if (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->sync_fences[0] != None)
  7202     XSyncDestroyFence (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  7203                        FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->sync_fences[0]);
  7204 
  7205   if (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->sync_fences[1] != None)
  7206     XSyncDestroyFence (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  7207                        FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->sync_fences[1]);
  7208 }
  7209 
  7210 #endif
  7211 
  7212 /* Tell the compositing manager that FRAME has been drawn and can be
  7213    updated.  */
  7214 
  7215 static void
  7216 x_sync_update_finish (struct frame *f)
  7217 {
  7218   XSyncValue value, add;
  7219   Bool overflow;
  7220 
  7221   if (FRAME_X_EXTENDED_COUNTER (f) == None)
  7222     return;
  7223 
  7224   value = FRAME_X_COUNTER_VALUE (f);
  7225 
  7226   if (!(XSyncValueLow32 (value) % 2))
  7227     return;
  7228 
  7229   if ((XSyncValueLow32 (value) % 4) == 1)
  7230     /* This means the frame is non-urgent and should be drawn at the
  7231        next redraw point.  */
  7232     XSyncIntToValue (&add, 3);
  7233   else
  7234     /* Otherwise, the frame is urgent and should be drawn as soon as
  7235        possible.  */
  7236     XSyncIntToValue (&add, 1);
  7237 
  7238   XSyncValueAdd (&FRAME_X_COUNTER_VALUE (f),
  7239                  value, add, &overflow);
  7240 
  7241   if (overflow)
  7242     XSyncIntToValue (&FRAME_X_COUNTER_VALUE (f), 0);
  7243 
  7244   /* Trigger any sync fences if necessary.  */
  7245 #ifdef HAVE_XSYNCTRIGGERFENCE
  7246   x_sync_trigger_fence (f, FRAME_X_COUNTER_VALUE (f));
  7247 #endif
  7248 
  7249   XSyncSetCounter (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  7250                    FRAME_X_EXTENDED_COUNTER (f),
  7251                    FRAME_X_COUNTER_VALUE (f));
  7252 
  7253   if (FRAME_OUTPUT_DATA (f)->use_vsync_p)
  7254     FRAME_X_WAITING_FOR_DRAW (f) = true;
  7255 }
  7256 
  7257 /* Handle a _NET_WM_FRAME_DRAWN message from the compositor.  */
  7258 
  7259 static void
  7260 x_sync_handle_frame_drawn (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
  7261                            XEvent *message, struct frame *f)
  7262 {
  7263   XSyncValue value, counter;
  7264 
  7265   if (FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f) == message->xclient.window)
  7266     {
  7267       counter = FRAME_X_COUNTER_VALUE (f);
  7268 
  7269       /* Check that the counter in the message is the same as the
  7270          counter in the frame.  */
  7271       XSyncIntsToValue (&value,
  7272                         message->xclient.data.l[0] & 0xffffffff,
  7273                         message->xclient.data.l[1] & 0xffffffff);
  7274 
  7275       if (XSyncValueEqual (value, counter))
  7276         FRAME_X_WAITING_FOR_DRAW (f) = false;
  7277 
  7278       /* As long as a _NET_WM_FRAME_DRAWN message arrives, we know
  7279          that the compositor is still sending events, so avoid timing
  7280          out.  */
  7281       FRAME_X_DRAW_JUST_HUNG (f) = false;
  7282     }
  7283 
  7284   x_sync_note_frame_times (dpyinfo, f, message);
  7285 }
  7286 #endif
  7287 
  7288 /* Start an update of frame F.  This function is installed as a hook
  7289    for update_begin, i.e. it is called when update_begin is called.
  7290    This function is called prior to calls to gui_update_window_begin for
  7291    each window being updated.  Currently, there is nothing to do here
  7292    because all interesting stuff is done on a window basis.  */
  7293 
  7294 static void
  7295 x_update_begin (struct frame *f)
  7296 {
  7297 #if defined HAVE_XSYNC && !defined USE_GTK && defined HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME
  7298   /* If F is double-buffered, we can make the entire frame center
  7299      around XdbeSwapBuffers.  */
  7300 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
  7301   if (!FRAME_X_DOUBLE_BUFFERED_P (f))
  7302 #endif
  7303     x_sync_update_begin (f);
  7304 #else
  7305   /* Nothing to do.  */
  7306 #endif
  7307 
  7308 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
  7309   if (FRAME_X_DOUBLE_BUFFERED_P (f))
  7310     /* The frame is no longer complete, as it is in the midst of an
  7311        update.  */
  7312     FRAME_X_COMPLETE_P (f) = false;
  7313 #endif
  7314 }
  7315 
  7316 /* Draw a vertical window border from (x,y0) to (x,y1)  */
  7317 
  7318 static void
  7319 x_draw_vertical_window_border (struct window *w, int x, int y0, int y1)
  7320 {
  7321   struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (w));
  7322   struct face *face;
  7323 
  7324   face = FACE_FROM_ID_OR_NULL (f, VERTICAL_BORDER_FACE_ID);
  7325   if (face)
  7326     XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->normal_gc,
  7327                     face->foreground);
  7328 
  7329 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  7330   x_fill_rectangle (f, f->output_data.x->normal_gc, x, y0, 1, y1 - y0, false);
  7331 #else
  7332   XDrawLine (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
  7333              f->output_data.x->normal_gc, x, y0, x, y1);
  7334 #endif
  7335 }
  7336 
  7337 /* Draw a window divider from (x0,y0) to (x1,y1)  */
  7338 
  7339 static void
  7340 x_draw_window_divider (struct window *w, int x0, int x1, int y0, int y1)
  7341 {
  7342   struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (w));
  7343   struct face *face = FACE_FROM_ID_OR_NULL (f, WINDOW_DIVIDER_FACE_ID);
  7344   struct face *face_first
  7345     = FACE_FROM_ID_OR_NULL (f, WINDOW_DIVIDER_FIRST_PIXEL_FACE_ID);
  7346   struct face *face_last
  7347     = FACE_FROM_ID_OR_NULL (f, WINDOW_DIVIDER_LAST_PIXEL_FACE_ID);
  7348   unsigned long color = face ? face->foreground : FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f);
  7349   unsigned long color_first = (face_first
  7350                                ? face_first->foreground
  7351                                : FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f));
  7352   unsigned long color_last = (face_last
  7353                               ? face_last->foreground
  7354                               : FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f));
  7355   Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  7356 
  7357   if ((y1 - y0 > x1 - x0) && (x1 - x0 >= 3))
  7358     /* A vertical divider, at least three pixels wide: Draw first and
  7359        last pixels differently.  */
  7360     {
  7361       XSetForeground (display, f->output_data.x->normal_gc, color_first);
  7362       x_fill_rectangle (f, f->output_data.x->normal_gc,
  7363                         x0, y0, 1, y1 - y0, false);
  7364       XSetForeground (display, f->output_data.x->normal_gc, color);
  7365       x_fill_rectangle (f, f->output_data.x->normal_gc,
  7366                         x0 + 1, y0, x1 - x0 - 2, y1 - y0, false);
  7367       XSetForeground (display, f->output_data.x->normal_gc, color_last);
  7368       x_fill_rectangle (f, f->output_data.x->normal_gc,
  7369                         x1 - 1, y0, 1, y1 - y0, false);
  7370     }
  7371   else if ((x1 - x0 > y1 - y0) && (y1 - y0 >= 3))
  7372     /* A horizontal divider, at least three pixels high: Draw first and
  7373        last pixels differently.  */
  7374     {
  7375       XSetForeground (display, f->output_data.x->normal_gc, color_first);
  7376       x_fill_rectangle (f, f->output_data.x->normal_gc,
  7377                         x0, y0, x1 - x0, 1, false);
  7378       XSetForeground (display, f->output_data.x->normal_gc, color);
  7379       x_fill_rectangle (f, f->output_data.x->normal_gc,
  7380                         x0, y0 + 1, x1 - x0, y1 - y0 - 2, false);
  7381       XSetForeground (display, f->output_data.x->normal_gc, color_last);
  7382       x_fill_rectangle (f, f->output_data.x->normal_gc,
  7383                         x0, y1 - 1, x1 - x0, 1, false);
  7384     }
  7385   else
  7386     {
  7387     /* In any other case do not draw the first and last pixels
  7388        differently.  */
  7389       XSetForeground (display, f->output_data.x->normal_gc, color);
  7390       x_fill_rectangle (f, f->output_data.x->normal_gc,
  7391                         x0, y0, x1 - x0, y1 - y0, false);
  7392     }
  7393 }
  7394 
  7395 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
  7396 
  7397 /* Show the frame back buffer.  If frame is double-buffered,
  7398    atomically publish to the user's screen graphics updates made since
  7399    the last call to show_back_buffer.  */
  7400 
  7401 static void
  7402 show_back_buffer (struct frame *f)
  7403 {
  7404   XdbeSwapInfo swap_info;
  7405 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  7406   cairo_t *cr;
  7407 #endif
  7408 
  7409   if (FRAME_X_DOUBLE_BUFFERED_P (f))
  7410     {
  7411 #if defined HAVE_XSYNC && !defined USE_GTK && defined HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME
  7412       /* Wait for drawing of the previous frame to complete before
  7413          displaying this new frame.  */
  7414       x_sync_wait_for_frame_drawn_event (f);
  7415 
  7416       /* Begin a new frame.  */
  7417       x_sync_update_begin (f);
  7418 #endif
  7419 
  7420 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  7421       cr = FRAME_CR_CONTEXT (f);
  7422       if (cr)
  7423         cairo_surface_flush (cairo_get_target (cr));
  7424 #endif
  7425       memset (&swap_info, 0, sizeof (swap_info));
  7426       swap_info.swap_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
  7427       swap_info.swap_action = XdbeCopied;
  7428       XdbeSwapBuffers (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), &swap_info, 1);
  7429 
  7430 #if defined HAVE_XSYNC && !defined USE_GTK && defined HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME
  7431       /* Finish the frame here.  */
  7432       x_sync_update_finish (f);
  7433 #endif
  7434     }
  7435 
  7436   FRAME_X_NEED_BUFFER_FLIP (f) = false;
  7437 }
  7438 
  7439 #endif
  7440 
  7441 /* Updates back buffer and flushes changes to display.  Called from
  7442    minibuf read code.  Note that we display the back buffer even if
  7443    buffer flipping is blocked.  */
  7444 static void
  7445 x_flip_and_flush (struct frame *f)
  7446 {
  7447   /* Flipping buffers requires a working connection to the X server,
  7448      which isn't always present if `inhibit-redisplay' is t, since
  7449      this can be called from the IO error handler.  */
  7450   if (!NILP (Vinhibit_redisplay)
  7451       /* This has to work for tooltip frames, however, and redisplay
  7452          cannot happen when they are being flushed anyway.  (bug#55519) */
  7453       && !FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (f))
  7454     return;
  7455 
  7456   block_input ();
  7457 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
  7458   if (FRAME_X_NEED_BUFFER_FLIP (f))
  7459     show_back_buffer (f);
  7460 
  7461   /* The frame is complete again as its contents were just
  7462      flushed.  */
  7463   FRAME_X_COMPLETE_P (f) = true;
  7464 #endif
  7465   x_flush (f);
  7466   unblock_input ();
  7467 }
  7468 
  7469 /* End update of frame F.  This function is installed as a hook in
  7470    update_end.  */
  7471 
  7472 static void
  7473 x_update_end (struct frame *f)
  7474 {
  7475   /* Mouse highlight may be displayed again.  */
  7476   MOUSE_HL_INFO (f)->mouse_face_defer = false;
  7477 
  7478 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  7479 # ifdef HAVE_XDBE
  7480   if (!FRAME_X_DOUBLE_BUFFERED_P (f) && FRAME_CR_CONTEXT (f))
  7481     cairo_surface_flush (cairo_get_target (FRAME_CR_CONTEXT (f)));
  7482 # endif
  7483 #endif
  7484 
  7485   /* If double buffering is disabled, finish the update here.
  7486      Otherwise, finish the update when the back buffer is next
  7487      displayed.  */
  7488 #if defined HAVE_XSYNC && !defined USE_GTK && defined HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME
  7489 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
  7490   if (!FRAME_X_DOUBLE_BUFFERED_P (f))
  7491 #endif
  7492     x_sync_update_finish (f);
  7493 #endif
  7494 }
  7495 
  7496 /* This function is called from various places in xdisp.c
  7497    whenever a complete update has been performed.  */
  7498 
  7499 static void
  7500 XTframe_up_to_date (struct frame *f)
  7501 {
  7502 #if defined HAVE_XSYNC && defined HAVE_GTK3
  7503   GtkWidget *widget;
  7504   GdkWindow *window;
  7505   GdkFrameClock *clock;
  7506 #endif
  7507 
  7508   eassert (FRAME_X_P (f));
  7509   block_input ();
  7510   FRAME_MOUSE_UPDATE (f);
  7511 
  7512 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
  7513   if (!buffer_flipping_blocked_p ()
  7514       && FRAME_X_NEED_BUFFER_FLIP (f))
  7515     show_back_buffer (f);
  7516 
  7517   /* The frame is now complete, as its contents have been drawn.  */
  7518   FRAME_X_COMPLETE_P (f) = true;
  7519 #endif
  7520 
  7521 #ifdef HAVE_XSYNC
  7522 #ifndef HAVE_GTK3
  7523   if (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->sync_end_pending_p
  7524       && FRAME_X_BASIC_COUNTER (f) != None)
  7525     {
  7526       XSyncSetCounter (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
  7527                        FRAME_X_BASIC_COUNTER (f),
  7528                        FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->pending_basic_counter_value);
  7529       FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->sync_end_pending_p = false;
  7530     }
  7531 #else
  7532   if (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->xg_sync_end_pending_p)
  7533     {
  7534       widget = FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f);
  7535       window = gtk_widget_get_window (widget);
  7536       eassert (window);
  7537       clock = gdk_window_get_frame_clock (window);
  7538       eassert (clock);
  7539 
  7540       gdk_frame_clock_request_phase (clock,
  7541                                      GDK_FRAME_CLOCK_PHASE_AFTER_PAINT);
  7542       FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->xg_sync_end_pending_p = false;
  7543     }
  7544 #endif
  7545 #endif
  7546   unblock_input ();
  7547 }
  7548 
  7549 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
  7550 static void
  7551 XTbuffer_flipping_unblocked_hook (struct frame *f)
  7552 {
  7553   block_input ();
  7554 
  7555   if (FRAME_X_NEED_BUFFER_FLIP (f))
  7556     show_back_buffer (f);
  7557 
  7558   unblock_input ();
  7559 }
  7560 #endif
  7561 
  7562 /**
  7563  * x_clear_under_internal_border:
  7564  *
  7565  * Clear area of frame F's internal border.  If the internal border face
  7566  * of F has been specified (is not null), fill the area with that face.
  7567  */
  7568 void
  7569 x_clear_under_internal_border (struct frame *f)
  7570 {
  7571   if (FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f) > 0)
  7572     {
  7573       int border = FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f);
  7574       int width = FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f);
  7575       int height = FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f);
  7576       int margin = FRAME_TOP_MARGIN_HEIGHT (f);
  7577       int bottom_margin = FRAME_BOTTOM_MARGIN_HEIGHT (f);
  7578       int face_id = (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f)
  7579                      ? (!NILP (Vface_remapping_alist)
  7580                         ? lookup_basic_face (NULL, f,
  7581                                              CHILD_FRAME_BORDER_FACE_ID)
  7582                         : CHILD_FRAME_BORDER_FACE_ID)
  7583                      : (!NILP (Vface_remapping_alist)
  7584                         ? lookup_basic_face (NULL, f,
  7585                                              INTERNAL_BORDER_FACE_ID)
  7586                         : INTERNAL_BORDER_FACE_ID));
  7587       struct face *face = FACE_FROM_ID_OR_NULL (f, face_id);
  7588 
  7589       if (face)
  7590         {
  7591           unsigned long color = face->background;
  7592           Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  7593           GC gc = f->output_data.x->normal_gc;
  7594 
  7595           XSetForeground (display, gc, color);
  7596           x_fill_rectangle (f, gc, 0, margin, width, border, false);
  7597           x_fill_rectangle (f, gc, 0, 0, border, height, false);
  7598           x_fill_rectangle (f, gc, width - border, 0, border, height, false);
  7599           x_fill_rectangle (f, gc, 0, height - bottom_margin - border,
  7600                             width, border, false);
  7601           XSetForeground (display, gc, FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f));
  7602         }
  7603       else
  7604         {
  7605           x_clear_area (f, 0, 0, border, height);
  7606           x_clear_area (f, 0, margin, width, border);
  7607           x_clear_area (f, width - border, 0, border, height);
  7608           x_clear_area (f, 0, height - bottom_margin - border,
  7609                         width, border);
  7610         }
  7611     }
  7612 }
  7613 
  7614 /* Draw truncation mark bitmaps, continuation mark bitmaps, overlay
  7615    arrow bitmaps, or clear the fringes if no bitmaps are required
  7616    before DESIRED_ROW is made current.  This function is called from
  7617    update_window_line only if it is known that there are differences
  7618    between bitmaps to be drawn between current row and DESIRED_ROW.  */
  7619 
  7620 static void
  7621 x_after_update_window_line (struct window *w, struct glyph_row *desired_row)
  7622 {
  7623   eassert (w);
  7624 
  7625   if (!desired_row->mode_line_p && !w->pseudo_window_p)
  7626     desired_row->redraw_fringe_bitmaps_p = true;
  7627 
  7628 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
  7629   /* When a window has disappeared, make sure that no rest of
  7630      full-width rows stays visible in the internal border.  Could
  7631      check here if updated window is the leftmost/rightmost window,
  7632      but I guess it's not worth doing since vertically split windows
  7633      are almost never used, internal border is rarely set, and the
  7634      overhead is very small.  */
  7635   {
  7636     struct frame *f;
  7637     int width, height;
  7638 
  7639     if (windows_or_buffers_changed
  7640         && desired_row->full_width_p
  7641         && (f = XFRAME (w->frame),
  7642             width = FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f),
  7643             width != 0)
  7644         && (height = desired_row->visible_height,
  7645             height > 0))
  7646       {
  7647         int y = WINDOW_TO_FRAME_PIXEL_Y (w, max (0, desired_row->y));
  7648         int face_id =
  7649           (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f)
  7650            ? (!NILP (Vface_remapping_alist)
  7651               ? lookup_basic_face (NULL, f, CHILD_FRAME_BORDER_FACE_ID)
  7652               : CHILD_FRAME_BORDER_FACE_ID)
  7653            : (!NILP (Vface_remapping_alist)
  7654               ? lookup_basic_face (NULL, f, INTERNAL_BORDER_FACE_ID)
  7655               : INTERNAL_BORDER_FACE_ID));
  7656         struct face *face = FACE_FROM_ID_OR_NULL (f, face_id);
  7657 
  7658         if (face)
  7659           {
  7660             unsigned long color = face->background;
  7661             Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  7662             GC gc = f->output_data.x->normal_gc;
  7663 
  7664             XSetForeground (display, gc, color);
  7665             x_fill_rectangle (f, gc, 0, y, width, height, true);
  7666             x_fill_rectangle (f, gc, FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f) - width, y,
  7667                               width, height, true);
  7668             XSetForeground (display, gc, FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f));
  7669           }
  7670         else
  7671           {
  7672             x_clear_area (f, 0, y, width, height);
  7673             x_clear_area (f, FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f) - width, y, width, height);
  7674           }
  7675       }
  7676   }
  7677 #endif
  7678 }
  7679 
  7680 /* Generate a premultiplied pixel value for COLOR with ALPHA applied
  7681    on the given display.  COLOR will be modified.  The display must
  7682    use a visual that supports an alpha channel.
  7683 
  7684    This is possibly dead code on builds which do not support
  7685    XRender.  */
  7686 
  7687 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
  7688 
  7689 static unsigned long
  7690 x_premultiply_pixel (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
  7691                      XColor *color, double alpha)
  7692 {
  7693   unsigned long pixel;
  7694 
  7695   eassert (dpyinfo->alpha_bits);
  7696 
  7697   /* Multiply the RGB channels.  */
  7698   color->red *= alpha;
  7699   color->green *= alpha;
  7700   color->blue *= alpha;
  7701 
  7702   /* First, allocate a fully opaque pixel.  */
  7703   pixel = x_make_truecolor_pixel (dpyinfo, color->red,
  7704                                   color->green,
  7705                                   color->blue);
  7706 
  7707   /* Next, erase the alpha component.  */
  7708   pixel &= ~dpyinfo->alpha_mask;
  7709 
  7710   /* And add an alpha channel.  */
  7711   pixel |= (((unsigned long) (alpha * 65535)
  7712              >> (16 - dpyinfo->alpha_bits))
  7713             << dpyinfo->alpha_offset);
  7714 
  7715   return pixel;
  7716 }
  7717 
  7718 #endif
  7719 
  7720 static void
  7721 x_draw_fringe_bitmap (struct window *w, struct glyph_row *row,
  7722                       struct draw_fringe_bitmap_params *p)
  7723 {
  7724   struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (w));
  7725   Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  7726   GC gc = f->output_data.x->normal_gc;
  7727   struct face *face = p->face;
  7728 
  7729   /* Must clip because of partially visible lines.  */
  7730   x_clip_to_row (w, row, ANY_AREA, gc);
  7731 
  7732   if (p->bx >= 0 && !p->overlay_p)
  7733     {
  7734       /* In case the same realized face is used for fringes and
  7735          for something displayed in the text (e.g. face `region' on
  7736          mono-displays, the fill style may have been changed to
  7737          FillSolid in x_draw_glyph_string_background.  */
  7738       if (face->stipple)
  7739         {
  7740           XSetFillStyle (display, face->gc, FillOpaqueStippled);
  7741           x_fill_rectangle (f, face->gc, p->bx, p->by, p->nx, p->ny,
  7742                             true);
  7743           XSetFillStyle (display, face->gc, FillSolid);
  7744 
  7745           row->stipple_p = true;
  7746         }
  7747       else
  7748         {
  7749           XSetBackground (display, face->gc, face->background);
  7750           x_clear_rectangle (f, face->gc, p->bx, p->by, p->nx, p->ny,
  7751                            true);
  7752           XSetForeground (display, face->gc, face->foreground);
  7753         }
  7754     }
  7755 
  7756 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  7757   if (p->which
  7758       && p->which < max_fringe_bmp
  7759       && p->which < max_used_fringe_bitmap)
  7760     {
  7761       XGCValues gcv;
  7762 
  7763       XGetGCValues (display, gc, GCForeground | GCBackground, &gcv);
  7764       XSetForeground (display, gc, (p->cursor_p
  7765                                     ? (p->overlay_p ? face->background
  7766                                        : f->output_data.x->cursor_pixel)
  7767                                     : face->foreground));
  7768       XSetBackground (display, gc, face->background);
  7769       if (!fringe_bmp[p->which])
  7770         {
  7771           /* This fringe bitmap is known to fringe.c, but lacks the
  7772              cairo_pattern_t pattern which shadows that bitmap.  This
  7773              is typical to define-fringe-bitmap being called when the
  7774              selected frame was not a GUI frame, for example, when
  7775              packages that define fringe bitmaps are loaded by a
  7776              daemon Emacs.  Create the missing pattern now.  */
  7777           gui_define_fringe_bitmap (f, p->which);
  7778         }
  7779       x_cr_draw_image (f, gc, fringe_bmp[p->which], 0, p->dh,
  7780                        p->wd, p->h, p->x, p->y, p->overlay_p);
  7781       XSetForeground (display, gc, gcv.foreground);
  7782       XSetBackground (display, gc, gcv.background);
  7783     }
  7784 #else  /* not USE_CAIRO */
  7785   if (p->which)
  7786     {
  7787       Drawable drawable = FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f);
  7788       char *bits;
  7789       Pixmap pixmap, clipmask = None;
  7790       int depth = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->n_planes;
  7791       XGCValues gcv;
  7792       unsigned long background = face->background;
  7793       XColor bg;
  7794 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
  7795       Picture picture = None;
  7796       XRenderPictureAttributes attrs;
  7797 
  7798       memset (&attrs, 0, sizeof attrs);
  7799 #endif
  7800 
  7801       if (p->wd > 8)
  7802         bits = (char *) (p->bits + p->dh);
  7803       else
  7804         bits = (char *) p->bits + p->dh;
  7805 
  7806       if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->alpha_bits
  7807           && f->alpha_background < 1.0)
  7808         {
  7809           /* Extend the background color with an alpha channel
  7810              according to f->alpha_background.  */
  7811           bg.pixel = background;
  7812           x_query_colors (f, &bg, 1);
  7813 
  7814           background
  7815             = x_premultiply_pixel (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
  7816                                    &bg,
  7817                                    f->alpha_background);
  7818         }
  7819 
  7820       /* Draw the bitmap.  I believe these small pixmaps can be cached
  7821          by the server.  */
  7822       pixmap = XCreatePixmapFromBitmapData (display, drawable, bits, p->wd, p->h,
  7823                                             (p->cursor_p
  7824                                              ? (p->overlay_p ? face->background
  7825                                                 : f->output_data.x->cursor_pixel)
  7826                                              : face->foreground),
  7827                                             background, depth);
  7828 
  7829 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
  7830       if (FRAME_X_PICTURE_FORMAT (f)
  7831           && (x_xr_ensure_picture (f), FRAME_X_PICTURE (f)))
  7832         picture = XRenderCreatePicture (display, pixmap,
  7833                                         FRAME_X_PICTURE_FORMAT (f),
  7834                                         0, &attrs);
  7835 #endif
  7836 
  7837       if (p->overlay_p)
  7838         {
  7839           clipmask = XCreatePixmapFromBitmapData (display,
  7840                                                   FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window,
  7841                                                   bits, p->wd, p->h,
  7842                                                   1, 0, 1);
  7843 
  7844 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
  7845           if (picture != None)
  7846             {
  7847               attrs.clip_mask = clipmask;
  7848               attrs.clip_x_origin = p->x;
  7849               attrs.clip_y_origin = p->y;
  7850 
  7851               XRenderChangePicture (display, FRAME_X_PICTURE (f),
  7852                                     CPClipMask | CPClipXOrigin | CPClipYOrigin,
  7853                                     &attrs);
  7854             }
  7855           else
  7856 #endif
  7857             {
  7858               gcv.clip_mask = clipmask;
  7859               gcv.clip_x_origin = p->x;
  7860               gcv.clip_y_origin = p->y;
  7861               XChangeGC (display, gc, GCClipMask | GCClipXOrigin | GCClipYOrigin, &gcv);
  7862             }
  7863         }
  7864 
  7865 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
  7866       if (picture != None)
  7867         {
  7868           x_xr_apply_ext_clip (f, gc);
  7869           XRenderComposite (display, PictOpSrc, picture,
  7870                             None, FRAME_X_PICTURE (f),
  7871                             0, 0, 0, 0, p->x, p->y, p->wd, p->h);
  7872           x_xr_reset_ext_clip (f);
  7873 
  7874           XRenderFreePicture (display, picture);
  7875         }
  7876       else
  7877 #endif
  7878         XCopyArea (display, pixmap, drawable, gc, 0, 0,
  7879                    p->wd, p->h, p->x, p->y);
  7880       XFreePixmap (display, pixmap);
  7881 
  7882       if (p->overlay_p)
  7883         {
  7884           gcv.clip_mask = (Pixmap) 0;
  7885           XChangeGC (display, gc, GCClipMask, &gcv);
  7886           XFreePixmap (display, clipmask);
  7887         }
  7888     }
  7889 #endif  /* not USE_CAIRO */
  7890 
  7891   x_reset_clip_rectangles (f, gc);
  7892 }
  7893 
  7894 /***********************************************************************
  7895                             Glyph display
  7896  ***********************************************************************/
  7897 
  7898 static bool x_alloc_lighter_color (struct frame *, Display *, Colormap,
  7899                                    unsigned long *, double, int);
  7900 static void x_scroll_bar_clear (struct frame *);
  7901 
  7902 #ifdef GLYPH_DEBUG
  7903 static void x_check_font (struct frame *, struct font *);
  7904 #endif
  7905 
  7906 /* If SEND_EVENT, make sure that TIME is larger than the current last
  7907    user time.  We don't sanitize timestamps from events sent by the X
  7908    server itself because some Lisp might have set the user time to a
  7909    ridiculously large value, and this way a more reasonable timestamp
  7910    can be obtained upon the next event.
  7911 
  7912    Alternatively, the server time could've overflowed.
  7913 
  7914    SET_PROPERTY specifies whether or not to change the user time
  7915    property for the active frame.  The important thing is to not set
  7916    the last user time upon leave events; on Metacity and GNOME Shell,
  7917    mapping a new frame on top of the old frame potentially causes
  7918    crossing events to be sent to the old frame if it contains the
  7919    pointer, as the new frame will initially stack above the old frame.
  7920    If _NET_WM_USER_TIME is changed at that point, then GNOME may get
  7921    notified about the user time change on the old frame before it
  7922    tries to focus the new frame, which will make it consider the new
  7923    frame (whose user time property will not have been updated at that
  7924    point, due to not being focused) as having been mapped
  7925    out-of-order, and lower the new frame, which is typically not what
  7926    users want.  */
  7927 
  7928 static void
  7929 x_display_set_last_user_time (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, Time time,
  7930                               bool send_event, bool set_property)
  7931 {
  7932 #if defined HAVE_XSYNC && !defined USE_GTK && defined HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME
  7933   uint_fast64_t monotonic_time;
  7934   uint_fast64_t monotonic_ms;
  7935   int_fast64_t diff_ms;
  7936 #endif
  7937 #ifndef USE_GTK
  7938   struct frame *focus_frame;
  7939   Time old_time;
  7940 
  7941   focus_frame = dpyinfo->x_focus_frame;
  7942   old_time = dpyinfo->last_user_time;
  7943 #endif
  7944 
  7945 #ifdef ENABLE_CHECKING
  7946   eassert (time <= X_ULONG_MAX);
  7947 #endif
  7948 
  7949   if (!send_event || time > dpyinfo->last_user_time)
  7950     dpyinfo->last_user_time = time;
  7951 
  7952 #if defined HAVE_XSYNC && !defined USE_GTK && defined HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME
  7953   if (!send_event)
  7954     {
  7955       /* See if the current CLOCK_MONOTONIC time is reasonably close
  7956          to the X server time.  */
  7957       monotonic_time = x_sync_current_monotonic_time ();
  7958       monotonic_ms = monotonic_time / 1000;
  7959 
  7960       dpyinfo->server_time_monotonic_p
  7961         = (monotonic_time != 0
  7962            && !ckd_sub (&diff_ms, time, monotonic_ms)
  7963            && -500 < diff_ms && diff_ms < 500);
  7964 
  7965       if (!dpyinfo->server_time_monotonic_p)
  7966         {
  7967           /* Compute an offset that can be subtracted from the server
  7968              time to estimate the monotonic time on the X server.  */
  7969 
  7970           if (!monotonic_time
  7971               || ckd_mul (&dpyinfo->server_time_offset, time, 1000)
  7972               || ckd_sub (&dpyinfo->server_time_offset,
  7973                           dpyinfo->server_time_offset, monotonic_time))
  7974             dpyinfo->server_time_offset = 0;
  7975 
  7976           /* If the server time is reasonably close to the monotonic
  7977              time after the latter is truncated to CARD32, simply make
  7978              the offset that between the server time in ms and the
  7979              actual time in ms.  */
  7980 
  7981           monotonic_ms = monotonic_ms & 0xffffffff;
  7982           if (!ckd_sub (&diff_ms, time, monotonic_ms)
  7983               && -500 < diff_ms && diff_ms < 500)
  7984             {
  7985               /* The server timestamp overflowed.  Make the time
  7986                  offset exactly how much it overflowed by.  */
  7987 
  7988               if (ckd_sub (&dpyinfo->server_time_offset,
  7989                            monotonic_time / 1000, monotonic_ms)
  7990                   || ckd_mul (&dpyinfo->server_time_offset,
  7991                               dpyinfo->server_time_offset, 1000)
  7992                   || ckd_sub (&dpyinfo->server_time_offset,
  7993                               0, dpyinfo->server_time_offset))
  7994                 dpyinfo->server_time_offset = 0;
  7995             }
  7996         }
  7997     }
  7998 #endif
  7999 
  8000 #ifndef USE_GTK
  8001   /* Don't waste bandwidth if the time hasn't actually changed.  */
  8002   if (focus_frame && old_time != dpyinfo->last_user_time
  8003       && set_property)
  8004     {
  8005       time = dpyinfo->last_user_time;
  8006 
  8007       while (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (focus_frame))
  8008         focus_frame = FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (focus_frame);
  8009 
  8010       if (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (focus_frame)->user_time_window != None)
  8011         XChangeProperty (dpyinfo->display,
  8012                          FRAME_X_OUTPUT (focus_frame)->user_time_window,
  8013                          dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_user_time,
  8014                          XA_CARDINAL, 32, PropModeReplace,
  8015                          (unsigned char *) &time, 1);
  8016     }
  8017 #endif
  8018 }
  8019 
  8020 #ifdef USE_GTK
  8021 
  8022 static void
  8023 x_set_gtk_user_time (struct frame *f, Time time)
  8024 {
  8025   GtkWidget *widget;
  8026   GdkWindow *window;
  8027 
  8028   widget = FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f);
  8029   window = gtk_widget_get_window (widget);
  8030 
  8031   /* This widget isn't realized yet.  */
  8032   if (!window)
  8033     return;
  8034 
  8035   gdk_x11_window_set_user_time (window, time);
  8036 }
  8037 
  8038 #endif
  8039 
  8040 #if !defined USE_GTK || defined HAVE_XFIXES
  8041 
  8042 /* Create and return a special window for receiving events such as
  8043    selection notify events, and reporting user time.  The window is an
  8044    1x1 unmapped override-redirect InputOnly window at -1, -1 relative
  8045    to the parent, which should prevent it from doing anything.  */
  8046 
  8047 static Window
  8048 x_create_special_window (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
  8049                          Window parent_window)
  8050 {
  8051   XSetWindowAttributes attrs;
  8052 
  8053   attrs.override_redirect = True;
  8054 
  8055   return XCreateWindow (dpyinfo->display, parent_window,
  8056                         -1, -1, 1, 1, 0, CopyFromParent, InputOnly,
  8057                         CopyFromParent, CWOverrideRedirect, &attrs);
  8058 }
  8059 
  8060 #endif
  8061 
  8062 /* Not needed on GTK because GTK handles reporting the user time
  8063    itself.  */
  8064 
  8065 #ifndef USE_GTK
  8066 
  8067 static void
  8068 x_update_frame_user_time_window (struct frame *f)
  8069 {
  8070   struct x_output *output;
  8071   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
  8072 
  8073   output = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f);
  8074   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  8075 
  8076   if (!NILP (Vx_no_window_manager)
  8077       || !x_wm_supports (f, dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_user_time))
  8078     {
  8079       if (output->user_time_window != None
  8080           && output->user_time_window != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f))
  8081         {
  8082           XDestroyWindow (dpyinfo->display, output->user_time_window);
  8083           XDeleteProperty (dpyinfo->display, FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
  8084                            dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_user_time_window);
  8085         }
  8086       else
  8087         XDeleteProperty (dpyinfo->display, FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
  8088                          dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_user_time);
  8089 
  8090       output->user_time_window = None;
  8091       return;
  8092     }
  8093 
  8094   if (!x_wm_supports (f, dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_user_time_window))
  8095     {
  8096       if (output->user_time_window == None)
  8097         output->user_time_window = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
  8098       else if (output->user_time_window != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f))
  8099         {
  8100           XDestroyWindow (dpyinfo->display,
  8101                           output->user_time_window);
  8102           XDeleteProperty (dpyinfo->display,
  8103                            FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
  8104                            dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_user_time_window);
  8105           output->user_time_window = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
  8106         }
  8107     }
  8108   else
  8109     {
  8110       if (output->user_time_window == FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f)
  8111           || output->user_time_window == None)
  8112         {
  8113           /* Create a "user time" window that is used to report user
  8114              activity on a given frame.  This is used in preference to
  8115              _NET_WM_USER_TIME, as using a separate window allows the
  8116              window manager to express interest in other properties
  8117              while only reading the user time when necessary, thereby
  8118              improving battery life by not involving the window
  8119              manager in each key press.  */
  8120 
  8121           output->user_time_window
  8122             = x_create_special_window (dpyinfo, FRAME_X_WINDOW (f));
  8123 
  8124           XDeleteProperty (dpyinfo->display, FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
  8125                            dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_user_time);
  8126           XChangeProperty (dpyinfo->display, FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
  8127                            dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_user_time_window,
  8128                            XA_WINDOW, 32, PropModeReplace,
  8129                            (unsigned char *) &output->user_time_window, 1);
  8130         }
  8131     }
  8132 }
  8133 
  8134 #endif
  8135 
  8136 void
  8137 x_set_last_user_time_from_lisp (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
  8138                                 Time time)
  8139 {
  8140   x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, time, true, true);
  8141 }
  8142 
  8143 
  8144 /* Set S->gc to a suitable GC for drawing glyph string S in cursor
  8145    face.  */
  8146 
  8147 static void
  8148 x_set_cursor_gc (struct glyph_string *s)
  8149 {
  8150   if (s->font == FRAME_FONT (s->f)
  8151       && s->face->background == FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (s->f)
  8152       && s->face->foreground == FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (s->f)
  8153       && !s->cmp)
  8154     s->gc = s->f->output_data.x->cursor_gc;
  8155   else
  8156     {
  8157       /* Cursor on non-default face: must merge.  */
  8158       XGCValues xgcv;
  8159       unsigned long mask;
  8160       Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
  8161 
  8162       xgcv.background = s->f->output_data.x->cursor_pixel;
  8163       xgcv.foreground = s->face->background;
  8164 
  8165       /* If the glyph would be invisible, try a different foreground.  */
  8166       if (xgcv.foreground == xgcv.background)
  8167         xgcv.foreground = s->face->foreground;
  8168       if (xgcv.foreground == xgcv.background)
  8169         xgcv.foreground = s->f->output_data.x->cursor_foreground_pixel;
  8170       if (xgcv.foreground == xgcv.background)
  8171         xgcv.foreground = s->face->foreground;
  8172 
  8173       /* Make sure the cursor is distinct from text in this face.  */
  8174       if (xgcv.background == s->face->background
  8175           && xgcv.foreground == s->face->foreground)
  8176         {
  8177           xgcv.background = s->face->foreground;
  8178           xgcv.foreground = s->face->background;
  8179         }
  8180 
  8181       IF_DEBUG (x_check_font (s->f, s->font));
  8182       xgcv.graphics_exposures = False;
  8183       xgcv.line_width = 1;
  8184       mask = (GCForeground | GCBackground
  8185               | GCGraphicsExposures
  8186               | GCLineWidth);
  8187 
  8188       if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (s->f)->scratch_cursor_gc)
  8189         XChangeGC (display, FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (s->f)->scratch_cursor_gc,
  8190                    mask, &xgcv);
  8191       else
  8192         FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (s->f)->scratch_cursor_gc
  8193           = XCreateGC (display, FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (s->f), mask, &xgcv);
  8194 
  8195       s->gc = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (s->f)->scratch_cursor_gc;
  8196     }
  8197 }
  8198 
  8199 
  8200 /* Set up S->gc of glyph string S for drawing text in mouse face.  */
  8201 
  8202 static void
  8203 x_set_mouse_face_gc (struct glyph_string *s)
  8204 {
  8205   if (s->font == s->face->font)
  8206     s->gc = s->face->gc;
  8207   else
  8208     {
  8209       /* Otherwise construct scratch_cursor_gc with values from FACE
  8210          except for FONT.  */
  8211       XGCValues xgcv;
  8212       unsigned long mask;
  8213       Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
  8214 
  8215       xgcv.background = s->face->background;
  8216       xgcv.foreground = s->face->foreground;
  8217       xgcv.graphics_exposures = False;
  8218       xgcv.line_width = 1;
  8219 
  8220       mask = (GCForeground | GCBackground
  8221               | GCGraphicsExposures
  8222               | GCLineWidth);
  8223 
  8224       if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (s->f)->scratch_cursor_gc)
  8225         XChangeGC (display, FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (s->f)->scratch_cursor_gc,
  8226                    mask, &xgcv);
  8227       else
  8228         FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (s->f)->scratch_cursor_gc
  8229           = XCreateGC (display, FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (s->f), mask, &xgcv);
  8230 
  8231       s->gc = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (s->f)->scratch_cursor_gc;
  8232 
  8233     }
  8234   eassert (s->gc != 0);
  8235 }
  8236 
  8237 
  8238 /* Set S->gc of glyph string S to a GC suitable for drawing a mode line.
  8239    Faces to use in the mode line have already been computed when the
  8240    matrix was built, so there isn't much to do, here.  */
  8241 
  8242 static void
  8243 x_set_mode_line_face_gc (struct glyph_string *s)
  8244 {
  8245   s->gc = s->face->gc;
  8246 }
  8247 
  8248 
  8249 /* Set S->gc of glyph string S for drawing that glyph string.  Set
  8250    S->stippled_p to a non-zero value if the face of S has a stipple
  8251    pattern.  */
  8252 
  8253 static void
  8254 x_set_glyph_string_gc (struct glyph_string *s)
  8255 {
  8256   prepare_face_for_display (s->f, s->face);
  8257 
  8258   if (s->hl == DRAW_NORMAL_TEXT)
  8259     {
  8260       s->gc = s->face->gc;
  8261       s->stippled_p = s->face->stipple != 0;
  8262     }
  8263   else if (s->hl == DRAW_INVERSE_VIDEO)
  8264     {
  8265       x_set_mode_line_face_gc (s);
  8266       s->stippled_p = s->face->stipple != 0;
  8267     }
  8268   else if (s->hl == DRAW_CURSOR)
  8269     {
  8270       x_set_cursor_gc (s);
  8271       s->stippled_p = false;
  8272     }
  8273   else if (s->hl == DRAW_MOUSE_FACE)
  8274     {
  8275       x_set_mouse_face_gc (s);
  8276       s->stippled_p = s->face->stipple != 0;
  8277     }
  8278   else if (s->hl == DRAW_IMAGE_RAISED
  8279            || s->hl == DRAW_IMAGE_SUNKEN)
  8280     {
  8281       s->gc = s->face->gc;
  8282       s->stippled_p = s->face->stipple != 0;
  8283     }
  8284   else
  8285     emacs_abort ();
  8286 
  8287   /* GC must have been set.  */
  8288   eassert (s->gc != 0);
  8289 }
  8290 
  8291 
  8292 /* Set clipping for output of glyph string S.  S may be part of a mode
  8293    line or menu if we don't have X toolkit support.  */
  8294 
  8295 static void
  8296 x_set_glyph_string_clipping (struct glyph_string *s)
  8297 {
  8298   XRectangle *r = s->clip;
  8299   int n = get_glyph_string_clip_rects (s, r, 2);
  8300 
  8301   if (n > 0)
  8302     x_set_clip_rectangles (s->f, s->gc, r, n);
  8303   s->num_clips = n;
  8304 }
  8305 
  8306 
  8307 /* Set SRC's clipping for output of glyph string DST.  This is called
  8308    when we are drawing DST's left_overhang or right_overhang only in
  8309    the area of SRC.  */
  8310 
  8311 static void
  8312 x_set_glyph_string_clipping_exactly (struct glyph_string *src, struct glyph_string *dst)
  8313 {
  8314   XRectangle r;
  8315 
  8316   r.x = src->x;
  8317   r.width = src->width;
  8318   r.y = src->y;
  8319   r.height = src->height;
  8320   dst->clip[0] = r;
  8321   dst->num_clips = 1;
  8322   x_set_clip_rectangles (dst->f, dst->gc, &r, 1);
  8323 }
  8324 
  8325 
  8326 /* RIF:
  8327    Compute left and right overhang of glyph string S.  */
  8328 
  8329 static void
  8330 x_compute_glyph_string_overhangs (struct glyph_string *s)
  8331 {
  8332   if (s->cmp == NULL
  8333       && (s->first_glyph->type == CHAR_GLYPH
  8334           || s->first_glyph->type == COMPOSITE_GLYPH))
  8335     {
  8336       struct font_metrics metrics;
  8337 
  8338       if (s->first_glyph->type == CHAR_GLYPH)
  8339         {
  8340           struct font *font = s->font;
  8341           font->driver->text_extents (font, s->char2b, s->nchars, &metrics);
  8342         }
  8343       else
  8344         {
  8345           Lisp_Object gstring = composition_gstring_from_id (s->cmp_id);
  8346 
  8347           composition_gstring_width (gstring, s->cmp_from, s->cmp_to, &metrics);
  8348         }
  8349       s->right_overhang = (metrics.rbearing > metrics.width
  8350                            ? metrics.rbearing - metrics.width : 0);
  8351       s->left_overhang = metrics.lbearing < 0 ? - metrics.lbearing : 0;
  8352     }
  8353   else if (s->cmp)
  8354     {
  8355       s->right_overhang = s->cmp->rbearing - s->cmp->pixel_width;
  8356       s->left_overhang = - s->cmp->lbearing;
  8357     }
  8358 }
  8359 
  8360 
  8361 /* Fill rectangle X, Y, W, H with background color of glyph string S.  */
  8362 
  8363 static void
  8364 x_clear_glyph_string_rect (struct glyph_string *s, int x, int y, int w, int h)
  8365 {
  8366   x_clear_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, x, y, w, h, s->hl != DRAW_CURSOR);
  8367 }
  8368 
  8369 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
  8370 
  8371 static void
  8372 x_clear_point (struct frame *f, GC gc, int x, int y,
  8373                bool respect_alpha_background)
  8374 {
  8375   XGCValues xgcv;
  8376   Display *dpy;
  8377 
  8378   dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  8379 
  8380   if (f->alpha_background != 1.0
  8381       && respect_alpha_background)
  8382     {
  8383       x_clear_rectangle (f, gc, x, y, 1, 1, true);
  8384       return;
  8385     }
  8386 
  8387   XGetGCValues (dpy, gc, GCBackground | GCForeground, &xgcv);
  8388   XSetForeground (dpy, gc, xgcv.background);
  8389   XDrawPoint (dpy, FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f), gc, x, y);
  8390   XSetForeground (dpy, gc, xgcv.foreground);
  8391 }
  8392 
  8393 #endif
  8394 
  8395 /* Draw the background of glyph_string S.  If S->background_filled_p
  8396    is non-zero don't draw it.  FORCE_P non-zero means draw the
  8397    background even if it wouldn't be drawn normally.  This is used
  8398    when a string preceding S draws into the background of S, or S
  8399    contains the first component of a composition.  */
  8400 
  8401 static void
  8402 x_draw_glyph_string_background (struct glyph_string *s, bool force_p)
  8403 {
  8404   /* Nothing to do if background has already been drawn or if it
  8405      shouldn't be drawn in the first place.  */
  8406   if (!s->background_filled_p)
  8407     {
  8408       int box_line_width = max (s->face->box_horizontal_line_width, 0);
  8409 
  8410       if (s->stippled_p)
  8411         {
  8412           Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
  8413 
  8414           /* Fill background with a stipple pattern.  */
  8415           XSetFillStyle (display, s->gc, FillOpaqueStippled);
  8416           x_fill_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, s->x,
  8417                             s->y + box_line_width,
  8418                             s->background_width,
  8419                             s->height - 2 * box_line_width,
  8420                             s->hl != DRAW_CURSOR);
  8421           XSetFillStyle (display, s->gc, FillSolid);
  8422           s->background_filled_p = true;
  8423         }
  8424       else if (FONT_HEIGHT (s->font) < s->height - 2 * box_line_width
  8425                /* When xdisp.c ignores FONT_HEIGHT, we cannot trust
  8426                   font dimensions, since the actual glyphs might be
  8427                   much smaller.  So in that case we always clear the
  8428                   rectangle with background color.  */
  8429                || FONT_TOO_HIGH (s->font)
  8430                || s->font_not_found_p
  8431                || s->extends_to_end_of_line_p
  8432                || force_p)
  8433         {
  8434           x_clear_glyph_string_rect (s, s->x, s->y + box_line_width,
  8435                                      s->background_width,
  8436                                      s->height - 2 * box_line_width);
  8437           s->background_filled_p = true;
  8438         }
  8439     }
  8440 }
  8441 
  8442 
  8443 /* Draw the foreground of glyph string S.  */
  8444 
  8445 static void
  8446 x_draw_glyph_string_foreground (struct glyph_string *s)
  8447 {
  8448   int i, x;
  8449 
  8450   /* If first glyph of S has a left box line, start drawing the text
  8451      of S to the right of that box line.  */
  8452   if (s->face->box != FACE_NO_BOX
  8453       && s->first_glyph->left_box_line_p)
  8454     x = s->x + max (s->face->box_vertical_line_width, 0);
  8455   else
  8456     x = s->x;
  8457 
  8458   /* Draw characters of S as rectangles if S's font could not be
  8459      loaded.  */
  8460   if (s->font_not_found_p)
  8461     {
  8462       for (i = 0; i < s->nchars; ++i)
  8463         {
  8464           struct glyph *g = s->first_glyph + i;
  8465           x_draw_rectangle (s->f,
  8466                           s->gc, x, s->y, g->pixel_width - 1,
  8467                           s->height - 1);
  8468           x += g->pixel_width;
  8469         }
  8470     }
  8471   else
  8472     {
  8473       struct font *font = s->font;
  8474 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  8475       if (!EQ (font->driver->type, Qx)
  8476           || x_try_cr_xlib_drawable (s->f, s->gc))
  8477         {
  8478 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
  8479           int boff = font->baseline_offset;
  8480           int y;
  8481 
  8482           if (font->vertical_centering)
  8483             boff = VCENTER_BASELINE_OFFSET (font, s->f) - boff;
  8484 
  8485           y = s->ybase - boff;
  8486           if (s->for_overlaps
  8487               || (s->background_filled_p && s->hl != DRAW_CURSOR))
  8488             font->driver->draw (s, 0, s->nchars, x, y, false);
  8489           else
  8490             font->driver->draw (s, 0, s->nchars, x, y, true);
  8491           if (s->face->overstrike)
  8492             font->driver->draw (s, 0, s->nchars, x + 1, y, false);
  8493 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  8494           if (EQ (font->driver->type, Qx))
  8495             x_end_cr_xlib_drawable (s->f, s->gc);
  8496         }
  8497       else
  8498         {
