  8499           /* Fallback for the case that no Xlib Drawable is available
  8500              for drawing text with X core fonts.  */
  8501           if (!(s->for_overlaps
  8502                 || (s->background_filled_p && s->hl != DRAW_CURSOR)))
  8503             {
  8504               int box_line_width = max (s->face->box_horizontal_line_width, 0);
  8505 
  8506               if (s->stippled_p)
  8507                 {
  8508                   Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
  8509 
  8510                   /* Fill background with a stipple pattern.  */
  8511                   XSetFillStyle (display, s->gc, FillOpaqueStippled);
  8512                   x_fill_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, s->x,
  8513                                     s->y + box_line_width,
  8514                                     s->background_width,
  8515                                     s->height - 2 * box_line_width,
  8516                                     false);
  8517                   XSetFillStyle (display, s->gc, FillSolid);
  8518                 }
  8519               else
  8520                 x_clear_glyph_string_rect (s, s->x, s->y + box_line_width,
  8521                                            s->background_width,
  8522                                            s->height - 2 * box_line_width);
  8523             }
  8524           for (i = 0; i < s->nchars; ++i)
  8525             {
  8526               struct glyph *g = s->first_glyph + i;
  8527               x_draw_rectangle (s->f,
  8528                                 s->gc, x, s->y, g->pixel_width - 1,
  8529                                 s->height - 1);
  8530               x += g->pixel_width;
  8531             }
  8532         }
  8533 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
  8534     }
  8535 }
  8536 
  8537 /* Draw the foreground of composite glyph string S.  */
  8538 
  8539 static void
  8540 x_draw_composite_glyph_string_foreground (struct glyph_string *s)
  8541 {
  8542   int i, j, x;
  8543   struct font *font = s->font;
  8544 
  8545   /* If first glyph of S has a left box line, start drawing the text
  8546      of S to the right of that box line.  */
  8547   if (s->face && s->face->box != FACE_NO_BOX
  8548       && s->first_glyph->left_box_line_p)
  8549     x = s->x + max (s->face->box_vertical_line_width, 0);
  8550   else
  8551     x = s->x;
  8552 
  8553   /* S is a glyph string for a composition.  S->cmp_from is the index
  8554      of the first character drawn for glyphs of this composition.
  8555      S->cmp_from == 0 means we are drawing the very first character of
  8556      this composition.  */
  8557 
  8558   /* Draw a rectangle for the composition if the font for the very
  8559      first character of the composition could not be loaded.  */
  8560   if (s->font_not_found_p)
  8561     {
  8562       if (s->cmp_from == 0)
  8563         x_draw_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, x, s->y,
  8564                         s->width - 1, s->height - 1);
  8565     }
  8566   else
  8567 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  8568     if (!EQ (font->driver->type, Qx)
  8569         || x_try_cr_xlib_drawable (s->f, s->gc))
  8570       {
  8571 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
  8572         if (! s->first_glyph->u.cmp.automatic)
  8573           {
  8574             int y = s->ybase;
  8575 
  8576             for (i = 0, j = s->cmp_from; i < s->nchars; i++, j++)
  8577               /* TAB in a composition means display glyphs with
  8578                  padding space on the left or right.  */
  8579               if (COMPOSITION_GLYPH (s->cmp, j) != '\t')
  8580                 {
  8581                   int xx = x + s->cmp->offsets[j * 2];
  8582                   int yy = y - s->cmp->offsets[j * 2 + 1];
  8583 
  8584                   font->driver->draw (s, j, j + 1, xx, yy, false);
  8585                   if (s->face->overstrike)
  8586                     font->driver->draw (s, j, j + 1, xx + 1, yy, false);
  8587                 }
  8588           }
  8589         else
  8590           {
  8591             Lisp_Object gstring = composition_gstring_from_id (s->cmp_id);
  8592             Lisp_Object glyph;
  8593             int y = s->ybase;
  8594             int width = 0;
  8595 
  8596             for (i = j = s->cmp_from; i < s->cmp_to; i++)
  8597               {
  8598                 glyph = LGSTRING_GLYPH (gstring, i);
  8599                 if (NILP (LGLYPH_ADJUSTMENT (glyph)))
  8600                   width += LGLYPH_WIDTH (glyph);
  8601                 else
  8602                   {
  8603                     int xoff, yoff, wadjust;
  8604 
  8605                     if (j < i)
  8606                       {
  8607                         font->driver->draw (s, j, i, x, y, false);
  8608                         if (s->face->overstrike)
  8609                           font->driver->draw (s, j, i, x + 1, y, false);
  8610                         x += width;
  8611                       }
  8612                     xoff = LGLYPH_XOFF (glyph);
  8613                     yoff = LGLYPH_YOFF (glyph);
  8614                     wadjust = LGLYPH_WADJUST (glyph);
  8615                     font->driver->draw (s, i, i + 1, x + xoff, y + yoff, false);
  8616                     if (s->face->overstrike)
  8617                       font->driver->draw (s, i, i + 1, x + xoff + 1, y + yoff,
  8618                                           false);
  8619                     x += wadjust;
  8620                     j = i + 1;
  8621                     width = 0;
  8622                   }
  8623               }
  8624             if (j < i)
  8625               {
  8626                 font->driver->draw (s, j, i, x, y, false);
  8627                 if (s->face->overstrike)
  8628                   font->driver->draw (s, j, i, x + 1, y, false);
  8629               }
  8630           }
  8631 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  8632         if (EQ (font->driver->type, Qx))
  8633           x_end_cr_xlib_drawable (s->f, s->gc);
  8634       }
  8635     else
  8636       {
  8637         /* Fallback for the case that no Xlib Drawable is available
  8638            for drawing text with X core fonts.  */
  8639         if (s->cmp_from == 0)
  8640           x_draw_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, x, s->y,
  8641                             s->width - 1, s->height - 1);
  8642       }
  8643 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
  8644 }
  8645 
  8646 
  8647 /* Draw the foreground of glyph string S for glyphless characters.  */
  8648 
  8649 static void
  8650 x_draw_glyphless_glyph_string_foreground (struct glyph_string *s)
  8651 {
  8652   struct glyph *glyph = s->first_glyph;
  8653   unsigned char2b[8];
  8654   int x, i, j;
  8655 
  8656   /* If first glyph of S has a left box line, start drawing the text
  8657      of S to the right of that box line.  */
  8658   if (s->face && s->face->box != FACE_NO_BOX
  8659       && s->first_glyph->left_box_line_p)
  8660     x = s->x + max (s->face->box_vertical_line_width, 0);
  8661   else
  8662     x = s->x;
  8663 
  8664   s->char2b = char2b;
  8665 
  8666   for (i = 0; i < s->nchars; i++, glyph++)
  8667     {
  8668 #ifdef GCC_LINT
  8669       enum { PACIFY_GCC_BUG_81401 = 1 };
  8670 #else
  8671       enum { PACIFY_GCC_BUG_81401 = 0 };
  8672 #endif
  8673       char buf[7 + PACIFY_GCC_BUG_81401];
  8674       char *str = NULL;
  8675       int len = glyph->u.glyphless.len;
  8676 
  8677       if (glyph->u.glyphless.method == GLYPHLESS_DISPLAY_ACRONYM)
  8678         {
  8679           if (len > 0
  8680               && CHAR_TABLE_P (Vglyphless_char_display)
  8681               && (CHAR_TABLE_EXTRA_SLOTS (XCHAR_TABLE (Vglyphless_char_display))
  8682                   >= 1))
  8683             {
  8684               Lisp_Object acronym
  8685                 = (! glyph->u.glyphless.for_no_font
  8686                    ? CHAR_TABLE_REF (Vglyphless_char_display,
  8687                                      glyph->u.glyphless.ch)
  8688                    : XCHAR_TABLE (Vglyphless_char_display)->extras[0]);
  8689               if (CONSP (acronym))
  8690                 acronym = XCAR (acronym);
  8691               if (STRINGP (acronym))
  8692                 str = SSDATA (acronym);
  8693             }
  8694         }
  8695       else if (glyph->u.glyphless.method == GLYPHLESS_DISPLAY_HEX_CODE)
  8696         {
  8697           unsigned int ch = glyph->u.glyphless.ch;
  8698           eassume (ch <= MAX_CHAR);
  8699           sprintf (buf, "%0*X", ch < 0x10000 ? 4 : 6, ch);
  8700           str = buf;
  8701         }
  8702 
  8703       if (str)
  8704         {
  8705           int upper_len = (len + 1) / 2;
  8706 
  8707           /* It is assured that all LEN characters in STR is ASCII.  */
  8708           for (j = 0; j < len; j++)
  8709             char2b[j] = s->font->driver->encode_char (s->font, str[j]) & 0xFFFF;
  8710           s->font->driver->draw (s, 0, upper_len,
  8711                                  x + glyph->slice.glyphless.upper_xoff,
  8712                                  s->ybase + glyph->slice.glyphless.upper_yoff,
  8713                                  false);
  8714           s->font->driver->draw (s, upper_len, len,
  8715                                  x + glyph->slice.glyphless.lower_xoff,
  8716                                  s->ybase + glyph->slice.glyphless.lower_yoff,
  8717                                  false);
  8718         }
  8719       if (glyph->u.glyphless.method != GLYPHLESS_DISPLAY_THIN_SPACE)
  8720         x_draw_rectangle (s->f, s->gc,
  8721                         x, s->ybase - glyph->ascent,
  8722                         glyph->pixel_width - 1,
  8723                         glyph->ascent + glyph->descent - 1);
  8724       x += glyph->pixel_width;
  8725    }
  8726 
  8727   /* Defend against hypothetical bad code elsewhere that uses
  8728      s->char2b after this function returns.  */
  8729   s->char2b = NULL;
  8730 }
  8731 
  8732 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
  8733 
  8734 #ifdef USE_LUCID
  8735 
  8736 /* Return the frame on which widget WIDGET is used.. Abort if frame
  8737    cannot be determined.  */
  8738 
  8739 static struct frame *
  8740 x_frame_of_widget (Widget widget)
  8741 {
  8742   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
  8743   Lisp_Object tail, frame;
  8744   struct frame *f;
  8745 
  8746   dpyinfo = x_display_info_for_display (XtDisplay (widget));
  8747 
  8748   /* Find the top-level shell of the widget.  Note that this function
  8749      can be called when the widget is not yet realized, so XtWindow
  8750      (widget) == 0.  That's the reason we can't simply use
  8751      x_any_window_to_frame.  */
  8752   while (!XtIsTopLevelShell (widget))
  8753     widget = XtParent (widget);
  8754 
  8755   /* Look for a frame with that top-level widget.  Allocate the color
  8756      on that frame to get the right gamma correction value.  */
  8757   FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
  8758     {
  8759       f = XFRAME (frame);
  8760       if (FRAME_X_P (f)
  8761           && FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f) == dpyinfo
  8762           && f->output_data.x->widget == widget)
  8763         return f;
  8764     }
  8765   emacs_abort ();
  8766 }
  8767 
  8768 /* Allocate a color which is lighter or darker than *PIXEL by FACTOR
  8769    or DELTA.  Try a color with RGB values multiplied by FACTOR first.
  8770    If this produces the same color as PIXEL, try a color where all RGB
  8771    values have DELTA added.  Return the allocated color in *PIXEL.
  8772    DISPLAY is the X display, CMAP is the colormap to operate on.
  8773    Value is true if successful.  */
  8774 
  8775 bool
  8776 x_alloc_lighter_color_for_widget (Widget widget, Display *display, Colormap cmap,
  8777                                   unsigned long *pixel, double factor, int delta)
  8778 {
  8779   struct frame *f = x_frame_of_widget (widget);
  8780   return x_alloc_lighter_color (f, display, cmap, pixel, factor, delta);
  8781 }
  8782 
  8783 #endif /* USE_LUCID */
  8784 
  8785 
  8786 /* Structure specifying which arguments should be passed by Xt to
  8787    cvt_string_to_pixel.  We want the widget's screen and colormap.  */
  8788 
  8789 static XtConvertArgRec cvt_string_to_pixel_args[] =
  8790   {
  8791     {XtWidgetBaseOffset, (XtPointer) offsetof (WidgetRec, core.screen),
  8792      sizeof (Screen *)},
  8793     {XtWidgetBaseOffset, (XtPointer) offsetof (WidgetRec, core.colormap),
  8794      sizeof (Colormap)}
  8795   };
  8796 
  8797 
  8798 /* The address of this variable is returned by
  8799    cvt_string_to_pixel.  */
  8800 
  8801 static Pixel cvt_string_to_pixel_value;
  8802 
  8803 
  8804 /* Convert a color name to a pixel color.
  8805 
  8806    DPY is the display we are working on.
  8807 
  8808    ARGS is an array of *NARGS XrmValue structures holding additional
  8809    information about the widget for which the conversion takes place.
  8810    The contents of this array are determined by the specification
  8811    in cvt_string_to_pixel_args.
  8812 
  8813    FROM is a pointer to an XrmValue which points to the color name to
  8814    convert.  TO is an XrmValue in which to return the pixel color.
  8815 
  8816    CLOSURE_RET is a pointer to user-data, in which we record if
  8817    we allocated the color or not.
  8818 
  8819    Value is True if successful, False otherwise.  */
  8820 
  8821 static Boolean
  8822 cvt_string_to_pixel (Display *dpy, XrmValue *args, Cardinal *nargs,
  8823                      XrmValue *from, XrmValue *to,
  8824                      XtPointer *closure_ret)
  8825 {
  8826   Screen *screen;
  8827   Colormap cmap;
  8828   Pixel pixel;
  8829   String color_name;
  8830   XColor color;
  8831 
  8832   if (*nargs != 2)
  8833     {
  8834       XtAppWarningMsg (XtDisplayToApplicationContext (dpy),
  8835                        "wrongParameters", "cvt_string_to_pixel",
  8836                        "XtToolkitError",
  8837                        "Screen and colormap args required", NULL, NULL);
  8838       return False;
  8839     }
  8840 
  8841   screen = *(Screen **) args[0].addr;
  8842   cmap = *(Colormap *) args[1].addr;
  8843   color_name = (String) from->addr;
  8844 
  8845   if (strcmp (color_name, XtDefaultBackground) == 0)
  8846     {
  8847       *closure_ret = (XtPointer) False;
  8848       pixel = WhitePixelOfScreen (screen);
  8849     }
  8850   else if (strcmp (color_name, XtDefaultForeground) == 0)
  8851     {
  8852       *closure_ret = (XtPointer) False;
  8853       pixel = BlackPixelOfScreen (screen);
  8854     }
  8855   else if (XParseColor (dpy, cmap, color_name, &color)
  8856            && x_alloc_nearest_color_1 (dpy, cmap, &color))
  8857     {
  8858       pixel = color.pixel;
  8859       *closure_ret = (XtPointer) True;
  8860     }
  8861   else
  8862     {
  8863       String params[1];
  8864       Cardinal nparams = 1;
  8865 
  8866       params[0] = color_name;
  8867       XtAppWarningMsg (XtDisplayToApplicationContext (dpy),
  8868                        "badValue", "cvt_string_to_pixel",
  8869                        "XtToolkitError", "Invalid color '%s'",
  8870                        params, &nparams);
  8871       return False;
  8872     }
  8873 
  8874   if (to->addr != NULL)
  8875     {
  8876       if (to->size < sizeof (Pixel))
  8877         {
  8878           to->size = sizeof (Pixel);
  8879           return False;
  8880         }
  8881 
  8882       *(Pixel *) to->addr = pixel;
  8883     }
  8884   else
  8885     {
  8886       cvt_string_to_pixel_value = pixel;
  8887       to->addr = (XtPointer) &cvt_string_to_pixel_value;
  8888     }
  8889 
  8890   to->size = sizeof (Pixel);
  8891   return True;
  8892 }
  8893 
  8894 
  8895 /* Free a pixel color which was previously allocated via
  8896    cvt_string_to_pixel.  This is registered as the destructor
  8897    for this type of resource via XtSetTypeConverter.
  8898 
  8899    APP is the application context in which we work.
  8900 
  8901    TO is a pointer to an XrmValue holding the color to free.
  8902    CLOSURE is the value we stored in CLOSURE_RET for this color
  8903    in cvt_string_to_pixel.
  8904 
  8905    ARGS and NARGS are like for cvt_string_to_pixel.  */
  8906 
  8907 static void
  8908 cvt_pixel_dtor (XtAppContext app, XrmValuePtr to, XtPointer closure, XrmValuePtr args,
  8909                 Cardinal *nargs)
  8910 {
  8911   if (*nargs != 2)
  8912     {
  8913       XtAppWarningMsg (app, "wrongParameters", "cvt_pixel_dtor",
  8914                        "XtToolkitError",
  8915                        "Screen and colormap arguments required",
  8916                        NULL, NULL);
  8917     }
  8918   else if (closure != NULL)
  8919     {
  8920       /* We did allocate the pixel, so free it.  */
  8921       Screen *screen = *(Screen **) args[0].addr;
  8922       Colormap cmap = *(Colormap *) args[1].addr;
  8923       x_free_dpy_colors (DisplayOfScreen (screen), screen, cmap,
  8924                          (Pixel *) to->addr, 1);
  8925     }
  8926 }
  8927 
  8928 
  8929 #endif /* USE_X_TOOLKIT */
  8930 
  8931 
  8932 /* Value is an array of XColor structures for the contents of the
  8933    color map of display DPY.  Set *NCELLS to the size of the array.
  8934    Note that this probably shouldn't be called for large color maps,
  8935    say a 24-bit TrueColor map.  */
  8936 
  8937 static const XColor *
  8938 x_color_cells (Display *dpy, int *ncells)
  8939 {
  8940   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = x_display_info_for_display (dpy);
  8941   eassume (dpyinfo);
  8942 
  8943   if (dpyinfo->color_cells == NULL)
  8944     {
  8945       int ncolor_cells = dpyinfo->visual_info.colormap_size;
  8946       int i;
  8947 
  8948       dpyinfo->color_cells = xnmalloc (ncolor_cells,
  8949                                        sizeof *dpyinfo->color_cells);
  8950       dpyinfo->ncolor_cells = ncolor_cells;
  8951 
  8952       for (i = 0; i < ncolor_cells; ++i)
  8953         dpyinfo->color_cells[i].pixel = i;
  8954 
  8955       XQueryColors (dpy, dpyinfo->cmap,
  8956                     dpyinfo->color_cells, ncolor_cells);
  8957     }
  8958 
  8959   *ncells = dpyinfo->ncolor_cells;
  8960   return dpyinfo->color_cells;
  8961 }
  8962 
  8963 
  8964 /* On frame F, translate pixel colors to RGB values for the NCOLORS
  8965    colors in COLORS.  Use cached information, if available.
  8966 
  8967    Pixel values are in unsigned normalized format, meaning that
  8968    extending missing bits is done straightforwardly without any
  8969    complex colorspace conversions.  */
  8970 
  8971 void
  8972 x_query_colors (struct frame *f, XColor *colors, int ncolors)
  8973 {
  8974   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  8975   int i;
  8976 
  8977   if (dpyinfo->red_bits > 0)
  8978     {
  8979       /* For TrueColor displays, we can decompose the RGB value
  8980          directly.  */
  8981       unsigned int rmult, gmult, bmult;
  8982       unsigned int rmask, gmask, bmask;
  8983 
  8984       rmask = (1 << dpyinfo->red_bits) - 1;
  8985       gmask = (1 << dpyinfo->green_bits) - 1;
  8986       bmask = (1 << dpyinfo->blue_bits) - 1;
  8987       /* If we're widening, for example, 8 bits in the pixel value to
  8988          16 bits for the separate-color representation, we want to
  8989          extrapolate the lower bits based on those bits available --
  8990          in other words, we'd like 0xff to become 0xffff instead of
  8991          the 0xff00 we'd get by just zero-filling the lower bits.
  8992 
  8993          We generate a 32-bit scaled-up value and shift it, in case
  8994          the bit count doesn't divide 16 evenly (e.g., when dealing
  8995          with a 3-3-2 bit RGB display), to get more of the lower bits
  8996          correct.
  8997 
  8998          Should we cache the multipliers in dpyinfo?  Maybe
  8999          special-case the 8-8-8 common case?  */
  9000       rmult = 0xffffffff / rmask;
  9001       gmult = 0xffffffff / gmask;
  9002       bmult = 0xffffffff / bmask;
  9003 
  9004       for (i = 0; i < ncolors; ++i)
  9005         {
  9006           unsigned int r, g, b;
  9007           unsigned long pixel = colors[i].pixel;
  9008 
  9009           r = (pixel >> dpyinfo->red_offset) & rmask;
  9010           g = (pixel >> dpyinfo->green_offset) & gmask;
  9011           b = (pixel >> dpyinfo->blue_offset) & bmask;
  9012 
  9013           colors[i].red = (r * rmult) >> 16;
  9014           colors[i].green = (g * gmult) >> 16;
  9015           colors[i].blue = (b * bmult) >> 16;
  9016         }
  9017 
  9018       return;
  9019     }
  9020 
  9021   if (dpyinfo->color_cells)
  9022     {
  9023       int i;
  9024       for (i = 0; i < ncolors; ++i)
  9025         {
  9026           unsigned long pixel = colors[i].pixel;
  9027           eassert (pixel < dpyinfo->ncolor_cells);
  9028           eassert (dpyinfo->color_cells[pixel].pixel == pixel);
  9029           colors[i] = dpyinfo->color_cells[pixel];
  9030         }
  9031       return;
  9032     }
  9033 
  9034   XQueryColors (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f), colors, ncolors);
  9035 }
  9036 
  9037 /* Store F's real background color into *BGCOLOR.  */
  9038 
  9039 static void
  9040 x_query_frame_background_color (struct frame *f, XColor *bgcolor)
  9041 {
  9042   unsigned long background = FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f);
  9043 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
  9044   XColor bg;
  9045 #endif
  9046 
  9047   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->alpha_bits)
  9048     {
  9049 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  9050       background = (background & ~FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->alpha_mask);
  9051       background |= (((unsigned long) (f->alpha_background * 0xffff)
  9052                       >> (16 - FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->alpha_bits))
  9053                      << FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->alpha_offset);
  9054 #else
  9055       if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->alpha_bits
  9056           && f->alpha_background < 1.0)
  9057         {
  9058           bg.pixel = background;
  9059           x_query_colors (f, &bg, 1);
  9060 
  9061           background
  9062             = x_premultiply_pixel (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
  9063                                    &bg, f->alpha_background);
  9064         }
  9065 #endif
  9066     }
  9067 
  9068   bgcolor->pixel = background;
  9069 
  9070   x_query_colors (f, bgcolor, 1);
  9071 }
  9072 
  9073 static unsigned int
  9074 x_hash_string_ignore_case (const char *string)
  9075 {
  9076   unsigned int i;
  9077 
  9078   i = 3323198485ul;
  9079   for (; *string; ++string)
  9080     {
  9081       i ^= c_tolower (*string);
  9082       i *= 0x5bd1e995;
  9083       i ^= i >> 15;
  9084     }
  9085   return i;
  9086 }
  9087 
  9088 /* On frame F, translate the color name to RGB values.  Use cached
  9089    information, if possible.
  9090 
  9091    If too many entries are placed in the cache, the least recently
  9092    used entries are removed.  */
  9093 
  9094 Status
  9095 x_parse_color (struct frame *f, const char *color_name,
  9096                XColor *color)
  9097 {
  9098   unsigned short r, g, b;
  9099   Display *dpy;
  9100   Colormap cmap;
  9101   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
  9102   struct color_name_cache_entry *cache_entry, *last;
  9103   struct color_name_cache_entry *next, *color_entry;
  9104   unsigned int hash, idx;
  9105   int rc, i;
  9106 
  9107   /* Don't pass #RGB strings directly to XParseColor, because that
  9108      follows the X convention of zero-extending each channel
  9109      value: #f00 means #f00000.  We want the convention of scaling
  9110      channel values, so #f00 means #ff0000, just as it does for
  9111      HTML, SVG, and CSS.  */
  9112   if (parse_color_spec (color_name, &r, &g, &b))
  9113     {
  9114       color->red = r;
  9115       color->green = g;
  9116       color->blue = b;
  9117 
  9118       return 1;
  9119     }
  9120 
  9121   /* Some X servers send BadValue on empty color names.  */
  9122   if (!strlen (color_name))
  9123     return 0;
  9124 
  9125   cmap = FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f);
  9126   dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  9127   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  9128 
  9129   hash = x_hash_string_ignore_case (color_name);
  9130   idx = hash % dpyinfo->color_names_size;
  9131 
  9132   last = NULL;
  9133 
  9134   for (cache_entry = dpyinfo->color_names[idx];
  9135        cache_entry; cache_entry = cache_entry->next)
  9136     {
  9137       if (!xstrcasecmp (cache_entry->name, color_name))
  9138         {
  9139           /* Move recently used entries to the start of the color
  9140              cache.  */
  9141 
  9142           if (last)
  9143             {
  9144               last->next = cache_entry->next;
  9145               cache_entry->next = dpyinfo->color_names[idx];
  9146 
  9147               dpyinfo->color_names[idx] = cache_entry;
  9148             }
  9149 
  9150           if (cache_entry->valid)
  9151             *color = cache_entry->rgb;
  9152 
  9153           return cache_entry->valid;
  9154         }
  9155 
  9156       last = cache_entry;
  9157     }
  9158 
  9159   block_input ();
  9160   rc = XParseColor (dpy, cmap, color_name, color);
  9161   unblock_input ();
  9162 
  9163   cache_entry = xzalloc (sizeof *cache_entry);
  9164   dpyinfo->color_names_length[idx] += 1;
  9165 
  9166   if (rc)
  9167     cache_entry->rgb = *color;
  9168 
  9169   cache_entry->valid = rc;
  9170   cache_entry->name = xstrdup (color_name);
  9171   cache_entry->next = dpyinfo->color_names[idx];
  9172 
  9173   dpyinfo->color_names[idx] = cache_entry;
  9174 
  9175   /* Don't let the color cache become too big.  */
  9176   if (dpyinfo->color_names_length[idx] > (x_color_cache_bucket_size > 0
  9177                                           ? x_color_cache_bucket_size : 128))
  9178     {
  9179       i = 0;
  9180 
  9181       for (last = dpyinfo->color_names[idx]; last; last = last->next)
  9182         {
  9183           if (++i == (x_color_cache_bucket_size > 0
  9184                       ? x_color_cache_bucket_size : 128))
  9185             {
  9186               next = last->next;
  9187               last->next = NULL;
  9188 
  9189               for (color_entry = next; color_entry; color_entry = last)
  9190                 {
  9191                   last = color_entry->next;
  9192 
  9193                   xfree (color_entry->name);
  9194                   xfree (color_entry);
  9195 
  9196                   dpyinfo->color_names_length[idx] -= 1;
  9197                 }
  9198 
  9199               return rc;
  9200             }
  9201         }
  9202     }
  9203 
  9204   return rc;
  9205 }
  9206 
  9207 
  9208 /* Allocate the color COLOR->pixel on DISPLAY, colormap CMAP.  If an
  9209    exact match can't be allocated, try the nearest color available.
  9210    Value is true if successful.  Set *COLOR to the color
  9211    allocated.  */
  9212 
  9213 static bool
  9214 x_alloc_nearest_color_1 (Display *dpy, Colormap cmap, XColor *color)
  9215 {
  9216   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = x_display_info_for_display (dpy);
  9217   bool rc;
  9218 
  9219   eassume (dpyinfo);
  9220   rc = XAllocColor (dpy, cmap, color) != 0;
  9221 
  9222   if (dpyinfo->visual_info.class == DirectColor)
  9223     return rc;
  9224 
  9225   if (rc == 0)
  9226     {
  9227       /* If we got to this point, the colormap is full, so we're going
  9228          to try and get the next closest color.  The algorithm used is
  9229          a least-squares matching, which is what X uses for closest
  9230          color matching with StaticColor visuals.  */
  9231 
  9232       const XColor *cells;
  9233       int no_cells;
  9234       int nearest;
  9235       long nearest_delta, trial_delta;
  9236       int x;
  9237       Status status;
  9238       bool retry = false;
  9239       int ncolor_cells, i;
  9240       bool temp_allocated;
  9241       XColor temp;
  9242 
  9243     start:
  9244       cells = x_color_cells (dpy, &no_cells);
  9245       temp_allocated = false;
  9246 
  9247       nearest = 0;
  9248       /* I'm assuming CSE so I'm not going to condense this. */
  9249       nearest_delta = ((((color->red >> 8) - (cells[0].red >> 8))
  9250                         * ((color->red >> 8) - (cells[0].red >> 8)))
  9251                        + (((color->green >> 8) - (cells[0].green >> 8))
  9252                           * ((color->green >> 8) - (cells[0].green >> 8)))
  9253                        + (((color->blue >> 8) - (cells[0].blue >> 8))
  9254                           * ((color->blue >> 8) - (cells[0].blue >> 8))));
  9255       for (x = 1; x < no_cells; x++)
  9256         {
  9257           trial_delta = ((((color->red >> 8) - (cells[x].red >> 8))
  9258                           * ((color->red >> 8) - (cells[x].red >> 8)))
  9259                          + (((color->green >> 8) - (cells[x].green >> 8))
  9260                             * ((color->green >> 8) - (cells[x].green >> 8)))
  9261                          + (((color->blue >> 8) - (cells[x].blue >> 8))
  9262                             * ((color->blue >> 8) - (cells[x].blue >> 8))));
  9263           if (trial_delta < nearest_delta)
  9264             {
  9265               /* We didn't decide to use this color, so free it.  */
  9266               if (temp_allocated)
  9267                 {
  9268                   XFreeColors (dpy, cmap, &temp.pixel, 1, 0);
  9269                   temp_allocated = false;
  9270                 }
  9271 
  9272               temp.red = cells[x].red;
  9273               temp.green = cells[x].green;
  9274               temp.blue = cells[x].blue;
  9275               status = XAllocColor (dpy, cmap, &temp);
  9276 
  9277               if (status)
  9278                 {
  9279                   temp_allocated = true;
  9280                   nearest = x;
  9281                   nearest_delta = trial_delta;
  9282                 }
  9283             }
  9284         }
  9285       color->red = cells[nearest].red;
  9286       color->green = cells[nearest].green;
  9287       color->blue = cells[nearest].blue;
  9288 
  9289       if (!temp_allocated)
  9290         status = XAllocColor (dpy, cmap, color);
  9291       else
  9292         {
  9293           *color = temp;
  9294           status = 1;
  9295         }
  9296 
  9297       if (status == 0 && !retry)
  9298         {
  9299           /* Our private cache of color cells is probably out of date.
  9300              Refresh it here, and try to allocate the nearest color
  9301              from the new colormap.  */
  9302 
  9303           retry = true;
  9304           xfree (dpyinfo->color_cells);
  9305 
  9306           ncolor_cells = dpyinfo->visual_info.colormap_size;
  9307 
  9308           dpyinfo->color_cells = xnmalloc (ncolor_cells,
  9309                                            sizeof *dpyinfo->color_cells);
  9310           dpyinfo->ncolor_cells = ncolor_cells;
  9311 
  9312           for (i = 0; i < ncolor_cells; ++i)
  9313             dpyinfo->color_cells[i].pixel = i;
  9314 
  9315           XQueryColors (dpy, dpyinfo->cmap,
  9316                         dpyinfo->color_cells, ncolor_cells);
  9317 
  9318           goto start;
  9319         }
  9320 
  9321       rc = status != 0;
  9322     }
  9323   else
  9324     {
  9325       /* If allocation succeeded, and the allocated pixel color is not
  9326          equal to a cached pixel color recorded earlier, there was a
  9327          change in the colormap, so clear the color cache.  */
  9328       struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = x_display_info_for_display (dpy);
  9329       eassume (dpyinfo);
  9330 
  9331       if (dpyinfo->color_cells)
  9332         {
  9333           XColor *cached_color = &dpyinfo->color_cells[color->pixel];
  9334           if (cached_color->red != color->red
  9335               || cached_color->blue != color->blue
  9336               || cached_color->green != color->green)
  9337             {
  9338               xfree (dpyinfo->color_cells);
  9339               dpyinfo->color_cells = NULL;
  9340               dpyinfo->ncolor_cells = 0;
  9341             }
  9342         }
  9343     }
  9344 
  9345 #ifdef DEBUG_X_COLORS
  9346   if (rc)
  9347     register_color (color->pixel);
  9348 #endif /* DEBUG_X_COLORS */
  9349 
  9350   return rc;
  9351 }
  9352 
  9353 
  9354 /* Allocate the color COLOR->pixel on frame F, colormap CMAP, after
  9355    gamma correction.  If an exact match can't be allocated, try the
  9356    nearest color available.  Value is true if successful.  Set *COLOR
  9357    to the color allocated.  */
  9358 
  9359 bool
  9360 x_alloc_nearest_color (struct frame *f, Colormap cmap, XColor *color)
  9361 {
  9362   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  9363 
  9364   gamma_correct (f, color);
  9365 
  9366   if (dpyinfo->red_bits > 0)
  9367     {
  9368       color->pixel = x_make_truecolor_pixel (dpyinfo,
  9369                                              color->red,
  9370                                              color->green,
  9371                                              color->blue);
  9372       return true;
  9373     }
  9374 
  9375   return x_alloc_nearest_color_1 (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), cmap, color);
  9376 }
  9377 
  9378 
  9379 /* Allocate color PIXEL on frame F.  PIXEL must already be allocated.
  9380    It's necessary to do this instead of just using PIXEL directly to
  9381    get color reference counts right.  */
  9382 
  9383 unsigned long
  9384 x_copy_color (struct frame *f, unsigned long pixel)
  9385 {
  9386   XColor color;
  9387 
  9388   /* If display has an immutable color map, freeing colors is not
  9389      necessary and some servers don't allow it.  Since we won't free a
  9390      color once we've allocated it, we don't need to re-allocate it to
  9391      maintain the server's reference count.  */
  9392   if (!x_mutable_colormap (FRAME_X_VISUAL_INFO (f)))
  9393     return pixel;
  9394 
  9395   color.pixel = pixel;
  9396   block_input ();
  9397   /* The color could still be found in the color_cells array.  */
  9398   x_query_colors (f, &color, 1);
  9399   XAllocColor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f), &color);
  9400   unblock_input ();
  9401 #ifdef DEBUG_X_COLORS
  9402   register_color (pixel);
  9403 #endif
  9404   return color.pixel;
  9405 }
  9406 
  9407 
  9408 /* Brightness beyond which a color won't have its highlight brightness
  9409    boosted.
  9410 
  9411    Nominally, highlight colors for `3d' faces are calculated by
  9412    brightening an object's color by a constant scale factor, but this
  9413    doesn't yield good results for dark colors, so for colors who's
  9414    brightness is less than this value (on a scale of 0-65535) have an
  9415    use an additional additive factor.
  9416 
  9417    The value here is set so that the default menu-bar/mode-line color
  9418    (grey75) will not have its highlights changed at all.  */
  9419 #define HIGHLIGHT_COLOR_DARK_BOOST_LIMIT 48000
  9420 
  9421 
  9422 /* Allocate a color which is lighter or darker than *PIXEL by FACTOR
  9423    or DELTA.  Try a color with RGB values multiplied by FACTOR first.
  9424    If this produces the same color as PIXEL, try a color where all RGB
  9425    values have DELTA added.  Return the allocated color in *PIXEL.
  9426    DISPLAY is the X display, CMAP is the colormap to operate on.
  9427    Value is non-zero if successful.  */
  9428 
  9429 static bool
  9430 x_alloc_lighter_color (struct frame *f, Display *display, Colormap cmap,
  9431                        unsigned long *pixel, double factor, int delta)
  9432 {
  9433   XColor color, new;
  9434   long bright;
  9435   bool success_p;
  9436 
  9437   /* Get RGB color values.  */
  9438   color.pixel = *pixel;
  9439   x_query_colors (f, &color, 1);
  9440 
  9441   /* Change RGB values by specified FACTOR.  Avoid overflow!  */
  9442   eassert (factor >= 0);
  9443   new.red = min (0xffff, factor * color.red);
  9444   new.green = min (0xffff, factor * color.green);
  9445   new.blue = min (0xffff, factor * color.blue);
  9446 
  9447   /* Calculate brightness of COLOR.  */
  9448   bright = (2 * color.red + 3 * color.green + color.blue) / 6;
  9449 
  9450   /* We only boost colors that are darker than
  9451      HIGHLIGHT_COLOR_DARK_BOOST_LIMIT.  */
  9452   if (bright < HIGHLIGHT_COLOR_DARK_BOOST_LIMIT)
  9453     /* Make an additive adjustment to NEW, because it's dark enough so
  9454        that scaling by FACTOR alone isn't enough.  */
  9455     {
  9456       /* How far below the limit this color is (0 - 1, 1 being darker).  */
  9457       double dimness = 1 - (double) bright / HIGHLIGHT_COLOR_DARK_BOOST_LIMIT;
  9458       /* The additive adjustment.  */
  9459       int min_delta = delta * dimness * factor / 2;
  9460 
  9461       if (factor < 1)
  9462         {
  9463           new.red =   max (0, new.red -   min_delta);
  9464           new.green = max (0, new.green - min_delta);
  9465           new.blue =  max (0, new.blue -  min_delta);
  9466         }
  9467       else
  9468         {
  9469           new.red =   min (0xffff, min_delta + new.red);
  9470           new.green = min (0xffff, min_delta + new.green);
  9471           new.blue =  min (0xffff, min_delta + new.blue);
  9472         }
  9473     }
  9474 
  9475   /* Try to allocate the color.  */
  9476   success_p = x_alloc_nearest_color (f, cmap, &new);
  9477   if (success_p)
  9478     {
  9479       if (new.pixel == *pixel)
  9480         {
  9481           /* If we end up with the same color as before, try adding
  9482              delta to the RGB values.  */
  9483           x_free_colors (f, &new.pixel, 1);
  9484 
  9485           new.red = min (0xffff, delta + color.red);
  9486           new.green = min (0xffff, delta + color.green);
  9487           new.blue = min (0xffff, delta + color.blue);
  9488           success_p = x_alloc_nearest_color (f, cmap, &new);
  9489         }
  9490       else
  9491         success_p = true;
  9492       *pixel = new.pixel;
  9493     }
  9494 
  9495   return success_p;
  9496 }
  9497 
  9498 
  9499 /* Set up the foreground color for drawing relief lines of glyph
  9500    string S.  RELIEF is a pointer to a struct relief containing the GC
  9501    with which lines will be drawn.  Use a color that is FACTOR or
  9502    DELTA lighter or darker than the relief's background which is found
  9503    in S->f->output_data.x->relief_background.  If such a color cannot
  9504    be allocated, use DEFAULT_PIXEL, instead.  */
  9505 
  9506 static void
  9507 x_setup_relief_color (struct frame *f, struct relief *relief, double factor,
  9508                       int delta, unsigned long default_pixel)
  9509 {
  9510   XGCValues xgcv;
  9511   struct x_output *di = f->output_data.x;
  9512   unsigned long mask = GCForeground | GCLineWidth | GCGraphicsExposures;
  9513   unsigned long pixel;
  9514   unsigned long background = di->relief_background;
  9515   Colormap cmap = FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f);
  9516   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
  9517   Display *dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  9518 
  9519   xgcv.graphics_exposures = False;
  9520   xgcv.line_width = 1;
  9521 
  9522   /* Free previously allocated color.  The color cell will be reused
  9523      when it has been freed as many times as it was allocated, so this
  9524      doesn't affect faces using the same colors.  */
  9525   if (relief->gc && relief->pixel != -1)
  9526     {
  9527       x_free_colors (f, &relief->pixel, 1);
  9528       relief->pixel = -1;
  9529     }
  9530 
  9531   /* Allocate new color.  */
  9532   xgcv.foreground = default_pixel;
  9533   pixel = background;
  9534   if (dpyinfo->n_planes != 1
  9535       && x_alloc_lighter_color (f, dpy, cmap, &pixel, factor, delta))
  9536     xgcv.foreground = relief->pixel = pixel;
  9537 
  9538   if (relief->gc == 0)
  9539     {
  9540       xgcv.stipple = dpyinfo->gray;
  9541       mask |= GCStipple;
  9542       relief->gc = XCreateGC (dpy, FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f), mask, &xgcv);
  9543     }
  9544   else
  9545     XChangeGC (dpy, relief->gc, mask, &xgcv);
  9546 }
  9547 
  9548 
  9549 /* Set up colors for the relief lines around glyph string S.  */
  9550 
  9551 static void
  9552 x_setup_relief_colors (struct glyph_string *s)
  9553 {
  9554   struct x_output *di = s->f->output_data.x;
  9555   unsigned long color;
  9556 
  9557   if (s->face->use_box_color_for_shadows_p)
  9558     color = s->face->box_color;
  9559   else if (s->first_glyph->type == IMAGE_GLYPH
  9560            && s->img->pixmap
  9561            && !IMAGE_BACKGROUND_TRANSPARENT (s->img, s->f, 0))
  9562     color = IMAGE_BACKGROUND (s->img, s->f, 0);
  9563   else
  9564     {
  9565       XGCValues xgcv;
  9566 
  9567       /* Get the background color of the face.  */
  9568       XGetGCValues (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f), s->gc, GCBackground, &xgcv);
  9569       color = xgcv.background;
  9570     }
  9571 
  9572   if (di->white_relief.gc == 0
  9573       || color != di->relief_background)
  9574     {
  9575       di->relief_background = color;
  9576       x_setup_relief_color (s->f, &di->white_relief, 1.2, 0x8000,
  9577                             WHITE_PIX_DEFAULT (s->f));
  9578       x_setup_relief_color (s->f, &di->black_relief, 0.6, 0x4000,
  9579                             BLACK_PIX_DEFAULT (s->f));
  9580     }
  9581 }
  9582 
  9583 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
  9584 static void
  9585 x_fill_triangle (struct frame *f, GC gc, XPoint point1,
  9586                  XPoint point2, XPoint point3)
  9587 {
  9588   XPoint abc[3];
  9589 
  9590   abc[0] = point1;
  9591   abc[1] = point2;
  9592   abc[2] = point3;
  9593 
  9594   XFillPolygon (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
  9595                 gc, abc, 3, Convex, CoordModeOrigin);
  9596 }
  9597 
  9598 static XPoint
  9599 x_make_point (int x, int y)
  9600 {
  9601   XPoint pt;
  9602 
  9603   pt.x = x;
  9604   pt.y = y;
  9605 
  9606   return pt;
  9607 }
  9608 
  9609 static bool
  9610 x_inside_rect_p (XRectangle *rects, int nrects, int x, int y)
  9611 {
  9612   int i;
  9613 
  9614   for (i = 0; i < nrects; ++i)
  9615     {
  9616       if (x >= rects[i].x && y >= rects[i].y
  9617           && x < rects[i].x + rects[i].width
  9618           && y < rects[i].y + rects[i].height)
  9619         return true;
  9620     }
  9621 
  9622   return false;
  9623 }
  9624 #endif
  9625 
  9626 /* Draw a relief on frame F inside the rectangle given by LEFT_X,
  9627    TOP_Y, RIGHT_X, and BOTTOM_Y.  VWIDTH and HWIDTH are respectively
  9628    the thickness of the vertical relief (left and right) and
  9629    horizontal relief (top and bottom) to draw, it must be >= 0.
  9630    RAISED_P means draw a raised relief.  LEFT_P means draw a relief on
  9631    the left side of the rectangle.  RIGHT_P means draw a relief on the
  9632    right side of the rectangle.  CLIP_RECT is the clipping rectangle
  9633    to use when drawing.  */
  9634 
  9635 static void
  9636 x_draw_relief_rect (struct frame *f, int left_x, int top_y, int right_x,
  9637                     int bottom_y, int hwidth, int vwidth, bool raised_p,
  9638                     bool top_p, bool bot_p, bool left_p, bool right_p,
  9639                     XRectangle *clip_rect)
  9640 {
  9641 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
  9642   GC top_left_gc, bottom_right_gc;
  9643   int corners = 0;
  9644 
  9645   if (raised_p)
  9646     {
  9647       top_left_gc = f->output_data.x->white_relief.gc;
  9648       bottom_right_gc = f->output_data.x->black_relief.gc;
  9649     }
  9650   else
  9651     {
  9652       top_left_gc = f->output_data.x->black_relief.gc;
  9653       bottom_right_gc = f->output_data.x->white_relief.gc;
  9654     }
  9655 
  9656   x_set_clip_rectangles (f, top_left_gc, clip_rect, 1);
  9657   x_set_clip_rectangles (f, bottom_right_gc, clip_rect, 1);
  9658 
  9659   if (left_p)
  9660     {
  9661       x_fill_rectangle (f, top_left_gc, left_x, top_y,
  9662                         vwidth, bottom_y + 1 - top_y, false);
  9663       if (top_p)
  9664         corners |= 1 << CORNER_TOP_LEFT;
  9665       if (bot_p)
  9666         corners |= 1 << CORNER_BOTTOM_LEFT;
  9667     }
  9668   if (right_p)
  9669     {
  9670       x_fill_rectangle (f, bottom_right_gc, right_x + 1 - vwidth, top_y,
  9671                         vwidth, bottom_y + 1 - top_y, false);
  9672       if (top_p)
  9673         corners |= 1 << CORNER_TOP_RIGHT;
  9674       if (bot_p)
  9675         corners |= 1 << CORNER_BOTTOM_RIGHT;
  9676     }
  9677   if (top_p)
  9678     {
  9679       if (!right_p)
  9680         x_fill_rectangle (f, top_left_gc, left_x, top_y,
  9681                           right_x + 1 - left_x, hwidth, false);
  9682       else
  9683         x_fill_trapezoid_for_relief (f, top_left_gc, left_x, top_y,
  9684                                      right_x + 1 - left_x, hwidth, 1);
  9685     }
  9686   if (bot_p)
  9687     {
  9688       if (!left_p)
  9689         x_fill_rectangle (f, bottom_right_gc, left_x, bottom_y + 1 - hwidth,
  9690                           right_x + 1 - left_x, hwidth, false);
  9691       else
  9692         x_fill_trapezoid_for_relief (f, bottom_right_gc,
  9693                                      left_x, bottom_y + 1 - hwidth,
  9694                                      right_x + 1 - left_x, hwidth, 0);
  9695     }
  9696   if (left_p && vwidth > 1)
  9697     x_fill_rectangle (f, bottom_right_gc, left_x, top_y,
  9698                       1, bottom_y + 1 - top_y, false);
  9699   if (top_p && hwidth > 1)
  9700     x_fill_rectangle (f, bottom_right_gc, left_x, top_y,
  9701                       right_x + 1 - left_x, 1, false);
  9702   if (corners)
  9703     {
  9704       XSetBackground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), top_left_gc,
  9705                       FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f));
  9706       x_erase_corners_for_relief (f, top_left_gc, left_x, top_y,
  9707                                   right_x - left_x + 1, bottom_y - top_y + 1,
  9708                                   6, 1, corners);
  9709     }
  9710 
  9711   x_reset_clip_rectangles (f, top_left_gc);
  9712   x_reset_clip_rectangles (f, bottom_right_gc);
  9713 #else
  9714   GC gc, white_gc, black_gc, normal_gc;
  9715   Drawable drawable;
  9716   Display *dpy;
  9717 
  9718   /* This code is more complicated than it has to be, because of two
  9719      minor hacks to make the boxes look nicer: (i) if width > 1, draw
  9720      the outermost line using the black relief.  (ii) Omit the four
  9721      corner pixels.  */
  9722 
  9723   white_gc = f->output_data.x->white_relief.gc;
  9724   black_gc = f->output_data.x->black_relief.gc;
  9725   normal_gc = f->output_data.x->normal_gc;
  9726 
  9727   drawable = FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f);
  9728   dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
  9729 
  9730   x_set_clip_rectangles (f, white_gc, clip_rect, 1);
  9731   x_set_clip_rectangles (f, black_gc, clip_rect, 1);
  9732 
  9733   if (raised_p)
  9734     gc = white_gc;
  9735   else
  9736     gc = black_gc;
  9737 
  9738   /* Draw lines.  */
  9739 
  9740   if (top_p)
  9741     x_fill_rectangle (f, gc, left_x, top_y,
  9742                       right_x - left_x + 1, hwidth,
  9743                       false);
  9744 
  9745   if (left_p)
  9746     x_fill_rectangle (f, gc, left_x, top_y, vwidth,
  9747                       bottom_y - top_y + 1, false);
  9748 
  9749   if (raised_p)
  9750     gc = black_gc;
  9751   else
  9752     gc = white_gc;
  9753 
  9754   if (bot_p)
  9755     x_fill_rectangle (f, gc, left_x, bottom_y - hwidth + 1,
  9756                       right_x - left_x + 1, hwidth, false);
  9757 
  9758   if (right_p)
  9759     x_fill_rectangle (f, gc, right_x - vwidth + 1, top_y,
  9760                       vwidth, bottom_y - top_y + 1, false);
  9761 
  9762   /* Draw corners.  */
  9763 
  9764   if (bot_p && left_p)
  9765     x_fill_triangle (f, raised_p ? white_gc : black_gc,
  9766                      x_make_point (left_x, bottom_y - hwidth),
  9767                      x_make_point (left_x + vwidth, bottom_y - hwidth),
  9768                      x_make_point (left_x, bottom_y));
  9769 
  9770   if (top_p && right_p)
  9771     x_fill_triangle (f, raised_p ? white_gc : black_gc,
  9772                      x_make_point (right_x - vwidth, top_y),
  9773                      x_make_point (right_x, top_y),
  9774                      x_make_point (right_x - vwidth, top_y + hwidth));
  9775 
  9776   /* Draw outer line.  */
  9777 
  9778   if (top_p && left_p && bot_p && right_p
  9779       && hwidth > 1 && vwidth > 1)
  9780     x_draw_rectangle (f, black_gc, left_x, top_y,
  9781                       right_x - left_x, bottom_y - top_y);
  9782   else
  9783     {
  9784       if (top_p && hwidth > 1)
  9785         XDrawLine (dpy, drawable, black_gc, left_x, top_y,
  9786                    right_x + 1, top_y);
  9787 
  9788       if (bot_p && hwidth > 1)
  9789         XDrawLine (dpy, drawable, black_gc, left_x, bottom_y,
  9790                    right_x + 1, bottom_y);
  9791 
  9792       if (left_p && vwidth > 1)
  9793         XDrawLine (dpy, drawable, black_gc, left_x, top_y,
  9794                    left_x, bottom_y + 1);
  9795 
  9796       if (right_p && vwidth > 1)
  9797         XDrawLine (dpy, drawable, black_gc, right_x, top_y,
  9798                    right_x, bottom_y + 1);
  9799     }
  9800 
  9801   /* Erase corners.  */
  9802 
  9803   if (hwidth > 1 && vwidth > 1)
  9804     {
  9805       if (left_p && top_p && x_inside_rect_p (clip_rect, 1,
  9806                                               left_x, top_y))
  9807         /* This should respect `alpha-background' since it's being
  9808            cleared with the background color of the frame.  */
  9809         x_clear_point (f, normal_gc, left_x, top_y, true);
  9810 
  9811       if (left_p && bot_p && x_inside_rect_p (clip_rect, 1,
  9812                                               left_x, bottom_y))
  9813         x_clear_point (f, normal_gc, left_x, bottom_y, true);
  9814 
  9815       if (right_p && top_p && x_inside_rect_p (clip_rect, 1,
  9816                                                right_x, top_y))
  9817         x_clear_point (f, normal_gc, right_x, top_y, true);
  9818 
  9819       if (right_p && bot_p && x_inside_rect_p (clip_rect, 1,
  9820                                                right_x, bottom_y))
  9821         x_clear_point (f, normal_gc, right_x, bottom_y, true);
  9822     }
  9823 
  9824   x_reset_clip_rectangles (f, white_gc);
  9825   x_reset_clip_rectangles (f, black_gc);
  9826 #endif
  9827 }
  9828 
  9829 
  9830 /* Draw a box on frame F inside the rectangle given by LEFT_X, TOP_Y,
  9831    RIGHT_X, and BOTTOM_Y.  WIDTH is the thickness of the lines to
  9832    draw, it must be >= 0.  LEFT_P means draw a line on the
  9833    left side of the rectangle.  RIGHT_P means draw a line
  9834    on the right side of the rectangle.  CLIP_RECT is the clipping
  9835    rectangle to use when drawing.  */
  9836 
  9837 static void
  9838 x_draw_box_rect (struct glyph_string *s,
  9839                  int left_x, int top_y, int right_x, int bottom_y, int hwidth,
  9840                  int vwidth, bool left_p, bool right_p, XRectangle *clip_rect)
  9841 {
  9842   Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
  9843   XGCValues xgcv;
  9844 
  9845   XGetGCValues (display, s->gc, GCForeground, &xgcv);
  9846   XSetForeground (display, s->gc, s->face->box_color);
  9847   x_set_clip_rectangles (s->f, s->gc, clip_rect, 1);
  9848 
  9849   /* Top.  */
  9850   x_fill_rectangle (s->f, s->gc,
  9851                     left_x, top_y, right_x - left_x + 1, hwidth,
  9852                     false);
  9853 
  9854   /* Left.  */
  9855   if (left_p)
  9856     x_fill_rectangle (s->f, s->gc,
  9857                       left_x, top_y, vwidth, bottom_y - top_y + 1,
  9858                       false);
  9859 
  9860   /* Bottom.  */
  9861   x_fill_rectangle (s->f, s->gc,
  9862                     left_x, bottom_y - hwidth + 1, right_x - left_x + 1, hwidth,
  9863                     false);
  9864 
  9865   /* Right.  */
  9866   if (right_p)
  9867     x_fill_rectangle (s->f, s->gc,
  9868                       right_x - vwidth + 1, top_y, vwidth, bottom_y - top_y + 1,
  9869                       false);
  9870 
  9871   XSetForeground (display, s->gc, xgcv.foreground);
  9872   x_reset_clip_rectangles (s->f, s->gc);
  9873 }
  9874 
  9875 
  9876 /* Draw a box around glyph string S.  */
  9877 
  9878 static void
  9879 x_draw_glyph_string_box (struct glyph_string *s)
  9880 {
  9881   int hwidth, vwidth, left_x, right_x, top_y, bottom_y, last_x;
  9882   bool raised_p, left_p, right_p;
  9883   struct glyph *last_glyph;
  9884   XRectangle clip_rect;
  9885 
  9886   last_x = ((s->row->full_width_p && !s->w->pseudo_window_p)
  9887             ? WINDOW_RIGHT_EDGE_X (s->w)
  9888             : window_box_right (s->w, s->area));
  9889 
  9890   /* The glyph that may have a right box line.  For static
  9891      compositions and images, the right-box flag is on the first glyph
  9892      of the glyph string; for other types it's on the last glyph.  */
  9893   if (s->cmp || s->img)
  9894     last_glyph = s->first_glyph;
  9895   else if (s->first_glyph->type == COMPOSITE_GLYPH
  9896            && s->first_glyph->u.cmp.automatic)
  9897     {
  9898       /* For automatic compositions, we need to look up the last glyph
  9899          in the composition.  */
  9900         struct glyph *end = s->row->glyphs[s->area] + s->row->used[s->area];
  9901         struct glyph *g = s->first_glyph;
  9902         for (last_glyph = g++;
  9903              g < end && g->u.cmp.automatic && g->u.cmp.id == s->cmp_id
  9904                && g->slice.cmp.to < s->cmp_to;
  9905              last_glyph = g++)
  9906           ;
  9907     }
  9908   else
  9909     last_glyph = s->first_glyph + s->nchars - 1;
  9910 
  9911   vwidth = eabs (s->face->box_vertical_line_width);
  9912   hwidth = eabs (s->face->box_horizontal_line_width);
  9913   raised_p = s->face->box == FACE_RAISED_BOX;
  9914   left_x = s->x;
  9915   right_x = (s->row->full_width_p && s->extends_to_end_of_line_p
  9916              ? last_x - 1
  9917              : min (last_x, s->x + s->background_width) - 1);
  9918   top_y = s->y;
  9919   bottom_y = top_y + s->height - 1;
  9920 
  9921   left_p = (s->first_glyph->left_box_line_p
  9922             || (s->hl == DRAW_MOUSE_FACE
  9923                 && (s->prev == NULL
  9924                     || s->prev->hl != s->hl)));
  9925   right_p = (last_glyph->right_box_line_p
  9926              || (s->hl == DRAW_MOUSE_FACE
  9927                  && (s->next == NULL
  9928                      || s->next->hl != s->hl)));
  9929 
  9930   get_glyph_string_clip_rect (s, &clip_rect);
  9931 
  9932   if (s->face->box == FACE_SIMPLE_BOX)
  9933     x_draw_box_rect (s, left_x, top_y, right_x, bottom_y, hwidth,
  9934                      vwidth, left_p, right_p, &clip_rect);
  9935   else
  9936     {
  9937       x_setup_relief_colors (s);
  9938       x_draw_relief_rect (s->f, left_x, top_y, right_x, bottom_y, hwidth,
  9939                           vwidth, raised_p, true, true, left_p, right_p,
  9940                           &clip_rect);
  9941     }
  9942 }
  9943 
  9944 
  9945 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
  9946 
  9947 static void
  9948 x_composite_image (struct glyph_string *s, Pixmap dest,
  9949 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
  9950                    Picture destination,
  9951 #endif
  9952                    int srcX, int srcY, int dstX, int dstY,
  9953                    int width, int height)
  9954 {
  9955   Display *display;
  9956 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
  9957   XRenderPictFormat *default_format;
  9958   XRenderPictureAttributes attr UNINIT;
  9959 #endif
  9960 
  9961   display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
  9962 
  9963 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
  9964   if (s->img->picture && FRAME_X_PICTURE_FORMAT (s->f))
  9965     {
  9966       if (destination == None)
  9967         {
  9968           /* The destination picture was not specified.  This means we
  9969              have to create a picture representing the */
  9970           default_format = FRAME_X_PICTURE_FORMAT (s->f);
  9971           destination = XRenderCreatePicture (display, dest,
  9972                                               default_format, 0, &attr);
  9973 
  9974           XRenderComposite (display, (s->img->mask_picture
  9975                                       ? PictOpOver : PictOpSrc),
  9976                             s->img->picture, s->img->mask_picture,
  9977                             destination, srcX, srcY, srcX, srcY,
  9978                             dstX, dstY, width, height);
  9979 
  9980           XRenderFreePicture (display, destination);
  9981         }
  9982       else
  9983         XRenderComposite (display, (s->img->mask_picture
  9984                                     ? PictOpOver : PictOpSrc),
  9985                           s->img->picture, s->img->mask_picture,
  9986                           destination, srcX, srcY, srcX, srcY,
  9987                           dstX, dstY, width, height);
  9988 
  9989       return;
  9990     }
  9991 #endif
  9992 
  9993   XCopyArea (display, s->img->pixmap,
  9994              dest, s->gc,
  9995              srcX, srcY,
  9996              width, height, dstX, dstY);
  9997 }
  9998 
  9999 #endif  /* !USE_CAIRO */
 10000 
 10001 
 10002 /* Draw foreground of image glyph string S.  */
 10003 
 10004 static void
 10005 x_draw_image_foreground (struct glyph_string *s)
 10006 {
 10007   int x = s->x;
 10008   int y = s->ybase - image_ascent (s->img, s->face, &s->slice);
 10009 
 10010   /* If first glyph of S has a left box line, start drawing it to the
 10011      right of that line.  */
 10012   if (s->face->box != FACE_NO_BOX
 10013       && s->first_glyph->left_box_line_p
 10014       && s->slice.x == 0)
 10015     x += max (s->face->box_vertical_line_width, 0);
 10016 
 10017   /* If there is a margin around the image, adjust x- and y-position
 10018      by that margin.  */
 10019   if (s->slice.x == 0)
 10020     x += s->img->hmargin;
 10021   if (s->slice.y == 0)
 10022     y += s->img->vmargin;
 10023 
 10024 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
 10025   if (s->img->cr_data)
 10026     {
 10027       x_set_glyph_string_clipping (s);
 10028       x_cr_draw_image (s->f, s->gc, s->img->cr_data,
 10029                        s->slice.x, s->slice.y, s->slice.width, s->slice.height,
 10030                        x, y, true);
 10031       if (!s->img->mask)
 10032         {
 10033           /* When the image has a mask, we can expect that at
 10034              least part of a mouse highlight or a block cursor will
 10035              be visible.  If the image doesn't have a mask, make
 10036              a block cursor visible by drawing a rectangle around
 10037              the image.  I believe it's looking better if we do
 10038              nothing here for mouse-face.  */
 10039           if (s->hl == DRAW_CURSOR)
 10040             {
 10041               int relief = eabs (s->img->relief);
 10042               x_draw_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, x - relief, y - relief,
 10043                                 s->slice.width + relief*2 - 1,
 10044                                 s->slice.height + relief*2 - 1);
 10045             }
 10046         }
 10047     }
 10048 #else  /* ! USE_CAIRO */
 10049   if (s->img->pixmap)
 10050     {
 10051       if (s->img->mask)
 10052         {
 10053           /* We can't set both a clip mask and use XSetClipRectangles
 10054              because the latter also sets a clip mask.  We also can't
 10055              trust on the shape extension to be available
 10056              (XShapeCombineRegion).  So, compute the rectangle to draw
 10057              manually.  */
 10058           /* FIXME: Do we need to do this when using XRender compositing?  */
 10059           unsigned long mask = (GCClipMask | GCClipXOrigin | GCClipYOrigin
 10060                                 | GCFunction);
 10061           XGCValues xgcv;
 10062           XRectangle clip_rect, image_rect, r;
 10063 
 10064           xgcv.clip_mask = s->img->mask;
 10065           xgcv.clip_x_origin = x;
 10066           xgcv.clip_y_origin = y;
 10067           xgcv.function = GXcopy;
 10068           XChangeGC (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f), s->gc, mask, &xgcv);
 10069 
 10070           get_glyph_string_clip_rect (s, &clip_rect);
 10071           image_rect.x = x;
 10072           image_rect.y = y;
 10073           image_rect.width = s->slice.width;
 10074           image_rect.height = s->slice.height;
 10075           if (gui_intersect_rectangles (&clip_rect, &image_rect, &r))
 10076             x_composite_image (s, FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (s->f),
 10077 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
 10078                                FRAME_X_PICTURE (s->f),
 10079 #endif
 10080                                s->slice.x + r.x - x, s->slice.y + r.y - y,
 10081                                r.x, r.y, r.width, r.height);
 10082         }
 10083       else
 10084         {
 10085           XRectangle clip_rect, image_rect, r;
 10086 
 10087           get_glyph_string_clip_rect (s, &clip_rect);
 10088           image_rect.x = x;
 10089           image_rect.y = y;
 10090           image_rect.width = s->slice.width;
 10091           image_rect.height = s->slice.height;
 10092           if (gui_intersect_rectangles (&clip_rect, &image_rect, &r))
 10093             x_composite_image (s, FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (s->f),
 10094 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
 10095                                FRAME_X_PICTURE (s->f),
 10096 #endif
 10097                                s->slice.x + r.x - x,
 10098                                s->slice.y + r.y - y,
 10099                                r.x, r.y, r.width, r.height);
 10100 
 10101           /* When the image has a mask, we can expect that at
 10102              least part of a mouse highlight or a block cursor will
 10103              be visible.  If the image doesn't have a mask, make
 10104              a block cursor visible by drawing a rectangle around
 10105              the image.  I believe it's looking better if we do
 10106              nothing here for mouse-face.  */
 10107           if (s->hl == DRAW_CURSOR)
 10108             {
 10109               int relief = eabs (s->img->relief);
 10110               x_draw_rectangle (s->f, s->gc,
 10111                               x - relief, y - relief,
 10112                               s->slice.width + relief*2 - 1,
 10113                               s->slice.height + relief*2 - 1);
 10114             }
 10115         }
 10116     }
 10117 #endif  /* ! USE_CAIRO */
 10118   else
 10119     /* Draw a rectangle if image could not be loaded.  */
 10120     x_draw_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, x, y,
 10121                     s->slice.width - 1, s->slice.height - 1);
 10122 }
 10123 
 10124 
 10125 /* Draw a relief around the image glyph string S.  */
 10126 
 10127 static void
 10128 x_draw_image_relief (struct glyph_string *s)
 10129 {
 10130   int x1, y1, thick;
 10131   bool raised_p, top_p, bot_p, left_p, right_p;
 10132   int extra_x, extra_y;
 10133   XRectangle r;
 10134   int x = s->x;
 10135   int y = s->ybase - image_ascent (s->img, s->face, &s->slice);
 10136 
 10137   /* If first glyph of S has a left box line, start drawing it to the
 10138      right of that line.  */
 10139   if (s->face->box != FACE_NO_BOX
 10140       && s->first_glyph->left_box_line_p
 10141       && s->slice.x == 0)
 10142     x += max (s->face->box_vertical_line_width, 0);
 10143 
 10144   /* If there is a margin around the image, adjust x- and y-position
 10145      by that margin.  */
 10146   if (s->slice.x == 0)
 10147     x += s->img->hmargin;
 10148   if (s->slice.y == 0)
 10149     y += s->img->vmargin;
 10150 
 10151   if (s->hl == DRAW_IMAGE_SUNKEN
 10152       || s->hl == DRAW_IMAGE_RAISED)
 10153     {
 10154       if (s->face->id == TAB_BAR_FACE_ID)
 10155         thick = (tab_bar_button_relief < 0
 10156                  ? DEFAULT_TAB_BAR_BUTTON_RELIEF
 10157                  : min (tab_bar_button_relief, 1000000));
 10158       else
 10159         thick = (tool_bar_button_relief < 0
 10160                  ? DEFAULT_TOOL_BAR_BUTTON_RELIEF
 10161                  : min (tool_bar_button_relief, 1000000));
 10162       raised_p = s->hl == DRAW_IMAGE_RAISED;
 10163     }
 10164   else
 10165     {
 10166       thick = eabs (s->img->relief);
 10167       raised_p = s->img->relief > 0;
 10168     }
 10169 
 10170   x1 = x + s->slice.width - 1;
 10171   y1 = y + s->slice.height - 1;
 10172 
 10173   extra_x = extra_y = 0;
 10174   if (s->face->id == TAB_BAR_FACE_ID)
 10175     {
 10176       if (CONSP (Vtab_bar_button_margin)
 10177           && FIXNUMP (XCAR (Vtab_bar_button_margin))
 10178           && FIXNUMP (XCDR (Vtab_bar_button_margin)))
 10179         {
 10180           extra_x = XFIXNUM (XCAR (Vtab_bar_button_margin)) - thick;
 10181           extra_y = XFIXNUM (XCDR (Vtab_bar_button_margin)) - thick;
 10182         }
 10183       else if (FIXNUMP (Vtab_bar_button_margin))
 10184         extra_x = extra_y = XFIXNUM (Vtab_bar_button_margin) - thick;
 10185     }
 10186 
 10187   if (s->face->id == TOOL_BAR_FACE_ID)
 10188     {
 10189       if (CONSP (Vtool_bar_button_margin)
 10190           && FIXNUMP (XCAR (Vtool_bar_button_margin))
 10191           && FIXNUMP (XCDR (Vtool_bar_button_margin)))
 10192         {
 10193           extra_x = XFIXNUM (XCAR (Vtool_bar_button_margin));
 10194           extra_y = XFIXNUM (XCDR (Vtool_bar_button_margin));
 10195         }
 10196       else if (FIXNUMP (Vtool_bar_button_margin))
 10197         extra_x = extra_y = XFIXNUM (Vtool_bar_button_margin);
 10198     }
 10199 
 10200   top_p = bot_p = left_p = right_p = false;
 10201 
 10202   if (s->slice.x == 0)
 10203     x -= thick + extra_x, left_p = true;
 10204   if (s->slice.y == 0)
 10205     y -= thick + extra_y, top_p = true;
 10206   if (s->slice.x + s->slice.width == s->img->width)
 10207     x1 += thick + extra_x, right_p = true;
 10208   if (s->slice.y + s->slice.height == s->img->height)
 10209     y1 += thick + extra_y, bot_p = true;
 10210 
 10211   x_setup_relief_colors (s);
 10212   get_glyph_string_clip_rect (s, &r);
 10213   x_draw_relief_rect (s->f, x, y, x1, y1, thick, thick, raised_p,
 10214                       top_p, bot_p, left_p, right_p, &r);
 10215 }
 10216 
 10217 
 10218 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
 10219 /* Draw the foreground of image glyph string S to PIXMAP.  */
 10220 
 10221 static void
 10222 x_draw_image_foreground_1 (struct glyph_string *s, Pixmap pixmap)
 10223 {
 10224   int x = 0;
 10225   int y = s->ybase - s->y - image_ascent (s->img, s->face, &s->slice);
 10226 
 10227   /* If first glyph of S has a left box line, start drawing it to the
 10228      right of that line.  */
 10229   if (s->face->box != FACE_NO_BOX
 10230       && s->first_glyph->left_box_line_p
 10231       && s->slice.x == 0)
 10232     x += max (s->face->box_vertical_line_width, 0);
 10233 
 10234   /* If there is a margin around the image, adjust x- and y-position
 10235      by that margin.  */
 10236   if (s->slice.x == 0)
 10237     x += s->img->hmargin;
 10238   if (s->slice.y == 0)
 10239     y += s->img->vmargin;
 10240 
 10241   if (s->img->pixmap)
 10242     {
 10243       Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
 10244 
 10245       if (s->img->mask)
 10246         {
 10247           /* We can't set both a clip mask and use XSetClipRectangles
 10248              because the latter also sets a clip mask.  We also can't
 10249              trust on the shape extension to be available
 10250              (XShapeCombineRegion).  So, compute the rectangle to draw
 10251              manually.  */
 10252           /* FIXME: Do we need to do this when using XRender compositing?  */
 10253           unsigned long mask = (GCClipMask | GCClipXOrigin | GCClipYOrigin
 10254                                 | GCFunction);
 10255           XGCValues xgcv;
 10256 
 10257           xgcv.clip_mask = s->img->mask;
 10258           xgcv.clip_x_origin = x - s->slice.x;
 10259           xgcv.clip_y_origin = y - s->slice.y;
 10260           xgcv.function = GXcopy;
 10261           XChangeGC (display, s->gc, mask, &xgcv);
 10262 
 10263           x_composite_image (s, pixmap,
 10264 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
 10265                              None,
 10266 #endif
 10267                              s->slice.x, s->slice.y, x, y,
 10268                              s->slice.width, s->slice.height);
 10269           XSetClipMask (display, s->gc, None);
 10270         }
 10271       else
 10272         {
 10273           XCopyArea (display, s->img->pixmap, pixmap, s->gc,
 10274                      s->slice.x, s->slice.y,
 10275                      s->slice.width, s->slice.height, x, y);
 10276 
 10277           /* When the image has a mask, we can expect that at
 10278              least part of a mouse highlight or a block cursor will
 10279              be visible.  If the image doesn't have a mask, make
 10280              a block cursor visible by drawing a rectangle around
 10281              the image.  I believe it's looking better if we do
 10282              nothing here for mouse-face.  */
 10283           if (s->hl == DRAW_CURSOR)
 10284             {
 10285               int r = eabs (s->img->relief);
 10286               x_draw_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, x - r, y - r,
 10287                               s->slice.width + r*2 - 1,
 10288                               s->slice.height + r*2 - 1);
 10289             }
 10290         }
 10291     }
 10292   else
 10293     /* Draw a rectangle if image could not be loaded.  */
 10294     x_draw_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, x, y,
 10295                     s->slice.width - 1, s->slice.height - 1);
 10296 }
 10297 #endif  /* ! USE_CAIRO */
 10298 
 10299 
 10300 /* Draw part of the background of glyph string S.  X, Y, W, and H
 10301    give the rectangle to draw.  */
 10302 
 10303 static void
 10304 x_draw_glyph_string_bg_rect (struct glyph_string *s, int x, int y, int w, int h)
 10305 {
 10306   if (s->stippled_p)
 10307     {
 10308       Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
 10309 
 10310       /* Fill background with a stipple pattern.  */
 10311       XSetFillStyle (display, s->gc, FillOpaqueStippled);
 10312       x_fill_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, x, y, w, h, true);
 10313       XSetFillStyle (display, s->gc, FillSolid);
 10314     }
 10315   else
 10316     x_clear_glyph_string_rect (s, x, y, w, h);
 10317 }
 10318 
 10319 
 10320 /* Draw image glyph string S.
 10321 
 10322             s->y
 10323    s->x      +-------------------------
 10324              |   s->face->box
 10325              |
 10326              |     +-------------------------
 10327              |     |  s->img->margin
 10328              |     |
 10329              |     |       +-------------------
 10330              |     |       |  the image
 10331 
 10332  */
 10333 
 10334 static void
 10335 x_draw_image_glyph_string (struct glyph_string *s)
 10336 {
 10337   int box_line_hwidth = max (s->face->box_vertical_line_width, 0);
 10338   int box_line_vwidth = max (s->face->box_horizontal_line_width, 0);
 10339   int height;
 10340 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
 10341   Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
 10342   Pixmap pixmap = None;
 10343 #endif
 10344 
 10345   height = s->height;
 10346   if (s->slice.y == 0)
 10347     height -= box_line_vwidth;
 10348   if (s->slice.y + s->slice.height >= s->img->height)
 10349     height -= box_line_vwidth;
 10350 
 10351   /* Fill background with face under the image.  Do it only if row is
 10352      taller than image or if image has a clip mask to reduce
 10353      flickering.  */
 10354   s->stippled_p = s->face->stipple != 0;
 10355   if (height > s->slice.height
 10356       || s->img->hmargin
 10357       || s->img->vmargin
 10358       || s->img->mask
 10359       || s->img->pixmap == 0
 10360       || s->width != s->background_width)
 10361     {
 10362       if (s->stippled_p)
 10363         s->row->stipple_p = true;
 10364 
 10365 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
 10366       if (s->img->mask)
 10367         {
 10368           /* Create a pixmap as large as the glyph string.  Fill it
 10369              with the background color.  Copy the image to it, using
 10370              its mask.  Copy the temporary pixmap to the display.  */
 10371           int depth = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (s->f)->n_planes;
 10372 
 10373           /* Create a pixmap as large as the glyph string.  */
 10374           pixmap = XCreatePixmap (display, FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (s->f),
 10375                                   s->background_width,
 10376                                   s->height, depth);
 10377 
 10378           /* Don't clip in the following because we're working on the
 10379              pixmap.  */
 10380           XSetClipMask (display, s->gc, None);
 10381 
 10382           /* Fill the pixmap with the background color/stipple.  */
 10383           if (s->stippled_p)
 10384             {
 10385               /* Fill background with a stipple pattern.  */
 10386               XSetFillStyle (display, s->gc, FillOpaqueStippled);
 10387               XSetTSOrigin (display, s->gc, - s->x, - s->y);
 10388               XFillRectangle (display, pixmap, s->gc,
 10389                               0, 0, s->background_width, s->height);
 10390               XSetFillStyle (display, s->gc, FillSolid);
 10391               XSetTSOrigin (display, s->gc, 0, 0);
 10392             }
 10393           else
 10394             {
 10395               XGCValues xgcv;
 10396 #if defined HAVE_XRENDER && (RENDER_MAJOR > 0 || (RENDER_MINOR >= 2))
 10397               if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (s->f)->alpha_bits
 10398                   && s->f->alpha_background != 1.0
 10399                   && FRAME_CHECK_XR_VERSION (s->f, 0, 2)
 10400                   && FRAME_X_PICTURE_FORMAT (s->f))
 10401                 {
 10402                   XRenderColor xc;
 10403                   XRenderPictureAttributes attrs;
 10404                   Picture pict;
 10405                   memset (&attrs, 0, sizeof attrs);
 10406 
 10407                   pict = XRenderCreatePicture (display, pixmap,
 10408                                                FRAME_X_PICTURE_FORMAT (s->f),
 10409                                                0, &attrs);
 10410                   x_xrender_color_from_gc_background (s->f, s->gc, &xc, true);
 10411                   XRenderFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f), PictOpSrc, pict,
 10412                                         &xc, 0, 0, s->background_width, s->height);
 10413                   XRenderFreePicture (display, pict);
 10414                 }
 10415               else
 10416 #endif
 10417                 {
 10418                   XGetGCValues (display, s->gc, GCForeground | GCBackground,
 10419                                 &xgcv);
 10420                   XSetForeground (display, s->gc, xgcv.background);
 10421                   XFillRectangle (display, pixmap, s->gc,
 10422                                   0, 0, s->background_width, s->height);
 10423                   XSetForeground (display, s->gc, xgcv.foreground);
 10424                 }
 10425             }
 10426         }
 10427       else
 10428 #endif  /* ! USE_CAIRO */
 10429         {
 10430           int x = s->x;
 10431           int y = s->y;
 10432           int width = s->background_width;
 10433 
 10434           if (s->first_glyph->left_box_line_p
 10435               && s->slice.x == 0)
 10436             {
 10437               x += box_line_hwidth;
 10438               width -= box_line_hwidth;
 10439             }
 10440 
 10441           if (s->slice.y == 0)
 10442             y += box_line_vwidth;
 10443 
 10444           x_draw_glyph_string_bg_rect (s, x, y, width, height);
 10445         }
 10446 
 10447       s->background_filled_p = true;
 10448     }
 10449 
 10450   /* Draw the foreground.  */
 10451 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
 10452   if (pixmap != None)
 10453     {
 10454       x_draw_image_foreground_1 (s, pixmap);
 10455       x_set_glyph_string_clipping (s);
 10456       XCopyArea (display, pixmap, FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (s->f), s->gc,
 10457                  0, 0, s->background_width, s->height, s->x, s->y);
 10458       XFreePixmap (display, pixmap);
 10459     }
 10460   else
 10461 #endif  /* ! USE_CAIRO */
 10462     x_draw_image_foreground (s);
 10463 
 10464   /* If we must draw a relief around the image, do it.  */
 10465   if (s->img->relief
 10466       || s->hl == DRAW_IMAGE_RAISED
 10467       || s->hl == DRAW_IMAGE_SUNKEN)
 10468     x_draw_image_relief (s);
 10469 }
 10470 
 10471 
 10472 /* Draw stretch glyph string S.  */
 10473 
 10474 static void
 10475 x_draw_stretch_glyph_string (struct glyph_string *s)
 10476 {
 10477   eassert (s->first_glyph->type == STRETCH_GLYPH);
 10478 
 10479   if (s->hl == DRAW_CURSOR
 10480       && !x_stretch_cursor_p)
 10481     {
 10482       /* If `x-stretch-cursor' is nil, don't draw a block cursor as
 10483          wide as the stretch glyph.  */
 10484       int width, background_width = s->background_width;
 10485       int x = s->x;
 10486 
 10487       if (!s->row->reversed_p)
 10488         {
 10489           int left_x = window_box_left_offset (s->w, TEXT_AREA);
 10490 
 10491           if (x < left_x)
 10492             {
 10493               background_width -= left_x - x;
 10494               x = left_x;
 10495             }
 10496         }
 10497       else
 10498         {
 10499           /* In R2L rows, draw the cursor on the right edge of the
 10500              stretch glyph.  */
 10501           int right_x = window_box_right (s->w, TEXT_AREA);
 10502 
 10503           if (x + background_width > right_x)
 10504             background_width -= x - right_x;
 10505           x += background_width;
 10506         }
 10507       width = min (FRAME_COLUMN_WIDTH (s->f), background_width);
 10508       if (s->row->reversed_p)
 10509         x -= width;
 10510 
 10511       /* Draw cursor.  */
 10512       x_draw_glyph_string_bg_rect (s, x, s->y, width, s->height);
 10513 
 10514       /* Clear rest using the GC of the original non-cursor face.  */
 10515       if (width < background_width)
 10516         {
 10517           int y = s->y;
 10518           int w = background_width - width, h = s->height;
 10519           Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
 10520           XRectangle r;
 10521           GC gc;
 10522 
 10523           if (!s->row->reversed_p)
 10524             x += width;
 10525           else
 10526             x = s->x;
 10527           if (s->row->mouse_face_p
 10528               && cursor_in_mouse_face_p (s->w))
 10529             {
 10530               x_set_mouse_face_gc (s);
 10531               gc = s->gc;
 10532             }
 10533           else
 10534             gc = s->face->gc;
 10535 
 10536           get_glyph_string_clip_rect (s, &r);
 10537           x_set_clip_rectangles (s->f, gc, &r, 1);
 10538 
 10539           if (s->face->stipple)
 10540             {
 10541               /* Fill background with a stipple pattern.  */
 10542               XSetFillStyle (display, gc, FillOpaqueStippled);
