 10543               x_fill_rectangle (s->f, gc, x, y, w, h, true);
 10544               XSetFillStyle (display, gc, FillSolid);
 10545 
 10546               s->row->stipple_p = true;
 10547             }
 10548           else
 10549             {
 10550               XGCValues xgcv;
 10551               XGetGCValues (display, gc, GCForeground | GCBackground, &xgcv);
 10552               XSetForeground (display, gc, xgcv.background);
 10553               x_fill_rectangle (s->f, gc, x, y, w, h, true);
 10554               XSetForeground (display, gc, xgcv.foreground);
 10555             }
 10556 
 10557           x_reset_clip_rectangles (s->f, gc);
 10558         }
 10559     }
 10560   else if (!s->background_filled_p)
 10561     {
 10562       int background_width = s->background_width;
 10563       int x = s->x, text_left_x = window_box_left (s->w, TEXT_AREA);
 10564 
 10565       /* Don't draw into left fringe or scrollbar area except for
 10566          header line and mode line.  */
 10567       if (s->area == TEXT_AREA
 10568           && x < text_left_x && !s->row->mode_line_p)
 10569         {
 10570           background_width -= text_left_x - x;
 10571           x = text_left_x;
 10572         }
 10573 
 10574       if (!s->row->stipple_p)
 10575         s->row->stipple_p = s->stippled_p;
 10576 
 10577       if (background_width > 0)
 10578         x_draw_glyph_string_bg_rect (s, x, s->y,
 10579                                      background_width, s->height);
 10580     }
 10581 
 10582   s->background_filled_p = true;
 10583 }
 10584 
 10585 static void
 10586 x_get_scale_factor (Display *disp, int *scale_x, int *scale_y)
 10587 {
 10588   const int base_res = 96;
 10589   struct x_display_info * dpyinfo = x_display_info_for_display (disp);
 10590 
 10591   *scale_x = *scale_y = 1;
 10592 
 10593   if (dpyinfo)
 10594     {
 10595       if (dpyinfo->resx > base_res)
 10596         *scale_x = floor (dpyinfo->resx / base_res);
 10597       if (dpyinfo->resy > base_res)
 10598         *scale_y = floor (dpyinfo->resy / base_res);
 10599     }
 10600 }
 10601 
 10602 /*
 10603    Draw a wavy line under S. The wave fills wave_height pixels from y0.
 10604 
 10605                     x0         wave_length = 2
 10606                                  --
 10607                 y0   *   *   *   *   *
 10608                      |* * * * * * * * *
 10609     wave_height = 3  | *   *   *   *
 10610 
 10611 */
 10612 static void
 10613 x_draw_underwave (struct glyph_string *s, int decoration_width)
 10614 {
 10615   Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
 10616 
 10617   /* Adjust for scale/HiDPI.  */
 10618   int scale_x, scale_y;
 10619 
 10620   x_get_scale_factor (display, &scale_x, &scale_y);
 10621 
 10622   int wave_height = 3 * scale_y, wave_length = 2 * scale_x;
 10623 
 10624 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
 10625   x_draw_horizontal_wave (s->f, s->gc, s->x, s->ybase - wave_height + 3,
 10626                           decoration_width, wave_height, wave_length);
 10627 #else  /* not USE_CAIRO */
 10628   int dx, dy, x0, y0, width, x1, y1, x2, y2, xmax, thickness = scale_y;;
 10629   bool odd;
 10630   XRectangle wave_clip, string_clip, final_clip;
 10631 
 10632   dx = wave_length;
 10633   dy = wave_height - 1;
 10634   x0 = s->x;
 10635   y0 = s->ybase + wave_height / 2 - scale_y;
 10636   width = decoration_width;
 10637   xmax = x0 + width;
 10638 
 10639   /* Find and set clipping rectangle */
 10640 
 10641   wave_clip.x = x0;
 10642   wave_clip.y = y0;
 10643   wave_clip.width = width;
 10644   wave_clip.height = wave_height;
 10645   get_glyph_string_clip_rect (s, &string_clip);
 10646 
 10647   if (!gui_intersect_rectangles (&wave_clip, &string_clip, &final_clip))
 10648     return;
 10649 
 10650   XSetClipRectangles (display, s->gc, 0, 0, &final_clip, 1, Unsorted);
 10651 
 10652   /* Draw the waves */
 10653 
 10654   x1 = x0 - (x0 % dx);
 10655   x2 = x1 + dx;
 10656   odd = (x1 / dx) & 1;
 10657   y1 = y2 = y0;
 10658 
 10659   if (odd)
 10660     y1 += dy;
 10661   else
 10662     y2 += dy;
 10663 
 10664   if (INT_MAX - dx < xmax)
 10665     emacs_abort ();
 10666 
 10667   while (x1 <= xmax)
 10668     {
 10669       XSetLineAttributes (display, s->gc, thickness, LineSolid, CapButt,
 10670                           JoinRound);
 10671       XDrawLine (display, FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (s->f), s->gc, x1, y1, x2, y2);
 10672       x1  = x2, y1 = y2;
 10673       x2 += dx, y2 = y0 + odd*dy;
 10674       odd = !odd;
 10675     }
 10676 
 10677   /* Restore previous clipping rectangle(s) */
 10678   XSetClipRectangles (display, s->gc, 0, 0, s->clip, s->num_clips, Unsorted);
 10679 #endif  /* not USE_CAIRO */
 10680 }
 10681 
 10682 
 10683 /* Draw glyph string S.  */
 10684 
 10685 static void
 10686 x_draw_glyph_string (struct glyph_string *s)
 10687 {
 10688   bool relief_drawn_p = false;
 10689 
 10690   /* If S draws into the background of its successors, draw the
 10691      background of the successors first so that S can draw into it.
 10692      This makes S->next use XDrawString instead of XDrawImageString.  */
 10693   if (s->next && s->right_overhang && !s->for_overlaps)
 10694     {
 10695       int width;
 10696       struct glyph_string *next;
 10697 
 10698       for (width = 0, next = s->next;
 10699            next && width < s->right_overhang;
 10700            width += next->width, next = next->next)
 10701         if (next->first_glyph->type != IMAGE_GLYPH)
 10702           {
 10703             x_set_glyph_string_gc (next);
 10704             x_set_glyph_string_clipping (next);
 10705             if (next->first_glyph->type == STRETCH_GLYPH)
 10706               x_draw_stretch_glyph_string (next);
 10707             else
 10708               x_draw_glyph_string_background (next, true);
 10709             next->num_clips = 0;
 10710           }
 10711     }
 10712 
 10713   /* Set up S->gc, set clipping and draw S.  */
 10714   x_set_glyph_string_gc (s);
 10715 
 10716   /* Draw relief (if any) in advance for char/composition so that the
 10717      glyph string can be drawn over it.  */
 10718   if (!s->for_overlaps
 10719       && s->face->box != FACE_NO_BOX
 10720       && (s->first_glyph->type == CHAR_GLYPH
 10721           || s->first_glyph->type == COMPOSITE_GLYPH))
 10722 
 10723     {
 10724       x_set_glyph_string_clipping (s);
 10725       x_draw_glyph_string_background (s, true);
 10726       x_draw_glyph_string_box (s);
 10727       x_set_glyph_string_clipping (s);
 10728       relief_drawn_p = true;
 10729     }
 10730   else if (!s->clip_head /* draw_glyphs didn't specify a clip mask. */
 10731            && !s->clip_tail
 10732            && ((s->prev && s->prev->hl != s->hl && s->left_overhang)
 10733                || (s->next && s->next->hl != s->hl && s->right_overhang)))
 10734     /* We must clip just this glyph.  left_overhang part has already
 10735        drawn when s->prev was drawn, and right_overhang part will be
 10736        drawn later when s->next is drawn. */
 10737     x_set_glyph_string_clipping_exactly (s, s);
 10738   else
 10739     x_set_glyph_string_clipping (s);
 10740 
 10741   switch (s->first_glyph->type)
 10742     {
 10743     case IMAGE_GLYPH:
 10744       x_draw_image_glyph_string (s);
 10745       break;
 10746 
 10747     case XWIDGET_GLYPH:
 10748       x_draw_xwidget_glyph_string (s);
 10749       break;
 10750 
 10751     case STRETCH_GLYPH:
 10752       x_draw_stretch_glyph_string (s);
 10753       break;
 10754 
 10755     case CHAR_GLYPH:
 10756       if (s->for_overlaps)
 10757         s->background_filled_p = true;
 10758       else
 10759         x_draw_glyph_string_background (s, false);
 10760       x_draw_glyph_string_foreground (s);
 10761       break;
 10762 
 10763     case COMPOSITE_GLYPH:
 10764       if (s->for_overlaps || (s->cmp_from > 0
 10765                               && ! s->first_glyph->u.cmp.automatic))
 10766         s->background_filled_p = true;
 10767       else
 10768         x_draw_glyph_string_background (s, true);
 10769       x_draw_composite_glyph_string_foreground (s);
 10770       break;
 10771 
 10772     case GLYPHLESS_GLYPH:
 10773       if (s->for_overlaps)
 10774         s->background_filled_p = true;
 10775       else
 10776         x_draw_glyph_string_background (s, true);
 10777       x_draw_glyphless_glyph_string_foreground (s);
 10778       break;
 10779 
 10780     default:
 10781       emacs_abort ();
 10782     }
 10783 
 10784   if (!s->for_overlaps)
 10785     {
 10786       int area_x, area_y, area_width, area_height;
 10787       int area_max_x, decoration_width;
 10788 
 10789       /* Prevent the underline from overwriting surrounding areas
 10790          and the fringe.  */
 10791       window_box (s->w, s->area, &area_x, &area_y,
 10792                   &area_width, &area_height);
 10793       area_max_x = area_x + area_width - 1;
 10794 
 10795       decoration_width = s->width;
 10796       if (!s->row->mode_line_p
 10797           && !s->row->tab_line_p
 10798           && area_max_x < (s->x + decoration_width - 1))
 10799         decoration_width -= (s->x + decoration_width - 1) - area_max_x;
 10800 
 10801       /* Draw relief if not yet drawn.  */
 10802       if (!relief_drawn_p && s->face->box != FACE_NO_BOX)
 10803         x_draw_glyph_string_box (s);
 10804 
 10805       /* Draw underline.  */
 10806       if (s->face->underline)
 10807         {
 10808           if (s->face->underline == FACE_UNDER_WAVE)
 10809             {
 10810               if (s->face->underline_defaulted_p)
 10811                 x_draw_underwave (s, decoration_width);
 10812               else
 10813                 {
 10814                   Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
 10815                   XGCValues xgcv;
 10816                   XGetGCValues (display, s->gc, GCForeground, &xgcv);
 10817                   XSetForeground (display, s->gc, s->face->underline_color);
 10818                   x_draw_underwave (s, decoration_width);
 10819                   XSetForeground (display, s->gc, xgcv.foreground);
 10820                 }
 10821             }
 10822           else if (s->face->underline == FACE_UNDER_LINE)
 10823             {
 10824               unsigned long thickness, position;
 10825               int y;
 10826 
 10827               if (s->prev
 10828                   && s->prev->face->underline == FACE_UNDER_LINE
 10829                   && (s->prev->face->underline_at_descent_line_p
 10830                       == s->face->underline_at_descent_line_p)
 10831                   && (s->prev->face->underline_pixels_above_descent_line
 10832                       == s->face->underline_pixels_above_descent_line))
 10833                 {
 10834                   /* We use the same underline style as the previous one.  */
 10835                   thickness = s->prev->underline_thickness;
 10836                   position = s->prev->underline_position;
 10837                 }
 10838               else
 10839                 {
 10840                   struct font *font = font_for_underline_metrics (s);
 10841                   unsigned long minimum_offset;
 10842                   bool underline_at_descent_line;
 10843                   bool use_underline_position_properties;
 10844                   Lisp_Object val = (WINDOW_BUFFER_LOCAL_VALUE
 10845                                      (Qunderline_minimum_offset, s->w));
 10846 
 10847                   if (FIXNUMP (val))
 10848                     minimum_offset = max (0, XFIXNUM (val));
 10849                   else
 10850                     minimum_offset = 1;
 10851 
 10852                   val = (WINDOW_BUFFER_LOCAL_VALUE
 10853                          (Qx_underline_at_descent_line, s->w));
 10854                   underline_at_descent_line
 10855                     = (!(NILP (val) || BASE_EQ (val, Qunbound))
 10856                        || s->face->underline_at_descent_line_p);
 10857 
 10858                   val = (WINDOW_BUFFER_LOCAL_VALUE
 10859                          (Qx_use_underline_position_properties, s->w));
 10860                   use_underline_position_properties
 10861                     = !(NILP (val) || BASE_EQ (val, Qunbound));
 10862 
 10863                   /* Get the underline thickness.  Default is 1 pixel.  */
 10864                   if (font && font->underline_thickness > 0)
 10865                     thickness = font->underline_thickness;
 10866                   else
 10867                     thickness = 1;
 10868                   if (underline_at_descent_line)
 10869                     position = ((s->height - thickness)
 10870                                 - (s->ybase - s->y)
 10871                                 - s->face->underline_pixels_above_descent_line);
 10872                   else
 10873                     {
 10874                       /* Get the underline position.  This is the
 10875                          recommended vertical offset in pixels from
 10876                          the baseline to the top of the underline.
 10877                          This is a signed value according to the
 10878                          specs, and its default is
 10879 
 10880                          ROUND ((maximum descent) / 2), with
 10881                          ROUND(x) = floor (x + 0.5)  */
 10882 
 10883                       if (use_underline_position_properties
 10884                           && font && font->underline_position >= 0)
 10885                         position = font->underline_position;
 10886                       else if (font)
 10887                         position = (font->descent + 1) / 2;
 10888                       else
 10889                         position = minimum_offset;
 10890                     }
 10891 
 10892                   /* Ignore minimum_offset if the amount of pixels was
 10893                      explicitly specified.  */
 10894                   if (!s->face->underline_pixels_above_descent_line)
 10895                     position = max (position, minimum_offset);
 10896                 }
 10897               /* Check the sanity of thickness and position.  We should
 10898                  avoid drawing underline out of the current line area.  */
 10899               if (s->y + s->height <= s->ybase + position)
 10900                 position = (s->height - 1) - (s->ybase - s->y);
 10901               if (s->y + s->height < s->ybase + position + thickness)
 10902                 thickness = (s->y + s->height) - (s->ybase + position);
 10903               s->underline_thickness = thickness;
 10904               s->underline_position = position;
 10905               y = s->ybase + position;
 10906               if (s->face->underline_defaulted_p)
 10907                 x_fill_rectangle (s->f, s->gc,
 10908                                   s->x, y, decoration_width, thickness,
 10909                                   false);
 10910               else
 10911                 {
 10912                   Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
 10913                   XGCValues xgcv;
 10914                   XGetGCValues (display, s->gc, GCForeground, &xgcv);
 10915                   XSetForeground (display, s->gc, s->face->underline_color);
 10916                   x_fill_rectangle (s->f, s->gc,
 10917                                     s->x, y, decoration_width, thickness,
 10918                                     false);
 10919                   XSetForeground (display, s->gc, xgcv.foreground);
 10920                 }
 10921             }
 10922         }
 10923       /* Draw overline.  */
 10924       if (s->face->overline_p)
 10925         {
 10926           unsigned long dy = 0, h = 1;
 10927 
 10928           if (s->face->overline_color_defaulted_p)
 10929             x_fill_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, s->x, s->y + dy,
 10930                               decoration_width, h, false);
 10931           else
 10932             {
 10933               Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
 10934               XGCValues xgcv;
 10935               XGetGCValues (display, s->gc, GCForeground, &xgcv);
 10936               XSetForeground (display, s->gc, s->face->overline_color);
 10937               x_fill_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, s->x, s->y + dy,
 10938                                 decoration_width, h, false);
 10939               XSetForeground (display, s->gc, xgcv.foreground);
 10940             }
 10941         }
 10942 
 10943       /* Draw strike-through.  */
 10944       if (s->face->strike_through_p)
 10945         {
 10946           /* Y-coordinate and height of the glyph string's first
 10947              glyph.  We cannot use s->y and s->height because those
 10948              could be larger if there are taller display elements
 10949              (e.g., characters displayed with a larger font) in the
 10950              same glyph row.  */
 10951           int glyph_y = s->ybase - s->first_glyph->ascent;
 10952           int glyph_height = s->first_glyph->ascent + s->first_glyph->descent;
 10953           /* Strike-through width and offset from the glyph string's
 10954              top edge.  */
 10955           unsigned long h = 1;
 10956           unsigned long dy = (glyph_height - h) / 2;
 10957 
 10958           if (s->face->strike_through_color_defaulted_p)
 10959             x_fill_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, s->x, glyph_y + dy,
 10960                               s->width, h, false);
 10961           else
 10962             {
 10963               Display *display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (s->f);
 10964               XGCValues xgcv;
 10965               XGetGCValues (display, s->gc, GCForeground, &xgcv);
 10966               XSetForeground (display, s->gc, s->face->strike_through_color);
 10967               x_fill_rectangle (s->f, s->gc, s->x, glyph_y + dy,
 10968                                 decoration_width, h, false);
 10969               XSetForeground (display, s->gc, xgcv.foreground);
 10970             }
 10971         }
 10972 
 10973       if (s->prev)
 10974         {
 10975           struct glyph_string *prev;
 10976 
 10977           for (prev = s->prev; prev; prev = prev->prev)
 10978             if (prev->hl != s->hl
 10979                 && prev->x + prev->width + prev->right_overhang > s->x)
 10980               {
 10981                 /* As prev was drawn while clipped to its own area, we
 10982                    must draw the right_overhang part using s->hl now.  */
 10983                 enum draw_glyphs_face save = prev->hl;
 10984 
 10985                 prev->hl = s->hl;
 10986                 x_set_glyph_string_gc (prev);
 10987                 x_set_glyph_string_clipping_exactly (s, prev);
 10988                 if (prev->first_glyph->type == CHAR_GLYPH)
 10989                   x_draw_glyph_string_foreground (prev);
 10990                 else
 10991                   x_draw_composite_glyph_string_foreground (prev);
 10992                 x_reset_clip_rectangles (prev->f, prev->gc);
 10993                 prev->hl = save;
 10994                 prev->num_clips = 0;
 10995               }
 10996         }
 10997 
 10998       if (s->next)
 10999         {
 11000           struct glyph_string *next;
 11001 
 11002           for (next = s->next; next; next = next->next)
 11003             if (next->hl != s->hl
 11004                 && next->x - next->left_overhang < s->x + s->width)
 11005               {
 11006                 /* As next will be drawn while clipped to its own area,
 11007                    we must draw the left_overhang part using s->hl now.  */
 11008                 enum draw_glyphs_face save = next->hl;
 11009 
 11010                 next->hl = s->hl;
 11011                 x_set_glyph_string_gc (next);
 11012                 x_set_glyph_string_clipping_exactly (s, next);
 11013                 if (next->first_glyph->type == CHAR_GLYPH)
 11014                   x_draw_glyph_string_foreground (next);
 11015                 else
 11016                   x_draw_composite_glyph_string_foreground (next);
 11017                 x_reset_clip_rectangles (next->f, next->gc);
 11018                 next->hl = save;
 11019                 next->num_clips = 0;
 11020                 next->clip_head = s->next;
 11021               }
 11022         }
 11023     }
 11024 
 11025   /* Reset clipping.  */
 11026   x_reset_clip_rectangles (s->f, s->gc);
 11027   s->num_clips = 0;
 11028 
 11029   /* Set the stippled flag that tells redisplay whether or not a
 11030      stipple was actually draw.  */
 11031 
 11032   if (s->first_glyph->type != STRETCH_GLYPH
 11033       && s->first_glyph->type != IMAGE_GLYPH
 11034       && !s->row->stipple_p)
 11035     s->row->stipple_p = s->stippled_p;
 11036 }
 11037 
 11038 /* Shift display to make room for inserted glyphs.   */
 11039 
 11040 static void
 11041 x_shift_glyphs_for_insert (struct frame *f, int x, int y, int width, int height, int shift_by)
 11042 {
 11043 /* Never called on a GUI frame, see
 11044    https://lists.gnu.org/r/emacs-devel/2015-05/msg00456.html
 11045 */
 11046   XCopyArea (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
 11047              f->output_data.x->normal_gc,
 11048              x, y, width, height,
 11049              x + shift_by, y);
 11050 }
 11051 
 11052 /* Delete N glyphs at the nominal cursor position.  Not implemented
 11053    for X frames.  */
 11054 
 11055 static void
 11056 x_delete_glyphs (struct frame *f, int n)
 11057 {
 11058   emacs_abort ();
 11059 }
 11060 
 11061 
 11062 /* Like XClearArea, but check that WIDTH and HEIGHT are reasonable.
 11063    If they are <= 0, this is probably an error.  */
 11064 
 11065 #if defined USE_GTK || !defined USE_CAIRO
 11066 static void
 11067 x_clear_area1 (Display *dpy, Window window,
 11068                int x, int y, int width, int height, int exposures)
 11069 {
 11070   eassert (width > 0 && height > 0);
 11071   XClearArea (dpy, window, x, y, width, height, exposures);
 11072 }
 11073 #endif
 11074 
 11075 void
 11076 x_clear_area (struct frame *f, int x, int y, int width, int height)
 11077 {
 11078 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
 11079   cairo_t *cr;
 11080 
 11081   eassert (width > 0 && height > 0);
 11082 
 11083   cr = x_begin_cr_clip (f, NULL);
 11084   x_set_cr_source_with_gc_background (f, f->output_data.x->normal_gc,
 11085                                       true);
 11086   cairo_rectangle (cr, x, y, width, height);
 11087   cairo_fill (cr);
 11088   x_end_cr_clip (f);
 11089 #else
 11090 #ifndef USE_GTK
 11091   if (f->alpha_background != 1.0
 11092 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
 11093       || FRAME_X_DOUBLE_BUFFERED_P (f)
 11094 #endif
 11095       )
 11096 #endif
 11097     {
 11098 #if defined HAVE_XRENDER && \
 11099   (RENDER_MAJOR > 0 || (RENDER_MINOR >= 2))
 11100       x_xr_ensure_picture (f);
 11101       if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->alpha_bits
 11102           && FRAME_X_PICTURE (f) != None
 11103           && f->alpha_background != 1.0
 11104           && FRAME_CHECK_XR_VERSION (f, 0, 2))
 11105         {
 11106           XRenderColor xc;
 11107           GC gc = f->output_data.x->normal_gc;
 11108 
 11109           x_xr_apply_ext_clip (f, gc);
 11110           x_xrender_color_from_gc_background (f, gc, &xc, true);
 11111           XRenderFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 11112                                 PictOpSrc, FRAME_X_PICTURE (f),
 11113                                 &xc, x, y, width, height);
 11114           x_xr_reset_ext_clip (f);
 11115           x_mark_frame_dirty (f);
 11116         }
 11117       else
 11118 #endif
 11119         XFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 11120                         FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
 11121                         f->output_data.x->reverse_gc,
 11122                         x, y, width, height);
 11123     }
 11124 #ifndef USE_GTK
 11125   else
 11126     x_clear_area1 (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 11127                    x, y, width, height, False);
 11128 #endif
 11129 #endif
 11130 }
 11131 
 11132 
 11133 /* Clear an entire frame.  */
 11134 
 11135 static void
 11136 x_clear_frame (struct frame *f)
 11137 {
 11138   /* Clearing the frame will erase any cursor, so mark them all as no
 11139      longer visible.  */
 11140   mark_window_cursors_off (XWINDOW (FRAME_ROOT_WINDOW (f)));
 11141 
 11142   block_input ();
 11143   font_drop_xrender_surfaces (f);
 11144   x_clear_window (f);
 11145 
 11146   /* We have to clear the scroll bars.  If we have changed colors or
 11147      something like that, then they should be notified.  */
 11148   x_scroll_bar_clear (f);
 11149 
 11150   unblock_input ();
 11151 }
 11152 
 11153 /* Send a message to frame F telling the event loop to track whether
 11154    or not an hourglass is being displayed.  This is required to ignore
 11155    the right events when the hourglass is mapped without callig XSync
 11156    after displaying or hiding the hourglass.  */
 11157 
 11158 static void
 11159 x_send_hourglass_message (struct frame *f, bool hourglass_enabled)
 11160 {
 11161   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 11162   XEvent msg;
 11163 
 11164   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 11165   memset (&msg, 0, sizeof msg);
 11166 
 11167   msg.xclient.type = ClientMessage;
 11168   msg.xclient.message_type
 11169     = dpyinfo->Xatom_EMACS_TMP;
 11170   msg.xclient.format = 8;
 11171   msg.xclient.window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
 11172   msg.xclient.data.b[0] = hourglass_enabled ? 1 : 0;
 11173 
 11174   XSendEvent (dpyinfo->display, FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 11175               False, NoEventMask, &msg);
 11176 }
 11177 
 11178 /* RIF: Show hourglass cursor on frame F.  */
 11179 
 11180 static void
 11181 x_show_hourglass (struct frame *f)
 11182 {
 11183   Display *dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
 11184 
 11185   if (dpy)
 11186     {
 11187       struct x_output *x = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f);
 11188 
 11189       /* If the hourglass window is mapped inside a popup menu, input
 11190          could be lost if the menu is popped down and the grab is
 11191          relinquished, but the hourglass window is still up.  Just
 11192          avoid displaying the hourglass at all while popups are
 11193          active.  */
 11194 
 11195       if (popup_activated ())
 11196         return;
 11197 
 11198       x_send_hourglass_message (f, true);
 11199 
 11200 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 11201       if (x->widget)
 11202 #else
 11203       if (FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f))
 11204 #endif
 11205        {
 11206          if (!x->hourglass_window)
 11207            {
 11208 #ifndef USE_XCB
 11209              unsigned long mask = CWCursor;
 11210              XSetWindowAttributes attrs;
 11211 #ifdef USE_GTK
 11212              Window parent = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
 11213 #else
 11214              Window parent = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
 11215 #endif
 11216              attrs.cursor = x->hourglass_cursor;
 11217 
 11218              x->hourglass_window = XCreateWindow
 11219                (dpy, parent, 0, 0, 32000, 32000, 0, 0,
 11220                 InputOnly, CopyFromParent, mask, &attrs);
 11221 #else
 11222              uint32_t cursor = (uint32_t) x->hourglass_cursor;
 11223 #ifdef USE_GTK
 11224              xcb_window_t parent = (xcb_window_t) FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
 11225 #else
 11226              xcb_window_t parent = (xcb_window_t) FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
 11227 #endif
 11228              x->hourglass_window
 11229                = (Window) xcb_generate_id (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xcb_connection);
 11230 
 11231              xcb_create_window (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xcb_connection,
 11232                                 XCB_COPY_FROM_PARENT,
 11233                                 (xcb_window_t) x->hourglass_window,
 11234                                 parent, 0, 0, FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f),
 11235                                 FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f), 0,
 11236                                 XCB_WINDOW_CLASS_INPUT_ONLY,
 11237                                 XCB_COPY_FROM_PARENT, XCB_CW_CURSOR,
 11238                                 &cursor);
 11239 #endif
 11240            }
 11241 
 11242 #ifndef USE_XCB
 11243          XMapRaised (dpy, x->hourglass_window);
 11244          /* Ensure that the spinning hourglass is shown.  */
 11245          flush_frame (f);
 11246 #else
 11247          uint32_t value = XCB_STACK_MODE_ABOVE;
 11248 
 11249          xcb_configure_window (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xcb_connection,
 11250                                (xcb_window_t) x->hourglass_window,
 11251                                XCB_CONFIG_WINDOW_STACK_MODE, &value);
 11252          xcb_map_window (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xcb_connection,
 11253                          (xcb_window_t) x->hourglass_window);
 11254          xcb_flush (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xcb_connection);
 11255 #endif
 11256        }
 11257     }
 11258 }
 11259 
 11260 /* RIF: Cancel hourglass cursor on frame F.  */
 11261 
 11262 static void
 11263 x_hide_hourglass (struct frame *f)
 11264 {
 11265   struct x_output *x = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f);
 11266 
 11267   /* Watch out for newly created frames.  */
 11268   if (x->hourglass_window)
 11269     {
 11270 #ifndef USE_XCB
 11271       XUnmapWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), x->hourglass_window);
 11272 #else
 11273       xcb_unmap_window (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xcb_connection,
 11274                         (xcb_window_t) x->hourglass_window);
 11275 #endif
 11276       x_send_hourglass_message (f, false);
 11277     }
 11278 }
 11279 
 11280 /* Invert the middle quarter of the frame for .15 sec.  */
 11281 
 11282 static void
 11283 XTflash (struct frame *f)
 11284 {
 11285   GC gc;
 11286   XGCValues values;
 11287   fd_set fds;
 11288   int fd, rc;
 11289 
 11290   block_input ();
 11291 
 11292   if (FRAME_X_VISUAL_INFO (f)->class == TrueColor)
 11293     {
 11294       values.function = GXxor;
 11295       values.foreground = (FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f)
 11296                            ^ FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f));
 11297 
 11298       gc = XCreateGC (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 11299                       GCFunction | GCForeground, &values);
 11300     }
 11301   else
 11302     gc = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->normal_gc;
 11303 
 11304 
 11305   /* Get the height not including a menu bar widget.  */
 11306   int height = FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f);
 11307   /* Height of each line to flash.  */
 11308   int flash_height = FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (f);
 11309   /* These will be the left and right margins of the rectangles.  */
 11310   int flash_left = FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f);
 11311   int flash_right = FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f) - FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f);
 11312   int width = flash_right - flash_left;
 11313 
 11314   /* If window is tall, flash top and bottom line.  */
 11315   if (height > 3 * FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (f))
 11316     {
 11317       XFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f), gc,
 11318                       flash_left,
 11319                       (FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f)
 11320                        + FRAME_TOP_MARGIN_HEIGHT (f)),
 11321                       width, flash_height);
 11322       XFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f), gc,
 11323                       flash_left,
 11324                       (height - flash_height
 11325                        - FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f)
 11326                        - FRAME_BOTTOM_MARGIN_HEIGHT (f)),
 11327                       width, flash_height);
 11328 
 11329     }
 11330   else
 11331     /* If it is short, flash it all.  */
 11332     XFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f), gc,
 11333                     flash_left, FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f),
 11334                     width, height - 2 * FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f));
 11335 
 11336   x_flush (f);
 11337 
 11338   struct timespec delay = make_timespec (0, 150 * 1000 * 1000);
 11339   struct timespec wakeup = timespec_add (current_timespec (), delay);
 11340   fd = ConnectionNumber (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
 11341 
 11342   /* Keep waiting until past the time wakeup or any input gets
 11343      available.  */
 11344   while (! detect_input_pending ())
 11345     {
 11346       struct timespec current = current_timespec ();
 11347       struct timespec timeout;
 11348 
 11349       /* Break if result would not be positive.  */
 11350       if (timespec_cmp (wakeup, current) <= 0)
 11351         break;
 11352 
 11353       /* How long `select' should wait.  */
 11354       timeout = make_timespec (0, 10 * 1000 * 1000);
 11355 
 11356       /* Wait for some input to become available on the X
 11357          connection.  */
 11358       FD_ZERO (&fds);
 11359       FD_SET (fd, &fds);
 11360 
 11361       /* Try to wait that long--but we might wake up sooner.  */
 11362       rc = pselect (fd + 1, &fds, NULL, NULL, &timeout, NULL);
 11363 
 11364       /* Some input is available, exit the visible bell.  */
 11365       if (rc >= 0 && FD_ISSET (fd, &fds))
 11366         break;
 11367     }
 11368 
 11369   /* If window is tall, flash top and bottom line.  */
 11370   if (height > 3 * FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (f))
 11371     {
 11372       XFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f), gc,
 11373                       flash_left,
 11374                       (FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f)
 11375                        + FRAME_TOP_MARGIN_HEIGHT (f)),
 11376                       width, flash_height);
 11377       XFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f), gc,
 11378                       flash_left,
 11379                       (height - flash_height
 11380                        - FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f)
 11381                        - FRAME_BOTTOM_MARGIN_HEIGHT (f)),
 11382                       width, flash_height);
 11383     }
 11384   else
 11385     /* If it is short, flash it all.  */
 11386     XFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f), gc,
 11387                     flash_left, FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f),
 11388                     width, height - 2 * FRAME_INTERNAL_BORDER_WIDTH (f));
 11389 
 11390   if (FRAME_X_VISUAL_INFO (f)->class == TrueColor)
 11391     XFreeGC (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc);
 11392   x_flush (f);
 11393 
 11394   unblock_input ();
 11395 }
 11396 
 11397 /* Make audible bell.  */
 11398 
 11399 static void
 11400 XTring_bell (struct frame *f)
 11401 {
 11402   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 11403 
 11404   if (!FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f))
 11405     return;
 11406 
 11407   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 11408 
 11409   if (visible_bell)
 11410     XTflash (f);
 11411   else
 11412     {
 11413       /* When Emacs is untrusted, Bell requests sometimes generate
 11414          Access errors.  This is not in the security extension
 11415          specification but seems to be a bug in the X consortium XKB
 11416          implementation.  */
 11417 
 11418       block_input ();
 11419       x_ignore_errors_for_next_request (dpyinfo, 0);
 11420 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 11421       XkbBell (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f), 0, None);
 11422 #else
 11423       XBell (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), 0);
 11424 #endif
 11425       XFlush (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
 11426       x_stop_ignoring_errors (dpyinfo);
 11427       unblock_input ();
 11428     }
 11429 }
 11430 
 11431 /***********************************************************************
 11432                               Line Dance
 11433  ***********************************************************************/
 11434 
 11435 /* Perform an insert-lines or delete-lines operation, inserting N
 11436    lines or deleting -N lines at vertical position VPOS.  */
 11437 
 11438 static void
 11439 x_ins_del_lines (struct frame *f, int vpos, int n)
 11440 {
 11441   emacs_abort ();
 11442 }
 11443 
 11444 
 11445 /* Scroll part of the display as described by RUN.  */
 11446 
 11447 static void
 11448 x_scroll_run (struct window *w, struct run *run)
 11449 {
 11450   struct frame *f = XFRAME (w->frame);
 11451   int x, y, width, height, from_y, to_y, bottom_y;
 11452 
 11453   /* Get frame-relative bounding box of the text display area of W,
 11454      without mode lines.  Include in this box the left and right
 11455      fringe of W.  */
 11456   window_box (w, ANY_AREA, &x, &y, &width, &height);
 11457 
 11458   from_y = WINDOW_TO_FRAME_PIXEL_Y (w, run->current_y);
 11459   to_y = WINDOW_TO_FRAME_PIXEL_Y (w, run->desired_y);
 11460   bottom_y = y + height;
 11461 
 11462   if (to_y < from_y)
 11463     {
 11464       /* Scrolling up.  Make sure we don't copy part of the mode
 11465          line at the bottom.  */
 11466       if (from_y + run->height > bottom_y)
 11467         height = bottom_y - from_y;
 11468       else
 11469         height = run->height;
 11470     }
 11471   else
 11472     {
 11473       /* Scrolling down.  Make sure we don't copy over the mode line.
 11474          at the bottom.  */
 11475       if (to_y + run->height > bottom_y)
 11476         height = bottom_y - to_y;
 11477       else
 11478         height = run->height;
 11479     }
 11480 
 11481   block_input ();
 11482 
 11483   /* Cursor off.  Will be switched on again in gui_update_window_end.  */
 11484   gui_clear_cursor (w);
 11485 
 11486 #ifdef HAVE_XWIDGETS
 11487   /* "Copy" xwidget windows in the area that will be scrolled.  */
 11488   Display *dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
 11489   Window window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
 11490 
 11491   Window root, parent, *children;
 11492   unsigned int nchildren;
 11493 
 11494   if (XQueryTree (dpy, window, &root, &parent, &children, &nchildren))
 11495     {
 11496       /* Now find xwidget views situated between from_y and to_y, and
 11497          attached to w.  */
 11498       for (unsigned int i = 0; i < nchildren; ++i)
 11499         {
 11500           Window child = children[i];
 11501           struct xwidget_view *view = xwidget_view_from_window (child);
 11502 
 11503           if (view && !view->hidden)
 11504             {
 11505               int window_y = view->y + view->clip_top;
 11506               int window_height = view->clip_bottom - view->clip_top;
 11507 
 11508               Emacs_Rectangle r1, r2, result;
 11509               r1.x = w->pixel_left;
 11510               r1.y = from_y;
 11511               r1.width = w->pixel_width;
 11512               r1.height = height;
 11513               r2 = r1;
 11514               r2.y = window_y;
 11515               r2.height = window_height;
 11516 
 11517               /* The window is offscreen, just unmap it.  */
 11518               if (window_height == 0)
 11519                 {
 11520                   view->hidden = true;
 11521                   XUnmapWindow (dpy, child);
 11522                   continue;
 11523                 }
 11524 
 11525               bool intersects_p =
 11526                 gui_intersect_rectangles (&r1, &r2, &result);
 11527 
 11528               if (XWINDOW (view->w) == w && intersects_p)
 11529                 {
 11530                   int y = view->y + (to_y - from_y);
 11531                   int text_area_x, text_area_y, text_area_width, text_area_height;
 11532                   int clip_top, clip_bottom;
 11533 
 11534                   window_box (w, view->area, &text_area_x, &text_area_y,
 11535                               &text_area_width, &text_area_height);
 11536 
 11537                   view->y = y;
 11538 
 11539                   clip_top = 0;
 11540                   clip_bottom = XXWIDGET (view->model)->height;
 11541 
 11542                   if (y < text_area_y)
 11543                     clip_top = text_area_y - y;
 11544 
 11545                   if ((y + clip_bottom) > (text_area_y + text_area_height))
 11546                     {
 11547                       clip_bottom -= (y + clip_bottom) - (text_area_y + text_area_height);
 11548                     }
 11549 
 11550                   view->clip_top = clip_top;
 11551                   view->clip_bottom = clip_bottom;
 11552 
 11553                   /* This means the view has moved offscreen.  Unmap
 11554                      it and hide it here.  */
 11555                   if ((view->clip_bottom - view->clip_top) <= 0)
 11556                     {
 11557                       view->hidden = true;
 11558                       XUnmapWindow (dpy, child);
 11559                     }
 11560                   else
 11561                     {
 11562                       XMoveResizeWindow (dpy, child, view->x + view->clip_left,
 11563                                          view->y + view->clip_top,
 11564                                          view->clip_right - view->clip_left,
 11565                                          view->clip_bottom - view->clip_top);
 11566                       cairo_xlib_surface_set_size (view->cr_surface,
 11567                                                    view->clip_right - view->clip_left,
 11568                                                    view->clip_bottom - view->clip_top);
 11569                     }
 11570                   xwidget_expose (view);
 11571                 }
 11572             }
 11573         }
 11574       XFree (children);
 11575     }
 11576 #endif
 11577 
 11578 #ifdef USE_CAIRO_XCB_SURFACE
 11579   /* Some of the following code depends on `normal_gc' being
 11580      up-to-date on the X server, but doesn't call a routine that will
 11581      flush it first.  So do this ourselves instead.  */
 11582   XFlushGC (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 11583             f->output_data.x->normal_gc);
 11584 #endif
 11585 
 11586 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
 11587   if (FRAME_CR_CONTEXT (f))
 11588     {
 11589       cairo_surface_t *surface = cairo_get_target (FRAME_CR_CONTEXT (f));
 11590       if (cairo_surface_get_type (surface) == CAIRO_SURFACE_TYPE_XLIB)
 11591         {
 11592           eassert (cairo_xlib_surface_get_display (surface)
 11593                    == FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
 11594           eassert (cairo_xlib_surface_get_drawable (surface)
 11595                    == FRAME_X_RAW_DRAWABLE (f));
 11596           cairo_surface_flush (surface);
 11597           XCopyArea (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 11598                      FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
 11599                      f->output_data.x->normal_gc,
 11600                      x, from_y,
 11601                      width, height,
 11602                      x, to_y);
 11603           cairo_surface_mark_dirty_rectangle (surface, x, to_y, width, height);
 11604         }
 11605 #ifdef USE_CAIRO_XCB_SURFACE
 11606       else if (cairo_surface_get_type (surface) == CAIRO_SURFACE_TYPE_XCB)
 11607         {
 11608           cairo_surface_flush (surface);
 11609           xcb_copy_area (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->xcb_connection,
 11610                          (xcb_drawable_t) FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
 11611                          (xcb_drawable_t) FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
 11612                          (xcb_gcontext_t) XGContextFromGC (f->output_data.x->normal_gc),
 11613                          x, from_y, x, to_y, width, height);
 11614           cairo_surface_mark_dirty_rectangle (surface, x, to_y, width, height);
 11615         }
 11616 #endif
 11617       else
 11618         {
 11619           cairo_surface_t *s
 11620             = cairo_surface_create_similar (surface,
 11621                                             cairo_surface_get_content (surface),
 11622                                             width, height);
 11623           cairo_t *cr = cairo_create (s);
 11624           cairo_set_source_surface (cr, surface, -x, -from_y);
 11625           cairo_paint (cr);
 11626           cairo_destroy (cr);
 11627 
 11628           cr = FRAME_CR_CONTEXT (f);
 11629           cairo_save (cr);
 11630           cairo_set_source_surface (cr, s, x, to_y);
 11631           cairo_set_operator (cr, CAIRO_OPERATOR_SOURCE);
 11632           cairo_rectangle (cr, x, to_y, width, height);
 11633           cairo_fill (cr);
 11634           cairo_restore (cr);
 11635           cairo_surface_destroy (s);
 11636         }
 11637     }
 11638   else
 11639 #endif  /* USE_CAIRO */
 11640     XCopyArea (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 11641                FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
 11642                f->output_data.x->normal_gc,
 11643                x, from_y,
 11644                width, height,
 11645                x, to_y);
 11646 
 11647   unblock_input ();
 11648 }
 11649 
 11650 
 11651 
 11652 /***********************************************************************
 11653                            Exposure Events
 11654  ***********************************************************************/
 11655 
 11656 
 11657 static void
 11658 x_frame_highlight (struct frame *f)
 11659 {
 11660   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 11661 
 11662   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 11663 
 11664   /* We used to only do this if Vx_no_window_manager was non-nil, but
 11665      the ICCCM (section 4.1.6) says that the window's border pixmap
 11666      and border pixel are window attributes which are "private to the
 11667      client", so we can always change it to whatever we want.  */
 11668   block_input ();
 11669   /* I recently started to get errors in this XSetWindowBorder, depending on
 11670      the window-manager in use, tho something more is at play since I've been
 11671      using that same window-manager binary for ever.  Let's not crash just
 11672      because of this (bug#9310).  */
 11673   x_ignore_errors_for_next_request (dpyinfo, 0);
 11674   XSetWindowBorder (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 11675                     f->output_data.x->border_pixel);
 11676   x_stop_ignoring_errors (dpyinfo);
 11677   unblock_input ();
 11678   gui_update_cursor (f, true);
 11679   x_set_frame_alpha (f);
 11680 }
 11681 
 11682 static void
 11683 x_frame_unhighlight (struct frame *f)
 11684 {
 11685   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 11686 
 11687   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 11688 
 11689   /* We used to only do this if Vx_no_window_manager was non-nil, but
 11690      the ICCCM (section 4.1.6) says that the window's border pixmap
 11691      and border pixel are window attributes which are "private to the
 11692      client", so we can always change it to whatever we want.  */
 11693 
 11694   block_input ();
 11695   /* Same as above for XSetWindowBorder (bug#9310).  */
 11696   x_ignore_errors_for_next_request (dpyinfo, 0);
 11697   XSetWindowBorderPixmap (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 11698                           f->output_data.x->border_tile);
 11699   x_stop_ignoring_errors (dpyinfo);
 11700   unblock_input ();
 11701 
 11702   gui_update_cursor (f, true);
 11703   x_set_frame_alpha (f);
 11704 }
 11705 
 11706 /* The focus has changed.  Update the frames as necessary to reflect
 11707    the new situation.  Note that we can't change the selected frame
 11708    here, because the Lisp code we are interrupting might become confused.
 11709    Each event gets marked with the frame in which it occurred, so the
 11710    Lisp code can tell when the switch took place by examining the events.  */
 11711 
 11712 static void
 11713 x_new_focus_frame (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, struct frame *frame)
 11714 {
 11715   struct frame *old_focus = dpyinfo->x_focus_frame;
 11716 #if defined USE_GTK && !defined HAVE_GTK3 && defined HAVE_XINPUT2
 11717   XIEventMask mask;
 11718   ptrdiff_t l;
 11719 
 11720   if (dpyinfo->supports_xi2)
 11721     {
 11722       l = XIMaskLen (XI_LASTEVENT);
 11723       mask.mask = alloca (l);
 11724       mask.mask_len = l;
 11725       memset (mask.mask, 0, l);
 11726 
 11727       mask.deviceid = XIAllDevices;
 11728     }
 11729 #endif
 11730 
 11731   if (frame != dpyinfo->x_focus_frame)
 11732     {
 11733       /* Set this before calling other routines, so that they see
 11734          the correct value of x_focus_frame.  */
 11735       dpyinfo->x_focus_frame = frame;
 11736 
 11737       /* Once none of our frames are focused anymore, stop selecting
 11738          for raw input events from the root window.  */
 11739 
 11740 #if defined USE_GTK && !defined HAVE_GTK3 && defined HAVE_XINPUT2
 11741       if (frame && dpyinfo->supports_xi2)
 11742         XISetMask (mask.mask, XI_RawKeyPress);
 11743 
 11744       if (dpyinfo->supports_xi2)
 11745         XISelectEvents (dpyinfo->display, dpyinfo->root_window, &mask, 1);
 11746 #endif
 11747 
 11748       if (old_focus && old_focus->auto_lower)
 11749         x_lower_frame (old_focus);
 11750 
 11751       if (dpyinfo->x_focus_frame && dpyinfo->x_focus_frame->auto_raise)
 11752         dpyinfo->x_pending_autoraise_frame = dpyinfo->x_focus_frame;
 11753       else
 11754         dpyinfo->x_pending_autoraise_frame = NULL;
 11755     }
 11756 
 11757   x_frame_rehighlight (dpyinfo);
 11758 }
 11759 
 11760 #if defined HAVE_XFIXES && XFIXES_VERSION >= 40000
 11761 
 11762 /* True if the display in DPYINFO supports a version of Xfixes
 11763    sufficient for pointer blanking.  */
 11764 
 11765 static bool
 11766 x_fixes_pointer_blanking_supported (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 11767 {
 11768   return (dpyinfo->xfixes_supported_p
 11769           && dpyinfo->xfixes_major >= 4);
 11770 }
 11771 
 11772 #endif /* HAVE_XFIXES && XFIXES_VERSION >= 40000 */
 11773 
 11774 /* Toggle mouse pointer visibility on frame F using the XFixes
 11775    extension.  */
 11776 #if defined HAVE_XFIXES && XFIXES_VERSION >= 40000
 11777 
 11778 static void
 11779 xfixes_toggle_visible_pointer (struct frame *f, bool invisible)
 11780 
 11781 {
 11782   if (invisible)
 11783     XFixesHideCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f));
 11784   else
 11785     XFixesShowCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f));
 11786   f->pointer_invisible = invisible;
 11787 }
 11788 
 11789 #endif /* HAVE_XFIXES */
 11790 
 11791 /* Create invisible cursor on the X display referred by DPYINFO.  */
 11792 static Cursor
 11793 make_invisible_cursor (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 11794 {
 11795   Display *dpy = dpyinfo->display;
 11796   static char const no_data[] = { 0 };
 11797   Pixmap pix;
 11798   XColor col;
 11799   Cursor c;
 11800 
 11801   c = None;
 11802 
 11803   x_catch_errors (dpy);
 11804   pix = XCreateBitmapFromData (dpy, dpyinfo->root_window, no_data, 1, 1);
 11805   if (!x_had_errors_p (dpy) && pix != None)
 11806     {
 11807       Cursor pixc;
 11808       col.pixel = 0;
 11809       col.red = col.green = col.blue = 0;
 11810       col.flags = DoRed | DoGreen | DoBlue;
 11811       pixc = XCreatePixmapCursor (dpy, pix, pix, &col, &col, 0, 0);
 11812       if (! x_had_errors_p (dpy) && pixc != None)
 11813         c = pixc;
 11814       XFreePixmap (dpy, pix);
 11815     }
 11816 
 11817   x_uncatch_errors ();
 11818 
 11819   return c;
 11820 }
 11821 
 11822 /* Toggle mouse pointer visibility on frame F by using an invisible
 11823    cursor.  */
 11824 static void
 11825 x_toggle_visible_pointer (struct frame *f, bool invisible)
 11826 {
 11827   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 11828 
 11829   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 11830 
 11831   /* We could have gotten a BadAlloc error while creating the
 11832      invisible cursor.  Try to create it again, but if that fails,
 11833      just give up.  */
 11834   if (dpyinfo->invisible_cursor == None)
 11835     dpyinfo->invisible_cursor = make_invisible_cursor (dpyinfo);
 11836 
 11837 #if !defined HAVE_XFIXES || XFIXES_VERSION < 40000
 11838   if (dpyinfo->invisible_cursor == None)
 11839     invisible = false;
 11840 #else
 11841   /* But if Xfixes is available, try using it instead.  */
 11842   if (dpyinfo->invisible_cursor == None)
 11843     {
 11844       if (x_fixes_pointer_blanking_supported (dpyinfo))
 11845         {
 11846           dpyinfo->fixes_pointer_blanking = true;
 11847           xfixes_toggle_visible_pointer (f, invisible);
 11848 
 11849           return;
 11850         }
 11851       else
 11852         invisible = false;
 11853     }
 11854 #endif
 11855 
 11856   if (invisible)
 11857     XDefineCursor (dpyinfo->display, FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 11858                    dpyinfo->invisible_cursor);
 11859   else
 11860     XDefineCursor (dpyinfo->display, FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 11861                    f->output_data.x->current_cursor);
 11862 
 11863   f->pointer_invisible = invisible;
 11864 }
 11865 
 11866 static void
 11867 XTtoggle_invisible_pointer (struct frame *f, bool invisible)
 11868 {
 11869   block_input ();
 11870 #if defined HAVE_XFIXES && XFIXES_VERSION >= 40000
 11871   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->fixes_pointer_blanking
 11872       && x_fixes_pointer_blanking_supported (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)))
 11873     xfixes_toggle_visible_pointer (f, invisible);
 11874   else
 11875 #endif
 11876     x_toggle_visible_pointer (f, invisible);
 11877   unblock_input ();
 11878 }
 11879 
 11880 /* Handle FocusIn and FocusOut state changes for FRAME.  If FRAME has
 11881    focus and there exists more than one frame, puts a FOCUS_IN_EVENT
 11882    into *BUFP.  Note that this code is not used to handle focus
 11883    changes on builds that can use the X Input extension for handling
 11884    input focus when it is available (currently the no toolkit and GTK
 11885    3 toolkits).  */
 11886 
 11887 static void
 11888 x_focus_changed (int type, int state, struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 11889                  struct frame *frame, struct input_event *bufp)
 11890 {
 11891   if (type == FocusIn)
 11892     {
 11893       if (dpyinfo->x_focus_event_frame != frame)
 11894         {
 11895           x_new_focus_frame (dpyinfo, frame);
 11896           dpyinfo->x_focus_event_frame = frame;
 11897           bufp->kind = FOCUS_IN_EVENT;
 11898           XSETFRAME (bufp->frame_or_window, frame);
 11899         }
 11900 
 11901       frame->output_data.x->focus_state |= state;
 11902 
 11903 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 11904       if (FRAME_XIC (frame))
 11905         XSetICFocus (FRAME_XIC (frame));
 11906 #ifdef USE_GTK
 11907       GtkWidget *widget;
 11908 
 11909       if (x_gtk_use_native_input)
 11910         {
 11911           gtk_im_context_focus_in (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (frame)->im_context);
 11912           widget = FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (frame);
 11913           gtk_im_context_set_client_window (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (frame)->im_context,
 11914                                             gtk_widget_get_window (widget));
 11915         }
 11916 #endif
 11917 #endif
 11918     }
 11919   else if (type == FocusOut)
 11920     {
 11921       frame->output_data.x->focus_state &= ~state;
 11922 
 11923       if (dpyinfo->x_focus_event_frame == frame)
 11924         {
 11925           dpyinfo->x_focus_event_frame = 0;
 11926           x_new_focus_frame (dpyinfo, 0);
 11927 
 11928           bufp->kind = FOCUS_OUT_EVENT;
 11929           XSETFRAME (bufp->frame_or_window, frame);
 11930         }
 11931 
 11932       if (!frame->output_data.x->focus_state)
 11933         {
 11934 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 11935           if (FRAME_XIC (frame))
 11936             XUnsetICFocus (FRAME_XIC (frame));
 11937 #ifdef USE_GTK
 11938           if (x_gtk_use_native_input)
 11939             {
 11940               gtk_im_context_focus_out (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (frame)->im_context);
 11941               gtk_im_context_set_client_window (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (frame)->im_context, NULL);
 11942             }
 11943 #endif
 11944 #endif
 11945         }
 11946 
 11947       if (frame->pointer_invisible)
 11948         XTtoggle_invisible_pointer (frame, false);
 11949     }
 11950 }
 11951 
 11952 /* Return the Emacs frame-object corresponding to an X window.  It
 11953    could be the frame's main window, an icon window, or an xwidget
 11954    window.  */
 11955 
 11956 static struct frame *
 11957 x_window_to_frame (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, int wdesc)
 11958 {
 11959   Lisp_Object tail, frame;
 11960   struct frame *f;
 11961 
 11962   if (wdesc == None)
 11963     return NULL;
 11964 
 11965 #ifdef HAVE_XWIDGETS
 11966   struct xwidget_view *xvw = xwidget_view_from_window (wdesc);
 11967 
 11968   if (xvw && xvw->frame)
 11969     return xvw->frame;
 11970 #endif
 11971 
 11972   FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 11973     {
 11974       f = XFRAME (frame);
 11975       if (!FRAME_X_P (f) || FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f) != dpyinfo)
 11976         continue;
 11977       if (f->output_data.x->hourglass_window == wdesc)
 11978         return f;
 11979 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 11980       if ((f->output_data.x->edit_widget
 11981            && XtWindow (f->output_data.x->edit_widget) == wdesc)
 11982           /* A tooltip frame?  */
 11983           || (!f->output_data.x->edit_widget
 11984               && FRAME_X_WINDOW (f) == wdesc)
 11985           || f->output_data.x->icon_desc == wdesc)
 11986         return f;
 11987 #else /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 11988 #ifdef USE_GTK
 11989       if (f->output_data.x->edit_widget)
 11990       {
 11991         GtkWidget *gwdesc = xg_win_to_widget (dpyinfo->display, wdesc);
 11992         struct x_output *x = f->output_data.x;
 11993         if (gwdesc != 0 && gwdesc == x->edit_widget)
 11994           return f;
 11995       }
 11996 #endif /* USE_GTK */
 11997       if (FRAME_X_WINDOW (f) == wdesc
 11998           || f->output_data.x->icon_desc == wdesc)
 11999         return f;
 12000 #endif /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 12001     }
 12002   return 0;
 12003 }
 12004 
 12005 /* Like x_any_window_to_frame but only try to find tooltip frames.
 12006 
 12007    If wdesc is a toolkit tooltip without an associated frame, set
 12008    UNRELATED_TOOLTIP_P to true.  Otherwise, set it to false.  */
 12009 static struct frame *
 12010 x_tooltip_window_to_frame (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 12011                            Window wdesc, bool *unrelated_tooltip_p)
 12012 {
 12013   Lisp_Object tail, frame;
 12014   struct frame *f;
 12015 #ifdef USE_GTK
 12016   GtkWidget *widget;
 12017   GdkWindow *tooltip_window;
 12018 #endif
 12019 
 12020   if (unrelated_tooltip_p)
 12021     *unrelated_tooltip_p = false;
 12022 
 12023   FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 12024     {
 12025       f = XFRAME (frame);
 12026 
 12027       if (FRAME_X_P (f) && FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (f)
 12028           && FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f) == dpyinfo
 12029           && FRAME_X_WINDOW (f) == wdesc)
 12030         return f;
 12031 
 12032 #ifdef USE_GTK
 12033       if (!FRAME_X_P (f))
 12034         continue;
 12035 
 12036       if (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->ttip_window)
 12037         widget = GTK_WIDGET (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->ttip_window);
 12038       else
 12039         widget = NULL;
 12040 
 12041       if (widget)
 12042         tooltip_window = gtk_widget_get_window (widget);
 12043       else
 12044         tooltip_window = NULL;
 12045 
 12046 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
 12047       if (tooltip_window
 12048           && (gdk_x11_window_get_xid (tooltip_window) == wdesc))
 12049         {
 12050           if (unrelated_tooltip_p)
 12051             *unrelated_tooltip_p = true;
 12052           break;
 12053         }
 12054 #else
 12055       if (tooltip_window
 12056           && (GDK_WINDOW_XID (tooltip_window) == wdesc))
 12057         {
 12058           if (unrelated_tooltip_p)
 12059             *unrelated_tooltip_p = true;
 12060           break;
 12061         }
 12062 #endif
 12063 #endif
 12064     }
 12065 
 12066   return NULL;
 12067 }
 12068 
 12069 #if defined (USE_X_TOOLKIT) || defined (USE_GTK)
 12070 
 12071 /* Like x_window_to_frame but also compares the window with the widget's
 12072    windows.  */
 12073 
 12074 static struct frame *
 12075 x_any_window_to_frame (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, int wdesc)
 12076 {
 12077   Lisp_Object tail, frame;
 12078   struct frame *f, *found = NULL;
 12079   struct x_output *x;
 12080 
 12081   if (wdesc == None)
 12082     return NULL;
 12083 
 12084 #ifdef HAVE_XWIDGETS
 12085   struct xwidget_view *xv = xwidget_view_from_window (wdesc);
 12086 
 12087   if (xv)
 12088     return xv->frame;
 12089 #endif
 12090 
 12091   FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 12092     {
 12093       if (found)
 12094         break;
 12095       f = XFRAME (frame);
 12096       if (FRAME_X_P (f) && FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f) == dpyinfo)
 12097         {
 12098           /* This frame matches if the window is any of its widgets.  */
 12099           x = f->output_data.x;
 12100           if (x->hourglass_window == wdesc)
 12101             found = f;
 12102           else if (x->widget)
 12103             {
 12104 #ifdef USE_GTK
 12105               GtkWidget *gwdesc = xg_win_to_widget (dpyinfo->display, wdesc);
 12106               if (gwdesc != 0
 12107                   && gtk_widget_get_toplevel (gwdesc) == x->widget)
 12108                 found = f;
 12109 #else
 12110               if (wdesc == XtWindow (x->widget)
 12111                   || wdesc == XtWindow (x->column_widget)
 12112                   || wdesc == XtWindow (x->edit_widget))
 12113                 found = f;
 12114               /* Match if the window is this frame's menubar.  */
 12115               else if (lw_window_is_in_menubar (wdesc, x->menubar_widget))
 12116                 found = f;
 12117 #endif
 12118             }
 12119           else if (FRAME_X_WINDOW (f) == wdesc)
 12120             /* A tooltip frame.  */
 12121             found = f;
 12122         }
 12123     }
 12124 
 12125   return found;
 12126 }
 12127 
 12128 /* Likewise, but consider only the menu bar widget.  */
 12129 
 12130 static struct frame *
 12131 x_menubar_window_to_frame (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 12132                            const XEvent *event)
 12133 {
 12134   Window wdesc;
 12135 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 12136   if (event->type == GenericEvent
 12137       && dpyinfo->supports_xi2
 12138       && (event->xcookie.evtype == XI_ButtonPress
 12139           || event->xcookie.evtype == XI_ButtonRelease))
 12140     wdesc = ((XIDeviceEvent *) event->xcookie.data)->event;
 12141   else
 12142 #endif
 12143     wdesc = event->xany.window;
 12144   Lisp_Object tail, frame;
 12145   struct frame *f;
 12146   struct x_output *x;
 12147 
 12148   if (wdesc == None)
 12149     return NULL;
 12150 
 12151   FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 12152     {
 12153       f = XFRAME (frame);
 12154       if (!FRAME_X_P (f) || FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f) != dpyinfo)
 12155         continue;
 12156       x = f->output_data.x;
 12157 #ifdef USE_GTK
 12158       if (x->menubar_widget && xg_event_is_for_menubar (f, event))
 12159         return f;
 12160 #else
 12161       /* Match if the window is this frame's menubar.  */
 12162       if (x->menubar_widget
 12163           && lw_window_is_in_menubar (wdesc, x->menubar_widget))
 12164         return f;
 12165 #endif
 12166     }
 12167   return 0;
 12168 }
 12169 
 12170 /* Return the frame whose principal (outermost) window is WDESC.
 12171    If WDESC is some other (smaller) window, we return 0.  */
 12172 
 12173 struct frame *
 12174 x_top_window_to_frame (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, int wdesc)
 12175 {
 12176   Lisp_Object tail, frame;
 12177   struct frame *f;
 12178   struct x_output *x;
 12179 
 12180   if (wdesc == None)
 12181     return NULL;
 12182 
 12183   FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 12184     {
 12185       f = XFRAME (frame);
 12186       if (!FRAME_X_P (f) || FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f) != dpyinfo)
 12187         continue;
 12188       x = f->output_data.x;
 12189 
 12190       if (x->widget)
 12191         {
 12192           /* This frame matches if the window is its topmost widget.  */
 12193 #ifdef USE_GTK
 12194           GtkWidget *gwdesc = xg_win_to_widget (dpyinfo->display, wdesc);
 12195           if (gwdesc == x->widget)
 12196             return f;
 12197 #else
 12198           if (wdesc == XtWindow (x->widget))
 12199             return f;
 12200 #endif
 12201         }
 12202       else if (FRAME_X_WINDOW (f) == wdesc)
 12203         /* Tooltip frame.  */
 12204         return f;
 12205     }
 12206   return 0;
 12207 }
 12208 
 12209 #else /* !USE_X_TOOLKIT && !USE_GTK */
 12210 
 12211 #define x_any_window_to_frame(d, i) x_window_to_frame (d, i)
 12212 
 12213 struct frame *
 12214 x_top_window_to_frame (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, int wdesc)
 12215 {
 12216   return x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, wdesc);
 12217 }
 12218 
 12219 static void
 12220 x_next_event_from_any_display (XEvent *event)
 12221 {
 12222   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 12223   fd_set fds, rfds;
 12224   int fd, maxfd, rc;
 12225 
 12226   rc = -1;
 12227   FD_ZERO (&rfds);
 12228 
 12229   while (true)
 12230     {
 12231       FD_ZERO (&fds);
 12232       maxfd = -1;
 12233 
 12234       for (dpyinfo = x_display_list; dpyinfo;
 12235            dpyinfo = dpyinfo->next)
 12236         {
 12237           fd = ConnectionNumber (dpyinfo->display);
 12238 
 12239           if ((rc < 0 || FD_ISSET (fd, &rfds))
 12240               && XPending (dpyinfo->display))
 12241             {
 12242               XNextEvent (dpyinfo->display, event);
 12243               return;
 12244             }
 12245 
 12246           if (fd > maxfd)
 12247             maxfd = fd;
 12248 
 12249           eassert (fd < FD_SETSIZE);
 12250           FD_SET (fd, &fds);
 12251         }
 12252 
 12253       eassert (maxfd >= 0);
 12254 
 12255       /* Continue to read input even if pselect fails, because if an
 12256          error occurs XPending will call the IO error handler, which
 12257          then brings us out of this loop.  */
 12258       rc = pselect (maxfd + 1, &fds, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
 12259 
 12260       if (rc >= 0)
 12261         rfds = fds;
 12262     }
 12263 }
 12264 
 12265 #endif /* USE_X_TOOLKIT || USE_GTK */
 12266 
 12267 static void
 12268 x_handle_pending_selection_requests_1 (struct x_selection_request_event *tem)
 12269 {
 12270   specpdl_ref count;
 12271   struct selection_input_event se;
 12272 
 12273   count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
 12274   se = tem->se;
 12275 
 12276   record_unwind_protect_ptr (xfree, tem);
 12277   x_handle_selection_event (&se);
 12278   unbind_to (count, Qnil);
 12279 }
 12280 
 12281 /* Handle all pending selection request events from modal event
 12282    loops.  */
 12283 void
 12284 x_handle_pending_selection_requests (void)
 12285 {
 12286   struct x_selection_request_event *tem;
 12287 
 12288   while (pending_selection_requests)
 12289     {
 12290       tem = pending_selection_requests;
 12291       pending_selection_requests = tem->next;
 12292 
 12293       x_handle_pending_selection_requests_1 (tem);
 12294     }
 12295 }
 12296 
 12297 static void
 12298 x_push_selection_request (struct selection_input_event *se)
 12299 {
 12300   struct x_selection_request_event *tem;
 12301 
 12302   tem = xmalloc (sizeof *tem);
 12303   tem->next = pending_selection_requests;
 12304   tem->se = *se;
 12305   pending_selection_requests = tem;
 12306 }
 12307 
 12308 bool
 12309 x_detect_pending_selection_requests (void)
 12310 {
 12311   return !!pending_selection_requests;
 12312 }
 12313 
 12314 static void
 12315 x_clear_dnd_action (void)
 12316 {
 12317   x_dnd_action_symbol = Qnil;
 12318 }
 12319 
 12320 /* Delete action descriptions from F after drag-and-drop.  */
 12321 static void
 12322 x_dnd_delete_action_list (Lisp_Object frame)
 12323 {
 12324   struct frame *f;
 12325 
 12326   /* Delete those two properties, since some clients look at them and
 12327      not the action to decide whether or not the user should be
 12328      prompted to select an action.  This can be called with FRAME no
 12329      longer alive (or its display dead).  */
 12330 
 12331   f = XFRAME (frame);
 12332 
 12333   if (!FRAME_LIVE_P (f) || !FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->display)
 12334     return;
 12335 
 12336   block_input ();
 12337   XDeleteProperty (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 12338                    FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionList);
 12339   XDeleteProperty (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 12340                    FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionDescription);
 12341   unblock_input ();
 12342 }
 12343 
 12344 static void
 12345 x_dnd_lose_ownership (Lisp_Object timestamp_and_frame)
 12346 {
 12347   struct frame *f;
 12348 
 12349   f = XFRAME (XCDR (timestamp_and_frame));
 12350 
 12351   if (FRAME_LIVE_P (f))
 12352     Fx_disown_selection_internal (QXdndSelection,
 12353                                   XCAR (timestamp_and_frame),
 12354                                   XCDR (timestamp_and_frame));
 12355 }
 12356 
 12357 /* Clean up an existing drag-and-drop operation in preparation for its
 12358    sudden termination.  */
 12359 
 12360 static void
 12361 x_dnd_process_quit (struct frame *f, Time timestamp)
 12362 {
 12363   xm_drop_start_message dmsg;
 12364 
 12365   if (x_dnd_in_progress)
 12366     {
 12367       if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 12368           && x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1)
 12369         x_dnd_send_leave (f, x_dnd_last_seen_window,
 12370                           x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel);
 12371       else if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 12372                && !XM_DRAG_STYLE_IS_DROP_ONLY (x_dnd_last_motif_style)
 12373                && x_dnd_last_motif_style != XM_DRAG_STYLE_NONE
 12374                && x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 12375         {
 12376           dmsg.reason = XM_DRAG_REASON (XM_DRAG_ORIGINATOR_INITIATOR,
 12377                                         XM_DRAG_REASON_DROP_START);
 12378           dmsg.byte_order = XM_BYTE_ORDER_CUR_FIRST;
 12379           dmsg.timestamp = timestamp;
 12380           dmsg.side_effects
 12381             = XM_DRAG_SIDE_EFFECT (xm_side_effect_from_action (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
 12382                                                                x_dnd_wanted_action),
 12383                                    XM_DROP_SITE_VALID, x_dnd_motif_operations,
 12384                                    XM_DROP_ACTION_DROP_CANCEL);
 12385           dmsg.x = 0;
 12386           dmsg.y = 0;
 12387           dmsg.index_atom = x_dnd_motif_atom;
 12388           dmsg.source_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
 12389 
 12390           x_dnd_send_xm_leave_for_drop (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f), f,
 12391                                         x_dnd_last_seen_window,
 12392                                         timestamp);
 12393           xm_send_drop_message (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 12394                                 x_dnd_last_seen_window, &dmsg);
 12395         }
 12396 
 12397       x_dnd_end_window = x_dnd_last_seen_window;
 12398       x_dnd_last_seen_window = None;
 12399       x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel = None;
 12400       x_dnd_in_progress = false;
 12401       x_dnd_frame = NULL;
 12402     }
 12403 
 12404   x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = false;
 12405   x_dnd_return_frame_object = NULL;
 12406   x_dnd_movement_frame = NULL;
 12407   x_dnd_wheel_frame = NULL;
 12408 }
 12409 
 12410 /* This function is defined far away from the rest of the XDND code so
 12411    it can utilize `x_any_window_to_frame'.  */
 12412 
 12413 /* Implementors beware!  On most other platforms (where drag-and-drop
 12414    data is not provided via selections, but some kind of serialization
 12415    mechanism), it is usually much easier to implement a suitable
 12416    primitive instead of copying the C code here, and then to build
 12417    `x-begin-drag' on top of that, by making it a wrapper function in
 12418    Lisp that converts the list of targets and value of `XdndSelection'
 12419    to serialized data.  Also be sure to update the data types used in
 12420    dnd.el.
 12421 
 12422    For examples of how to do this, see `haiku-drag-message' and
 12423    `x-begin-drag' in haikuselect.c and lisp/term/haiku-win.el, and
 12424    `ns-begin-drag' and `x-begin-drag' in nsselect.m and
 12425    lisp/term/ns-win.el.  */
 12426 
 12427 Lisp_Object
 12428 x_dnd_begin_drag_and_drop (struct frame *f, Time time, Atom xaction,
 12429                            Lisp_Object return_frame, Atom *ask_action_list,
 12430                            const char **ask_action_names, size_t n_ask_actions,
 12431                            bool allow_current_frame, Atom *target_atoms,
 12432                            int ntargets, Lisp_Object selection_target_list,
 12433                            bool follow_tooltip)
 12434 {
 12435 #ifndef USE_GTK
 12436   XEvent next_event;
 12437   int finish;
 12438 #endif
 12439   XWindowAttributes root_window_attrs;
 12440   struct input_event hold_quit;
 12441   char *atom_name, *ask_actions;
 12442   Lisp_Object action, ltimestamp, val;
 12443   specpdl_ref ref, count, base;
 12444   ptrdiff_t i, end, fill;
 12445   XTextProperty prop;
 12446   Lisp_Object frame_object, x, y, frame, local_value;
 12447   bool signals_were_pending, need_sync;
 12448 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 12449   XkbStateRec keyboard_state;
 12450 #endif
 12451 #ifndef USE_GTK
 12452   struct x_display_info *event_display;
 12453 #endif
 12454   unsigned int additional_mask;
 12455 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 12456   struct xi_device_t *device;
 12457 #endif
 12458 
 12459   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->untrusted)
 12460     /* Untrusted clients cannot send messages to trusted clients or
 12461        read the window tree, so drag and drop will likely not work at
 12462        all.  */
 12463     error ("Drag-and-drop is not possible when the client is"
 12464            " not trusted by the X server.");
 12465 
 12466   base = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
 12467 
 12468   /* Bind this here to avoid juggling bindings and SAFE_FREE in
 12469      Fx_begin_drag.  */
 12470   specbind (Qx_dnd_targets_list, selection_target_list);
 12471 
 12472   if (!FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
 12473     error ("Frame must be visible");
 12474 
 12475   XSETFRAME (frame, f);
 12476   local_value = assq_no_quit (QXdndSelection,
 12477                               FRAME_TERMINAL (f)->Vselection_alist);
 12478 
 12479   if (x_dnd_in_progress || x_dnd_waiting_for_finish)
 12480     error ("A drag-and-drop session is already in progress");
 12481 
 12482   DEFER_SELECTIONS;
 12483 
 12484   /* If local_value is nil, then we lost ownership of XdndSelection.
 12485      Signal a more informative error than args-out-of-range.  */
 12486   if (NILP (local_value))
 12487     error ("No local value for XdndSelection");
 12488 
 12489   if (popup_activated ())
 12490     error ("Trying to drag-and-drop from within a menu-entry");
 12491 
 12492   x_set_dnd_targets (target_atoms, ntargets);
 12493   record_unwind_protect_void (x_free_dnd_targets);
 12494   record_unwind_protect_void (x_clear_dnd_action);
 12495 
 12496   ltimestamp = x_timestamp_for_selection (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
 12497                                           QXdndSelection);
 12498 
 12499   if (NILP (ltimestamp))
 12500     error ("No local value for XdndSelection");
 12501 
 12502   if (BIGNUMP (ltimestamp))
 12503     x_dnd_selection_timestamp = bignum_to_intmax (ltimestamp);
 12504   else
 12505     x_dnd_selection_timestamp = XFIXNUM (ltimestamp);
 12506 
 12507   /* Release ownership of XdndSelection after this function returns.
 12508      VirtualBox uses the owner of XdndSelection to determine whether
 12509      or not mouse motion is part of a drag-and-drop operation.  */
 12510 
 12511   if (!x_dnd_preserve_selection_data)
 12512     record_unwind_protect (x_dnd_lose_ownership,
 12513                            Fcons (ltimestamp, frame));
 12514 
 12515   x_dnd_motif_operations
 12516     = xm_side_effect_from_action (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f), xaction);
 12517 
 12518   x_dnd_first_motif_operation = XM_DRAG_NOOP;
 12519 
 12520   if (n_ask_actions)
 12521     {
 12522       x_dnd_motif_operations
 12523         = xm_operations_from_actions (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
 12524                                       ask_action_list,
 12525                                       n_ask_actions);
 12526       x_dnd_first_motif_operation
 12527         = xm_side_effect_from_action (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
 12528                                       ask_action_list[0]);
 12529 
 12530       record_unwind_protect (x_dnd_delete_action_list, frame);
 12531 
 12532       ask_actions = NULL;
 12533       end = 0;
 12534       count = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
 12535 
 12536       for (i = 0; i < n_ask_actions; ++i)
 12537         {
 12538           fill = end;
 12539           end += strlen (ask_action_names[i]) + 1;
 12540 
 12541           if (ask_actions)
 12542             ask_actions = xrealloc (ask_actions, end);
 12543           else
 12544             ask_actions = xmalloc (end);
 12545 
 12546           strncpy (ask_actions + fill,
 12547                    ask_action_names[i],
 12548                    end - fill);
 12549         }
 12550 
 12551       prop.value = (unsigned char *) ask_actions;
 12552       prop.encoding = XA_STRING;
 12553       prop.format = 8;
 12554       prop.nitems = end;
 12555 
 12556       record_unwind_protect_ptr (xfree, ask_actions);
 12557 
 12558       /* This can potentially store a lot of data in window
 12559          properties, so check for allocation errors.  */
 12560       block_input ();
 12561       x_catch_errors (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
 12562       XSetTextProperty (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 12563                         &prop, FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionDescription);
 12564 
 12565       XChangeProperty (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 12566                        FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XdndActionList, XA_ATOM, 32,
 12567                        PropModeReplace, (unsigned char *) ask_action_list,
 12568                        n_ask_actions);
 12569       x_check_errors (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 12570                       "Can't set action descriptions: %s");
 12571       x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
 12572       unblock_input ();
 12573 
 12574       unbind_to (count, Qnil);
 12575     }
 12576 
 12577   record_unwind_protect_void (x_clear_dnd_variables);
 12578 
 12579   if (follow_tooltip)
 12580     {
 12581 #if defined HAVE_XRANDR || defined USE_GTK
 12582       x_dnd_monitors
 12583         = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->last_monitor_attributes_list;
 12584 
 12585       if (NILP (x_dnd_monitors))
 12586 #endif
 12587         x_dnd_monitors
 12588           = Fx_display_monitor_attributes_list (frame);
 12589     }
 12590 
 12591   x_dnd_update_tooltip = follow_tooltip;
 12592 
 12593   /* This shouldn't happen.  */
 12594   if (x_dnd_toplevels)
 12595     x_dnd_free_toplevels (true);
 12596 
 12597 #ifdef USE_GTK
 12598   /* Prevent GTK+ timeouts from being run, since they can call
 12599      handle_one_xevent behind our back.  */
 12600   suppress_xg_select ();
 12601   record_unwind_protect_void (release_xg_select);
 12602 #endif
 12603 
 12604   /* Set up a meaningless alias.  */
 12605   XSETCAR (x_dnd_selection_alias_cell, QSECONDARY);
 12606   XSETCDR (x_dnd_selection_alias_cell, QSECONDARY);
 12607 
 12608   /* Bind this here.  The cell doesn't actually alias between
 12609      anything until `xm_setup_dnd_targets' is called.  */
 12610   specbind (Qx_selection_alias_alist,
 12611             Fcons (x_dnd_selection_alias_cell,
 12612                    Vx_selection_alias_alist));
 12613 
 12614   /* Initialize most of the state for the drag-and-drop operation.  */
 12615   x_dnd_in_progress = true;
 12616   x_dnd_recursion_depth = command_loop_level + minibuf_level;
 12617   x_dnd_frame = f;
 12618   x_dnd_last_seen_window = None;
 12619   x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel = None;
 12620   x_dnd_last_protocol_version = -1;
 12621   x_dnd_last_window_is_frame = false;
 12622   x_dnd_last_motif_style = XM_DRAG_STYLE_NONE;
 12623   x_dnd_mouse_rect_target = None;
 12624   x_dnd_action = None;
 12625   x_dnd_action_symbol = Qnil;
 12626   x_dnd_wanted_action = xaction;
