 12627   x_dnd_return_frame = 0;
 12628   x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = false;
 12629   x_dnd_waiting_for_motif_finish = 0;
 12630   x_dnd_waiting_for_status_window = None;
 12631   x_dnd_pending_send_position.type = 0;
 12632   x_dnd_xm_use_help = false;
 12633   x_dnd_motif_setup_p = false;
 12634   x_dnd_end_window = None;
 12635   x_dnd_run_unsupported_drop_function = false;
 12636   x_dnd_use_toplevels
 12637     = x_wm_supports (f, FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_net_client_list_stacking);
 12638   x_dnd_last_tooltip_valid = false;
 12639   x_dnd_toplevels = NULL;
 12640   x_dnd_allow_current_frame = allow_current_frame;
 12641   x_dnd_movement_frame = NULL;
 12642   x_dnd_wheel_frame = NULL;
 12643   x_dnd_init_type_lists = false;
 12644   x_dnd_need_send_drop = false;
 12645 
 12646 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 12647 
 12648   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->supports_xi2)
 12649     {
 12650       /* Only accept input from the last master pointer to have interacted
 12651          with Emacs.  This prevents another pointer device getting our
 12652          idea of the button state messed up.  */
 12653       if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->client_pointer_device != -1)
 12654         x_dnd_pointer_device
 12655           = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->client_pointer_device;
 12656       else
 12657         /* This returns Bool but cannot actually fail.  */
 12658         XIGetClientPointer (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), None,
 12659                             &x_dnd_pointer_device);
 12660 
 12661       x_dnd_keyboard_device = -1;
 12662 
 12663       device = xi_device_from_id (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
 12664                                   x_dnd_pointer_device);
 12665 
 12666       if (device)
 12667         x_dnd_keyboard_device = device->attachment;
 12668     }
 12669   else
 12670     {
 12671       x_dnd_pointer_device = -1;
 12672       x_dnd_keyboard_device = -1;
 12673     }
 12674 
 12675 #endif
 12676 
 12677 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 12678   x_dnd_keyboard_state = 0;
 12679 
 12680   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->supports_xkb)
 12681     {
 12682       XkbSelectEvents (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), XkbUseCoreKbd,
 12683                        XkbStateNotifyMask, XkbStateNotifyMask);
 12684       XkbGetState (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), XkbUseCoreKbd,
 12685                    &keyboard_state);
 12686 
 12687       x_dnd_keyboard_state = (keyboard_state.mods
 12688                               | keyboard_state.ptr_buttons);
 12689     }
 12690 #endif
 12691 
 12692   if (x_dnd_use_toplevels)
 12693     {
 12694       if (x_dnd_compute_toplevels (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)))
 12695         {
 12696           x_dnd_free_toplevels (true);
 12697           x_dnd_use_toplevels = false;
 12698         }
 12699       else
 12700         record_unwind_protect_void (x_free_dnd_toplevels);
 12701     }
 12702 
 12703   if (!NILP (return_frame))
 12704     x_dnd_return_frame = 1;
 12705 
 12706   if (EQ (return_frame, Qnow))
 12707     x_dnd_return_frame = 2;
 12708 
 12709   /* Now select for SubstructureNotifyMask and PropertyChangeMask on
 12710      the root window, so we can get notified when window stacking
 12711      changes, a common operation during drag-and-drop.  */
 12712 
 12713   XGetWindowAttributes (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 12714                         FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window,
 12715                         &root_window_attrs);
 12716 
 12717   additional_mask = SubstructureNotifyMask;
 12718 
 12719   if (x_dnd_use_toplevels)
 12720     additional_mask |= PropertyChangeMask;
 12721 
 12722   XSelectInput (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 12723                 FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window,
 12724                 root_window_attrs.your_event_mask
 12725                 | additional_mask);
 12726 
 12727   if (EQ (return_frame, Qnow))
 12728     x_dnd_update_state (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f), CurrentTime);
 12729 
 12730   while (x_dnd_in_progress || x_dnd_waiting_for_finish)
 12731     {
 12732       EVENT_INIT (hold_quit);
 12733 
 12734 #ifdef USE_GTK
 12735       current_finish = X_EVENT_NORMAL;
 12736       current_hold_quit = &hold_quit;
 12737       current_count = 0;
 12738       xg_pending_quit_event.kind = NO_EVENT;
 12739 #endif
 12740 
 12741       block_input ();
 12742       x_dnd_inside_handle_one_xevent = true;
 12743 #ifdef USE_GTK
 12744       gtk_main_iteration ();
 12745 #elif defined USE_X_TOOLKIT
 12746       XtAppNextEvent (Xt_app_con, &next_event);
 12747 #else
 12748       x_next_event_from_any_display (&next_event);
 12749 #endif
 12750 
 12751 #ifndef USE_GTK
 12752       event_display
 12753         = x_display_info_for_display (next_event.xany.display);
 12754 
 12755       if (event_display)
 12756         {
 12757 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 12758 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 12759           if (next_event.type != GenericEvent
 12760               || !event_display->supports_xi2
 12761               || (next_event.xgeneric.extension
 12762                   != event_display->xi2_opcode))
 12763             {
 12764 #endif
 12765               if (!x_filter_event (event_display, &next_event))
 12766                 handle_one_xevent (event_display,
 12767                                    &next_event, &finish, &hold_quit);
 12768 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 12769             }
 12770           else
 12771             handle_one_xevent (event_display,
 12772                                &next_event, &finish, &hold_quit);
 12773 #endif
 12774 #else
 12775           handle_one_xevent (event_display,
 12776                              &next_event, &finish, &hold_quit);
 12777 #endif
 12778         }
 12779 #else
 12780       /* Clear these before the read_socket_hook can be called.  */
 12781       current_count = -1;
 12782       current_hold_quit = NULL;
 12783 #endif
 12784       x_dnd_inside_handle_one_xevent = false;
 12785 
 12786       /* Clean up any event handlers that are now out of date.  */
 12787       x_clean_failable_requests (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f));
 12788 
 12789       /* The unblock_input below might try to read input, but
 12790          XTread_socket does nothing inside a drag-and-drop event
 12791          loop, so don't let it clear the pending_signals flag.  */
 12792       signals_were_pending = pending_signals;
 12793       unblock_input ();
 12794       pending_signals = signals_were_pending;
 12795 
 12796       /* Ignore mouse movement from displays that aren't the DND
 12797          display.  */
 12798 #ifndef USE_GTK
 12799       if (event_display == FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f))
 12800         {
 12801 #endif
 12802           if (x_dnd_movement_frame
 12803               /* FIXME: how come this can end up with movement frames
 12804                  from other displays on GTK builds?  */
 12805               && (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (x_dnd_movement_frame)
 12806                   == FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f))
 12807               /* If both those variables are false, then F is no
 12808                  longer protected from deletion by Lisp code.  This
 12809                  can only happen during the final iteration of the DND
 12810                  event loop.  */
 12811               && (x_dnd_in_progress || x_dnd_waiting_for_finish))
 12812             {
 12813               XSETFRAME (frame_object, x_dnd_movement_frame);
 12814               XSETINT (x, x_dnd_movement_x);
 12815               XSETINT (y, x_dnd_movement_y);
 12816               x_dnd_movement_frame = NULL;
 12817 
 12818               if (!NILP (Vx_dnd_movement_function)
 12819                   && FRAME_LIVE_P (XFRAME (frame_object))
 12820                   && !FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (XFRAME (frame_object))
 12821                   && x_dnd_movement_x >= 0
 12822                   && x_dnd_movement_y >= 0
 12823                   && x_dnd_frame
 12824                   && (XFRAME (frame_object) != x_dnd_frame
 12825                       || x_dnd_allow_current_frame))
 12826                 {
 12827                   x_dnd_old_window_attrs = root_window_attrs;
 12828                   x_dnd_unwind_flag = true;
 12829 
 12830                   ref = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
 12831                   record_unwind_protect_ptr (x_dnd_cleanup_drag_and_drop, f);
 12832                   call2 (Vx_dnd_movement_function, frame_object,
 12833                          Fposn_at_x_y (x, y, frame_object, Qnil));
 12834                   x_dnd_unwind_flag = false;
 12835                   unbind_to (ref, Qnil);
 12836 
 12837                   /* Redisplay this way to preserve the echo area.
 12838                      Otherwise, the contents will abruptly disappear
 12839                      when the mouse moves over a frame.  */
 12840                   redisplay_preserve_echo_area (33);
 12841                 }
 12842             }
 12843 
 12844           if (x_dnd_wheel_frame
 12845               && (x_dnd_in_progress || x_dnd_waiting_for_finish))
 12846             {
 12847               XSETFRAME (frame_object, x_dnd_wheel_frame);
 12848               XSETINT (x, x_dnd_wheel_x);
 12849               XSETINT (y, x_dnd_wheel_y);
 12850               x_dnd_wheel_frame = NULL;
 12851 
 12852               if (!NILP (Vx_dnd_wheel_function)
 12853                   && FRAME_LIVE_P (XFRAME (frame_object))
 12854                   && !FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (XFRAME (frame_object))
 12855                   && x_dnd_movement_x >= 0
 12856                   && x_dnd_movement_y >= 0
 12857                   && x_dnd_frame
 12858                   && (XFRAME (frame_object) != x_dnd_frame
 12859                       || x_dnd_allow_current_frame))
 12860                 {
 12861                   x_dnd_old_window_attrs = root_window_attrs;
 12862                   x_dnd_unwind_flag = true;
 12863 
 12864                   ref = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
 12865                   record_unwind_protect_ptr (x_dnd_cleanup_drag_and_drop, f);
 12866                   call4 (Vx_dnd_wheel_function,
 12867                          Fposn_at_x_y (x, y, frame_object, Qnil),
 12868                          make_fixnum (x_dnd_wheel_button),
 12869                          make_uint (x_dnd_wheel_state),
 12870                          make_uint (x_dnd_wheel_time));
 12871                   x_dnd_unwind_flag = false;
 12872                   unbind_to (ref, Qnil);
 12873 
 12874                   /* Redisplay this way to preserve the echo area.
 12875                      Otherwise, the contents will abruptly disappear
 12876                      when the mouse moves over a frame.  */
 12877                   redisplay_preserve_echo_area (33);
 12878                 }
 12879             }
 12880 
 12881           if (hold_quit.kind != NO_EVENT)
 12882             {
 12883               x_dnd_process_quit (f, hold_quit.timestamp);
 12884 #ifdef USE_GTK
 12885               current_hold_quit = NULL;
 12886 #endif
 12887               /* Restore the old event mask.  */
 12888               x_restore_events_after_dnd (f, &root_window_attrs);
 12889 
 12890               /* Call kbd_buffer_store event, which calls
 12891                  handle_interrupt and sets `last-event-frame' along
 12892                  with various other things.  */
 12893               kbd_buffer_store_event (&hold_quit);
 12894               /* Now quit anyway.  */
 12895               quit ();
 12896             }
 12897 
 12898           if (pending_selection_requests
 12899               && (x_dnd_in_progress || x_dnd_waiting_for_finish))
 12900             {
 12901               x_dnd_old_window_attrs = root_window_attrs;
 12902               x_dnd_unwind_flag = true;
 12903 
 12904               ref = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
 12905               record_unwind_protect_ptr (x_dnd_cleanup_drag_and_drop, f);
 12906               x_handle_pending_selection_requests ();
 12907               x_dnd_unwind_flag = false;
 12908               unbind_to (ref, Qnil);
 12909             }
 12910 
 12911           /* Sometimes C-g can be pressed inside a selection
 12912              converter, where quitting is inhibited.  We want
 12913              to quit after the converter exits.  */
 12914           if (!NILP (Vquit_flag) && !NILP (Vinhibit_quit))
 12915             {
 12916               x_dnd_process_quit (f, FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->last_user_time);
 12917 #ifdef USE_GTK
 12918               current_hold_quit = NULL;
 12919 #endif
 12920               x_restore_events_after_dnd (f, &root_window_attrs);
 12921               quit ();
 12922             }
 12923 
 12924           if (x_dnd_run_unsupported_drop_function
 12925               && x_dnd_waiting_for_finish)
 12926             {
 12927               x_dnd_run_unsupported_drop_function = false;
 12928               x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = false;
 12929               x_dnd_unwind_flag = true;
 12930 
 12931               ref = SPECPDL_INDEX ();
 12932               record_unwind_protect_ptr (x_dnd_cleanup_drag_and_drop, f);
 12933 
 12934               if (!NILP (Vx_dnd_unsupported_drop_function))
 12935                 val = call8 (Vx_dnd_unsupported_drop_function,
 12936                              XCAR (XCDR (x_dnd_unsupported_drop_data)),
 12937                              Fnth (make_fixnum (3), x_dnd_unsupported_drop_data),
 12938                              Fnth (make_fixnum (4), x_dnd_unsupported_drop_data),
 12939                              Fnth (make_fixnum (2), x_dnd_unsupported_drop_data),
 12940                              make_uint (x_dnd_unsupported_drop_window),
 12941                              frame, make_uint (x_dnd_unsupported_drop_time),
 12942                              Fcopy_sequence (XCAR (x_dnd_unsupported_drop_data)));
 12943               else
 12944                 val = Qnil;
 12945 
 12946               if (NILP (val))
 12947                 x_dnd_do_unsupported_drop (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
 12948                                            frame, XCAR (x_dnd_unsupported_drop_data),
 12949                                            XCAR (XCDR (x_dnd_unsupported_drop_data)),
 12950                                            x_dnd_unsupported_drop_window,
 12951                                            XFIXNUM (Fnth (make_fixnum (3),
 12952                                                           x_dnd_unsupported_drop_data)),
 12953                                            XFIXNUM (Fnth (make_fixnum (4),
 12954                                                           x_dnd_unsupported_drop_data)),
 12955                                            x_dnd_unsupported_drop_time);
 12956               else if (SYMBOLP (val))
 12957                 x_dnd_action_symbol = val;
 12958 
 12959               x_dnd_unwind_flag = false;
 12960               unbind_to (ref, Qnil);
 12961 
 12962               /* Break out of the loop now, since DND has
 12963                  completed.  */
 12964               break;
 12965             }
 12966 
 12967 #ifdef USE_GTK
 12968           if (xg_pending_quit_event.kind != NO_EVENT)
 12969             {
 12970               xg_pending_quit_event.kind = NO_EVENT;
 12971               current_hold_quit = NULL;
 12972 
 12973               x_dnd_process_quit (f, FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->last_user_time);
 12974               x_restore_events_after_dnd (f, &root_window_attrs);
 12975               quit ();
 12976             }
 12977 #else
 12978         }
 12979       else
 12980         {
 12981           if (x_dnd_movement_frame)
 12982             x_dnd_movement_frame = NULL;
 12983 
 12984           if (x_dnd_wheel_frame)
 12985             x_dnd_wheel_frame = NULL;
 12986 
 12987           if (hold_quit.kind != NO_EVENT)
 12988             EVENT_INIT (hold_quit);
 12989         }
 12990 #endif
 12991     }
 12992 
 12993   x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = false;
 12994 
 12995 #ifdef USE_GTK
 12996   current_hold_quit = NULL;
 12997 #endif
 12998   x_dnd_movement_frame = NULL;
 12999   x_dnd_wheel_frame = NULL;
 13000   x_restore_events_after_dnd (f, &root_window_attrs);
 13001 
 13002   if (x_dnd_return_frame == 3
 13003       && FRAME_LIVE_P (x_dnd_return_frame_object))
 13004     {
 13005       /* Deliberately preserve the last device if
 13006          x_dnd_return_frame_object is the drag source.  */
 13007 
 13008       if (x_dnd_return_frame_object != x_dnd_frame)
 13009         x_dnd_return_frame_object->last_mouse_device = Qnil;
 13010 
 13011       x_dnd_return_frame_object->mouse_moved = true;
 13012 
 13013       XSETFRAME (action, x_dnd_return_frame_object);
 13014       x_dnd_return_frame_object = NULL;
 13015 
 13016       return unbind_to (base, action);
 13017     }
 13018 
 13019   x_dnd_return_frame_object = NULL;
 13020   FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->grabbed = 0;
 13021 
 13022   if (!NILP (x_dnd_action_symbol))
 13023     return unbind_to (base, x_dnd_action_symbol);
 13024 
 13025   if (x_dnd_action != None)
 13026     {
 13027       block_input ();
 13028       x_catch_errors (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
 13029       atom_name = x_get_atom_name (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
 13030                                    x_dnd_action, &need_sync);
 13031 
 13032       if (need_sync)
 13033         x_uncatch_errors ();
 13034       else
 13035         /* No protocol request actually happened, so avoid the extra
 13036            sync by calling x_uncatch_errors_after_check instead.  */
 13037         x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
 13038 
 13039       if (atom_name)
 13040         {
 13041           action = intern (atom_name);
 13042           xfree (atom_name);
 13043         }
 13044       else
 13045         action = Qnil;
 13046       unblock_input ();
 13047 
 13048       return unbind_to (base, action);
 13049     }
 13050 
 13051   return unbind_to (base, Qnil);
 13052 }
 13053 
 13054 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 13055 
 13056 /* Since the input extension assigns a keyboard focus to each master
 13057    device, there is no longer a 1:1 correspondence between the
 13058    selected frame and the focus frame immediately after the keyboard
 13059    focus is switched to a given frame.  This situation is handled by
 13060    keeping track of each master device's focus frame, the time of the
 13061    last interaction with that frame, and always keeping the focus on
 13062    the most recently selected frame.  We also use the pointer of the
 13063    device that is keeping the current frame focused in functions like
 13064    `mouse-position'.  */
 13065 
 13066 static void
 13067 xi_handle_focus_change (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 13068 {
 13069   struct input_event ie;
 13070   struct frame *focus, *new;
 13071   struct xi_device_t *device, *source = NULL;
 13072   ptrdiff_t i;
 13073   Time time;
 13074 #ifdef USE_GTK
 13075   struct x_output *output;
 13076   GtkWidget *widget;
 13077 #endif
 13078 
 13079   focus = dpyinfo->x_focus_frame;
 13080   new = NULL;
 13081   time = 0;
 13082 
 13083   dpyinfo->client_pointer_device = -1;
 13084 
 13085   for (i = 0; i < dpyinfo->num_devices; ++i)
 13086     {
 13087       device = &dpyinfo->devices[i];
 13088 
 13089       if (device->focus_frame
 13090           && device->focus_frame_time > time)
 13091         {
 13092           new = device->focus_frame;
 13093           time = device->focus_frame_time;
 13094           source = device;
 13095 
 13096           /* Use this device for future calls to `mouse-position' etc.
 13097              If it is a keyboard, use its attached pointer.  */
 13098 
 13099           if (device->use == XIMasterKeyboard)
 13100             dpyinfo->client_pointer_device = device->attachment;
 13101           else
 13102             dpyinfo->client_pointer_device = device->device_id;
 13103         }
 13104       /* Even if the implicit focus was set after the explicit focus
 13105          on this specific device, the explicit focus is what really
 13106          matters.  So use it instead.  */
 13107       else if (device->focus_implicit_frame
 13108                && device->focus_implicit_time > time)
 13109         {
 13110           new = device->focus_implicit_frame;
 13111           time = device->focus_implicit_time;
 13112           source = device;
 13113 
 13114           /* Use this device for future calls to `mouse-position' etc.
 13115              If it is a keyboard, use its attached pointer.  */
 13116 
 13117           if (device->use == XIMasterKeyboard)
 13118             dpyinfo->client_pointer_device = device->attachment;
 13119           else
 13120             dpyinfo->client_pointer_device = device->device_id;
 13121         }
 13122     }
 13123 
 13124   if (new != focus && focus)
 13125     {
 13126 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 13127       if (FRAME_XIC (focus))
 13128         XUnsetICFocus (FRAME_XIC (focus));
 13129 #endif
 13130 
 13131 #ifdef USE_GTK
 13132       output = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (focus);
 13133 
 13134       if (x_gtk_use_native_input)
 13135         {
 13136           gtk_im_context_focus_out (output->im_context);
 13137           gtk_im_context_set_client_window (output->im_context,
 13138                                             NULL);
 13139         }
 13140 #endif
 13141 
 13142       EVENT_INIT (ie);
 13143       ie.kind = FOCUS_OUT_EVENT;
 13144       XSETFRAME (ie.frame_or_window, focus);
 13145 
 13146       kbd_buffer_store_event (&ie);
 13147     }
 13148 
 13149   if (new != focus && new)
 13150     {
 13151 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 13152       if (FRAME_XIC (new))
 13153         XSetICFocus (FRAME_XIC (new));
 13154 #endif
 13155 
 13156 #ifdef USE_GTK
 13157       output = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (new);
 13158 
 13159       if (x_gtk_use_native_input)
 13160         {
 13161           widget = FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (new);
 13162 
 13163           gtk_im_context_focus_in (output->im_context);
 13164           gtk_im_context_set_client_window (output->im_context,
 13165                                             gtk_widget_get_window (widget));
 13166         }
 13167 #endif
 13168 
 13169       EVENT_INIT (ie);
 13170       ie.kind = FOCUS_IN_EVENT;
 13171       ie.device = source->name;
 13172       XSETFRAME (ie.frame_or_window, new);
 13173 
 13174       kbd_buffer_store_event (&ie);
 13175     }
 13176 
 13177   x_new_focus_frame (dpyinfo, new);
 13178 }
 13179 
 13180 static void
 13181 xi_focus_handle_for_device (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 13182                             struct frame *mentioned_frame,
 13183                             XIEvent *base_event)
 13184 {
 13185   struct xi_device_t *device;
 13186   XIEnterEvent *event;
 13187 
 13188   /* XILeaveEvent, XIFocusInEvent, etc are just synonyms for
 13189      XIEnterEvent.  */
 13190   event = (XIEnterEvent *) base_event;
 13191   device = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, event->deviceid);
 13192 
 13193   if (!device)
 13194     return;
 13195 
 13196   switch (event->evtype)
 13197     {
 13198     case XI_FocusIn:
 13199       /* The last-focus-change time of the device changed, so update the
 13200          frame's user time.  */
 13201       x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, event->time,
 13202                                     event->send_event, true);
 13203 
 13204       device->focus_frame = mentioned_frame;
 13205       device->focus_frame_time = event->time;
 13206       break;
 13207 
 13208     case XI_FocusOut:
 13209       /* The last-focus-change time of the device changed, so update the
 13210          frame's user time.  */
 13211       x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, event->time,
 13212                                     event->send_event, false);
 13213 
 13214       device->focus_frame = NULL;
 13215 
 13216       /* So, unfortunately, the X Input Extension is implemented such
 13217          that means XI_Leave events will not have their focus field
 13218          set if the core focus is transferred to another window after
 13219          an entry event that pretends to (or really does) set the
 13220          implicit focus.  In addition, if the core focus is set, but
 13221          the extension focus on the client pointer is not, all
 13222          XI_Enter events will have their focus fields set, despite not
 13223          actually changing the effective focus window.  Combined with
 13224          almost all window managers not setting the focus on input
 13225          extension devices, this means that Emacs will continue to
 13226          think the implicit focus is set on one of its frames if the
 13227          actual (core) focus is transferred to another window while
 13228          the pointer remains inside a frame.  The only workaround in
 13229          this case is to clear the implicit focus along with
 13230          XI_FocusOut events, which is not correct at all, but better
 13231          than leaving frames in an incorrectly-focused state.
 13232          (bug#57468) */
 13233       device->focus_implicit_frame = NULL;
 13234       break;
 13235 
 13236     case XI_Enter:
 13237       if (!event->focus)
 13238         break;
 13239 
 13240       if (device->use == XIMasterPointer)
 13241         device = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, device->attachment);
 13242 
 13243       if (!device)
 13244         break;
 13245 
 13246       device->focus_implicit_frame = mentioned_frame;
 13247       device->focus_implicit_time = event->time;
 13248       break;
 13249 
 13250     case XI_Leave:
 13251       if (!event->focus)
 13252         break;
 13253 
 13254       if (device->use == XIMasterPointer)
 13255         device = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, device->attachment);
 13256 
 13257       if (!device)
 13258         break;
 13259 
 13260       device->focus_implicit_frame = NULL;
 13261       break;
 13262     }
 13263 
 13264   xi_handle_focus_change (dpyinfo);
 13265 }
 13266 
 13267 static void
 13268 xi_handle_delete_frame (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 13269                         struct frame *f)
 13270 {
 13271   struct xi_device_t *device;
 13272   ptrdiff_t i;
 13273 
 13274   for (i = 0; i < dpyinfo->num_devices; ++i)
 13275     {
 13276       device = &dpyinfo->devices[i];
 13277 
 13278       if (device->focus_frame == f)
 13279         device->focus_frame = NULL;
 13280 
 13281       if (device->focus_implicit_frame == f)
 13282         device->focus_implicit_frame = NULL;
 13283     }
 13284 }
 13285 
 13286 /* Handle an interaction by DEVICE on frame F.  TIME is the time of
 13287    the interaction; if F isn't currently the global focus frame, but
 13288    is the focus of DEVICE, make it the focus frame.  */
 13289 
 13290 static void
 13291 xi_handle_interaction (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 13292                        struct frame *f, struct xi_device_t *device,
 13293                        Time time)
 13294 {
 13295   bool change;
 13296 
 13297   /* If DEVICE is a pointer, use its attached keyboard device.  */
 13298   if (device->use == XIMasterPointer)
 13299     device = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, device->attachment);
 13300 
 13301   if (!device)
 13302     return;
 13303 
 13304   change = false;
 13305 
 13306   if (device->focus_frame == f)
 13307     {
 13308       device->focus_frame_time = time;
 13309       change = true;
 13310     }
 13311 
 13312   if (device->focus_implicit_frame == f)
 13313     {
 13314       device->focus_implicit_time = time;
 13315       change = true;
 13316     }
 13317 
 13318   /* If F isn't currently focused, update the focus state.  */
 13319   if (change && f != dpyinfo->x_focus_frame)
 13320     xi_handle_focus_change (dpyinfo);
 13321 }
 13322 
 13323 /* Return whether or not XEV actually represents a change in the
 13324    position of the pointer on DEVICE, with respect to the last event
 13325    received.  This is necessary because the input extension reports
 13326    motion events in very high resolution, while Emacs is only fast
 13327    enough to process motion events aligned to the pixel grid.  */
 13328 
 13329 static bool
 13330 xi_position_changed (struct xi_device_t *device, XIDeviceEvent *xev)
 13331 {
 13332   bool changed;
 13333 
 13334   changed = true;
 13335 
 13336   if (xev->event != device->last_motion_window)
 13337     goto out;
 13338 
 13339   if (lrint (xev->event_x) == device->last_motion_x
 13340       && lrint (xev->event_y) == device->last_motion_y)
 13341     {
 13342       changed = false;
 13343       goto out;
 13344     }
 13345 
 13346  out:
 13347   device->last_motion_x = lrint (xev->event_x);
 13348   device->last_motion_y = lrint (xev->event_y);
 13349   device->last_motion_window = xev->event;
 13350 
 13351   return changed;
 13352 }
 13353 
 13354 static void
 13355 xi_report_motion_window_clear (struct xi_device_t *device)
 13356 {
 13357   device->last_motion_window = None;
 13358 }
 13359 
 13360 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_1
 13361 
 13362 /* Look up a scroll valuator in DEVICE by NUMBER.  */
 13363 
 13364 static struct xi_scroll_valuator_t *
 13365 xi_get_scroll_valuator (struct xi_device_t *device, int number)
 13366 {
 13367   int i;
 13368 
 13369   for (i = 0; i < device->scroll_valuator_count; ++i)
 13370     {
 13371       if (device->valuators[i].number == number)
 13372         return &device->valuators[i];
 13373     }
 13374 
 13375   return NULL;
 13376 }
 13377 
 13378 /* Check if EVENT, a DeviceChanged event, contains any scroll
 13379    valuators.  */
 13380 
 13381 static bool
 13382 xi_has_scroll_valuators (XIDeviceChangedEvent *event)
 13383 {
 13384   int i;
 13385 
 13386   for (i = 0; i < event->num_classes; ++i)
 13387     {
 13388       if (event->classes[i]->type == XIScrollClass)
 13389         return true;
 13390     }
 13391 
 13392   return false;
 13393 }
 13394 
 13395 /* Repopulate the information (touchpoint tracking information, scroll
 13396    valuators, etc) in DEVICE with the device classes provided in
 13397    CLASSES.  This is called upon receiving a DeviceChanged event.
 13398 
 13399    This function is not present on XI 2.0 as there are no worthwhile
 13400    classes there.  */
 13401 
 13402 static void
 13403 xi_handle_new_classes (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, struct xi_device_t *device,
 13404                        XIAnyClassInfo **classes, int num_classes)
 13405 {
 13406   XIScrollClassInfo *scroll;
 13407   struct xi_scroll_valuator_t *valuator;
 13408   XIValuatorClassInfo *valuator_info;
 13409   int i;
 13410 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_2
 13411   XITouchClassInfo *touch;
 13412 #endif
 13413 
 13414   if (dpyinfo->xi2_version < 1)
 13415     /* Emacs is connected to an XI 2.0 server, which reports no
 13416        classes of interest.  */
 13417     return;
 13418 
 13419   device->valuators = xnmalloc (num_classes,
 13420                                 sizeof *device->valuators);
 13421   device->scroll_valuator_count = 0;
 13422 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_2
 13423   device->direct_p = false;
 13424 #endif
 13425 
 13426   for (i = 0; i < num_classes; ++i)
 13427     {
 13428       switch (classes[i]->type)
 13429         {
 13430         case XIScrollClass:
 13431           scroll = (XIScrollClassInfo *) classes[i];
 13432 
 13433           xi_populate_scroll_valuator (device,
 13434                                        device->scroll_valuator_count++,
 13435                                        scroll);
 13436           break;
 13437 
 13438 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_2
 13439         case XITouchClass:
 13440           touch = (XITouchClassInfo *) classes[i];
 13441 
 13442           if (touch->mode == XIDirectTouch)
 13443             device->direct_p = true;
 13444           break;
 13445 #endif
 13446         }
 13447     }
 13448 
 13449   /* Restore the values of any scroll valuators that we already
 13450      know about.  */
 13451 
 13452   for (i = 0; i < num_classes; ++i)
 13453     {
 13454       if (classes[i]->type != XIValuatorClass)
 13455         continue;
 13456 
 13457       valuator_info = (XIValuatorClassInfo *) classes[i];
 13458 
 13459       /* Avoid restoring bogus values if some driver accidentally
 13460          specifies relative values in scroll valuator classes how the
 13461          input extension spec says they should be, but allow restoring
 13462          values when a value is set, which is how the input extension
 13463          actually behaves.  */
 13464 
 13465       if (valuator_info->value == 0.0
 13466           && valuator_info->mode != XIModeAbsolute)
 13467         continue;
 13468 
 13469       valuator = xi_get_scroll_valuator (device,
 13470                                          valuator_info->number);
 13471 
 13472       if (!valuator)
 13473         continue;
 13474 
 13475       valuator->invalid_p = false;
 13476       valuator->current_value = valuator_info->value;
 13477       valuator->emacs_value = 0;
 13478 
 13479       break;
 13480     }
 13481 }
 13482 
 13483 #endif
 13484 
 13485 /* Handle EVENT, a DeviceChanged event.  Look up the device that
 13486    changed, and update its information with the data in EVENT.  */
 13487 
 13488 static void
 13489 xi_handle_device_changed (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 13490                           struct xi_device_t *device,
 13491                           XIDeviceChangedEvent *event)
 13492 {
 13493 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_1
 13494   int ndevices;
 13495   XIDeviceInfo *info;
 13496 #endif
 13497 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_2
 13498   struct xi_touch_point_t *tem, *last;
 13499 #endif
 13500 
 13501 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_1
 13502   if (xi_has_scroll_valuators (event))
 13503     /* Scroll valuators are provided by this event.  Use the values
 13504        provided in this event to populate the device's new scroll
 13505        valuator list: if this event is a SlaveSwitch event caused by
 13506        wheel movement, then querying for the device info will probably
 13507        return the value after the wheel movement, leading to a delta
 13508        of 0 being computed upon handling the subsequent XI_Motion
 13509        event.  (bug#58980) */
 13510     xi_handle_new_classes (dpyinfo, device, event->classes,
 13511                            event->num_classes);
 13512   else
 13513     {
 13514       /* When a DeviceChange event is received for a master device,
 13515          the X server sometimes does not send any scroll valuators
 13516          along with it.  This is possibly an X server bug but I really
 13517          don't want to dig any further, so fetch the scroll valuators
 13518          manually.  (bug#57020) */
 13519 
 13520       x_catch_errors (dpyinfo->display);
 13521       info = XIQueryDevice (dpyinfo->display, event->deviceid,
 13522                             /* ndevices is always 1 if a deviceid is
 13523                                specified.  If the request fails, NULL will
 13524                                be returned.  */
 13525                             &ndevices);
 13526       x_uncatch_errors ();
 13527 
 13528       if (!info)
 13529         return;
 13530 
 13531       /* info contains the classes currently associated with the
 13532          event.  Apply them.  */
 13533       xi_handle_new_classes (dpyinfo, device, info->classes,
 13534                              info->num_classes);
 13535     }
 13536 #endif
 13537 
 13538 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_2
 13539   /* The device is no longer a DirectTouch device, so remove any
 13540      touchpoints that we might have recorded.  */
 13541   if (!device->direct_p)
 13542     {
 13543       tem = device->touchpoints;
 13544 
 13545       while (tem)
 13546         {
 13547           last = tem;
 13548           tem = tem->next;
 13549           xfree (last);
 13550         }
 13551 
 13552       device->touchpoints = NULL;
 13553     }
 13554 #endif
 13555 }
 13556 
 13557 /* Remove the client-side record of every device in TO_DISABLE.
 13558    Called while processing XI_HierarchyChanged events.  We batch up
 13559    multiple disabled devices because it is more efficient to disable
 13560    them at once.  */
 13561 
 13562 static void
 13563 xi_disable_devices (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 13564                     int *to_disable, int n_disabled)
 13565 {
 13566   struct xi_device_t *devices;
 13567   int ndevices, i, j;
 13568 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_2
 13569   struct xi_touch_point_t *tem, *last;
 13570 #endif
 13571 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2_2 && !defined HAVE_EXT_TOOL_BAR
 13572   struct x_output *output;
 13573   Lisp_Object tail, frame;
 13574 #endif
 13575 
 13576   /* Don't pointlessly copy dpyinfo->devices if there are no devices
 13577      to disable.  */
 13578   if (!n_disabled)
 13579     return;
 13580 
 13581   ndevices = 0;
 13582   devices = xzalloc (sizeof *devices * dpyinfo->num_devices);
 13583 
 13584   /* Loop through every device currently in DPYINFO, and copy it to
 13585      DEVICES if it is not in TO_DISABLE.  Note that this function
 13586      should be called with input blocked, since xfree can otherwise
 13587      call GC, which will call mark_xterm with invalid state.  */
 13588   for (i = 0; i < dpyinfo->num_devices; ++i)
 13589     {
 13590       for (j = 0; j < n_disabled; ++j)
 13591         {
 13592           if (to_disable[j] == dpyinfo->devices[i].device_id)
 13593             {
 13594               if (x_dnd_in_progress
 13595                   /* If the drag-and-drop pointer device is being
 13596                      disabled, then cancel the drag and drop
 13597                      operation.  */
 13598                   && to_disable[j] == x_dnd_pointer_device)
 13599                 x_dnd_cancel_dnd_early ();
 13600 
 13601               /* Free any scroll valuators that might be on this
 13602                  device.  */
 13603 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_1
 13604               xfree (dpyinfo->devices[i].valuators);
 13605 #endif
 13606 
 13607               /* Free any currently active touch points on this
 13608                  device.  */
 13609 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_2
 13610               tem = dpyinfo->devices[i].touchpoints;
 13611               while (tem)
 13612                 {
 13613                   last = tem;
 13614                   tem = tem->next;
 13615                   xfree (last);
 13616                 }
 13617 
 13618 #ifndef HAVE_EXT_TOOL_BAR
 13619 
 13620               /* Now look through each frame on DPYINFO.  If it has an
 13621                  outstanding tool bar press for this device, release
 13622                  the tool bar.  */
 13623 
 13624               FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 13625                 {
 13626                   if (!FRAME_X_P (XFRAME (frame))
 13627                       || (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (XFRAME (frame))
 13628                           != dpyinfo))
 13629                     continue;
 13630 
 13631                   output = FRAME_OUTPUT_DATA (XFRAME (frame));
 13632 
 13633                   if (output->tool_bar_touch_device
 13634                       == dpyinfo->devices[i].device_id)
 13635                     {
 13636                       if (XFRAME (frame)->last_tool_bar_item != -1
 13637                           && WINDOWP (XFRAME (frame)->tool_bar_window))
 13638                         handle_tool_bar_click (XFRAME (frame), 0, 0,
 13639                                                false, 0);
 13640 
 13641                       output->tool_bar_touch_device = 0;
 13642                     }
 13643                 }
 13644 #endif
 13645 #endif
 13646 
 13647               goto out;
 13648             }
 13649 
 13650           devices[ndevices++] = dpyinfo->devices[i];
 13651 
 13652         out:
 13653           continue;
 13654         }
 13655     }
 13656 
 13657   /* Free the old devices array and replace it with ndevices.  */
 13658   xfree (dpyinfo->devices);
 13659 
 13660   dpyinfo->devices = devices;
 13661   dpyinfo->num_devices = ndevices;
 13662 }
 13663 
 13664 #endif
 13665 
 13666 /* The focus may have changed.  Figure out if it is a real focus change,
 13667    by checking both FocusIn/Out and Enter/LeaveNotify events.
 13668 
 13669    Returns FOCUS_IN_EVENT event in *BUFP. */
 13670 
 13671 static void
 13672 x_detect_focus_change (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, struct frame *frame,
 13673                        const XEvent *event, struct input_event *bufp)
 13674 {
 13675   if (!frame)
 13676     return;
 13677 
 13678   switch (event->type)
 13679     {
 13680     case EnterNotify:
 13681     case LeaveNotify:
 13682       {
 13683         struct frame *focus_frame = dpyinfo->x_focus_event_frame;
 13684         int focus_state
 13685           = focus_frame ? focus_frame->output_data.x->focus_state : 0;
 13686 
 13687         if (event->xcrossing.detail != NotifyInferior
 13688             && event->xcrossing.focus
 13689             && ! (focus_state & FOCUS_EXPLICIT))
 13690           x_focus_changed ((event->type == EnterNotify ? FocusIn : FocusOut),
 13691                            FOCUS_IMPLICIT,
 13692                            dpyinfo, frame, bufp);
 13693       }
 13694       break;
 13695 
 13696     case FocusIn:
 13697     case FocusOut:
 13698       /* Ignore transient focus events from hotkeys, window manager
 13699          gadgets, and other odd sources.  Some buggy window managers
 13700          (e.g., Muffin 4.2.4) send FocusIn events of this type without
 13701          corresponding FocusOut events even when some other window
 13702          really has focus, and these kinds of focus event don't
 13703          correspond to real user input changes.  GTK+ uses the same
 13704          filtering. */
 13705       if (event->xfocus.mode == NotifyGrab
 13706           || event->xfocus.mode == NotifyUngrab)
 13707         return;
 13708       x_focus_changed (event->type,
 13709                        (event->xfocus.detail == NotifyPointer ?
 13710                         FOCUS_IMPLICIT : FOCUS_EXPLICIT),
 13711                        dpyinfo, frame, bufp);
 13712       break;
 13713 
 13714     case ClientMessage:
 13715       if (event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_XEMBED)
 13716         {
 13717           enum xembed_message msg = event->xclient.data.l[1];
 13718           x_focus_changed ((msg == XEMBED_FOCUS_IN ? FocusIn : FocusOut),
 13719                            FOCUS_EXPLICIT, dpyinfo, frame, bufp);
 13720         }
 13721       break;
 13722     }
 13723 }
 13724 
 13725 
 13726 #if (defined USE_LUCID && defined HAVE_XINPUT2) \
 13727   || (!defined USE_X_TOOLKIT && !defined USE_GTK)
 13728 /* Handle an event saying the mouse has moved out of an Emacs frame.  */
 13729 
 13730 void
 13731 x_mouse_leave (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 13732 {
 13733 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2 && !defined USE_X_TOOLKIT
 13734   struct xi_device_t *device;
 13735 #endif
 13736   Mouse_HLInfo *hlinfo;
 13737 
 13738   hlinfo = &dpyinfo->mouse_highlight;
 13739 
 13740   if (hlinfo->mouse_face_mouse_frame)
 13741     {
 13742       clear_mouse_face (hlinfo);
 13743       hlinfo->mouse_face_mouse_frame = NULL;
 13744     }
 13745 
 13746 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2 && !defined USE_X_TOOLKIT
 13747   if (!dpyinfo->supports_xi2)
 13748     /* The call below is supposed to reset the implicit focus and
 13749        revert the focus back to the last explicitly focused frame.  It
 13750        doesn't work on input extension builds because focus tracking
 13751        does not set x_focus_event_frame, and proceeds on a per-device
 13752        basis.  On such builds, clear the implicit focus of the client
 13753        pointer instead.  */
 13754 #endif
 13755     x_new_focus_frame (dpyinfo, dpyinfo->x_focus_event_frame);
 13756 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2 && !defined USE_X_TOOLKIT
 13757   else
 13758     {
 13759       if (dpyinfo->client_pointer_device == -1)
 13760         /* If there's no client pointer device, then no implicit focus
 13761            is currently set.  */
 13762         return;
 13763 
 13764       device = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, dpyinfo->client_pointer_device);
 13765 
 13766       if (device && device->focus_implicit_frame)
 13767         {
 13768           device->focus_implicit_frame = NULL;
 13769 
 13770           /* The focus might have changed; compute the new focus.  */
 13771           xi_handle_focus_change (dpyinfo);
 13772         }
 13773     }
 13774 #endif
 13775 }
 13776 #endif
 13777 
 13778 /* The focus has changed, or we have redirected a frame's focus to
 13779    another frame (this happens when a frame uses a surrogate
 13780    mini-buffer frame).  Shift the highlight as appropriate.
 13781 
 13782    The FRAME argument doesn't necessarily have anything to do with which
 13783    frame is being highlighted or un-highlighted; we only use it to find
 13784    the appropriate X display info.  */
 13785 
 13786 static void
 13787 XTframe_rehighlight (struct frame *frame)
 13788 {
 13789   x_frame_rehighlight (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (frame));
 13790 }
 13791 
 13792 static void
 13793 x_frame_rehighlight (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 13794 {
 13795   struct frame *old_highlight = dpyinfo->highlight_frame;
 13796 
 13797   if (dpyinfo->x_focus_frame)
 13798     {
 13799       dpyinfo->highlight_frame
 13800         = ((FRAMEP (FRAME_FOCUS_FRAME (dpyinfo->x_focus_frame)))
 13801            ? XFRAME (FRAME_FOCUS_FRAME (dpyinfo->x_focus_frame))
 13802            : dpyinfo->x_focus_frame);
 13803       if (! FRAME_LIVE_P (dpyinfo->highlight_frame))
 13804         {
 13805           fset_focus_frame (dpyinfo->x_focus_frame, Qnil);
 13806           dpyinfo->highlight_frame = dpyinfo->x_focus_frame;
 13807         }
 13808     }
 13809   else
 13810     dpyinfo->highlight_frame = 0;
 13811 
 13812   if (dpyinfo->highlight_frame != old_highlight)
 13813     {
 13814       if (old_highlight)
 13815         x_frame_unhighlight (old_highlight);
 13816       if (dpyinfo->highlight_frame)
 13817         x_frame_highlight (dpyinfo->highlight_frame);
 13818     }
 13819 }
 13820 
 13821 
 13822 
 13823 /* Keyboard processing - modifier keys, vendor-specific keysyms, etc.  */
 13824 
 13825 /* Initialize mode_switch_bit and modifier_meaning.  */
 13826 static void
 13827 x_find_modifier_meanings (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 13828 {
 13829   int min_code, max_code;
 13830   KeySym *syms;
 13831   int syms_per_code;
 13832   XModifierKeymap *mods;
 13833 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 13834   int i;
 13835   int found_meta_p = false;
 13836   unsigned int vmodmask;
 13837 #endif
 13838 
 13839   dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask = 0;
 13840   dpyinfo->shift_lock_mask = 0;
 13841   dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask = 0;
 13842   dpyinfo->super_mod_mask = 0;
 13843   dpyinfo->hyper_mod_mask = 0;
 13844 
 13845 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 13846   if (dpyinfo->xkb_desc
 13847       && dpyinfo->xkb_desc->server)
 13848     {
 13849       for (i = 0; i < XkbNumVirtualMods; i++)
 13850         {
 13851           vmodmask = dpyinfo->xkb_desc->server->vmods[i];
 13852 
 13853           if (dpyinfo->xkb_desc->names->vmods[i] == dpyinfo->Xatom_Meta)
 13854             {
 13855               dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask |= vmodmask;
 13856 
 13857               if (vmodmask)
 13858                 found_meta_p = true;
 13859             }
 13860           else if (dpyinfo->xkb_desc->names->vmods[i] == dpyinfo->Xatom_Alt)
 13861             dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask |= vmodmask;
 13862           else if (dpyinfo->xkb_desc->names->vmods[i] == dpyinfo->Xatom_Super)
 13863             dpyinfo->super_mod_mask |= vmodmask;
 13864           else if (dpyinfo->xkb_desc->names->vmods[i] == dpyinfo->Xatom_Hyper)
 13865             dpyinfo->hyper_mod_mask |= vmodmask;
 13866           else if (dpyinfo->xkb_desc->names->vmods[i] == dpyinfo->Xatom_ShiftLock)
 13867             dpyinfo->shift_lock_mask |= vmodmask;
 13868         }
 13869 
 13870       if (!found_meta_p)
 13871         {
 13872           dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask = dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask;
 13873           dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask = 0;
 13874         }
 13875 
 13876       if (dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask & dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask)
 13877         dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask &= ~dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask;
 13878 
 13879       if (dpyinfo->hyper_mod_mask & dpyinfo->super_mod_mask)
 13880         dpyinfo->hyper_mod_mask &= ~dpyinfo->super_mod_mask;
 13881 
 13882       return;
 13883     }
 13884 #endif
 13885 
 13886   XDisplayKeycodes (dpyinfo->display, &min_code, &max_code);
 13887 
 13888   syms = XGetKeyboardMapping (dpyinfo->display,
 13889                               min_code, max_code - min_code + 1,
 13890                               &syms_per_code);
 13891 
 13892   if (!syms)
 13893     {
 13894       dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask = Mod1Mask;
 13895       dpyinfo->super_mod_mask = Mod2Mask;
 13896       return;
 13897     }
 13898 
 13899   mods = XGetModifierMapping (dpyinfo->display);
 13900 
 13901   /* Scan the modifier table to see which modifier bits the Meta and
 13902      Alt keysyms are on.  */
 13903   {
 13904     int row, col;       /* The row and column in the modifier table.  */
 13905     bool found_alt_or_meta;
 13906 
 13907     for (row = 3; row < 8; row++)
 13908       {
 13909         found_alt_or_meta = false;
 13910         for (col = 0; col < mods->max_keypermod; col++)
 13911           {
 13912             KeyCode code = mods->modifiermap[(row * mods->max_keypermod) + col];
 13913 
 13914             /* Zeroes are used for filler.  Skip them.  */
 13915             if (code == 0)
 13916               continue;
 13917 
 13918             /* Are any of this keycode's keysyms a meta key?  */
 13919             {
 13920               int code_col;
 13921 
 13922               for (code_col = 0; code_col < syms_per_code; code_col++)
 13923                 {
 13924                   int sym = syms[((code - min_code) * syms_per_code) + code_col];
 13925 
 13926                   switch (sym)
 13927                     {
 13928                     case XK_Meta_L:
 13929                     case XK_Meta_R:
 13930                       found_alt_or_meta = true;
 13931                       dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask |= (1 << row);
 13932                       break;
 13933 
 13934                     case XK_Alt_L:
 13935                     case XK_Alt_R:
 13936                       found_alt_or_meta = true;
 13937                       dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask |= (1 << row);
 13938                       break;
 13939 
 13940                     case XK_Hyper_L:
 13941                     case XK_Hyper_R:
 13942                       if (!found_alt_or_meta)
 13943                         dpyinfo->hyper_mod_mask |= (1 << row);
 13944                       code_col = syms_per_code;
 13945                       col = mods->max_keypermod;
 13946                       break;
 13947 
 13948                     case XK_Super_L:
 13949                     case XK_Super_R:
 13950                       if (!found_alt_or_meta)
 13951                         dpyinfo->super_mod_mask |= (1 << row);
 13952                       code_col = syms_per_code;
 13953                       col = mods->max_keypermod;
 13954                       break;
 13955 
 13956                     case XK_Shift_Lock:
 13957                       /* Ignore this if it's not on the lock modifier.  */
 13958                       if (!found_alt_or_meta && ((1 << row) == LockMask))
 13959                         dpyinfo->shift_lock_mask = LockMask;
 13960                       code_col = syms_per_code;
 13961                       col = mods->max_keypermod;
 13962                       break;
 13963                     }
 13964                 }
 13965             }
 13966           }
 13967       }
 13968   }
 13969 
 13970   /* If we couldn't find any meta keys, accept any alt keys as meta keys.  */
 13971   if (! dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask)
 13972     {
 13973       dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask = dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask;
 13974       dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask = 0;
 13975     }
 13976 
 13977   /* If some keys are both alt and meta,
 13978      make them just meta, not alt.  */
 13979   if (dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask & dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask)
 13980     {
 13981       dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask &= ~dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask;
 13982     }
 13983 
 13984   /* If some keys are both super and hyper, make them just super.
 13985      Many X servers are misconfigured so that super and hyper are both
 13986      Mod4, but most users have no hyper key.  */
 13987   if (dpyinfo->hyper_mod_mask & dpyinfo->super_mod_mask)
 13988     dpyinfo->hyper_mod_mask &= ~dpyinfo->super_mod_mask;
 13989 
 13990   XFree (syms);
 13991 
 13992   if (dpyinfo->modmap)
 13993     XFreeModifiermap (dpyinfo->modmap);
 13994   dpyinfo->modmap = mods;
 13995 }
 13996 
 13997 /* Convert between the modifier bits X uses and the modifier bits
 13998    Emacs uses.  */
 13999 
 14000 int
 14001 x_x_to_emacs_modifiers (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, int state)
 14002 {
 14003   int mod_ctrl = ctrl_modifier;
 14004   int mod_meta = meta_modifier;
 14005   int mod_alt  = alt_modifier;
 14006   int mod_hyper = hyper_modifier;
 14007   int mod_super = super_modifier;
 14008   Lisp_Object tem;
 14009 
 14010   tem = Fget (Vx_ctrl_keysym, Qmodifier_value);
 14011   if (FIXNUMP (tem)) mod_ctrl = XFIXNUM (tem) & INT_MAX;
 14012   tem = Fget (Vx_alt_keysym, Qmodifier_value);
 14013   if (FIXNUMP (tem)) mod_alt = XFIXNUM (tem) & INT_MAX;
 14014   tem = Fget (Vx_meta_keysym, Qmodifier_value);
 14015   if (FIXNUMP (tem)) mod_meta = XFIXNUM (tem) & INT_MAX;
 14016   tem = Fget (Vx_hyper_keysym, Qmodifier_value);
 14017   if (FIXNUMP (tem)) mod_hyper = XFIXNUM (tem) & INT_MAX;
 14018   tem = Fget (Vx_super_keysym, Qmodifier_value);
 14019   if (FIXNUMP (tem)) mod_super = XFIXNUM (tem) & INT_MAX;
 14020 
 14021   return (  ((state & (ShiftMask | dpyinfo->shift_lock_mask)) ? shift_modifier : 0)
 14022             | ((state & ControlMask)                    ? mod_ctrl      : 0)
 14023             | ((state & dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask)         ? mod_meta      : 0)
 14024             | ((state & dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask)          ? mod_alt       : 0)
 14025             | ((state & dpyinfo->super_mod_mask)        ? mod_super     : 0)
 14026             | ((state & dpyinfo->hyper_mod_mask)        ? mod_hyper     : 0));
 14027 }
 14028 
 14029 int
 14030 x_emacs_to_x_modifiers (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, intmax_t state)
 14031 {
 14032   EMACS_INT mod_ctrl = ctrl_modifier;
 14033   EMACS_INT mod_meta = meta_modifier;
 14034   EMACS_INT mod_alt  = alt_modifier;
 14035   EMACS_INT mod_hyper = hyper_modifier;
 14036   EMACS_INT mod_super = super_modifier;
 14037 
 14038   Lisp_Object tem;
 14039 
 14040   tem = Fget (Vx_ctrl_keysym, Qmodifier_value);
 14041   if (FIXNUMP (tem)) mod_ctrl = XFIXNUM (tem);
 14042   tem = Fget (Vx_alt_keysym, Qmodifier_value);
 14043   if (FIXNUMP (tem)) mod_alt = XFIXNUM (tem);
 14044   tem = Fget (Vx_meta_keysym, Qmodifier_value);
 14045   if (FIXNUMP (tem)) mod_meta = XFIXNUM (tem);
 14046   tem = Fget (Vx_hyper_keysym, Qmodifier_value);
 14047   if (FIXNUMP (tem)) mod_hyper = XFIXNUM (tem);
 14048   tem = Fget (Vx_super_keysym, Qmodifier_value);
 14049   if (FIXNUMP (tem)) mod_super = XFIXNUM (tem);
 14050 
 14051 
 14052   return (  ((state & mod_alt)          ? dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask   : 0)
 14053             | ((state & mod_super)      ? dpyinfo->super_mod_mask : 0)
 14054             | ((state & mod_hyper)      ? dpyinfo->hyper_mod_mask : 0)
 14055             | ((state & shift_modifier) ? ShiftMask        : 0)
 14056             | ((state & mod_ctrl)       ? ControlMask      : 0)
 14057             | ((state & mod_meta)       ? dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask  : 0));
 14058 }
 14059 
 14060 /* Convert a keysym to its name.  */
 14061 
 14062 char *
 14063 get_keysym_name (int keysym)
 14064 {
 14065   char *value;
 14066 
 14067   block_input ();
 14068   value = XKeysymToString (keysym);
 14069   unblock_input ();
 14070 
 14071   return value;
 14072 }
 14073 
 14074 /* Given the root and event coordinates of an X event destined for F's
 14075    edit window, compute the offset between that window and F's root
 14076    window.  This information is then used as an optimization to avoid
 14077    synchronizing when converting coordinates from some other event to
 14078    F's edit window.  */
 14079 
 14080 static void
 14081 x_compute_root_window_offset (struct frame *f, int root_x, int root_y,
 14082                               int event_x, int event_y)
 14083 {
 14084   FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->window_offset_certain_p = true;
 14085   FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->root_x = root_x - event_x;
 14086   FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->root_y = root_y - event_y;
 14087 }
 14088 
 14089 /* Translate the given coordinates from the root window to the edit
 14090    window of FRAME, taking into account any cached root window
 14091    offsets.  This allows Emacs to avoid excessive calls to _XReply in
 14092    many cases while handling events, which would otherwise result in
 14093    slowdowns over slow network connections.  */
 14094 
 14095 void
 14096 x_translate_coordinates (struct frame *f, int root_x, int root_y,
 14097                          int *x_out, int *y_out)
 14098 {
 14099   struct x_output *output;
 14100   Window dummy;
 14101 
 14102   output = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f);
 14103 
 14104   if (output->window_offset_certain_p)
 14105     {
 14106       /* Use the cached root window offset.  */
 14107       *x_out = root_x - output->root_x;
 14108       *y_out = root_y - output->root_y;
 14109 
 14110       return;
 14111     }
 14112 
 14113   /* Otherwise, do the transformation manually.  Then, cache the root
 14114      window position.  */
 14115   if (!XTranslateCoordinates (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 14116                               FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window,
 14117                               FRAME_X_WINDOW (f), root_x, root_y,
 14118                               x_out, y_out, &dummy))
 14119     /* Use some dummy values.  This is not supposed to be called with
 14120        coordinates out of the screen.  */
 14121     *x_out = 0, *y_out = 0;
 14122   else
 14123     {
 14124       /* Cache the root window offset of the edit window.  */
 14125       output->window_offset_certain_p = true;
 14126       output->root_x = root_x - *x_out;
 14127       output->root_y = root_y - *y_out;
 14128     }
 14129 }
 14130 
 14131 /* Translate the given coordinates from the edit window of FRAME,
 14132    taking into account any cached root window offsets.  This is mainly
 14133    used from the popup menu code.  */
 14134 
 14135 void
 14136 x_translate_coordinates_to_root (struct frame *f, int x, int y,
 14137                                  int *x_out, int *y_out)
 14138 {
 14139   struct x_output *output;
 14140   Window dummy;
 14141 
 14142   output = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f);
 14143 
 14144   if (output->window_offset_certain_p)
 14145     {
 14146       /* Use the cached root window offset.  */
 14147       *x_out = x + output->root_x;
 14148       *y_out = y + output->root_y;
 14149 
 14150       return;
 14151     }
 14152 
 14153   /* Otherwise, do the transform manually and compute and cache the
 14154      root window position.  */
 14155   if (!XTranslateCoordinates (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 14156                               FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window,
 14157                               x, y, x_out, y_out, &dummy))
 14158     *x_out = 0, *y_out = 0;
 14159   else
 14160     {
 14161       /* Cache the root window offset of the edit window.  */
 14162       output->window_offset_certain_p = true;
 14163       output->root_x = *x_out - x;
 14164       output->root_y = *y_out - y;
 14165     }
 14166 }
 14167 
 14168 /* Do x-translate-coordinates, but try to avoid a roundtrip to the X
 14169    server at the cost of not returning `child', which most callers
 14170    have no reason to use.  */
 14171 
 14172 Lisp_Object
 14173 x_handle_translate_coordinates (struct frame *f, Lisp_Object dest_window,
 14174                                 int source_x, int source_y)
 14175 {
 14176   if (NILP (dest_window))
 14177     {
 14178       /* We are translating coordinates from a frame to the root
 14179          window.  Avoid a roundtrip if possible by using cached
 14180          coordinates.  */
 14181 
 14182       if (!FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->window_offset_certain_p)
 14183         return Qnil;
 14184 
 14185       return list3 (make_fixnum (source_x + FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->root_x),
 14186                     make_fixnum (source_y + FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->root_y),
 14187                     Qnil);
 14188     }
 14189 
 14190   return Qnil;
 14191 }
 14192 
 14193 /* The same, but for an XIDeviceEvent.  */
 14194 
 14195 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 14196 
 14197 static void
 14198 xi_compute_root_window_offset (struct frame *f, XIDeviceEvent *xev)
 14199 {
 14200   /* Truncate coordinates instead of rounding them, because that is
 14201      how the X server handles window hierarchy.  */
 14202   x_compute_root_window_offset (f, xev->root_x, xev->root_y,
 14203                                 xev->event_x, xev->event_y);
 14204 }
 14205 
 14206 static void
 14207 xi_compute_root_window_offset_enter (struct frame *f, XIEnterEvent *enter)
 14208 {
 14209   x_compute_root_window_offset (f, enter->root_x, enter->root_y,
 14210                                 enter->event_x, enter->event_y);
 14211 }
 14212 
 14213 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_4
 14214 
 14215 static void
 14216 xi_compute_root_window_offset_pinch (struct frame *f, XIGesturePinchEvent *pev)
 14217 {
 14218   /* Truncate coordinates instead of rounding them, because that is
 14219      how the X server handles window hierarchy.  */
 14220   x_compute_root_window_offset (f, pev->root_x, pev->root_y,
 14221                                 pev->event_x, pev->event_y);
 14222 }
 14223 
 14224 #endif
 14225 
 14226 #endif
 14227 
 14228 static Bool
 14229 x_query_pointer_1 (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 14230                    int client_pointer_device, Window w,
 14231                    Window *root_return, Window *child_return,
 14232                    int *root_x_return, int *root_y_return,
 14233                    int *win_x_return, int *win_y_return,
 14234                    unsigned int *mask_return)
 14235 {
 14236   Bool rc;
 14237   Display *dpy;
 14238 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 14239   bool had_errors;
 14240   XIModifierState modifiers;
 14241   XIButtonState buttons;
 14242   XIGroupState group; /* Unused.  */
 14243   double root_x, root_y, win_x, win_y;
 14244   unsigned int state;
 14245 #endif
 14246 
 14247   dpy = dpyinfo->display;
 14248 
 14249 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 14250   if (client_pointer_device != -1)
 14251     {
 14252       /* Catch errors caused by the device going away.  This is not
 14253          very expensive, since XIQueryPointer will sync anyway.  */
 14254       x_catch_errors (dpy);
 14255       rc = XIQueryPointer (dpyinfo->display,
 14256                            dpyinfo->client_pointer_device,
 14257                            w, root_return, child_return,
 14258                            &root_x, &root_y, &win_x, &win_y,
 14259                            &buttons, &modifiers, &group);
 14260       had_errors = x_had_errors_p (dpy);
 14261       x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
 14262 
 14263       if (had_errors)
 14264         {
 14265           /* If the specified client pointer is the display's client
 14266              pointer, clear it now.  A new client pointer might not be
 14267              found before the next call to x_query_pointer_1 and
 14268              waiting for the error leads to excessive syncing.  */
 14269 
 14270           if (client_pointer_device == dpyinfo->client_pointer_device)
 14271             dpyinfo->client_pointer_device = -1;
 14272 
 14273           rc = XQueryPointer (dpyinfo->display, w, root_return,
 14274                               child_return, root_x_return,
 14275                               root_y_return, win_x_return,
 14276                               win_y_return, mask_return);
 14277         }
 14278       else
 14279         {
 14280           state = 0;
 14281 
 14282           xi_convert_button_state (&buttons, &state);
 14283           *mask_return = state | modifiers.effective;
 14284 
 14285           XFree (buttons.mask);
 14286 
 14287           *root_x_return = lrint (root_x);
 14288           *root_y_return = lrint (root_y);
 14289           *win_x_return = lrint (win_x);
 14290           *win_y_return = lrint (win_y);
 14291         }
 14292     }
 14293   else
 14294 #endif
 14295     rc = XQueryPointer (dpy, w, root_return, child_return,
 14296                         root_x_return, root_y_return, win_x_return,
 14297                         win_y_return, mask_return);
 14298 
 14299   return rc;
 14300 }
 14301 
 14302 Bool
 14303 x_query_pointer (Display *dpy, Window w, Window *root_return,
 14304                  Window *child_return, int *root_x_return,
 14305                  int *root_y_return, int *win_x_return,
 14306                  int *win_y_return, unsigned int *mask_return)
 14307 {
 14308   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 14309 
 14310   dpyinfo = x_display_info_for_display (dpy);
 14311 
 14312   if (!dpyinfo)
 14313     emacs_abort ();
 14314 
 14315 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 14316   return x_query_pointer_1 (dpyinfo, dpyinfo->client_pointer_device,
 14317                             w, root_return, child_return, root_x_return,
 14318                             root_y_return, win_x_return, win_y_return,
 14319                             mask_return);
 14320 #else
 14321   return x_query_pointer_1 (dpyinfo, -1, w, root_return, child_return,
 14322                             root_x_return, root_y_return, win_x_return,
 14323                             win_y_return, mask_return);
 14324 #endif
 14325 }
 14326 
 14327 /* Mouse clicks and mouse movement.  Rah.
 14328 
 14329    Formerly, we used PointerMotionHintMask (in standard_event_mask)
 14330    so that we would have to call XQueryPointer after each MotionNotify
 14331    event to ask for another such event.  However, this made mouse tracking
 14332    slow, and there was a bug that made it eventually stop.
 14333 
 14334    Simply asking for MotionNotify all the time seems to work better.
 14335 
 14336    In order to avoid asking for motion events and then throwing most
 14337    of them away or busy-polling the server for mouse positions, we ask
 14338    the server for pointer motion hints.  This means that we get only
 14339    one event per group of mouse movements.  "Groups" are delimited by
 14340    other kinds of events (focus changes and button clicks, for
 14341    example), or by XQueryPointer calls; when one of these happens, we
 14342    get another MotionNotify event the next time the mouse moves.  This
 14343    is at least as efficient as getting motion events when mouse
 14344    tracking is on, and I suspect only negligibly worse when tracking
 14345    is off.  */
 14346 
 14347 /* Prepare a mouse-event in *RESULT for placement in the input queue.
 14348 
 14349    If the event is a button press, then note that we have grabbed
 14350    the mouse.
 14351 
 14352    The XButtonEvent structure passed as EVENT might not come from the
 14353    X server, and instead be artificially constructed from input
 14354    extension events.  In these special events, the only fields that
 14355    are initialized are `time', `button', `state', `type', `window' and
 14356    `x', `y', `x_root' and `y_root'.  This function should not access
 14357    any other fields in EVENT without also initializing the
 14358    corresponding fields in `bv' under the XI_ButtonPress and
 14359    XI_ButtonRelease labels inside `handle_one_xevent'.  */
 14360 
 14361 static Lisp_Object
 14362 x_construct_mouse_click (struct input_event *result,
 14363                          const XButtonEvent *event,
 14364                          struct frame *f)
 14365 {
 14366   int x = event->x;
 14367   int y = event->y;
 14368 
 14369   /* Make the event type NO_EVENT; we'll change that when we decide
 14370      otherwise.  */
 14371   result->kind = MOUSE_CLICK_EVENT;
 14372   result->code = event->button - Button1;
 14373   result->timestamp = event->time;
 14374   result->modifiers = (x_x_to_emacs_modifiers (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
 14375                                                event->state)
 14376                        | (event->type == ButtonRelease
 14377                           ? up_modifier
 14378                           : down_modifier));
 14379 
 14380   /* If result->window is not the frame's edit widget (which can
 14381      happen with GTK+ scroll bars, for example), translate the
 14382      coordinates so they appear at the correct position.  */
 14383   if (event->window != FRAME_X_WINDOW (f))
 14384     x_translate_coordinates (f, event->x_root, event->y_root,
 14385                              &x, &y);
 14386 
 14387   XSETINT (result->x, x);
 14388   XSETINT (result->y, y);
 14389   XSETFRAME (result->frame_or_window, f);
 14390   result->arg = Qnil;
 14391   return Qnil;
 14392 }
 14393 
 14394 /* Function to report a mouse movement to the mainstream Emacs code.
 14395    The input handler calls this.
 14396 
 14397    We have received a mouse movement event, which is given in *event.
 14398    If the mouse is over a different glyph than it was last time, tell
 14399    the mainstream emacs code by setting mouse_moved.  If not, ask for
 14400    another motion event, so we can check again the next time it moves.
 14401 
 14402    The XMotionEvent structure passed as EVENT might not come from the
 14403    X server, and instead be artificially constructed from input
 14404    extension events.  In these special events, the only fields that
 14405    are initialized are `time', `window', `send_event', `x' and `y'.
 14406    This function should not access any other fields in EVENT without
 14407    also initializing the corresponding fields in `ev' under the
 14408    XI_Motion, XI_Enter and XI_Leave labels inside
 14409    `handle_one_xevent'.  */
 14410 
 14411 static bool
 14412 x_note_mouse_movement (struct frame *frame, const XMotionEvent *event,
 14413                        Lisp_Object device)
 14414 {
 14415   XRectangle *r;
 14416   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 14417 
 14418   if (!FRAME_X_OUTPUT (frame))
 14419     return false;
 14420 
 14421   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (frame);
 14422   dpyinfo->last_mouse_movement_time = event->time;
 14423   dpyinfo->last_mouse_movement_time_send_event = event->send_event;
 14424   dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame = frame;
 14425   dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_x = event->x;
 14426   dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_y = event->y;
 14427 
 14428   if (event->window != FRAME_X_WINDOW (frame))
 14429     {
 14430       frame->mouse_moved = true;
 14431       frame->last_mouse_device = device;
 14432       dpyinfo->last_mouse_scroll_bar = NULL;
 14433       note_mouse_highlight (frame, -1, -1);
 14434       dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame = NULL;
 14435       return true;
 14436     }
 14437 
 14438 
 14439   /* Has the mouse moved off the glyph it was on at the last sighting?  */
 14440   r = &dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph;
 14441   if (frame != dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame
 14442       || event->x < r->x || event->x >= r->x + r->width
 14443       || event->y < r->y || event->y >= r->y + r->height)
 14444     {
 14445       frame->mouse_moved = true;
 14446       frame->last_mouse_device = device;
 14447       dpyinfo->last_mouse_scroll_bar = NULL;
 14448       note_mouse_highlight (frame, event->x, event->y);
 14449       /* Remember which glyph we're now on.  */
 14450       remember_mouse_glyph (frame, event->x, event->y, r);
 14451       dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame = frame;
 14452       return true;
 14453     }
 14454 
 14455   return false;
 14456 }
 14457 
 14458 /* Get a sibling below WINDOW on DPY at PARENT_X and PARENT_Y.  */
 14459 static Window
 14460 x_get_window_below (Display *dpy, Window window,
 14461                     int parent_x, int parent_y,
 14462                     int *inner_x, int *inner_y)
 14463 {
 14464   int rc, i, cx, cy;
 14465   XWindowAttributes attrs;
 14466   unsigned int nchildren;
 14467   Window root, parent, *children, value;
 14468   bool window_seen;
 14469 
 14470   /* TODO: rewrite to have less dependencies.  */
 14471 
 14472   children = NULL;
 14473   window_seen = false;
 14474   value = None;
 14475 
 14476   rc = XQueryTree (dpy, window, &root, &parent,
 14477                    &children, &nchildren);
 14478 
 14479   if (rc)
 14480     {
 14481       if (children)
 14482         XFree (children);
 14483 
 14484       rc = XQueryTree (dpy, parent, &root,
 14485                        &parent, &children, &nchildren);
 14486     }
 14487 
 14488   if (rc)
 14489     {
 14490       for (i = nchildren - 1; i >= 0; --i)
 14491         {
 14492           if (children[i] == window)
 14493             {
 14494               window_seen = true;
 14495               continue;
 14496             }
 14497 
 14498           if (!window_seen)
 14499             continue;
 14500 
 14501           rc = XGetWindowAttributes (dpy, children[i], &attrs);
 14502 
 14503           if (rc && attrs.map_state != IsViewable)
 14504             continue;
 14505 
 14506           if (rc && parent_x >= attrs.x
 14507               && parent_y >= attrs.y
 14508               && parent_x < attrs.x + attrs.width
 14509               && parent_y < attrs.y + attrs.height)
 14510             {
 14511               value = children[i];
 14512               cx = parent_x - attrs.x;
 14513               cy = parent_y - attrs.y;
 14514 
 14515               break;
 14516             }
 14517         }
 14518     }
 14519 
 14520   if (children)
 14521     XFree (children);
 14522 
 14523   if (value)
 14524     {
 14525       *inner_x = cx;
 14526       *inner_y = cy;
 14527     }
 14528 
 14529   return value;
 14530 }
 14531 
 14532 /* Like XTmouse_position, but much faster.  */
 14533 
 14534 static void
 14535 x_fast_mouse_position (struct frame **fp, int insist, Lisp_Object *bar_window,
 14536                        enum scroll_bar_part *part, Lisp_Object *x, Lisp_Object *y,
 14537                        Time *timestamp)
 14538 {
 14539   int root_x, root_y, win_x, win_y;
 14540   unsigned int mask;
 14541   Window dummy;
 14542   struct scroll_bar *bar;
 14543   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 14544   Lisp_Object tail, frame;
 14545   struct frame *f1;
 14546 
 14547   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (*fp);
 14548 
 14549   if (dpyinfo->last_mouse_scroll_bar && !insist)
 14550     {
 14551       bar = dpyinfo->last_mouse_scroll_bar;
 14552 
 14553       if (bar->horizontal)
 14554         x_horizontal_scroll_bar_report_motion (fp, bar_window, part,
 14555                                                x, y, timestamp);
 14556       else
 14557         x_scroll_bar_report_motion (fp, bar_window, part,
 14558                                     x, y, timestamp);
 14559 
 14560       return;
 14561     }
 14562 
 14563   if (!EQ (Vx_use_fast_mouse_position, Qreally_fast))
 14564     {
 14565       /* This means that Emacs should select a frame and report the
 14566          mouse position relative to it.  The approach used here avoids
 14567          making multiple roundtrips to the X server querying for the
 14568          window beneath the pointer, and was borrowed from
 14569          haiku_mouse_position in haikuterm.c.  */
 14570 
 14571       FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 14572         {
 14573           if (FRAME_X_P (XFRAME (frame))
 14574               && (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (XFRAME (frame))
 14575                   == dpyinfo))
 14576             XFRAME (frame)->mouse_moved = false;
 14577         }
 14578 
 14579       if (gui_mouse_grabbed (dpyinfo)
 14580           && !EQ (track_mouse, Qdropping)
 14581           && !EQ (track_mouse, Qdrag_source))
 14582         /* Pick the last mouse frame if dropping.  */
 14583         f1 = dpyinfo->last_mouse_frame;
 14584       else
 14585         /* Otherwise, pick the last mouse motion frame.  */
 14586         f1 = dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame;
 14587 
 14588       if (!f1 && (FRAME_X_P (SELECTED_FRAME ())
 14589                   && (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (SELECTED_FRAME ())
 14590                       == dpyinfo)))
 14591         f1 = SELECTED_FRAME ();
 14592 
 14593       if (!f1 || (!FRAME_X_P (f1) && (insist > 0)))
 14594         FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 14595           if (FRAME_X_P (XFRAME (frame))
 14596               && (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (XFRAME (frame))
 14597                   == dpyinfo)
 14598               && !FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (XFRAME (frame)))
 14599             f1 = XFRAME (frame);
 14600 
 14601       if (f1 && FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (f1))
 14602         f1 = NULL;
 14603 
 14604       if (f1 && FRAME_X_P (f1) && FRAME_X_WINDOW (f1))
 14605         {
 14606           if (!x_query_pointer (dpyinfo->display, FRAME_X_WINDOW (f1),
 14607                                 &dummy, &dummy, &root_x, &root_y,
 14608                                 &win_x, &win_y, &mask))
 14609             /* The pointer is out of the screen.  */
 14610             return;
 14611 
 14612           remember_mouse_glyph (f1, win_x, win_y,
 14613                                 &dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph);
 14614           dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame = f1;
 14615 
 14616           *bar_window = Qnil;
 14617           *part = scroll_bar_nowhere;
 14618 
 14619           /* If track-mouse is `drag-source' and the mouse pointer is
 14620              certain to not be actually under the chosen frame, return
 14621              NULL in FP.  */
 14622           if (EQ (track_mouse, Qdrag_source)
 14623               && (win_x < 0 || win_y < 0
 14624                   || win_x >= FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f1)
 14625                   || win_y >= FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f1)))
 14626             *fp = NULL;
 14627           else
 14628             *fp = f1;
 14629 
 14630           *timestamp = dpyinfo->last_mouse_movement_time;
 14631           XSETINT (*x, win_x);
 14632           XSETINT (*y, win_y);
 14633         }
 14634     }
 14635   else
 14636     {
 14637       /* This means Emacs should only report the coordinates of the
 14638          last mouse motion.  */
 14639 
 14640       if (dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame)
 14641         {
 14642           *fp = dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame;
 14643           *timestamp = dpyinfo->last_mouse_movement_time;
 14644           *x = make_fixnum (dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_x);
 14645           *y = make_fixnum (dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_y);
 14646           *bar_window = Qnil;
 14647           *part = scroll_bar_nowhere;
 14648 
 14649           FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 14650             {
 14651               if (FRAME_X_P (XFRAME (frame))
 14652                   && (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (XFRAME (frame))
 14653                       == dpyinfo))
 14654                 XFRAME (frame)->mouse_moved = false;
 14655             }
 14656 
 14657           dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame->mouse_moved = false;
 14658         }
 14659     }
 14660 }
 14661 
 14662 /* Return the current position of the mouse.
 14663    *FP should be a frame which indicates which display to ask about.
 14664 
 14665    If the mouse movement started in a scroll bar, set *FP, *BAR_WINDOW,
 14666    and *PART to the frame, window, and scroll bar part that the mouse
 14667    is over.  Set *X and *Y to the portion and whole of the mouse's
 14668    position on the scroll bar.
 14669 
 14670    If the mouse movement started elsewhere, set *FP to the frame the
 14671    mouse is on, *BAR_WINDOW to nil, and *X and *Y to the character cell
 14672    the mouse is over.
 14673 
 14674    Set *TIMESTAMP to the server time-stamp for the time at which the mouse
 14675    was at this position.
 14676 
 14677    Don't store anything if we don't have a valid set of values to report.
 14678
