 14679    This clears the mouse_moved flag, so we can wait for the next mouse
 14680    movement.  */
 14681 
 14682 static void
 14683 XTmouse_position (struct frame **fp, int insist, Lisp_Object *bar_window,
 14684                   enum scroll_bar_part *part, Lisp_Object *x, Lisp_Object *y,
 14685                   Time *timestamp)
 14686 {
 14687   struct frame *f1, *maybe_tooltip;
 14688   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 14689   bool unrelated_tooltip;
 14690 
 14691   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (*fp);
 14692 
 14693   if (!NILP (Vx_use_fast_mouse_position))
 14694     {
 14695       /* The user says that Emacs is running over the network, and a
 14696          fast approximation of `mouse-position' should be used.
 14697 
 14698          Depending on what the value of `x-use-fast-mouse-position'
 14699          is, do one of two things: only perform the XQueryPointer to
 14700          obtain the coordinates from the last mouse frame, or only
 14701          return the last mouse motion frame and the
 14702          last_mouse_motion_x and Y.  */
 14703 
 14704       x_fast_mouse_position (fp, insist, bar_window, part, x,
 14705                              y, timestamp);
 14706       return;
 14707     }
 14708 
 14709   block_input ();
 14710 
 14711   if (dpyinfo->last_mouse_scroll_bar && insist == 0)
 14712     {
 14713       struct scroll_bar *bar = dpyinfo->last_mouse_scroll_bar;
 14714 
 14715       if (bar->horizontal)
 14716         x_horizontal_scroll_bar_report_motion (fp, bar_window, part, x, y, timestamp);
 14717       else
 14718         x_scroll_bar_report_motion (fp, bar_window, part, x, y, timestamp);
 14719     }
 14720   else
 14721     {
 14722       Window root;
 14723       int root_x, root_y;
 14724 
 14725       Window dummy_window;
 14726       int dummy;
 14727 
 14728       Lisp_Object frame, tail;
 14729 
 14730       /* Clear the mouse-moved flag for every frame on this display.  */
 14731       FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 14732         if (FRAME_X_P (XFRAME (frame))
 14733             && FRAME_X_DISPLAY (XFRAME (frame)) == FRAME_X_DISPLAY (*fp))
 14734           XFRAME (frame)->mouse_moved = false;
 14735 
 14736       dpyinfo->last_mouse_scroll_bar = NULL;
 14737 
 14738       /* Figure out which root window we're on.  */
 14739       x_query_pointer (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (*fp),
 14740                        DefaultRootWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (*fp)),
 14741                        /* The root window which contains the pointer.  */
 14742                        &root,
 14743                        /* Trash which we can't trust if the pointer is on
 14744                           a different screen.  */
 14745                        &dummy_window,
 14746                        /* The position on that root window.  */
 14747                        &root_x, &root_y,
 14748                        /* More trash we can't trust.  */
 14749                        &dummy, &dummy,
 14750                        /* Modifier keys and pointer buttons, about which
 14751                           we don't care.  */
 14752                        (unsigned int *) &dummy);
 14753 
 14754       /* Now we have a position on the root; find the innermost window
 14755          containing the pointer.  */
 14756       {
 14757         Window win, child;
 14758 #ifdef USE_GTK
 14759         Window first_win = 0;
 14760 #endif
 14761         int win_x, win_y;
 14762         int parent_x, parent_y;
 14763 
 14764         win = root;
 14765         parent_x = root_x;
 14766         parent_y = root_y;
 14767 
 14768         /* XTranslateCoordinates can get errors if the window
 14769            structure is changing at the same time this function
 14770            is running.  So at least we must not crash from them.  */
 14771 
 14772         x_catch_errors (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (*fp));
 14773 
 14774         if (gui_mouse_grabbed (dpyinfo) && !EQ (track_mouse, Qdropping)
 14775             && !EQ (track_mouse, Qdrag_source))
 14776           {
 14777             /* If mouse was grabbed on a frame, give coords for that frame
 14778                even if the mouse is now outside it.  */
 14779             XTranslateCoordinates (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (*fp),
 14780                                    /* From-window.  */
 14781                                    root,
 14782                                    /* To-window.  */
 14783                                    FRAME_X_WINDOW (dpyinfo->last_mouse_frame),
 14784                                    /* From-position, to-position.  */
 14785                                    root_x, root_y, &win_x, &win_y,
 14786                                    /* Child of win.  */
 14787                                    &child);
 14788             f1 = dpyinfo->last_mouse_frame;
 14789           }
 14790         else
 14791           {
 14792             while (true)
 14793               {
 14794                 XTranslateCoordinates (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (*fp),
 14795                                        /* From-window, to-window.  */
 14796                                        root, win,
 14797                                        /* From-position, to-position.  */
 14798                                        root_x, root_y, &win_x, &win_y,
 14799                                        /* Child of win.  */
 14800                                        &child);
 14801 
 14802                 /* If CHILD is a tooltip frame, look below it if
 14803                    track-mouse is drag-source.  */
 14804                 if (child != None
 14805                     && (EQ (track_mouse, Qdrag_source)
 14806                         || EQ (track_mouse, Qdropping)))
 14807                   {
 14808                     maybe_tooltip = x_tooltip_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, child,
 14809                                                                &unrelated_tooltip);
 14810 
 14811                     if (maybe_tooltip || unrelated_tooltip)
 14812                       child = x_get_window_below (dpyinfo->display, child,
 14813                                                   parent_x, parent_y, &win_x,
 14814                                                   &win_y);
 14815                   }
 14816 
 14817                 if (child == None || child == win)
 14818                   {
 14819 #ifdef USE_GTK
 14820                     /* On GTK we have not inspected WIN yet.  If it has
 14821                        a frame and that frame has a parent, use it.  */
 14822                     struct frame *f = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, win);
 14823 
 14824                     if (f && FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))
 14825                       first_win = win;
 14826 #endif
 14827                     break;
 14828                   }
 14829 #ifdef USE_GTK
 14830                 /* We don't want to know the innermost window.  We
 14831                    want the edit window.  For non-Gtk+ the innermost
 14832                    window is the edit window.  For Gtk+ it might not
 14833                    be.  It might be the tool bar for example.  */
 14834                 if (x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, win))
 14835                   /* But don't hurry.  We might find a child frame
 14836                      beneath.  */
 14837                   first_win = win;
 14838 #endif
 14839                 win = child;
 14840                 parent_x = win_x;
 14841                 parent_y = win_y;
 14842               }
 14843 
 14844 #ifdef USE_GTK
 14845             if (first_win)
 14846               win = first_win;
 14847 #endif
 14848 
 14849             /* Now we know that:
 14850                win is the innermost window containing the pointer
 14851                (XTC says it has no child containing the pointer),
 14852                win_x and win_y are the pointer's position in it
 14853                (XTC did this the last time through), and
 14854                parent_x and parent_y are the pointer's position in win's parent.
 14855                (They are what win_x and win_y were when win was child.
 14856                If win is the root window, it has no parent, and
 14857                parent_{x,y} are invalid, but that's okay, because we'll
 14858                never use them in that case.)  */
 14859 
 14860 #ifdef USE_GTK
 14861             /* We don't want to know the innermost window.  We
 14862                want the edit window.  */
 14863             f1 = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, win);
 14864 #else
 14865             /* Is win one of our frames?  */
 14866             f1 = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, win);
 14867 #endif
 14868 
 14869 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 14870             /* If we end up with the menu bar window, say it's not
 14871                on the frame.  */
 14872             if (f1 != NULL
 14873                 && f1->output_data.x->menubar_widget
 14874                 && win == XtWindow (f1->output_data.x->menubar_widget))
 14875               f1 = NULL;
 14876 #endif /* USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 14877           }
 14878 
 14879         /* Set last user time to avoid confusing some window managers
 14880            about the tooltip displayed during drag-and-drop.  */
 14881 
 14882         if ((EQ (track_mouse, Qdrag_source)
 14883              || EQ (track_mouse, Qdropping))
 14884             && (dpyinfo->last_user_time
 14885                 < dpyinfo->last_mouse_movement_time))
 14886           x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo,
 14887                                         dpyinfo->last_mouse_movement_time,
 14888                                         dpyinfo->last_mouse_movement_time_send_event,
 14889                                         true);
 14890 
 14891         if ((!f1 || FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (f1))
 14892             && (EQ (track_mouse, Qdropping)
 14893                 || EQ (track_mouse, Qdrag_source))
 14894             && gui_mouse_grabbed (dpyinfo))
 14895           {
 14896             /* When dropping then if we didn't get a frame or only a
 14897                tooltip frame and the mouse was grabbed on a frame,
 14898                give coords for that frame even if the mouse is now
 14899                outside it.  */
 14900             XTranslateCoordinates (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (*fp),
 14901                                    /* From-window.  */
 14902                                    root,
 14903                                    /* To-window.  */
 14904                                    FRAME_X_WINDOW (dpyinfo->last_mouse_frame),
 14905                                    /* From-position, to-position.  */
 14906                                    root_x, root_y, &win_x, &win_y,
 14907                                    /* Child of win.  */
 14908                                    &child);
 14909 
 14910             if (!EQ (track_mouse, Qdrag_source)
 14911                 /* Don't let tooltips interfere.  */
 14912                 || (f1 && FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (f1)))
 14913               f1 = dpyinfo->last_mouse_frame;
 14914             else
 14915               {
 14916                 /* Don't set FP but do set WIN_X and WIN_Y in this
 14917                    case, so make_lispy_movement knows which
 14918                    coordinates to report.  */
 14919                 *bar_window = Qnil;
 14920                 *part = 0;
 14921                 *fp = NULL;
 14922                 XSETINT (*x, win_x);
 14923                 XSETINT (*y, win_y);
 14924                 *timestamp = dpyinfo->last_mouse_movement_time;
 14925               }
 14926           }
 14927         else if (f1 && FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (f1))
 14928           f1 = NULL;
 14929 
 14930         if (x_had_errors_p (dpyinfo->display))
 14931           f1 = NULL;
 14932 
 14933         x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
 14934 
 14935         /* If not, is it one of our scroll bars?  */
 14936         if (!f1)
 14937           {
 14938             struct scroll_bar *bar;
 14939 
 14940             bar = x_window_to_scroll_bar (dpyinfo->display, win, 2);
 14941 
 14942             if (bar)
 14943               {
 14944                 f1 = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (XWINDOW (bar->window)));
 14945                 win_x = parent_x;
 14946                 win_y = parent_y;
 14947               }
 14948           }
 14949 
 14950         if (!f1 && insist > 0)
 14951           f1 = SELECTED_FRAME ();
 14952 
 14953         if (f1 && FRAME_X_P (f1))
 14954           {
 14955             /* Ok, we found a frame.  Store all the values.
 14956                last_mouse_glyph is a rectangle used to reduce the
 14957                generation of mouse events.  To not miss any motion
 14958                events, we must divide the frame into rectangles of the
 14959                size of the smallest character that could be displayed
 14960                on it, i.e. into the same rectangles that matrices on
 14961                the frame are divided into.  */
 14962 
 14963             dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f1);
 14964             remember_mouse_glyph (f1, win_x, win_y, &dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph);
 14965             dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame = f1;
 14966 
 14967             *bar_window = Qnil;
 14968             *part = 0;
 14969             *fp = f1;
 14970             XSETINT (*x, win_x);
 14971             XSETINT (*y, win_y);
 14972             *timestamp = dpyinfo->last_mouse_movement_time;
 14973           }
 14974       }
 14975     }
 14976 
 14977   unblock_input ();
 14978 }
 14979 
 14980 
 14981 
 14982 /***********************************************************************
 14983                                Scroll bars
 14984  ***********************************************************************/
 14985 
 14986 /* Scroll bar support.  */
 14987 
 14988 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2
 14989 
 14990 /* Select for input extension events used by scroll bars.  This will
 14991    result in the corresponding core events not being generated for
 14992    SCROLL_BAR.  */
 14993 
 14994 MAYBE_UNUSED static void
 14995 xi_select_scroll_bar_events (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 14996                              Window scroll_bar)
 14997 {
 14998   XIEventMask mask;
 14999   unsigned char *m;
 15000   ptrdiff_t length;
 15001 
 15002   length = XIMaskLen (XI_LASTEVENT);
 15003   mask.mask = m = alloca (length);
 15004   memset (m, 0, length);
 15005   mask.mask_len = length;
 15006 
 15007   mask.deviceid = XIAllMasterDevices;
 15008   XISetMask (m, XI_ButtonPress);
 15009   XISetMask (m, XI_ButtonRelease);
 15010   XISetMask (m, XI_Motion);
 15011   XISetMask (m, XI_Enter);
 15012   XISetMask (m, XI_Leave);
 15013 
 15014   XISelectEvents (dpyinfo->display, scroll_bar, &mask, 1);
 15015 }
 15016 
 15017 #endif
 15018 
 15019 /* Given an X window ID and a DISPLAY, find the struct scroll_bar which
 15020    manages it.
 15021    This can be called in GC, so we have to make sure to strip off mark
 15022    bits.  */
 15023 
 15024 static struct scroll_bar *
 15025 x_window_to_scroll_bar (Display *display, Window window_id, int type)
 15026 {
 15027   Lisp_Object tail, frame;
 15028 
 15029 #if defined (USE_GTK) && !defined (HAVE_GTK3) && defined (USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS)
 15030   window_id = (Window) xg_get_scroll_id_for_window (display, window_id);
 15031 #endif /* USE_GTK && !HAVE_GTK3  && USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 15032 
 15033   FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 15034     {
 15035       Lisp_Object bar, condemned;
 15036 
 15037       if (! FRAME_X_P (XFRAME (frame)))
 15038         continue;
 15039 
 15040       /* Scan this frame's scroll bar list for a scroll bar with the
 15041          right window ID.  */
 15042       condemned = FRAME_CONDEMNED_SCROLL_BARS (XFRAME (frame));
 15043       for (bar = FRAME_SCROLL_BARS (XFRAME (frame));
 15044            /* This trick allows us to search both the ordinary and
 15045               condemned scroll bar lists with one loop.  */
 15046            ! NILP (bar) || (bar = condemned,
 15047                                condemned = Qnil,
 15048                                ! NILP (bar));
 15049            bar = XSCROLL_BAR (bar)->next)
 15050         if (XSCROLL_BAR (bar)->x_window == window_id
 15051             && FRAME_X_DISPLAY (XFRAME (frame)) == display
 15052             && (type == 2
 15053                 || (type == 1 && XSCROLL_BAR (bar)->horizontal)
 15054                 || (type == 0 && !XSCROLL_BAR (bar)->horizontal)))
 15055           return XSCROLL_BAR (bar);
 15056     }
 15057 
 15058   return NULL;
 15059 }
 15060 
 15061 
 15062 #if defined USE_LUCID
 15063 
 15064 /* Return the Lucid menu bar WINDOW is part of.  Return null
 15065    if WINDOW is not part of a menu bar.  */
 15066 
 15067 static Widget
 15068 x_window_to_menu_bar (Window window)
 15069 {
 15070   Lisp_Object tail, frame;
 15071 
 15072   FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 15073     if (FRAME_X_P (XFRAME (frame)))
 15074       {
 15075         Widget menu_bar = XFRAME (frame)->output_data.x->menubar_widget;
 15076 
 15077         if (menu_bar && xlwmenu_window_p (menu_bar, window))
 15078           return menu_bar;
 15079       }
 15080   return NULL;
 15081 }
 15082 
 15083 #endif /* USE_LUCID */
 15084 
 15085 
 15086 /************************************************************************
 15087                          Toolkit scroll bars
 15088  ************************************************************************/
 15089 
 15090 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 15091 
 15092 static void x_send_scroll_bar_event (Lisp_Object, enum scroll_bar_part,
 15093                                      int, int, bool);
 15094 
 15095 /* Lisp window being scrolled.  Set when starting to interact with
 15096    a toolkit scroll bar, reset to nil when ending the interaction.  */
 15097 
 15098 static Lisp_Object window_being_scrolled;
 15099 
 15100 static Time
 15101 x_get_last_toolkit_time (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 15102 {
 15103 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 15104   return XtLastTimestampProcessed (dpyinfo->display);
 15105 #else
 15106   return dpyinfo->last_user_time;
 15107 #endif
 15108 }
 15109 
 15110 #ifndef USE_GTK
 15111 /* Id of action hook installed for scroll bars and horizontal scroll
 15112    bars.  */
 15113 
 15114 static XtActionHookId action_hook_id;
 15115 static XtActionHookId horizontal_action_hook_id;
 15116 
 15117 /* Whether this is an Xaw with arrow-scrollbars.  This should imply
 15118    that movements of 1/20 of the screen size are mapped to up/down.  */
 15119 
 15120 static Boolean xaw3d_arrow_scroll;
 15121 
 15122 /* Whether the drag scrolling maintains the mouse at the top of the
 15123    thumb.  If not, resizing the thumb needs to be done more carefully
 15124    to avoid jerkiness.  */
 15125 
 15126 static Boolean xaw3d_pick_top;
 15127 
 15128 /* Action hook installed via XtAppAddActionHook when toolkit scroll
 15129    bars are used..  The hook is responsible for detecting when
 15130    the user ends an interaction with the scroll bar, and generates
 15131    a `end-scroll' SCROLL_BAR_CLICK_EVENT' event if so.  */
 15132 
 15133 static void
 15134 xt_action_hook (Widget widget, XtPointer client_data, String action_name,
 15135                 XEvent *event, String *params, Cardinal *num_params)
 15136 {
 15137   bool scroll_bar_p;
 15138   const char *end_action;
 15139 
 15140 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 15141   scroll_bar_p = XmIsScrollBar (widget);
 15142   end_action = "Release";
 15143 #else /* !USE_MOTIF i.e. use Xaw */
 15144   scroll_bar_p = XtIsSubclass (widget, scrollbarWidgetClass);
 15145   end_action = "EndScroll";
 15146 #endif /* USE_MOTIF */
 15147 
 15148   if (scroll_bar_p
 15149       && strcmp (action_name, end_action) == 0
 15150       && WINDOWP (window_being_scrolled))
 15151     {
 15152       struct window *w;
 15153       struct scroll_bar *bar;
 15154 
 15155       x_send_scroll_bar_event (window_being_scrolled,
 15156                                scroll_bar_end_scroll, 0, 0, false);
 15157       w = XWINDOW (window_being_scrolled);
 15158       bar = XSCROLL_BAR (w->vertical_scroll_bar);
 15159 
 15160       if (bar->dragging != -1)
 15161         {
 15162           bar->dragging = -1;
 15163           /* The thumb size is incorrect while dragging: fix it.  */
 15164           set_vertical_scroll_bar (w);
 15165         }
 15166       window_being_scrolled = Qnil;
 15167 #if defined (USE_LUCID)
 15168       bar->last_seen_part = scroll_bar_nowhere;
 15169 #endif
 15170       /* Xt timeouts no longer needed.  */
 15171       toolkit_scroll_bar_interaction = false;
 15172     }
 15173 }
 15174 
 15175 
 15176 static void
 15177 xt_horizontal_action_hook (Widget widget, XtPointer client_data, String action_name,
 15178                            XEvent *event, String *params, Cardinal *num_params)
 15179 {
 15180   bool scroll_bar_p;
 15181   const char *end_action;
 15182 
 15183 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 15184   scroll_bar_p = XmIsScrollBar (widget);
 15185   end_action = "Release";
 15186 #else /* !USE_MOTIF i.e. use Xaw */
 15187   scroll_bar_p = XtIsSubclass (widget, scrollbarWidgetClass);
 15188   end_action = "EndScroll";
 15189 #endif /* USE_MOTIF */
 15190 
 15191   if (scroll_bar_p
 15192       && strcmp (action_name, end_action) == 0
 15193       && WINDOWP (window_being_scrolled))
 15194     {
 15195       struct window *w;
 15196       struct scroll_bar *bar;
 15197 
 15198       x_send_scroll_bar_event (window_being_scrolled,
 15199                                scroll_bar_end_scroll, 0, 0, true);
 15200       w = XWINDOW (window_being_scrolled);
 15201       if (!NILP (w->horizontal_scroll_bar))
 15202         {
 15203           bar = XSCROLL_BAR (w->horizontal_scroll_bar);
 15204           if (bar->dragging != -1)
 15205             {
 15206               bar->dragging = -1;
 15207               /* The thumb size is incorrect while dragging: fix it.  */
 15208               set_horizontal_scroll_bar (w);
 15209             }
 15210           window_being_scrolled = Qnil;
 15211 #if defined (USE_LUCID)
 15212           bar->last_seen_part = scroll_bar_nowhere;
 15213 #endif
 15214           /* Xt timeouts no longer needed.  */
 15215           toolkit_scroll_bar_interaction = false;
 15216         }
 15217     }
 15218 }
 15219 #endif /* not USE_GTK */
 15220 
 15221 /* Protect WINDOW from garbage collection until a matching scroll bar
 15222    message is received.  Return whether or not protection
 15223    succeeded.  */
 15224 static bool
 15225 x_protect_window_for_callback (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 15226                                Lisp_Object window)
 15227 {
 15228   if (dpyinfo->n_protected_windows + 1
 15229       >= dpyinfo->protected_windows_max)
 15230     return false;
 15231 
 15232   dpyinfo->protected_windows[dpyinfo->n_protected_windows++]
 15233     = window;
 15234   return true;
 15235 }
 15236 
 15237 static Lisp_Object
 15238 x_unprotect_window_for_callback (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 15239 {
 15240   Lisp_Object window;
 15241 
 15242   if (!dpyinfo->n_protected_windows)
 15243     return Qnil;
 15244 
 15245   window = dpyinfo->protected_windows[0];
 15246 
 15247   dpyinfo->n_protected_windows--;
 15248 
 15249   if (dpyinfo->n_protected_windows)
 15250     memmove (dpyinfo->protected_windows, &dpyinfo->protected_windows[1],
 15251              sizeof (Lisp_Object) * dpyinfo->n_protected_windows);
 15252 
 15253   return window;
 15254 }
 15255 
 15256 /* Send a client message with message type Xatom_Scrollbar for a
 15257    scroll action to the frame of WINDOW.  PART is a value identifying
 15258    the part of the scroll bar that was clicked on.  PORTION is the
 15259    amount to scroll of a whole of WHOLE.  */
 15260 
 15261 static void
 15262 x_send_scroll_bar_event (Lisp_Object window, enum scroll_bar_part part,
 15263                          int portion, int whole, bool horizontal)
 15264 {
 15265   XEvent event;
 15266   XClientMessageEvent *ev = &event.xclient;
 15267   struct window *w = XWINDOW (window);
 15268   struct frame *f = XFRAME (w->frame);
 15269   verify (INTPTR_WIDTH <= 64);
 15270 
 15271   /* Don't do anything if too many scroll bar events have been
 15272      sent but not received.  */
 15273   if (!x_protect_window_for_callback (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f), window))
 15274     return;
 15275 
 15276   block_input ();
 15277   /* Construct a ClientMessage event to send to the frame.  */
 15278   ev->type = ClientMessage;
 15279   ev->message_type = (horizontal
 15280                       ? FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_Horizontal_Scrollbar
 15281                       : FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_Scrollbar);
 15282   ev->display = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
 15283   ev->window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
 15284   ev->format = 32;
 15285 
 15286   /* These messages formerly contained a pointer to the window, but
 15287      now that information is kept internally.  The following two
 15288      fields are thus zero.  */
 15289   ev->data.l[0] = 0;
 15290   ev->data.l[1] = 0;
 15291   ev->data.l[2] = part;
 15292   ev->data.l[3] = portion;
 15293   ev->data.l[4] = whole;
 15294 
 15295   /* Make Xt timeouts work while the scroll bar is active.  */
 15296 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 15297   toolkit_scroll_bar_interaction = true;
 15298   x_activate_timeout_atimer ();
 15299 #endif
 15300 
 15301   /* Setting the event mask to zero means that the message will
 15302      be sent to the client that created the window, and if that
 15303      window no longer exists, no event will be sent.  */
 15304   XSendEvent (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f), False,
 15305               NoEventMask, &event);
 15306   unblock_input ();
 15307 }
 15308 
 15309 
 15310 /* Transform a scroll bar ClientMessage EVENT to an Emacs input event
 15311    in *IEVENT.  */
 15312 
 15313 static void
 15314 x_scroll_bar_to_input_event (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 15315                              const XEvent *event,
 15316                              struct input_event *ievent)
 15317 {
 15318   Lisp_Object window;
 15319 
 15320   /* Every time a scroll bar ClientMessage event is sent, the window
 15321      is pushed onto a queue that is traced for garbage collection.
 15322      Every time we need a window for a read scroll bar event, we
 15323      simply read from the other side of the queue.  */
 15324   window = x_unprotect_window_for_callback (dpyinfo);
 15325 
 15326   if (NILP (window))
 15327     {
 15328       /* This means we are getting extra scroll bar events for some
 15329          reason, and shouldn't be possible in practice.  */
 15330       EVENT_INIT (*ievent);
 15331       return;
 15332     }
 15333 
 15334   ievent->kind = SCROLL_BAR_CLICK_EVENT;
 15335   ievent->frame_or_window = window;
 15336   ievent->arg = Qnil;
 15337   ievent->timestamp = x_get_last_toolkit_time (dpyinfo);
 15338   ievent->code = 0;
 15339   ievent->part = event->xclient.data.l[2];
 15340   ievent->x = make_fixnum (event->xclient.data.l[3]);
 15341   ievent->y = make_fixnum (event->xclient.data.l[4]);
 15342   ievent->modifiers = 0;
 15343 }
 15344 
 15345 /* Transform a horizontal scroll bar ClientMessage EVENT to an Emacs
 15346    input event in *IEVENT.  */
 15347 
 15348 static void
 15349 x_horizontal_scroll_bar_to_input_event (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 15350                                         const XEvent *event,
 15351                                         struct input_event *ievent)
 15352 {
 15353   Lisp_Object window;
 15354 
 15355   /* Every time a scroll bar ClientMessage event is sent, the window
 15356      is pushed onto a queue that is traced for garbage collection.
 15357      Every time we need a window for a read scroll bar event, we
 15358      simply read from the other side of the queue.  */
 15359   window = x_unprotect_window_for_callback (dpyinfo);
 15360 
 15361   if (NILP (window))
 15362     {
 15363       /* This means we are getting extra scroll bar events for some
 15364          reason, and shouldn't be possible in practice.  */
 15365       EVENT_INIT (*ievent);
 15366       return;
 15367     }
 15368 
 15369   ievent->kind = HORIZONTAL_SCROLL_BAR_CLICK_EVENT;
 15370   ievent->frame_or_window = window;
 15371   ievent->arg = Qnil;
 15372   ievent->timestamp = x_get_last_toolkit_time (dpyinfo);
 15373   ievent->code = 0;
 15374   ievent->part = event->xclient.data.l[2];
 15375   ievent->x = make_fixnum (event->xclient.data.l[3]);
 15376   ievent->y = make_fixnum (event->xclient.data.l[4]);
 15377   ievent->modifiers = 0;
 15378 }
 15379 
 15380 
 15381 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 15382 
 15383 /* Minimum and maximum values used for Motif scroll bars.  */
 15384 
 15385 #define XM_SB_MAX 10000000
 15386 
 15387 /* Scroll bar callback for Motif scroll bars.  WIDGET is the scroll
 15388    bar widget.  CLIENT_DATA is a pointer to the scroll_bar structure.
 15389    CALL_DATA is a pointer to a XmScrollBarCallbackStruct.  */
 15390 
 15391 static void
 15392 xm_scroll_callback (Widget widget, XtPointer client_data, XtPointer call_data)
 15393 {
 15394   struct scroll_bar *bar = client_data;
 15395   XmScrollBarCallbackStruct *cs = call_data;
 15396   enum scroll_bar_part part = scroll_bar_nowhere;
 15397   bool horizontal = bar->horizontal;
 15398   int whole = 0, portion = 0;
 15399 
 15400   switch (cs->reason)
 15401     {
 15402     case XmCR_DECREMENT:
 15403       bar->dragging = -1;
 15404       part = horizontal ? scroll_bar_left_arrow : scroll_bar_up_arrow;
 15405       break;
 15406 
 15407     case XmCR_INCREMENT:
 15408       bar->dragging = -1;
 15409       part = horizontal ? scroll_bar_right_arrow : scroll_bar_down_arrow;
 15410       break;
 15411 
 15412     case XmCR_PAGE_DECREMENT:
 15413       bar->dragging = -1;
 15414       part = horizontal ? scroll_bar_before_handle : scroll_bar_above_handle;
 15415       break;
 15416 
 15417     case XmCR_PAGE_INCREMENT:
 15418       bar->dragging = -1;
 15419       part = horizontal ? scroll_bar_after_handle : scroll_bar_below_handle;
 15420       break;
 15421 
 15422     case XmCR_TO_TOP:
 15423       bar->dragging = -1;
 15424       part = horizontal ? scroll_bar_to_leftmost : scroll_bar_to_top;
 15425       break;
 15426 
 15427     case XmCR_TO_BOTTOM:
 15428       bar->dragging = -1;
 15429       part = horizontal ? scroll_bar_to_rightmost : scroll_bar_to_bottom;
 15430       break;
 15431 
 15432     case XmCR_DRAG:
 15433       {
 15434         int slider_size;
 15435 
 15436         block_input ();
 15437         XtVaGetValues (widget, XmNsliderSize, &slider_size, NULL);
 15438         unblock_input ();
 15439 
 15440         if (horizontal)
 15441           {
 15442             portion = bar->whole * ((float)cs->value / XM_SB_MAX);
 15443             whole = bar->whole * ((float)(XM_SB_MAX - slider_size) / XM_SB_MAX);
 15444             portion = min (portion, whole);
 15445             part = scroll_bar_horizontal_handle;
 15446           }
 15447         else
 15448           {
 15449             whole = XM_SB_MAX - slider_size;
 15450             portion = min (cs->value, whole);
 15451             part = scroll_bar_handle;
 15452           }
 15453 
 15454         bar->dragging = cs->value;
 15455       }
 15456       break;
 15457 
 15458     case XmCR_VALUE_CHANGED:
 15459       break;
 15460     };
 15461 
 15462   if (part != scroll_bar_nowhere)
 15463     {
 15464       window_being_scrolled = bar->window;
 15465       x_send_scroll_bar_event (bar->window, part, portion, whole,
 15466                                bar->horizontal);
 15467     }
 15468 }
 15469 
 15470 #elif defined USE_GTK
 15471 
 15472 /* Scroll bar callback for GTK scroll bars.  WIDGET is the scroll
 15473    bar widget.  DATA is a pointer to the scroll_bar structure. */
 15474 
 15475 static gboolean
 15476 xg_scroll_callback (GtkRange *range, GtkScrollType scroll,
 15477                     gdouble value, gpointer user_data)
 15478 {
 15479   int whole, portion;
 15480   struct scroll_bar *bar;
 15481   enum scroll_bar_part part;
 15482   GtkAdjustment *adj;
 15483   struct frame *f;
 15484   guint32 time;
 15485   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 15486 
 15487   if (xg_ignore_gtk_scrollbar) return false;
 15488 
 15489   whole = 0;
 15490   portion = 0;
 15491   bar = user_data;
 15492   part = scroll_bar_nowhere;
 15493   adj = GTK_ADJUSTMENT (gtk_range_get_adjustment (range));
 15494   f = g_object_get_data (G_OBJECT (range), XG_FRAME_DATA);
 15495   time = gtk_get_current_event_time ();
 15496   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 15497 
 15498   if (time != GDK_CURRENT_TIME)
 15499     x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, time, true,
 15500                                   true);
 15501 
 15502   switch (scroll)
 15503     {
 15504     case GTK_SCROLL_JUMP:
 15505       /* Buttons 1 2 or 3 must be grabbed.  */
 15506       if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->grabbed != 0
 15507           && FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->grabbed < (1 << 4))
 15508         {
 15509           if (bar->horizontal)
 15510             {
 15511               part = scroll_bar_horizontal_handle;
 15512               whole = (int)(gtk_adjustment_get_upper (adj) -
 15513                             gtk_adjustment_get_page_size (adj));
 15514               portion = min ((int)value, whole);
 15515               bar->dragging = portion;
 15516             }
 15517           else
 15518             {
 15519               part = scroll_bar_handle;
 15520               whole = gtk_adjustment_get_upper (adj) -
 15521                 gtk_adjustment_get_page_size (adj);
 15522               portion = min ((int)value, whole);
 15523               bar->dragging = portion;
 15524             }
 15525         }
 15526       break;
 15527     case GTK_SCROLL_STEP_BACKWARD:
 15528       part = (bar->horizontal
 15529               ? scroll_bar_left_arrow : scroll_bar_up_arrow);
 15530       bar->dragging = -1;
 15531       break;
 15532     case GTK_SCROLL_STEP_FORWARD:
 15533       part = (bar->horizontal
 15534               ? scroll_bar_right_arrow : scroll_bar_down_arrow);
 15535       bar->dragging = -1;
 15536       break;
 15537     case GTK_SCROLL_PAGE_BACKWARD:
 15538       part = (bar->horizontal
 15539               ? scroll_bar_before_handle : scroll_bar_above_handle);
 15540       bar->dragging = -1;
 15541       break;
 15542     case GTK_SCROLL_PAGE_FORWARD:
 15543       part = (bar->horizontal
 15544               ? scroll_bar_after_handle : scroll_bar_below_handle);
 15545       bar->dragging = -1;
 15546       break;
 15547     default:
 15548       break;
 15549     }
 15550 
 15551   if (part != scroll_bar_nowhere)
 15552     {
 15553       window_being_scrolled = bar->window;
 15554       x_send_scroll_bar_event (bar->window, part, portion, whole,
 15555                                bar->horizontal);
 15556     }
 15557 
 15558   return false;
 15559 }
 15560 
 15561 /* Callback for button release. Sets dragging to -1 when dragging is done.  */
 15562 
 15563 static gboolean
 15564 xg_end_scroll_callback (GtkWidget *widget,
 15565                         GdkEventButton *event,
 15566                         gpointer user_data)
 15567 {
 15568   struct scroll_bar *bar;
 15569 
 15570   bar = user_data;
 15571   bar->dragging = -1;
 15572 
 15573   if (WINDOWP (window_being_scrolled))
 15574     {
 15575       x_send_scroll_bar_event (window_being_scrolled,
 15576                                scroll_bar_end_scroll, 0, 0, bar->horizontal);
 15577       window_being_scrolled = Qnil;
 15578     }
 15579 
 15580   return false;
 15581 }
 15582 
 15583 
 15584 #else /* not USE_GTK and not USE_MOTIF */
 15585 
 15586 /* Xaw scroll bar callback.  Invoked when the thumb is dragged.
 15587    WIDGET is the scroll bar widget.  CLIENT_DATA is a pointer to the
 15588    scroll bar struct.  CALL_DATA is a pointer to a float saying where
 15589    the thumb is.  */
 15590 
 15591 static void
 15592 xaw_jump_callback (Widget widget, XtPointer client_data, XtPointer call_data)
 15593 {
 15594   struct scroll_bar *bar = client_data;
 15595   float *top_addr = call_data;
 15596   float top = *top_addr;
 15597   float shown;
 15598   int whole, portion, height, width;
 15599   enum scroll_bar_part part;
 15600   bool horizontal = bar->horizontal;
 15601 
 15602   if (horizontal)
 15603     {
 15604       /* Get the size of the thumb, a value between 0 and 1.  */
 15605       block_input ();
 15606       XtVaGetValues (widget, XtNshown, &shown, XtNwidth, &width, NULL);
 15607       unblock_input ();
 15608 
 15609       if (shown < 1)
 15610         {
 15611           whole = bar->whole - (shown * bar->whole);
 15612           portion = min (top * bar->whole, whole);
 15613         }
 15614       else
 15615         {
 15616           whole = bar->whole;
 15617           portion = 0;
 15618         }
 15619 
 15620       part = scroll_bar_horizontal_handle;
 15621     }
 15622   else
 15623     {
 15624       /* Get the size of the thumb, a value between 0 and 1.  */
 15625       block_input ();
 15626       XtVaGetValues (widget, XtNshown, &shown, XtNheight, &height, NULL);
 15627       unblock_input ();
 15628 
 15629       whole = 10000000;
 15630       portion = shown < 1 ? top * whole : 0;
 15631 
 15632       if (shown < 1 && (eabs (top + shown - 1) < 1.0f / height))
 15633         /* Some derivatives of Xaw refuse to shrink the thumb when you reach
 15634            the bottom, so we force the scrolling whenever we see that we're
 15635            too close to the bottom (in x_set_toolkit_scroll_bar_thumb
 15636            we try to ensure that we always stay two pixels away from the
 15637            bottom).  */
 15638         part = scroll_bar_down_arrow;
 15639       else
 15640         part = scroll_bar_handle;
 15641     }
 15642 
 15643   window_being_scrolled = bar->window;
 15644   bar->dragging = portion;
 15645   bar->last_seen_part = part;
 15646   x_send_scroll_bar_event (bar->window, part, portion, whole, bar->horizontal);
 15647 }
 15648 
 15649 
 15650 /* Xaw scroll bar callback.  Invoked for incremental scrolling.,
 15651    i.e. line or page up or down.  WIDGET is the Xaw scroll bar
 15652    widget.  CLIENT_DATA is a pointer to the scroll_bar structure for
 15653    the scroll bar.  CALL_DATA is an integer specifying the action that
 15654    has taken place.  Its magnitude is in the range 0..height of the
 15655    scroll bar.  Negative values mean scroll towards buffer start.
 15656    Values < height of scroll bar mean line-wise movement.  */
 15657 
 15658 static void
 15659 xaw_scroll_callback (Widget widget, XtPointer client_data, XtPointer call_data)
 15660 {
 15661   struct scroll_bar *bar = client_data;
 15662   /* The position really is stored cast to a pointer.  */
 15663   int position = (intptr_t) call_data;
 15664   Dimension height, width;
 15665   enum scroll_bar_part part;
 15666 
 15667   if (bar->horizontal)
 15668     {
 15669       /* Get the width of the scroll bar.  */
 15670       block_input ();
 15671       XtVaGetValues (widget, XtNwidth, &width, NULL);
 15672       unblock_input ();
 15673 
 15674       if (eabs (position) >= width)
 15675         part = (position < 0) ? scroll_bar_before_handle : scroll_bar_after_handle;
 15676 
 15677       /* If Xaw3d was compiled with ARROW_SCROLLBAR,
 15678          it maps line-movement to call_data = max(5, height/20).  */
 15679       else if (xaw3d_arrow_scroll && eabs (position) <= max (5, width / 20))
 15680         part = (position < 0) ? scroll_bar_left_arrow : scroll_bar_right_arrow;
 15681       else
 15682         part = scroll_bar_move_ratio;
 15683 
 15684       window_being_scrolled = bar->window;
 15685       bar->dragging = -1;
 15686       bar->last_seen_part = part;
 15687       x_send_scroll_bar_event (bar->window, part, position, width,
 15688                                bar->horizontal);
 15689     }
 15690   else
 15691     {
 15692 
 15693       /* Get the height of the scroll bar.  */
 15694       block_input ();
 15695       XtVaGetValues (widget, XtNheight, &height, NULL);
 15696       unblock_input ();
 15697 
 15698       if (eabs (position) >= height)
 15699         part = (position < 0) ? scroll_bar_above_handle : scroll_bar_below_handle;
 15700 
 15701       /* If Xaw3d was compiled with ARROW_SCROLLBAR,
 15702          it maps line-movement to call_data = max(5, height/20).  */
 15703       else if (xaw3d_arrow_scroll && eabs (position) <= max (5, height / 20))
 15704         part = (position < 0) ? scroll_bar_up_arrow : scroll_bar_down_arrow;
 15705       else
 15706         part = scroll_bar_move_ratio;
 15707 
 15708       window_being_scrolled = bar->window;
 15709       bar->dragging = -1;
 15710       bar->last_seen_part = part;
 15711       x_send_scroll_bar_event (bar->window, part, position, height,
 15712                                bar->horizontal);
 15713     }
 15714 }
 15715 
 15716 #endif /* not USE_GTK and not USE_MOTIF */
 15717 
 15718 #define SCROLL_BAR_NAME "verticalScrollBar"
 15719 #define SCROLL_BAR_HORIZONTAL_NAME "horizontalScrollBar"
 15720 
 15721 /* Create the widget for scroll bar BAR on frame F.  Record the widget
 15722    and X window of the scroll bar in BAR.  */
 15723 
 15724 #ifdef USE_GTK
 15725 static void
 15726 x_create_toolkit_scroll_bar (struct frame *f, struct scroll_bar *bar)
 15727 {
 15728   const char *scroll_bar_name = SCROLL_BAR_NAME;
 15729 
 15730   block_input ();
 15731   xg_create_scroll_bar (f, bar, G_CALLBACK (xg_scroll_callback),
 15732                         G_CALLBACK (xg_end_scroll_callback),
 15733                         scroll_bar_name);
 15734   unblock_input ();
 15735 }
 15736 
 15737 static void
 15738 x_create_horizontal_toolkit_scroll_bar (struct frame *f, struct scroll_bar *bar)
 15739 {
 15740   const char *scroll_bar_name = SCROLL_BAR_HORIZONTAL_NAME;
 15741 
 15742   block_input ();
 15743   xg_create_horizontal_scroll_bar (f, bar, G_CALLBACK (xg_scroll_callback),
 15744                                    G_CALLBACK (xg_end_scroll_callback),
 15745                                    scroll_bar_name);
 15746   unblock_input ();
 15747 }
 15748 
 15749 #else /* not USE_GTK */
 15750 
 15751 static void
 15752 x_create_toolkit_scroll_bar (struct frame *f, struct scroll_bar *bar)
 15753 {
 15754   Window xwindow;
 15755   Widget widget;
 15756   Arg av[20];
 15757   int ac = 0;
 15758   const char *scroll_bar_name = SCROLL_BAR_NAME;
 15759   unsigned long pixel;
 15760 
 15761   block_input ();
 15762 
 15763 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 15764   /* Set resources.  Create the widget.  */
 15765   XtSetArg (av[ac], XtNmappedWhenManaged, False); ++ac;
 15766   XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNminimum, 0); ++ac;
 15767   XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNmaximum, XM_SB_MAX); ++ac;
 15768   XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNorientation, XmVERTICAL); ++ac;
 15769   XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNprocessingDirection, XmMAX_ON_BOTTOM), ++ac;
 15770   XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNincrement, 1); ++ac;
 15771   XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNpageIncrement, 1); ++ac;
 15772 
 15773   /* Note: "background" is the thumb color, and "trough" is the color behind
 15774      everything. */
 15775   pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_foreground_pixel;
 15776   if (pixel != -1)
 15777     {
 15778       XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNbackground, pixel);
 15779       ++ac;
 15780     }
 15781 
 15782   pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel;
 15783   if (pixel != -1)
 15784     {
 15785       XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNtroughColor, pixel);
 15786       ++ac;
 15787     }
 15788 
 15789   widget = XmCreateScrollBar (f->output_data.x->edit_widget,
 15790                               (char *) scroll_bar_name, av, ac);
 15791 
 15792   /* Add one callback for everything that can happen.  */
 15793   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNdecrementCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 15794                  (XtPointer) bar);
 15795   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNdragCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 15796                  (XtPointer) bar);
 15797   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNincrementCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 15798                  (XtPointer) bar);
 15799   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNpageDecrementCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 15800                  (XtPointer) bar);
 15801   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNpageIncrementCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 15802                  (XtPointer) bar);
 15803   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNtoBottomCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 15804                  (XtPointer) bar);
 15805   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNtoTopCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 15806                  (XtPointer) bar);
 15807 
 15808   /* Realize the widget.  Only after that is the X window created.  */
 15809   XtRealizeWidget (widget);
 15810 
 15811   /* Set the cursor to an arrow.  I didn't find a resource to do that.
 15812      And I'm wondering why it hasn't an arrow cursor by default.  */
 15813   XDefineCursor (XtDisplay (widget), XtWindow (widget),
 15814                  f->output_data.x->nontext_cursor);
 15815 
 15816 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 15817   /* Ask for input extension button and motion events.  This lets us
 15818      send the proper `wheel-up' or `wheel-down' events to Emacs.  */
 15819   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->supports_xi2)
 15820     xi_select_scroll_bar_events (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
 15821                                  XtWindow (widget));
 15822 #endif
 15823 #else /* !USE_MOTIF i.e. use Xaw */
 15824 
 15825   /* Set resources.  Create the widget.  The background of the
 15826      Xaw3d scroll bar widget is a little bit light for my taste.
 15827      We don't alter it here to let users change it according
 15828      to their taste with `emacs*verticalScrollBar.background: xxx'.  */
 15829   XtSetArg (av[ac], XtNmappedWhenManaged, False); ++ac;
 15830   XtSetArg (av[ac], XtNorientation, XtorientVertical); ++ac;
 15831   /* For smoother scrolling with Xaw3d   -sm */
 15832   /* XtSetArg (av[ac], XtNpickTop, True); ++ac; */
 15833 
 15834   pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_foreground_pixel;
 15835   if (pixel != -1)
 15836     {
 15837       XtSetArg (av[ac], XtNforeground, pixel);
 15838       ++ac;
 15839     }
 15840 
 15841   pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel;
 15842   if (pixel != -1)
 15843     {
 15844       XtSetArg (av[ac], XtNbackground, pixel);
 15845       ++ac;
 15846     }
 15847 
 15848   /* Top/bottom shadow colors.  */
 15849 
 15850   /* Allocate them, if necessary.  */
 15851   if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_top_shadow_pixel == -1)
 15852     {
 15853       pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel;
 15854       if (pixel != -1)
 15855         {
 15856           if (!x_alloc_lighter_color (f, FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 15857                                       FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f),
 15858                                       &pixel, 1.2, 0x8000))
 15859             pixel = -1;
 15860           f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_top_shadow_pixel = pixel;
 15861         }
 15862     }
 15863   if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_bottom_shadow_pixel == -1)
 15864     {
 15865       pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel;
 15866       if (pixel != -1)
 15867         {
 15868           if (!x_alloc_lighter_color (f, FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 15869                                       FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f),
 15870                                       &pixel, 0.6, 0x4000))
 15871             pixel = -1;
 15872           f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_bottom_shadow_pixel = pixel;
 15873         }
 15874     }
 15875 
 15876 #ifdef XtNbeNiceToColormap
 15877   /* Tell the toolkit about them.  */
 15878   if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_top_shadow_pixel == -1
 15879       || f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_bottom_shadow_pixel == -1)
 15880     /* We tried to allocate a color for the top/bottom shadow, and
 15881        failed, so tell Xaw3d to use dithering instead.   */
 15882     /* But only if we have a small colormap.  Xaw3d can allocate nice
 15883        colors itself.  */
 15884     {
 15885       XtSetArg (av[ac], (String) XtNbeNiceToColormap,
 15886                 DefaultDepthOfScreen (FRAME_X_SCREEN (f)) < 16);
 15887       ++ac;
 15888     }
 15889   else
 15890     /* Tell what colors Xaw3d should use for the top/bottom shadow, to
 15891        be more consistent with other emacs 3d colors, and since Xaw3d is
 15892        not good at dealing with allocation failure.  */
 15893     {
 15894       /* This tells Xaw3d to use real colors instead of dithering for
 15895          the shadows.  */
 15896       XtSetArg (av[ac], (String) XtNbeNiceToColormap, False);
 15897       ++ac;
 15898 
 15899       /* Specify the colors.  */
 15900       pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_top_shadow_pixel;
 15901       if (pixel != -1)
 15902         {
 15903           XtSetArg (av[ac], (String) XtNtopShadowPixel, pixel);
 15904           ++ac;
 15905         }
 15906       pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_bottom_shadow_pixel;
 15907       if (pixel != -1)
 15908         {
 15909           XtSetArg (av[ac], (String) XtNbottomShadowPixel, pixel);
 15910           ++ac;
 15911         }
 15912     }
 15913 #endif
 15914 
 15915   widget = XtCreateWidget (scroll_bar_name, scrollbarWidgetClass,
 15916                            f->output_data.x->edit_widget, av, ac);
 15917 
 15918   {
 15919     char const *initial = "";
 15920     char const *val = initial;
 15921     XtVaGetValues (widget, XtNscrollVCursor, (XtPointer) &val,
 15922 #ifdef XtNarrowScrollbars
 15923                    XtNarrowScrollbars, (XtPointer) &xaw3d_arrow_scroll,
 15924 #endif
 15925                    XtNpickTop, (XtPointer) &xaw3d_pick_top, NULL);
 15926     if (xaw3d_arrow_scroll || val == initial)
 15927       { /* ARROW_SCROLL */
 15928         xaw3d_arrow_scroll = True;
 15929         /* Isn't that just a personal preference ?   --Stef */
 15930         XtVaSetValues (widget, XtNcursorName, "top_left_arrow", NULL);
 15931       }
 15932   }
 15933 
 15934   /* Define callbacks.  */
 15935   XtAddCallback (widget, XtNjumpProc, xaw_jump_callback, (XtPointer) bar);
 15936   XtAddCallback (widget, XtNscrollProc, xaw_scroll_callback,
 15937                  (XtPointer) bar);
 15938 
 15939   /* Realize the widget.  Only after that is the X window created.  */
 15940   XtRealizeWidget (widget);
 15941 
 15942 #endif /* !USE_MOTIF */
 15943 
 15944   /* Install an action hook that lets us detect when the user
 15945      finishes interacting with a scroll bar.  */
 15946   if (action_hook_id == 0)
 15947     action_hook_id = XtAppAddActionHook (Xt_app_con, xt_action_hook, 0);
 15948 
 15949   /* Remember X window and widget in the scroll bar vector.  */
 15950   SET_SCROLL_BAR_X_WIDGET (bar, widget);
 15951   xwindow = XtWindow (widget);
 15952   bar->x_window = xwindow;
 15953   bar->whole = 1;
 15954   bar->horizontal = false;
 15955 
 15956   unblock_input ();
 15957 }
 15958 
 15959 static void
 15960 x_create_horizontal_toolkit_scroll_bar (struct frame *f, struct scroll_bar *bar)
 15961 {
 15962   Window xwindow;
 15963   Widget widget;
 15964   Arg av[20];
 15965   int ac = 0;
 15966   const char *scroll_bar_name = SCROLL_BAR_HORIZONTAL_NAME;
 15967   unsigned long pixel;
 15968 
 15969   block_input ();
 15970 
 15971 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 15972   /* Set resources.  Create the widget.  */
 15973   XtSetArg (av[ac], XtNmappedWhenManaged, False); ++ac;
 15974   XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNminimum, 0); ++ac;
 15975   XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNmaximum, XM_SB_MAX); ++ac;
 15976   XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNorientation, XmHORIZONTAL); ++ac;
 15977   XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNprocessingDirection, XmMAX_ON_RIGHT), ++ac;
 15978   XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNincrement, 1); ++ac;
 15979   XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNpageIncrement, 1); ++ac;
 15980 
 15981   /* Note: "background" is the thumb color, and "trough" is the color behind
 15982      everything. */
 15983   pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_foreground_pixel;
 15984   if (pixel != -1)
 15985     {
 15986       XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNbackground, pixel);
 15987       ++ac;
 15988     }
 15989 
 15990   pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel;
 15991   if (pixel != -1)
 15992     {
 15993       XtSetArg (av[ac], XmNtroughColor, pixel);
 15994       ++ac;
 15995     }
 15996 
 15997   widget = XmCreateScrollBar (f->output_data.x->edit_widget,
 15998                               (char *) scroll_bar_name, av, ac);
 15999 
 16000   /* Add one callback for everything that can happen.  */
 16001   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNdecrementCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 16002                  (XtPointer) bar);
 16003   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNdragCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 16004                  (XtPointer) bar);
 16005   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNincrementCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 16006                  (XtPointer) bar);
 16007   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNpageDecrementCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 16008                  (XtPointer) bar);
 16009   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNpageIncrementCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 16010                  (XtPointer) bar);
 16011   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNtoBottomCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 16012                  (XtPointer) bar);
 16013   XtAddCallback (widget, XmNtoTopCallback, xm_scroll_callback,
 16014                  (XtPointer) bar);
 16015 
 16016   /* Realize the widget.  Only after that is the X window created.  */
 16017   XtRealizeWidget (widget);
 16018 
 16019   /* Set the cursor to an arrow.  I didn't find a resource to do that.
 16020      And I'm wondering why it hasn't an arrow cursor by default.  */
 16021   XDefineCursor (XtDisplay (widget), XtWindow (widget),
 16022                  f->output_data.x->nontext_cursor);
 16023 
 16024 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 16025   /* Ask for input extension button and motion events.  This lets us
 16026      send the proper `wheel-up' or `wheel-down' events to Emacs.  */
 16027   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->supports_xi2)
 16028     xi_select_scroll_bar_events (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
 16029                                  XtWindow (widget));
 16030 #endif
 16031 #else /* !USE_MOTIF i.e. use Xaw */
 16032 
 16033   /* Set resources.  Create the widget.  The background of the
 16034      Xaw3d scroll bar widget is a little bit light for my taste.
 16035      We don't alter it here to let users change it according
 16036      to their taste with `emacs*verticalScrollBar.background: xxx'.  */
 16037   XtSetArg (av[ac], XtNmappedWhenManaged, False); ++ac;
 16038   XtSetArg (av[ac], XtNorientation, XtorientHorizontal); ++ac;
 16039   /* For smoother scrolling with Xaw3d   -sm */
 16040   /* XtSetArg (av[ac], XtNpickTop, True); ++ac; */
 16041 
 16042   pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_foreground_pixel;
 16043   if (pixel != -1)
 16044     {
 16045       XtSetArg (av[ac], XtNforeground, pixel);
 16046       ++ac;
 16047     }
 16048 
 16049   pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel;
 16050   if (pixel != -1)
 16051     {
 16052       XtSetArg (av[ac], XtNbackground, pixel);
 16053       ++ac;
 16054     }
 16055 
 16056   /* Top/bottom shadow colors.  */
 16057 
 16058   /* Allocate them, if necessary.  */
 16059   if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_top_shadow_pixel == -1)
 16060     {
 16061       pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel;
 16062       if (pixel != -1)
 16063         {
 16064           if (!x_alloc_lighter_color (f, FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 16065                                       FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f),
 16066                                       &pixel, 1.2, 0x8000))
 16067             pixel = -1;
 16068           f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_top_shadow_pixel = pixel;
 16069         }
 16070     }
 16071   if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_bottom_shadow_pixel == -1)
 16072     {
 16073       pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel;
 16074       if (pixel != -1)
 16075         {
 16076           if (!x_alloc_lighter_color (f, FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 16077                                       FRAME_X_COLORMAP (f),
 16078                                       &pixel, 0.6, 0x4000))
 16079             pixel = -1;
 16080           f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_bottom_shadow_pixel = pixel;
 16081         }
 16082     }
 16083 
 16084 #ifdef XtNbeNiceToColormap
 16085   /* Tell the toolkit about them.  */
 16086   if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_top_shadow_pixel == -1
 16087       || f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_bottom_shadow_pixel == -1)
 16088     /* We tried to allocate a color for the top/bottom shadow, and
 16089        failed, so tell Xaw3d to use dithering instead.   */
 16090     /* But only if we have a small colormap.  Xaw3d can allocate nice
 16091        colors itself.  */
 16092     {
 16093       XtSetArg (av[ac], (String) XtNbeNiceToColormap,
 16094                 DefaultDepthOfScreen (FRAME_X_SCREEN (f)) < 16);
 16095       ++ac;
 16096     }
 16097   else
 16098     /* Tell what colors Xaw3d should use for the top/bottom shadow, to
 16099        be more consistent with other emacs 3d colors, and since Xaw3d is
 16100        not good at dealing with allocation failure.  */
 16101     {
 16102       /* This tells Xaw3d to use real colors instead of dithering for
 16103          the shadows.  */
 16104       XtSetArg (av[ac], (String) XtNbeNiceToColormap, False);
 16105       ++ac;
 16106 
 16107       /* Specify the colors.  */
 16108       pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_top_shadow_pixel;
 16109       if (pixel != -1)
 16110         {
 16111           XtSetArg (av[ac], (String) XtNtopShadowPixel, pixel);
 16112           ++ac;
 16113         }
 16114       pixel = f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_bottom_shadow_pixel;
 16115       if (pixel != -1)
 16116         {
 16117           XtSetArg (av[ac], (String) XtNbottomShadowPixel, pixel);
 16118           ++ac;
 16119         }
 16120     }
 16121 #endif
 16122 
 16123   widget = XtCreateWidget (scroll_bar_name, scrollbarWidgetClass,
 16124                            f->output_data.x->edit_widget, av, ac);
 16125 
 16126   {
 16127     char const *initial = "";
 16128     char const *val = initial;
 16129     XtVaGetValues (widget, XtNscrollVCursor, (XtPointer) &val,
 16130 #ifdef XtNarrowScrollbars
 16131                    XtNarrowScrollbars, (XtPointer) &xaw3d_arrow_scroll,
 16132 #endif
 16133                    XtNpickTop, (XtPointer) &xaw3d_pick_top, NULL);
 16134     if (xaw3d_arrow_scroll || val == initial)
 16135       { /* ARROW_SCROLL */
 16136         xaw3d_arrow_scroll = True;
 16137         /* Isn't that just a personal preference ?   --Stef */
 16138         XtVaSetValues (widget, XtNcursorName, "top_left_arrow", NULL);
 16139       }
 16140   }
 16141 
 16142   /* Define callbacks.  */
 16143   XtAddCallback (widget, XtNjumpProc, xaw_jump_callback, (XtPointer) bar);
 16144   XtAddCallback (widget, XtNscrollProc, xaw_scroll_callback,
 16145                  (XtPointer) bar);
 16146 
 16147   /* Realize the widget.  Only after that is the X window created.  */
 16148   XtRealizeWidget (widget);
 16149 
 16150 #endif /* !USE_MOTIF */
 16151 
 16152   /* Install an action hook that lets us detect when the user
 16153      finishes interacting with a scroll bar.  */
 16154   if (horizontal_action_hook_id == 0)
 16155    horizontal_action_hook_id
 16156      = XtAppAddActionHook (Xt_app_con, xt_horizontal_action_hook, 0);
 16157 
 16158   /* Remember X window and widget in the scroll bar vector.  */
 16159   SET_SCROLL_BAR_X_WIDGET (bar, widget);
 16160   xwindow = XtWindow (widget);
 16161   bar->x_window = xwindow;
 16162   bar->whole = 1;
 16163   bar->horizontal = true;
 16164 
 16165   unblock_input ();
 16166 }
 16167 #endif /* not USE_GTK */
 16168 
 16169 
 16170 /* Set the thumb size and position of scroll bar BAR.  We are currently
 16171    displaying PORTION out of a whole WHOLE, and our position POSITION.  */
 16172 
 16173 #ifdef USE_GTK
 16174 static void
 16175 x_set_toolkit_scroll_bar_thumb (struct scroll_bar *bar, int portion, int position, int whole)
 16176 {
 16177   xg_set_toolkit_scroll_bar_thumb (bar, portion, position, whole);
 16178 }
 16179 
 16180 static void
 16181 x_set_toolkit_horizontal_scroll_bar_thumb (struct scroll_bar *bar, int portion, int position, int whole)
 16182 {
 16183   xg_set_toolkit_horizontal_scroll_bar_thumb (bar, portion, position, whole);
 16184 }
 16185 
 16186 #else /* not USE_GTK */
 16187 static void
 16188 x_set_toolkit_scroll_bar_thumb (struct scroll_bar *bar, int portion, int position,
 16189                                 int whole)
 16190 {
 16191   struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (XWINDOW (bar->window)));
 16192   Widget widget = SCROLL_BAR_X_WIDGET (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), bar);
 16193   float top, shown;
 16194 
 16195   block_input ();
 16196 
 16197 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 16198 
 16199   if (scroll_bar_adjust_thumb_portion_p)
 16200     {
 16201       /* We use an estimate of 30 chars per line rather than the real
 16202          `portion' value.  This has the disadvantage that the thumb size
 16203          is not very representative, but it makes our life a lot easier.
 16204          Otherwise, we have to constantly adjust the thumb size, which
 16205          we can't always do quickly enough: while dragging, the size of
 16206          the thumb might prevent the user from dragging the thumb all the
 16207          way to the end.  but Motif and some versions of Xaw3d don't allow
 16208          updating the thumb size while dragging.  Also, even if we can update
 16209          its size, the update will often happen too late.
 16210          If you don't believe it, check out revision 1.650 of xterm.c to see
 16211          what hoops we were going through and the still poor behavior we got.  */
 16212       portion = WINDOW_TOTAL_LINES (XWINDOW (bar->window)) * 30;
 16213       /* When the thumb is at the bottom, position == whole.
 16214          So we need to increase `whole' to make space for the thumb.  */
 16215       whole += portion;
 16216     }
 16217 
 16218   if (whole <= 0)
 16219     top = 0, shown = 1;
 16220   else
 16221     {
 16222       top = (float) position / whole;
 16223       shown = (float) portion / whole;
 16224     }
 16225 
 16226   if (bar->dragging == -1)
 16227     {
 16228       int size, value;
 16229 
 16230       /* Slider size.  Must be in the range [1 .. MAX - MIN] where MAX
 16231          is the scroll bar's maximum and MIN is the scroll bar's minimum
 16232          value.  */
 16233       size = clip_to_bounds (1, shown * XM_SB_MAX, XM_SB_MAX);
 16234 
 16235       /* Position.  Must be in the range [MIN .. MAX - SLIDER_SIZE].  */
 16236       value = top * XM_SB_MAX;
 16237       value = min (value, XM_SB_MAX - size);
 16238 
 16239       XmScrollBarSetValues (widget, value, size, 0, 0, False);
 16240     }
 16241 #else /* !USE_MOTIF i.e. use Xaw */
 16242 
 16243   if (whole == 0)
 16244     top = 0, shown = 1;
 16245   else
 16246     {
 16247       top = (float) position / whole;
 16248       shown = (float) portion / whole;
 16249     }
 16250 
 16251   {
 16252     float old_top, old_shown;
 16253     Dimension height;
 16254     XtVaGetValues (widget,
 16255                    XtNtopOfThumb, &old_top,
 16256                    XtNshown, &old_shown,
 16257                    XtNheight, &height,
 16258                    NULL);
 16259 
 16260     /* Massage the top+shown values.  */
 16261     if (bar->dragging == -1 || bar->last_seen_part == scroll_bar_down_arrow)
 16262       top = max (0, min (1, top));
 16263     else
 16264       top = old_top;
 16265 #if ! defined (HAVE_XAW3D)
 16266     /* With Xaw, 'top' values too closer to 1.0 may
 16267        cause the thumb to disappear.  Fix that.  */
 16268     top = min (top, 0.99f);
 16269 #endif
 16270     /* Keep two pixels available for moving the thumb down.  */
 16271     shown = max (0, min (1 - top - (2.0f / height), shown));
 16272 #if ! defined (HAVE_XAW3D)
 16273     /* Likewise with too small 'shown'.  */
 16274     shown = max (shown, 0.01f);
 16275 #endif
 16276 
 16277     /* If the call to XawScrollbarSetThumb below doesn't seem to
 16278        work, check that 'NARROWPROTO' is defined in src/config.h.
 16279        If this is not so, most likely you need to fix configure.  */
 16280     if (top != old_top || shown != old_shown)
 16281       {
 16282         if (bar->dragging == -1)
 16283           XawScrollbarSetThumb (widget, top, shown);
 16284         else
 16285           {
 16286             /* Try to make the scrolling a tad smoother.  */
 16287             if (!xaw3d_pick_top)
 16288               shown = min (shown, old_shown);
 16289 
 16290             XawScrollbarSetThumb (widget, top, shown);
 16291           }
 16292       }
 16293   }
 16294 #endif /* !USE_MOTIF */
 16295 
 16296   unblock_input ();
 16297 }
 16298 
 16299 static void
 16300 x_set_toolkit_horizontal_scroll_bar_thumb (struct scroll_bar *bar, int portion, int position,
 16301                                 int whole)
 16302 {
 16303   struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (XWINDOW (bar->window)));
 16304   Widget widget = SCROLL_BAR_X_WIDGET (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), bar);
 16305   float top, shown;
 16306 
 16307   block_input ();
 16308 
 16309 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 16310   bar->whole = whole;
 16311   shown = (float) portion / whole;
 16312   top = (float) position / (whole - portion);
 16313   {
 16314     int size = clip_to_bounds (1, shown * XM_SB_MAX, XM_SB_MAX);
 16315     int value = clip_to_bounds (0, top * (XM_SB_MAX - size), XM_SB_MAX - size);
 16316 
 16317     XmScrollBarSetValues (widget, value, size, 0, 0, False);
 16318   }
 16319 #else /* !USE_MOTIF i.e. use Xaw */
 16320   bar->whole = whole;
 16321   if (whole == 0)
 16322     top = 0, shown = 1;
 16323   else
 16324     {
 16325       top = (float) position / whole;
 16326       shown = (float) portion / whole;
 16327     }
 16328 
 16329   {
 16330     float old_top, old_shown;
 16331     Dimension height;
 16332     XtVaGetValues (widget,
 16333                    XtNtopOfThumb, &old_top,
 16334                    XtNshown, &old_shown,
 16335                    XtNheight, &height,
 16336                    NULL);
 16337 
 16338 #if false
 16339     /* Massage the top+shown values.  */
 16340     if (bar->dragging == -1 || bar->last_seen_part == scroll_bar_down_arrow)
 16341       top = max (0, min (1, top));
 16342     else
 16343       top = old_top;
 16344 #if ! defined (HAVE_XAW3D)
 16345     /* With Xaw, 'top' values too closer to 1.0 may
 16346        cause the thumb to disappear.  Fix that.  */
 16347     top = min (top, 0.99f);
 16348 #endif
 16349     /* Keep two pixels available for moving the thumb down.  */
 16350     shown = max (0, min (1 - top - (2.0f / height), shown));
 16351 #if ! defined (HAVE_XAW3D)
 16352     /* Likewise with too small 'shown'.  */
 16353     shown = max (shown, 0.01f);
 16354 #endif
 16355 #endif
 16356 
 16357     /* If the call to XawScrollbarSetThumb below doesn't seem to
 16358        work, check that 'NARROWPROTO' is defined in src/config.h.
 16359        If this is not so, most likely you need to fix configure.  */
 16360     XawScrollbarSetThumb (widget, top, shown);
 16361 #if false
 16362     if (top != old_top || shown != old_shown)
 16363       {
 16364         if (bar->dragging == -1)
 16365           XawScrollbarSetThumb (widget, top, shown);
 16366         else
 16367           {
 16368             /* Try to make the scrolling a tad smoother.  */
 16369             if (!xaw3d_pick_top)
 16370               shown = min (shown, old_shown);
 16371 
 16372             XawScrollbarSetThumb (widget, top, shown);
 16373           }
 16374       }
 16375 #endif
 16376   }
 16377 #endif /* !USE_MOTIF */
 16378 
 16379   unblock_input ();
 16380 }
 16381 #endif /* not USE_GTK */
 16382 
 16383 #endif /* USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16384 
 16385 
 16386 
 16387 /************************************************************************
 16388                          Scroll bars, general
 16389  ************************************************************************/
 16390 
 16391 /* Create a scroll bar and return the scroll bar vector for it.  W is
 16392    the Emacs window on which to create the scroll bar. TOP, LEFT,
 16393    WIDTH and HEIGHT are the pixel coordinates and dimensions of the
 16394    scroll bar. */
 16395 
 16396 static struct scroll_bar *
 16397 x_scroll_bar_create (struct window *w, int top, int left,
 16398                      int width, int height, bool horizontal)
 16399 {
 16400   struct frame *f = XFRAME (w->frame);
 16401   struct scroll_bar *bar = ALLOCATE_PSEUDOVECTOR (struct scroll_bar, prev,
 16402                                                   PVEC_OTHER);
 16403   Lisp_Object barobj;
 16404 
 16405   block_input ();
 16406 
 16407 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 16408   if (horizontal)
 16409     x_create_horizontal_toolkit_scroll_bar (f, bar);
 16410   else
 16411     x_create_toolkit_scroll_bar (f, bar);
 16412 #else /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16413   {
 16414     XSetWindowAttributes a;
 16415     unsigned long mask;
 16416     Window window;
 16417 
 16418     a.event_mask = (ButtonPressMask | ButtonReleaseMask
 16419                     | ButtonMotionMask | PointerMotionHintMask);
 16420     a.cursor = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->vertical_scroll_bar_cursor;
 16421 
 16422     mask = (CWEventMask | CWCursor);
 16423 
 16424     /* Clear the area of W that will serve as a scroll bar.  This is
 16425        for the case that a window has been split horizontally.  In
 16426        this case, no clear_frame is generated to reduce flickering.  */
 16427     if (width > 0 && window_box_height (w) > 0)
 16428       x_clear_area (f, left, top, width, window_box_height (w));
 16429 
 16430     /* Create an input only window.  Scroll bar contents are drawn to
 16431        the frame window itself, so they can be double buffered and
 16432        synchronized using the same mechanism as the frame.  */
 16433     window = XCreateWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 16434                             /* Position and size of scroll bar.  */
 16435                             left, top, width, height,
 16436                             /* Border width.  */
 16437                             0,
 16438                             /* Depth.  */
 16439                             CopyFromParent,
 16440                             /* Class.  */
 16441                             InputOnly,
 16442                             /* Visual class.  */
 16443                             CopyFromParent,
 16444                              /* Attributes.  */
 16445                             mask, &a);
 16446 
 16447 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 16448   /* Ask for input extension button and motion events.  This lets us
 16449      send the proper `wheel-up' or `wheel-down' events to Emacs.  */
 16450   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->supports_xi2)
 16451     xi_select_scroll_bar_events (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
 16452                                  window);
 16453 #endif
 16454 
 16455     bar->x_window = window;
 16456   }
 16457 #endif /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16458 
 16459   XSETWINDOW (bar->window, w);
 16460   bar->top = top;
 16461   bar->left = left;
 16462   bar->width = width;
 16463   bar->height = height;
 16464   bar->start = 0;
 16465   bar->end = 0;
 16466   bar->dragging = -1;
 16467   bar->horizontal = horizontal;
 16468 #if defined (USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS) && defined (USE_LUCID)
 16469   bar->last_seen_part = scroll_bar_nowhere;
 16470 #endif
 16471 
 16472   /* Add bar to its frame's list of scroll bars.  */
 16473   bar->next = FRAME_SCROLL_BARS (f);
 16474   bar->prev = Qnil;
 16475   XSETVECTOR (barobj, bar);
 16476   fset_scroll_bars (f, barobj);
 16477   if (!NILP (bar->next))
 16478     XSETVECTOR (XSCROLL_BAR (bar->next)->prev, bar);
 16479 
 16480   /* Map the window/widget.  */
 16481 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 16482   {
 16483 #ifdef USE_GTK
 16484     if (horizontal)
 16485       xg_update_horizontal_scrollbar_pos (f, bar->x_window, top,
 16486                                           left, width, max (height, 1));
 16487     else
 16488       xg_update_scrollbar_pos (f, bar->x_window, top,
 16489                                left, width, max (height, 1));
 16490 #else /* not USE_GTK */
 16491     Widget scroll_bar = SCROLL_BAR_X_WIDGET (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), bar);
 16492     XtConfigureWidget (scroll_bar, left, top, width, max (height, 1), 0);
 16493     XtMapWidget (scroll_bar);
 16494     /* Don't obscure any child frames.  */
 16495     XLowerWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), bar->x_window);
 16496 #endif /* not USE_GTK */
 16497     }
 16498 #else /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16499   XMapWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), bar->x_window);
 16500   /* Don't obscure any child frames.  */
 16501   XLowerWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), bar->x_window);
 16502 #endif /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16503 
 16504   unblock_input ();
 16505   return bar;
 16506 }
 16507 
 16508 
 16509 #ifndef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 16510 
 16511 /* Draw BAR's handle in the proper position.
 16512 
 16513    If the handle is already drawn from START to END, don't bother
 16514    redrawing it, unless REBUILD; in that case, always
 16515    redraw it.  (REBUILD is handy for drawing the handle after expose
 16516    events.)
 16517 
 16518    Normally, we want to constrain the start and end of the handle to
 16519    fit inside its rectangle, but if the user is dragging the scroll
 16520    bar handle, we want to let them drag it down all the way, so that
 16521    the bar's top is as far down as it goes; otherwise, there's no way
 16522    to move to the very end of the buffer.  */
 16523 
 16524 static void
 16525 x_scroll_bar_set_handle (struct scroll_bar *bar, int start, int end,
 16526                          bool rebuild)
 16527 {
 16528   bool dragging;
 16529   struct frame *f;
 16530   Drawable w;
 16531   GC gc;
 16532   int inside_width, inside_height, top_range, length;
 16533 
 16534   /* If the display is already accurate, do nothing.  */
 16535   if (! rebuild
 16536       && start == bar->start
 16537       && end == bar->end)
 16538     return;
 16539 
 16540   f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (XWINDOW (bar->window)));
 16541   dragging = bar->dragging != -1;
 16542   gc = f->output_data.x->normal_gc;
 16543   w = FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f);
 16544 
 16545   block_input ();
 16546 
 16547   inside_width = VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_INSIDE_WIDTH (f, bar->width);
 16548   inside_height = VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_INSIDE_HEIGHT (f, bar->height);
 16549   top_range = VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_TOP_RANGE (f, bar->height);
 16550 
 16551   /* Make sure the values are reasonable, and try to preserve
 16552      the distance between start and end.  */
 16553   length = end - start;
 16554 
 16555   if (start < 0)
 16556     start = 0;
 16557   else if (start > top_range)
 16558     start = top_range;
 16559   end = start + length;
 16560 
 16561   if (end < start)
 16562     end = start;
 16563   else if (end > top_range && ! dragging)
 16564     end = top_range;
 16565 
 16566   /* Store the adjusted setting in the scroll bar.  */
 16567   bar->start = start;
 16568   bar->end = end;
 16569 
 16570   /* Clip the end position, just for display.  */
 16571   if (end > top_range)
 16572     end = top_range;
 16573 
 16574   /* Draw bottom positions VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_MIN_HANDLE pixels
 16575      below top positions, to make sure the handle is always at least
 16576      that many pixels tall.  */
 16577   end += VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_MIN_HANDLE;
 16578 
 16579   /* Draw the empty space above the handle.  Note that we can't clear
 16580      zero-height areas; that means "clear to end of window."  */
 16581   if ((inside_width > 0) && (start > 0))
 16582     {
 16583       if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel != -1)
 16584         XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 16585                         f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel);
 16586       else
 16587         XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 16588                         FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f));
 16589 
 16590       XFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), w, gc,
 16591                       bar->left + VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_LEFT_BORDER,
 16592                       bar->top + VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_TOP_BORDER,
 16593                       inside_width, start);
 16594 
 16595       XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 16596                       FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f));
 16597     }
 16598 
 16599   /* Change to proper foreground color if one is specified.  */
 16600   if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_foreground_pixel != -1)
 16601     XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 16602                     f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_foreground_pixel);
 16603 
 16604   /* Draw the handle itself.  */
 16605   XFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), w, gc,
 16606                   /* x, y, width, height */
 16607                   bar->left + VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_LEFT_BORDER,
 16608                   bar->top + VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_TOP_BORDER + start,
 16609                   inside_width, end - start);
 16610 
 16611 
 16612   /* Draw the empty space below the handle.  Note that we can't
 16613      clear zero-height areas; that means "clear to end of window." */
 16614   if ((inside_width > 0) && (end < inside_height))
 16615     {
 16616       if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel != -1)
 16617         XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 16618                         f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel);
 16619       else
 16620         XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 16621                         FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f));
 16622 
 16623       XFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), w, gc,
 16624                       bar->left + VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_LEFT_BORDER,
 16625                       bar->top + VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_TOP_BORDER + end,
 16626                       inside_width, inside_height - end);
 16627 
 16628       XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 16629                       FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f));
 16630     }
 16631 
 16632   /* Restore the foreground color of the GC if we changed it above.  */
 16633   if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_foreground_pixel != -1)
 16634     XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 16635                     FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f));
 16636 
 16637   unblock_input ();
 16638 }
 16639 
 16640 #endif /* !USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16641 
 16642 /* Destroy scroll bar BAR, and set its Emacs window's scroll bar to
 16643    nil.  */
 16644 
 16645 static void
 16646 x_scroll_bar_remove (struct scroll_bar *bar)
 16647 {
 16648   struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (XWINDOW (bar->window)));
 16649   block_input ();
 16650 
 16651 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 16652 #ifdef USE_GTK
 16653   xg_remove_scroll_bar (f, bar->x_window);
 16654 #else /* not USE_GTK */
 16655   XtDestroyWidget (SCROLL_BAR_X_WIDGET (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), bar));
 16656 #endif /* not USE_GTK */
 16657 #else
 16658   XDestroyWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), bar->x_window);
 16659 #endif
 16660 
 16661   /* Dissociate this scroll bar from its window.  */
 16662   if (bar->horizontal)
 16663     wset_horizontal_scroll_bar (XWINDOW (bar->window), Qnil);
 16664   else
 16665     wset_vertical_scroll_bar (XWINDOW (bar->window), Qnil);
 16666 
 16667   unblock_input ();
 16668 }
 16669 
 16670 
 16671 /* Set the handle of the vertical scroll bar for WINDOW to indicate
 16672    that we are displaying PORTION characters out of a total of WHOLE
 16673    characters, starting at POSITION.  If WINDOW has no scroll bar,
 16674    create one.  */
 16675 
 16676 static void
