 16677 XTset_vertical_scroll_bar (struct window *w, int portion, int whole, int position)
 16678 {
 16679   struct frame *f = XFRAME (w->frame);
 16680   Lisp_Object barobj;
 16681   struct scroll_bar *bar;
 16682   int top, height, left, width;
 16683   int window_y, window_height;
 16684 
 16685   /* Get window dimensions.  */
 16686   window_box (w, ANY_AREA, 0, &window_y, 0, &window_height);
 16687   top = window_y;
 16688   height = window_height;
 16689   left = WINDOW_SCROLL_BAR_AREA_X (w);
 16690   width = WINDOW_SCROLL_BAR_AREA_WIDTH (w);
 16691 
 16692   /* Does the scroll bar exist yet?  */
 16693   if (NILP (w->vertical_scroll_bar))
 16694     {
 16695       if (width > 0 && height > 0)
 16696         {
 16697           block_input ();
 16698           x_clear_area (f, left, top, width, height);
 16699           unblock_input ();
 16700         }
 16701 
 16702       bar = x_scroll_bar_create (w, top, left, width, max (height, 1), false);
 16703 #ifndef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 16704       /* Since non-toolkit scroll bars don't display their contents to
 16705          a dedicated window, no expose event will be generated.
 16706          Redraw the scroll bar manually.  */
 16707       x_scroll_bar_redraw (bar);
 16708 #endif
 16709     }
 16710   else
 16711     {
 16712       /* It may just need to be moved and resized.  */
 16713       unsigned int mask = 0;
 16714 
 16715       bar = XSCROLL_BAR (w->vertical_scroll_bar);
 16716 
 16717       block_input ();
 16718 
 16719       if (left != bar->left)
 16720         mask |= CWX;
 16721       if (top != bar->top)
 16722         mask |= CWY;
 16723       if (width != bar->width)
 16724         mask |= CWWidth;
 16725       if (height != bar->height)
 16726         mask |= CWHeight;
 16727 
 16728 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 16729 
 16730       /* Move/size the scroll bar widget.  */
 16731       if (mask)
 16732         {
 16733           /* Since toolkit scroll bars are smaller than the space reserved
 16734              for them on the frame, we have to clear "under" them.  */
 16735           if (width > 0 && height > 0)
 16736             x_clear_area (f, left, top, width, height);
 16737 #ifdef USE_GTK
 16738           xg_update_scrollbar_pos (f, bar->x_window, top,
 16739                                    left, width, max (height, 1));
 16740 #else /* not USE_GTK */
 16741           XtConfigureWidget (SCROLL_BAR_X_WIDGET (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), bar),
 16742                              left, top, width, max (height, 1), 0);
 16743 #endif /* not USE_GTK */
 16744         }
 16745 #else /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16746 
 16747       /* Move/size the scroll bar window.  */
 16748       if (mask)
 16749         {
 16750           XWindowChanges wc;
 16751 
 16752           wc.x = left;
 16753           wc.y = top;
 16754           wc.width = width;
 16755           wc.height = height;
 16756           XConfigureWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), bar->x_window,
 16757                             mask, &wc);
 16758         }
 16759 
 16760 #endif /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16761 
 16762       /* Remember new settings.  */
 16763       bar->left = left;
 16764       bar->top = top;
 16765       bar->width = width;
 16766       bar->height = height;
 16767 
 16768 #ifndef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 16769       /* Redraw the scroll bar.  */
 16770       x_scroll_bar_redraw (bar);
 16771 #endif
 16772 
 16773       unblock_input ();
 16774     }
 16775 
 16776 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 16777   x_set_toolkit_scroll_bar_thumb (bar, portion, position, whole);
 16778 #else /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16779   /* Set the scroll bar's current state, unless we're currently being
 16780      dragged.  */
 16781   if (bar->dragging == -1)
 16782     {
 16783       int top_range = VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_TOP_RANGE (f, height);
 16784 
 16785       if (whole == 0)
 16786         x_scroll_bar_set_handle (bar, 0, top_range, false);
 16787       else
 16788         {
 16789           int start = ((double) position * top_range) / whole;
 16790           int end = ((double) (position + portion) * top_range) / whole;
 16791           x_scroll_bar_set_handle (bar, start, end, false);
 16792         }
 16793     }
 16794 #endif /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16795 
 16796   XSETVECTOR (barobj, bar);
 16797   wset_vertical_scroll_bar (w, barobj);
 16798 }
 16799 
 16800 
 16801 static void
 16802 XTset_horizontal_scroll_bar (struct window *w, int portion, int whole, int position)
 16803 {
 16804   struct frame *f = XFRAME (w->frame);
 16805   Lisp_Object barobj;
 16806   struct scroll_bar *bar;
 16807   int top, height, left, width;
 16808   int window_x, window_width;
 16809   int pixel_width = WINDOW_PIXEL_WIDTH (w);
 16810 
 16811   /* Get window dimensions.  */
 16812   window_box (w, ANY_AREA, &window_x, 0, &window_width, 0);
 16813   left = window_x;
 16814   width = window_width;
 16815   top = WINDOW_SCROLL_BAR_AREA_Y (w);
 16816   height = WINDOW_SCROLL_BAR_AREA_HEIGHT (w);
 16817 
 16818   /* Does the scroll bar exist yet?  */
 16819   if (NILP (w->horizontal_scroll_bar))
 16820     {
 16821       if (width > 0 && height > 0)
 16822         {
 16823           block_input ();
 16824 
 16825           /* Clear also part between window_width and
 16826              WINDOW_PIXEL_WIDTH.  */
 16827           x_clear_area (f, left, top, pixel_width, height);
 16828           unblock_input ();
 16829         }
 16830 
 16831       bar = x_scroll_bar_create (w, top, left, width, height, true);
 16832     }
 16833   else
 16834     {
 16835       /* It may just need to be moved and resized.  */
 16836       unsigned int mask = 0;
 16837 
 16838       bar = XSCROLL_BAR (w->horizontal_scroll_bar);
 16839 
 16840       block_input ();
 16841 
 16842       if (left != bar->left)
 16843         mask |= CWX;
 16844       if (top != bar->top)
 16845         mask |= CWY;
 16846       if (width != bar->width)
 16847         mask |= CWWidth;
 16848       if (height != bar->height)
 16849         mask |= CWHeight;
 16850 
 16851 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 16852       /* Move/size the scroll bar widget.  */
 16853       if (mask)
 16854         {
 16855           /* Since toolkit scroll bars are smaller than the space reserved
 16856              for them on the frame, we have to clear "under" them.  */
 16857           if (width > 0 && height > 0)
 16858             x_clear_area (f,
 16859                           WINDOW_LEFT_EDGE_X (w), top,
 16860                           pixel_width - WINDOW_RIGHT_DIVIDER_WIDTH (w), height);
 16861 #ifdef USE_GTK
 16862           xg_update_horizontal_scrollbar_pos (f, bar->x_window, top, left,
 16863                                               width, height);
 16864 #else /* not USE_GTK */
 16865           XtConfigureWidget (SCROLL_BAR_X_WIDGET (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), bar),
 16866                              left, top, width, height, 0);
 16867 #endif /* not USE_GTK */
 16868         }
 16869 #else /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16870 
 16871       /* Clear areas not covered by the scroll bar because it's not as
 16872          wide as the area reserved for it.  This makes sure a
 16873          previous mode line display is cleared after C-x 2 C-x 1, for
 16874          example.  */
 16875       {
 16876         int area_height = WINDOW_CONFIG_SCROLL_BAR_HEIGHT (w);
 16877         int rest = area_height - height;
 16878         if (rest > 0 && width > 0)
 16879           x_clear_area (f, left, top, width, rest);
 16880       }
 16881 
 16882       /* Move/size the scroll bar window.  */
 16883       if (mask)
 16884         {
 16885           XWindowChanges wc;
 16886 
 16887           wc.x = left;
 16888           wc.y = top;
 16889           wc.width = width;
 16890           wc.height = height;
 16891           XConfigureWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), bar->x_window,
 16892                             mask, &wc);
 16893         }
 16894 
 16895 #endif /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16896 
 16897       /* Remember new settings.  */
 16898       bar->left = left;
 16899       bar->top = top;
 16900       bar->width = width;
 16901       bar->height = height;
 16902 
 16903       unblock_input ();
 16904     }
 16905 
 16906 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 16907   x_set_toolkit_horizontal_scroll_bar_thumb (bar, portion, position, whole);
 16908 #else /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16909   /* Set the scroll bar's current state, unless we're currently being
 16910      dragged.  */
 16911   if (bar->dragging == -1)
 16912     {
 16913       int left_range = HORIZONTAL_SCROLL_BAR_LEFT_RANGE (f, width);
 16914 
 16915       if (whole == 0)
 16916         x_scroll_bar_set_handle (bar, 0, left_range, false);
 16917       else
 16918         {
 16919           int start = ((double) position * left_range) / whole;
 16920           int end = ((double) (position + portion) * left_range) / whole;
 16921           x_scroll_bar_set_handle (bar, start, end, false);
 16922         }
 16923     }
 16924 #endif /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 16925 
 16926   XSETVECTOR (barobj, bar);
 16927   wset_horizontal_scroll_bar (w, barobj);
 16928 }
 16929 
 16930 
 16931 /* The following three hooks are used when we're doing a thorough
 16932    redisplay of the frame.  We don't explicitly know which scroll bars
 16933    are going to be deleted, because keeping track of when windows go
 16934    away is a real pain - "Can you say set-window-configuration, boys
 16935    and girls?"  Instead, we just assert at the beginning of redisplay
 16936    that *all* scroll bars are to be removed, and then save a scroll bar
 16937    from the fiery pit when we actually redisplay its window.  */
 16938 
 16939 /* Arrange for all scroll bars on FRAME to be removed at the next call
 16940    to `*judge_scroll_bars_hook'.  A scroll bar may be spared if
 16941    `*redeem_scroll_bar_hook' is applied to its window before the judgment.  */
 16942 
 16943 static void
 16944 XTcondemn_scroll_bars (struct frame *frame)
 16945 {
 16946   if (!NILP (FRAME_SCROLL_BARS (frame)))
 16947     {
 16948       if (!NILP (FRAME_CONDEMNED_SCROLL_BARS (frame)))
 16949         {
 16950           /* Prepend scrollbars to already condemned ones.  */
 16951           Lisp_Object last = FRAME_SCROLL_BARS (frame);
 16952 
 16953           while (!NILP (XSCROLL_BAR (last)->next))
 16954             last = XSCROLL_BAR (last)->next;
 16955 
 16956           XSCROLL_BAR (last)->next = FRAME_CONDEMNED_SCROLL_BARS (frame);
 16957           XSCROLL_BAR (FRAME_CONDEMNED_SCROLL_BARS (frame))->prev = last;
 16958         }
 16959 
 16960       fset_condemned_scroll_bars (frame, FRAME_SCROLL_BARS (frame));
 16961       fset_scroll_bars (frame, Qnil);
 16962     }
 16963 }
 16964 
 16965 
 16966 /* Un-mark WINDOW's scroll bar for deletion in this judgment cycle.
 16967    Note that WINDOW isn't necessarily condemned at all.  */
 16968 
 16969 static void
 16970 XTredeem_scroll_bar (struct window *w)
 16971 {
 16972   struct scroll_bar *bar;
 16973   Lisp_Object barobj;
 16974   struct frame *f;
 16975 
 16976   /* We can't redeem this window's scroll bar if it doesn't have one.  */
 16977   if (NILP (w->vertical_scroll_bar) && NILP (w->horizontal_scroll_bar))
 16978     emacs_abort ();
 16979 
 16980   if (!NILP (w->vertical_scroll_bar) && WINDOW_HAS_VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR (w))
 16981     {
 16982       bar = XSCROLL_BAR (w->vertical_scroll_bar);
 16983       /* Unlink it from the condemned list.  */
 16984       f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (w));
 16985       if (NILP (bar->prev))
 16986         {
 16987           /* If the prev pointer is nil, it must be the first in one of
 16988              the lists.  */
 16989           if (EQ (FRAME_SCROLL_BARS (f), w->vertical_scroll_bar))
 16990             /* It's not condemned.  Everything's fine.  */
 16991             goto horizontal;
 16992           else if (EQ (FRAME_CONDEMNED_SCROLL_BARS (f),
 16993                        w->vertical_scroll_bar))
 16994             fset_condemned_scroll_bars (f, bar->next);
 16995           else
 16996             /* If its prev pointer is nil, it must be at the front of
 16997                one or the other!  */
 16998             emacs_abort ();
 16999         }
 17000       else
 17001         XSCROLL_BAR (bar->prev)->next = bar->next;
 17002 
 17003       if (! NILP (bar->next))
 17004         XSCROLL_BAR (bar->next)->prev = bar->prev;
 17005 
 17006       bar->next = FRAME_SCROLL_BARS (f);
 17007       bar->prev = Qnil;
 17008       XSETVECTOR (barobj, bar);
 17009       fset_scroll_bars (f, barobj);
 17010       if (! NILP (bar->next))
 17011         XSETVECTOR (XSCROLL_BAR (bar->next)->prev, bar);
 17012     }
 17013 
 17014  horizontal:
 17015   if (!NILP (w->horizontal_scroll_bar) && WINDOW_HAS_HORIZONTAL_SCROLL_BAR (w))
 17016     {
 17017       bar = XSCROLL_BAR (w->horizontal_scroll_bar);
 17018       /* Unlink it from the condemned list.  */
 17019       f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (w));
 17020       if (NILP (bar->prev))
 17021         {
 17022           /* If the prev pointer is nil, it must be the first in one of
 17023              the lists.  */
 17024           if (EQ (FRAME_SCROLL_BARS (f), w->horizontal_scroll_bar))
 17025             /* It's not condemned.  Everything's fine.  */
 17026             return;
 17027           else if (EQ (FRAME_CONDEMNED_SCROLL_BARS (f),
 17028                        w->horizontal_scroll_bar))
 17029             fset_condemned_scroll_bars (f, bar->next);
 17030           else
 17031             /* If its prev pointer is nil, it must be at the front of
 17032                one or the other!  */
 17033             emacs_abort ();
 17034         }
 17035       else
 17036         XSCROLL_BAR (bar->prev)->next = bar->next;
 17037 
 17038       if (! NILP (bar->next))
 17039         XSCROLL_BAR (bar->next)->prev = bar->prev;
 17040 
 17041       bar->next = FRAME_SCROLL_BARS (f);
 17042       bar->prev = Qnil;
 17043       XSETVECTOR (barobj, bar);
 17044       fset_scroll_bars (f, barobj);
 17045       if (! NILP (bar->next))
 17046         XSETVECTOR (XSCROLL_BAR (bar->next)->prev, bar);
 17047     }
 17048 }
 17049 
 17050 /* Remove all scroll bars on FRAME that haven't been saved since the
 17051    last call to `*condemn_scroll_bars_hook'.  */
 17052 
 17053 static void
 17054 XTjudge_scroll_bars (struct frame *f)
 17055 {
 17056   Lisp_Object bar, next;
 17057 
 17058   bar = FRAME_CONDEMNED_SCROLL_BARS (f);
 17059 
 17060   /* Clear out the condemned list now so we won't try to process any
 17061      more events on the hapless scroll bars.  */
 17062   fset_condemned_scroll_bars (f, Qnil);
 17063 
 17064   for (; ! NILP (bar); bar = next)
 17065     {
 17066       struct scroll_bar *b = XSCROLL_BAR (bar);
 17067 
 17068       x_scroll_bar_remove (b);
 17069 
 17070       next = b->next;
 17071       b->next = b->prev = Qnil;
 17072     }
 17073 
 17074   /* Now there should be no references to the condemned scroll bars,
 17075      and they should get garbage-collected.  */
 17076 }
 17077 
 17078 
 17079 #ifndef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 17080 /* Handle exposure event EVENT generated for F, by redrawing all
 17081    intersecting scroll bars.  */
 17082 
 17083 static void
 17084 x_scroll_bar_handle_exposure (struct frame *f, XEvent *event)
 17085 {
 17086   int x, y, width, height;
 17087   XRectangle rect, scroll_bar_rect, intersection;
 17088   Lisp_Object bar, condemned;
 17089   struct scroll_bar *b;
 17090 
 17091   if (event->type == GraphicsExpose)
 17092     {
 17093       x = event->xgraphicsexpose.x;
 17094       y = event->xgraphicsexpose.y;
 17095       width = event->xgraphicsexpose.width;
 17096       height = event->xgraphicsexpose.height;
 17097     }
 17098   else
 17099     {
 17100       x = event->xexpose.x;
 17101       y = event->xexpose.y;
 17102       width = event->xexpose.width;
 17103       height = event->xexpose.height;
 17104     }
 17105 
 17106   rect.x = x;
 17107   rect.y = y;
 17108   rect.width = width;
 17109   rect.height = height;
 17110 
 17111   /* Scan this frame's scroll bar list for intersecting scroll
 17112      bars.  */
 17113   condemned = FRAME_CONDEMNED_SCROLL_BARS (f);
 17114   for (bar = FRAME_SCROLL_BARS (f);
 17115        /* This trick allows us to search both the ordinary and
 17116           condemned scroll bar lists with one loop.  */
 17117        !NILP (bar) || (bar = condemned,
 17118                        condemned = Qnil,
 17119                        !NILP (bar));
 17120        bar = XSCROLL_BAR (bar)->next)
 17121     {
 17122       b = XSCROLL_BAR (bar);
 17123 
 17124       scroll_bar_rect.x = b->left;
 17125       scroll_bar_rect.y = b->top;
 17126       scroll_bar_rect.width = b->width;
 17127       scroll_bar_rect.height = b->height;
 17128 
 17129       if (gui_intersect_rectangles (&rect,
 17130                                     &scroll_bar_rect,
 17131                                     &intersection))
 17132         x_scroll_bar_redraw (b);
 17133     }
 17134 }
 17135 
 17136 /* Redraw the scroll bar BAR.  Draw its border and set its thumb.
 17137    This is usually called from x_clear_frame, but is also used to
 17138    handle exposure events that overlap scroll bars.  */
 17139 
 17140 static void
 17141 x_scroll_bar_redraw (struct scroll_bar *bar)
 17142 {
 17143   struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (XWINDOW (bar->window)));
 17144   GC gc = f->output_data.x->normal_gc;
 17145 
 17146   if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel != -1)
 17147     XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 17148                     f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel);
 17149   else
 17150     XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 17151                     FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f));
 17152 
 17153   XFillRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f), gc,
 17154                   bar->left, bar->top, bar->width, bar->height);
 17155 
 17156   XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 17157                   FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f));
 17158 
 17159   x_scroll_bar_set_handle (bar, bar->start, bar->end, true);
 17160 
 17161   /* Switch to scroll bar foreground color.  */
 17162   if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_foreground_pixel != -1)
 17163     XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 17164                     f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_foreground_pixel);
 17165 
 17166   /* Draw a one-pixel border just inside the edges of the scroll bar.  */
 17167   XDrawRectangle (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f), gc,
 17168                   bar->left, bar->top, bar->width - 1, bar->height - 1);
 17169 
 17170   /* Restore the foreground color of the GC if we changed it above.  */
 17171   if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_foreground_pixel != -1)
 17172     XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 17173                     FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f));
 17174 }
 17175 #endif /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 17176 
 17177 /* Handle a mouse click on the scroll bar BAR.  If *EMACS_EVENT's kind
 17178    is set to something other than NO_EVENT, it is enqueued.
 17179 
 17180    This may be called from a signal handler, so we have to ignore GC
 17181    mark bits.  */
 17182 
 17183 
 17184 static void
 17185 x_scroll_bar_handle_click (struct scroll_bar *bar,
 17186                            const XEvent *event,
 17187                            struct input_event *emacs_event,
 17188                            Lisp_Object device)
 17189 {
 17190   int left_range, x, top_range, y;
 17191 #ifndef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 17192   int new_start, new_end;
 17193 #endif
 17194 
 17195   if (! WINDOWP (bar->window))
 17196     emacs_abort ();
 17197 
 17198   emacs_event->kind = (bar->horizontal
 17199                        ? HORIZONTAL_SCROLL_BAR_CLICK_EVENT
 17200                        : SCROLL_BAR_CLICK_EVENT);
 17201   emacs_event->code = event->xbutton.button - Button1;
 17202   emacs_event->modifiers
 17203     = (x_x_to_emacs_modifiers (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO
 17204                                (XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (XWINDOW (bar->window)))),
 17205                                event->xbutton.state)
 17206        | (event->type == ButtonRelease
 17207           ? up_modifier
 17208           : down_modifier));
 17209   emacs_event->frame_or_window = bar->window;
 17210   emacs_event->arg = Qnil;
 17211   emacs_event->timestamp = event->xbutton.time;
 17212 
 17213   if (!NILP (device))
 17214     emacs_event->device = device;
 17215 
 17216   if (bar->horizontal)
 17217     {
 17218 
 17219       left_range = HORIZONTAL_SCROLL_BAR_LEFT_RANGE (f, bar->width);
 17220       x = event->xbutton.x - HORIZONTAL_SCROLL_BAR_LEFT_BORDER;
 17221 
 17222       if (x < 0) x = 0;
 17223       if (x > left_range) x = left_range;
 17224 
 17225       if (x < bar->start)
 17226         emacs_event->part = scroll_bar_before_handle;
 17227       else if (x < bar->end + HORIZONTAL_SCROLL_BAR_MIN_HANDLE)
 17228         emacs_event->part = scroll_bar_horizontal_handle;
 17229       else
 17230         emacs_event->part = scroll_bar_after_handle;
 17231 
 17232 #ifndef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 17233       /* If the user has released the handle, set it to its final position.  */
 17234       if (event->type == ButtonRelease && bar->dragging != -1)
 17235         {
 17236           new_start = - bar->dragging;
 17237           new_end = new_start + bar->end - bar->start;
 17238 
 17239           x_scroll_bar_set_handle (bar, new_start, new_end, false);
 17240           bar->dragging = -1;
 17241         }
 17242 #endif
 17243 
 17244       XSETINT (emacs_event->x, left_range);
 17245       XSETINT (emacs_event->y, x);
 17246     }
 17247   else
 17248     {
 17249       top_range
 17250         = VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_TOP_RANGE (f, bar->height);
 17251       y = event->xbutton.y - VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_TOP_BORDER;
 17252 
 17253       if (y < 0) y = 0;
 17254       if (y > top_range) y = top_range;
 17255 
 17256       if (y < bar->start)
 17257         emacs_event->part = scroll_bar_above_handle;
 17258       else if (y < bar->end + VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_MIN_HANDLE)
 17259         emacs_event->part = scroll_bar_handle;
 17260       else
 17261         emacs_event->part = scroll_bar_below_handle;
 17262 
 17263 #ifndef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 17264       /* If the user has released the handle, set it to its final position.  */
 17265       if (event->type == ButtonRelease && bar->dragging != -1)
 17266         {
 17267           new_start = y - bar->dragging;
 17268           new_end = new_start + bar->end - bar->start;
 17269 
 17270           x_scroll_bar_set_handle (bar, new_start, new_end, false);
 17271           bar->dragging = -1;
 17272         }
 17273 #endif
 17274 
 17275       XSETINT (emacs_event->x, y);
 17276       XSETINT (emacs_event->y, top_range);
 17277     }
 17278 }
 17279 
 17280 #ifndef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 17281 
 17282 /* Handle some mouse motion while someone is dragging the scroll bar.
 17283 
 17284    This may be called from a signal handler, so we have to ignore GC
 17285    mark bits.  */
 17286 
 17287 static void
 17288 x_scroll_bar_note_movement (struct scroll_bar *bar,
 17289                             const XMotionEvent *event)
 17290 {
 17291   struct frame *f = XFRAME (XWINDOW (bar->window)->frame);
 17292   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 17293 
 17294   dpyinfo->last_mouse_movement_time = event->time;
 17295   dpyinfo->last_mouse_movement_time_send_event = event->send_event;
 17296   dpyinfo->last_mouse_scroll_bar = bar;
 17297   f->mouse_moved = true;
 17298 
 17299   /* If we're dragging the bar, display it.  */
 17300   if (bar->dragging != -1)
 17301     {
 17302       /* Where should the handle be now?  */
 17303       int new_start = event->y - bar->dragging;
 17304 
 17305       if (new_start != bar->start)
 17306         {
 17307           int new_end = new_start + bar->end - bar->start;
 17308 
 17309           x_scroll_bar_set_handle (bar, new_start, new_end, false);
 17310         }
 17311     }
 17312 }
 17313 
 17314 #endif /* !USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 17315 
 17316 /* Return information to the user about the current position of the mouse
 17317    on the scroll bar.  */
 17318 
 17319 static void
 17320 x_scroll_bar_report_motion (struct frame **fp, Lisp_Object *bar_window,
 17321                             enum scroll_bar_part *part, Lisp_Object *x,
 17322                             Lisp_Object *y, Time *timestamp)
 17323 {
 17324   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (*fp);
 17325   struct scroll_bar *bar = dpyinfo->last_mouse_scroll_bar;
 17326   Window w = bar->x_window;
 17327   struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (XWINDOW (bar->window)));
 17328   int win_x, win_y;
 17329   Window dummy_window;
 17330   int dummy_coord;
 17331   unsigned int dummy_mask;
 17332 
 17333   block_input ();
 17334 
 17335   /* Get the mouse's position relative to the scroll bar window, and
 17336      report that.  */
 17337   if (x_query_pointer (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), w,
 17338 
 17339                        /* Root, child, root x and root y.  */
 17340                        &dummy_window, &dummy_window,
 17341                        &dummy_coord, &dummy_coord,
 17342 
 17343                        /* Position relative to scroll bar.  */
 17344                        &win_x, &win_y,
 17345 
 17346                        /* Mouse buttons and modifier keys.  */
 17347                        &dummy_mask))
 17348     {
 17349       int top_range = VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_TOP_RANGE (f, bar->height);
 17350 
 17351       win_y -= VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_TOP_BORDER;
 17352 
 17353       if (bar->dragging != -1)
 17354         win_y -= bar->dragging;
 17355 
 17356       if (win_y < 0)
 17357         win_y = 0;
 17358       if (win_y > top_range)
 17359         win_y = top_range;
 17360 
 17361       *fp = f;
 17362       *bar_window = bar->window;
 17363 
 17364       if (bar->dragging != -1)
 17365         *part = scroll_bar_handle;
 17366       else if (win_y < bar->start)
 17367         *part = scroll_bar_above_handle;
 17368       else if (win_y < bar->end + VERTICAL_SCROLL_BAR_MIN_HANDLE)
 17369         *part = scroll_bar_handle;
 17370       else
 17371         *part = scroll_bar_below_handle;
 17372 
 17373       XSETINT (*x, win_y);
 17374       XSETINT (*y, top_range);
 17375 
 17376       f->mouse_moved = false;
 17377       dpyinfo->last_mouse_scroll_bar = NULL;
 17378       *timestamp = dpyinfo->last_mouse_movement_time;
 17379     }
 17380 
 17381   unblock_input ();
 17382 }
 17383 
 17384 
 17385 /* Return information to the user about the current position of the mouse
 17386    on the scroll bar.  */
 17387 
 17388 static void
 17389 x_horizontal_scroll_bar_report_motion (struct frame **fp, Lisp_Object *bar_window,
 17390                                        enum scroll_bar_part *part, Lisp_Object *x,
 17391                                        Lisp_Object *y, Time *timestamp)
 17392 {
 17393   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (*fp);
 17394   struct scroll_bar *bar = dpyinfo->last_mouse_scroll_bar;
 17395   Window w = bar->x_window;
 17396   struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (XWINDOW (bar->window)));
 17397   int win_x, win_y;
 17398   Window dummy_window;
 17399   int dummy_coord;
 17400   unsigned int dummy_mask;
 17401 
 17402   block_input ();
 17403 
 17404   /* Get the mouse's position relative to the scroll bar window, and
 17405      report that.  */
 17406   if (x_query_pointer (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), w,
 17407 
 17408                        /* Root, child, root x and root y.  */
 17409                        &dummy_window, &dummy_window,
 17410                        &dummy_coord, &dummy_coord,
 17411 
 17412                        /* Position relative to scroll bar.  */
 17413                        &win_x, &win_y,
 17414 
 17415                        /* Mouse buttons and modifier keys.  */
 17416                        &dummy_mask))
 17417     {
 17418       int left_range = HORIZONTAL_SCROLL_BAR_LEFT_RANGE (f, bar->width);
 17419 
 17420       win_x -= HORIZONTAL_SCROLL_BAR_LEFT_BORDER;
 17421 
 17422       if (bar->dragging != -1)
 17423         win_x -= bar->dragging;
 17424 
 17425       if (win_x < 0)
 17426         win_x = 0;
 17427       if (win_x > left_range)
 17428         win_x = left_range;
 17429 
 17430       *fp = f;
 17431       *bar_window = bar->window;
 17432 
 17433       if (bar->dragging != -1)
 17434         *part = scroll_bar_horizontal_handle;
 17435       else if (win_x < bar->start)
 17436         *part = scroll_bar_before_handle;
 17437       else if (win_x < bar->end + HORIZONTAL_SCROLL_BAR_MIN_HANDLE)
 17438         *part = scroll_bar_handle;
 17439       else
 17440         *part = scroll_bar_after_handle;
 17441 
 17442       XSETINT (*y, win_x);
 17443       XSETINT (*x, left_range);
 17444 
 17445       f->mouse_moved = false;
 17446       dpyinfo->last_mouse_scroll_bar = NULL;
 17447       *timestamp = dpyinfo->last_mouse_movement_time;
 17448     }
 17449 
 17450   unblock_input ();
 17451 }
 17452 
 17453 
 17454 /* The screen has been cleared and foreground or background colors may
 17455    have changed, so the scroll bars need to be redrawn.  Clear the
 17456    scroll bars and redraw them.  */
 17457 
 17458 static void
 17459 x_scroll_bar_clear (struct frame *f)
 17460 {
 17461 #ifndef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 17462   Lisp_Object bar, condemned;
 17463   GC gc = f->output_data.x->normal_gc;
 17464 
 17465   if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel != -1)
 17466     XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 17467                     f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel);
 17468   else
 17469     XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 17470                     FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f));
 17471 
 17472   /* We can have scroll bars even if this is 0,
 17473      if we just turned off scroll bar mode.
 17474      But in that case we should not clear them.  */
 17475   if (FRAME_HAS_VERTICAL_SCROLL_BARS (f))
 17476     {
 17477       condemned = FRAME_CONDEMNED_SCROLL_BARS (f);
 17478       for (bar = FRAME_SCROLL_BARS (f);
 17479            /* This trick allows us to search both the ordinary and
 17480               condemned scroll bar lists with one loop.  */
 17481            !NILP (bar) || (bar = condemned,
 17482                            condemned = Qnil,
 17483                            !NILP (bar));
 17484            bar = XSCROLL_BAR (bar)->next)
 17485         x_scroll_bar_redraw (XSCROLL_BAR (bar));
 17486     }
 17487 
 17488   XSetForeground (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), gc,
 17489                   FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f));
 17490 #endif /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 17491 }
 17492 
 17493 #ifdef ENABLE_CHECKING
 17494 
 17495 /* Record the last 100 characters stored
 17496    to help debug the loss-of-chars-during-GC problem.  */
 17497 
 17498 static int temp_index;
 17499 static short temp_buffer[100];
 17500 
 17501 #define STORE_KEYSYM_FOR_DEBUG(keysym)                          \
 17502   if (temp_index == ARRAYELTS (temp_buffer))                    \
 17503     temp_index = 0;                                             \
 17504   temp_buffer[temp_index++] = (keysym)
 17505 
 17506 #else /* not ENABLE_CHECKING */
 17507 
 17508 #define STORE_KEYSYM_FOR_DEBUG(keysym) ((void)0)
 17509 
 17510 #endif /* ENABLE_CHECKING */
 17511 
 17512 /* Set this to nonzero to fake an "X I/O error"
 17513    on a particular display.  */
 17514 
 17515 static struct x_display_info *XTread_socket_fake_io_error;
 17516 
 17517 /* When we find no input here, we occasionally do a no-op command
 17518    to verify that the X server is still running and we can still talk with it.
 17519    We try all the open displays, one by one.
 17520    This variable is used for cycling thru the displays.  */
 17521 
 17522 static struct x_display_info *next_noop_dpyinfo;
 17523 
 17524 /* Filter events for the current X input method.
 17525    DPYINFO is the display this event is for.
 17526    EVENT is the X event to filter.
 17527 
 17528    Returns non-zero if the event was filtered, caller shall not process
 17529    this event further.
 17530    Returns zero if event is wasn't filtered.  */
 17531 
 17532 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 17533 static int
 17534 x_filter_event (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, XEvent *event)
 17535 {
 17536   /* XFilterEvent returns non-zero if the input method has
 17537    consumed the event.  We pass the frame's X window to
 17538    XFilterEvent because that's the one for which the IC
 17539    was created.  */
 17540 
 17541   struct frame *f1;
 17542 
 17543 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2 && defined USE_GTK
 17544   bool xinput_event = false;
 17545   if (dpyinfo->supports_xi2
 17546       && event->type == GenericEvent
 17547       && (event->xgeneric.extension
 17548           == dpyinfo->xi2_opcode)
 17549       && ((event->xgeneric.evtype
 17550            == XI_KeyPress)
 17551           || (event->xgeneric.evtype
 17552               == XI_KeyRelease)))
 17553     {
 17554       f1 = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo,
 17555                                   ((XIDeviceEvent *)
 17556                                    event->xcookie.data)->event);
 17557       xinput_event = true;
 17558     }
 17559   else
 17560 #endif
 17561     f1 = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo,
 17562                                 event->xclient.window);
 17563 
 17564 #ifdef USE_GTK
 17565   if (!x_gtk_use_native_input
 17566       && !dpyinfo->prefer_native_input)
 17567     {
 17568 #endif
 17569       return XFilterEvent (event, f1 ? FRAME_X_WINDOW (f1) : None);
 17570 #ifdef USE_GTK
 17571     }
 17572   else if (f1 && (event->type == KeyPress
 17573                   || event->type == KeyRelease
 17574 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 17575                   || xinput_event
 17576 #endif
 17577                   ))
 17578     {
 17579       bool result;
 17580 
 17581       block_input ();
 17582       result = xg_filter_key (f1, event);
 17583       unblock_input ();
 17584 
 17585       /* Clear `xg_pending_quit_event' so we don't end up reacting to quit
 17586          events sent outside the main event loop (i.e. those sent from
 17587          inside a popup menu event loop).  */
 17588 
 17589       if (popup_activated ())
 17590         xg_pending_quit_event.kind = NO_EVENT;
 17591 
 17592       if (result && f1)
 17593         /* There will probably be a GDK event generated soon, so
 17594            exercise the wire to make pselect return.  */
 17595         XNoOp (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f1));
 17596 
 17597       return result;
 17598     }
 17599 
 17600   return 0;
 17601 #endif
 17602 }
 17603 #endif
 17604 
 17605 #ifdef USE_GTK
 17606 /* This is the filter function invoked by the GTK event loop.
 17607    It is invoked before the XEvent is translated to a GdkEvent,
 17608    so we have a chance to act on the event before GTK.  */
 17609 static GdkFilterReturn
 17610 event_handler_gdk (GdkXEvent *gxev, GdkEvent *ev, gpointer data)
 17611 {
 17612   XEvent *xev = (XEvent *) gxev;
 17613 
 17614   block_input ();
 17615   if (current_count >= 0)
 17616     {
 17617       struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 17618 
 17619       dpyinfo = x_display_info_for_display (xev->xany.display);
 17620 
 17621 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 17622       /* Filter events for the current X input method.
 17623          GTK calls XFilterEvent but not for key press and release,
 17624          so we do it here.  */
 17625       if ((xev->type == KeyPress || xev->type == KeyRelease)
 17626           && dpyinfo
 17627           && x_filter_event (dpyinfo, xev))
 17628         {
 17629           unblock_input ();
 17630           return GDK_FILTER_REMOVE;
 17631         }
 17632 #elif USE_GTK
 17633       if (dpyinfo && (dpyinfo->prefer_native_input
 17634                       || x_gtk_use_native_input)
 17635           && (xev->type == KeyPress
 17636 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 17637               /* GTK claims cookies for us, so we don't have to claim
 17638                  them here.  */
 17639               || (dpyinfo->supports_xi2
 17640                   && xev->type == GenericEvent
 17641                   && (xev->xgeneric.extension
 17642                       == dpyinfo->xi2_opcode)
 17643                   && ((xev->xgeneric.evtype
 17644                        == XI_KeyPress)
 17645                       || (xev->xgeneric.evtype
 17646                           == XI_KeyRelease)))
 17647 #endif
 17648               ))
 17649         {
 17650           struct frame *f;
 17651 
 17652 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 17653           if (xev->type == GenericEvent)
 17654             f = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo,
 17655                                        ((XIDeviceEvent *) xev->xcookie.data)->event);
 17656           else
 17657 #endif
 17658             f = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, xev->xany.window);
 17659 
 17660           if (f && xg_filter_key (f, xev))
 17661             {
 17662               unblock_input ();
 17663               return GDK_FILTER_REMOVE;
 17664             }
 17665         }
 17666 #endif
 17667 
 17668       if (! dpyinfo)
 17669         current_finish = X_EVENT_NORMAL;
 17670       else
 17671         current_count
 17672           += handle_one_xevent (dpyinfo, xev, &current_finish,
 17673                                 current_hold_quit);
 17674     }
 17675   else
 17676     current_finish = x_dispatch_event (xev, xev->xany.display);
 17677 
 17678   unblock_input ();
 17679 
 17680   if (current_finish == X_EVENT_GOTO_OUT || current_finish == X_EVENT_DROP)
 17681     return GDK_FILTER_REMOVE;
 17682 
 17683   return GDK_FILTER_CONTINUE;
 17684 }
 17685 #endif /* USE_GTK */
 17686 
 17687 
 17688 static void xembed_send_message (struct frame *f, Time,
 17689                                  enum xembed_message,
 17690                                  long detail, long data1, long data2);
 17691 
 17692 static void
 17693 x_net_wm_state (struct frame *f, Window window)
 17694 {
 17695   int value = FULLSCREEN_NONE;
 17696   Lisp_Object lval = Qnil;
 17697   bool sticky = false, shaded = false;
 17698 
 17699   x_get_current_wm_state (f, window, &value, &sticky, &shaded);
 17700 
 17701   switch (value)
 17702     {
 17703     case FULLSCREEN_WIDTH:
 17704       lval = Qfullwidth;
 17705       break;
 17706     case FULLSCREEN_HEIGHT:
 17707       lval = Qfullheight;
 17708       break;
 17709     case FULLSCREEN_BOTH:
 17710       lval = Qfullboth;
 17711       break;
 17712     case FULLSCREEN_MAXIMIZED:
 17713       lval = Qmaximized;
 17714       break;
 17715     }
 17716 
 17717   store_frame_param (f, Qfullscreen, lval);
 17718   store_frame_param (f, Qsticky, sticky ? Qt : Qnil);
 17719   store_frame_param (f, Qshaded, shaded ? Qt : Qnil);
 17720 }
 17721 
 17722 /* Flip back buffers on F if it has undrawn content.  */
 17723 
 17724 static void
 17725 x_flush_dirty_back_buffer_on (struct frame *f)
 17726 {
 17727 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
 17728   if (FRAME_GARBAGED_P (f)
 17729       || buffer_flipping_blocked_p ()
 17730       /* If the frame is not already up to date, do not flush buffers
 17731          on input, as that will result in flicker.  */
 17732       || !FRAME_X_COMPLETE_P (f)
 17733       || !FRAME_X_NEED_BUFFER_FLIP (f))
 17734     return;
 17735 
 17736   show_back_buffer (f);
 17737 #endif
 17738 }
 17739 
 17740 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
 17741 void
 17742 x_scroll_bar_configure (GdkEvent *event)
 17743 {
 17744   XEvent configure;
 17745   GdkDisplay *gdpy;
 17746   Display *dpy;
 17747 
 17748   configure.xconfigure.type = ConfigureNotify;
 17749   configure.xconfigure.serial = 0;
 17750   configure.xconfigure.send_event = event->configure.send_event;
 17751   configure.xconfigure.x = event->configure.x;
 17752   configure.xconfigure.y = event->configure.y;
 17753   configure.xconfigure.width = event->configure.width;
 17754   configure.xconfigure.height = event->configure.height;
 17755   configure.xconfigure.border_width = 0;
 17756   configure.xconfigure.event = GDK_WINDOW_XID (event->configure.window);
 17757   configure.xconfigure.window = GDK_WINDOW_XID (event->configure.window);
 17758   configure.xconfigure.above = None;
 17759   configure.xconfigure.override_redirect = False;
 17760 
 17761   gdpy = gdk_window_get_display (event->configure.window);
 17762   dpy = gdk_x11_display_get_xdisplay (gdpy);
 17763 
 17764   x_dispatch_event (&configure, dpy);
 17765 }
 17766 #endif
 17767 
 17768 /**
 17769   mouse_or_wdesc_frame: When not dropping and the mouse was grabbed
 17770   for DPYINFO, return the frame where the mouse was seen last.  If
 17771   there's no such frame, return the frame according to WDESC.  When
 17772   dropping, return the frame according to WDESC.  If there's no such
 17773   frame and the mouse was grabbed for DPYINFO, return the frame where
 17774   the mouse was seen last.  In either case, never return a tooltip
 17775   frame.  */
 17776 static struct frame *
 17777 mouse_or_wdesc_frame (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, int wdesc)
 17778 {
 17779   struct frame *lm_f = (gui_mouse_grabbed (dpyinfo)
 17780                         ? dpyinfo->last_mouse_frame
 17781                         : NULL);
 17782 
 17783   if (lm_f && !EQ (track_mouse, Qdropping)
 17784       && !EQ (track_mouse, Qdrag_source))
 17785     return lm_f;
 17786   else
 17787     {
 17788       struct frame *w_f = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, wdesc);
 17789 
 17790       /* Do not return a tooltip frame.  */
 17791       if (!w_f || FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (w_f))
 17792         return EQ (track_mouse, Qdropping) ? lm_f : NULL;
 17793       else
 17794         /* When dropping it would be probably nice to raise w_f
 17795            here.  */
 17796         return w_f;
 17797     }
 17798 }
 17799 
 17800 static void
 17801 x_dnd_compute_tip_xy (int *root_x, int *root_y, Lisp_Object attributes)
 17802 {
 17803   Lisp_Object monitor, geometry;
 17804   int min_x, min_y, max_x, max_y;
 17805   int width, height;
 17806 
 17807   width = FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (XFRAME (tip_frame));
 17808   height = FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (XFRAME (tip_frame));
 17809 
 17810   max_y = -1;
 17811 
 17812   /* Try to determine the monitor where the mouse pointer is and
 17813      its geometry.  See bug#22549.  */
 17814   while (CONSP (attributes))
 17815     {
 17816       monitor = XCAR (attributes);
 17817       geometry = assq_no_quit (Qgeometry, monitor);
 17818 
 17819       if (CONSP (geometry))
 17820         {
 17821           min_x = XFIXNUM (Fnth (make_fixnum (1), geometry));
 17822           min_y = XFIXNUM (Fnth (make_fixnum (2), geometry));
 17823           max_x = min_x + XFIXNUM (Fnth (make_fixnum (3), geometry));
 17824           max_y = min_y + XFIXNUM (Fnth (make_fixnum (4), geometry));
 17825 
 17826           if (min_x <= *root_x && *root_x < max_x
 17827               && min_y <= *root_y && *root_y < max_y)
 17828             break;
 17829 
 17830           max_y = -1;
 17831         }
 17832 
 17833       attributes = XCDR (attributes);
 17834     }
 17835 
 17836   /* It was not possible to determine the monitor's geometry, so we
 17837      assign some sane defaults here: */
 17838   if (max_y < 0)
 17839     {
 17840       min_x = 0;
 17841       min_y = 0;
 17842       max_x = x_display_pixel_width (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame));
 17843       max_y = x_display_pixel_height (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame));
 17844     }
 17845 
 17846   if (*root_y + XFIXNUM (tip_dy) <= min_y)
 17847     *root_y = min_y; /* Can happen for negative dy */
 17848   else if (*root_y + XFIXNUM (tip_dy) + height <= max_y)
 17849     /* It fits below the pointer */
 17850     *root_y += XFIXNUM (tip_dy);
 17851   else if (height + XFIXNUM (tip_dy) + min_y <= *root_y)
 17852     /* It fits above the pointer.  */
 17853     *root_y -= height + XFIXNUM (tip_dy);
 17854   else
 17855     /* Put it on the top.  */
 17856     *root_y = min_y;
 17857 
 17858   if (*root_x + XFIXNUM (tip_dx) <= min_x)
 17859     *root_x = 0; /* Can happen for negative dx */
 17860   else if (*root_x + XFIXNUM (tip_dx) + width <= max_x)
 17861     /* It fits to the right of the pointer.  */
 17862     *root_x += XFIXNUM (tip_dx);
 17863   else if (width + XFIXNUM (tip_dx) + min_x <= *root_x)
 17864     /* It fits to the left of the pointer.  */
 17865     *root_x -= width + XFIXNUM (tip_dx);
 17866   else
 17867     /* Put it left justified on the screen -- it ought to fit that way.  */
 17868     *root_x = min_x;
 17869 }
 17870 
 17871 static void
 17872 x_dnd_update_tooltip_position (int root_x, int root_y)
 17873 {
 17874   struct frame *tip_f;
 17875 
 17876   if (!x_dnd_in_progress || !x_dnd_update_tooltip)
 17877     return;
 17878 
 17879   if (!FRAMEP (tip_frame))
 17880     return;
 17881 
 17882   tip_f = XFRAME (tip_frame);
 17883 
 17884   if (!FRAME_LIVE_P (tip_f)
 17885       || !FRAME_VISIBLE_P (tip_f)
 17886       || (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (tip_f)
 17887           != FRAME_X_DISPLAY (x_dnd_frame)))
 17888     return;
 17889 
 17890   if (tip_window != None
 17891       && FIXNUMP (tip_dx) && FIXNUMP (tip_dy))
 17892     {
 17893       x_dnd_compute_tip_xy (&root_x, &root_y,
 17894                             x_dnd_monitors);
 17895 
 17896       if (x_dnd_last_tooltip_valid
 17897           && root_x == x_dnd_last_tooltip_x
 17898           && root_y == x_dnd_last_tooltip_y)
 17899         return;
 17900 
 17901       x_dnd_last_tooltip_x = root_x;
 17902       x_dnd_last_tooltip_y = root_y;
 17903       x_dnd_last_tooltip_valid = true;
 17904 
 17905       XMoveWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (x_dnd_frame),
 17906                    tip_window, root_x, root_y);
 17907     }
 17908 }
 17909 
 17910 static void
 17911 x_dnd_update_tooltip_now (void)
 17912 {
 17913   int root_x, root_y;
 17914   Window root, child;
 17915   int win_x, win_y;
 17916   unsigned int mask;
 17917   Bool rc;
 17918   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 17919 
 17920   if (!x_dnd_in_progress || !x_dnd_update_tooltip)
 17921     return;
 17922 
 17923   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame);
 17924 
 17925 #ifndef HAVE_XINPUT2
 17926   rc = XQueryPointer (dpyinfo->display,
 17927                       dpyinfo->root_window,
 17928                       &root, &child, &root_x,
 17929                       &root_y, &win_x, &win_y,
 17930                       &mask);
 17931 #else
 17932   rc = x_query_pointer_1 (dpyinfo, x_dnd_pointer_device,
 17933                           dpyinfo->root_window,
 17934                           &root, &child, &root_x,
 17935                           &root_y, &win_x, &win_y,
 17936                           &mask);
 17937 #endif
 17938 
 17939   if (rc)
 17940     x_dnd_update_tooltip_position (root_x, root_y);
 17941 }
 17942 
 17943 /* Get the window underneath the pointer, see if it moved, and update
 17944    the DND state accordingly.  */
 17945 static void
 17946 x_dnd_update_state (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, Time timestamp)
 17947 {
 17948   int root_x, root_y, dummy_x, dummy_y, target_proto, motif_style;
 17949   unsigned int dummy_mask;
 17950   Window dummy, dummy_child, target, toplevel;
 17951   xm_top_level_leave_message lmsg;
 17952   xm_top_level_enter_message emsg;
 17953   xm_drag_motion_message dmsg;
 17954   xm_drop_start_message dsmsg;
 17955   bool was_frame;
 17956 
 17957   if (x_query_pointer_1 (dpyinfo,
 17958 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 17959                          x_dnd_pointer_device,
 17960 #else
 17961                          -1,
 17962 #endif
 17963                          dpyinfo->root_window,
 17964                          &dummy, &dummy_child,
 17965                          &root_x, &root_y,
 17966                          &dummy_x, &dummy_y,
 17967                          &dummy_mask))
 17968     {
 17969       target = x_dnd_get_target_window (dpyinfo, root_x,
 17970                                         root_y, &target_proto,
 17971                                         &motif_style, &toplevel,
 17972                                         &was_frame);
 17973 
 17974       if (toplevel != x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel)
 17975         {
 17976           if (toplevel != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame)
 17977               && x_dnd_return_frame == 1)
 17978             x_dnd_return_frame = 2;
 17979 
 17980           if (x_dnd_return_frame == 2
 17981               && x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, toplevel))
 17982             {
 17983               if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 17984                   && x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1
 17985                   && x_dnd_last_seen_window != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame))
 17986                 x_dnd_send_leave (x_dnd_frame, x_dnd_last_seen_window,
 17987                                   x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel);
 17988               else if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 17989                        && XM_DRAG_STYLE_IS_DYNAMIC (x_dnd_last_motif_style)
 17990                        && !x_dnd_disable_motif_drag
 17991                        && x_dnd_last_seen_window != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame))
 17992                 {
 17993                   if (!x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 17994                     xm_setup_drag_info (dpyinfo, x_dnd_frame);
 17995 
 17996                   lmsg.reason = XM_DRAG_REASON (XM_DRAG_ORIGINATOR_INITIATOR,
 17997                                                 XM_DRAG_REASON_TOP_LEVEL_LEAVE);
 17998                   lmsg.byteorder = XM_BYTE_ORDER_CUR_FIRST;
 17999                   lmsg.zero = 0;
 18000                   lmsg.timestamp = timestamp;
 18001                   lmsg.source_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame);
 18002 
 18003                   if (x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 18004                     xm_send_top_level_leave_message (dpyinfo, FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame),
 18005                                                      x_dnd_last_seen_window, &lmsg);
 18006                 }
 18007 
 18008               x_dnd_end_window = x_dnd_last_seen_window;
 18009               x_dnd_last_seen_window = None;
 18010               x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel = None;
 18011               x_dnd_in_progress = false;
 18012               x_dnd_return_frame_object
 18013                 = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, toplevel);
 18014               x_dnd_return_frame = 3;
 18015               x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = false;
 18016               target = None;
 18017             }
 18018         }
 18019 
 18020       if (target != x_dnd_last_seen_window)
 18021         {
 18022           if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 18023               && x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1
 18024               && x_dnd_last_seen_window != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame))
 18025             x_dnd_send_leave (x_dnd_frame, x_dnd_last_seen_window,
 18026                               x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel);
 18027           else if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 18028                    && XM_DRAG_STYLE_IS_DYNAMIC (x_dnd_last_motif_style)
 18029                    && !x_dnd_disable_motif_drag
 18030                    && x_dnd_last_seen_window != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame))
 18031             {
 18032               if (!x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 18033                 xm_setup_drag_info (dpyinfo, x_dnd_frame);
 18034 
 18035               lmsg.reason = XM_DRAG_REASON (XM_DRAG_ORIGINATOR_INITIATOR,
 18036                                             XM_DRAG_REASON_TOP_LEVEL_LEAVE);
 18037               lmsg.byteorder = XM_BYTE_ORDER_CUR_FIRST;
 18038               lmsg.zero = 0;
 18039               lmsg.timestamp = timestamp;
 18040               lmsg.source_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame);
 18041 
 18042               if (x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 18043                 xm_send_top_level_leave_message (dpyinfo, FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame),
 18044                                                  x_dnd_last_seen_window, &lmsg);
 18045             }
 18046 
 18047           x_dnd_action = None;
 18048           x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel = toplevel;
 18049           x_dnd_last_seen_window = target;
 18050           x_dnd_last_protocol_version = target_proto;
 18051           x_dnd_last_motif_style = motif_style;
 18052           x_dnd_last_window_is_frame = was_frame;
 18053 
 18054           if (target != None && x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1)
 18055             x_dnd_send_enter (x_dnd_frame, target, x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel,
 18056                               x_dnd_last_protocol_version);
 18057           else if (target != None && XM_DRAG_STYLE_IS_DYNAMIC (x_dnd_last_motif_style)
 18058                    && !x_dnd_disable_motif_drag)
 18059             {
 18060               if (!x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 18061                 xm_setup_drag_info (dpyinfo, x_dnd_frame);
 18062 
 18063               emsg.reason = XM_DRAG_REASON (XM_DRAG_ORIGINATOR_INITIATOR,
 18064                                             XM_DRAG_REASON_TOP_LEVEL_ENTER);
 18065               emsg.byteorder = XM_BYTE_ORDER_CUR_FIRST;
 18066               emsg.zero = 0;
 18067               emsg.timestamp = timestamp;
 18068               emsg.source_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame);
 18069               emsg.index_atom = x_dnd_motif_atom;
 18070 
 18071               if (x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 18072                 xm_send_top_level_enter_message (dpyinfo, FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame),
 18073                                                  target, &emsg);
 18074             }
 18075         }
 18076       else
 18077         x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel = toplevel;
 18078 
 18079       if (x_dnd_last_window_is_frame && target != None)
 18080         x_dnd_note_self_position (dpyinfo, target, root_x, root_y);
 18081       else if (x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1 && target != None)
 18082         x_dnd_send_position (x_dnd_frame, target,
 18083                              x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel,
 18084                              x_dnd_last_protocol_version,
 18085                              root_x, root_y,
 18086                              x_dnd_selection_timestamp,
 18087                              x_dnd_wanted_action, 0,
 18088 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 18089                              x_dnd_keyboard_state
 18090 #else
 18091                              0
 18092 #endif
 18093                              );
 18094       else if (XM_DRAG_STYLE_IS_DYNAMIC (x_dnd_last_motif_style) && target != None
 18095                && !x_dnd_disable_motif_drag)
 18096         {
 18097           if (!x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 18098             xm_setup_drag_info (dpyinfo, x_dnd_frame);
 18099 
 18100           dmsg.reason = XM_DRAG_REASON (XM_DRAG_ORIGINATOR_INITIATOR,
 18101                                         XM_DRAG_REASON_DRAG_MOTION);
 18102           dmsg.byteorder = XM_BYTE_ORDER_CUR_FIRST;
 18103           dmsg.side_effects
 18104             = XM_DRAG_SIDE_EFFECT (xm_side_effect_from_action (dpyinfo,
 18105                                                                x_dnd_wanted_action),
 18106                                    XM_DROP_SITE_VALID, x_dnd_motif_operations,
 18107                                    (!x_dnd_xm_use_help
 18108                                     ? XM_DROP_ACTION_DROP
 18109                                     : XM_DROP_ACTION_DROP_HELP));
 18110           dmsg.timestamp = timestamp;
 18111           dmsg.x = root_x;
 18112           dmsg.y = root_y;
 18113 
 18114           if (x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 18115             xm_send_drag_motion_message (dpyinfo, FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame),
 18116                                          target, &dmsg);
 18117         }
 18118 
 18119       x_dnd_update_tooltip_position (root_x, root_y);
 18120     }
 18121   /* The pointer moved out of the screen.  */
 18122   else if (x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1)
 18123     {
 18124       if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 18125           && x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1)
 18126         x_dnd_send_leave (x_dnd_frame,
 18127                           x_dnd_last_seen_window,
 18128                           x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel);
 18129       else if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 18130                && !XM_DRAG_STYLE_IS_DROP_ONLY (x_dnd_last_motif_style)
 18131                && x_dnd_last_motif_style != XM_DRAG_STYLE_NONE
 18132                && x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 18133         {
 18134           dsmsg.reason = XM_DRAG_REASON (XM_DRAG_ORIGINATOR_INITIATOR,
 18135                                          XM_DRAG_REASON_DROP_START);
 18136           dmsg.byteorder = XM_BYTE_ORDER_CUR_FIRST;
 18137           dsmsg.timestamp = timestamp;
 18138           dsmsg.side_effects
 18139             = XM_DRAG_SIDE_EFFECT (xm_side_effect_from_action (dpyinfo,
 18140                                                                x_dnd_wanted_action),
 18141                                    XM_DROP_SITE_VALID, x_dnd_motif_operations,
 18142                                    XM_DROP_ACTION_DROP_CANCEL);
 18143           dsmsg.x = 0;
 18144           dsmsg.y = 0;
 18145           dsmsg.index_atom = x_dnd_motif_atom;
 18146           dsmsg.source_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame);
 18147 
 18148           x_dnd_send_xm_leave_for_drop (dpyinfo, x_dnd_frame,
 18149                                         x_dnd_last_seen_window, timestamp);
 18150           xm_send_drop_message (dpyinfo, FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame),
 18151                                 x_dnd_last_seen_window, &dsmsg);
 18152         }
 18153 
 18154       x_dnd_end_window = x_dnd_last_seen_window;
 18155       x_dnd_last_seen_window = None;
 18156       x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel = None;
 18157       x_dnd_in_progress = false;
 18158       x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = false;
 18159       x_dnd_frame = NULL;
 18160     }
 18161 }
 18162 
 18163 int
 18164 x_display_pixel_height (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 18165 {
 18166   if (dpyinfo->screen_height)
 18167     return dpyinfo->screen_height;
 18168 
 18169   return HeightOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen);
 18170 }
 18171 
 18172 int
 18173 x_display_pixel_width (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 18174 {
 18175   if (dpyinfo->screen_width)
 18176     return dpyinfo->screen_width;
 18177 
 18178   return WidthOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen);
 18179 }
 18180 
 18181 /* Handle events from each display until CELL's car becomes non-nil,
 18182    or TIMEOUT elapses.  */
 18183 void
 18184 x_wait_for_cell_change (Lisp_Object cell, struct timespec timeout)
 18185 {
 18186   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 18187   fd_set fds;
 18188   int fd, maxfd;
 18189 #ifndef USE_GTK
 18190   int finish, rc;
 18191   XEvent event;
 18192   fd_set rfds;
 18193 #endif
 18194   struct input_event hold_quit;
 18195   struct timespec current, at;
 18196 
 18197   at = timespec_add (current_timespec (), timeout);
 18198 
 18199 #ifndef USE_GTK
 18200   FD_ZERO (&rfds);
 18201   rc = -1;
 18202 #endif
 18203 
 18204   while (true)
 18205     {
 18206       FD_ZERO (&fds);
 18207       maxfd = -1;
 18208 
 18209       for (dpyinfo = x_display_list; dpyinfo;
 18210            dpyinfo = dpyinfo->next)
 18211         {
 18212           fd = ConnectionNumber (dpyinfo->display);
 18213 
 18214 #ifndef USE_GTK
 18215           if ((rc < 0 || FD_ISSET (fd, &rfds))
 18216               /* If pselect failed, the erroring display's IO error
 18217                  handler will eventually be called.  */
 18218               && XPending (dpyinfo->display))
 18219             {
 18220               while (XPending (dpyinfo->display))
 18221                 {
 18222                   EVENT_INIT (hold_quit);
 18223 
 18224                   XNextEvent (dpyinfo->display, &event);
 18225                   handle_one_xevent (dpyinfo, &event,
 18226                                      &finish, &hold_quit);
 18227 
 18228                   if (!NILP (XCAR (cell)))
 18229                     return;
 18230 
 18231                   if (finish == X_EVENT_GOTO_OUT)
 18232                     break;
 18233 
 18234                   /* Make us quit now.  */
 18235                   if (hold_quit.kind != NO_EVENT)
 18236                     kbd_buffer_store_event (&hold_quit);
 18237                 }
 18238             }
 18239 #endif
 18240 
 18241           if (fd > maxfd)
 18242             maxfd = fd;
 18243 
 18244           eassert (fd < FD_SETSIZE);
 18245           FD_SET (fd, &fds);
 18246         }
 18247 
 18248       /* Prevent events from being lost (from GTK's point of view) by
 18249          using GDK to run the event loop.  */
 18250 #ifdef USE_GTK
 18251       while (gtk_events_pending ())
 18252         {
 18253           EVENT_INIT (hold_quit);
 18254           current_count = 0;
 18255           current_hold_quit = &hold_quit;
 18256           current_finish = X_EVENT_NORMAL;
 18257 
 18258           gtk_main_iteration ();
 18259 
 18260           current_count = -1;
 18261           current_hold_quit = NULL;
 18262 
 18263           /* Make us quit now.  */
 18264           if (hold_quit.kind != NO_EVENT)
 18265             kbd_buffer_store_event (&hold_quit);
 18266 
 18267           if (!NILP (XCAR (cell)))
 18268             return;
 18269 
 18270           if (current_finish == X_EVENT_GOTO_OUT)
 18271             break;
 18272         }
 18273 #endif
 18274 
 18275       eassert (maxfd >= 0);
 18276 
 18277       current = current_timespec ();
 18278 
 18279       if (timespec_cmp (at, current) < 0
 18280           || !NILP (XCAR (cell)))
 18281         return;
 18282 
 18283       timeout = timespec_sub (at, current);
 18284 
 18285 #ifndef USE_GTK
 18286       rc = pselect (maxfd + 1, &fds, NULL, NULL, &timeout, NULL);
 18287 
 18288       if (rc >= 0)
 18289         rfds = fds;
 18290 #else
 18291       pselect (maxfd + 1, &fds, NULL, NULL, &timeout, NULL);
 18292 #endif
 18293     }
 18294 }
 18295 
 18296 /* Find whether or not an undelivered MONITORS_CHANGED_EVENT is
 18297    already on the event queue.  DPYINFO is the display any such event
 18298    must apply to.  */
 18299 
 18300 static bool
 18301 x_find_monitors_changed_event (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 18302 {
 18303   union buffered_input_event *event;
 18304 
 18305   event = kbd_fetch_ptr;
 18306 
 18307   while (event != kbd_store_ptr)
 18308     {
 18309       if (event->ie.kind == MONITORS_CHANGED_EVENT
 18310           && XTERMINAL (event->ie.arg) == dpyinfo->terminal)
 18311         return true;
 18312 
 18313       event = X_NEXT_KBD_EVENT (event);
 18314     }
 18315 
 18316   return false;
 18317 }
 18318 
 18319 #ifdef USE_GTK
 18320 static void
 18321 x_monitors_changed_cb (GdkScreen *gscr, gpointer user_data)
 18322 {
 18323   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 18324   struct input_event ie;
 18325   Lisp_Object current_monitors, terminal;
 18326   GdkDisplay *gdpy;
 18327   Display *dpy;
 18328 
 18329   gdpy = gdk_screen_get_display (gscr);
 18330   dpy = gdk_x11_display_get_xdisplay (gdpy);
 18331   dpyinfo = x_display_info_for_display (dpy);
 18332 
 18333   if (!dpyinfo)
 18334     return;
 18335 
 18336   if (x_find_monitors_changed_event (dpyinfo))
 18337     return;
 18338 
 18339   XSETTERMINAL (terminal, dpyinfo->terminal);
 18340 
 18341   current_monitors
 18342     = Fx_display_monitor_attributes_list (terminal);
 18343 
 18344   if (NILP (Fequal (current_monitors,
 18345                     dpyinfo->last_monitor_attributes_list)))
 18346     {
 18347       EVENT_INIT (ie);
 18348       ie.kind = MONITORS_CHANGED_EVENT;
 18349       ie.arg = terminal;
 18350 
 18351       kbd_buffer_store_event (&ie);
 18352 
 18353       if (x_dnd_in_progress && x_dnd_update_tooltip)
 18354         x_dnd_monitors = current_monitors;
 18355 
 18356       x_dnd_update_tooltip_now ();
 18357     }
 18358 
 18359   dpyinfo->last_monitor_attributes_list = current_monitors;
 18360 }
 18361 #endif
 18362 
 18363 /* Extract the root window coordinates from the client message EVENT
 18364    if it is a message that we already understand.  Return false if the
 18365    event was not understood.  */
 18366 static bool
 18367 x_coords_from_dnd_message (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 18368                            XEvent *event, int *x_out, int *y_out)
 18369 {
 18370   xm_drag_motion_message dmsg;
 18371   xm_drag_motion_reply dreply;
 18372   xm_drop_start_message smsg;
 18373   xm_drop_start_reply reply;
 18374   unsigned long kde_data;
 18375 
 18376   if (event->type != ClientMessage)
 18377     return false;
 18378 
 18379   if (event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_XdndPosition)
 18380     {
 18381       if (event->xclient.format != 32)
 18382         return false;
 18383 
 18384       *x_out = (((unsigned long) event->xclient.data.l[2]) >> 16
 18385                 & 0xffff);
 18386       *y_out = (event->xclient.data.l[2] & 0xffff);
 18387 
 18388       return true;
 18389     }
 18390 
 18391   if ((event->xclient.message_type
 18392        == dpyinfo->Xatom_MOTIF_DRAG_AND_DROP_MESSAGE)
 18393       && event->xclient.format == 8)
 18394     {
 18395       if (!xm_read_drag_motion_message (event, &dmsg))
 18396         {
 18397           *x_out = dmsg.x;
 18398           *y_out = dmsg.y;
 18399 
 18400           return true;
 18401         }
 18402       else if (!xm_read_drag_motion_reply (event, &dreply))
 18403         {
 18404           *x_out = dreply.better_x;
 18405           *y_out = dreply.better_y;
 18406 
 18407           return true;
 18408         }
 18409       else if (!xm_read_drop_start_message (event, &smsg))
 18410         {
 18411           *x_out = smsg.x;
 18412           *y_out = smsg.y;
 18413 
 18414           return true;
 18415         }
 18416       else if (!xm_read_drop_start_reply (event, &reply))
 18417         {
 18418           *x_out = reply.better_x;
 18419           *y_out = reply.better_y;
 18420 
 18421           return true;
 18422         }
 18423     }
 18424 
 18425   if (((event->xclient.message_type
 18426         == dpyinfo->Xatom_DndProtocol)
 18427        || (event->xclient.message_type
 18428            == dpyinfo->Xatom_DND_PROTOCOL))
 18429       && event->xclient.format == 32
 18430       /* Check that the version of the old KDE protocol is new
 18431          enough to include coordinates.  */
 18432       && event->xclient.data.l[4])
 18433     {
 18434       kde_data = (unsigned long) event->xclient.data.l[3];
 18435 
 18436       *x_out = (kde_data & 0xffff);
 18437       *y_out = (kde_data >> 16 & 0xffff);
 18438 
 18439       return true;
 18440     }
 18441 
 18442   return false;
 18443 }
 18444 
 18445 static void
 18446 x_handle_wm_state (struct frame *f, struct input_event *ie)
 18447 {
 18448   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 18449   Atom type;
 18450   int format;
 18451   unsigned long nitems, bytes_after;
 18452   unsigned char *data;
 18453   unsigned long *state;
 18454 
 18455   data = NULL;
 18456   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 18457 
 18458   if (XGetWindowProperty (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 18459                           dpyinfo->Xatom_wm_state, 0, 2, False,
 18460                           AnyPropertyType, &type, &format, &nitems,
 18461                           &bytes_after, &data) != Success)
 18462     return;
 18463 
 18464   if (!data || nitems != 2 || format != 32)
 18465     {
 18466       if (data)
 18467         XFree (data);
 18468 
 18469       return;
 18470     }
 18471 
 18472   state = (unsigned long *) data;
 18473 
 18474   if (state[0] == NormalState && FRAME_ICONIFIED_P (f))
 18475     {
 18476       /* The frame has been deiconified.  It has not been withdrawn
 18477          and is now visible.  */
 18478       SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 1);
 18479       SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, false);
 18480       f->output_data.x->has_been_visible = true;
 18481 
 18482       ie->kind = DEICONIFY_EVENT;
 18483       XSETFRAME (ie->frame_or_window, f);
 18484     }
 18485   else if (state[0] == IconicState
 18486            /* _NET_WM_STATE_HIDDEN should be used if the window
 18487               manager supports that.  */
 18488            && !x_wm_supports (f, dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_state_hidden))
 18489     {
 18490       /* The frame is actually iconified right now.  Mark it as
 18491          such.  */
 18492 
 18493       SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 0);
 18494       SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, true);
 18495 
 18496       ie->kind = ICONIFY_EVENT;
 18497       XSETFRAME (ie->frame_or_window, f);
 18498     }
 18499 
 18500   /* state[0] can also be WithdrawnState, meaning that the window has
 18501      been withdrawn and is no longer iconified.  However, Emacs sets
 18502      the correct flags upon withdrawing the window, so there is no
 18503      need to do anything here.  */
 18504 
 18505   XFree (data);
 18506 }
 18507 
 18508 #ifdef HAVE_XFIXES
 18509 
 18510 static bool
 18511 x_handle_selection_monitor_event (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 18512                                   const XEvent *event)
 18513 {
 18514   XFixesSelectionNotifyEvent *notify;
 18515   int i;
 18516 
 18517   notify = (XFixesSelectionNotifyEvent *) event;
 18518 
 18519   if (notify->window != dpyinfo->selection_tracking_window)
 18520     return false;
 18521 
 18522   for (i = 0; i < dpyinfo->n_monitored_selections; ++i)
 18523     {
 18524       /* We don't have to keep track of timestamps here.  */
 18525       if (notify->selection == dpyinfo->monitored_selections[i].name)
 18526         dpyinfo->monitored_selections[i].owner = notify->owner;
 18527     }
 18528 
 18529   return true;
 18530 }
 18531 
 18532 Window
 18533 x_find_selection_owner (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, Atom selection)
 18534 {
 18535   int i;
 18536 
 18537   for (i = 0; i < dpyinfo->n_monitored_selections; ++i)
 18538     {
 18539       if (selection == dpyinfo->monitored_selections[i].name)
 18540         return dpyinfo->monitored_selections[i].owner;
 18541     }
 18542 
 18543   return X_INVALID_WINDOW;
 18544 }
 18545 
 18546 #endif
 18547 
 18548 /* Handles the XEvent EVENT on display DPYINFO.
 18549 
 18550    *FINISH is X_EVENT_GOTO_OUT if caller should stop reading events.
 18551    *FINISH is zero if caller should continue reading events.
 18552    *FINISH is X_EVENT_DROP if event should not be passed to the toolkit.
 18553    *EVENT is unchanged unless we're processing KeyPress event.
 18554 
 18555    We return the number of characters stored into the buffer.  */
 18556 
 18557 static int
 18558 handle_one_xevent (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 18559 #ifndef HAVE_XINPUT2
 18560                    const XEvent *event,
 18561 #else
 18562                    XEvent *event,
 18563 #endif
 18564                    int *finish, struct input_event *hold_quit)
 18565 {
 18566   union buffered_input_event inev;
 18567   int count = 0;
 18568   int do_help = 0;
 18569 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 18570   struct xi_device_t *gen_help_device;
 18571   Time gen_help_time UNINIT;
 18572 #endif
 18573   ptrdiff_t nbytes = 0;
 18574   struct frame *any, *f = NULL, *mouse_frame;
 18575   Mouse_HLInfo *hlinfo = &dpyinfo->mouse_highlight;
 18576   /* This holds the state XLookupString needs to implement dead keys
 18577      and other tricks known as "compose processing".  _X Window System_
 18578      says that a portable program can't use this, but Stephen Gildea assures
 18579      me that letting the compiler initialize it to zeros will work okay.  */
 18580   static XComposeStatus compose_status;
 18581   XEvent configureEvent;
 18582   XEvent next_event;
 18583   Lisp_Object coding;
 18584 #if defined USE_X_TOOLKIT && defined HAVE_XINPUT2
 18585   /* Some XInput 2 events are important for Motif and Lucid menu bars
 18586      to work correctly, so they must be translated into core events
 18587      before being passed to XtDispatchEvent.  */
 18588   bool use_copy = false;
 18589   XEvent copy;
 18590 #elif defined USE_GTK && !defined HAVE_GTK3 && defined HAVE_XINPUT2
 18591   GdkEvent *copy = NULL;
 18592   GdkDisplay *gdpy = gdk_x11_lookup_xdisplay (dpyinfo->display);
 18593 #endif
 18594   int dx, dy;
 18595 
 18596   /* Avoid warnings when SAFE_ALLOCA is not actually used.  */
 18597 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2 || defined HAVE_XKB || defined HAVE_X_I18N
 18598   USE_SAFE_ALLOCA;
 18599 #endif
 18600 
 18601   /* This function is not reentrant, so input should be blocked before
 18602      it is called.  */
 18603 
 18604   if (!input_blocked_p ())
 18605     emacs_abort ();
 18606 
 18607   *finish = X_EVENT_NORMAL;
 18608 
 18609   EVENT_INIT (inev.ie);
 18610   inev.ie.kind = NO_EVENT;
 18611   inev.ie.arg = Qnil;
 18612 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 18613   gen_help_device = NULL;
 18614 #endif
 18615 
 18616   /* Ignore events coming from various extensions, such as XFIXES and
 18617      XKB.  */
 18618   if (event->type < LASTEvent)
 18619     {
 18620 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 18621       if (event->type != GenericEvent)
 18622 #endif
 18623         any = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xany.window);
 18624 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 18625       else
 18626         any = NULL;
 18627 #endif
 18628     }
 18629   else
 18630     any = NULL;
 18631 
 18632   if (any && any->wait_event_type == event->type)
 18633     any->wait_event_type = 0; /* Indicates we got it.  */
 18634 
 18635   switch (event->type)
 18636     {
 18637     case ClientMessage:
 18638       {
 18639         int rc;
 18640 
 18641         if (((x_dnd_in_progress
 18642               && FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame) == dpyinfo)
 18643              || (x_dnd_waiting_for_finish
 18644                  && FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_finish_frame) == dpyinfo))
 18645             && event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_XdndStatus)
 18646           {
 18647             Window target;
 18648             unsigned long r1, r2;
 18649             int root_x, root_y;
 18650             bool button;
 18651 
 18652             target = event->xclient.data.l[0];
 18653 
 18654             if (x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1
 18655                 && x_dnd_in_progress
 18656                 && target == x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel
 18657                 /* The XDND documentation is not very clearly worded.
 18658                    But this should be the correct behavior, since
 18659                    "kDNDStatusSendHereFlag" in the reference
 18660                    implementation is 2, and means the mouse rect
 18661                    should be ignored.  */
 18662                 && !(event->xclient.data.l[1] & 2))
 18663               {
 18664                 r1 = event->xclient.data.l[2];
 18665                 r2 = event->xclient.data.l[3];
 18666 
 18667                 x_dnd_mouse_rect_target = target;
 18668                 x_dnd_mouse_rect.x = (r1 & 0xffff0000) >> 16;
 18669                 x_dnd_mouse_rect.y = (r1 & 0xffff);
 18670                 x_dnd_mouse_rect.width = (r2 & 0xffff0000) >> 16;
 18671                 x_dnd_mouse_rect.height = (r2 & 0xffff);
 18672               }
 18673             else
 18674               x_dnd_mouse_rect_target = None;
 18675 
 18676             if (x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1
 18677                 && (x_dnd_in_progress
 18678                     && target == x_dnd_last_seen_window))
 18679               {
 18680                 if (event->xclient.data.l[1] & 1)
 18681                   {
 18682                     if (x_dnd_last_protocol_version >= 2)
 18683                       x_dnd_action = event->xclient.data.l[4];
 18684                     else
 18685                       x_dnd_action = dpyinfo->Xatom_XdndActionCopy;
 18686                   }
 18687                 else
 18688                   x_dnd_action = None;
 18689               }
 18690 
 18691             /* Send any pending XdndPosition message.  */
 18692             if (x_dnd_waiting_for_status_window == target)
 18693               {
 18694                 if (x_dnd_pending_send_position.type != 0)
 18695                   {
 18696                     /* If the last XdndStatus specified a mouse
 18697                        rectangle and this event falls inside, don't
 18698                        send the event, but clear
 18699                        x_dnd_waiting_for_status_window instead.  */
 18700 
 18701                     root_x = x_dnd_pending_send_position_root_x;
 18702                     root_y = x_dnd_pending_send_position_root_y;
 18703                     button = x_dnd_pending_send_position_button;
 18704 
 18705                     if (target == x_dnd_mouse_rect_target
 18706                         && x_dnd_mouse_rect.width
 18707                         && x_dnd_mouse_rect.height
 18708                         /* Ignore the mouse rectangle if we're
 18709                            supposed to be sending a button press
 18710                            instead.  */
 18711                         && !button
 18712                         && (root_x >= x_dnd_mouse_rect.x
 18713                             && root_x < (x_dnd_mouse_rect.x
 18714                                          + x_dnd_mouse_rect.width)
 18715                             && root_y >= x_dnd_mouse_rect.y
 18716                             && root_y < (x_dnd_mouse_rect.y
 18717                                          + x_dnd_mouse_rect.height)))
 18718                       x_dnd_waiting_for_status_window = None;
 18719                     else
 18720                       {
 18721                         x_ignore_errors_for_next_request (dpyinfo, 0);
 18722                         XSendEvent (dpyinfo->display, target,
 18723                                     False, NoEventMask,
 18724                                     &x_dnd_pending_send_position);
 18725                         x_stop_ignoring_errors (dpyinfo);
 18726                         x_dnd_pending_send_position.type = 0;
 18727 
 18728                         /* Since we sent another XdndPosition message, we
 18729                            have to wait for another one in reply, so don't
 18730                            reset `x_dnd_waiting_for_status_window'
 18731                            here.  */
 18732                       }
 18733                   }
 18734                 else
 18735                   x_dnd_waiting_for_status_window = None;
 18736 
 18737                 /* Send any pending drop if warranted.  */
 18738                 if (x_dnd_waiting_for_finish && x_dnd_need_send_drop
 18739                     && x_dnd_waiting_for_status_window == None)
 18740                   {
 18741                     if (event->xclient.data.l[1] & 1)
 18742                       {
 18743                         if (x_dnd_send_drop_proto >= 2)
 18744                           x_dnd_action = event->xclient.data.l[4];
 18745                         else
 18746                           x_dnd_action = dpyinfo->Xatom_XdndActionCopy;
 18747                       }
 18748                     else
 18749                       x_dnd_action = None;
 18750 
 18751                     x_dnd_waiting_for_finish
 18752                       = x_dnd_send_drop (x_dnd_finish_frame,
 18753                                          target,
 18754                                          x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel,
 18755                                          x_dnd_selection_timestamp,
 18756                                          x_dnd_send_drop_proto);
 18757                   }
 18758               }
 18759 
 18760             goto done;
 18761           }
 18762 
 18763         if (event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_XdndFinished
 18764             && (x_dnd_waiting_for_finish && !x_dnd_waiting_for_motif_finish)
