 18765             /* Also check that the display is correct, since
 18766                `x_dnd_pending_finish_target' could still be valid on
 18767                another X server.  */
 18768             && dpyinfo->display == x_dnd_finish_display
 18769             && event->xclient.data.l[0] == x_dnd_pending_finish_target)
 18770           {
 18771             x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = false;
 18772 
 18773             if (x_dnd_waiting_for_finish_proto >= 5)
 18774               x_dnd_action = event->xclient.data.l[2];
 18775 
 18776             if (x_dnd_waiting_for_finish_proto >= 5
 18777                 && !(event->xclient.data.l[1] & 1))
 18778               x_dnd_action = None;
 18779 
 18780             goto done;
 18781           }
 18782 
 18783         if ((event->xclient.message_type
 18784              == dpyinfo->Xatom_MOTIF_DRAG_AND_DROP_MESSAGE)
 18785             && x_dnd_waiting_for_finish
 18786             && x_dnd_waiting_for_motif_finish == 1
 18787             && dpyinfo == x_dnd_waiting_for_motif_finish_display)
 18788           {
 18789             xm_drop_start_reply reply;
 18790             uint16_t operation, status, action;
 18791 
 18792             if (!xm_read_drop_start_reply (event, &reply))
 18793               {
 18794                 operation = XM_DRAG_SIDE_EFFECT_OPERATION (reply.side_effects);
 18795                 status = XM_DRAG_SIDE_EFFECT_SITE_STATUS (reply.side_effects);
 18796                 action = XM_DRAG_SIDE_EFFECT_DROP_ACTION (reply.side_effects);
 18797 
 18798                 if (operation != XM_DRAG_MOVE
 18799                     && operation != XM_DRAG_COPY
 18800                     && XM_DRAG_OPERATION_IS_LINK (operation))
 18801                   {
 18802                     x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = false;
 18803                     goto done;
 18804                   }
 18805 
 18806                 if (status != XM_DROP_SITE_VALID
 18807                     || (action == XM_DROP_ACTION_DROP_CANCEL
 18808                         || action == XM_DROP_ACTION_DROP_HELP))
 18809                   {
 18810                     x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = false;
 18811                     goto done;
 18812                   }
 18813 
 18814                 switch (operation)
 18815                   {
 18816                   case XM_DRAG_MOVE:
 18817                     x_dnd_action_symbol = QXdndActionMove;
 18818                     break;
 18819 
 18820                   case XM_DRAG_COPY:
 18821                     x_dnd_action_symbol = QXdndActionCopy;
 18822                     break;
 18823 
 18824                     /* This means XM_DRAG_OPERATION_IS_LINK (operation).  */
 18825                   default:
 18826                     x_dnd_action_symbol = QXdndActionLink;
 18827                     break;
 18828                   }
 18829 
 18830                 x_dnd_waiting_for_motif_finish = 2;
 18831                 goto done;
 18832               }
 18833           }
 18834 
 18835         if (event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_EMACS_TMP
 18836             && event->xclient.format == 8)
 18837           {
 18838             /* This is actually an hourglass message.  Set whether or
 18839                not events from here on have the hourglass enabled.  */
 18840 
 18841             if (any)
 18842               FRAME_X_OUTPUT (any)->hourglass_p = event->xclient.data.b[0];
 18843           }
 18844 
 18845         if (event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_wm_protocols
 18846             && event->xclient.format == 32)
 18847           {
 18848             if (event->xclient.data.l[0] == dpyinfo->Xatom_wm_take_focus)
 18849               {
 18850                 /* Use the value returned by x_any_window_to_frame
 18851                    because this could be the shell widget window
 18852                    if the frame has no title bar.  */
 18853                 f = any;
 18854 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 18855                 /* Not quite sure this is needed -pd */
 18856                 if (f && FRAME_XIC (f))
 18857                   XSetICFocus (FRAME_XIC (f));
 18858 #endif
 18859 #if false
 18860       /* Emacs sets WM hints whose `input' field is `true'.  This
 18861          instructs the WM to set the input focus automatically for
 18862          Emacs with a call to XSetInputFocus.  Setting WM_TAKE_FOCUS
 18863          tells the WM to send us a ClientMessage WM_TAKE_FOCUS after
 18864          it has set the focus.  So, XSetInputFocus below is not
 18865          needed.
 18866 
 18867          The call to XSetInputFocus below has also caused trouble.  In
 18868          cases where the XSetInputFocus done by the WM and the one
 18869          below are temporally close (on a fast machine), the call
 18870          below can generate additional FocusIn events which confuse
 18871          Emacs.  */
 18872 
 18873                 /* Since we set WM_TAKE_FOCUS, we must call
 18874                    XSetInputFocus explicitly.  But not if f is null,
 18875                    since that might be an event for a deleted frame.  */
 18876                 if (f)
 18877                   {
 18878                     Display *d = event->xclient.display;
 18879                     /* Catch and ignore errors, in case window has been
 18880                        iconified by a window manager such as GWM.  */
 18881                     x_catch_errors (d);
 18882                     XSetInputFocus (d, event->xclient.window,
 18883                                     /* The ICCCM says this is
 18884                                        the only valid choice.  */
 18885                                     RevertToParent,
 18886                                     event->xclient.data.l[1]);
 18887                     x_uncatch_errors ();
 18888                   }
 18889                 /* Not certain about handling scroll bars here */
 18890 #endif
 18891                 /* Set the provided time as the user time, which is
 18892                    required for SetInputFocus to work correctly after
 18893                    taking the input focus.  */
 18894 
 18895                 /* Time can be sign extended if retrieved from a client message.
 18896                    Make sure it is always 32 bits, or systems with 64-bit longs
 18897                    will crash after 24 days of X server uptime.  (bug#59480) */
 18898                 x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, (event->xclient.data.l[1]
 18899                                                         & 0xffffffff),
 18900                                               true, true);
 18901                 goto done;
 18902               }
 18903 
 18904             if (event->xclient.data.l[0] == dpyinfo->Xatom_wm_save_yourself)
 18905               {
 18906                 /* Save state modify the WM_COMMAND property to
 18907                    something which can reinstate us.  This notifies
 18908                    the session manager, who's looking for such a
 18909                    PropertyNotify.  Can restart processing when
 18910                    a keyboard or mouse event arrives.  */
 18911                 /* If we have a session manager, don't set this.
 18912                    KDE will then start two Emacsen, one for the
 18913                    session manager and one for this. */
 18914 #ifdef HAVE_X_SM
 18915                 if (! x_session_have_connection ())
 18916 #endif
 18917                   {
 18918                     f = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo,
 18919                                                event->xclient.window);
 18920                     /* This is just so we only give real data once
 18921                        for a single Emacs process.  */
 18922                     if (f == SELECTED_FRAME ())
 18923                       XSetCommand (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 18924                                    event->xclient.window,
 18925                                    initial_argv, initial_argc);
 18926                     else if (f)
 18927                       XSetCommand (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 18928                                    event->xclient.window,
 18929                                    0, 0);
 18930                   }
 18931                 goto done;
 18932               }
 18933 
 18934             if (event->xclient.data.l[0] == dpyinfo->Xatom_wm_delete_window)
 18935               {
 18936                 f = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo,
 18937                                            event->xclient.window);
 18938 
 18939                 if (!f)
 18940                   goto OTHER; /* May be a dialog that is to be removed  */
 18941 
 18942                 inev.ie.kind = DELETE_WINDOW_EVENT;
 18943                 inev.ie.timestamp = event->xclient.data.l[1];
 18944                 XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 18945                 goto done;
 18946               }
 18947 
 18948 
 18949             if (event->xclient.data.l[0] == dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_ping
 18950                 /* Handling window stacking changes during
 18951                    drag-and-drop requires Emacs to select for
 18952                    SubstructureNotifyMask, which in turn causes the
 18953                    message to be sent to Emacs itself using the event
 18954                    mask specified by the EWMH.  To avoid an infinite
 18955                    loop, make sure the client message's window is not
 18956                    the root window if DND is in progress.  */
 18957                 && (!(x_dnd_in_progress
 18958                       || x_dnd_waiting_for_finish)
 18959                     || event->xclient.window != dpyinfo->root_window)
 18960                 && event->xclient.format == 32)
 18961               {
 18962                 XEvent send_event = *event;
 18963 
 18964                 send_event.xclient.window = dpyinfo->root_window;
 18965                 XSendEvent (dpyinfo->display, dpyinfo->root_window, False,
 18966                             SubstructureRedirectMask | SubstructureNotifyMask,
 18967                             &send_event);
 18968 
 18969                 *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 18970                 goto done;
 18971               }
 18972 
 18973 #if defined HAVE_XSYNC
 18974             if (event->xclient.data.l[0] == dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_sync_request
 18975                 && event->xclient.format == 32
 18976                 && dpyinfo->xsync_supported_p)
 18977               {
 18978                 struct frame *f
 18979                   = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo,
 18980                                            event->xclient.window);
 18981 #if defined HAVE_GTK3
 18982                 GtkWidget *widget;
 18983                 GdkWindow *window;
 18984                 GdkFrameClock *frame_clock;
 18985 #endif
 18986 
 18987                 if (f)
 18988                   {
 18989 #ifndef HAVE_GTK3
 18990                     if (event->xclient.data.l[4] == 0)
 18991                       {
 18992                         XSyncIntsToValue (&FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->pending_basic_counter_value,
 18993                                           event->xclient.data.l[2], event->xclient.data.l[3]);
 18994                         FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->sync_end_pending_p = true;
 18995                       }
 18996                     else if (event->xclient.data.l[4] == 1)
 18997                       {
 18998                         XSyncIntsToValue (&FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->resize_counter_value,
 18999                                           event->xclient.data.l[2],
 19000                                           event->xclient.data.l[3]);
 19001 
 19002                         FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->ext_sync_end_pending_p = true;
 19003                       }
 19004 
 19005                     *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 19006 #else
 19007                     widget = FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f);
 19008                     window = gtk_widget_get_window (widget);
 19009                     eassert (window);
 19010 
 19011                     /* This could be a (former) child frame for which
 19012                        frame synchronization was disabled.  Enable it
 19013                        now.  */
 19014                     gdk_x11_window_set_frame_sync_enabled (window, TRUE);
 19015 
 19016                     if (widget && !FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->xg_sync_end_pending_p)
 19017                       {
 19018                         frame_clock = gdk_window_get_frame_clock (window);
 19019                         eassert (frame_clock);
 19020 
 19021                         gdk_frame_clock_request_phase (frame_clock,
 19022                                                        GDK_FRAME_CLOCK_PHASE_BEFORE_PAINT);
 19023                         FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->xg_sync_end_pending_p = true;
 19024                       }
 19025 #endif
 19026                     goto done;
 19027                   }
 19028               }
 19029 #endif
 19030 
 19031             goto done;
 19032           }
 19033 
 19034         if (event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_wm_configure_denied)
 19035           goto done;
 19036 
 19037         if (event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_wm_window_moved)
 19038           {
 19039             int new_x, new_y;
 19040             f = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xclient.window);
 19041 
 19042             new_x = event->xclient.data.s[0];
 19043             new_y = event->xclient.data.s[1];
 19044 
 19045             if (f)
 19046               {
 19047                 f->left_pos = new_x;
 19048                 f->top_pos = new_y;
 19049               }
 19050             goto done;
 19051           }
 19052 
 19053 #ifdef X_TOOLKIT_EDITRES
 19054         if (event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_editres)
 19055           {
 19056             f = any;
 19057             if (f)
 19058               {
 19059                 _XEditResCheckMessages (f->output_data.x->widget,
 19060                                         NULL, (XEvent *) event, NULL);
 19061                 goto done;
 19062               }
 19063 
 19064             goto OTHER;
 19065           }
 19066 #endif /* X_TOOLKIT_EDITRES */
 19067 
 19068         if (event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_DONE
 19069             || event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_PAGE)
 19070           {
 19071             /* Ghostview job completed.  Kill it.  We could
 19072                reply with "Next" if we received "Page", but we
 19073                currently never do because we are interested in
 19074                images, only, which should have 1 page.  */
 19075             f = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xclient.window);
 19076             if (!f)
 19077               goto OTHER;
 19078 #ifndef USE_CAIRO
 19079             Pixmap pixmap = (Pixmap) event->xclient.data.l[1];
 19080             /* FIXME: why does this sometimes generate a BadMatch
 19081                error?  */
 19082             x_catch_errors (dpyinfo->display);
 19083             x_kill_gs_process (pixmap, f);
 19084             x_uncatch_errors ();
 19085             expose_frame (f, 0, 0, 0, 0);
 19086 #endif  /* !USE_CAIRO */
 19087             goto done;
 19088           }
 19089 
 19090 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 19091         /* Scroll bar callbacks send a ClientMessage from which
 19092            we construct an input_event.  */
 19093         if (event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_Scrollbar)
 19094           {
 19095             /* Convert the scroll bar event to an input event using
 19096                the first window entered into the scroll bar event
 19097                queue. */
 19098             x_scroll_bar_to_input_event (dpyinfo, event, &inev.ie);
 19099 
 19100             *finish = X_EVENT_GOTO_OUT;
 19101             goto done;
 19102           }
 19103         else if (event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_Horizontal_Scrollbar)
 19104           {
 19105             /* Convert the horizontal scroll bar event to an input
 19106                event using the first window entered into the scroll
 19107                bar event queue. */
 19108             x_horizontal_scroll_bar_to_input_event (dpyinfo, event,
 19109                                                     &inev.ie);
 19110 
 19111             *finish = X_EVENT_GOTO_OUT;
 19112             goto done;
 19113           }
 19114 #endif /* USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 19115 
 19116         /* XEmbed messages from the embedder (if any).  */
 19117         if (event->xclient.message_type == dpyinfo->Xatom_XEMBED)
 19118           {
 19119             enum xembed_message msg = event->xclient.data.l[1];
 19120             if (msg == XEMBED_FOCUS_IN || msg == XEMBED_FOCUS_OUT)
 19121               x_detect_focus_change (dpyinfo, any, event, &inev.ie);
 19122 
 19123             *finish = X_EVENT_GOTO_OUT;
 19124             goto done;
 19125           }
 19126 
 19127 #if defined HAVE_XSYNC && !defined USE_GTK && defined HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME
 19128         /* These messages are sent by the compositing manager after a
 19129            frame is drawn under extended synchronization.  */
 19130         if (event->xclient.message_type
 19131             == dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_frame_drawn)
 19132           {
 19133             if (any)
 19134               x_sync_handle_frame_drawn (dpyinfo, (XEvent *) event, any);
 19135 
 19136             goto done;
 19137           }
 19138 
 19139         if (event->xclient.message_type
 19140             == dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_frame_timings)
 19141           goto done;
 19142 #endif
 19143 
 19144         if (xft_settings_event (dpyinfo, event))
 19145           goto done;
 19146 
 19147         f = any;
 19148         /* We don't want to ever leak tooltip frames to Lisp code.  */
 19149         if (!f || FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (f))
 19150           goto OTHER;
 19151 
 19152         /* These values are always used initialized, but GCC doesn't
 19153            know that.  */
 19154         dx = 0;
 19155         dy = 0;
 19156 
 19157         rc = x_coords_from_dnd_message (dpyinfo, (XEvent *) event,
 19158                                         &dx, &dy);
 19159 
 19160         if (x_handle_dnd_message (f, &event->xclient, dpyinfo, &inev.ie,
 19161                                   rc, dx, dy))
 19162           *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 19163       }
 19164       break;
 19165 
 19166     case SelectionNotify:
 19167 #if defined USE_X_TOOLKIT || defined USE_GTK
 19168       if (!x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xselection.requestor))
 19169         goto OTHER;
 19170 #endif /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT and not USE_GTK */
 19171 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
 19172       /* GTK 3 apparently chokes on these events since they have no
 19173          associated device.  (bug#56869, another bug as well that I
 19174          can't find) */
 19175       *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 19176 #endif
 19177       x_handle_selection_notify (&event->xselection);
 19178       break;
 19179 
 19180     case SelectionClear:        /* Someone has grabbed ownership.  */
 19181 #if defined USE_X_TOOLKIT || defined USE_GTK
 19182       if (!x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xselectionclear.window))
 19183         goto OTHER;
 19184 #endif /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT and not USE_GTK */
 19185 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
 19186       *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 19187 #endif
 19188       {
 19189         const XSelectionClearEvent *eventp = &event->xselectionclear;
 19190 
 19191         if (eventp->selection == dpyinfo->motif_drag_atom
 19192             && (eventp->time == CurrentTime
 19193                 || dpyinfo->motif_drag_atom_time <= eventp->time))
 19194           dpyinfo->motif_drag_atom = None;
 19195 
 19196         inev.sie.kind = SELECTION_CLEAR_EVENT;
 19197         SELECTION_EVENT_DPYINFO (&inev.sie) = dpyinfo;
 19198         SELECTION_EVENT_SELECTION (&inev.sie) = eventp->selection;
 19199         SELECTION_EVENT_TIME (&inev.sie) = eventp->time;
 19200 
 19201         if (x_use_pending_selection_requests)
 19202           {
 19203             x_push_selection_request (&inev.sie);
 19204             EVENT_INIT (inev.ie);
 19205           }
 19206       }
 19207       break;
 19208 
 19209     case SelectionRequest:      /* Someone wants our selection.  */
 19210 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 19211       if (!x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xselectionrequest.owner))
 19212         goto OTHER;
 19213 #endif /* USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 19214 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
 19215       *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 19216 #endif
 19217       {
 19218         const XSelectionRequestEvent *eventp = &event->xselectionrequest;
 19219 
 19220         inev.sie.kind = SELECTION_REQUEST_EVENT;
 19221         SELECTION_EVENT_DPYINFO (&inev.sie) = dpyinfo;
 19222         SELECTION_EVENT_REQUESTOR (&inev.sie) = eventp->requestor;
 19223         SELECTION_EVENT_SELECTION (&inev.sie) = eventp->selection;
 19224         SELECTION_EVENT_TARGET (&inev.sie) = eventp->target;
 19225         SELECTION_EVENT_PROPERTY (&inev.sie) = eventp->property;
 19226         SELECTION_EVENT_TIME (&inev.sie) = eventp->time;
 19227 
 19228         /* If drag-and-drop or another modal dialog/menu is in
 19229            progress, handle SelectionRequest events immediately, by
 19230            pushing it onto the selection queue.  */
 19231 
 19232         if (x_use_pending_selection_requests)
 19233           {
 19234             x_push_selection_request (&inev.sie);
 19235             EVENT_INIT (inev.ie);
 19236           }
 19237 
 19238         if (x_dnd_waiting_for_finish
 19239             && x_dnd_waiting_for_motif_finish == 2
 19240             && dpyinfo == x_dnd_waiting_for_motif_finish_display
 19241             && eventp->selection == x_dnd_motif_atom
 19242             && (eventp->target == dpyinfo->Xatom_XmTRANSFER_SUCCESS
 19243                 || eventp->target == dpyinfo->Xatom_XmTRANSFER_FAILURE))
 19244           {
 19245             x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = false;
 19246 
 19247             /* If the transfer failed, then return nil from
 19248                `x-begin-drag'.  */
 19249             if (eventp->target == dpyinfo->Xatom_XmTRANSFER_FAILURE)
 19250               x_dnd_action = None;
 19251           }
 19252       }
 19253       break;
 19254 
 19255     case PropertyNotify:
 19256       if (x_dnd_in_progress && x_dnd_use_toplevels
 19257           && dpyinfo == FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame)
 19258           && event->xproperty.atom == dpyinfo->Xatom_wm_state)
 19259         {
 19260           struct x_client_list_window *tem, *last;
 19261 
 19262           for (last = NULL, tem = x_dnd_toplevels; tem;
 19263                last = tem, tem = tem->next)
 19264             {
 19265               if (tem->window == event->xproperty.window)
 19266                 {
 19267                   Atom actual_type;
 19268                   int actual_format, rc;
 19269                   unsigned long nitems, bytesafter;
 19270                   unsigned char *data = NULL;
 19271 
 19272                   if (event->xproperty.state == PropertyDelete)
 19273                     {
 19274                       if (!last)
 19275                         x_dnd_toplevels = tem->next;
 19276                       else
 19277                         last->next = tem->next;
 19278 
 19279 #ifdef HAVE_XSHAPE
 19280                       if (tem->n_input_rects != -1)
 19281                         xfree (tem->input_rects);
 19282                       if (tem->n_bounding_rects != -1)
 19283                         xfree (tem->bounding_rects);
 19284 #endif
 19285                       xfree (tem);
 19286                     }
 19287                   else
 19288                     {
 19289                       x_catch_errors (dpyinfo->display);
 19290                       rc = XGetWindowProperty (dpyinfo->display,
 19291                                                event->xproperty.window,
 19292                                                dpyinfo->Xatom_wm_state,
 19293                                                0, 2, False, AnyPropertyType,
 19294                                                &actual_type, &actual_format,
 19295                                                &nitems, &bytesafter, &data);
 19296 
 19297                       if (!x_had_errors_p (dpyinfo->display) && rc == Success && data
 19298                           && nitems == 2 && actual_format == 32)
 19299                         tem->wm_state = ((unsigned long *) data)[0];
 19300                       else
 19301                         tem->wm_state = WithdrawnState;
 19302 
 19303                       if (data)
 19304                         XFree (data);
 19305                       x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
 19306                     }
 19307 
 19308                   x_dnd_update_state (dpyinfo, event->xproperty.time);
 19309                   break;
 19310                 }
 19311             }
 19312         }
 19313 
 19314       f = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xproperty.window);
 19315       if (f && event->xproperty.atom == dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_state
 19316           /* This should never happen with embedded windows.  */
 19317           && !FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f))
 19318         {
 19319           bool not_hidden = x_handle_net_wm_state (f, &event->xproperty);
 19320 
 19321           if (not_hidden && FRAME_ICONIFIED_P (f))
 19322             {
 19323               if (CONSP (frame_size_history))
 19324                 frame_size_history_plain
 19325                   (f, build_string ("PropertyNotify, not hidden & iconified"));
 19326 
 19327               /* Gnome shell does not iconify us when C-z is pressed.
 19328                  It hides the frame.  So if our state says we aren't
 19329                  hidden anymore, treat it as deiconified.  */
 19330               SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 1);
 19331               SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, false);
 19332 
 19333               f->output_data.x->has_been_visible = true;
 19334               inev.ie.kind = DEICONIFY_EVENT;
 19335 #if defined USE_GTK && defined HAVE_GTK3
 19336               /* If GTK3 wants to impose some old size here (Bug#24526),
 19337                  tell it that the current size is what we want.  */
 19338               if (f->was_invisible)
 19339                 {
 19340                   xg_frame_set_char_size
 19341                     (f, FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f), FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f));
 19342                   f->was_invisible = false;
 19343                 }
 19344 #endif
 19345               XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 19346             }
 19347           else if (!not_hidden && !FRAME_ICONIFIED_P (f))
 19348             {
 19349               if (CONSP (frame_size_history))
 19350                 frame_size_history_plain
 19351                   (f, build_string ("PropertyNotify, hidden & not iconified"));
 19352 
 19353               SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 0);
 19354               SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, true);
 19355               inev.ie.kind = ICONIFY_EVENT;
 19356               XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 19357             }
 19358         }
 19359 
 19360       if (f && event->xproperty.atom == dpyinfo->Xatom_wm_state
 19361           && !FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f) && !FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))
 19362         /* Handle WM_STATE.  We use this to clear the iconified flag
 19363            on a frame if it is set.
 19364 
 19365            GTK builds ignore deiconifying frames on FocusIn or Expose
 19366            by default, and cannot wait for the window manager to
 19367            remove _NET_WM_STATE_HIDDEN, as it is ambiguous when not
 19368            set.  Handling UnmapNotify also checks for
 19369            _NET_WM_STATE_HIDDEN, and thus suffers from the same
 19370            problem.  */
 19371         x_handle_wm_state (f, &inev.ie);
 19372 
 19373       if (f && FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->alpha_identical_p
 19374           && (event->xproperty.atom
 19375               == dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_window_opacity))
 19376         {
 19377 #ifndef USE_XCB
 19378           int rc, actual_format;
 19379           Atom actual;
 19380           unsigned char *tmp_data;
 19381           unsigned long n, left, opacity;
 19382 
 19383           tmp_data = NULL;
 19384 #else
 19385           xcb_get_property_cookie_t opacity_cookie;
 19386           xcb_get_property_reply_t *opacity_reply;
 19387           xcb_generic_error_t *error;
 19388           bool rc;
 19389           uint32_t value;
 19390 #endif
 19391 
 19392           if (event->xproperty.state == PropertyDelete)
 19393             {
 19394               f->alpha[0] = 1.0;
 19395               f->alpha[1] = 1.0;
 19396 
 19397               store_frame_param (f, Qalpha, Qnil);
 19398             }
 19399           else
 19400             {
 19401 #ifndef USE_XCB
 19402               rc = XGetWindowProperty (dpyinfo->display, FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 19403                                        dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_window_opacity,
 19404                                        0, 1, False, AnyPropertyType, &actual,
 19405                                        &actual_format, &n, &left, &tmp_data);
 19406 
 19407               if (rc == Success && actual_format == 32
 19408                   && (actual == XA_CARDINAL
 19409                       /* Some broken programs set the opacity property
 19410                          to those types, but window managers accept
 19411                          them anyway.  */
 19412                       || actual == XA_ATOM
 19413                       || actual == XA_WINDOW) && n)
 19414                 {
 19415                   opacity = *(unsigned long *) tmp_data & OPAQUE;
 19416                   f->alpha[0] = (double) opacity / (double) OPAQUE;
 19417                   f->alpha[1] = (double) opacity / (double) OPAQUE;
 19418 
 19419                   store_frame_param (f, Qalpha, make_float (f->alpha[0]));
 19420                 }
 19421               else
 19422                 {
 19423                   f->alpha[0] = 1.0;
 19424                   f->alpha[1] = 1.0;
 19425 
 19426                   store_frame_param (f, Qalpha, Qnil);
 19427                 }
 19428 #else
 19429               opacity_cookie
 19430                 = xcb_get_property (dpyinfo->xcb_connection, 0,
 19431                                     (xcb_window_t) FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 19432                                     (xcb_atom_t) dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_window_opacity,
 19433                                     XA_CARDINAL, 0, 1);
 19434               opacity_reply
 19435                 = xcb_get_property_reply (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
 19436                                           opacity_cookie, &error);
 19437 
 19438               if (!opacity_reply)
 19439                 free (error), rc = false;
 19440               else
 19441                 rc = (opacity_reply->format == 32
 19442                       && (opacity_reply->type == XA_CARDINAL
 19443                           || opacity_reply->type == XA_ATOM
 19444                           || opacity_reply->type == XA_WINDOW)
 19445                       && (xcb_get_property_value_length (opacity_reply) >= 4));
 19446 
 19447               if (rc)
 19448                 {
 19449                   value = *(uint32_t *) xcb_get_property_value (opacity_reply);
 19450 
 19451                   f->alpha[0] = (double) value / (double) OPAQUE;
 19452                   f->alpha[1] = (double) value / (double) OPAQUE;
 19453                   store_frame_param (f, Qalpha, make_float (f->alpha[0]));
 19454                 }
 19455               else
 19456                 {
 19457                   f->alpha[0] = 1.0;
 19458                   f->alpha[1] = 1.0;
 19459 
 19460                   store_frame_param (f, Qalpha, Qnil);
 19461                 }
 19462 
 19463               if (opacity_reply)
 19464                 free (opacity_reply);
 19465 #endif
 19466             }
 19467 
 19468 #ifndef USE_XCB
 19469           if (tmp_data)
 19470             XFree (tmp_data);
 19471 #endif
 19472         }
 19473 
 19474       if (event->xproperty.window == dpyinfo->root_window
 19475           && (event->xproperty.atom == dpyinfo->Xatom_net_client_list_stacking
 19476               || event->xproperty.atom == dpyinfo->Xatom_net_current_desktop)
 19477           && x_dnd_in_progress
 19478           && dpyinfo == FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame))
 19479         {
 19480           if (x_dnd_use_toplevels)
 19481             {
 19482               x_dnd_free_toplevels (true);
 19483 
 19484               if (x_dnd_compute_toplevels (dpyinfo))
 19485                 {
 19486                   x_dnd_free_toplevels (true);
 19487                   x_dnd_use_toplevels = false;
 19488                 }
 19489             }
 19490 
 19491           x_dnd_update_state (dpyinfo, event->xproperty.time);
 19492         }
 19493 
 19494       x_handle_property_notify (&event->xproperty);
 19495       xft_settings_event (dpyinfo, event);
 19496       goto OTHER;
 19497 
 19498     case ReparentNotify:
 19499       f = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xreparent.window);
 19500       if (f)
 19501         {
 19502 #ifndef USE_GTK
 19503           if (FRAME_OUTPUT_DATA (f)->parent_desc
 19504               && FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f))
 19505             {
 19506               /* The frame's embedder was destroyed; mark the frame as
 19507                  no longer embedded, and map the frame.  An
 19508                  UnmapNotify event must have previously been received
 19509                  during the start of save-set processing.  */
 19510 
 19511               FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->explicit_parent = false;
 19512 
 19513               /* Remove the leftover XEMBED_INFO property.  */
 19514               XDeleteProperty (dpyinfo->display, FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 19515                                dpyinfo->Xatom_XEMBED_INFO);
 19516               x_make_frame_visible (f);
 19517             }
 19518 #endif
 19519 
 19520           /* Maybe we shouldn't set this for child frames ??  */
 19521           f->output_data.x->parent_desc = event->xreparent.parent;
 19522 
 19523           if (!FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))
 19524             {
 19525               x_real_positions (f, &f->left_pos, &f->top_pos);
 19526 
 19527               /* Perhaps reparented due to a WM restart.  Reset this.  */
 19528               dpyinfo->wm_type = X_WMTYPE_UNKNOWN;
 19529               dpyinfo->net_supported_window = 0;
 19530 
 19531 #ifndef USE_GTK
 19532               /* The window manager could have restarted and the new
 19533                  window manager might not support user time windows,
 19534                  so update what is used accordingly.
 19535 
 19536                  Note that this doesn't handle changes between
 19537                  non-reparenting window managers.  */
 19538               if (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->has_been_visible)
 19539                 x_update_frame_user_time_window (f);
 19540 #endif
 19541             }
 19542           else
 19543             {
 19544               Window root;
 19545               unsigned int dummy_uint;
 19546 
 19547               XGetGeometry (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 19548                             &root, &f->left_pos, &f->top_pos,
 19549                             &dummy_uint, &dummy_uint, &dummy_uint, &dummy_uint);
 19550             }
 19551 
 19552           x_set_frame_alpha (f);
 19553         }
 19554       goto OTHER;
 19555 
 19556     case Expose:
 19557 
 19558 #ifdef HAVE_XWIDGETS
 19559       {
 19560         struct xwidget_view *xv;
 19561 
 19562         xv = xwidget_view_from_window (event->xexpose.window);
 19563 
 19564         if (xv)
 19565           {
 19566             xwidget_expose (xv);
 19567             goto OTHER;
 19568           }
 19569       }
 19570 #endif
 19571 
 19572       f = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xexpose.window);
 19573       if (f)
 19574         {
 19575           if (!FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
 19576             {
 19577               /* By default, do not set the frame's visibility here, see
 19578                  https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/emacs-devel/2017-02/msg00133.html.
 19579                  The default behavior can be overridden by setting
 19580                  'x-set-frame-visibility-more-laxly' (Bug#49955,
 19581                  Bug#53298).  */
 19582               if (EQ (x_set_frame_visibility_more_laxly, Qexpose)
 19583                   || EQ (x_set_frame_visibility_more_laxly, Qt))
 19584                 {
 19585                   SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 1);
 19586                   SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, false);
 19587                 }
 19588 
 19589 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
 19590               if (FRAME_X_DOUBLE_BUFFERED_P (f))
 19591                 x_drop_xrender_surfaces (f);
 19592 #endif
 19593               f->output_data.x->has_been_visible = true;
 19594               SET_FRAME_GARBAGED (f);
 19595             }
 19596           else if (FRAME_GARBAGED_P (f))
 19597             {
 19598 #ifdef USE_GTK
 19599               /* Go around the back buffer and manually clear the
 19600                  window the first time we show it.  This way, we avoid
 19601                  showing users the sanity-defying horror of whatever
 19602                  GtkWindow is rendering beneath us.  We've garbaged
 19603                  the frame, so we'll redraw the whole thing on next
 19604                  redisplay anyway.  Yuck.  */
 19605               x_clear_area1 (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 19606                              FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 19607                              event->xexpose.x, event->xexpose.y,
 19608                              event->xexpose.width, event->xexpose.height,
 19609                              0);
 19610               x_clear_under_internal_border (f);
 19611 #endif
 19612             }
 19613 
 19614           if (!FRAME_GARBAGED_P (f))
 19615             {
 19616 #if defined USE_X_TOOLKIT && defined USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 19617               if (f->output_data.x->edit_widget)
 19618                 /* The widget's expose proc will be run in this
 19619                    case.  */
 19620                 goto OTHER;
 19621 #endif
 19622 #ifdef USE_GTK
 19623               /* This seems to be needed for GTK 2.6 and later, see
 19624                  https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=15398.  */
 19625               x_clear_area (f,
 19626                             event->xexpose.x, event->xexpose.y,
 19627                             event->xexpose.width, event->xexpose.height);
 19628 #endif
 19629               expose_frame (f, event->xexpose.x, event->xexpose.y,
 19630                             event->xexpose.width, event->xexpose.height);
 19631 #ifndef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 19632               x_scroll_bar_handle_exposure (f, (XEvent *) event);
 19633 #endif
 19634 #ifdef USE_GTK
 19635               x_clear_under_internal_border (f);
 19636 #endif
 19637             }
 19638 #ifndef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 19639           else
 19640             x_scroll_bar_handle_exposure (f, (XEvent *) event);
 19641 #endif
 19642 
 19643 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
 19644           if (!FRAME_GARBAGED_P (f))
 19645             show_back_buffer (f);
 19646 #endif
 19647         }
 19648       else
 19649         {
 19650 #if defined USE_LUCID
 19651           /* Submenus of the Lucid menu bar aren't widgets
 19652              themselves, so there's no way to dispatch events
 19653              to them.  Recognize this case separately.  */
 19654           {
 19655             Widget widget = x_window_to_menu_bar (event->xexpose.window);
 19656             if (widget)
 19657               xlwmenu_redisplay (widget);
 19658           }
 19659 #endif /* USE_LUCID */
 19660 
 19661           /* Dispatch event to the widget.  */
 19662           goto OTHER;
 19663         }
 19664       break;
 19665 
 19666     case GraphicsExpose:        /* This occurs when an XCopyArea's
 19667                                    source area was obscured or not
 19668                                    available.  */
 19669       f = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xgraphicsexpose.drawable);
 19670       if (f)
 19671         {
 19672           expose_frame (f, event->xgraphicsexpose.x,
 19673                         event->xgraphicsexpose.y,
 19674                         event->xgraphicsexpose.width,
 19675                         event->xgraphicsexpose.height);
 19676 #ifndef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 19677           x_scroll_bar_handle_exposure (f, (XEvent *) event);
 19678 #endif
 19679 #ifdef USE_GTK
 19680           x_clear_under_internal_border (f);
 19681 #endif
 19682 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
 19683           show_back_buffer (f);
 19684 #endif
 19685         }
 19686 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 19687       else
 19688         goto OTHER;
 19689 #endif /* USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 19690       break;
 19691 
 19692     case NoExpose:              /* This occurs when an XCopyArea's
 19693                                    source area was completely
 19694                                    available.  */
 19695 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 19696       *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 19697 #endif
 19698       break;
 19699 
 19700     case UnmapNotify:
 19701       if (x_dnd_in_progress && x_dnd_use_toplevels
 19702           && dpyinfo == FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame))
 19703         {
 19704           for (struct x_client_list_window *tem = x_dnd_toplevels; tem;
 19705                tem = tem->next)
 19706             {
 19707               if (tem->window == event->xunmap.window)
 19708                 {
 19709                   tem->mapped_p = false;
 19710                   break;
 19711                 }
 19712             }
 19713         }
 19714 
 19715       /* Redo the mouse-highlight after the tooltip has gone.  */
 19716       if (event->xunmap.window == tip_window)
 19717         {
 19718           tip_window = None;
 19719           gui_redo_mouse_highlight (dpyinfo);
 19720         }
 19721 
 19722       f = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xunmap.window);
 19723       if (f)            /* F may no longer exist if
 19724                            the frame was deleted.  */
 19725         {
 19726           bool visible = FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f);
 19727 
 19728 #ifdef USE_LUCID
 19729           /* Bloodcurdling hack alert: The Lucid menu bar widget's
 19730              redisplay procedure is not called when a tip frame over
 19731              menu items is unmapped.  Redisplay the menu manually...  */
 19732           if (FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (f) && popup_activated ())
 19733             {
 19734               Widget w;
 19735               Lisp_Object tail, frame;
 19736               struct frame *f1;
 19737 
 19738               FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 19739                 {
 19740                   if (!FRAME_X_P (XFRAME (frame)))
 19741                     continue;
 19742 
 19743                   f1 = XFRAME (frame);
 19744 
 19745                   if (FRAME_LIVE_P (f1))
 19746                     {
 19747                       w = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f1)->menubar_widget;
 19748 
 19749                       if (w && !DoesSaveUnders (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f1)->screen))
 19750                         xlwmenu_redisplay (w);
 19751                     }
 19752                 }
 19753             }
 19754 #endif /* USE_LUCID */
 19755 
 19756           /* While a frame is unmapped, display generation is
 19757              disabled; you don't want to spend time updating a
 19758              display that won't ever be seen.  */
 19759           SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 0);
 19760           /* We can't distinguish, from the event, whether the window
 19761              has become iconified or invisible.  So assume, if it
 19762              was previously visible, than now it is iconified.
 19763              But x_make_frame_invisible clears both
 19764              the visible flag and the iconified flag;
 19765              and that way, we know the window is not iconified now.  */
 19766           if (visible || FRAME_ICONIFIED_P (f))
 19767             {
 19768               if (CONSP (frame_size_history))
 19769                 frame_size_history_plain
 19770                   (f, build_string ("UnmapNotify, visible | iconified"));
 19771 
 19772               SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, true);
 19773               inev.ie.kind = ICONIFY_EVENT;
 19774               XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 19775             }
 19776           else if (CONSP (frame_size_history))
 19777             frame_size_history_plain
 19778               (f, build_string ("UnmapNotify, not visible & not iconified"));
 19779         }
 19780       goto OTHER;
 19781 
 19782     case MapNotify:
 19783 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2 && defined HAVE_GTK3
 19784       if (xg_is_menu_window (dpyinfo->display, event->xmap.window))
 19785         popup_activated_flag = 1;
 19786 #endif
 19787 
 19788       if (x_dnd_in_progress
 19789           /* When _NET_WM_CLIENT_LIST stacking is being used, changes
 19790              in that property are watched for, and it's not necessary
 19791              to update the state in response to ordinary window
 19792              substructure events.  */
 19793           && !x_dnd_use_toplevels
 19794           && dpyinfo == FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame))
 19795         x_dnd_update_state (dpyinfo, dpyinfo->last_user_time);
 19796 
 19797       if (x_dnd_in_progress && x_dnd_use_toplevels
 19798           && dpyinfo == FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame))
 19799         {
 19800           for (struct x_client_list_window *tem = x_dnd_toplevels; tem;
 19801                tem = tem->next)
 19802             {
 19803               if (tem->window == event->xmap.window)
 19804                 {
 19805                   tem->mapped_p = true;
 19806                   break;
 19807                 }
 19808             }
 19809         }
 19810 
 19811       /* We use x_top_window_to_frame because map events can
 19812          come for sub-windows and they don't mean that the
 19813          frame is visible.  */
 19814       f = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xmap.window);
 19815       if (f)
 19816         {
 19817           bool iconified = FRAME_ICONIFIED_P (f);
 19818           int value;
 19819           bool sticky, shaded;
 19820           bool not_hidden = x_get_current_wm_state (f, event->xmap.window, &value, &sticky,
 19821                                                     &shaded);
 19822 
 19823           if (CONSP (frame_size_history))
 19824             frame_size_history_extra
 19825               (f,
 19826                iconified
 19827                ? (not_hidden
 19828                   ? build_string ("MapNotify, not hidden & iconified")
 19829                   : build_string ("MapNotify, hidden & iconified"))
 19830                : (not_hidden
 19831                   ? build_string ("MapNotify, not hidden & not iconified")
 19832                   : build_string ("MapNotify, hidden & not iconified")),
 19833                FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f), FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f),
 19834                -1, -1, f->new_width, f->new_height);
 19835 
 19836           /* Check if fullscreen was specified before we where mapped the
 19837              first time, i.e. from the command line.  */
 19838           if (!f->output_data.x->has_been_visible)
 19839             {
 19840 
 19841               x_check_fullscreen (f);
 19842 #ifndef USE_GTK
 19843               /* For systems that cannot synthesize `skip_taskbar' for
 19844                  unmapped windows do the following.  */
 19845               if (FRAME_SKIP_TASKBAR (f))
 19846                 x_set_skip_taskbar (f, Qt, Qnil);
 19847 #endif /* Not USE_GTK */
 19848             }
 19849 
 19850           if (!iconified)
 19851             {
 19852               /* The `z-group' is reset every time a frame becomes
 19853                  invisible.  Handle this here.  */
 19854               if (FRAME_Z_GROUP (f) == z_group_above)
 19855                 x_set_z_group (f, Qabove, Qnil);
 19856               else if (FRAME_Z_GROUP (f) == z_group_below)
 19857                 x_set_z_group (f, Qbelow, Qnil);
 19858             }
 19859 
 19860           /* Embedded frames might have NET_WM_STATE left over, but
 19861              are always visible once mapped.  */
 19862           if (not_hidden || FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f))
 19863             {
 19864               SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 1);
 19865               SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, false);
 19866 #if defined USE_GTK && defined HAVE_GTK3
 19867               /* If GTK3 wants to impose some old size here (Bug#24526),
 19868                  tell it that the current size is what we want.  */
 19869               if (f->was_invisible)
 19870                 {
 19871                   xg_frame_set_char_size
 19872                     (f, FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f), FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f));
 19873                   f->was_invisible = false;
 19874                 }
 19875 #endif
 19876               f->output_data.x->has_been_visible = true;
 19877             }
 19878 
 19879           x_update_opaque_region (f, NULL);
 19880 
 19881           if ((not_hidden || FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f)) && iconified)
 19882             {
 19883               inev.ie.kind = DEICONIFY_EVENT;
 19884               XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 19885             }
 19886         }
 19887       goto OTHER;
 19888 
 19889     case KeyPress:
 19890       x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, event->xkey.time,
 19891                                     event->xkey.send_event,
 19892                                     true);
 19893       ignore_next_mouse_click_timeout = 0;
 19894 
 19895       coding = Qlatin_1;
 19896 
 19897 #if defined (USE_X_TOOLKIT) || defined (USE_GTK)
 19898       /* Dispatch KeyPress events when in menu.  */
 19899       if (popup_activated ())
 19900         goto OTHER;
 19901 #endif
 19902 
 19903       f = any;
 19904 
 19905 #ifdef USE_GTK
 19906       if (f)
 19907         x_set_gtk_user_time (f, event->xkey.time);
 19908 #endif
 19909 
 19910       /* If mouse-highlight is an integer, input clears out
 19911          mouse highlighting.  */
 19912       if (!hlinfo->mouse_face_hidden && FIXNUMP (Vmouse_highlight)
 19913           && (f == 0
 19914 #if ! defined (USE_GTK)
 19915               || !EQ (f->tool_bar_window, hlinfo->mouse_face_window)
 19916 #endif
 19917               || !EQ (f->tab_bar_window, hlinfo->mouse_face_window))
 19918           )
 19919         {
 19920           mouse_frame = hlinfo->mouse_face_mouse_frame;
 19921 
 19922           clear_mouse_face (hlinfo);
 19923           hlinfo->mouse_face_hidden = true;
 19924 
 19925           if (mouse_frame)
 19926             x_flush_dirty_back_buffer_on (mouse_frame);
 19927         }
 19928 
 19929 #if defined USE_MOTIF && defined USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 19930       if (f == 0)
 19931         {
 19932           /* Scroll bars consume key events, but we want
 19933              the keys to go to the scroll bar's frame.  */
 19934           Widget widget = XtWindowToWidget (dpyinfo->display,
 19935                                             event->xkey.window);
 19936           if (widget && XmIsScrollBar (widget))
 19937             {
 19938               widget = XtParent (widget);
 19939               f = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, XtWindow (widget));
 19940             }
 19941         }
 19942 #endif /* USE_MOTIF and USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 19943 
 19944       if (f != 0)
 19945         {
 19946           KeySym keysym, orig_keysym;
 19947           /* al%imercury@uunet.uu.net says that making this 81
 19948              instead of 80 fixed a bug whereby meta chars made
 19949              his Emacs hang.
 19950 
 19951              It seems that some version of XmbLookupString has
 19952              a bug of not returning XBufferOverflow in
 19953              status_return even if the input is too long to
 19954              fit in 81 bytes.  So, we must prepare sufficient
 19955              bytes for copy_buffer.  513 bytes (256 chars for
 19956              two-byte character set) seems to be a fairly good
 19957              approximation.  -- 2000.8.10 handa@gnu.org  */
 19958           unsigned char copy_buffer[513];
 19959           unsigned char *copy_bufptr = copy_buffer;
 19960           int copy_bufsiz = sizeof (copy_buffer);
 19961           int modifiers;
 19962           Lisp_Object c;
 19963           /* `xkey' will be modified, but it's not important to modify
 19964              `event' itself.  */
 19965           XKeyEvent xkey = event->xkey;
 19966 
 19967           if (event->xkey.window == FRAME_X_WINDOW (f))
 19968             /* See the comment above x_compute_root_window_offset for
 19969                why this optimization is performed.  */
 19970             x_compute_root_window_offset (f, event->xkey.x_root,
 19971                                           event->xkey.y_root,
 19972                                           event->xkey.x, event->xkey.y);
 19973 
 19974 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 19975           Time pending_keystroke_time;
 19976           struct xi_device_t *source;
 19977 
 19978           pending_keystroke_time = dpyinfo->pending_keystroke_time;
 19979 
 19980           if (event->xkey.time >= pending_keystroke_time)
 19981             {
 19982 #if defined USE_GTK && !defined HAVE_GTK3
 19983               if (!dpyinfo->pending_keystroke_time_special_p)
 19984 #endif
 19985                 dpyinfo->pending_keystroke_time = 0;
 19986 #if defined USE_GTK && !defined HAVE_GTK3
 19987               else
 19988                 dpyinfo->pending_keystroke_time_special_p = false;
 19989 #endif
 19990             }
 19991 #endif
 19992 
 19993 #ifdef USE_GTK
 19994           /* Don't pass keys to GTK.  A Tab will shift focus to the
 19995              tool bar in GTK 2.4.  Keys will still go to menus and
 19996              dialogs because in that case popup_activated is nonzero
 19997              (see above).  */
 19998           *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 19999 #endif
 20000 
 20001           xkey.state |= x_emacs_to_x_modifiers (dpyinfo,
 20002                                                 extra_keyboard_modifiers);
 20003           modifiers = xkey.state;
 20004 
 20005           /* This will have to go some day...  */
 20006 
 20007           /* make_lispy_event turns chars into control chars.
 20008              Don't do it here because XLookupString is too eager.  */
 20009           xkey.state &= ~ControlMask;
 20010           xkey.state &= ~(dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask
 20011                           | dpyinfo->super_mod_mask
 20012                           | dpyinfo->hyper_mod_mask
 20013                           | dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask);
 20014 
 20015           /* In case Meta is ComposeCharacter,
 20016              clear its status.  According to Markus Ehrnsperger
 20017              Markus.Ehrnsperger@lehrstuhl-bross.physik.uni-muenchen.de
 20018              this enables ComposeCharacter to work whether or
 20019              not it is combined with Meta.  */
 20020           if (modifiers & dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask)
 20021             memset (&compose_status, 0, sizeof (compose_status));
 20022 
 20023 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 20024           if (FRAME_XIC (f))
 20025             {
 20026               Status status_return;
 20027 
 20028               nbytes = XmbLookupString (FRAME_XIC (f),
 20029                                         &xkey, (char *) copy_bufptr,
 20030                                         copy_bufsiz, &keysym,
 20031                                         &status_return);
 20032               coding = FRAME_X_XIM_CODING (f);
 20033               if (status_return == XBufferOverflow)
 20034                 {
 20035                   copy_bufsiz = nbytes + 1;
 20036                   copy_bufptr = SAFE_ALLOCA (copy_bufsiz);
 20037                   nbytes = XmbLookupString (FRAME_XIC (f),
 20038                                             &xkey, (char *) copy_bufptr,
 20039                                             copy_bufsiz, &keysym,
 20040                                             &status_return);
 20041                 }
 20042               /* Xutf8LookupString is a new but already deprecated interface.  -stef  */
 20043               if (status_return == XLookupNone)
 20044                 break;
 20045               else if (status_return == XLookupChars)
 20046                 {
 20047                   keysym = NoSymbol;
 20048                   modifiers = 0;
 20049                 }
 20050               else if (status_return != XLookupKeySym
 20051                        && status_return != XLookupBoth)
 20052                 emacs_abort ();
 20053             }
 20054           else
 20055 #endif
 20056             {
 20057 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 20058               int overflow;
 20059               unsigned int consumed;
 20060 
 20061               if (dpyinfo->xkb_desc)
 20062                 {
 20063                   if (!XkbTranslateKeyCode (dpyinfo->xkb_desc,
 20064                                             xkey.keycode, xkey.state,
 20065                                             &consumed, &keysym))
 20066                     goto done_keysym;
 20067 
 20068                   overflow = 0;
 20069 
 20070                   nbytes = XkbTranslateKeySym (dpyinfo->display, &keysym,
 20071                                                xkey.state & ~consumed,
 20072                                                (char *) copy_bufptr,
 20073                                                copy_bufsiz, &overflow);
 20074 
 20075                   if (overflow)
 20076                     {
 20077                       copy_bufptr = SAFE_ALLOCA ((copy_bufsiz += overflow)
 20078                                                  * sizeof *copy_bufptr);
 20079                       overflow = 0;
 20080                       nbytes = XkbTranslateKeySym (dpyinfo->display, &keysym,
 20081                                                    xkey.state & ~consumed,
 20082                                                    (char *) copy_bufptr,
 20083                                                    copy_bufsiz, &overflow);
 20084 
 20085                       if (overflow)
 20086                         nbytes = 0;
 20087                     }
 20088 
 20089                   if (nbytes)
 20090                     coding = Qnil;
 20091                 }
 20092               else
 20093 #endif
 20094                 nbytes = XLookupString (&xkey, (char *) copy_bufptr,
 20095                                         copy_bufsiz, &keysym,
 20096                                         &compose_status);
 20097             }
 20098 
 20099 #ifdef XK_F1
 20100           if (x_dnd_in_progress && keysym == XK_F1)
 20101             {
 20102               x_dnd_xm_use_help = true;
 20103               goto done_keysym;
 20104             }
 20105 #endif
 20106 
 20107           /* See if keysym should make Emacs quit.  */
 20108 
 20109           if (keysym == dpyinfo->quit_keysym
 20110               && (xkey.time - dpyinfo->quit_keysym_time
 20111                   <= 350))
 20112             {
 20113               Vquit_flag = Qt;
 20114               goto done_keysym;
 20115             }
 20116 
 20117           if (keysym == dpyinfo->quit_keysym)
 20118             {
 20119               /* Otherwise, set the last time that keysym was
 20120                  pressed.  */
 20121               dpyinfo->quit_keysym_time = xkey.time;
 20122               goto done_keysym;
 20123             }
 20124 
 20125           /* If not using XIM/XIC, and a compose sequence is in progress,
 20126              we break here.  Otherwise, chars_matched is always 0.  */
 20127           if (compose_status.chars_matched > 0 && nbytes == 0)
 20128             break;
 20129 
 20130           memset (&compose_status, 0, sizeof (compose_status));
 20131           orig_keysym = keysym;
 20132 
 20133           /* Common for all keysym input events.  */
 20134           XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 20135           inev.ie.modifiers
 20136             = x_x_to_emacs_modifiers (dpyinfo, modifiers);
 20137           inev.ie.timestamp = xkey.time;
 20138 
 20139           /* First deal with keysyms which have defined
 20140              translations to characters.  */
 20141           if (keysym >= 32 && keysym < 128)
 20142             /* Avoid explicitly decoding each ASCII character.  */
 20143             {
 20144               inev.ie.kind = ASCII_KEYSTROKE_EVENT;
 20145               inev.ie.code = keysym;
 20146 
 20147 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 20148               if (event->xkey.time == pending_keystroke_time)
 20149                 {
 20150                   source = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo,
 20151                                               dpyinfo->pending_keystroke_source);
 20152 
 20153                   if (source)
 20154                     inev.ie.device = source->name;
 20155                 }
 20156 #endif
 20157 
 20158               goto done_keysym;
 20159             }
 20160 
 20161           /* Keysyms directly mapped to Unicode characters.  */
 20162           if (keysym >= 0x01000000 && keysym <= 0x0110FFFF)
 20163             {
 20164               if (keysym < 0x01000080)
 20165                 inev.ie.kind = ASCII_KEYSTROKE_EVENT;
 20166               else
 20167                 inev.ie.kind = MULTIBYTE_CHAR_KEYSTROKE_EVENT;
 20168               inev.ie.code = keysym & 0xFFFFFF;
 20169 
 20170 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 20171               if (event->xkey.time == pending_keystroke_time)
 20172                 {
 20173                   source = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo,
 20174                                               dpyinfo->pending_keystroke_source);
 20175 
 20176                   if (source)
 20177                     inev.ie.device = source->name;
 20178                 }
 20179 #endif
 20180 
 20181               goto done_keysym;
 20182             }
 20183 
 20184           /* Now non-ASCII.  */
 20185           if (HASH_TABLE_P (Vx_keysym_table)
 20186               && (c = Fgethash (make_fixnum (keysym),
 20187                                 Vx_keysym_table,
 20188                                 Qnil),
 20189                   FIXNATP (c)))
 20190             {
 20191               inev.ie.kind = (SINGLE_BYTE_CHAR_P (XFIXNAT (c))
 20192                               ? ASCII_KEYSTROKE_EVENT
 20193                               : MULTIBYTE_CHAR_KEYSTROKE_EVENT);
 20194               inev.ie.code = XFIXNAT (c);
 20195 
 20196 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 20197               if (event->xkey.time == pending_keystroke_time)
 20198                 {
 20199                   source = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo,
 20200                                               dpyinfo->pending_keystroke_source);
 20201 
 20202                   if (source)
 20203                     inev.ie.device = source->name;
 20204                 }
 20205 #endif
 20206 
 20207               goto done_keysym;
 20208             }
 20209 
 20210           /* Random non-modifier sorts of keysyms.  */
 20211           if (((keysym >= XK_BackSpace && keysym <= XK_Escape)
 20212                || keysym == XK_Delete
 20213 #ifdef XK_ISO_Left_Tab
 20214                || (keysym >= XK_ISO_Left_Tab
 20215                    && keysym <= XK_ISO_Enter)
 20216 #endif
 20217                || IsCursorKey (keysym) /* 0xff50 <= x < 0xff60 */
 20218                || IsMiscFunctionKey (keysym) /* 0xff60 <= x < VARIES */
 20219 #ifdef HPUX
 20220                /* This recognizes the "extended function
 20221                   keys".  It seems there's no cleaner way.
 20222                   Test IsModifierKey to avoid handling
 20223                   mode_switch incorrectly.  */
 20224                || (XK_Select <= keysym && keysym < XK_KP_Space)
 20225 #endif
 20226 #ifdef XK_dead_circumflex
 20227                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_circumflex
 20228 #endif
 20229 #ifdef XK_dead_grave
 20230                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_grave
 20231 #endif
 20232 #ifdef XK_dead_tilde
 20233                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_tilde
 20234 #endif
 20235 #ifdef XK_dead_diaeresis
 20236                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_diaeresis
 20237 #endif
 20238 #ifdef XK_dead_macron
 20239                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_macron
 20240 #endif
 20241 #ifdef XK_dead_degree
 20242                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_degree
 20243 #endif
 20244 #ifdef XK_dead_acute
 20245                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_acute
 20246 #endif
 20247 #ifdef XK_dead_cedilla
 20248                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_cedilla
 20249 #endif
 20250 #ifdef XK_dead_breve
 20251                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_breve
 20252 #endif
 20253 #ifdef XK_dead_ogonek
 20254                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_ogonek
 20255 #endif
 20256 #ifdef XK_dead_caron
 20257                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_caron
 20258 #endif
 20259 #ifdef XK_dead_doubleacute
 20260                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_doubleacute
 20261 #endif
 20262 #ifdef XK_dead_abovedot
 20263                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_abovedot
 20264 #endif
 20265 #ifdef XK_dead_abovering
 20266                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_abovering
 20267 #endif
 20268 #ifdef XK_dead_belowdot
 20269                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_belowdot
 20270 #endif
 20271 #ifdef XK_dead_voiced_sound
 20272                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_voiced_sound
 20273 #endif
 20274 #ifdef XK_dead_semivoiced_sound
 20275                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_semivoiced_sound
 20276 #endif
 20277 #ifdef XK_dead_hook
 20278                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_hook
 20279 #endif
 20280 #ifdef XK_dead_horn
 20281                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_horn
 20282 #endif
 20283 #ifdef XK_dead_stroke
 20284                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_stroke
 20285 #endif
 20286 #ifdef XK_dead_abovecomma
 20287                || orig_keysym == XK_dead_abovecomma
 20288 #endif
 20289                || IsKeypadKey (keysym) /* 0xff80 <= x < 0xffbe */
 20290                || IsFunctionKey (keysym) /* 0xffbe <= x < 0xffe1 */
 20291                /* Any "vendor-specific" key is ok.  */
 20292                || (orig_keysym & (1 << 28))
 20293                || (keysym != NoSymbol && nbytes == 0))
 20294               && ! (IsModifierKey (orig_keysym)
 20295                     /* The symbols from XK_ISO_Lock
 20296                        to XK_ISO_Last_Group_Lock
 20297                        don't have real modifiers but
 20298                        should be treated similarly to
 20299                        Mode_switch by Emacs. */
 20300 #if defined XK_ISO_Lock && defined XK_ISO_Last_Group_Lock
 20301                     || (XK_ISO_Lock <= orig_keysym
 20302                         && orig_keysym <= XK_ISO_Last_Group_Lock)
 20303 #endif
 20304                     ))
 20305             {
 20306               STORE_KEYSYM_FOR_DEBUG (keysym);
 20307               /* make_lispy_event will convert this to a symbolic
 20308                  key.  */
 20309               inev.ie.kind = NON_ASCII_KEYSTROKE_EVENT;
 20310               inev.ie.code = keysym;
 20311 
 20312 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 20313               if (event->xkey.time == pending_keystroke_time)
 20314                 {
 20315                   source = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo,
 20316                                               dpyinfo->pending_keystroke_source);
 20317 
 20318                   if (source)
 20319                     inev.ie.device = source->name;
 20320                 }
 20321 #endif
 20322 
 20323               goto done_keysym;
 20324             }
 20325 
 20326           {     /* Raw bytes, not keysym.  */
 20327             ptrdiff_t i;
 20328 
 20329             for (i = 0; i < nbytes; i++)
 20330               {
 20331                 STORE_KEYSYM_FOR_DEBUG (copy_bufptr[i]);
 20332               }
 20333 
 20334             if (nbytes)
 20335               {
 20336                 inev.ie.kind = MULTIBYTE_CHAR_KEYSTROKE_EVENT;
 20337                 inev.ie.arg = make_unibyte_string ((char *) copy_bufptr, nbytes);
 20338 
 20339                 Fput_text_property (make_fixnum (0), make_fixnum (nbytes),
 20340                                     Qcoding, coding, inev.ie.arg);
 20341 
 20342 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 20343                 if (event->xkey.time == pending_keystroke_time
 20344                     /* I-Bus sometimes sends events generated from
 20345                        multiple filtered keystrokes with a time of 0,
 20346                        so just use the recorded source device if it
 20347                        exists.  */
 20348                     || (pending_keystroke_time && !event->xkey.time))
 20349                   {
 20350                     source = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo,
 20351                                                 dpyinfo->pending_keystroke_source);
 20352 
 20353                     if (source)
 20354                       inev.ie.device = source->name;
 20355                   }
 20356 #endif
 20357               }
 20358 
 20359             if (keysym == NoSymbol)
 20360               break;
 20361           }
 20362         }
 20363     done_keysym:
 20364 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 20365       if (f)
 20366         {
 20367           struct window *w = XWINDOW (f->selected_window);
 20368           xic_set_preeditarea (w, w->cursor.x, w->cursor.y);
 20369 
 20370           if (FRAME_XIC (f) && (FRAME_XIC_STYLE (f) & XIMStatusArea))
 20371             xic_set_statusarea (f);
 20372         }
 20373 
 20374       /* Don't dispatch this event since XtDispatchEvent calls
 20375          XFilterEvent, and two calls in a row may freeze the
 20376          client.  */
 20377       break;
 20378 #else
 20379       goto OTHER;
 20380 #endif
 20381 
 20382     case KeyRelease:
 20383 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 20384       /* Don't dispatch this event since XtDispatchEvent calls
 20385          XFilterEvent, and two calls in a row may freeze the
 20386          client.  */
 20387       break;
 20388 #else
 20389       goto OTHER;
 20390 #endif
 20391 
 20392     case EnterNotify:
 20393       x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, event->xcrossing.time,
 20394                                     event->xcrossing.send_event,
 20395                                     false);
 20396 
 20397 #ifdef HAVE_XWIDGETS
 20398       {
 20399         struct xwidget_view *xvw;
 20400         Mouse_HLInfo *hlinfo;
 20401 
 20402         xvw = xwidget_view_from_window (event->xcrossing.window);
 20403 
 20404         if (xvw)
 20405           {
 20406             xwidget_motion_or_crossing (xvw, event);
 20407             hlinfo = MOUSE_HL_INFO (xvw->frame);
 20408 
 20409             if (xvw->frame == hlinfo->mouse_face_mouse_frame)
 20410               {
 20411                 clear_mouse_face (hlinfo);
 20412                 hlinfo->mouse_face_mouse_frame = 0;
 20413                 x_flush_dirty_back_buffer_on (xvw->frame);
 20414               }
 20415 
 20416             if (any_help_event_p)
 20417               do_help = -1;
 20418 
 20419             goto OTHER;
 20420           }
 20421       }
 20422 #endif
 20423 
 20424 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 20425       /* For whatever reason, the X server continues to deliver
 20426          EnterNotify and LeaveNotify events despite us selecting for
 20427          related XI_Enter and XI_Leave events.  It's not just our
 20428          problem, since windows created by "xinput test-xi2" suffer
 20429          from the same defect.  Simply ignore all such events while
 20430          the input extension is enabled.  (bug#57468) */
 20431 
 20432       if (dpyinfo->supports_xi2)
 20433         goto OTHER;
 20434 #endif
 20435 
 20436       if (x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xcrossing.window))
 20437         x_detect_focus_change (dpyinfo, any, event, &inev.ie);
 20438 
 20439       f = any;
 20440 
 20441       if (f && event->xcrossing.window == FRAME_X_WINDOW (f))
 20442         x_compute_root_window_offset (f, event->xcrossing.x_root,
 20443                                       event->xcrossing.y_root,
 20444                                       event->xcrossing.x,
 20445                                       event->xcrossing.y);
 20446 
 20447       /* The code below relies on the first several fields of
 20448          XCrossingEvent being laid out the same way as
 20449          XMotionEvent.  */
 20450 
 20451       if (f && x_mouse_click_focus_ignore_position)
 20452         {
 20453           ignore_next_mouse_click_timeout = (event->xmotion.time
 20454                                              + x_mouse_click_focus_ignore_time);
 20455           mouse_click_timeout_display = dpyinfo;
 20456         }
 20457 
 20458       /* EnterNotify counts as mouse movement,
 20459          so update things that depend on mouse position.  */
 20460       if (f && !f->output_data.x->hourglass_p)
 20461         x_note_mouse_movement (f, &event->xmotion, Qnil);
 20462 #ifdef USE_GTK
 20463       /* We may get an EnterNotify on the buttons in the toolbar.  In that
 20464          case we moved out of any highlighted area and need to note this.  */
 20465       if (!f && dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame)
 20466         x_note_mouse_movement (dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame, &event->xmotion,
 20467                                Qnil);
 20468 #endif
 20469       goto OTHER;
 20470 
 20471     case FocusIn:
 20472 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2                                                \
 20473   && (defined HAVE_GTK3 || (!defined USE_GTK && !defined USE_X_TOOLKIT))
 20474       /* If a FocusIn event is received (because the window manager
 20475          sent us one), don't set the core focus if XInput 2 is
 20476          enabled, since that would mess up the device-specific focus
 20477          tracking.
 20478 
 20479          The long looking preprocessor conditional only enables this
 20480          code on GTK 3 and no toolkit builds, since those are the only
 20481          builds where focus is tracked specific to each master device.
 20482          Other builds use core events and the client pointer to handle
 20483          focus, much like on a build without XInput 2.  */
 20484       if (dpyinfo->supports_xi2)
 20485         goto OTHER;
 20486 #endif
 20487 #ifdef USE_GTK
 20488       /* Some WMs (e.g. Mutter in Gnome Shell), don't unmap
 20489          minimized/iconified windows; thus, for those WMs we won't get
 20490          a MapNotify when unminimizing/deiconifying.  Check here if we
 20491          are deiconizing a window (Bug42655).
 20492 
 20493          But don't do that by default on GTK since it may cause a plain
 20494          invisible frame get reported as iconified, compare
 20495          https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/emacs-devel/2017-02/msg00133.html.
 20496          That is fixed above but bites us here again.
 20497 
 20498          The option x_set_frame_visibility_more_laxly allows to override
 20499          the default behavior (Bug#49955, Bug#53298).  */
 20500       if (EQ (x_set_frame_visibility_more_laxly, Qfocus_in)
 20501           || EQ (x_set_frame_visibility_more_laxly, Qt))
 20502 #endif /* USE_GTK */
 20503         {
 20504           f = any;
 20505           if (f && FRAME_ICONIFIED_P (f))
 20506             {
 20507               SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 1);
 20508               SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, false);
 20509               f->output_data.x->has_been_visible = true;
 20510               inev.ie.kind = DEICONIFY_EVENT;
 20511               XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 20512             }
 20513         }
 20514 
 20515       x_detect_focus_change (dpyinfo, any, event, &inev.ie);
 20516       goto OTHER;
 20517 
 20518     case LeaveNotify:
 20519       x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, event->xcrossing.time,
 20520                                     event->xcrossing.send_event, false);
 20521 
 20522 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 20523       /* For whatever reason, the X server continues to deliver
 20524          EnterNotify and LeaveNotify events despite us selecting for
 20525          related XI_Enter and XI_Leave events.  It's not just our
 20526          problem, since windows created by "xinput test-xi2" suffer
 20527          from the same defect.  Simply ignore all such events while
 20528          the input extension is enabled.  (bug#57468) */
 20529 
 20530       if (dpyinfo->supports_xi2)
 20531         {
 20532 #if !defined USE_X_TOOLKIT && (!defined USE_GTK || defined HAVE_GTK3)
 20533           goto OTHER;
 20534 #else
 20535           /* Unfortunately, X toolkit popups generate LeaveNotify
 20536              events due to the core grabs they acquire (and our
 20537              releasing of the device grab).  This leads to the mouse
 20538              face persisting if a popup is activated by clicking on a
 20539              button, and then dismissed by releasing the mouse button
 20540              outside the frame, in which case no XI_Enter event is
 20541              generated for the grab.  */
 20542           goto just_clear_mouse_face;
 20543 #endif
 20544         }
 20545 #endif
 20546 
 20547 #ifdef HAVE_XWIDGETS
 20548       {
 20549         struct xwidget_view *xvw;
 20550 
 20551         xvw = xwidget_view_from_window (event->xcrossing.window);
 20552 
 20553         if (xvw)
 20554           {
 20555             xwidget_motion_or_crossing (xvw, event);
 20556             goto OTHER;
 20557           }
 20558       }
 20559 #endif
 20560 
 20561       if (x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xcrossing.window))
 20562         x_detect_focus_change (dpyinfo, any, event, &inev.ie);
 20563 
 20564 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2                                                \
 20565   && (defined USE_X_TOOLKIT || (defined USE_GTK && !defined HAVE_GTK3))
 20566     just_clear_mouse_face:
 20567 #endif
 20568 
 20569 #if defined USE_X_TOOLKIT
 20570       /* If the mouse leaves the edit widget, then any mouse highlight
 20571          should be cleared.  */
 20572       f = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xcrossing.window);
 20573 
 20574       if (!f)
 20575         f = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xcrossing.window);
 20576 #else
 20577       f = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xcrossing.window);
 20578 #endif
 20579 
 20580       if (f)
 20581         {
 20582           /* Now clear dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame, or
 20583              gui_redo_mouse_highlight will end up highlighting the
 20584              last known position of the mouse if a tooltip frame is
 20585              later unmapped.  */
 20586 
 20587           if (f == dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame)
 20588             dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame = NULL;
 20589 
 20590           /* Something similar applies to
 20591              dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame.  */
 20592           if (f == dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame)
 20593             dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame = NULL;
 20594 
 20595           if (f == hlinfo->mouse_face_mouse_frame)
 20596             {
 20597               /* If we move outside the frame, then we're
 20598                  certainly no longer on any text in the frame.  */
 20599               clear_mouse_face (hlinfo);
 20600               hlinfo->mouse_face_mouse_frame = 0;
