 20601               x_flush_dirty_back_buffer_on (f);
 20602             }
 20603 
 20604           /* Generate a nil HELP_EVENT to cancel a help-echo.
 20605              Do it only if there's something to cancel.
 20606              Otherwise, the startup message is cleared when
 20607              the mouse leaves the frame.  */
 20608           if (any_help_event_p
 20609               /* But never if `mouse-drag-and-drop-region' is in
 20610                  progress, since that results in the tooltip being
 20611                  dismissed when the mouse moves on top.  */
 20612               && !((EQ (track_mouse, Qdrag_source)
 20613                     || EQ (track_mouse, Qdropping))
 20614                    && gui_mouse_grabbed (dpyinfo)))
 20615             do_help = -1;
 20616 
 20617           if (event->xcrossing.window == FRAME_X_WINDOW (f))
 20618             x_compute_root_window_offset (f, event->xcrossing.x_root,
 20619                                           event->xcrossing.y_root,
 20620                                           event->xcrossing.x,
 20621                                           event->xcrossing.y);
 20622 
 20623         }
 20624 #ifdef USE_GTK
 20625       /* See comment in EnterNotify above */
 20626       else if (dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame)
 20627         x_note_mouse_movement (dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame,
 20628                                &event->xmotion, Qnil);
 20629 #endif
 20630       goto OTHER;
 20631 
 20632     case FocusOut:
 20633 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2                                                \
 20634   && (defined HAVE_GTK3 || (!defined USE_GTK && !defined USE_X_TOOLKIT))
 20635       /* If a FocusIn event is received (because the window manager
 20636          sent us one), don't set the core focus if XInput 2 is
 20637          enabled, since that would mess up the device-specific focus
 20638          tracking.
 20639 
 20640          The long looking preprocessor conditional only enables this
 20641          code on GTK 3 and no toolkit builds, since those are the only
 20642          builds where focus is tracked specific to each master device.
 20643          Other builds use core events and the client pointer to handle
 20644          focus, much like on a build without XInput 2.  */
 20645       if (dpyinfo->supports_xi2)
 20646         goto OTHER;
 20647 #endif
 20648       x_detect_focus_change (dpyinfo, any, event, &inev.ie);
 20649       goto OTHER;
 20650 
 20651     case MotionNotify:
 20652       {
 20653         XMotionEvent xmotion = event->xmotion;
 20654 
 20655         previous_help_echo_string = help_echo_string;
 20656         help_echo_string = Qnil;
 20657 
 20658         if (hlinfo->mouse_face_hidden)
 20659           {
 20660             hlinfo->mouse_face_hidden = false;
 20661             clear_mouse_face (hlinfo);
 20662           }
 20663 
 20664         f = mouse_or_wdesc_frame (dpyinfo, event->xmotion.window);
 20665 
 20666         if (f && event->xmotion.window == FRAME_X_WINDOW (f))
 20667           /* See the comment above x_compute_root_window_offset for
 20668              why this optimization is performed.  */
 20669           x_compute_root_window_offset (f, event->xmotion.x_root,
 20670                                         event->xmotion.y_root,
 20671                                         event->xmotion.x,
 20672                                         event->xmotion.y);
 20673 
 20674         if (x_dnd_in_progress
 20675             /* Handle these events normally if the recursion
 20676                level is higher than when the drag-and-drop
 20677                operation was initiated.  This is so that mouse
 20678                input works while we're in the debugger for, say,
 20679                `x-dnd-movement-function`.  */
 20680             && (command_loop_level + minibuf_level
 20681                 <= x_dnd_recursion_depth)
 20682             && dpyinfo == FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame))
 20683           {
 20684             Window target, toplevel;
 20685             int target_proto, motif_style;
 20686             xm_top_level_leave_message lmsg;
 20687             xm_top_level_enter_message emsg;
 20688             xm_drag_motion_message dmsg;
 20689             XRectangle *r;
 20690             bool was_frame;
 20691 
 20692             /* Always clear mouse face.  */
 20693             clear_mouse_face (hlinfo);
 20694             hlinfo->mouse_face_hidden = true;
 20695 
 20696             /* Sometimes the drag-and-drop operation starts with the
 20697                pointer of a frame invisible due to input.  Since
 20698                motion events are ignored during that, make the pointer
 20699                visible manually.  */
 20700 
 20701             if (f)
 20702               {
 20703                 XTtoggle_invisible_pointer (f, false);
 20704 
 20705                 r = &dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph;
 20706 
 20707                 /* Also remember the mouse glyph and set
 20708                    mouse_moved.  */
 20709                 if (f != dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame
 20710                     || event->xmotion.x < r->x
 20711                     || event->xmotion.x >= r->x + r->width
 20712                     || event->xmotion.y < r->y
 20713                     || event->xmotion.y >= r->y + r->height)
 20714                   {
 20715                     f->mouse_moved = true;
 20716                     f->last_mouse_device = Qnil;
 20717                     dpyinfo->last_mouse_scroll_bar = NULL;
 20718 
 20719                     remember_mouse_glyph (f, event->xmotion.x,
 20720                                           event->xmotion.y, r);
 20721                     dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame = f;
 20722                   }
 20723               }
 20724 
 20725             if (event->xmotion.same_screen)
 20726               target = x_dnd_get_target_window (dpyinfo,
 20727                                                 event->xmotion.x_root,
 20728                                                 event->xmotion.y_root,
 20729                                                 &target_proto,
 20730                                                 &motif_style, &toplevel,
 20731                                                 &was_frame);
 20732             else
 20733               target = x_dnd_fill_empty_target (&target_proto, &motif_style,
 20734                                                 &toplevel, &was_frame);
 20735 
 20736             if (toplevel != x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel)
 20737               {
 20738                 if (toplevel != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame)
 20739                     && x_dnd_return_frame == 1)
 20740                   x_dnd_return_frame = 2;
 20741 
 20742                 if (x_dnd_return_frame == 2
 20743                     && x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, toplevel))
 20744                   {
 20745                     if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 20746                         && x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1
 20747                         && x_dnd_last_seen_window != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame))
 20748                       x_dnd_send_leave (x_dnd_frame, x_dnd_last_seen_window,
 20749                                         x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel);
 20750                     else if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 20751                              && XM_DRAG_STYLE_IS_DYNAMIC (x_dnd_last_motif_style)
 20752                              && !x_dnd_disable_motif_drag
 20753                              && x_dnd_last_seen_window != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame))
 20754                       {
 20755                         if (!x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 20756                           xm_setup_drag_info (dpyinfo, x_dnd_frame);
 20757 
 20758                         lmsg.reason = XM_DRAG_REASON (XM_DRAG_ORIGINATOR_INITIATOR,
 20759                                                       XM_DRAG_REASON_TOP_LEVEL_LEAVE);
 20760                         lmsg.byteorder = XM_BYTE_ORDER_CUR_FIRST;
 20761                         lmsg.zero = 0;
 20762                         lmsg.timestamp = event->xmotion.time;
 20763                         lmsg.source_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame);
 20764 
 20765                         if (x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 20766                           xm_send_top_level_leave_message (dpyinfo, FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame),
 20767                                                            x_dnd_last_seen_window, &lmsg);
 20768                       }
 20769 
 20770                     x_dnd_end_window = x_dnd_last_seen_window;
 20771                     x_dnd_last_seen_window = None;
 20772                     x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel = None;
 20773                     x_dnd_in_progress = false;
 20774                     x_dnd_return_frame_object
 20775                       = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, toplevel);
 20776                     x_dnd_return_frame = 3;
 20777                     x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = false;
 20778                     target = None;
 20779                   }
 20780               }
 20781 
 20782             if (target != x_dnd_last_seen_window)
 20783               {
 20784                 if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 20785                     && x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1
 20786                     && x_dnd_last_seen_window != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame))
 20787                   x_dnd_send_leave (x_dnd_frame, x_dnd_last_seen_window,
 20788                                     x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel);
 20789                 else if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 20790                          && XM_DRAG_STYLE_IS_DYNAMIC (x_dnd_last_motif_style)
 20791                          && x_dnd_disable_motif_drag
 20792                          && x_dnd_last_seen_window != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame))
 20793                   {
 20794                     if (!x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 20795                       xm_setup_drag_info (dpyinfo, x_dnd_frame);
 20796 
 20797                     /* This is apparently required.  If we don't send
 20798                        a motion event with the current root window
 20799                        coordinates of the pointer before the top level
 20800                        leave, then Motif displays an ugly black border
 20801                        around the previous drop site.  */
 20802 
 20803                     dmsg.reason = XM_DRAG_REASON (XM_DRAG_ORIGINATOR_INITIATOR,
 20804                                                   XM_DRAG_REASON_DRAG_MOTION);
 20805                     dmsg.byteorder = XM_BYTE_ORDER_CUR_FIRST;
 20806                     dmsg.side_effects = XM_DRAG_SIDE_EFFECT (xm_side_effect_from_action (dpyinfo,
 20807                                                                                          x_dnd_wanted_action),
 20808                                                              XM_DROP_SITE_NONE, x_dnd_motif_operations,
 20809                                                              XM_DROP_ACTION_DROP_CANCEL);
 20810                     dmsg.timestamp = event->xmotion.time;
 20811                     dmsg.x = event->xmotion.x_root;
 20812                     dmsg.y = event->xmotion.y_root;
 20813 
 20814                     lmsg.reason = XM_DRAG_REASON (XM_DRAG_ORIGINATOR_INITIATOR,
 20815                                                   XM_DRAG_REASON_TOP_LEVEL_LEAVE);
 20816                     lmsg.byteorder = XM_BYTE_ORDER_CUR_FIRST;
 20817                     lmsg.zero = 0;
 20818                     lmsg.timestamp = event->xbutton.time;
 20819                     lmsg.source_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame);
 20820 
 20821                     if (x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 20822                       {
 20823                         xm_send_drag_motion_message (dpyinfo, FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame),
 20824                                                      x_dnd_last_seen_window, &dmsg);
 20825                         xm_send_top_level_leave_message (dpyinfo, FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame),
 20826                                                          x_dnd_last_seen_window, &lmsg);
 20827                       }
 20828                   }
 20829 
 20830                 x_dnd_action = None;
 20831                 x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel = toplevel;
 20832                 x_dnd_last_seen_window = target;
 20833                 x_dnd_last_protocol_version = target_proto;
 20834                 x_dnd_last_motif_style = motif_style;
 20835                 x_dnd_last_window_is_frame = was_frame;
 20836 
 20837                 if (target != None && x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1)
 20838                   x_dnd_send_enter (x_dnd_frame, target,
 20839                                     x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel,
 20840                                     x_dnd_last_protocol_version);
 20841                 else if (target != None && XM_DRAG_STYLE_IS_DYNAMIC (x_dnd_last_motif_style)
 20842                          && !x_dnd_disable_motif_drag)
 20843                   {
 20844                     if (!x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 20845                       xm_setup_drag_info (dpyinfo, x_dnd_frame);
 20846 
 20847                     emsg.reason = XM_DRAG_REASON (XM_DRAG_ORIGINATOR_INITIATOR,
 20848                                                   XM_DRAG_REASON_TOP_LEVEL_ENTER);
 20849                     emsg.byteorder = XM_BYTE_ORDER_CUR_FIRST;
 20850                     emsg.zero = 0;
 20851                     emsg.timestamp = event->xbutton.time;
 20852                     emsg.source_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame);
 20853                     emsg.index_atom = x_dnd_motif_atom;
 20854 
 20855                     if (x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 20856                       xm_send_top_level_enter_message (dpyinfo, FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame),
 20857                                                        target, &emsg);
 20858                   }
 20859               }
 20860             else
 20861               x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel = toplevel;
 20862 
 20863             if (x_dnd_last_window_is_frame && target != None)
 20864               x_dnd_note_self_position (dpyinfo, target,
 20865                                         event->xbutton.x_root,
 20866                                         event->xbutton.y_root);
 20867             else if (x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1 && target != None)
 20868               x_dnd_send_position (x_dnd_frame, target,
 20869                                    x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel,
 20870                                    x_dnd_last_protocol_version,
 20871                                    event->xmotion.x_root,
 20872                                    event->xmotion.y_root,
 20873                                    x_dnd_selection_timestamp,
 20874                                    x_dnd_wanted_action, 0,
 20875                                    event->xmotion.state);
 20876             else if (XM_DRAG_STYLE_IS_DYNAMIC (x_dnd_last_motif_style) && target != None
 20877                      && !x_dnd_disable_motif_drag)
 20878               {
 20879                 if (!x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 20880                   xm_setup_drag_info (dpyinfo, x_dnd_frame);
 20881 
 20882                 dmsg.reason = XM_DRAG_REASON (XM_DRAG_ORIGINATOR_INITIATOR,
 20883                                               XM_DRAG_REASON_DRAG_MOTION);
 20884                 dmsg.byteorder = XM_BYTE_ORDER_CUR_FIRST;
 20885                 dmsg.side_effects = XM_DRAG_SIDE_EFFECT (xm_side_effect_from_action (dpyinfo,
 20886                                                                                      x_dnd_wanted_action),
 20887                                                          XM_DROP_SITE_VALID, x_dnd_motif_operations,
 20888                                                          (!x_dnd_xm_use_help
 20889                                                           ? XM_DROP_ACTION_DROP
 20890                                                           : XM_DROP_ACTION_DROP_HELP));
 20891                 dmsg.timestamp = event->xbutton.time;
 20892                 dmsg.x = event->xmotion.x_root;
 20893                 dmsg.y = event->xmotion.y_root;
 20894 
 20895                 if (x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 20896                   xm_send_drag_motion_message (dpyinfo, FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame),
 20897                                                target, &dmsg);
 20898               }
 20899 
 20900             x_dnd_update_tooltip_position (event->xmotion.x_root,
 20901                                            event->xmotion.y_root);
 20902 
 20903             goto OTHER;
 20904           }
 20905 
 20906 #ifdef USE_GTK
 20907         if (f && xg_event_is_for_scrollbar (f, event, false))
 20908           f = 0;
 20909 #endif
 20910 #ifdef HAVE_XWIDGETS
 20911         struct xwidget_view *xvw;
 20912 
 20913         xvw = xwidget_view_from_window (event->xmotion.window);
 20914 
 20915         if (xvw)
 20916           xwidget_motion_or_crossing (xvw, event);
 20917 #endif
 20918         if (f)
 20919           {
 20920             /* Maybe generate a SELECT_WINDOW_EVENT for
 20921                `mouse-autoselect-window' but don't let popup menus
 20922                interfere with this (Bug#1261).  */
 20923             if (!NILP (Vmouse_autoselect_window)
 20924                 && !popup_activated ()
 20925                 /* Don't switch if we're currently in the minibuffer.
 20926                    This tries to work around problems where the
 20927                    minibuffer gets unselected unexpectedly, and where
 20928                    you then have to move your mouse all the way down to
 20929                    the minibuffer to select it.  */
 20930                 && !MINI_WINDOW_P (XWINDOW (selected_window))
 20931                 /* With `focus-follows-mouse' non-nil create an event
 20932                    also when the target window is on another frame.  */
 20933                 && (f == XFRAME (selected_frame)
 20934                     || !NILP (focus_follows_mouse)))
 20935               {
 20936                 static Lisp_Object last_mouse_window;
 20937 
 20938                 if (xmotion.window != FRAME_X_WINDOW (f))
 20939                   {
 20940                     x_translate_coordinates (f, xmotion.x_root, xmotion.y_root,
 20941                                              &xmotion.x, &xmotion.y);
 20942                     xmotion.window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
 20943                   }
 20944 
 20945                 Lisp_Object window = window_from_coordinates
 20946                   (f, xmotion.x, xmotion.y, 0, false, false);
 20947 
 20948                 /* A window will be autoselected only when it is not
 20949                    selected now and the last mouse movement event was
 20950                    not in it.  The remainder of the code is a bit vague
 20951                    wrt what a "window" is.  For immediate autoselection,
 20952                    the window is usually the entire window but for GTK
 20953                    where the scroll bars don't count.  For delayed
 20954                    autoselection the window is usually the window's text
 20955                    area including the margins.  */
 20956                 if (WINDOWP (window)
 20957                     && !EQ (window, last_mouse_window)
 20958                     && !EQ (window, selected_window))
 20959                   {
 20960                     inev.ie.kind = SELECT_WINDOW_EVENT;
 20961                     inev.ie.frame_or_window = window;
 20962                   }
 20963 
 20964                 /* Remember the last window where we saw the mouse.  */
 20965                 last_mouse_window = window;
 20966               }
 20967 
 20968             if (!x_note_mouse_movement (f, &xmotion, Qnil))
 20969               help_echo_string = previous_help_echo_string;
 20970           }
 20971         else
 20972           {
 20973 #ifndef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 20974             struct scroll_bar *bar
 20975               = x_window_to_scroll_bar (event->xmotion.display,
 20976                                         event->xmotion.window, 2);
 20977 
 20978             if (bar)
 20979               x_scroll_bar_note_movement (bar, &event->xmotion);
 20980 #endif /* USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 20981 
 20982             /* If we move outside the frame, then we're
 20983                certainly no longer on any text in the frame.  */
 20984             clear_mouse_face (hlinfo);
 20985           }
 20986 
 20987         /* If the contents of the global variable help_echo_string
 20988            has changed, generate a HELP_EVENT.  */
 20989         if (!NILP (help_echo_string)
 20990             || !NILP (previous_help_echo_string))
 20991           do_help = 1;
 20992 
 20993         if (f)
 20994           x_flush_dirty_back_buffer_on (f);
 20995         goto OTHER;
 20996       }
 20997 
 20998     case ConfigureNotify:
 20999       /* An opaque move can generate a stream of events as the window
 21000          is dragged around.  If the connection round trip time isn't
 21001          really short, they may come faster than we can respond to
 21002          them, given the multiple queries we can do to check window
 21003          manager state, translate coordinates, etc.
 21004 
 21005          So if this ConfigureNotify is immediately followed by another
 21006          for the same window, use the info from the latest update, and
 21007          consider the events all handled.  */
 21008 
 21009       /* Opaque resize may be trickier; ConfigureNotify events are
 21010          mixed with Expose events for multiple windows.  */
 21011       configureEvent = *event;
 21012       while (XPending (dpyinfo->display))
 21013         {
 21014           XNextEvent (dpyinfo->display, &next_event);
 21015           if (next_event.type != ConfigureNotify
 21016               || next_event.xconfigure.window != event->xconfigure.window
 21017               /* Skipping events with different sizes can lead to a
 21018                  mispositioned mode line at initial window creation.
 21019                  Only drop window motion events for now.  */
 21020               || next_event.xconfigure.width != event->xconfigure.width
 21021               || next_event.xconfigure.height != event->xconfigure.height)
 21022             {
 21023               XPutBackEvent (dpyinfo->display, &next_event);
 21024               break;
 21025             }
 21026           else
 21027             configureEvent = next_event;
 21028         }
 21029 
 21030       /* If we get a ConfigureNotify for the root window, this means
 21031          the dimensions of the screen it's on changed.  */
 21032 
 21033       if (configureEvent.xconfigure.window == dpyinfo->root_window)
 21034         {
 21035 #ifdef HAVE_XRANDR
 21036           /* This function is OK to call even if the X server doesn't
 21037              support RandR.  */
 21038           XRRUpdateConfiguration (&configureEvent);
 21039 #elif !defined USE_GTK
 21040           /* Catch screen size changes even if RandR is not available
 21041              on the client.  GTK does this internally.  */
 21042 
 21043           if (configureEvent.xconfigure.width != dpyinfo->screen_width
 21044               || configureEvent.xconfigure.height != dpyinfo->screen_height)
 21045             {
 21046               /* Also avoid storing duplicate events here, since
 21047                  Fx_display_monitor_attributes_list will return the
 21048                  same information for both invocations of the
 21049                  hook.  */
 21050               if (!x_find_monitors_changed_event (dpyinfo))
 21051                 {
 21052                   inev.ie.kind = MONITORS_CHANGED_EVENT;
 21053                   XSETTERMINAL (inev.ie.arg, dpyinfo->terminal);
 21054 
 21055                   /* Store this event now since inev.ie.type could be set to
 21056                      MOVE_FRAME_EVENT later.  */
 21057                   kbd_buffer_store_event (&inev.ie);
 21058                   inev.ie.kind = NO_EVENT;
 21059                 }
 21060 
 21061               /* Also update the position of the drag-and-drop
 21062                  tooltip.  */
 21063               x_dnd_update_tooltip_now ();
 21064             }
 21065 #endif
 21066 
 21067           dpyinfo->screen_width = configureEvent.xconfigure.width;
 21068           dpyinfo->screen_height = configureEvent.xconfigure.height;
 21069         }
 21070 
 21071       if (x_dnd_in_progress && x_dnd_use_toplevels
 21072           && dpyinfo == FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame))
 21073         {
 21074           int rc, dest_x, dest_y;
 21075           Window child;
 21076           struct x_client_list_window *tem, *last = NULL;
 21077 
 21078           for (tem = x_dnd_toplevels; tem; last = tem, tem = tem->next)
 21079             {
 21080               /* Not completely right, since the parent could be
 21081                  unmapped, but good enough.  */
 21082 
 21083               if (tem->window == configureEvent.xconfigure.window)
 21084                 {
 21085                   x_catch_errors (dpyinfo->display);
 21086                   rc = (XTranslateCoordinates (dpyinfo->display,
 21087                                                configureEvent.xconfigure.window,
 21088                                                dpyinfo->root_window,
 21089                                                -configureEvent.xconfigure.border_width,
 21090                                                -configureEvent.xconfigure.border_width,
 21091                                                &dest_x, &dest_y, &child)
 21092                         && !x_had_errors_p (dpyinfo->display));
 21093                   x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
 21094 
 21095                   if (rc)
 21096                     {
 21097                       tem->x = dest_x;
 21098                       tem->y = dest_y;
 21099                       tem->width = (configureEvent.xconfigure.width
 21100                                     + configureEvent.xconfigure.border_width);
 21101                       tem->height = (configureEvent.xconfigure.height
 21102                                      + configureEvent.xconfigure.border_width);
 21103                     }
 21104                   else
 21105                     {
 21106                       /* The window was probably destroyed, so get rid
 21107                          of it.  */
 21108 
 21109                       if (!last)
 21110                         x_dnd_toplevels = tem->next;
 21111                       else
 21112                         last->next = tem->next;
 21113 
 21114 #ifdef HAVE_XSHAPE
 21115                       if (tem->n_input_rects != -1)
 21116                         xfree (tem->input_rects);
 21117                       if (tem->n_bounding_rects != -1)
 21118                         xfree (tem->bounding_rects);
 21119 #endif
 21120                       xfree (tem);
 21121                     }
 21122 
 21123                   break;
 21124                 }
 21125             }
 21126         }
 21127 
 21128 #if defined HAVE_GTK3 && defined USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 21129           struct scroll_bar *bar = x_window_to_scroll_bar (dpyinfo->display,
 21130                                                            configureEvent.xconfigure.window, 2);
 21131 
 21132           /* There is really no other way to make GTK scroll bars fit
 21133              in the dimensions we want them to.  */
 21134           if (bar)
 21135             {
 21136               /* Skip all the pending configure events, not just the
 21137                  ones where window motion occurred.  */
 21138               while (XPending (dpyinfo->display))
 21139                 {
 21140                   XNextEvent (dpyinfo->display, &next_event);
 21141                   if (next_event.type != ConfigureNotify
 21142                       || next_event.xconfigure.window != event->xconfigure.window)
 21143                     {
 21144                       XPutBackEvent (dpyinfo->display, &next_event);
 21145                       break;
 21146                     }
 21147                   else
 21148                     configureEvent = next_event;
 21149                 }
 21150 
 21151               if (configureEvent.xconfigure.width != max (bar->width, 1)
 21152                   || configureEvent.xconfigure.height != max (bar->height, 1))
 21153                 {
 21154                   XResizeWindow (dpyinfo->display, bar->x_window,
 21155                                  max (bar->width, 1), max (bar->height, 1));
 21156                   x_flush (WINDOW_XFRAME (XWINDOW (bar->window)));
 21157                 }
 21158 
 21159 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
 21160               if (f && FRAME_X_DOUBLE_BUFFERED_P (f))
 21161                 x_drop_xrender_surfaces (f);
 21162 #endif
 21163 
 21164               goto OTHER;
 21165             }
 21166 #endif
 21167 
 21168       f = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, configureEvent.xconfigure.window);
 21169 
 21170       /* This means we can no longer be certain of the root window
 21171          coordinates of any's edit window.  */
 21172       if (any)
 21173         FRAME_X_OUTPUT (any)->window_offset_certain_p = false;
 21174 
 21175       /* Unfortunately, we need to call x_drop_xrender_surfaces for
 21176          _all_ ConfigureNotify events, otherwise we miss some and
 21177          flicker.  Don't try to optimize these calls by looking only
 21178          for size changes: that's not sufficient.  We miss some
 21179          surface invalidations and flicker.  */
 21180 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
 21181       if (f && FRAME_X_DOUBLE_BUFFERED_P (f))
 21182         x_drop_xrender_surfaces (f);
 21183 #endif
 21184 #if defined USE_CAIRO && !defined USE_GTK
 21185       if (f)
 21186         x_cr_update_surface_desired_size (f, configureEvent.xconfigure.width,
 21187                                           configureEvent.xconfigure.height);
 21188       else if (any && configureEvent.xconfigure.window == FRAME_X_WINDOW (any))
 21189         x_cr_update_surface_desired_size (any,
 21190                                           configureEvent.xconfigure.width,
 21191                                           configureEvent.xconfigure.height);
 21192 #endif
 21193 
 21194 #if !defined USE_X_TOOLKIT && !defined USE_GTK
 21195 
 21196       /* Make the new size of the frame its opaque region.  This is a
 21197          region describing areas of the window which are always
 21198          guaranteed to be completely opaque and can be treated as such
 21199          by the compositor.  It is set to the width and height of the
 21200          only window in no-toolkit builds when `alpha_background' is
 21201          not set, and is cleared otherwise.  */
 21202 
 21203       if (f || (any && configureEvent.xconfigure.window
 21204                 == FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (any)))
 21205         x_update_opaque_region (f ? f : any, &configureEvent);
 21206 
 21207 #endif /* !defined USE_X_TOOLKIT && !defined USE_GTK */
 21208 
 21209 #ifdef USE_GTK
 21210       if (!f
 21211           && (f = any)
 21212           && configureEvent.xconfigure.window == FRAME_X_WINDOW (f)
 21213           && (FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f)
 21214               || !(configureEvent.xconfigure.width <= 1
 21215                    && configureEvent.xconfigure.height <= 1)))
 21216         {
 21217 
 21218           if (CONSP (frame_size_history))
 21219             frame_size_history_extra
 21220               (f, build_string ("ConfigureNotify"),
 21221                FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f), FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f),
 21222                configureEvent.xconfigure.width,
 21223                configureEvent.xconfigure.height,
 21224                f->new_width, f->new_height);
 21225 
 21226 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
 21227           if (FRAME_X_DOUBLE_BUFFERED_P (f))
 21228             x_drop_xrender_surfaces (f);
 21229 #endif
 21230           xg_frame_resized (f, configureEvent.xconfigure.width,
 21231                             configureEvent.xconfigure.height);
 21232 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
 21233           x_cr_update_surface_desired_size (f, configureEvent.xconfigure.width,
 21234                                             configureEvent.xconfigure.height);
 21235 #endif
 21236           x_update_opaque_region (f, &configureEvent);
 21237           f = 0;
 21238         }
 21239 #endif
 21240       if (f && (FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f)
 21241                 || !(configureEvent.xconfigure.width <= 1
 21242                      && configureEvent.xconfigure.height <= 1)))
 21243         {
 21244 #ifdef USE_GTK
 21245           /* For GTK+ don't call x_net_wm_state for the scroll bar
 21246              window.  (Bug#24963, Bug#25887) */
 21247           if (configureEvent.xconfigure.window == FRAME_X_WINDOW (f))
 21248 #endif
 21249             x_net_wm_state (f, configureEvent.xconfigure.window);
 21250 
 21251 #if defined USE_X_TOOLKIT || defined USE_GTK
 21252           /* Tip frames are pure X window, set size for them.  */
 21253           if (FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (f))
 21254             {
 21255               if (FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f) != configureEvent.xconfigure.height
 21256                   || FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f) != configureEvent.xconfigure.width)
 21257                 SET_FRAME_GARBAGED (f);
 21258 
 21259               FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f) = configureEvent.xconfigure.height;
 21260               FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f) = configureEvent.xconfigure.width;
 21261             }
 21262 #endif
 21263 
 21264 #ifndef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 21265 #ifndef USE_GTK
 21266           int width = configureEvent.xconfigure.width;
 21267           int height = configureEvent.xconfigure.height;
 21268 
 21269           if (CONSP (frame_size_history))
 21270             frame_size_history_extra
 21271               (f, build_string ("ConfigureNotify"),
 21272                FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f), FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f),
 21273                width, height, f->new_width, f->new_height);
 21274 
 21275           /* In the toolkit version, change_frame_size
 21276              is called by the code that handles resizing
 21277              of the EmacsFrame widget.  */
 21278 
 21279           /* Even if the number of character rows and columns has
 21280              not changed, the font size may have changed, so we need
 21281              to check the pixel dimensions as well.  */
 21282 
 21283           if (width != FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f)
 21284               || height != FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f)
 21285               || (f->new_size_p
 21286                   && ((f->new_width >= 0 && width != f->new_width)
 21287                       || (f->new_height >= 0 && height != f->new_height))))
 21288             {
 21289               change_frame_size (f, width, height, false, true, false);
 21290               x_clear_under_internal_border (f);
 21291               SET_FRAME_GARBAGED (f);
 21292               cancel_mouse_face (f);
 21293             }
 21294 #endif /* not USE_GTK */
 21295 #endif
 21296 
 21297 #ifdef USE_GTK
 21298           /* GTK creates windows but doesn't map them.
 21299              Only get real positions when mapped.  */
 21300           if (FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f)
 21301               && gtk_widget_get_mapped (FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f)))
 21302 #endif
 21303             {
 21304               int old_left = f->left_pos;
 21305               int old_top = f->top_pos;
 21306               Lisp_Object frame;
 21307 
 21308               XSETFRAME (frame, f);
 21309 
 21310               if (!FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))
 21311                 x_real_positions (f, &f->left_pos, &f->top_pos);
 21312               else
 21313                 {
 21314                   Window root;
 21315                   unsigned int dummy_uint;
 21316 
 21317                   XGetGeometry (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 21318                                 &root, &f->left_pos, &f->top_pos,
 21319                                 &dummy_uint, &dummy_uint, &dummy_uint, &dummy_uint);
 21320                 }
 21321 
 21322               if (!FRAME_TOOLTIP_P (f)
 21323                   && (old_left != f->left_pos || old_top != f->top_pos))
 21324                 {
 21325                   inev.ie.kind = MOVE_FRAME_EVENT;
 21326                   XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 21327                 }
 21328             }
 21329 
 21330 
 21331 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 21332           if (f)
 21333             {
 21334               if (FRAME_XIC (f) && (FRAME_XIC_STYLE (f) & XIMStatusArea))
 21335                 xic_set_statusarea (f);
 21336 
 21337               struct window *w = XWINDOW (f->selected_window);
 21338               xic_set_preeditarea (w, w->cursor.x, w->cursor.y);
 21339             }
 21340 #endif
 21341 
 21342 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 21343           if (f && dpyinfo->supports_xi2)
 21344             {
 21345               Mouse_HLInfo *hlinfo;
 21346 
 21347               /* The input extension doesn't report motion events when
 21348                  the part of the window below the pointer changes.  To
 21349                  avoid outdated information from keeping
 21350                  i.e. mouse-highlight at the wrong position after the
 21351                  frame is moved or resized, reset the mouse highlight
 21352                  and last_mouse_motion_frame.  */
 21353 
 21354               if (dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame == f)
 21355                 dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame = NULL;
 21356 
 21357               hlinfo = MOUSE_HL_INFO (f);
 21358 
 21359               if (hlinfo->mouse_face_mouse_frame == f)
 21360                 reset_mouse_highlight (hlinfo);
 21361             }
 21362 #endif
 21363 
 21364         }
 21365 
 21366       if (x_dnd_in_progress
 21367           && dpyinfo == FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame))
 21368         x_dnd_update_state (dpyinfo, dpyinfo->last_user_time);
 21369       goto OTHER;
 21370 
 21371     case ButtonRelease:
 21372     case ButtonPress:
 21373       {
 21374         if (event->xbutton.type == ButtonPress)
 21375           x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, event->xbutton.time,
 21376                                         event->xbutton.send_event, true);
 21377 
 21378 #ifdef HAVE_XWIDGETS
 21379         struct xwidget_view *xvw;
 21380 
 21381         xvw = xwidget_view_from_window (event->xbutton.window);
 21382 
 21383         if (xvw)
 21384           {
 21385             xwidget_button (xvw, event->type == ButtonPress,
 21386                             event->xbutton.x, event->xbutton.y,
 21387                             event->xbutton.button, event->xbutton.state,
 21388                             event->xbutton.time);
 21389 
 21390             if (!EQ (selected_window, xvw->w) && (event->xbutton.button < 4))
 21391               {
 21392                 inev.ie.kind = SELECT_WINDOW_EVENT;
 21393                 inev.ie.frame_or_window = xvw->w;
 21394               }
 21395 
 21396             *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 21397             goto OTHER;
 21398           }
 21399 #endif
 21400         /* If we decide we want to generate an event to be seen
 21401            by the rest of Emacs, we put it here.  */
 21402         Lisp_Object tab_bar_arg = Qnil;
 21403         bool tab_bar_p = false;
 21404         bool tool_bar_p = false;
 21405         bool dnd_grab = false;
 21406 
 21407         if (x_dnd_in_progress
 21408             /* Handle these events normally if the recursion
 21409                level is higher than when the drag-and-drop
 21410                operation was initiated.  This is so that mouse
 21411                input works while we're in the debugger for, say,
 21412                `x-dnd-movement-function`.  */
 21413             && (command_loop_level + minibuf_level
 21414                 <= x_dnd_recursion_depth)
 21415             && dpyinfo == FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame))
 21416           {
 21417             f = mouse_or_wdesc_frame (dpyinfo, event->xbutton.window);
 21418 
 21419             if (f && event->xbutton.window == FRAME_X_WINDOW (f))
 21420               /* See the comment above x_compute_root_window_offset
 21421                  for why this optimization is performed.  */
 21422               x_compute_root_window_offset (f, event->xbutton.x_root,
 21423                                             event->xbutton.y_root,
 21424                                             event->xbutton.x,
 21425                                             event->xbutton.y);
 21426 
 21427             if (event->type == ButtonPress)
 21428               {
 21429                 x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, event->xbutton.time,
 21430                                               event->xbutton.send_event, true);
 21431 
 21432                 dpyinfo->grabbed |= (1 << event->xbutton.button);
 21433                 dpyinfo->last_mouse_frame = f;
 21434 
 21435                 if (f)
 21436                   f->last_tab_bar_item = -1;
 21437 #if ! defined (USE_GTK)
 21438                 if (f)
 21439                   f->last_tool_bar_item = -1;
 21440 #endif /* not USE_GTK */
 21441               }
 21442             else
 21443               dpyinfo->grabbed &= ~(1 << event->xbutton.button);
 21444 
 21445             if (event->xbutton.type == ButtonPress
 21446                 && x_dnd_last_seen_window != None)
 21447               {
 21448                 if (x_dnd_last_window_is_frame)
 21449                   x_dnd_note_self_wheel (dpyinfo,
 21450                                          x_dnd_last_seen_window,
 21451                                          event->xbutton.x_root,
 21452                                          event->xbutton.y_root,
 21453                                          event->xbutton.button,
 21454                                          event->xbutton.state,
 21455                                          event->xbutton.time);
 21456                 else if (x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1)
 21457                   x_dnd_send_position (x_dnd_frame,
 21458                                        x_dnd_last_seen_window,
 21459                                        x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel,
 21460                                        x_dnd_last_protocol_version,
 21461                                        event->xbutton.x_root,
 21462                                        event->xbutton.y_root,
 21463                                        event->xbutton.time,
 21464                                        x_dnd_wanted_action,
 21465                                        event->xbutton.button,
 21466                                        event->xbutton.state);
 21467 
 21468                 goto OTHER;
 21469               }
 21470 
 21471             if (event->xbutton.type == ButtonRelease)
 21472               {
 21473                 for (int i = 1; i < 8; ++i)
 21474                   {
 21475                     if (i != event->xbutton.button
 21476                         && event->xbutton.state & (Button1Mask << (i - 1)))
 21477                       dnd_grab = true;
 21478                   }
 21479 
 21480                 if (!dnd_grab)
 21481                   {
 21482                     x_dnd_end_window = x_dnd_last_seen_window;
 21483                     x_dnd_in_progress = false;
 21484 
 21485                     if (x_dnd_update_tooltip
 21486                         && FRAMEP (tip_frame)
 21487                         && FRAME_LIVE_P (XFRAME (tip_frame))
 21488                         && (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (XFRAME (tip_frame))
 21489                             == FRAME_X_DISPLAY (x_dnd_frame)))
 21490                       Fx_hide_tip ();
 21491 
 21492                     x_dnd_finish_frame = x_dnd_frame;
 21493 
 21494                     if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 21495                         && x_dnd_last_window_is_frame)
 21496                       {
 21497                         x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = false;
 21498                         x_dnd_note_self_drop (dpyinfo,
 21499                                               x_dnd_last_seen_window,
 21500                                               event->xbutton.x_root,
 21501                                               event->xbutton.y_root,
 21502                                               event->xbutton.time);
 21503                       }
 21504                     else if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None
 21505                              && x_dnd_last_protocol_version != -1)
 21506                       {
 21507                         x_dnd_pending_finish_target = x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel;
 21508                         x_dnd_waiting_for_finish_proto = x_dnd_last_protocol_version;
 21509 
 21510                         x_dnd_waiting_for_finish
 21511                           = x_dnd_do_drop (x_dnd_last_seen_window,
 21512                                            x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel,
 21513                                            x_dnd_last_protocol_version);
 21514                         x_dnd_finish_display = dpyinfo->display;
 21515                       }
 21516                     else if (x_dnd_last_seen_window != None)
 21517                       {
 21518                         xm_drop_start_message dmsg;
 21519                         xm_drag_receiver_info drag_receiver_info;
 21520 
 21521                         if (!xm_read_drag_receiver_info (dpyinfo, x_dnd_last_seen_window,
 21522                                                          &drag_receiver_info)
 21523                             && !x_dnd_disable_motif_protocol
 21524                             && drag_receiver_info.protocol_style != XM_DRAG_STYLE_NONE
 21525                             && (x_dnd_allow_current_frame
 21526                                 || x_dnd_last_seen_window != FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame)))
 21527                           {
 21528                             if (!x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 21529                               xm_setup_drag_info (dpyinfo, x_dnd_frame);
 21530 
 21531                             if (x_dnd_motif_setup_p)
 21532                               {
 21533                                 memset (&dmsg, 0, sizeof dmsg);
 21534 
 21535                                 dmsg.reason = XM_DRAG_REASON (XM_DRAG_ORIGINATOR_INITIATOR,
 21536                                                               XM_DRAG_REASON_DROP_START);
 21537                                 dmsg.byte_order = XM_BYTE_ORDER_CUR_FIRST;
 21538                                 dmsg.side_effects
 21539                                   = XM_DRAG_SIDE_EFFECT (xm_side_effect_from_action (dpyinfo,
 21540                                                                                      x_dnd_wanted_action),
 21541                                                          XM_DROP_SITE_VALID, x_dnd_motif_operations,
 21542                                                          (!x_dnd_xm_use_help
 21543                                                           ? XM_DROP_ACTION_DROP
 21544                                                           : XM_DROP_ACTION_DROP_HELP));
 21545                                 dmsg.timestamp = event->xbutton.time;
 21546                                 dmsg.x = event->xbutton.x_root;
 21547                                 dmsg.y = event->xbutton.y_root;
 21548                                 dmsg.index_atom = x_dnd_motif_atom;
 21549                                 dmsg.source_window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame);
 21550 
 21551                                 if (!XM_DRAG_STYLE_IS_DROP_ONLY (drag_receiver_info.protocol_style))
 21552                                   x_dnd_send_xm_leave_for_drop (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame),
 21553                                                                 x_dnd_frame, x_dnd_last_seen_window,
 21554                                                                 event->xbutton.time);
 21555 
 21556                                 xm_send_drop_message (dpyinfo, FRAME_X_WINDOW (x_dnd_frame),
 21557                                                       x_dnd_last_seen_window, &dmsg);
 21558 
 21559                                 x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = true;
 21560                                 x_dnd_waiting_for_motif_finish_display = dpyinfo;
 21561                                 x_dnd_waiting_for_motif_finish = 1;
 21562                                 x_dnd_finish_display = dpyinfo->display;
 21563                               }
 21564                           }
 21565                         else
 21566                           x_dnd_send_unsupported_drop (dpyinfo, (x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel != None
 21567                                                                  ? x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel
 21568                                                                  : x_dnd_last_seen_window),
 21569                                                        event->xbutton.x_root, event->xbutton.y_root,
 21570                                                        event->xbutton.time);
 21571                       }
 21572                     else if (x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel != None)
 21573                       x_dnd_send_unsupported_drop (dpyinfo, x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel,
 21574                                                    event->xbutton.x_root,
 21575                                                    event->xbutton.y_root,
 21576                                                    event->xbutton.time);
 21577 
 21578 
 21579                     x_dnd_last_protocol_version = -1;
 21580                     x_dnd_last_motif_style = XM_DRAG_STYLE_NONE;
 21581                     x_dnd_last_seen_window = None;
 21582                     x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel = None;
 21583                     x_dnd_last_window_is_frame = false;
 21584                     x_dnd_frame = NULL;
 21585                   }
 21586               }
 21587 
 21588             goto OTHER;
 21589           }
 21590 
 21591         if (x_dnd_in_progress
 21592             && (command_loop_level + minibuf_level
 21593                 <= x_dnd_recursion_depth))
 21594           goto OTHER;
 21595 
 21596         memset (&compose_status, 0, sizeof (compose_status));
 21597         dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame = NULL;
 21598 
 21599         f = mouse_or_wdesc_frame (dpyinfo, event->xbutton.window);
 21600 
 21601         if (f && event->xbutton.window == FRAME_X_WINDOW (f))
 21602           /* See the comment above x_compute_root_window_offset
 21603              for why this optimization is performed.  */
 21604           x_compute_root_window_offset (f, event->xbutton.x_root,
 21605                                         event->xbutton.y_root,
 21606                                         event->xbutton.x,
 21607                                         event->xbutton.y);
 21608 
 21609         if (f && event->xbutton.type == ButtonPress
 21610             && !popup_activated ()
 21611             && !x_window_to_scroll_bar (event->xbutton.display,
 21612                                         event->xbutton.window, 2)
 21613             && !FRAME_NO_ACCEPT_FOCUS (f))
 21614           {
 21615             /* When clicking into a child frame or when clicking
 21616                into a parent frame with the child frame selected and
 21617                `no-accept-focus' is not set, select the clicked
 21618                frame.  */
 21619             struct frame *hf = dpyinfo->highlight_frame;
 21620 
 21621             if (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f) || (hf && frame_ancestor_p (f, hf)))
 21622               {
 21623                 x_ignore_errors_for_next_request (dpyinfo, 0);
 21624                 XSetInputFocus (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 21625                                 RevertToParent, event->xbutton.time);
 21626                 x_stop_ignoring_errors (dpyinfo);
 21627 
 21628                 if (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))
 21629                   XRaiseWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f));
 21630               }
 21631           }
 21632 
 21633 #ifdef USE_GTK
 21634         if (!f)
 21635           {
 21636             f = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xbutton.window);
 21637 
 21638             if (event->xbutton.button > 3
 21639                 && event->xbutton.button < 8
 21640                 && f)
 21641               {
 21642                 if (ignore_next_mouse_click_timeout
 21643                     && dpyinfo == mouse_click_timeout_display)
 21644                   {
 21645                     if (event->type == ButtonPress
 21646                         && event->xbutton.time > ignore_next_mouse_click_timeout)
 21647                       {
 21648                         ignore_next_mouse_click_timeout = 0;
 21649                         x_construct_mouse_click (&inev.ie, &event->xbutton, f);
 21650                       }
 21651                     if (event->type == ButtonRelease)
 21652                       ignore_next_mouse_click_timeout = 0;
 21653                   }
 21654                 else
 21655                   x_construct_mouse_click (&inev.ie, &event->xbutton, f);
 21656 
 21657                 *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 21658                 goto OTHER;
 21659               }
 21660             else
 21661               f = NULL;
 21662           }
 21663 
 21664         if (f && xg_event_is_for_scrollbar (f, event, false))
 21665           f = 0;
 21666 #endif
 21667         if (f)
 21668           {
 21669             /* Is this in the tab-bar?  */
 21670             if (WINDOWP (f->tab_bar_window)
 21671                 && WINDOW_TOTAL_LINES (XWINDOW (f->tab_bar_window)))
 21672               {
 21673                 Lisp_Object window;
 21674                 int x = event->xbutton.x;
 21675                 int y = event->xbutton.y;
 21676 
 21677                 window = window_from_coordinates (f, x, y, 0, true, true);
 21678                 tab_bar_p = EQ (window, f->tab_bar_window);
 21679 
 21680                 if (tab_bar_p)
 21681                   {
 21682                     tab_bar_arg = handle_tab_bar_click
 21683                       (f, x, y, event->xbutton.type == ButtonPress,
 21684                        x_x_to_emacs_modifiers (dpyinfo, event->xbutton.state));
 21685                     x_flush_dirty_back_buffer_on (f);
 21686                   }
 21687               }
 21688 
 21689 #if ! defined (USE_GTK)
 21690             /* Is this in the tool-bar?  */
 21691             if (WINDOWP (f->tool_bar_window)
 21692                 && WINDOW_TOTAL_LINES (XWINDOW (f->tool_bar_window)))
 21693               {
 21694                 Lisp_Object window;
 21695                 int x = event->xbutton.x;
 21696                 int y = event->xbutton.y;
 21697 
 21698                 window = window_from_coordinates (f, x, y, 0, true, true);
 21699                 tool_bar_p = (EQ (window, f->tool_bar_window)
 21700                               && (event->xbutton.type != ButtonRelease
 21701                                   || f->last_tool_bar_item != -1));
 21702 
 21703                 if (tool_bar_p && event->xbutton.button < 4)
 21704                   {
 21705                     handle_tool_bar_click
 21706                       (f, x, y, event->xbutton.type == ButtonPress,
 21707                        x_x_to_emacs_modifiers (dpyinfo, event->xbutton.state));
 21708                     x_flush_dirty_back_buffer_on (f);
 21709                   }
 21710               }
 21711 #endif /* !USE_GTK */
 21712 
 21713             if (!(tab_bar_p && NILP (tab_bar_arg)) && !tool_bar_p)
 21714 #if defined (USE_X_TOOLKIT) || defined (USE_GTK)
 21715               if (! popup_activated ())
 21716 #endif
 21717                 {
 21718                   if (ignore_next_mouse_click_timeout
 21719                       && dpyinfo == mouse_click_timeout_display)
 21720                     {
 21721                       if (event->type == ButtonPress
 21722                           && event->xbutton.time > ignore_next_mouse_click_timeout)
 21723                         {
 21724                           ignore_next_mouse_click_timeout = 0;
 21725                           x_construct_mouse_click (&inev.ie, &event->xbutton, f);
 21726                         }
 21727                       if (event->type == ButtonRelease)
 21728                         ignore_next_mouse_click_timeout = 0;
 21729                     }
 21730                   else
 21731                     x_construct_mouse_click (&inev.ie, &event->xbutton, f);
 21732 
 21733                   if (!NILP (tab_bar_arg))
 21734                     inev.ie.arg = tab_bar_arg;
 21735                 }
 21736 
 21737             if (FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f)
 21738                 && !FRAME_NO_ACCEPT_FOCUS (f))
 21739               xembed_send_message (f, event->xbutton.time,
 21740                                    XEMBED_REQUEST_FOCUS, 0, 0, 0);
 21741           }
 21742         else
 21743           {
 21744             struct scroll_bar *bar
 21745               = x_window_to_scroll_bar (event->xbutton.display,
 21746                                         event->xbutton.window, 2);
 21747 
 21748 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 21749             /* Make the "Ctrl-Mouse-2 splits window" work for toolkit
 21750                scroll bars.  */
 21751             if (bar && event->xbutton.state & ControlMask)
 21752               {
 21753                 x_scroll_bar_handle_click (bar, event, &inev.ie, Qnil);
 21754                 *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 21755               }
 21756 #else /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 21757             if (bar)
 21758               x_scroll_bar_handle_click (bar, event, &inev.ie, Qnil);
 21759 #endif /* not USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 21760           }
 21761 
 21762         if (event->type == ButtonPress)
 21763           {
 21764             dpyinfo->grabbed |= (1 << event->xbutton.button);
 21765             dpyinfo->last_mouse_frame = f;
 21766             if (f && !tab_bar_p)
 21767               f->last_tab_bar_item = -1;
 21768 #if ! defined (USE_GTK)
 21769             if (f && !tool_bar_p)
 21770               f->last_tool_bar_item = -1;
 21771 #endif /* not USE_GTK */
 21772           }
 21773         else
 21774           dpyinfo->grabbed &= ~(1 << event->xbutton.button);
 21775 
 21776         /* Ignore any mouse motion that happened before this event;
 21777            any subsequent mouse-movement Emacs events should reflect
 21778            only motion after the ButtonPress/Release.  */
 21779         if (f != 0)
 21780           f->mouse_moved = false;
 21781 
 21782 #if defined (USE_X_TOOLKIT) || defined (USE_GTK)
 21783         f = x_menubar_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event);
 21784         /* For a down-event in the menu bar, don't pass it to Xt or
 21785            GTK right away.  Instead, save it and pass it to Xt or GTK
 21786            from kbd_buffer_get_event.  That way, we can run some Lisp
 21787            code first.  */
 21788         if (! popup_activated ()
 21789 #ifdef USE_GTK
 21790             /* Gtk+ menus only react to the first three buttons. */
 21791             && event->xbutton.button < 3
 21792 #endif
 21793             && f && event->type == ButtonPress
 21794             /* Verify the event is really within the menu bar
 21795                and not just sent to it due to grabbing.  */
 21796             && event->xbutton.x >= 0
 21797             && event->xbutton.x < FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f)
 21798             && event->xbutton.y >= 0
 21799             && event->xbutton.y < FRAME_MENUBAR_HEIGHT (f)
 21800             && event->xbutton.same_screen)
 21801           {
 21802 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 21803             Widget widget;
 21804 
 21805             widget = XtWindowToWidget (dpyinfo->display,
 21806                                        event->xbutton.window);
 21807 
 21808             if (widget && XmIsCascadeButton (widget)
 21809                 && XtIsSensitive (widget))
 21810               {
 21811 #endif
 21812                 if (!f->output_data.x->saved_menu_event)
 21813                   f->output_data.x->saved_menu_event = xmalloc (sizeof *event);
 21814                 *f->output_data.x->saved_menu_event = *event;
 21815                 inev.ie.kind = MENU_BAR_ACTIVATE_EVENT;
 21816                 XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 21817                 *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 21818 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 21819               }
 21820 #endif
 21821           }
 21822         else
 21823           goto OTHER;
 21824 #endif /* USE_X_TOOLKIT || USE_GTK */
 21825       }
 21826       break;
 21827 
 21828     case CirculateNotify:
 21829       if (x_dnd_in_progress
 21830           /* When _NET_WM_CLIENT_LIST stacking is being used, changes
 21831              in that property are watched for, and it's not necessary
 21832              to update the state in response to ordinary window
 21833              substructure events.  */
 21834           && !x_dnd_use_toplevels
 21835           && dpyinfo == FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame))
 21836         x_dnd_update_state (dpyinfo, dpyinfo->last_user_time);
 21837       goto OTHER;
 21838 
 21839     case CirculateRequest:
 21840       goto OTHER;
 21841 
 21842     case VisibilityNotify:
 21843       f = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, event->xvisibility.window);
 21844 
 21845       if (f)
 21846         FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->visibility_state = event->xvisibility.state;
 21847 
 21848       goto OTHER;
 21849 
 21850     case MappingNotify:
 21851       /* Someone has changed the keyboard mapping - update the
 21852          local cache.  */
 21853       switch (event->xmapping.request)
 21854         {
 21855         case MappingModifier:
 21856           x_find_modifier_meanings (dpyinfo);
 21857           FALLTHROUGH;
 21858         case MappingKeyboard:
 21859           XRefreshKeyboardMapping ((XMappingEvent *) &event->xmapping);
 21860         }
 21861       goto OTHER;
 21862 
 21863     case DestroyNotify:
 21864       if (event->xdestroywindow.window
 21865           == dpyinfo->net_supported_window)
 21866         dpyinfo->net_supported_window = None;
 21867 
 21868       if (event->xdestroywindow.window
 21869           == dpyinfo->motif_drag_window)
 21870         /* We get DestroyNotify events for the drag window because
 21871            x_special_window_exists_p selects for structure
 21872            notification.  The drag window is not supposed to go away
 21873            but not all clients obey that requirement when setting the
 21874            drag window property.  */
 21875         dpyinfo->motif_drag_window = None;
 21876 
 21877       xft_settings_event (dpyinfo, event);
 21878       break;
 21879 
 21880 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 21881     case GenericEvent:
 21882       {
 21883         if (!dpyinfo->supports_xi2)
 21884           goto OTHER;
 21885 
 21886         if (event->xgeneric.extension != dpyinfo->xi2_opcode)
 21887           /* Not an XI2 event. */
 21888           goto OTHER;
 21889 
 21890         bool must_free_data = false;
 21891         XIEvent *xi_event = (XIEvent *) event->xcookie.data;
 21892 
 21893         /* Sometimes the event is already claimed by GTK, which
 21894            will free its data in due course. */
 21895         if (!xi_event)
 21896           {
 21897             if (XGetEventData (dpyinfo->display, &event->xcookie))
 21898               must_free_data = true;
 21899 
 21900             xi_event = (XIEvent *) event->xcookie.data;
 21901           }
 21902 
 21903         XIDeviceEvent *xev = (XIDeviceEvent *) xi_event;
 21904 
 21905         if (!xi_event)
 21906           {
 21907             /* It may turn out that the event data has already been
 21908                implicitly freed for various reasons up to and
 21909                including XMenuActivate pushing some other event onto
 21910                the foreign-event queue, or x_menu_wait_for_events
 21911                calling XNextEvent through a timer that tries to wait
 21912                for input.
 21913 
 21914                In that case, XGetEventData will return True, but
 21915                cookie->data will be NULL.  Since handling such input
 21916                events is not really important, we can afford to
 21917                discard them.
 21918 
 21919                The way Xlib is currently implemented makes calling
 21920                XFreeEventData unnecessary in this case, but call it
 21921                anyway, since not doing so may lead to a memory leak in
 21922                the future.  */
 21923 
 21924             if (must_free_data)
 21925               XFreeEventData (dpyinfo->display, &event->xcookie);
 21926             goto OTHER;
 21927           }
 21928 
 21929         switch (event->xcookie.evtype)
 21930           {
 21931           case XI_FocusIn:
 21932             {
 21933               XIFocusInEvent *focusin;
 21934 
 21935               focusin = (XIFocusInEvent *) xi_event;
 21936               any = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, focusin->event);
 21937 
 21938 #ifdef USE_GTK
 21939               /* Some WMs (e.g. Mutter in Gnome Shell), don't unmap
 21940                  minimized/iconified windows; thus, for those WMs we won't get
 21941                  a MapNotify when unminimizing/deiconifying.  Check here if we
 21942                  are deiconizing a window (Bug42655).
 21943 
 21944                  But don't do that by default on GTK since it may cause a plain
 21945                  invisible frame get reported as iconified, compare
 21946                  https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/emacs-devel/2017-02/msg00133.html.
 21947                  That is fixed above but bites us here again.
 21948 
 21949                  The option x_set_frame_visibility_more_laxly allows to override
 21950                  the default behavior (Bug#49955, Bug#53298).  */
 21951               if (EQ (x_set_frame_visibility_more_laxly, Qfocus_in)
 21952                   || EQ (x_set_frame_visibility_more_laxly, Qt))
 21953 #endif /* USE_GTK */
 21954                 {
 21955                   f = any;
 21956                   if (f && FRAME_ICONIFIED_P (f))
 21957                     {
 21958                       SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 1);
 21959                       SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, false);
 21960                       f->output_data.x->has_been_visible = true;
 21961                       inev.ie.kind = DEICONIFY_EVENT;
 21962                       XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 21963                     }
 21964                 }
 21965 
 21966               xi_focus_handle_for_device (dpyinfo, any, xi_event);
 21967 
 21968               goto XI_OTHER;
 21969             }
 21970 
 21971           case XI_FocusOut:
 21972             {
 21973               XIFocusOutEvent *focusout;
 21974 
 21975               focusout = (XIFocusOutEvent *) xi_event;
 21976               any = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, focusout->event);
 21977               xi_focus_handle_for_device (dpyinfo, any, xi_event);
 21978 
 21979               goto XI_OTHER;
 21980             }
 21981 
 21982           case XI_Enter:
 21983             {
 21984               XIEnterEvent *enter = (XIEnterEvent *) xi_event;
 21985               XMotionEvent ev;
 21986               struct xi_device_t *source;
 21987 
 21988               any = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, enter->event);
 21989               source = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, enter->sourceid);
 21990 
 21991               ev.x = lrint (enter->event_x);
 21992               ev.y = lrint (enter->event_y);
 21993               ev.window = enter->event;
 21994               ev.time = enter->time;
 21995               ev.send_event = enter->send_event;
 21996 
 21997               x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, enter->time,
 21998                                             enter->send_event, false);
 21999 
 22000 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 22001               use_copy = true;
 22002 
 22003               copy.xcrossing.type = EnterNotify;
 22004               copy.xcrossing.serial = enter->serial;
 22005               copy.xcrossing.send_event = enter->send_event;
 22006               copy.xcrossing.display = dpyinfo->display;
 22007               copy.xcrossing.window = enter->event;
 22008               copy.xcrossing.root = enter->root;
 22009               copy.xcrossing.subwindow = enter->child;
 22010               copy.xcrossing.time = enter->time;
 22011               copy.xcrossing.x = lrint (enter->event_x);
 22012               copy.xcrossing.y = lrint (enter->event_y);
 22013               copy.xcrossing.x_root = lrint (enter->root_x);
 22014               copy.xcrossing.y_root = lrint (enter->root_y);
 22015               copy.xcrossing.mode = enter->mode;
 22016               copy.xcrossing.detail = enter->detail;
 22017               copy.xcrossing.focus = enter->focus;
 22018               copy.xcrossing.state = 0;
 22019               copy.xcrossing.same_screen = True;
 22020 #endif
 22021 
 22022               /* There is no need to handle entry/exit events for
 22023                  passive focus from non-top windows at all, since they
 22024                  are an inferiors of the frame's top window, which will
 22025                  get virtual events.  */
 22026               if (any)
 22027                 xi_focus_handle_for_device (dpyinfo, any, xi_event);
 22028 
 22029               if (!any)
 22030                 any = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, enter->event);
 22031 
 22032 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_1
 22033               /* xfwm4 selects for button events on the frame window,
 22034                  resulting in passive grabs being generated along with
 22035                  the delivery of emulated button events; this then
 22036                  interferes with scrolling, since device valuators
 22037                  will constantly be reset as the crossing events
 22038                  related to those grabs arrive.  The only way to
 22039                  remedy this is to never reset scroll valuators on a
 22040                  grab-related crossing event.  (bug#57476) */
 22041 
 22042               if (enter->mode != XINotifyUngrab
 22043                   && enter->mode != XINotifyGrab
 22044                   && enter->mode != XINotifyPassiveGrab
 22045                   && enter->mode != XINotifyPassiveUngrab)
 22046                 xi_reset_scroll_valuators_for_device_id (dpyinfo,
 22047                                                          enter->deviceid);
 22048 #endif
 22049 
 22050               {
 22051 #ifdef HAVE_XWIDGETS
 22052                 struct xwidget_view *xwidget_view;
 22053 
 22054                 xwidget_view = xwidget_view_from_window (enter->event);
 22055 
 22056                 if (xwidget_view)
 22057                   {
 22058                     xwidget_motion_or_crossing (xwidget_view, event);
 22059 
 22060                     goto XI_OTHER;
 22061                   }
 22062 #endif
 22063               }
 22064 
 22065               f = any;
 22066 
 22067               if (f && enter->event == FRAME_X_WINDOW (f))
 22068                 xi_compute_root_window_offset_enter (f, enter);
 22069 
 22070               if (f && x_mouse_click_focus_ignore_position)
 22071                 {
 22072                   ignore_next_mouse_click_timeout = (enter->time
 22073                                                      + x_mouse_click_focus_ignore_time);
 22074                   mouse_click_timeout_display = dpyinfo;
 22075                 }
 22076 
 22077               /* EnterNotify counts as mouse movement,
 22078                  so update things that depend on mouse position.  */
 22079               if (f && !f->output_data.x->hourglass_p)
 22080                 x_note_mouse_movement (f, &ev, source ? source->name : Qnil);
 22081 #ifdef USE_GTK
 22082               /* We may get an EnterNotify on the buttons in the toolbar.  In that
 22083                  case we moved out of any highlighted area and need to note this.  */
 22084               if (!f && dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame)
 22085                 x_note_mouse_movement (dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame, &ev,
 22086                                        source ? source->name : Qnil);
 22087 #endif
 22088               goto XI_OTHER;
 22089             }
 22090 
 22091           case XI_Leave:
 22092             {
 22093               XILeaveEvent *leave;
 22094               struct xi_device_t *device;
 22095 
 22096               leave = (XILeaveEvent *) xi_event;
 22097 #ifdef USE_GTK
 22098               struct xi_device_t *source;
 22099               XMotionEvent ev;
 22100 
 22101               ev.x = lrint (leave->event_x);
 22102               ev.y = lrint (leave->event_y);
 22103               ev.window = leave->event;
 22104               ev.time = leave->time;
 22105               ev.send_event = leave->send_event;
 22106 #endif
 22107 
 22108               any = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, leave->event);
 22109 
 22110 #ifdef USE_GTK
 22111               source = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, leave->sourceid);
 22112 #endif
 22113               device = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, leave->deviceid);
 22114 
 22115               if (device)
 22116                 xi_report_motion_window_clear (device);
 22117 
 22118               /* This allows us to catch LeaveNotify events generated by
 22119                  popup menu grabs.  FIXME: this is right when there is a
 22120                  focus menu, but implicit focus tracking can get screwed
 22121                  up if we get this and no XI_Enter event later.   */
 22122 
 22123 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 22124               if (popup_activated ()
 22125                   && (leave->mode == XINotifyPassiveUngrab
 22126                       || leave->mode == XINotifyUngrab))
 22127                 any = x_any_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, leave->event);
 22128 #endif
 22129 
 22130 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 22131               use_copy = true;
 22132 
 22133               copy.xcrossing.type = LeaveNotify;
 22134               copy.xcrossing.serial = leave->serial;
 22135               copy.xcrossing.send_event = leave->send_event;
 22136               copy.xcrossing.display = dpyinfo->display;
 22137               copy.xcrossing.window = leave->event;
 22138               copy.xcrossing.root = leave->root;
 22139               copy.xcrossing.subwindow = leave->child;
 22140               copy.xcrossing.time = leave->time;
 22141               copy.xcrossing.x = lrint (leave->event_x);
 22142               copy.xcrossing.y = lrint (leave->event_y);
 22143               copy.xcrossing.x_root = lrint (leave->root_x);
 22144               copy.xcrossing.y_root = lrint (leave->root_y);
 22145               copy.xcrossing.mode = leave->mode;
 22146               copy.xcrossing.detail = leave->detail;
 22147               copy.xcrossing.focus = leave->focus;
 22148               copy.xcrossing.state = 0;
 22149               copy.xcrossing.same_screen = True;
 22150 #endif
 22151 
 22152               /* One problem behind the design of XInput 2 scrolling is
 22153                  that valuators are not unique to each window, but only
 22154                  the window that has grabbed the valuator's device or
 22155                  the window that the device's pointer is on top of can
 22156                  receive motion events.  There is also no way to
 22157                  retrieve the value of a valuator outside of each motion
 22158                  event.
 22159 
 22160                  As such, to prevent wildly inaccurate results when
 22161                  the valuators have changed outside Emacs, we reset
 22162                  our records of each valuator's value whenever the
 22163                  pointer moves out of a frame.  Ideally, this would
 22164                  ignore events with a detail of XINotifyInferior, as
 22165                  the window the pointer moved to would be one known to
 22166                  Emacs, but the code to keep track of which valuators
 22167                  had to be reset upon the corresponding XI_Enter event
 22168                  was very complicated and kept running into server
 22169                  bugs.  */
 22170 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_1
 22171               /* xfwm4 selects for button events on the frame window,
 22172                  resulting in passive grabs being generated along with
 22173                  the delivery of emulated button events; this then
 22174                  interferes with scrolling, since device valuators
 22175                  will constantly be reset as the crossing events
 22176                  related to those grabs arrive.  The only way to
 22177                  remedy this is to never reset scroll valuators on a
 22178                  grab-related crossing event.  (bug#57476) */
 22179 
 22180               if (leave->mode != XINotifyUngrab
 22181                   && leave->mode != XINotifyGrab
 22182                   && leave->mode != XINotifyPassiveUngrab
 22183                   && leave->mode != XINotifyPassiveGrab)
 22184                 xi_reset_scroll_valuators_for_device_id (dpyinfo,
 22185                                                          leave->deviceid);
 22186 #endif
 22187 
 22188               x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, leave->time,
 22189                                             leave->send_event, false);
 22190 
 22191 #ifdef HAVE_XWIDGETS
 22192               {
 22193                 struct xwidget_view *xvw;
 22194 
 22195                 xvw = xwidget_view_from_window (leave->event);
 22196 
 22197                 if (xvw)
 22198                   {
 22199                     *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 22200                     xwidget_motion_or_crossing (xvw, event);
 22201 
 22202                     goto XI_OTHER;
 22203                   }
 22204               }
 22205 #endif
 22206 
 22207               if (any)
 22208                 xi_focus_handle_for_device (dpyinfo, any, xi_event);
 22209 
 22210 #ifndef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 22211               f = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, leave->event);
 22212 #else
 22213               /* On Xt builds that have XI2, the enter and leave event
 22214                  masks are set on the frame widget's window.  */
 22215               f = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, leave->event);
 22216 
 22217               if (!f)
 22218                 f = x_top_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, leave->event);
 22219 #endif
 22220 
 22221               if (f)
 22222                 {
 22223                   /* Now clear dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame, or
 22224                      gui_redo_mouse_highlight will end up highlighting
 22225                      the last known position of the mouse if a
 22226                      tooltip frame is later unmapped.  */
 22227 
 22228                   if (f == dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame)
 22229                     dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame = NULL;
 22230 
 22231                   /* Something similar applies to
 22232                      dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame.  */
 22233                   if (f == dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame)
 22234                     dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame = NULL;
 22235
