 23790                   /* Don't pass keys to GTK.  A Tab will shift focus to the
 23791                      tool bar in GTK 2.4.  Keys will still go to menus and
 23792                      dialogs because in that case popup_activated is nonzero
 23793                      (see above).  */
 23794                   *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 23795 #endif
 23796 
 23797                   XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 23798                   inev.ie.timestamp = xev->time;
 23799 
 23800 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 23801                   if (FRAME_XIC (f))
 23802                     {
 23803                       Status status_return;
 23804                       nbytes = XmbLookupString (FRAME_XIC (f),
 23805                                                 &xkey, (char *) copy_bufptr,
 23806                                                 copy_bufsiz, &keysym,
 23807                                                 &status_return);
 23808                       coding = FRAME_X_XIM_CODING (f);
 23809 
 23810                       if (status_return == XBufferOverflow)
 23811                         {
 23812                           copy_bufsiz = nbytes + 1;
 23813                           copy_bufptr = SAFE_ALLOCA (copy_bufsiz);
 23814                           nbytes = XmbLookupString (FRAME_XIC (f),
 23815                                                     &xkey, (char *) copy_bufptr,
 23816                                                     copy_bufsiz, &keysym,
 23817                                                     &status_return);
 23818                         }
 23819 
 23820                       if (status_return == XLookupNone)
 23821                         goto xi_done_keysym;
 23822                       else if (status_return == XLookupChars)
 23823                         {
 23824                           keysym = NoSymbol;
 23825                           state = 0;
 23826                         }
 23827                       else if (status_return != XLookupKeySym
 23828                                && status_return != XLookupBoth)
 23829                         emacs_abort ();
 23830                     }
 23831                   else
 23832 #endif
 23833                     {
 23834 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 23835                       int overflow = 0;
 23836                       KeySym sym = keysym;
 23837 
 23838                       if (dpyinfo->xkb_desc)
 23839                         {
 23840                           nbytes = XkbTranslateKeySym (dpyinfo->display, &sym,
 23841                                                        state & ~mods_rtrn, copy_bufptr,
 23842                                                        copy_bufsiz, &overflow);
 23843                           if (overflow)
 23844                             {
 23845                               copy_bufptr = SAFE_ALLOCA ((copy_bufsiz += overflow)
 23846                                                          * sizeof *copy_bufptr);
 23847                               overflow = 0;
 23848                               nbytes = XkbTranslateKeySym (dpyinfo->display, &sym,
 23849                                                            state & ~mods_rtrn, copy_bufptr,
 23850                                                            copy_bufsiz, &overflow);
 23851 
 23852                               if (overflow)
 23853                                 nbytes = 0;
 23854                             }
 23855 
 23856                           coding = Qnil;
 23857                         }
 23858                       else
 23859 #endif
 23860                         {
 23861                           old_state = xkey.state;
 23862                           xkey.state &= ~ControlMask;
 23863                           xkey.state &= ~(dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask
 23864                                           | dpyinfo->super_mod_mask
 23865                                           | dpyinfo->hyper_mod_mask
 23866                                           | dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask);
 23867 
 23868                           nbytes = XLookupString (&xkey, copy_bufptr,
 23869                                                   copy_bufsiz, &keysym,
 23870                                                   NULL);
 23871 
 23872                           xkey.state = old_state;
 23873                         }
 23874                     }
 23875 
 23876                   inev.ie.modifiers = x_x_to_emacs_modifiers (dpyinfo, state);
 23877 
 23878 #ifdef XK_F1
 23879                   if (x_dnd_in_progress
 23880                       && xev->deviceid == x_dnd_keyboard_device
 23881                       && keysym == XK_F1)
 23882                     {
 23883                       x_dnd_xm_use_help = true;
 23884                       goto xi_done_keysym;
 23885                     }
 23886 #endif
 23887 
 23888                   /* See if keysym should make Emacs quit.  */
 23889 
 23890                   if (keysym == dpyinfo->quit_keysym
 23891                       && (xev->time - dpyinfo->quit_keysym_time
 23892                           <= 350))
 23893                     {
 23894                       Vquit_flag = Qt;
 23895                       goto xi_done_keysym;
 23896                     }
 23897 
 23898                   if (keysym == dpyinfo->quit_keysym)
 23899                     {
 23900                       /* Otherwise, set the last time that keysym was
 23901                          pressed.  */
 23902                       dpyinfo->quit_keysym_time = xev->time;
 23903                       goto xi_done_keysym;
 23904                     }
 23905 
 23906                   /* First deal with keysyms which have defined
 23907                      translations to characters.  */
 23908                   if (keysym >= 32 && keysym < 128)
 23909                     /* Avoid explicitly decoding each ASCII character.  */
 23910                     {
 23911                       inev.ie.kind = ASCII_KEYSTROKE_EVENT;
 23912                       inev.ie.code = keysym;
 23913 
 23914                       if (source)
 23915                         inev.ie.device = source->name;
 23916 
 23917                       goto xi_done_keysym;
 23918                     }
 23919 
 23920                   /* Keysyms directly mapped to Unicode characters.  */
 23921                   if (keysym >= 0x01000000 && keysym <= 0x0110FFFF)
 23922                     {
 23923                       if (keysym < 0x01000080)
 23924                         inev.ie.kind = ASCII_KEYSTROKE_EVENT;
 23925                       else
 23926                         inev.ie.kind = MULTIBYTE_CHAR_KEYSTROKE_EVENT;
 23927 
 23928                       if (source)
 23929                         inev.ie.device = source->name;
 23930 
 23931                       inev.ie.code = keysym & 0xFFFFFF;
 23932                       goto xi_done_keysym;
 23933                     }
 23934 
 23935                   /* Now non-ASCII.  */
 23936                   if (HASH_TABLE_P (Vx_keysym_table)
 23937                       && (c = Fgethash (make_fixnum (keysym),
 23938                                         Vx_keysym_table,
 23939                                         Qnil),
 23940                           FIXNATP (c)))
 23941                     {
 23942                       inev.ie.kind = (SINGLE_BYTE_CHAR_P (XFIXNAT (c))
 23943                                       ? ASCII_KEYSTROKE_EVENT
 23944                                       : MULTIBYTE_CHAR_KEYSTROKE_EVENT);
 23945                       inev.ie.code = XFIXNAT (c);
 23946 
 23947                       if (source)
 23948                         inev.ie.device = source->name;
 23949 
 23950                       goto xi_done_keysym;
 23951                     }
 23952 
 23953                   /* Random non-modifier sorts of keysyms.  */
 23954                   if (((keysym >= XK_BackSpace && keysym <= XK_Escape)
 23955                        || keysym == XK_Delete
 23956 #ifdef XK_ISO_Left_Tab
 23957                        || (keysym >= XK_ISO_Left_Tab
 23958                            && keysym <= XK_ISO_Enter)
 23959 #endif
 23960                        || IsCursorKey (keysym) /* 0xff50 <= x < 0xff60 */
 23961                        || IsMiscFunctionKey (keysym) /* 0xff60 <= x < VARIES */
 23962 #ifdef HPUX
 23963                        /* This recognizes the "extended function
 23964                           keys".  It seems there's no cleaner way.
 23965                           Test IsModifierKey to avoid handling
 23966                           mode_switch incorrectly.  */
 23967                        || (XK_Select <= keysym && keysym < XK_KP_Space)
 23968 #endif
 23969 #ifdef XK_dead_circumflex
 23970                        || keysym == XK_dead_circumflex
 23971 #endif
 23972 #ifdef XK_dead_grave
 23973                        || keysym == XK_dead_grave
 23974 #endif
 23975 #ifdef XK_dead_tilde
 23976                        || keysym == XK_dead_tilde
 23977 #endif
 23978 #ifdef XK_dead_diaeresis
 23979                        || keysym == XK_dead_diaeresis
 23980 #endif
 23981 #ifdef XK_dead_macron
 23982                        || keysym == XK_dead_macron
 23983 #endif
 23984 #ifdef XK_dead_degree
 23985                        || keysym == XK_dead_degree
 23986 #endif
 23987 #ifdef XK_dead_acute
 23988                        || keysym == XK_dead_acute
 23989 #endif
 23990 #ifdef XK_dead_cedilla
 23991                        || keysym == XK_dead_cedilla
 23992 #endif
 23993 #ifdef XK_dead_breve
 23994                        || keysym == XK_dead_breve
 23995 #endif
 23996 #ifdef XK_dead_ogonek
 23997                        || keysym == XK_dead_ogonek
 23998 #endif
 23999 #ifdef XK_dead_caron
 24000                        || keysym == XK_dead_caron
 24001 #endif
 24002 #ifdef XK_dead_doubleacute
 24003                        || keysym == XK_dead_doubleacute
 24004 #endif
 24005 #ifdef XK_dead_abovedot
 24006                        || keysym == XK_dead_abovedot
 24007 #endif
 24008 #ifdef XK_dead_abovering
 24009                        || keysym == XK_dead_abovering
 24010 #endif
 24011 #ifdef XK_dead_belowdot
 24012                        || keysym == XK_dead_belowdot
 24013 #endif
 24014 #ifdef XK_dead_voiced_sound
 24015                        || keysym == XK_dead_voiced_sound
 24016 #endif
 24017 #ifdef XK_dead_semivoiced_sound
 24018                        || keysym == XK_dead_semivoiced_sound
 24019 #endif
 24020 #ifdef XK_dead_hook
 24021                        || keysym == XK_dead_hook
 24022 #endif
 24023 #ifdef XK_dead_horn
 24024                        || keysym == XK_dead_horn
 24025 #endif
 24026 #ifdef XK_dead_stroke
 24027                        || keysym == XK_dead_stroke
 24028 #endif
 24029 #ifdef XK_dead_abovecomma
 24030                        || keysym == XK_dead_abovecomma
 24031 #endif
 24032                        || IsKeypadKey (keysym) /* 0xff80 <= x < 0xffbe */
 24033                        || IsFunctionKey (keysym) /* 0xffbe <= x < 0xffe1 */
 24034                        /* Any "vendor-specific" key is ok.  */
 24035                        || (keysym & (1 << 28))
 24036                        || (keysym != NoSymbol && nbytes == 0))
 24037                       && ! (IsModifierKey (keysym)
 24038                             /* The symbols from XK_ISO_Lock
 24039                                to XK_ISO_Last_Group_Lock
 24040                                don't have real modifiers but
 24041                                should be treated similarly to
 24042                                Mode_switch by Emacs. */
 24043 #if defined XK_ISO_Lock && defined XK_ISO_Last_Group_Lock
 24044                             || (XK_ISO_Lock <= keysym
 24045                                 && keysym <= XK_ISO_Last_Group_Lock)
 24046 #endif
 24047                             ))
 24048                     {
 24049                       STORE_KEYSYM_FOR_DEBUG (keysym);
 24050                       /* make_lispy_event will convert this to a symbolic
 24051                          key.  */
 24052                       inev.ie.kind = NON_ASCII_KEYSTROKE_EVENT;
 24053                       inev.ie.code = keysym;
 24054 
 24055                       if (source)
 24056                         inev.ie.device = source->name;
 24057 
 24058                       goto xi_done_keysym;
 24059                     }
 24060 
 24061                   for (i = 0; i < nbytes; i++)
 24062                     {
 24063                       STORE_KEYSYM_FOR_DEBUG (copy_bufptr[i]);
 24064                     }
 24065 
 24066                   if (nbytes)
 24067                     {
 24068                       inev.ie.kind = MULTIBYTE_CHAR_KEYSTROKE_EVENT;
 24069                       inev.ie.arg = make_unibyte_string (copy_bufptr, nbytes);
 24070 
 24071                       Fput_text_property (make_fixnum (0), make_fixnum (nbytes),
 24072                                           Qcoding, coding, inev.ie.arg);
 24073 
 24074                       if (source)
 24075                         inev.ie.device = source->name;
 24076                     }
 24077                   goto xi_done_keysym;
 24078                 }
 24079 
 24080               goto XI_OTHER;
 24081             }
 24082 
 24083 #if defined USE_GTK && !defined HAVE_GTK3
 24084           case XI_RawKeyPress:
 24085             {
 24086               XIRawEvent *raw_event = (XIRawEvent *) xi_event;
 24087 
 24088               /* This is the only way to attribute core keyboard
 24089                  events generated on GTK+ 2.x to the extension device
 24090                  that generated them.  */
 24091               dpyinfo->pending_keystroke_time = raw_event->time;
 24092               dpyinfo->pending_keystroke_source = raw_event->sourceid;
 24093               dpyinfo->pending_keystroke_time_special_p = true;
 24094               goto XI_OTHER;
 24095             }
 24096 #endif
 24097 
 24098           case XI_KeyRelease:
 24099 #if defined HAVE_X_I18N || defined USE_GTK || defined USE_LUCID
 24100             {
 24101               XKeyPressedEvent xkey;
 24102 
 24103               memset (&xkey, 0, sizeof xkey);
 24104 
 24105               xkey.type = KeyRelease;
 24106               xkey.serial = xev->serial;
 24107               xkey.send_event = xev->send_event;
 24108               xkey.display = dpyinfo->display;
 24109               xkey.window = xev->event;
 24110               xkey.root = xev->root;
 24111               xkey.subwindow = xev->child;
 24112               xkey.time = xev->time;
 24113               xkey.state = xi_convert_event_keyboard_state (xev);
 24114               xkey.x = lrint (xev->event_x);
 24115               xkey.y = lrint (xev->event_y);
 24116               xkey.x_root = lrint (xev->root_x);
 24117               xkey.y_root = lrint (xev->root_y);
 24118 
 24119               /* Some input methods react differently depending on the
 24120                  buttons that are pressed.  */
 24121               xi_convert_button_state (&xev->buttons, &xkey.state);
 24122 
 24123               xkey.keycode = xev->detail;
 24124               xkey.same_screen = True;
 24125 
 24126 #ifdef USE_LUCID
 24127               if (!popup_activated ())
 24128                 {
 24129 #endif
 24130 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 24131                   if (x_filter_event (dpyinfo, (XEvent *) &xkey))
 24132                     *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 24133 #elif defined USE_GTK
 24134                   f = x_any_window_to_frame (xkey->event);
 24135 
 24136                   if (f && xg_filter_key (f, event))
 24137                     *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 24138 #endif
 24139 #ifdef USE_LUCID
 24140                 }
 24141               else
 24142                 {
 24143                   /* FIXME: the Lucid menu bar pops down upon any key
 24144                      release event, so we don't dispatch these events
 24145                      at all, which doesn't seem to be the right
 24146                      solution.
 24147 
 24148                      use_copy = true;
 24149                      copy.xkey = xkey; */
 24150                 }
 24151 #endif
 24152             }
 24153 #endif
 24154 
 24155             goto XI_OTHER;
 24156 
 24157           case XI_PropertyEvent:
 24158             goto XI_OTHER;
 24159 
 24160           case XI_HierarchyChanged:
 24161             {
 24162               XIHierarchyEvent *hev;
 24163               XIDeviceInfo *info;
 24164               int i, ndevices, n_disabled, *disabled;
 24165               struct xi_device_t *device;
 24166               bool any_changed;
 24167 
 24168               any_changed = false;
 24169               hev = (XIHierarchyEvent *) xi_event;
 24170               disabled = SAFE_ALLOCA (sizeof *disabled * hev->num_info);
 24171               n_disabled = 0;
 24172 
 24173               for (i = 0; i < hev->num_info; ++i)
 24174                 {
 24175                   if (hev->info[i].flags & XIDeviceEnabled)
 24176                     {
 24177                       /* Handle all disabled devices now, to prevent
 24178                          things happening out-of-order later.  */
 24179 
 24180                       if (n_disabled)
 24181                         {
 24182                           xi_disable_devices (dpyinfo, disabled, n_disabled);
 24183                           n_disabled = 0;
 24184 
 24185                           /* This flag really just means that disabled
 24186                              devices were handled early and should be
 24187                              used in conjunction with n_disabled.  */
 24188                           any_changed = true;
 24189                         }
 24190 
 24191                       /* Under unknown circumstances, multiple
 24192                          XIDeviceEnabled events are sent at once,
 24193                          causing the device to be duplicated.  Check
 24194                          that the device doesn't exist before adding
 24195                          it.  */
 24196 
 24197                       if (!xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo,
 24198                                               hev->info[i].deviceid))
 24199                         {
 24200                           x_catch_errors (dpyinfo->display);
 24201                           info = XIQueryDevice (dpyinfo->display,
 24202                                                 hev->info[i].deviceid,
 24203                                                 &ndevices);
 24204                           x_uncatch_errors ();
 24205 
 24206                           if (info && info->enabled)
 24207                             {
 24208                               dpyinfo->devices
 24209                                 = xrealloc (dpyinfo->devices,
 24210                                             (sizeof *dpyinfo->devices
 24211                                              * ++dpyinfo->num_devices));
 24212                               memset (dpyinfo->devices + dpyinfo->num_devices - 1,
 24213                                       0, sizeof *dpyinfo->devices);
 24214                               device = &dpyinfo->devices[dpyinfo->num_devices - 1];
 24215                               xi_populate_device_from_info (dpyinfo, device, info);
 24216                             }
 24217 
 24218                           if (info)
 24219                             XIFreeDeviceInfo (info);
 24220                         }
 24221                     }
 24222                   else if (hev->info[i].flags & XIDeviceDisabled)
 24223                     disabled[n_disabled++] = hev->info[i].deviceid;
 24224                   else if (hev->info[i].flags & XISlaveDetached
 24225                            || hev->info[i].flags & XISlaveAttached)
 24226                     {
 24227                       device = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, hev->info[i].deviceid);
 24228                       x_catch_errors (dpyinfo->display);
 24229                       info = XIQueryDevice (dpyinfo->display, hev->info[i].deviceid,
 24230                                             &ndevices);
 24231                       x_uncatch_errors ();
 24232 
 24233                       if (info)
 24234                         {
 24235                           if (device)
 24236                             {
 24237                               device->use = info->use;
 24238                               device->attachment = info->attachment;
 24239                             }
 24240 
 24241                           /* device could have been disabled by now.
 24242                              But instead of removing it immediately,
 24243                              wait for XIDeviceDisabled, or internal
 24244                              state could be left inconsistent.  */
 24245 
 24246                           XIFreeDeviceInfo (info);
 24247                         }
 24248                     }
 24249                 }
 24250 
 24251               /* Delete all devices that were disabled by this
 24252                  event.  */
 24253               xi_disable_devices (dpyinfo, disabled, n_disabled);
 24254 
 24255               /* If the device hierarchy has been changed, recompute
 24256                  focus.  This might seem like a micro-optimization but
 24257                  it actually keeps the focus from changing in some
 24258                  cases where it would be undesierable.  */
 24259               if (any_changed || n_disabled)
 24260                 xi_handle_focus_change (dpyinfo);
 24261 
 24262               goto XI_OTHER;
 24263             }
 24264 
 24265           case XI_DeviceChanged:
 24266             {
 24267               XIDeviceChangedEvent *device_changed;
 24268               struct xi_device_t *device;
 24269 
 24270               device_changed = (XIDeviceChangedEvent *) xi_event;
 24271               device = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, device_changed->deviceid);
 24272 
 24273               /* If the device isn't enabled, then stop handling this
 24274                  event.  A HierarchyChanged event will be sent if it
 24275                  is enabled afterwards.  */
 24276               if (!device)
 24277                 goto XI_OTHER;
 24278 
 24279               /* Now handle the event by retrieving scroll valuators
 24280                  and touch info.  */
 24281               xi_handle_device_changed (dpyinfo, device, device_changed);
 24282               goto XI_OTHER;
 24283             }
 24284 
 24285 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_2
 24286           case XI_TouchBegin:
 24287             {
 24288               struct xi_device_t *device, *source;
 24289               bool menu_bar_p = false, tool_bar_p = false;
 24290 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
 24291               GdkRectangle test_rect;
 24292 #endif
 24293               device = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, xev->deviceid);
 24294               source = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, xev->sourceid);
 24295               x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, xev->time,
 24296                                             xev->send_event, true);
 24297 
 24298               if (!device)
 24299                 goto XI_OTHER;
 24300 
 24301               if (xi_find_touch_point (device, xev->detail))
 24302                 emacs_abort ();
 24303 
 24304               f = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, xev->event);
 24305 
 24306               if (f)
 24307                 /* See the comment above x_compute_root_window_offset
 24308                    for why this optimization is performed.  */
 24309                 xi_compute_root_window_offset (f, xev);
 24310 
 24311 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
 24312               menu_bar_p = (f && FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->menubar_widget
 24313                             && xg_event_is_for_menubar (f, event));
 24314               if (f && FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->toolbar_widget)
 24315                 {
 24316                   int scale = xg_get_scale (f);
 24317 
 24318                   test_rect.x = xev->event_x / scale;
 24319                   test_rect.y = xev->event_y / scale;
 24320                   test_rect.width = 1;
 24321                   test_rect.height = 1;
 24322 
 24323                   tool_bar_p = gtk_widget_intersect (FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->toolbar_widget,
 24324                                                      &test_rect, NULL);
 24325                 }
 24326 #endif
 24327 
 24328 #ifndef HAVE_EXT_TOOL_BAR
 24329               /* Is this a touch from a direct touch device that is in
 24330                  the tool-bar?  */
 24331               if (device->direct_p
 24332                   && WINDOWP (f->tool_bar_window)
 24333                   && WINDOW_TOTAL_LINES (XWINDOW (f->tool_bar_window)))
 24334                 {
 24335                   Lisp_Object window;
 24336                   int x = xev->event_x;
 24337                   int y = xev->event_y;
 24338 
 24339                   window = window_from_coordinates (f, x, y, 0, true, true);
 24340                   /* Ignore button release events if the mouse
 24341                      wasn't previously pressed on the tool bar.
 24342                      We do this because otherwise selecting some
 24343                      text with the mouse and then releasing it on
 24344                      the tool bar doesn't stop selecting text,
 24345                      since the tool bar eats the button up
 24346                      event.  */
 24347                   tool_bar_p = EQ (window, f->tool_bar_window);
 24348 
 24349                   /* If this touch has started in the tool bar, do not
 24350                      send it to Lisp.  Instead, simulate a tool bar
 24351                      click, releasing it once it goes away.  */
 24352 
 24353                   if (tool_bar_p)
 24354                     {
 24355                       /* Call note_mouse_highlight on the tool bar
 24356                          item.  Otherwise, get_tool_bar_item will
 24357                          return 1.
 24358 
 24359                          This is not necessary when mouse-highlight is
 24360                          nil.  */
 24361 
 24362                       if (!NILP (Vmouse_highlight))
 24363                         {
 24364                           note_mouse_highlight (f, x, y);
 24365 
 24366                           /* Always allow future mouse motion to
 24367                              update the mouse highlight, no matter
 24368                              where it is.  */
 24369                           memset (&dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph, 0,
 24370                                   sizeof dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph);
 24371                           dpyinfo->last_mouse_glyph_frame = f;
 24372                         }
 24373 
 24374                       handle_tool_bar_click_with_device (f, x, y, true, 0,
 24375                                                          (source
 24376                                                           ? source->name : Qt));
 24377 
 24378                       /* Flush any changes made by that to the front
 24379                          buffer.  */
 24380                       x_flush_dirty_back_buffer_on (f);
 24381 
 24382                       /* Record the device and the touch ID on the
 24383                          frame.  That way, Emacs knows when to dismiss
 24384                          the tool bar click later.  */
 24385 
 24386                       FRAME_OUTPUT_DATA (f)->tool_bar_touch_device
 24387                         = device->device_id;
 24388                       FRAME_OUTPUT_DATA (f)->tool_bar_touch_id = xev->detail;
 24389 
 24390                       goto XI_OTHER;
 24391                     }
 24392                 }
 24393 #endif
 24394 
 24395               if (!menu_bar_p && !tool_bar_p)
 24396                 {
 24397                   if (f && device->direct_p)
 24398                     {
 24399                       *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 24400 
 24401                       x_catch_errors (dpyinfo->display);
 24402 
 24403                       if (x_input_grab_touch_events)
 24404                         XIAllowTouchEvents (dpyinfo->display,
 24405                                             xev->deviceid,
 24406                                             xev->detail, xev->event,
 24407                                             XIAcceptTouch);
 24408 
 24409                       if (!x_had_errors_p (dpyinfo->display))
 24410                         {
 24411                           xi_link_touch_point (device, xev->detail,
 24412                                                xev->event_x,
 24413                                                xev->event_y, f);
 24414 
 24415                           inev.ie.kind = TOUCHSCREEN_BEGIN_EVENT;
 24416                           inev.ie.timestamp = xev->time;
 24417                           XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 24418                           XSETINT (inev.ie.x, lrint (xev->event_x));
 24419                           XSETINT (inev.ie.y, lrint (xev->event_y));
 24420                           XSETINT (inev.ie.arg, xev->detail);
 24421 
 24422                           if (source)
 24423                             inev.ie.device = source->name;
 24424                         }
 24425 
 24426                       x_uncatch_errors ();
 24427                     }
 24428 #ifndef HAVE_GTK3
 24429                   else if (x_input_grab_touch_events)
 24430                     {
 24431                       x_ignore_errors_for_next_request (dpyinfo, 0);
 24432                       XIAllowTouchEvents (dpyinfo->display, xev->deviceid,
 24433                                           xev->detail, xev->event, XIRejectTouch);
 24434                       x_stop_ignoring_errors (dpyinfo);
 24435                     }
 24436 #endif
 24437                 }
 24438               else
 24439                 {
 24440 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
 24441                   bool was_waiting_for_input = waiting_for_input;
 24442                   /* This hack was adopted from the NS port.  Whether
 24443                      or not it is actually safe is a different story
 24444                      altogether.  */
 24445                   if (waiting_for_input)
 24446                     waiting_for_input = 0;
 24447                   set_frame_menubar (f, true);
 24448                   waiting_for_input = was_waiting_for_input;
 24449 #endif
 24450                 }
 24451 
 24452               goto XI_OTHER;
 24453             }
 24454 
 24455           case XI_TouchUpdate:
 24456             {
 24457               struct xi_device_t *device, *source;
 24458               struct xi_touch_point_t *touchpoint;
 24459               Lisp_Object arg = Qnil;
 24460 
 24461               device = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, xev->deviceid);
 24462               source = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, xev->sourceid);
 24463               x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, xev->time,
 24464                                             xev->send_event, true);
 24465 
 24466               if (!device)
 24467                 goto XI_OTHER;
 24468 
 24469               touchpoint = xi_find_touch_point (device, xev->detail);
 24470 
 24471               if (!touchpoint)
 24472                 goto XI_OTHER;
 24473 
 24474               touchpoint->x = xev->event_x;
 24475               touchpoint->y = xev->event_y;
 24476 
 24477               f = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, xev->event);
 24478 
 24479               if (f && device->direct_p)
 24480                 {
 24481                   inev.ie.kind = TOUCHSCREEN_UPDATE_EVENT;
 24482                   inev.ie.timestamp = xev->time;
 24483                   XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 24484 
 24485                   for (touchpoint = device->touchpoints;
 24486                        touchpoint; touchpoint = touchpoint->next)
 24487                     {
 24488                       if (touchpoint->frame == f)
 24489                         arg = Fcons (list3i (lrint (touchpoint->x),
 24490                                              lrint (touchpoint->y),
 24491                                              lrint (touchpoint->number)),
 24492                                      arg);
 24493                     }
 24494 
 24495                   if (source)
 24496                     inev.ie.device = source->name;
 24497 
 24498                   inev.ie.arg = arg;
 24499                 }
 24500 
 24501               goto XI_OTHER;
 24502             }
 24503 
 24504           case XI_TouchEnd:
 24505             {
 24506               struct xi_device_t *device, *source;
 24507               bool unlinked_p;
 24508 
 24509               device = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, xev->deviceid);
 24510               source = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, xev->sourceid);
 24511               x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, xev->time,
 24512                                             xev->send_event, true);
 24513 
 24514               if (!device)
 24515                 goto XI_OTHER;
 24516 
 24517               unlinked_p = xi_unlink_touch_point (xev->detail, device);
 24518 
 24519               if (unlinked_p)
 24520                 {
 24521                   f = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, xev->event);
 24522 
 24523                   if (f && device->direct_p)
 24524                     {
 24525                       inev.ie.kind = TOUCHSCREEN_END_EVENT;
 24526                       inev.ie.timestamp = xev->time;
 24527 
 24528                       XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, f);
 24529                       XSETINT (inev.ie.x, lrint (xev->event_x));
 24530                       XSETINT (inev.ie.y, lrint (xev->event_y));
 24531                       XSETINT (inev.ie.arg, xev->detail);
 24532 
 24533                       if (source)
 24534                         inev.ie.device = source->name;
 24535                     }
 24536                 }
 24537 
 24538 #ifndef HAVE_EXT_TOOL_BAR
 24539               /* Now see if the touchpoint was previously on the tool bar.
 24540                  If it was, release the tool bar.  */
 24541 
 24542               if (!f)
 24543                 f = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, xev->event);
 24544 
 24545               if (f && (FRAME_OUTPUT_DATA (f)->tool_bar_touch_id
 24546                         == xev->detail))
 24547                 {
 24548                   if (f->last_tool_bar_item != -1)
 24549                     handle_tool_bar_click_with_device (f, xev->event_x,
 24550                                                        xev->event_y,
 24551                                                        false, 0,
 24552                                                        (source
 24553                                                         ? source->name
 24554                                                         : Qnil));
 24555 
 24556                   /* Cancel any outstanding mouse highlight.  */
 24557                   note_mouse_highlight (f, -1, -1);
 24558                   x_flush_dirty_back_buffer_on (f);
 24559 
 24560                   /* Now clear the tool bar device.  */
 24561                   FRAME_OUTPUT_DATA (f)->tool_bar_touch_device = 0;
 24562                 }
 24563 #endif
 24564 
 24565               goto XI_OTHER;
 24566             }
 24567 
 24568 #endif
 24569 
 24570 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_4
 24571           case XI_GesturePinchBegin:
 24572           case XI_GesturePinchUpdate:
 24573             {
 24574               XIGesturePinchEvent *pev = (XIGesturePinchEvent *) xi_event;
 24575               struct xi_device_t *device, *source;
 24576 
 24577               device = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, pev->deviceid);
 24578               source = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, pev->sourceid);
 24579               x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, pev->time,
 24580                                             pev->send_event, true);
 24581 
 24582               if (!device)
 24583                 goto XI_OTHER;
 24584 
 24585 #ifdef HAVE_XWIDGETS
 24586               struct xwidget_view *xvw = xwidget_view_from_window (pev->event);
 24587 
 24588               if (xvw)
 24589                 {
 24590                   *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 24591                   xwidget_pinch (xvw, pev);
 24592                   goto XI_OTHER;
 24593                 }
 24594 #endif
 24595 
 24596               any = x_window_to_frame (dpyinfo, pev->event);
 24597 
 24598               if (any)
 24599                 {
 24600                   if (pev->event == FRAME_X_WINDOW (any))
 24601                     xi_compute_root_window_offset_pinch (any, pev);
 24602 
 24603                   inev.ie.kind = PINCH_EVENT;
 24604                   inev.ie.modifiers
 24605                     = x_x_to_emacs_modifiers (dpyinfo, pev->mods.effective);
 24606 
 24607                   XSETINT (inev.ie.x, lrint (pev->event_x));
 24608                   XSETINT (inev.ie.y, lrint (pev->event_y));
 24609                   XSETFRAME (inev.ie.frame_or_window, any);
 24610                   inev.ie.arg = list4 (make_float (pev->delta_x),
 24611                                        make_float (pev->delta_y),
 24612                                        make_float (pev->scale),
 24613                                        make_float (pev->delta_angle));
 24614 
 24615                   if (source)
 24616                     inev.ie.device = source->name;
 24617                 }
 24618 
 24619               /* Once again GTK seems to crash when confronted by
 24620                  events it doesn't understand.  */
 24621               *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 24622               goto XI_OTHER;
 24623             }
 24624 
 24625           case XI_GesturePinchEnd:
 24626             {
 24627 #if defined HAVE_XWIDGETS
 24628               XIGesturePinchEvent *pev = (XIGesturePinchEvent *) xi_event;
 24629               struct xwidget_view *xvw = xwidget_view_from_window (pev->event);
 24630 
 24631               if (xvw)
 24632                 xwidget_pinch (xvw, pev);
 24633 #endif
 24634               *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 24635               goto XI_OTHER;
 24636             }
 24637 #endif
 24638           default:
 24639             goto XI_OTHER;
 24640           }
 24641 
 24642       xi_done_keysym:
 24643 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 24644       if (f)
 24645         {
 24646           struct window *w = XWINDOW (f->selected_window);
 24647           xic_set_preeditarea (w, w->cursor.x, w->cursor.y);
 24648 
 24649           if (FRAME_XIC (f) && (FRAME_XIC_STYLE (f) & XIMStatusArea))
 24650             xic_set_statusarea (f);
 24651         }
 24652 #endif
 24653         if (must_free_data)
 24654           XFreeEventData (dpyinfo->display, &event->xcookie);
 24655         goto done_keysym;
 24656 
 24657       XI_OTHER:
 24658         if (must_free_data)
 24659           XFreeEventData (dpyinfo->display, &event->xcookie);
 24660         goto OTHER;
 24661       }
 24662 #endif
 24663 
 24664     default:
 24665 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 24666       if (dpyinfo->supports_xkb
 24667           && event->type == dpyinfo->xkb_event_type)
 24668         {
 24669           XkbEvent *xkbevent = (XkbEvent *) event;
 24670 
 24671           if (xkbevent->any.xkb_type == XkbNewKeyboardNotify
 24672               || xkbevent->any.xkb_type == XkbMapNotify)
 24673             {
 24674               XkbRefreshKeyboardMapping (&xkbevent->map);
 24675 
 24676               if (dpyinfo->xkb_desc)
 24677                 {
 24678                   if (XkbGetUpdatedMap (dpyinfo->display,
 24679                                         (XkbKeySymsMask
 24680                                          | XkbKeyTypesMask
 24681                                          | XkbModifierMapMask
 24682                                          | XkbVirtualModsMask),
 24683                                         dpyinfo->xkb_desc) == Success)
 24684                     XkbGetNames (dpyinfo->display, XkbAllNamesMask,
 24685                                  dpyinfo->xkb_desc);
 24686                   else
 24687                     {
 24688                       XkbFreeKeyboard (dpyinfo->xkb_desc,
 24689                                        XkbAllComponentsMask, True);
 24690                       dpyinfo->xkb_desc = NULL;
 24691                     }
 24692                 }
 24693               else
 24694                 {
 24695                   dpyinfo->xkb_desc = XkbGetMap (dpyinfo->display,
 24696                                                  (XkbKeySymsMask
 24697                                                   | XkbKeyTypesMask
 24698                                                   | XkbModifierMapMask
 24699                                                   | XkbVirtualModsMask),
 24700                                                  XkbUseCoreKbd);
 24701 
 24702                   if (dpyinfo->xkb_desc)
 24703                     XkbGetNames (dpyinfo->display, XkbAllNamesMask,
 24704                                  dpyinfo->xkb_desc);
 24705                 }
 24706 
 24707               x_find_modifier_meanings (dpyinfo);
 24708             }
 24709           else if (x_dnd_in_progress
 24710                    && xkbevent->any.xkb_type == XkbStateNotify)
 24711             x_dnd_keyboard_state = (xkbevent->state.mods
 24712                                     | xkbevent->state.ptr_buttons);
 24713         }
 24714 #endif
 24715 #ifdef HAVE_XSHAPE
 24716       if (dpyinfo->xshape_supported_p
 24717           && event->type == dpyinfo->xshape_event_base + ShapeNotify
 24718           && x_dnd_in_progress && x_dnd_use_toplevels
 24719           && dpyinfo == FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (x_dnd_frame))
 24720         {
 24721 #ifndef USE_GTK
 24722           XEvent xevent;
 24723 #endif
 24724           XShapeEvent *xse = (XShapeEvent *) event;
 24725 #if defined HAVE_XCB_SHAPE && defined HAVE_XCB_SHAPE_INPUT_RECTS
 24726           xcb_shape_get_rectangles_cookie_t bounding_rect_cookie;
 24727           xcb_shape_get_rectangles_reply_t *bounding_rect_reply;
 24728           xcb_rectangle_iterator_t bounding_rect_iterator;
 24729 
 24730           xcb_shape_get_rectangles_cookie_t input_rect_cookie;
 24731           xcb_shape_get_rectangles_reply_t *input_rect_reply;
 24732           xcb_rectangle_iterator_t input_rect_iterator;
 24733 
 24734           xcb_generic_error_t *error;
 24735 #else
 24736           XRectangle *rects;
 24737           int rc, ordering;
 24738 #endif
 24739 
 24740           /* Somehow this really interferes with GTK's own processing
 24741              of ShapeNotify events.  Not sure what GTK uses them for,
 24742              but we cannot skip any of them here.  */
 24743 #ifndef USE_GTK
 24744           while (XPending (dpyinfo->display))
 24745             {
 24746               XNextEvent (dpyinfo->display, &xevent);
 24747 
 24748               if (xevent.type == dpyinfo->xshape_event_base + ShapeNotify
 24749                   && ((XShapeEvent *) &xevent)->window == xse->window)
 24750                 xse = (XShapeEvent *) &xevent;
 24751               else
 24752                 {
 24753                   XPutBackEvent (dpyinfo->display, &xevent);
 24754                   break;
 24755                 }
 24756             }
 24757 #endif
 24758 
 24759           for (struct x_client_list_window *tem = x_dnd_toplevels; tem;
 24760                tem = tem->next)
 24761             {
 24762               if (tem->window == xse->window)
 24763                 {
 24764                   if (tem->n_input_rects != -1)
 24765                     xfree (tem->input_rects);
 24766                   if (tem->n_bounding_rects != -1)
 24767                     xfree (tem->bounding_rects);
 24768 
 24769                   tem->n_input_rects = -1;
 24770                   tem->n_bounding_rects = -1;
 24771 
 24772 #if defined HAVE_XCB_SHAPE && defined HAVE_XCB_SHAPE_INPUT_RECTS
 24773                   bounding_rect_cookie = xcb_shape_get_rectangles (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
 24774                                                                    (xcb_window_t) xse->window,
 24775                                                                    XCB_SHAPE_SK_BOUNDING);
 24776                   if (dpyinfo->xshape_major > 1
 24777                       || (dpyinfo->xshape_major == 1
 24778                           && dpyinfo->xshape_minor >= 1))
 24779                     input_rect_cookie
 24780                       = xcb_shape_get_rectangles (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
 24781                                                   (xcb_window_t) xse->window,
 24782                                                   XCB_SHAPE_SK_INPUT);
 24783 
 24784                   bounding_rect_reply = xcb_shape_get_rectangles_reply (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
 24785                                                                         bounding_rect_cookie,
 24786                                                                         &error);
 24787 
 24788                   if (bounding_rect_reply)
 24789                     {
 24790                       bounding_rect_iterator
 24791                         = xcb_shape_get_rectangles_rectangles_iterator (bounding_rect_reply);
 24792                       tem->n_bounding_rects = bounding_rect_iterator.rem + 1;
 24793                       tem->bounding_rects = xmalloc (tem->n_bounding_rects
 24794                                                      * sizeof *tem->bounding_rects);
 24795                       tem->n_bounding_rects = 0;
 24796 
 24797                       for (; bounding_rect_iterator.rem; xcb_rectangle_next (&bounding_rect_iterator))
 24798                         {
 24799                           tem->bounding_rects[tem->n_bounding_rects].x
 24800                             = bounding_rect_iterator.data->x;
 24801                           tem->bounding_rects[tem->n_bounding_rects].y
 24802                             = bounding_rect_iterator.data->y;
 24803                           tem->bounding_rects[tem->n_bounding_rects].width
 24804                             = bounding_rect_iterator.data->width;
 24805                           tem->bounding_rects[tem->n_bounding_rects].height
 24806                             = bounding_rect_iterator.data->height;
 24807 
 24808                           tem->n_bounding_rects++;
 24809                         }
 24810 
 24811                       free (bounding_rect_reply);
 24812                     }
 24813                   else
 24814                     free (error);
 24815 
 24816                   if (dpyinfo->xshape_major > 1
 24817                       || (dpyinfo->xshape_major == 1
 24818                           && dpyinfo->xshape_minor >= 1))
 24819                     {
 24820                       input_rect_reply = xcb_shape_get_rectangles_reply (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
 24821                                                                          input_rect_cookie, &error);
 24822 
 24823                       if (input_rect_reply)
 24824                         {
 24825                           input_rect_iterator
 24826                             = xcb_shape_get_rectangles_rectangles_iterator (input_rect_reply);
 24827                           tem->n_input_rects = input_rect_iterator.rem + 1;
 24828                           tem->input_rects = xmalloc (tem->n_input_rects
 24829                                                       * sizeof *tem->input_rects);
 24830                           tem->n_input_rects = 0;
 24831 
 24832                           for (; input_rect_iterator.rem; xcb_rectangle_next (&input_rect_iterator))
 24833                             {
 24834                               tem->input_rects[tem->n_input_rects].x
 24835                                 = input_rect_iterator.data->x;
 24836                               tem->input_rects[tem->n_input_rects].y
 24837                                 = input_rect_iterator.data->y;
 24838                               tem->input_rects[tem->n_input_rects].width
 24839                                 = input_rect_iterator.data->width;
 24840                               tem->input_rects[tem->n_input_rects].height
 24841                                 = input_rect_iterator.data->height;
 24842 
 24843                               tem->n_input_rects++;
 24844                             }
 24845 
 24846                           free (input_rect_reply);
 24847                         }
 24848                       else
 24849                         free (error);
 24850                     }
 24851 #else
 24852                   x_catch_errors (dpyinfo->display);
 24853                   rects = XShapeGetRectangles (dpyinfo->display,
 24854                                                xse->window,
 24855                                                ShapeBounding,
 24856                                                &count, &ordering);
 24857                   rc = x_had_errors_p (dpyinfo->display);
 24858                   x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
 24859 
 24860                   /* Does XShapeGetRectangles allocate anything upon an
 24861                      error?  */
 24862                   if (!rc)
 24863                     {
 24864                       tem->n_bounding_rects = count;
 24865                       tem->bounding_rects
 24866                         = xmalloc (sizeof *tem->bounding_rects * count);
 24867                       memcpy (tem->bounding_rects, rects,
 24868                               sizeof *tem->bounding_rects * count);
 24869 
 24870                       XFree (rects);
 24871                     }
 24872 
 24873 #ifdef ShapeInput
 24874                   if (dpyinfo->xshape_major > 1
 24875                       || (dpyinfo->xshape_major == 1
 24876                           && dpyinfo->xshape_minor >= 1))
 24877                     {
 24878                       x_catch_errors (dpyinfo->display);
 24879                       rects = XShapeGetRectangles (dpyinfo->display,
 24880                                                    xse->window, ShapeInput,
 24881                                                    &count, &ordering);
 24882                       rc = x_had_errors_p (dpyinfo->display);
 24883                       x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
 24884 
 24885                       /* Does XShapeGetRectangles allocate anything upon
 24886                          an error?  */
 24887                       if (!rc)
 24888                         {
 24889                           tem->n_input_rects = count;
 24890                           tem->input_rects
 24891                             = xmalloc (sizeof *tem->input_rects * count);
 24892                           memcpy (tem->input_rects, rects,
 24893                                   sizeof *tem->input_rects * count);
 24894 
 24895                           XFree (rects);
 24896                         }
 24897                     }
 24898 #endif
 24899 #endif
 24900 
 24901                   /* Handle the common case where the input shape equals the
 24902                      bounding shape.  */
 24903 
 24904                   if (tem->n_input_rects != -1
 24905                       && tem->n_bounding_rects == tem->n_input_rects
 24906                       && !memcmp (tem->bounding_rects, tem->input_rects,
 24907                                   tem->n_input_rects * sizeof *tem->input_rects))
 24908                     {
 24909                       xfree (tem->input_rects);
 24910                       tem->n_input_rects = -1;
 24911                     }
 24912 
 24913                   /* And the common case where there is no input rect and the
 24914                      bounding rect equals the window dimensions.  */
 24915 
 24916                   if (tem->n_input_rects == -1
 24917                       && tem->n_bounding_rects == 1
 24918                       && tem->bounding_rects[0].width == tem->width
 24919                       && tem->bounding_rects[0].height == tem->height
 24920                       && tem->bounding_rects[0].x == -tem->border_width
 24921                       && tem->bounding_rects[0].y == -tem->border_width)
 24922                     {
 24923                       xfree (tem->bounding_rects);
 24924                       tem->n_bounding_rects = -1;
 24925                     }
 24926 
 24927                   break;
 24928                 }
 24929             }
 24930         }
 24931 #endif
 24932 #if defined HAVE_XRANDR && !defined USE_GTK
 24933       if (dpyinfo->xrandr_supported_p
 24934           && (event->type == (dpyinfo->xrandr_event_base
 24935                               + RRScreenChangeNotify)
 24936               || event->type == (dpyinfo->xrandr_event_base
 24937                                  + RRNotify)))
 24938         {
 24939           Time timestamp;
 24940           Lisp_Object current_monitors;
 24941           XRRScreenChangeNotifyEvent *notify;
 24942 
 24943           if (event->type == (dpyinfo->xrandr_event_base
 24944                               + RRScreenChangeNotify))
 24945             XRRUpdateConfiguration ((XEvent *) event);
 24946 
 24947           if (event->type == (dpyinfo->xrandr_event_base
 24948                               + RRScreenChangeNotify))
 24949             {
 24950               notify = ((XRRScreenChangeNotifyEvent *) event);
 24951               timestamp = notify->timestamp;
 24952 
 24953               /* Don't set screen dimensions if the notification is
 24954                  for a different screen.  */
 24955               if (notify->root == dpyinfo->root_window)
 24956                 {
 24957                   dpyinfo->screen_width = notify->width;
 24958                   dpyinfo->screen_height = notify->height;
 24959                   dpyinfo->screen_mm_width = notify->mwidth;
 24960                   dpyinfo->screen_mm_height = notify->mheight;
 24961                 }
 24962             }
 24963           else
 24964             timestamp = 0;
 24965 
 24966           if (x_find_monitors_changed_event (dpyinfo))
 24967             /* Don't store a MONITORS_CHANGED_EVENT if there is
 24968                already an undelivered event on the queue.  */
 24969             goto OTHER;
 24970 
 24971           inev.ie.kind = MONITORS_CHANGED_EVENT;
 24972           inev.ie.timestamp = timestamp;
 24973           XSETTERMINAL (inev.ie.arg, dpyinfo->terminal);
 24974 
 24975           /* Also don't do anything if the monitor configuration
 24976              didn't really change.  */
 24977 
 24978           current_monitors
 24979             = Fx_display_monitor_attributes_list (inev.ie.arg);
 24980 
 24981           if (!NILP (Fequal (current_monitors,
 24982                              dpyinfo->last_monitor_attributes_list)))
 24983             inev.ie.kind = NO_EVENT;
 24984 
 24985           dpyinfo->last_monitor_attributes_list = current_monitors;
 24986 
 24987           if (x_dnd_in_progress && x_dnd_update_tooltip)
 24988             x_dnd_monitors = current_monitors;
 24989 
 24990           if (inev.ie.kind != NO_EVENT)
 24991             x_dnd_update_tooltip_now ();
 24992         }
 24993 #endif
 24994 #ifdef HAVE_XFIXES
 24995       if (dpyinfo->xfixes_supported_p
 24996           && event->type == (dpyinfo->xfixes_event_base
 24997                              + XFixesSelectionNotify)
 24998           && x_handle_selection_monitor_event (dpyinfo, event))
 24999         /* GTK 3 crashes if an XFixesSelectionNotify arrives with a
 25000            window other than the root window, because it wants to know
 25001            the screen in order to determine the compositing manager
 25002            selection name.  (bug#58584) */
 25003         *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 25004 #endif
 25005     OTHER:
 25006 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 25007       if (*finish != X_EVENT_DROP)
 25008         {
 25009           /* Ignore some obviously bogus ConfigureNotify events that
 25010              other clients have been known to send Emacs.
 25011              (bug#54051) */
 25012           if (event->type != ConfigureNotify
 25013               || (event->xconfigure.width != 0
 25014                   && event->xconfigure.height != 0))
 25015             {
 25016 #if defined USE_X_TOOLKIT && defined HAVE_XINPUT2
 25017               XtDispatchEvent (use_copy ? &copy : (XEvent *) event);
 25018 #else
 25019               XtDispatchEvent ((XEvent *) event);
 25020 #endif
 25021             }
 25022         }
 25023 #endif /* USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 25024 #if defined USE_GTK && !defined HAVE_GTK3 && defined HAVE_XINPUT2
 25025       if (*finish != X_EVENT_DROP && copy)
 25026         {
 25027           gtk_main_do_event (copy);
 25028           *finish = X_EVENT_DROP;
 25029         }
 25030 
 25031       if (copy)
 25032         gdk_event_free (copy);
 25033 #endif
 25034     break;
 25035     }
 25036 
 25037  done:
 25038   if (inev.ie.kind != NO_EVENT)
 25039     {
 25040       kbd_buffer_store_buffered_event (&inev, hold_quit);
 25041       count++;
 25042     }
 25043 
 25044   if (do_help
 25045       && !(hold_quit && hold_quit->kind != NO_EVENT))
 25046     {
 25047       Lisp_Object frame;
 25048 
 25049       if (f)
 25050         XSETFRAME (frame, f);
 25051       else
 25052         frame = Qnil;
 25053 
 25054       if (do_help > 0)
 25055         {
 25056           any_help_event_p = true;
 25057 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 25058           if (gen_help_device)
 25059             xi_handle_interaction (dpyinfo, f,
 25060                                    gen_help_device,
 25061                                    gen_help_time);
 25062 #endif
 25063           gen_help_event (help_echo_string, frame, help_echo_window,
 25064                           help_echo_object, help_echo_pos);
 25065         }
 25066       else
 25067         {
 25068           help_echo_string = Qnil;
 25069           gen_help_event (Qnil, frame, Qnil, Qnil, 0);
 25070         }
 25071       count++;
 25072     }
 25073 
 25074 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2 || defined HAVE_XKB || defined HAVE_X_I18N
 25075   SAFE_FREE ();
 25076 #endif
 25077 
 25078   return count;
 25079 }
 25080 
 25081 /* Handles the XEvent EVENT on display DISPLAY.
 25082    This is used for event loops outside the normal event handling,
 25083    i.e. looping while a popup menu or a dialog is posted.
 25084 
 25085    Returns the value handle_one_xevent sets in the finish argument.  */
 25086 
 25087 #ifdef USE_GTK
 25088 static int
 25089 #else
 25090 int
 25091 #endif
 25092 x_dispatch_event (XEvent *event, Display *display)
 25093 {
 25094   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 25095   int finish = X_EVENT_NORMAL;
 25096 
 25097   dpyinfo = x_display_info_for_display (display);
 25098 
 25099   if (dpyinfo)
 25100     {
 25101       /* Block input before calling x_dispatch_event.  */
 25102       block_input ();
 25103       handle_one_xevent (dpyinfo, event, &finish, 0);
 25104       unblock_input ();
 25105     }
 25106 
 25107   return finish;
 25108 }
 25109 
 25110 /* Read events coming from the X server.
 25111    Return as soon as there are no more events to be read.
 25112 
 25113    Return the number of characters stored into the buffer,
 25114    thus pretending to be `read' (except the characters we store
 25115    in the keyboard buffer can be multibyte, so are not necessarily
 25116    C chars).  */
 25117 
 25118 static int
 25119 XTread_socket (struct terminal *terminal, struct input_event *hold_quit)
 25120 {
 25121   int count = 0;
 25122   bool event_found = false;
 25123   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = terminal->display_info.x;
 25124 
 25125   /* Don't allow XTread_socket to do anything if drag-and-drop is in
 25126      progress.  If unblock_input causes XTread_socket to be called and
 25127      read X events while the drag-and-drop event loop is in progress,
 25128      things can go wrong very quick.
 25129 
 25130      When x_dnd_unwind_flag is true, the above doesn't apply, since
 25131      the surrounding code takes special precautions to keep it safe.
 25132 
 25133      That doesn't matter for events from displays other than the
 25134      display of the drag-and-drop operation, though.  */
 25135   if (!x_dnd_unwind_flag
 25136       && ((x_dnd_in_progress
 25137            && dpyinfo->display == FRAME_X_DISPLAY (x_dnd_frame))
 25138           || (x_dnd_waiting_for_finish
 25139               && dpyinfo->display == x_dnd_finish_display)))
 25140     return 0;
 25141 
 25142   x_clean_failable_requests (dpyinfo);
 25143 
 25144   block_input ();
 25145 
 25146   /* For debugging, this gives a way to fake an I/O error.  */
 25147   if (dpyinfo == XTread_socket_fake_io_error)
 25148     {
 25149       XTread_socket_fake_io_error = 0;
 25150       x_io_error_quitter (dpyinfo->display);
 25151     }
 25152 
 25153 #ifndef USE_GTK
 25154   while (XPending (dpyinfo->display))
 25155     {
 25156       int finish;
 25157       XEvent event;
 25158 
 25159       XNextEvent (dpyinfo->display, &event);
 25160 
 25161 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 25162       /* Filter events for the current X input method.  */
 25163 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 25164       if (event.type != GenericEvent
 25165           || !dpyinfo->supports_xi2
 25166           || event.xgeneric.extension != dpyinfo->xi2_opcode)
 25167         {
 25168           /* Input extension key events are filtered inside
 25169              handle_one_xevent.  */
 25170 #endif
 25171           if (x_filter_event (dpyinfo, &event))
 25172             continue;
 25173 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 25174         }
 25175 #endif
 25176 #endif
 25177       event_found = true;
 25178 
 25179       count += handle_one_xevent (dpyinfo, &event, &finish, hold_quit);
 25180 
 25181       if (finish == X_EVENT_GOTO_OUT)
 25182         break;
 25183     }
 25184 
 25185 #else /* USE_GTK */
 25186 
 25187   /* For GTK we must use the GTK event loop.  But XEvents gets passed
 25188      to our filter function above, and then to the big event switch.
 25189      We use a bunch of globals to communicate with our filter function,
 25190      that is kind of ugly, but it works.
 25191 
 25192      There is no way to do one display at the time, GTK just does events
 25193      from all displays.  */
 25194 
 25195   while (gtk_events_pending ())
 25196     {
 25197       current_count = count;
 25198       current_hold_quit = hold_quit;
 25199 
 25200       gtk_main_iteration ();
 25201 
 25202       count = current_count;
 25203       current_count = -1;
 25204       current_hold_quit = 0;
 25205 
 25206       if (current_finish == X_EVENT_GOTO_OUT)
 25207         break;
 25208     }
 25209 
 25210   /* Now see if `xg_pending_quit_event' was set.  */
 25211   if (xg_pending_quit_event.kind != NO_EVENT)
 25212     {
 25213       /* Check that the frame is still valid.  It could have been
 25214          deleted between now and the time the event was recorded.  */
 25215       if (FRAME_LIVE_P (XFRAME (xg_pending_quit_event.frame_or_window)))
 25216         /* Store that event into hold_quit and clear the pending quit
 25217            event.  */
 25218         *hold_quit = xg_pending_quit_event;
 25219 
 25220       /* If the frame is invalid, just clear the event as well.  */
 25221       xg_pending_quit_event.kind = NO_EVENT;
 25222     }
 25223 #endif /* USE_GTK */
 25224 
 25225   /* On some systems, an X bug causes Emacs to get no more events
 25226      when the window is destroyed.  Detect that.  (1994.)  */
 25227   if (! event_found)
 25228     {
 25229       /* Emacs and the X Server eats up CPU time if XNoOp is done every time.
 25230          One XNOOP in 100 loops will make Emacs terminate.
 25231          B. Bretthauer, 1994 */
 25232       x_noop_count++;
 25233       if (x_noop_count >= 100)
 25234         {
 25235           x_noop_count=0;
 25236 
 25237           if (next_noop_dpyinfo == 0)
 25238             next_noop_dpyinfo = x_display_list;
 25239 
 25240           XNoOp (next_noop_dpyinfo->display);
 25241 
 25242           /* Each time we get here, cycle through the displays now open.  */
 25243           next_noop_dpyinfo = next_noop_dpyinfo->next;
 25244         }
 25245     }
 25246 
 25247   /* If the focus was just given to an auto-raising frame,
 25248      raise it now.  FIXME: handle more than one such frame.  */
 25249   if (dpyinfo->x_pending_autoraise_frame)
 25250     {
 25251       x_raise_frame (dpyinfo->x_pending_autoraise_frame);
 25252       dpyinfo->x_pending_autoraise_frame = NULL;
 25253     }
 25254 
 25255   unblock_input ();
 25256 
 25257   return count;
 25258 }
 25259 
 25260 
 25261 
 25262 
 25263 /***********************************************************************
 25264                              Text Cursor
 25265  ***********************************************************************/
 25266 
 25267 /* Set clipping for output in glyph row ROW.  W is the window in which
 25268    we operate.  GC is the graphics context to set clipping in.
 25269 
 25270    ROW may be a text row or, e.g., a mode line.  Text rows must be
 25271    clipped to the interior of the window dedicated to text display,
 25272    mode lines must be clipped to the whole window.  */
 25273 
 25274 static void
 25275 x_clip_to_row (struct window *w, struct glyph_row *row,
 25276                enum glyph_row_area area, GC gc)
 25277 {
 25278   struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (w));
 25279   XRectangle clip_rect;
 25280   int window_x, window_y, window_width;
 25281 
 25282   window_box (w, area, &window_x, &window_y, &window_width, 0);
 25283 
 25284   clip_rect.x = window_x;
 25285   clip_rect.y = WINDOW_TO_FRAME_PIXEL_Y (w, max (0, row->y));
 25286   clip_rect.y = max (clip_rect.y, window_y);
 25287   clip_rect.width = window_width;
 25288   clip_rect.height = row->visible_height;
 25289 
 25290   x_set_clip_rectangles (f, gc, &clip_rect, 1);
 25291 }
 25292 
 25293 
 25294 /* Draw a hollow box cursor on window W in glyph row ROW.  */
 25295 
 25296 static void
 25297 x_draw_hollow_cursor (struct window *w, struct glyph_row *row)
 25298 {
 25299   struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (w));
 25300   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 25301   Display *dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
 25302   int x, y, wd, h;
 25303   XGCValues xgcv;
 25304   struct glyph *cursor_glyph;
 25305   GC gc;
 25306 
 25307   /* Get the glyph the cursor is on.  If we can't tell because
 25308      the current matrix is invalid or such, give up.  */
 25309   cursor_glyph = get_phys_cursor_glyph (w);
 25310   if (cursor_glyph == NULL)
 25311     return;
 25312 
 25313   /* Compute frame-relative coordinates for phys cursor.  */
 25314   get_phys_cursor_geometry (w, row, cursor_glyph, &x, &y, &h);
 25315   wd = w->phys_cursor_width - 1;
 25316 
 25317   /* The foreground of cursor_gc is typically the same as the normal
 25318      background color, which can cause the cursor box to be invisible.  */
 25319   xgcv.foreground = f->output_data.x->cursor_pixel;
 25320   xgcv.line_width = 1;
 25321   if (dpyinfo->scratch_cursor_gc)
 25322     XChangeGC (dpy, dpyinfo->scratch_cursor_gc, GCForeground | GCLineWidth, &xgcv);
 25323   else
 25324     dpyinfo->scratch_cursor_gc = XCreateGC (dpy, FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f),
 25325                                             GCForeground | GCLineWidth, &xgcv);
 25326   gc = dpyinfo->scratch_cursor_gc;
 25327 
 25328   /* When on R2L character, show cursor at the right edge of the
 25329      glyph, unless the cursor box is as wide as the glyph or wider
 25330      (the latter happens when x-stretch-cursor is non-nil).  */
 25331   if ((cursor_glyph->resolved_level & 1) != 0
 25332       && cursor_glyph->pixel_width > wd)
 25333     {
 25334       x += cursor_glyph->pixel_width - wd;
 25335       if (wd > 0)
 25336         wd -= 1;
 25337     }
 25338   /* Set clipping, draw the rectangle, and reset clipping again.  */
 25339   x_clip_to_row (w, row, TEXT_AREA, gc);
 25340   x_draw_rectangle (f, gc, x, y, wd, h - 1);
 25341   x_reset_clip_rectangles (f, gc);
 25342 }
 25343 
 25344 
 25345 /* Draw a bar cursor on window W in glyph row ROW.
 25346 
 25347    Implementation note: One would like to draw a bar cursor with an
 25348    angle equal to the one given by the font property XA_ITALIC_ANGLE.
 25349    Unfortunately, I didn't find a font yet that has this property set.
 25350    --gerd.  */
 25351 
 25352 static void
 25353 x_draw_bar_cursor (struct window *w, struct glyph_row *row, int width, enum text_cursor_kinds kind)
 25354 {
 25355   struct frame *f = XFRAME (w->frame);
 25356   struct glyph *cursor_glyph;
 25357 
 25358   /* If cursor is out of bounds, don't draw garbage.  This can happen
 25359      in mini-buffer windows when switching between echo area glyphs
 25360      and mini-buffer.  */
 25361   cursor_glyph = get_phys_cursor_glyph (w);
 25362   if (cursor_glyph == NULL)
 25363     return;
 25364 
 25365   /* Experimental avoidance of cursor on xwidget.  */
 25366   if (cursor_glyph->type == XWIDGET_GLYPH)
 25367     return;
 25368 
 25369   /* If on an image, draw like a normal cursor.  That's usually better
 25370      visible than drawing a bar, esp. if the image is large so that
 25371      the bar might not be in the window.  */
 25372   if (cursor_glyph->type == IMAGE_GLYPH)
 25373     {
 25374       struct glyph_row *r;
 25375       r = MATRIX_ROW (w->current_matrix, w->phys_cursor.vpos);
 25376       draw_phys_cursor_glyph (w, r, DRAW_CURSOR);
 25377     }
 25378   else
 25379     {
 25380       Display *dpy = FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f);
 25381       Drawable drawable = FRAME_X_DRAWABLE (f);
 25382       GC gc = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->scratch_cursor_gc;
 25383       unsigned long mask = GCForeground | GCBackground | GCGraphicsExposures;
 25384       struct face *face = FACE_FROM_ID (f, cursor_glyph->face_id);
 25385       XGCValues xgcv;
 25386 
 25387       /* If the glyph's background equals the color we normally draw
 25388          the bars cursor in, the bar cursor in its normal color is
 25389          invisible.  Use the glyph's foreground color instead in this
 25390          case, on the assumption that the glyph's colors are chosen so
 25391          that the glyph is legible.  */
 25392       if (face->background == f->output_data.x->cursor_pixel)
 25393         xgcv.background = xgcv.foreground = face->foreground;
 25394       else
 25395         xgcv.background = xgcv.foreground = f->output_data.x->cursor_pixel;
 25396       xgcv.graphics_exposures = False;
 25397       xgcv.line_width = 1;
 25398 
 25399       mask |= GCLineWidth;
 25400 
 25401       if (gc)
 25402         XChangeGC (dpy, gc, mask, &xgcv);
 25403       else
 25404         {
 25405           gc = XCreateGC (dpy, drawable, mask, &xgcv);
 25406           FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->scratch_cursor_gc = gc;
 25407         }
 25408 
 25409       x_clip_to_row (w, row, TEXT_AREA, gc);
 25410 
 25411       if (kind == BAR_CURSOR)
 25412         {
 25413           int x = WINDOW_TEXT_TO_FRAME_PIXEL_X (w, w->phys_cursor.x);
 25414 
 25415           if (width < 0)
 25416             width = FRAME_CURSOR_WIDTH (f);
 25417           width = min (cursor_glyph->pixel_width, width);
 25418 
 25419           w->phys_cursor_width = width;
 25420 
 25421           /* If the character under cursor is R2L, draw the bar cursor
 25422              on the right of its glyph, rather than on the left.  */
 25423           if ((cursor_glyph->resolved_level & 1) != 0)
 25424             x += cursor_glyph->pixel_width - width;
 25425 
 25426           x_fill_rectangle (f, gc, x,
 25427                             WINDOW_TO_FRAME_PIXEL_Y (w, w->phys_cursor.y),
 25428                             width, row->height, false);
 25429         }
 25430       else /* HBAR_CURSOR */
 25431         {
 25432           int dummy_x, dummy_y, dummy_h;
 25433           int x = WINDOW_TEXT_TO_FRAME_PIXEL_X (w, w->phys_cursor.x);
 25434 
 25435           if (width < 0)
 25436             width = row->height;
 25437 
 25438           width = min (row->height, width);
 25439 
 25440           get_phys_cursor_geometry (w, row, cursor_glyph, &dummy_x,
 25441                                     &dummy_y, &dummy_h);
 25442 
 25443           if ((cursor_glyph->resolved_level & 1) != 0
 25444               && cursor_glyph->pixel_width > w->phys_cursor_width - 1)
 25445             x += cursor_glyph->pixel_width - w->phys_cursor_width + 1;
 25446           x_fill_rectangle (f, gc, x,
 25447                             WINDOW_TO_FRAME_PIXEL_Y (w, w->phys_cursor.y +
 25448                                                      row->height - width),
 25449                             w->phys_cursor_width - 1, width, false);
 25450         }
 25451 
 25452       x_reset_clip_rectangles (f, gc);
 25453     }
 25454 }
 25455 
 25456 
 25457 /* RIF: Define cursor CURSOR on frame F.  */
 25458 
 25459 static void
 25460 x_define_frame_cursor (struct frame *f, Emacs_Cursor cursor)
 25461 {
 25462   if (!f->pointer_invisible
 25463       && f->output_data.x->current_cursor != cursor)
 25464     XDefineCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f), cursor);
 25465   f->output_data.x->current_cursor = cursor;
 25466 }
 25467 
 25468 
 25469 /* RIF: Clear area on frame F.  */
 25470 
 25471 static void
 25472 x_clear_frame_area (struct frame *f, int x, int y, int width, int height)
 25473 {
 25474   x_clear_area (f, x, y, width, height);
 25475 }
 25476 
 25477 
 25478 /* RIF: Draw cursor on window W.  */
 25479 
 25480 static void
 25481 x_draw_window_cursor (struct window *w, struct glyph_row *glyph_row, int x,
 25482                       int y, enum text_cursor_kinds cursor_type,
 25483                       int cursor_width, bool on_p, bool active_p)
 25484 {
 25485 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 25486   struct frame *f = XFRAME (WINDOW_FRAME (w));
 25487 #endif
 25488 
 25489   if (on_p)
 25490     {
 25491       w->phys_cursor_type = cursor_type;
 25492       w->phys_cursor_on_p = true;
 25493 
 25494       if (glyph_row->exact_window_width_line_p
 25495           && (glyph_row->reversed_p
 25496               ? (w->phys_cursor.hpos < 0)
 25497               : (w->phys_cursor.hpos >= glyph_row->used[TEXT_AREA])))
 25498         {
 25499           glyph_row->cursor_in_fringe_p = true;
 25500           draw_fringe_bitmap (w, glyph_row, glyph_row->reversed_p);
 25501         }
 25502       else
 25503         {
 25504           switch (cursor_type)
 25505             {
 25506             case HOLLOW_BOX_CURSOR:
 25507               x_draw_hollow_cursor (w, glyph_row);
 25508               break;
 25509 
 25510             case FILLED_BOX_CURSOR:
 25511               draw_phys_cursor_glyph (w, glyph_row, DRAW_CURSOR);
 25512               break;
 25513 
 25514             case BAR_CURSOR:
 25515               x_draw_bar_cursor (w, glyph_row, cursor_width, BAR_CURSOR);
 25516               break;
 25517 
 25518             case HBAR_CURSOR:
 25519               x_draw_bar_cursor (w, glyph_row, cursor_width, HBAR_CURSOR);
 25520               break;
 25521 
 25522             case NO_CURSOR:
 25523               w->phys_cursor_width = 0;
 25524               break;
 25525 
 25526             default:
 25527               emacs_abort ();
 25528             }
 25529         }
 25530 
 25531 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 25532       if (w == XWINDOW (f->selected_window))
 25533         xic_set_preeditarea (w, x, y);
 25534 #endif
 25535     }
 25536 }
 25537 
 25538 
 25539 /* Icons.  */
 25540 
 25541 /* Make the x-window of frame F use the gnu icon bitmap.  */
 25542 
 25543 static bool
 25544 x_bitmap_icon (struct frame *f, Lisp_Object file)
 25545 {
 25546   ptrdiff_t bitmap_id;
 25547 
 25548   if (FRAME_X_WINDOW (f) == 0)
 25549     return true;
 25550 
 25551   /* Free up our existing icon bitmap and mask if any.  */
 25552   if (f->output_data.x->icon_bitmap > 0)
 25553     image_destroy_bitmap (f, f->output_data.x->icon_bitmap);
 25554   f->output_data.x->icon_bitmap = 0;
 25555 
 25556   if (STRINGP (file))
 25557     {
 25558 #ifdef USE_GTK
 25559       /* Use gtk_window_set_icon_from_file () if available,
 25560          It's not restricted to bitmaps */
 25561       if (xg_set_icon (f, file))
 25562         return false;
 25563 #endif /* USE_GTK */
 25564       bitmap_id = image_create_bitmap_from_file (f, file);
 25565       x_create_bitmap_mask (f, bitmap_id);
 25566     }
 25567   else
 25568     {
 25569       /* Create the GNU bitmap and mask if necessary.  */
 25570       if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->icon_bitmap_id < 0)
 25571         {
 25572           ptrdiff_t rc = -1;
 25573 
 25574 #ifdef USE_GTK
 25575 
 25576           if (xg_set_icon (f, xg_default_icon_file)
 25577               || xg_set_icon_from_xpm_data (f, gnu_xpm_bits))
 25578             {
 25579               FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->icon_bitmap_id = -2;
 25580               return false;
 25581             }
 25582 
 25583 #elif defined (HAVE_XPM) && defined (HAVE_X_WINDOWS)
 25584           /* This allocates too many colors.  */
 25585           if ((FRAME_X_VISUAL_INFO (f)->class == TrueColor
 25586                || FRAME_X_VISUAL_INFO (f)->class == StaticColor
 25587                || FRAME_X_VISUAL_INFO (f)->class == StaticGray)
 25588               /* That pixmap needs about 240 colors, and we should
 25589                  also leave some more space for other colors as
 25590                  well.  */
 25591               || FRAME_X_VISUAL_INFO (f)->colormap_size >= (240 * 4))
 25592             {
 25593               rc = x_create_bitmap_from_xpm_data (f, gnu_xpm_bits);
 25594               if (rc != -1)
 25595                 FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->icon_bitmap_id = rc;
 25596             }
 25597 #endif
 25598 
 25599           /* If all else fails, use the (black and white) xbm image. */
 25600           if (rc == -1)
 25601             {
 25602               rc = image_create_bitmap_from_data (f,
 25603                                                   (char *) gnu_xbm_bits,
 25604                                                   gnu_xbm_width,
 25605                                                   gnu_xbm_height);
 25606               if (rc == -1)
 25607                 return true;
 25608 
 25609               FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->icon_bitmap_id = rc;
 25610               x_create_bitmap_mask (f, FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->icon_bitmap_id);
 25611             }
 25612         }
 25613 
 25614       /* The first time we create the GNU bitmap and mask,
 25615          this increments the ref-count one extra time.
 25616          As a result, the GNU bitmap and mask are never freed.
 25617          That way, we don't have to worry about allocating it again.  */
 25618       image_reference_bitmap (f, FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->icon_bitmap_id);
 25619 
 25620       bitmap_id = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->icon_bitmap_id;
 25621     }
 25622 
 25623   x_wm_set_icon_pixmap (f, bitmap_id);
 25624   f->output_data.x->icon_bitmap = bitmap_id;
 25625 
 25626   return false;
 25627 }
 25628 
 25629 
 25630 /* Make the x-window of frame F use a rectangle with text.
 25631    Use ICON_NAME as the text.  */
 25632 
 25633 bool
 25634 x_text_icon (struct frame *f, const char *icon_name)
 25635 {
 25636   if (FRAME_X_WINDOW (f) == 0)
 25637     return true;
 25638 
 25639   {
 25640     XTextProperty text;
