 27716       struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 27717 
 27718       switch (f->want_fullscreen)
 27719         {
 27720           /* No difference between these two when there is no WM */
 27721         case FULLSCREEN_MAXIMIZED:
 27722           lval = Qmaximized;
 27723           width = x_display_pixel_width (dpyinfo);
 27724           height = x_display_pixel_height (dpyinfo);
 27725           break;
 27726         case FULLSCREEN_BOTH:
 27727           lval = Qfullboth;
 27728           width = x_display_pixel_width (dpyinfo);
 27729           height = x_display_pixel_height (dpyinfo);
 27730           break;
 27731         case FULLSCREEN_WIDTH:
 27732           lval = Qfullwidth;
 27733           width = x_display_pixel_width (dpyinfo);
 27734           height = height + FRAME_MENUBAR_HEIGHT (f);
 27735           break;
 27736         case FULLSCREEN_HEIGHT:
 27737           lval = Qfullheight;
 27738           height = x_display_pixel_height (dpyinfo);
 27739           break;
 27740         default:
 27741           emacs_abort ();
 27742         }
 27743 
 27744       x_wm_set_size_hint (f, 0, false);
 27745 
 27746       XResizeWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 27747                      width, height);
 27748 
 27749       if (FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
 27750         x_wait_for_event (f, ConfigureNotify);
 27751       else
 27752         change_frame_size (f, width, height, false, true, false);
 27753     }
 27754 
 27755   /* `x_net_wm_state' might have reset the fullscreen frame parameter,
 27756      restore it. */
 27757   store_frame_param (f, Qfullscreen, lval);
 27758 }
 27759 
 27760 /* This function is called by x_set_offset to determine whether the window
 27761    manager interfered with the positioning of the frame.  Type A window
 27762    managers position the surrounding window manager decorations a small
 27763    amount above and left of the user-supplied position.  Type B window
 27764    managers position the surrounding window manager decorations at the
 27765    user-specified position.  If we detect a Type A window manager, we
 27766    compensate by moving the window right and down by the proper amount.  */
 27767 
 27768 static void
 27769 x_check_expected_move (struct frame *f, int expected_left, int expected_top)
 27770 {
 27771   int current_left = 0, current_top = 0;
 27772 
 27773   /* x_real_positions returns the left and top offsets of the outermost
 27774      window manager window around the frame.  */
 27775 
 27776   x_real_positions (f, &current_left, &current_top);
 27777 
 27778   if (current_left != expected_left || current_top != expected_top)
 27779     {
 27780       /* It's a "Type A" window manager. */
 27781 
 27782       int adjusted_left;
 27783       int adjusted_top;
 27784 
 27785       FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->wm_type = X_WMTYPE_A;
 27786       FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->move_offset_left = expected_left - current_left;
 27787       FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->move_offset_top = expected_top - current_top;
 27788 
 27789       /* Now fix the mispositioned frame's location. */
 27790 
 27791       adjusted_left = expected_left + FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->move_offset_left;
 27792       adjusted_top = expected_top + FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->move_offset_top;
 27793 
 27794       XMoveWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 27795                    adjusted_left, adjusted_top);
 27796 
 27797       x_sync_with_move (f, expected_left, expected_top, false);
 27798     }
 27799   else
 27800     /* It's a "Type B" window manager.  We don't have to adjust the
 27801        frame's position. */
 27802       FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->wm_type = X_WMTYPE_B;
 27803 }
 27804 
 27805 
 27806 /* Wait for XGetGeometry to return up-to-date position information for a
 27807    recently-moved frame.  Call this immediately after calling XMoveWindow.
 27808    If FUZZY is non-zero, then LEFT and TOP are just estimates of where the
 27809    frame has been moved to, so we use a fuzzy position comparison instead
 27810    of an exact comparison.  */
 27811 
 27812 static void
 27813 x_sync_with_move (struct frame *f, int left, int top, bool fuzzy)
 27814 {
 27815   sigset_t emptyset;
 27816   int count, current_left, current_top;
 27817   struct timespec fallback;
 27818 
 27819   sigemptyset (&emptyset);
 27820   count = 0;
 27821 
 27822   while (count++ < 50)
 27823     {
 27824       current_left = 0;
 27825       current_top = 0;
 27826 
 27827       /* There is no need to call XSync (even when no window manager
 27828          is present) because x_real_positions already does that
 27829          implicitly.  */
 27830       x_real_positions (f, &current_left, &current_top);
 27831 
 27832       if (fuzzy)
 27833         {
 27834           /* The left fuzz-factor is 10 pixels.  The top fuzz-factor is 40
 27835              pixels.  */
 27836 
 27837           if (eabs (current_left - left) <= 10
 27838               && eabs (current_top - top) <= 40)
 27839             return;
 27840         }
 27841       else if (current_left == left && current_top == top)
 27842         return;
 27843     }
 27844 
 27845   /* As a last resort, just wait 0.5 seconds and hope that XGetGeometry
 27846      will then return up-to-date position info. */
 27847 
 27848   fallback = dtotimespec (0.5);
 27849 
 27850   /* This will hang if input is blocked, so use pselect to wait
 27851      instead.  */
 27852   if (input_blocked_p ())
 27853     pselect (0, NULL, NULL, NULL, &fallback, &emptyset);
 27854   else
 27855     wait_reading_process_output (0, 500000000, 0, false, Qnil, NULL, 0);
 27856 }
 27857 
 27858 /* Wait for an event on frame F matching EVENTTYPE.  */
 27859 void
 27860 x_wait_for_event (struct frame *f, int eventtype)
 27861 {
 27862   if (!FLOATP (Vx_wait_for_event_timeout))
 27863     return;
 27864 
 27865   int level = interrupt_input_blocked;
 27866   fd_set fds;
 27867   struct timespec tmo, tmo_at, time_now;
 27868   int fd = ConnectionNumber (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
 27869 
 27870   f->wait_event_type = eventtype;
 27871 
 27872   /* Default timeout is 0.1 second.  Hopefully not noticeable.  */
 27873   double timeout = XFLOAT_DATA (Vx_wait_for_event_timeout);
 27874   time_t timeout_seconds = (time_t) timeout;
 27875   tmo = make_timespec
 27876     (timeout_seconds, (long int) ((timeout - timeout_seconds)
 27877                                   * 1000 * 1000 * 1000));
 27878   tmo_at = timespec_add (current_timespec (), tmo);
 27879 
 27880   while (f->wait_event_type)
 27881     {
 27882       pending_signals = true;
 27883       totally_unblock_input ();
 27884       /* XTread_socket is called after unblock.  */
 27885       block_input ();
 27886       interrupt_input_blocked = level;
 27887 
 27888       FD_ZERO (&fds);
 27889       FD_SET (fd, &fds);
 27890 
 27891       time_now = current_timespec ();
 27892       if (timespec_cmp (tmo_at, time_now) < 0)
 27893         break;
 27894 
 27895       tmo = timespec_sub (tmo_at, time_now);
 27896       if (pselect (fd + 1, &fds, NULL, NULL, &tmo, NULL) == 0)
 27897         break; /* Timeout */
 27898     }
 27899 
 27900   f->wait_event_type = 0;
 27901 }
 27902 
 27903 
 27904 /* Change the size of frame F's X window to WIDTH/HEIGHT in the case F
 27905    doesn't have a widget.  If CHANGE_GRAVITY, change to
 27906    top-left-corner window gravity for this size change and subsequent
 27907    size changes.  Otherwise leave the window gravity unchanged.  */
 27908 
 27909 static void
 27910 x_set_window_size_1 (struct frame *f, bool change_gravity,
 27911                      int width, int height)
 27912 {
 27913   if (change_gravity)
 27914     f->win_gravity = NorthWestGravity;
 27915   x_wm_set_size_hint (f, 0, false);
 27916 
 27917   XResizeWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 27918                  width, height + FRAME_MENUBAR_HEIGHT (f));
 27919 
 27920   /* We've set {FRAME,PIXEL}_{WIDTH,HEIGHT} to the values we hope to
 27921      receive in the ConfigureNotify event; if we get what we asked
 27922      for, then the event won't cause the screen to become garbaged, so
 27923      we have to make sure to do it here.  */
 27924   SET_FRAME_GARBAGED (f);
 27925 
 27926   /* The following code is too slow over a latent network
 27927      connection, so skip it when the user says so.  */
 27928 
 27929   if (!NILP (Vx_lax_frame_positioning))
 27930     return;
 27931 
 27932   /* Now, strictly speaking, we can't be sure that this is accurate,
 27933      but the window manager will get around to dealing with the size
 27934      change request eventually, and we'll hear how it went when the
 27935      ConfigureNotify event gets here.
 27936 
 27937      We could just not bother storing any of this information here,
 27938      and let the ConfigureNotify event set everything up, but that
 27939      might be kind of confusing to the Lisp code, since size changes
 27940      wouldn't be reported in the frame parameters until some random
 27941      point in the future when the ConfigureNotify event arrives.
 27942 
 27943      Pass true for DELAY since we can't run Lisp code inside of
 27944      a BLOCK_INPUT.  */
 27945 
 27946   /* But the ConfigureNotify may in fact never arrive, and then this is
 27947      not right if the frame is visible.  Instead wait (with timeout)
 27948      for the ConfigureNotify.  */
 27949   if (FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
 27950     {
 27951       x_wait_for_event (f, ConfigureNotify);
 27952 
 27953       if (CONSP (frame_size_history))
 27954         frame_size_history_extra
 27955           (f, build_string ("x_set_window_size_1, visible"),
 27956            FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f), FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f), width, height,
 27957            f->new_width, f->new_height);
 27958     }
 27959   else
 27960     {
 27961       if (CONSP (frame_size_history))
 27962         frame_size_history_extra
 27963           (f, build_string ("x_set_window_size_1, invisible"),
 27964            FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f), FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f), width, height,
 27965            f->new_width, f->new_height);
 27966 
 27967       /* Call adjust_frame_size right away as with GTK.  It might be
 27968          tempting to clear out f->new_width and f->new_height here.  */
 27969       adjust_frame_size (f, FRAME_PIXEL_TO_TEXT_WIDTH (f, width),
 27970                          FRAME_PIXEL_TO_TEXT_HEIGHT (f, height),
 27971                          5, 0, Qx_set_window_size_1);
 27972     }
 27973 }
 27974 
 27975 
 27976 /* Change the size of frame F's X window to WIDTH and HEIGHT pixels.  If
 27977    CHANGE_GRAVITY, change to top-left-corner window gravity for this
 27978    size change and subsequent size changes.  Otherwise we leave the
 27979    window gravity unchanged.  */
 27980 
 27981 void
 27982 x_set_window_size (struct frame *f, bool change_gravity,
 27983                    int width, int height)
 27984 {
 27985   block_input ();
 27986 
 27987 #ifdef USE_GTK
 27988   if (FRAME_GTK_WIDGET (f))
 27989     xg_frame_set_char_size (f, width, height);
 27990   else
 27991     x_set_window_size_1 (f, change_gravity, width, height);
 27992 #else /* not USE_GTK */
 27993   x_set_window_size_1 (f, change_gravity, width, height);
 27994   x_clear_under_internal_border (f);
 27995 #endif /* not USE_GTK */
 27996 
 27997   /* If cursor was outside the new size, mark it as off.  */
 27998   mark_window_cursors_off (XWINDOW (f->root_window));
 27999 
 28000   /* Clear out any recollection of where the mouse highlighting was,
 28001      since it might be in a place that's outside the new frame size.
 28002      Actually checking whether it is outside is a pain in the neck,
 28003      so don't try--just let the highlighting be done afresh with new size.  */
 28004   cancel_mouse_face (f);
 28005 
 28006   unblock_input ();
 28007 
 28008   do_pending_window_change (false);
 28009 }
 28010 
 28011 /* Move the mouse to position pixel PIX_X, PIX_Y relative to frame F.  */
 28012 
 28013 void
 28014 frame_set_mouse_pixel_position (struct frame *f, int pix_x, int pix_y)
 28015 {
 28016 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 28017   int deviceid;
 28018 
 28019   deviceid = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->client_pointer_device;
 28020 
 28021   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->supports_xi2
 28022       && deviceid != -1)
 28023     {
 28024       block_input ();
 28025       x_ignore_errors_for_next_request (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f), 0);
 28026       XIWarpPointer (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), deviceid, None,
 28027                      FRAME_X_WINDOW (f), 0, 0, 0, 0, pix_x, pix_y);
 28028       x_stop_ignoring_errors (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f));
 28029       unblock_input ();
 28030     }
 28031   else
 28032 #endif
 28033     XWarpPointer (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), None, FRAME_X_WINDOW (f),
 28034                   0, 0, 0, 0, pix_x, pix_y);
 28035 }
 28036 
 28037 /* Raise frame F.  */
 28038 
 28039 static void
 28040 x_raise_frame (struct frame *f)
 28041 {
 28042   block_input ();
 28043 
 28044   if (FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
 28045     {
 28046       XRaiseWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 28047                     FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f));
 28048       XFlush (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
 28049     }
 28050 
 28051   unblock_input ();
 28052 }
 28053 
 28054 static void
 28055 x_lower_frame_1 (struct frame *f)
 28056 {
 28057   Window *windows;
 28058   Lisp_Object frame, tail;
 28059   struct frame *sibling;
 28060 
 28061   windows = alloca (2 * sizeof *windows);
 28062 
 28063   /* Lowering a child frame leads to the window being put below any
 28064      scroll bars on the parent.  To avoid that, restack the child
 28065      frame below all of its siblings instead of just lowering it.  */
 28066 
 28067   FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 28068     {
 28069       sibling = XFRAME (frame);
 28070 
 28071       if (sibling == f)
 28072         continue;
 28073 
 28074       if (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (sibling)
 28075           != FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))
 28076         continue;
 28077 
 28078       windows[0] = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (sibling);
 28079       windows[1] = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
 28080 
 28081       XRestackWindows (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), windows, 2);
 28082     }
 28083 }
 28084 
 28085 /* Lower frame F.  */
 28086 
 28087 static void
 28088 x_lower_frame (struct frame *f)
 28089 {
 28090   if (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f)
 28091       && (FRAME_HAS_VERTICAL_SCROLL_BARS (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))
 28092           || FRAME_HAS_HORIZONTAL_SCROLL_BARS (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))))
 28093     x_lower_frame_1 (f);
 28094   else
 28095     XLowerWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 28096                   FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f));
 28097 
 28098 #ifdef HAVE_XWIDGETS
 28099   /* Make sure any X windows owned by xwidget views of the parent
 28100      still display below the lowered frame.  */
 28101 
 28102   if (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))
 28103     lower_frame_xwidget_views (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f));
 28104 #endif
 28105 
 28106   XFlush (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
 28107 }
 28108 
 28109 static void
 28110 XTframe_raise_lower (struct frame *f, bool raise_flag)
 28111 {
 28112   if (raise_flag)
 28113     x_raise_frame (f);
 28114   else
 28115     x_lower_frame (f);
 28116 }
 28117 
 28118 /* Request focus with XEmbed */
 28119 
 28120 static void
 28121 xembed_request_focus (struct frame *f)
 28122 {
 28123   /* See XEmbed Protocol Specification at
 28124      https://freedesktop.org/wiki/Specifications/xembed-spec/  */
 28125   if (FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
 28126     xembed_send_message (f, CurrentTime,
 28127                          XEMBED_REQUEST_FOCUS, 0, 0, 0);
 28128 }
 28129 
 28130 static Bool
 28131 server_timestamp_predicate (Display *display, XEvent *xevent,
 28132                             XPointer arg)
 28133 {
 28134   XID *args = (XID *) arg;
 28135 
 28136   if (xevent->type == PropertyNotify
 28137       && xevent->xproperty.window == args[0]
 28138       && xevent->xproperty.atom == args[1])
 28139     return True;
 28140 
 28141   return False;
 28142 }
 28143 
 28144 /* Get the server time.  The X server is guaranteed to deliver the
 28145    PropertyNotify event, so there is no reason to use x_if_event.  */
 28146 
 28147 static Time
 28148 x_get_server_time (struct frame *f)
 28149 {
 28150   Atom property_atom;
 28151   XEvent property_dummy;
 28152   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 28153   XID client_data[2];
 28154 #if defined HAVE_XSYNC && !defined USE_GTK && defined HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME
 28155   uint_fast64_t current_monotonic_time;
 28156 #endif
 28157 
 28158   /* If the server time is the same as the monotonic time, avoid a
 28159      roundtrip by using that instead.  */
 28160 
 28161 #if defined HAVE_XSYNC && !defined USE_GTK && defined HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME
 28162   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->server_time_monotonic_p)
 28163     {
 28164       current_monotonic_time = x_sync_current_monotonic_time ();
 28165 
 28166       if (current_monotonic_time)
 28167         /* Truncate the time to CARD32.  */
 28168         return (current_monotonic_time / 1000) & X_ULONG_MAX;
 28169     }
 28170 #endif
 28171 
 28172   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 28173   property_atom = dpyinfo->Xatom_EMACS_SERVER_TIME_PROP;
 28174   client_data[0] = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
 28175   client_data[1] = property_atom;
 28176 
 28177   XChangeProperty (dpyinfo->display, FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 28178                    property_atom, XA_ATOM, 32,
 28179                    PropModeReplace,
 28180                    (unsigned char *) &property_atom, 1);
 28181 
 28182   XIfEvent (dpyinfo->display, &property_dummy,
 28183             server_timestamp_predicate, (XPointer) client_data);
 28184 
 28185   return property_dummy.xproperty.time;
 28186 }
 28187 
 28188 /* Activate frame with Extended Window Manager Hints */
 28189 
 28190 static void
 28191 x_ewmh_activate_frame (struct frame *f)
 28192 {
 28193   XEvent msg;
 28194   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 28195   Time time;
 28196 
 28197   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 28198 
 28199   if (FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
 28200     {
 28201       /* See the documentation at
 28202          https://specifications.freedesktop.org/wm-spec/wm-spec-latest.html
 28203          for more details on the format of this message.  */
 28204       msg.xclient.type = ClientMessage;
 28205       msg.xclient.window = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
 28206       msg.xclient.message_type = dpyinfo->Xatom_net_active_window;
 28207       msg.xclient.format = 32;
 28208       msg.xclient.data.l[0] = 1;
 28209       msg.xclient.data.l[1] = dpyinfo->last_user_time;
 28210       msg.xclient.data.l[2] = (!dpyinfo->x_focus_frame
 28211                                ? None
 28212                                : FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (dpyinfo->x_focus_frame));
 28213       msg.xclient.data.l[3] = 0;
 28214       msg.xclient.data.l[4] = 0;
 28215 
 28216       /* No frame is currently focused on that display, so apply any
 28217          bypass for focus stealing prevention that the user has
 28218          specified.  */
 28219       if (!dpyinfo->x_focus_frame)
 28220         {
 28221           if (EQ (Vx_allow_focus_stealing, Qimitate_pager))
 28222             msg.xclient.data.l[0] = 2;
 28223           else if (EQ (Vx_allow_focus_stealing, Qnewer_time))
 28224             {
 28225               block_input ();
 28226               time = x_get_server_time (f);
 28227 #ifdef USE_GTK
 28228               x_set_gtk_user_time (f, time);
 28229 #endif
 28230               /* Temporarily override dpyinfo->x_focus_frame so the
 28231                  user time property is set on the right window.  */
 28232               dpyinfo->x_focus_frame = f;
 28233               x_display_set_last_user_time (dpyinfo, time, true, true);
 28234               dpyinfo->x_focus_frame = NULL;
 28235               unblock_input ();
 28236 
 28237               msg.xclient.data.l[1] = time;
 28238             }
 28239           else if (EQ (Vx_allow_focus_stealing, Qraise_and_focus))
 28240             {
 28241               time = x_get_server_time (f);
 28242 
 28243               x_set_input_focus (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f),
 28244                                  FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 28245                                  time);
 28246               XRaiseWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f));
 28247 
 28248               return;
 28249             }
 28250         }
 28251 
 28252       XSendEvent (dpyinfo->display, dpyinfo->root_window,
 28253                   False, (SubstructureRedirectMask
 28254                           | SubstructureNotifyMask), &msg);
 28255     }
 28256 }
 28257 
 28258 static Lisp_Object
 28259 x_get_focus_frame (struct frame *f)
 28260 {
 28261   Lisp_Object lisp_focus;
 28262 
 28263   struct frame *focus =  FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->x_focus_frame;
 28264 
 28265   if (!focus)
 28266     return Qnil;
 28267 
 28268   XSETFRAME (lisp_focus, focus);
 28269   return lisp_focus;
 28270 }
 28271 
 28272 /* Return the toplevel parent of F, if it is a child frame.
 28273    Otherwise, return NULL.  */
 28274 
 28275 static struct frame *
 28276 x_get_toplevel_parent (struct frame *f)
 28277 {
 28278   struct frame *parent;
 28279 
 28280   if (!FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))
 28281     return NULL;
 28282 
 28283   parent = FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f);
 28284 
 28285   while (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (parent))
 28286     parent = FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (parent);
 28287 
 28288   return parent;
 28289 }
 28290 
 28291 static void
 28292 x_set_input_focus (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, Window window,
 28293                    Time time)
 28294 {
 28295 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 28296   struct xi_device_t *device;
 28297 #endif
 28298 
 28299   /* Do the equivalent of XSetInputFocus with the specified window and
 28300      time, but use the attachment to the device that Emacs has
 28301      designated the client pointer on X Input Extension builds.
 28302      Asynchronously trap errors around the generated XI_SetFocus or
 28303      SetInputFocus request, in case the device has been destroyed or
 28304      the window obscured.
 28305 
 28306      The revert_to will be set to RevertToParent for generated
 28307      SetInputFocus requests.  */
 28308 
 28309 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 28310   if (dpyinfo->supports_xi2
 28311       && dpyinfo->client_pointer_device != -1)
 28312     {
 28313       device = xi_device_from_id (dpyinfo, dpyinfo->client_pointer_device);
 28314 
 28315       /* The device is a master pointer.  Use its attachment, which
 28316          should be the master keyboard.  */
 28317 
 28318       if (device)
 28319         {
 28320           eassert (device->use == XIMasterPointer);
 28321 
 28322           x_ignore_errors_for_next_request (dpyinfo, 0);
 28323           XISetFocus (dpyinfo->display, device->attachment,
 28324                       /* Note that the input extension
 28325                          only supports RevertToParent-type
 28326                          behavior.  */
 28327                       window, time);
 28328           x_stop_ignoring_errors (dpyinfo);
 28329 
 28330           return;
 28331         }
 28332     }
 28333 #endif
 28334 
 28335   /* Otherwise, use the pointer device that the X server says is the
 28336      client pointer.  */
 28337   x_ignore_errors_for_next_request (dpyinfo, 0);
 28338   XSetInputFocus (dpyinfo->display, window, RevertToParent, time);
 28339   x_stop_ignoring_errors (dpyinfo);
 28340 }
 28341 
 28342 /* In certain situations, when the window manager follows a
 28343    click-to-focus policy, there seems to be no way around calling
 28344    XSetInputFocus to give another frame the input focus.
 28345 
 28346    In an ideal world, XSetInputFocus should generally be avoided so
 28347    that applications don't interfere with the window manager's focus
 28348    policy.  But I think it's okay to use when it's clearly done
 28349    following a user-command.  */
 28350 
 28351 static void
 28352 x_focus_frame (struct frame *f, bool noactivate)
 28353 {
 28354   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 28355   Time time;
 28356 
 28357   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 28358 
 28359   if (dpyinfo->untrusted)
 28360     /* The X server ignores all input focus related requests from
 28361        untrusted clients.  */
 28362     return;
 28363 
 28364   /* The code below is not reentrant wrt to dpyinfo->x_focus_frame and
 28365      friends being set.  */
 28366   block_input ();
 28367 
 28368   if (FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f))
 28369     /* For Xembedded frames, normally the embedder forwards key
 28370        events.  See XEmbed Protocol Specification at
 28371        https://freedesktop.org/wiki/Specifications/xembed-spec/  */
 28372     xembed_request_focus (f);
 28373   else
 28374     {
 28375       if (!noactivate
 28376           /* If F is override-redirect, use SetInputFocus instead.
 28377              Override-redirect frames are not subject to window
 28378              management.  */
 28379           && !FRAME_OVERRIDE_REDIRECT (f)
 28380           /* If F is a child frame, use SetInputFocus instead.  This
 28381              may not work if its parent is not activated.  */
 28382           && !FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f)
 28383           /* If the focus is being transferred from a child frame to
 28384              its toplevel parent, also use SetInputFocus.  */
 28385           && (!dpyinfo->x_focus_frame
 28386               || (x_get_toplevel_parent (dpyinfo->x_focus_frame)
 28387                   != f))
 28388           && x_wm_supports (f, dpyinfo->Xatom_net_active_window))
 28389         {
 28390           /* When window manager activation is possible, use it
 28391              instead.  The window manager is expected to perform any
 28392              necessary actions such as raising the frame, moving it to
 28393              the current workspace, and mapping it, etc, before moving
 28394              input focus to the frame.  */
 28395           x_ewmh_activate_frame (f);
 28396           goto out;
 28397         }
 28398 
 28399       if (NILP (Vx_no_window_manager))
 28400         {
 28401           /* Use the last user time.  It is invalid to use CurrentTime
 28402              according to the ICCCM:
 28403 
 28404                Clients that use a SetInputFocus request must set the
 28405                time field to the timestamp of the event that caused
 28406                them to make the attempt. [...] Note that clients must
 28407                not use CurrentTime in the time field.  */
 28408           time = dpyinfo->last_user_time;
 28409 
 28410           /* Unless the focus doesn't belong to Emacs anymore and
 28411              `x-allow-focus-stealing' is set to Qnewer_time.  */
 28412           if (EQ (Vx_allow_focus_stealing, Qnewer_time)
 28413               && !dpyinfo->x_focus_frame)
 28414             time = x_get_server_time (f);
 28415 
 28416           /* Ignore any BadMatch error this request might result in.
 28417              A BadMatch error can occur if the window was obscured
 28418              after the time of the last user interaction without
 28419              changing the last-focus-change-time.  */
 28420           x_set_input_focus (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 28421                              time);
 28422         }
 28423       else
 28424         x_set_input_focus (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 28425                            /* But when no window manager is in use,
 28426                               respecting the ICCCM doesn't really
 28427                               matter.  */
 28428                            CurrentTime);
 28429     }
 28430 
 28431  out:
 28432   unblock_input ();
 28433 }
 28434 
 28435 
 28436 /* XEmbed implementation.  */
 28437 
 28438 #if defined USE_X_TOOLKIT || ! defined USE_GTK
 28439 
 28440 /* XEmbed implementation.  */
 28441 
 28442 #define XEMBED_VERSION 0
 28443 
 28444 static void
 28445 xembed_set_info (struct frame *f, enum xembed_info flags)
 28446 {
 28447   unsigned long data[2];
 28448   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 28449 
 28450   data[0] = XEMBED_VERSION;
 28451   data[1] = flags;
 28452 
 28453   XChangeProperty (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 28454                    dpyinfo->Xatom_XEMBED_INFO, dpyinfo->Xatom_XEMBED_INFO,
 28455                    32, PropModeReplace, (unsigned char *) data, 2);
 28456 }
 28457 #endif /* defined USE_X_TOOLKIT || ! defined USE_GTK */
 28458 
 28459 static void
 28460 xembed_send_message (struct frame *f, Time t, enum xembed_message msg,
 28461                      long int detail, long int data1, long int data2)
 28462 {
 28463   XEvent event;
 28464 
 28465   event.xclient.type = ClientMessage;
 28466   event.xclient.window = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->parent_desc;
 28467   event.xclient.message_type = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_XEMBED;
 28468   event.xclient.format = 32;
 28469   event.xclient.data.l[0] = t;
 28470   event.xclient.data.l[1] = msg;
 28471   event.xclient.data.l[2] = detail;
 28472   event.xclient.data.l[3] = data1;
 28473   event.xclient.data.l[4] = data2;
 28474 
 28475   /* XXX: the XEmbed spec tells us to trap errors around this request,
 28476      but I don't understand why: there is no way for clients to
 28477      survive the death of the parent anyway.  */
 28478 
 28479   x_ignore_errors_for_next_request (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f), 0);
 28480   XSendEvent (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f)->parent_desc,
 28481               False, NoEventMask, &event);
 28482   x_stop_ignoring_errors (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f));
 28483 }
 28484 
 28485 /* Change of visibility.  */
 28486 
 28487 /* This tries to wait until the frame is really visible, depending on
 28488    the value of Vx_wait_for_event_timeout.
 28489    However, if the window manager asks the user where to position
 28490    the frame, this will return before the user finishes doing that.
 28491    The frame will not actually be visible at that time,
 28492    but it will become visible later when the window manager
 28493    finishes with it.  */
 28494 
 28495 void
 28496 x_make_frame_visible (struct frame *f)
 28497 {
 28498 #ifndef USE_GTK
 28499   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 28500   struct x_output *output;
 28501 #endif
 28502   bool output_flushed;
 28503 
 28504   if (FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f))
 28505     {
 28506       if (!FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
 28507         {
 28508           block_input ();
 28509 #ifdef USE_GTK
 28510           gtk_widget_show_all (FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f));
 28511           XMoveWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 28512                        f->left_pos, f->top_pos);
 28513 #else
 28514           XMapRaised (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f));
 28515 #endif
 28516           unblock_input ();
 28517 
 28518           SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, true);
 28519           SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, false);
 28520         }
 28521       return;
 28522     }
 28523 
 28524   block_input ();
 28525 
 28526   gui_set_bitmap_icon (f);
 28527 
 28528 #ifndef USE_GTK
 28529   dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 28530 #endif
 28531 
 28532   if (! FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
 28533     {
 28534       /* We test asked_for_visible here to make sure we don't
 28535          call x_set_offset a second time
 28536          if we get to x_make_frame_visible a second time
 28537          before the window gets really visible.  */
 28538       if (! FRAME_ICONIFIED_P (f)
 28539           && ! FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f)
 28540           && ! f->output_data.x->asked_for_visible)
 28541         x_set_offset (f, f->left_pos, f->top_pos, 0);
 28542 
 28543 #ifndef USE_GTK
 28544       output = FRAME_X_OUTPUT (f);
 28545       x_update_frame_user_time_window (f);
 28546 
 28547       /* It's been a while since I wrote that code...  I don't
 28548          remember if it can leave `user_time_window' unset or not.  */
 28549       if (output->user_time_window != None)
 28550         {
 28551           if (dpyinfo->last_user_time)
 28552             XChangeProperty (dpyinfo->display, output->user_time_window,
 28553                              dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_user_time,
 28554                              XA_CARDINAL, 32, PropModeReplace,
 28555                              (unsigned char *) &dpyinfo->last_user_time, 1);
 28556           else
 28557             XDeleteProperty (dpyinfo->display, output->user_time_window,
 28558                              dpyinfo->Xatom_net_wm_user_time);
 28559         }
 28560 #endif
 28561 
 28562       f->output_data.x->asked_for_visible = true;
 28563 
 28564       if (! EQ (Vx_no_window_manager, Qt))
 28565         x_wm_set_window_state (f, NormalState);
 28566 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 28567       if (FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f))
 28568         xembed_set_info (f, XEMBED_MAPPED);
 28569       else
 28570         {
 28571           /* This was XtPopup, but that did nothing for an iconified frame.  */
 28572           XtMapWidget (f->output_data.x->widget);
 28573         }
 28574 #else /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 28575 #ifdef USE_GTK
 28576       gtk_widget_show_all (FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f));
 28577       gtk_window_deiconify (GTK_WINDOW (FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f)));
 28578 #else
 28579       if (FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f))
 28580         xembed_set_info (f, XEMBED_MAPPED);
 28581       else
 28582         XMapRaised (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f));
 28583 #endif /* not USE_GTK */
 28584 #endif /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 28585 
 28586       if (FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f))
 28587         {
 28588           SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, true);
 28589           SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, false);
 28590         }
 28591     }
 28592 
 28593   /* Synchronize to ensure Emacs knows the frame is visible
 28594      before we do anything else.  We do this loop with input not blocked
 28595      so that incoming events are handled.  */
 28596   {
 28597     Lisp_Object frame;
 28598     /* This must be before UNBLOCK_INPUT
 28599        since events that arrive in response to the actions above
 28600        will set it when they are handled.  */
 28601     bool previously_visible = f->output_data.x->has_been_visible;
 28602 
 28603     XSETFRAME (frame, f);
 28604 
 28605     int original_left = f->left_pos;
 28606     int original_top = f->top_pos;
 28607 
 28608     /* This must come after we set COUNT.  */
 28609     unblock_input ();
 28610 
 28611     /* Keep track of whether or not the output buffer was flushed, to
 28612        avoid any extra flushes.  */
 28613     output_flushed = false;
 28614 
 28615     /* We unblock here so that arriving X events are processed.  */
 28616 
 28617     /* Now move the window back to where it was "supposed to be".
 28618        But don't do it if the gravity is negative.
 28619        When the gravity is negative, this uses a position
 28620        that is 3 pixels too low.  Perhaps that's really the border width.
 28621 
 28622        Don't do this if the window has never been visible before,
 28623        because the window manager may choose the position
 28624        and we don't want to override it.  */
 28625 
 28626     if (!FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f)
 28627         && !FRAME_ICONIFIED_P (f)
 28628         && !FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f)
 28629         && !FRAME_PARENT_FRAME (f)
 28630         && NILP (Vx_lax_frame_positioning)
 28631         && f->win_gravity == NorthWestGravity
 28632         && previously_visible)
 28633       {
 28634         Drawable rootw;
 28635         int x, y;
 28636         unsigned int width, height, border, depth;
 28637 
 28638         block_input ();
 28639 
 28640         /* On some window managers (such as FVWM) moving an existing
 28641            window, even to the same place, causes the window manager
 28642            to introduce an offset.  This can cause the window to move
 28643            to an unexpected location.  Check the geometry (a little
 28644            slow here) and then verify that the window is in the right
 28645            place.  If the window is not in the right place, move it
 28646            there, and take the potential window manager hit.  */
 28647         XGetGeometry (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 28648                       &rootw, &x, &y, &width, &height, &border, &depth);
 28649         output_flushed = true;
 28650 
 28651         if (original_left != x || original_top != y)
 28652           XMoveWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 28653                        original_left, original_top);
 28654 
 28655         unblock_input ();
 28656       }
 28657 
 28658     /* Try to wait for a MapNotify event (that is what tells us when a
 28659        frame becomes visible).  Unless `x-lax-frame-positioning' is
 28660        non-nil: there, that is a little slow.  */
 28661 
 28662 #ifdef CYGWIN
 28663     /* On Cygwin, which uses input polling, we need to force input to
 28664        be read.  See
 28665        https://lists.gnu.org/r/emacs-devel/2013-12/msg00351.html
 28666        and https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=24091#131.
 28667        Fake an alarm signal to let the handler know that there's
 28668        something to be read.
 28669 
 28670        It could be confusing if a real alarm arrives while processing
 28671        the fake one.  Turn it off and let the handler reset it.  */
 28672     int old_poll_suppress_count = poll_suppress_count;
 28673     poll_suppress_count = 1;
 28674     poll_for_input_1 ();
 28675     poll_suppress_count = old_poll_suppress_count;
 28676 #endif
 28677 
 28678     if (!FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f)
 28679         && NILP (Vx_lax_frame_positioning))
 28680       {
 28681         if (CONSP (frame_size_history))
 28682           frame_size_history_plain
 28683             (f, build_string ("x_make_frame_visible"));
 28684 
 28685         x_wait_for_event (f, MapNotify);
 28686         output_flushed = true;
 28687       }
 28688 
 28689     if (!output_flushed)
 28690       x_flush (f);
 28691   }
 28692 }
 28693 
 28694 /* Change from mapped state to withdrawn state.  */
 28695 
 28696 /* Make the frame visible (mapped and not iconified).  */
 28697 
 28698 void
 28699 x_make_frame_invisible (struct frame *f)
 28700 {
 28701   Window window;
 28702 
 28703   /* Use the frame's outermost window, not the one we normally draw on.  */
 28704   window = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
 28705 
 28706   /* Don't keep the highlight on an invisible frame.  */
 28707   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->highlight_frame == f)
 28708     FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->highlight_frame = 0;
 28709 
 28710   block_input ();
 28711 
 28712 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_2
 28713   /* Remove any touch points associated with F.  */
 28714   xi_unlink_touch_points (f);
 28715 #endif
 28716 
 28717   /* Before unmapping the window, update the WM_SIZE_HINTS property to claim
 28718      that the current position of the window is user-specified, rather than
 28719      program-specified, so that when the window is mapped again, it will be
 28720      placed at the same location, without forcing the user to position it
 28721      by hand again (they have already done that once for this window.)  */
 28722   x_wm_set_size_hint (f, 0, true);
 28723 
 28724 #ifdef USE_GTK
 28725   if (FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f))
 28726     gtk_widget_hide (FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f));
 28727   else
 28728 #else
 28729   if (FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f))
 28730     xembed_set_info (f, 0);
 28731   else
 28732 #endif
 28733 
 28734     if (! XWithdrawWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), window,
 28735                            DefaultScreen (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f))))
 28736       {
 28737         unblock_input ();
 28738         error ("Can't notify window manager of window withdrawal");
 28739       }
 28740 
 28741   /* Don't perform the synchronization if the network connection is
 28742      slow, and the user says it is unwanted.  */
 28743   if (NILP (Vx_lax_frame_positioning))
 28744     XSync (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), False);
 28745 
 28746   /* We can't distinguish this from iconification
 28747      just by the event that we get from the server.
 28748      So we can't win using the usual strategy of letting
 28749      FRAME_SAMPLE_VISIBILITY set this.  So do it by hand,
 28750      and synchronize with the server to make sure we agree.  */
 28751   SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 0);
 28752   SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, false);
 28753 
 28754   if (CONSP (frame_size_history))
 28755     frame_size_history_plain (f, build_string ("x_make_frame_invisible"));
 28756 
 28757   unblock_input ();
 28758 }
 28759 
 28760 static void
 28761 x_make_frame_visible_invisible (struct frame *f, bool visible)
 28762 {
 28763   if (visible)
 28764     x_make_frame_visible (f);
 28765   else
 28766     x_make_frame_invisible (f);
 28767 }
 28768 
 28769 Cursor
 28770 x_create_font_cursor (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, int glyph)
 28771 {
 28772   if (glyph <= 65535)
 28773     return XCreateFontCursor (dpyinfo->display, glyph);
 28774 
 28775   /* x-pointer-invisible cannot fit in CARD16, and thus cannot be any
 28776      existing cursor.  */
 28777   return make_invisible_cursor (dpyinfo);
 28778 }
 28779 
 28780 
 28781 /* Change window state from mapped to iconified.  */
 28782 
 28783 void
 28784 x_iconify_frame (struct frame *f)
 28785 {
 28786 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 28787   int result;
 28788 #endif
 28789 
 28790   /* Don't keep the highlight on an invisible frame.  */
 28791   if (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->highlight_frame == f)
 28792     FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->highlight_frame = 0;
 28793 
 28794   if (FRAME_ICONIFIED_P (f))
 28795     return;
 28796 
 28797   block_input ();
 28798 
 28799   gui_set_bitmap_icon (f);
 28800 
 28801 #if defined (USE_GTK)
 28802   if (FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f))
 28803     {
 28804       if (! FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
 28805         gtk_widget_show_all (FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f));
 28806 
 28807       gtk_window_iconify (GTK_WINDOW (FRAME_GTK_OUTER_WIDGET (f)));
 28808       SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 0);
 28809       SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, true);
 28810       unblock_input ();
 28811       return;
 28812     }
 28813 #endif
 28814 
 28815 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 28816 
 28817   if (! FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
 28818     {
 28819       if (! EQ (Vx_no_window_manager, Qt))
 28820         x_wm_set_window_state (f, IconicState);
 28821       /* This was XtPopup, but that did nothing for an iconified frame.  */
 28822       XtMapWidget (f->output_data.x->widget);
 28823       /* The server won't give us any event to indicate
 28824          that an invisible frame was changed to an icon,
 28825          so we have to record it here.  */
 28826       SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 0);
 28827       SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, true);
 28828       unblock_input ();
 28829       return;
 28830     }
 28831 
 28832   result = XIconifyWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 28833                            XtWindow (f->output_data.x->widget),
 28834                            DefaultScreen (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f)));
 28835   unblock_input ();
 28836 
 28837   if (!result)
 28838     error ("Can't notify window manager of iconification");
 28839 
 28840   SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, true);
 28841   SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 0);
 28842 
 28843   block_input ();
 28844   XFlush (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
 28845   unblock_input ();
 28846 #else /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 28847 
 28848   /* Make sure the X server knows where the window should be positioned,
 28849      in case the user deiconifies with the window manager.  */
 28850   if (! FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f)
 28851       && ! FRAME_ICONIFIED_P (f)
 28852       && ! FRAME_X_EMBEDDED_P (f))
 28853     x_set_offset (f, f->left_pos, f->top_pos, 0);
 28854 
 28855   /* Since we don't know which revision of X we're running, we'll use both
 28856      the X11R3 and X11R4 techniques.  I don't know if this is a good idea.  */
 28857 
 28858   /* X11R4: send a ClientMessage to the window manager using the
 28859      WM_CHANGE_STATE type.  */
 28860   {
 28861     XEvent msg;
 28862 
 28863     msg.xclient.window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
 28864     msg.xclient.type = ClientMessage;
 28865     msg.xclient.message_type = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->Xatom_wm_change_state;
 28866     msg.xclient.format = 32;
 28867     msg.xclient.data.l[0] = IconicState;
 28868     msg.xclient.data.l[1] = 0;
 28869     msg.xclient.data.l[2] = 0;
 28870     msg.xclient.data.l[3] = 0;
 28871     msg.xclient.data.l[4] = 0;
 28872 
 28873     if (! XSendEvent (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 28874                       FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f)->root_window,
 28875                       False,
 28876                       SubstructureRedirectMask | SubstructureNotifyMask,
 28877                       &msg))
 28878       {
 28879         unblock_input ();
 28880         error ("Can't notify window manager of iconification");
 28881       }
 28882   }
 28883 
 28884   /* X11R3: set the initial_state field of the window manager hints to
 28885      IconicState.  */
 28886   x_wm_set_window_state (f, IconicState);
 28887 
 28888   if (!FRAME_VISIBLE_P (f))
 28889     {
 28890       /* If the frame was withdrawn, before, we must map it.  */
 28891       XMapRaised (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f));
 28892     }
 28893 
 28894   SET_FRAME_ICONIFIED (f, true);
 28895   SET_FRAME_VISIBLE (f, 0);
 28896 
 28897   XFlush (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f));
 28898   unblock_input ();
 28899 #endif /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 28900 }
 28901 
 28902 
 28903 /* Free X resources of frame F.  */
 28904 
 28905 void
 28906 x_free_frame_resources (struct frame *f)
 28907 {
 28908   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 28909   Mouse_HLInfo *hlinfo = &dpyinfo->mouse_highlight;
 28910 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 28911   Lisp_Object bar;
 28912   struct scroll_bar *b;
 28913 #endif
 28914 
 28915   block_input ();
 28916 
 28917 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 28918   /* Remove any record of this frame being focused.  */
 28919   xi_handle_delete_frame (dpyinfo, f);
 28920 #endif
 28921 
 28922 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_2
 28923   /* Remove any touch points associated with F.  */
 28924   xi_unlink_touch_points (f);
 28925 #endif
 28926 
 28927   /* If a display connection is dead, don't try sending more
 28928      commands to the X server.  */
 28929   if (dpyinfo->display)
 28930     {
 28931       /* Always exit with visible pointer to avoid weird issue
 28932          with Xfixes (Bug#17609).  */
 28933       if (f->pointer_invisible)
 28934         XTtoggle_invisible_pointer (f, 0);
 28935 
 28936       /* We must free faces before destroying windows because some
 28937          font-driver (e.g. xft) access a window while finishing a
 28938          face.  */
 28939       free_frame_faces (f);
 28940       tear_down_x_back_buffer (f);
 28941 
 28942       if (f->output_data.x->icon_desc)
 28943         XDestroyWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->icon_desc);
 28944 
 28945 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 28946       /* Explicitly destroy the scroll bars of the frame.  Without
 28947          this, we get "BadDrawable" errors from the toolkit later on,
 28948          presumably from expose events generated for the disappearing
 28949          toolkit scroll bars.  */
 28950       for (bar = FRAME_SCROLL_BARS (f); !NILP (bar); bar = b->next)
 28951         {
 28952           b = XSCROLL_BAR (bar);
 28953           x_scroll_bar_remove (b);
 28954         }
 28955 #endif
 28956 
 28957 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 28958       if (FRAME_XIC (f))
 28959         free_frame_xic (f);
 28960 #endif
 28961 
 28962 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
 28963       x_cr_destroy_frame_context (f);
 28964 #endif
 28965 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 28966       if (f->output_data.x->widget)
 28967         {
 28968           XtDestroyWidget (f->output_data.x->widget);
 28969           f->output_data.x->widget = NULL;
 28970         }
 28971       /* Tooltips don't have widgets, only a simple X window, even if
 28972          we are using a toolkit.  */
 28973       else if (FRAME_X_WINDOW (f))
 28974         XDestroyWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f));
 28975 
 28976       free_frame_menubar (f);
 28977 
 28978       if (f->shell_position)
 28979         xfree (f->shell_position);
 28980 #else  /* !USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 28981 
 28982 #ifdef HAVE_XWIDGETS
 28983       kill_frame_xwidget_views (f);
 28984 #endif
 28985 
 28986 #ifdef USE_GTK
 28987       xg_free_frame_widgets (f);
 28988 #endif /* USE_GTK */
 28989 
 28990       tear_down_x_back_buffer (f);
 28991       if (FRAME_X_WINDOW (f))
 28992         XDestroyWindow (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), FRAME_X_WINDOW (f));
 28993 #endif /* !USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 28994 
 28995 #ifdef HAVE_XSYNC
 28996       if (FRAME_X_BASIC_COUNTER (f) != None)
 28997         XSyncDestroyCounter (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 28998                              FRAME_X_BASIC_COUNTER (f));
 28999 
 29000       if (FRAME_X_EXTENDED_COUNTER (f) != None)
 29001         XSyncDestroyCounter (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f),
 29002                              FRAME_X_EXTENDED_COUNTER (f));
 29003 #endif
 29004 
 29005       unload_color (f, FRAME_FOREGROUND_PIXEL (f));
 29006       unload_color (f, FRAME_BACKGROUND_PIXEL (f));
 29007       unload_color (f, f->output_data.x->cursor_pixel);
 29008       unload_color (f, f->output_data.x->cursor_foreground_pixel);
 29009       unload_color (f, f->output_data.x->border_pixel);
 29010       unload_color (f, f->output_data.x->mouse_pixel);
 29011 
 29012       if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel != -1)
 29013         unload_color (f, f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_background_pixel);
 29014       if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_foreground_pixel != -1)
 29015         unload_color (f, f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_foreground_pixel);
 29016 #if defined (USE_LUCID) && defined (USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS)
 29017       /* Scrollbar shadow colors.  */
 29018       if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_top_shadow_pixel != -1)
 29019         unload_color (f, f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_top_shadow_pixel);
 29020       if (f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_bottom_shadow_pixel != -1)
 29021         unload_color (f, f->output_data.x->scroll_bar_bottom_shadow_pixel);
 29022 #endif /* USE_LUCID && USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS */
 29023       if (f->output_data.x->white_relief.pixel != -1)
 29024         unload_color (f, f->output_data.x->white_relief.pixel);
 29025       if (f->output_data.x->black_relief.pixel != -1)
 29026         unload_color (f, f->output_data.x->black_relief.pixel);
 29027 
 29028       x_free_gcs (f);
 29029 
 29030       /* Free extra GCs allocated by x_setup_relief_colors.  */
 29031       if (f->output_data.x->white_relief.gc)
 29032         {
 29033           XFreeGC (dpyinfo->display, f->output_data.x->white_relief.gc);
 29034           f->output_data.x->white_relief.gc = 0;
 29035         }
 29036       if (f->output_data.x->black_relief.gc)
 29037         {
 29038           XFreeGC (dpyinfo->display, f->output_data.x->black_relief.gc);
 29039           f->output_data.x->black_relief.gc = 0;
 29040         }
 29041 
 29042       /* Free cursors.  */
 29043       if (f->output_data.x->text_cursor != 0)
 29044         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->text_cursor);
 29045       if (f->output_data.x->nontext_cursor != 0)
 29046         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->nontext_cursor);
 29047       if (f->output_data.x->modeline_cursor != 0)
 29048         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->modeline_cursor);
 29049       if (f->output_data.x->hand_cursor != 0)
 29050         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->hand_cursor);
 29051       if (f->output_data.x->hourglass_cursor != 0)
 29052         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->hourglass_cursor);
 29053       if (f->output_data.x->horizontal_drag_cursor != 0)
 29054         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->horizontal_drag_cursor);
 29055       if (f->output_data.x->vertical_drag_cursor != 0)
 29056         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->vertical_drag_cursor);
 29057       if (f->output_data.x->left_edge_cursor != 0)
 29058         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->left_edge_cursor);
 29059       if (f->output_data.x->top_left_corner_cursor != 0)
 29060         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->top_left_corner_cursor);
 29061       if (f->output_data.x->top_edge_cursor != 0)
 29062         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->top_edge_cursor);
 29063       if (f->output_data.x->top_right_corner_cursor != 0)
 29064         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->top_right_corner_cursor);
 29065       if (f->output_data.x->right_edge_cursor != 0)
 29066         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->right_edge_cursor);
 29067       if (f->output_data.x->bottom_right_corner_cursor != 0)
 29068         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->bottom_right_corner_cursor);
 29069       if (f->output_data.x->bottom_edge_cursor != 0)
 29070         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->bottom_edge_cursor);
 29071       if (f->output_data.x->bottom_left_corner_cursor != 0)
 29072         XFreeCursor (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), f->output_data.x->bottom_left_corner_cursor);
 29073 
 29074       /* Free sync fences.  */
 29075 #if defined HAVE_XSYNCTRIGGERFENCE && !defined USE_GTK && defined HAVE_CLOCK_GETTIME
 29076       x_sync_free_fences (f);
 29077 #endif
 29078 
 29079 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 29080       /* Since the frame was destroyed, we can no longer guarantee
 29081          that scroll bar events will be received.  Clear
 29082          protected_windows.  */
 29083       dpyinfo->n_protected_windows = 0;
 29084 #endif
 29085     }
 29086 
 29087 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
 29088   if (FRAME_OUTPUT_DATA (f)->scrollbar_background_css_provider)
 29089     g_object_unref (FRAME_OUTPUT_DATA (f)->scrollbar_background_css_provider);
 29090 
 29091   if (FRAME_OUTPUT_DATA (f)->scrollbar_foreground_css_provider)
 29092     g_object_unref (FRAME_OUTPUT_DATA (f)->scrollbar_foreground_css_provider);
 29093 #endif
 29094 
 29095   if (f == dpyinfo->motif_drag_atom_owner)
 29096     {
 29097       dpyinfo->motif_drag_atom_owner = NULL;
 29098       dpyinfo->motif_drag_atom = None;
 29099     }
 29100 
 29101   if (f == dpyinfo->x_focus_frame)
 29102     dpyinfo->x_focus_frame = 0;
 29103   if (f == dpyinfo->x_focus_event_frame)
 29104     dpyinfo->x_focus_event_frame = 0;
 29105   if (f == dpyinfo->highlight_frame)
 29106     dpyinfo->highlight_frame = 0;
 29107   if (f == hlinfo->mouse_face_mouse_frame)
 29108     reset_mouse_highlight (hlinfo);
 29109 
 29110   /* These two need to be freed now that they are used to compute the
 29111      mouse position, I think.  */
 29112   if (f == dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame)
 29113     dpyinfo->last_mouse_motion_frame = NULL;
 29114   if (f == dpyinfo->last_mouse_frame)
 29115     dpyinfo->last_mouse_frame = NULL;
 29116 
 29117 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 29118   /* Consider a frame being unfocused with no following FocusIn event
 29119      while an older focus from another seat exists.  The client
 29120      pointer should then revert to the other seat, so handle potential
 29121      focus changes.  */
 29122 
 29123   if (dpyinfo->supports_xi2)
 29124     xi_handle_focus_change (dpyinfo);
 29125 #endif
 29126 
 29127   unblock_input ();
 29128 }
 29129 
 29130 
 29131 /* Destroy the X window of frame F.  */
 29132 
 29133 static void
 29134 x_destroy_window (struct frame *f)
 29135 {
 29136   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo = FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f);
 29137 
 29138   /* If a display connection is dead, don't try sending more
 29139      commands to the X server.  */
 29140   if (dpyinfo->display != 0)
 29141     x_free_frame_resources (f);
 29142 
 29143   xfree (f->output_data.x->saved_menu_event);
 29144 
 29145 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 29146   if (f->output_data.x->preedit_chars)
 29147     xfree (f->output_data.x->preedit_chars);
 29148 #endif
 29149 
 29150 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 29151 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_1
 29152   if (f->output_data.x->xi_masks)
 29153     XFree (f->output_data.x->xi_masks);
 29154 #else
 29155   /* This is allocated by us under very old versions of libXi; see
 29156      `setup_xi_event_mask'.  */
 29157   if (f->output_data.x->xi_masks)
 29158     xfree (f->output_data.x->xi_masks);
 29159 #endif
 29160 #endif
 29161 
 29162   xfree (f->output_data.x);
 29163   f->output_data.x = NULL;
 29164 
 29165   dpyinfo->reference_count--;
 29166 }
 29167 
 29168 /* Intern NAME in DPYINFO, but check to see if the atom was already
 29169    interned when the X connection was opened, and use that instead.
 29170 
 29171    If PREDEFINED_ONLY, return None if the atom was not interned during
 29172    connection setup or is predefined.  */
 29173 Atom
 29174 x_intern_cached_atom (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 29175                       const char *name, bool predefined_only)
 29176 {
 29177   int i;
 29178   char *ptr;
 29179   Atom *atom;
 29180 
 29181   /* Special atoms that depend on the screen number.  */
 29182   char xsettings_atom_name[sizeof "_XSETTINGS_S%d" - 2
 29183                            + INT_STRLEN_BOUND (int)];
 29184   char cm_atom_name[sizeof "_NET_WM_CM_S%d" - 2
 29185                     + INT_STRLEN_BOUND (int)];
 29186 
 29187   sprintf (xsettings_atom_name, "_XSETTINGS_S%d",
 29188            XScreenNumberOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen));
 29189   sprintf (cm_atom_name, "_NET_WM_CM_S%d",
 29190            XScreenNumberOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen));
 29191 
 29192   if (!strcmp (name, xsettings_atom_name))
 29193     return dpyinfo->Xatom_xsettings_sel;
 29194 
 29195   if (!strcmp (name, cm_atom_name))
 29196     return dpyinfo->Xatom_NET_WM_CM_Sn;
 29197 
 29198   /* Now do some common predefined atoms.  */
 29199   if (!strcmp (name, "PRIMARY"))
 29200     return XA_PRIMARY;
 29201 
 29202   if (!strcmp (name, "SECONDARY"))
 29203     return XA_SECONDARY;
 29204 
 29205   if (!strcmp (name, "STRING"))
 29206     return XA_STRING;
 29207 
 29208   if (!strcmp (name, "INTEGER"))
 29209     return XA_INTEGER;
 29210 
 29211   if (!strcmp (name, "ATOM"))
 29212     return XA_ATOM;
 29213 
 29214   if (!strcmp (name, "WINDOW"))
 29215     return XA_WINDOW;
 29216 
 29217   if (!strcmp (name, "DRAWABLE"))
 29218     return XA_DRAWABLE;
 29219 
 29220   if (!strcmp (name, "BITMAP"))
 29221     return XA_BITMAP;
 29222 
 29223   if (!strcmp (name, "CARDINAL"))
 29224     return XA_CARDINAL;
 29225 
 29226   if (!strcmp (name, "COLORMAP"))
 29227     return XA_COLORMAP;
 29228 
 29229   if (!strcmp (name, "CURSOR"))
 29230     return XA_CURSOR;
 29231 
 29232   if (!strcmp (name, "FONT"))
 29233     return XA_FONT;
 29234 
 29235   if (dpyinfo->motif_drag_atom != None
 29236       && !strcmp (name, dpyinfo->motif_drag_atom_name))
 29237     return dpyinfo->motif_drag_atom;
 29238 
 29239   for (i = 0; i < ARRAYELTS (x_atom_refs); ++i)
 29240     {
 29241       ptr = (char *) dpyinfo;
 29242 
 29243       if (!strcmp (x_atom_refs[i].name, name))
 29244         {
 29245           atom = (Atom *) (ptr + x_atom_refs[i].offset);
 29246 
 29247           return *atom;
 29248         }
 29249     }
 29250 
 29251   if (predefined_only)
 29252     return None;
 29253 
 29254   return XInternAtom (dpyinfo->display, name, False);
 29255 }
 29256 
 29257 /* Get the name of ATOM, but try not to make a request to the X
 29258    server.  Whether or not a request to the X server happened is
 29259    placed in NEED_SYNC.  */
 29260 char *
 29261 x_get_atom_name (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, Atom atom,
 29262                  bool *need_sync)
 29263 {
 29264   char *dpyinfo_pointer, *name, *value, *buffer;
 29265   int i;
 29266   Atom ref_atom;
 29267 
 29268   dpyinfo_pointer = (char *) dpyinfo;
 29269   value = NULL;
 29270 
 29271   if (need_sync)
 29272     *need_sync = false;
 29273 
 29274   buffer = alloca (45 + INT_STRLEN_BOUND (int));
 29275 
 29276   switch (atom)
 29277     {
 29278     case XA_PRIMARY:
 29279       return xstrdup ("PRIMARY");
 29280 
 29281     case XA_SECONDARY:
 29282       return xstrdup ("SECONDARY");
 29283 
 29284     case XA_INTEGER:
 29285       return xstrdup ("INTEGER");
 29286 
 29287     case XA_ATOM:
 29288       return xstrdup ("ATOM");
 29289 
 29290     case XA_CARDINAL:
 29291       return xstrdup ("CARDINAL");
 29292 
 29293     case XA_WINDOW:
 29294       return xstrdup ("WINDOW");
 29295 
 29296     case XA_DRAWABLE:
 29297       return xstrdup ("DRAWABLE");
 29298 
 29299     case XA_BITMAP:
 29300       return xstrdup ("BITMAP");
 29301 
 29302     case XA_COLORMAP:
 29303       return xstrdup ("COLORMAP");
 29304 
 29305     case XA_FONT:
 29306       return xstrdup ("FONT");
 29307 
 29308     default:
 29309       if (dpyinfo->motif_drag_atom
 29310           && atom == dpyinfo->motif_drag_atom)
 29311         return xstrdup (dpyinfo->motif_drag_atom_name);
 29312 
 29313       if (atom == dpyinfo->Xatom_xsettings_sel)
 29314         {
 29315           sprintf (buffer, "_XSETTINGS_S%d",
 29316                    XScreenNumberOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen));
 29317           return xstrdup (buffer);
 29318         }
 29319 
 29320       if (atom == dpyinfo->Xatom_NET_WM_CM_Sn)
 29321         {
 29322           sprintf (buffer, "_NET_WM_CM_S%d",
 29323                    XScreenNumberOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen));
 29324           return xstrdup (buffer);
 29325         }
 29326 
 29327       for (i = 0; i < ARRAYELTS (x_atom_refs); ++i)
 29328         {
 29329           ref_atom = *(Atom *) (dpyinfo_pointer
 29330                                 + x_atom_refs[i].offset);
 29331 
 29332           if (atom == ref_atom)
 29333             return xstrdup (x_atom_refs[i].name);
 29334         }
 29335 
 29336       name = XGetAtomName (dpyinfo->display, atom);
 29337 
 29338       if (need_sync)
 29339         *need_sync = true;
 29340 
 29341       if (name)
 29342         {
 29343           value = xstrdup (name);
 29344           XFree (name);
 29345         }
 29346 
 29347       break;
 29348     }
 29349 
 29350   return value;
 29351 }
 29352 
 29353 /* Intern an array of atoms, and do so quickly, avoiding extraneous
 29354    roundtrips to the X server.
 29355 
 29356    Avoid sending atoms that have already been found to the X server.
 29357    This cannot do anything that will end up triggering garbage
 29358    collection.  */
 29359 
 29360 void
 29361 x_intern_atoms (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, char **names, int count,
 29362                 Atom *atoms_return)
 29363 {
 29364   int i, j, indices[256];
 29365   char *new_names[256];
 29366   Atom results[256], candidate;
 29367 
 29368   if (count > 256)
 29369     /* Atoms array too big to inspect reasonably, just send it to the
 29370        server and back.  */
 29371     XInternAtoms (dpyinfo->display, new_names, count, False, atoms_return);
 29372   else
 29373     {
 29374       for (i = 0, j = 0; i < count; ++i)
 29375         {
 29376           candidate = x_intern_cached_atom (dpyinfo, names[i],
 29377                                             true);
 29378 
 29379           if (candidate)
 29380             atoms_return[i] = candidate;
 29381           else
 29382             {
 29383               indices[j++] = i;
 29384               new_names[j - 1] = names[i];
 29385             }
 29386         }
 29387 
 29388       if (!j)
 29389         return;
 29390 
 29391       /* Now, get the results back from the X server.  */
 29392       XInternAtoms (dpyinfo->display, new_names, j, False,
 29393                     results);
 29394 
 29395       for (i = 0; i < j; ++i)
 29396         atoms_return[indices[i]] = results[i];
 29397     }
 29398 }
 29399 
 29400 #ifndef USE_GTK
 29401 
 29402 /* Set up XEmbed for F, and change its save set to handle the parent
 29403    being destroyed.  */
 29404 
 29405 bool
 29406 x_embed_frame (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, struct frame *f)
 29407 {
 29408   bool rc;
 29409 
 29410   x_catch_errors (dpyinfo->display);
 29411   /* Catch errors; the target window might no longer exist.  */
 29412   XReparentWindow (dpyinfo->display, FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f),
 29413                    FRAME_OUTPUT_DATA (f)->parent_desc, 0, 0);
 29414   rc = x_had_errors_p (dpyinfo->display);
 29415   x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
 29416 
 29417   if (rc)
 29418     return false;
 29419 
 29420   return true;
 29421 }
 29422 
 29423 #endif
 29424 
 29425 
 29426 /* Setting window manager hints.  */
 29427 
 29428 /* Set the normal size hints for the window manager, for frame F.
 29429    FLAGS is the flags word to use--or 0 meaning preserve the flags
 29430    that the window now has.
 29431    If USER_POSITION, set the USPosition
 29432    flag (this is useful when FLAGS is 0).
 29433    The GTK version is in gtkutils.c.  */
 29434 
 29435 void
 29436 x_wm_set_size_hint (struct frame *f, long flags, bool user_position)
 29437 {
 29438 #ifndef USE_GTK
 29439   XSizeHints size_hints;
 29440   Window window = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
 29441 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 29442   WMShellWidget shell;
 29443 #ifndef USE_MOTIF
 29444   bool hints_changed;
 29445 #endif
 29446 #endif
 29447 
 29448   if (!window)
 29449     return;
 29450 
 29451 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 29452   if (f->output_data.x->widget)
 29453     {
 29454       /* Do this dance in xterm.c because some stuff is not as easily
 29455          available in widget.c.  */
 29456 
 29457       eassert (XtIsWMShell (f->output_data.x->widget));
 29458       shell = (WMShellWidget) f->output_data.x->widget;
 29459 
 29460       if (flags)
 29461         {
 29462           shell->wm.size_hints.flags &= ~(PPosition | USPosition);
 29463           shell->wm.size_hints.flags |= flags & (PPosition | USPosition);
 29464         }
 29465 
 29466       if (user_position)
 29467         {
 29468           shell->wm.size_hints.flags &= ~PPosition;
 29469           shell->wm.size_hints.flags |= USPosition;
 29470         }
 29471 
 29472 #ifndef USE_MOTIF
 29473       hints_changed
 29474         = widget_update_wm_size_hints (f->output_data.x->widget,
 29475                                        f->output_data.x->edit_widget);
 29476 #else
 29477       widget_update_wm_size_hints (f->output_data.x->widget,
 29478                                    f->output_data.x->edit_widget);
 29479 
 29480       /* Do this all over again for the benefit of Motif, which always
 29481          knows better than the programmer.  */
 29482       shell->wm.size_hints.flags &= ~(PPosition | USPosition);
 29483       shell->wm.size_hints.flags |= flags & (PPosition | USPosition);
 29484 
 29485       if (user_position)
 29486         {
 29487           shell->wm.size_hints.flags &= ~PPosition;
 29488           shell->wm.size_hints.flags |= USPosition;
 29489         }
 29490 #endif
 29491 
 29492       /* Drill hints into Motif, since it keeps setting its own.  */
 29493       size_hints.flags = shell->wm.size_hints.flags;
 29494       size_hints.x = shell->wm.size_hints.x;
 29495       size_hints.y = shell->wm.size_hints.y;
 29496       size_hints.width = shell->wm.size_hints.width;
 29497       size_hints.height = shell->wm.size_hints.height;
 29498       size_hints.min_width = shell->wm.size_hints.min_width;
 29499       size_hints.min_height = shell->wm.size_hints.min_height;
 29500       size_hints.max_width = shell->wm.size_hints.max_width;
 29501       size_hints.max_height = shell->wm.size_hints.max_height;
 29502       size_hints.width_inc = shell->wm.size_hints.width_inc;
 29503       size_hints.height_inc = shell->wm.size_hints.height_inc;
 29504       size_hints.min_aspect.x = shell->wm.size_hints.min_aspect.x;
 29505       size_hints.min_aspect.y = shell->wm.size_hints.min_aspect.y;
 29506       size_hints.max_aspect.x = shell->wm.size_hints.max_aspect.x;
 29507       size_hints.max_aspect.y = shell->wm.size_hints.max_aspect.y;
 29508       size_hints.base_width = shell->wm.base_width;
 29509       size_hints.base_height = shell->wm.base_height;
 29510       size_hints.win_gravity = shell->wm.win_gravity;
 29511 
 29512 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 29513       XSetWMNormalHints (XtDisplay (f->output_data.x->widget),
 29514                          XtWindow (f->output_data.x->widget),
 29515                          &size_hints);
 29516 #else
 29517       /* In many cases, widget_update_wm_size_hints will not have
 29518          updated the size hints if only flags changed.  When that
 29519          happens, set the WM hints manually.  */
 29520 
 29521       if (!hints_changed)
 29522         XSetWMNormalHints (XtDisplay (f->output_data.x->widget),
 29523                            XtWindow (f->output_data.x->widget),
 29524                            &size_hints);
 29525 #endif
 29526 
 29527       return;
 29528     }
 29529 #endif
 29530 
 29531   /* Setting PMaxSize caused various problems.  */
 29532   size_hints.flags = PResizeInc | PMinSize /* | PMaxSize */;
 29533 
 29534   size_hints.x = f->left_pos;
 29535   size_hints.y = f->top_pos;
 29536 
 29537   size_hints.width = FRAME_PIXEL_WIDTH (f);
 29538   size_hints.height = FRAME_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f);
 29539 
 29540   size_hints.width_inc = frame_resize_pixelwise ? 1 : FRAME_COLUMN_WIDTH (f);
 29541   size_hints.height_inc = frame_resize_pixelwise ? 1 : FRAME_LINE_HEIGHT (f);
 29542 
 29543   size_hints.max_width = x_display_pixel_width (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f))
 29544     - FRAME_TEXT_COLS_TO_PIXEL_WIDTH (f, 0);
 29545   size_hints.max_height = x_display_pixel_height (FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (f))
 29546     - FRAME_TEXT_LINES_TO_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f, 0);
 29547 
 29548   /* Calculate the base and minimum sizes.  */
 29549   {
 29550     int base_width, base_height;
 29551 
 29552     base_width = FRAME_TEXT_COLS_TO_PIXEL_WIDTH (f, 0);
 29553     base_height = FRAME_TEXT_LINES_TO_PIXEL_HEIGHT (f, 0);
 29554 
 29555     /* The window manager uses the base width hints to calculate the
 29556        current number of rows and columns in the frame while
 29557        resizing; min_width and min_height aren't useful for this
 29558        purpose, since they might not give the dimensions for a
 29559        zero-row, zero-column frame.  */
 29560 
 29561     size_hints.flags |= PBaseSize;
 29562     size_hints.base_width = base_width;
 29563     size_hints.base_height = base_height + FRAME_MENUBAR_HEIGHT (f);
 29564     size_hints.min_width  = base_width;
 29565     size_hints.min_height = base_height;
 29566   }
 29567 
 29568   /* If we don't need the old flags, we don't need the old hint at all.  */
 29569   if (flags)
 29570     {
 29571       size_hints.flags |= flags;
 29572       goto no_read;
 29573     }
 29574 
 29575   {
 29576     XSizeHints hints;           /* Sometimes I hate X Windows... */
 29577     long supplied_return;
 29578     int value;
 29579 
 29580     value = XGetWMNormalHints (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), window, &hints,
 29581                                &supplied_return);
 29582 
 29583     if (flags)
 29584       size_hints.flags |= flags;
 29585     else
 29586       {
 29587         if (value == 0)
 29588           hints.flags = 0;
 29589         if (hints.flags & PSize)
 29590           size_hints.flags |= PSize;
 29591         if (hints.flags & PPosition)
 29592           size_hints.flags |= PPosition;
 29593         if (hints.flags & USPosition)
 29594           size_hints.flags |= USPosition;
 29595         if (hints.flags & USSize)
 29596           size_hints.flags |= USSize;
 29597       }
 29598   }
 29599 
 29600  no_read:
 29601 
 29602 #ifdef PWinGravity
 29603   size_hints.win_gravity = f->win_gravity;
 29604   size_hints.flags |= PWinGravity;
 29605 
 29606   if (user_position)
 29607     {
 29608       size_hints.flags &= ~ PPosition;
 29609       size_hints.flags |= USPosition;
 29610     }
 29611 #endif /* PWinGravity */
 29612 
 29613   XSetWMNormalHints (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), window, &size_hints);
 29614 #else
 29615   xg_wm_set_size_hint (f, flags, user_position);
 29616 #endif /* USE_GTK */
 29617 }
 29618 
 29619 /* Used for IconicState or NormalState */
 29620 
 29621 static void
 29622 x_wm_set_window_state (struct frame *f, int state)
 29623 {
 29624 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 29625   Arg al[1];
 29626 
 29627   XtSetArg (al[0], XtNinitialState, state);
 29628   XtSetValues (f->output_data.x->widget, al, 1);
 29629 #else /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 29630   Window window = FRAME_X_WINDOW (f);
 29631 
 29632   f->output_data.x->wm_hints.flags |= StateHint;
 29633   f->output_data.x->wm_hints.initial_state = state;
 29634 
 29635   XSetWMHints (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), window, &f->output_data.x->wm_hints);
 29636 #endif /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 29637 }
 29638 
 29639 static void
 29640 x_wm_set_icon_pixmap (struct frame *f, ptrdiff_t pixmap_id)
 29641 {
 29642   Pixmap icon_pixmap, icon_mask;
 29643 
 29644 #if !defined USE_X_TOOLKIT && !defined USE_GTK
 29645   Window window = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
 29646 #endif
 29647 
 29648   if (pixmap_id > 0)
 29649     {
 29650       icon_pixmap = image_bitmap_pixmap (f, pixmap_id);
 29651       f->output_data.x->wm_hints.icon_pixmap = icon_pixmap;
 29652       icon_mask = x_bitmap_mask (f, pixmap_id);
 29653       f->output_data.x->wm_hints.icon_mask = icon_mask;
 29654     }
 29655   else
 29656     {
 29657       /* It seems there is no way to turn off use of an icon
 29658          pixmap.  */
 29659       return;
 29660     }
 29661 
 29662 
 29663 #ifdef USE_GTK
 29664   {
 29665     xg_set_frame_icon (f, icon_pixmap, icon_mask);
 29666     return;
 29667   }
 29668 
 29669 #elif defined (USE_X_TOOLKIT) /* same as in x_wm_set_window_state.  */
 29670 
 29671   {
 29672     Arg al[1];
 29673     XtSetArg (al[0], XtNiconPixmap, icon_pixmap);
 29674     XtSetValues (f->output_data.x->widget, al, 1);
 29675     XtSetArg (al[0], XtNiconMask, icon_mask);
 29676     XtSetValues (f->output_data.x->widget, al, 1);
 29677   }
 29678 
 29679 #else /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT && not USE_GTK */
 29680 
 29681   f->output_data.x->wm_hints.flags |= (IconPixmapHint | IconMaskHint);
 29682   XSetWMHints (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), window, &f->output_data.x->wm_hints);
 29683 
 29684 #endif /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT && not USE_GTK */
 29685 }
 29686 
 29687 void
 29688 x_wm_set_icon_position (struct frame *f, int icon_x, int icon_y)
 29689 {
 29690   Window window = FRAME_OUTER_WINDOW (f);
 29691 
 29692   f->output_data.x->wm_hints.flags |= IconPositionHint;
 29693   f->output_data.x->wm_hints.icon_x = icon_x;
 29694   f->output_data.x->wm_hints.icon_y = icon_y;
 29695 
 29696   XSetWMHints (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), window, &f->output_data.x->wm_hints);
 29697 }
 29698 
 29699 
 29700 /***********************************************************************
 29701                                 Fonts
 29702  ***********************************************************************/
 29703 
 29704 #ifdef GLYPH_DEBUG
 29705 
 29706 /* Check that FONT is valid on frame F.  It is if it can be found in F's
 29707    font table.  */
 29708 
 29709 static void
 29710 x_check_font (struct frame *f, struct font *font)
 29711 {
 29712   eassert (font != NULL && ! NILP (font->props[FONT_TYPE_INDEX]));
 29713   if (font->driver->check)
 29714     eassert (font->driver->check (f, font) == 0);
 29715 }
 29716 
 29717 #endif /* GLYPH_DEBUG */
 29718 
 29719 
 29720 /***********************************************************************
 29721                              Image Hooks
 29722  ***********************************************************************/
 29723 
 29724 static void
 29725 x_free_pixmap (struct frame *f, Emacs_Pixmap pixmap)
 29726 {
 29727 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
 29728   if (pixmap)
 29729     {
 29730       xfree (pixmap->data);
 29731       xfree (pixmap);
 29732     }
 29733 #else
 29734   XFreePixmap (FRAME_X_DISPLAY (f), pixmap);
 29735 #endif
 29736 }
 29737 
 29738 
 29739 /***********************************************************************
 29740                             Initialization
 29741  ***********************************************************************/
 29742 
 29743 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 29744 static XrmOptionDescRec emacs_options[] = {
 29745   {(char *) "-geometry", (char *) ".geometry", XrmoptionSepArg, NULL},
 29746   {(char *) "-iconic", (char *) ".iconic", XrmoptionNoArg, (XtPointer) "yes"},
 29747 
 29748   {(char *) "-internal-border-width",
 29749    (char *) "*EmacsScreen.internalBorderWidth", XrmoptionSepArg, NULL},
 29750   {(char *) "-ib", (char *) "*EmacsScreen.internalBorderWidth",
 29751    XrmoptionSepArg, NULL},
 29752   {(char *) "-T", (char *) "*EmacsShell.title", XrmoptionSepArg, NULL},
 29753   {(char *) "-wn", (char *) "*EmacsShell.title", XrmoptionSepArg, NULL},
 29754   {(char *) "-title", (char *) "*EmacsShell.title", XrmoptionSepArg, NULL},
 29755   {(char *) "-iconname", (char *) "*EmacsShell.iconName",
 29756    XrmoptionSepArg, NULL},
 29757   {(char *) "-in", (char *) "*EmacsShell.iconName", XrmoptionSepArg, NULL},
 29758   {(char *) "-mc", (char *) "*pointerColor", XrmoptionSepArg, NULL},
 29759   {(char *) "-cr", (char *) "*cursorColor", XrmoptionSepArg, NULL}
 29760 };
 29761 
 29762 /* Whether atimer for Xt timeouts is activated or not.  */
 29763 
 29764 static bool x_timeout_atimer_activated_flag;
 29765 
 29766 #endif /* USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 29767 
 29768 static int x_initialized;
 29769 
 29770 /* Test whether two display-name strings agree up to the dot that separates
 29771    the screen number from the server number.  */
 29772 static bool
 29773 same_x_server (const char *name1, const char *name2)
 29774 {
 29775   bool seen_colon = false;
 29776   Lisp_Object sysname = Fsystem_name ();
 29777   if (! STRINGP (sysname))
 29778     sysname = empty_unibyte_string;
 29779   const char *system_name = SSDATA (sysname);
 29780   ptrdiff_t system_name_length = SBYTES (sysname);
 29781   ptrdiff_t length_until_period = 0;
 29782 
 29783   while (system_name[length_until_period] != 0
 29784          && system_name[length_until_period] != '.')
 29785     length_until_period++;
 29786 
 29787   /* Treat `unix' like an empty host name.  */
 29788   if (! strncmp (name1, "unix:", 5))
 29789     name1 += 4;
 29790   if (! strncmp (name2, "unix:", 5))
 29791     name2 += 4;
 29792   /* Treat this host's name like an empty host name.  */
 29793   if (! strncmp (name1, system_name, system_name_length)
 29794       && name1[system_name_length] == ':')
 29795     name1 += system_name_length;
 29796   if (! strncmp (name2, system_name, system_name_length)
 29797       && name2[system_name_length] == ':')
 29798     name2 += system_name_length;
 29799   /* Treat this host's domainless name like an empty host name.  */
 29800   if (! strncmp (name1, system_name, length_until_period)
 29801       && name1[length_until_period] == ':')
 29802     name1 += length_until_period;
 29803   if (! strncmp (name2, system_name, length_until_period)
 29804       && name2[length_until_period] == ':')
 29805     name2 += length_until_period;
 29806 
 29807   for (; *name1 != '\0' && *name1 == *name2; name1++, name2++)
 29808     {
 29809       if (*name1 == ':')
 29810         seen_colon = true;
 29811       if (seen_colon && *name1 == '.')
 29812         return true;
 29813     }
 29814   return (seen_colon
 29815           && (*name1 == '.' || *name1 == '\0')
 29816           && (*name2 == '.' || *name2 == '\0'));
 29817 }
 29818 
 29819 /* Count number of set bits in mask and number of bits to shift to
 29820    get to the first bit.  With MASK 0x7e0, *BITS is set to 6, and *OFFSET
 29821    to 5.  */
 29822 static void
 29823 get_bits_and_offset (unsigned long mask, int *bits, int *offset)
 29824 {
 29825   int nr = 0;
 29826   int off = 0;
 29827
