 29828   while (!(mask & 1))
 29829     {
 29830       off++;
 29831       mask >>= 1;
 29832     }
 29833 
 29834   while (mask & 1)
 29835     {
 29836       nr++;
 29837       mask >>= 1;
 29838     }
 29839 
 29840   *offset = off;
 29841   *bits = nr;
 29842 }
 29843 
 29844 /* Return true iff display DISPLAY is available for use.
 29845    But don't permanently open it, just test its availability.  */
 29846 
 29847 bool
 29848 x_display_ok (const char *display)
 29849 {
 29850   /* XOpenDisplay fails if it gets a signal.  Block SIGIO which may arrive.  */
 29851   unrequest_sigio ();
 29852   Display *dpy = XOpenDisplay (display);
 29853   request_sigio ();
 29854   if (!dpy)
 29855     return false;
 29856   XCloseDisplay (dpy);
 29857   return true;
 29858 }
 29859 
 29860 #ifdef USE_GTK
 29861 static void
 29862 my_log_handler (const gchar *log_domain, GLogLevelFlags log_level,
 29863                 const gchar *msg, gpointer user_data)
 29864 {
 29865   if (!strstr (msg, "g_set_prgname"))
 29866       fprintf (stderr, "%s-WARNING **: %s\n", log_domain, msg);
 29867 }
 29868 #endif
 29869 
 29870 /* Current X display connection identifier.  Incremented for each next
 29871    connection established.  */
 29872 static unsigned x_display_id;
 29873 
 29874 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2 && !defined HAVE_GTK3
 29875 
 29876 /* Select for device change events on the root window of DPYINFO.
 29877    These include device change and hierarchy change notifications.  */
 29878 
 29879 static void
 29880 xi_select_hierarchy_events (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 29881 {
 29882   XIEventMask mask;
 29883   ptrdiff_t l;
 29884   unsigned char *m;
 29885 
 29886   l = XIMaskLen (XI_LASTEVENT);
 29887   mask.mask = m = alloca (l);
 29888   memset (m, 0, l);
 29889   mask.mask_len = l;
 29890 
 29891   mask.deviceid = XIAllDevices;
 29892 
 29893   XISetMask (m, XI_PropertyEvent);
 29894   XISetMask (m, XI_HierarchyChanged);
 29895   XISetMask (m, XI_DeviceChanged);
 29896 
 29897   XISelectEvents (dpyinfo->display, dpyinfo->root_window,
 29898                   &mask, 1);
 29899 }
 29900 
 29901 #endif
 29902 
 29903 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2 && defined HAVE_GTK3
 29904 
 29905 /* Look up whether or not GTK already initialized the X input
 29906    extension.
 29907 
 29908    Value is 0 if GTK was not built with the input extension, or if it
 29909    was explicitly disabled, 1 if GTK enabled the input extension and
 29910    the version was successfully determined, and 2 if that information
 29911    could not be determined.  */
 29912 
 29913 static int
 29914 xi_check_toolkit (Display *display)
 29915 {
 29916   GdkDisplay *gdpy;
 29917   GdkDeviceManager *manager;
 29918 
 29919   gdpy = gdk_x11_lookup_xdisplay (display);
 29920   eassume (gdpy);
 29921   manager = gdk_display_get_device_manager (gdpy);
 29922 
 29923   if (!strcmp (G_OBJECT_TYPE_NAME (manager),
 29924                "GdkX11DeviceManagerXI2"))
 29925     return 1;
 29926 
 29927   if (!strcmp (G_OBJECT_TYPE_NAME (manager),
 29928                "GdkX11DeviceManagerCore"))
 29929     return 0;
 29930 
 29931   /* Something changed in GDK so this information is no longer
 29932      available.  */
 29933 
 29934   return 2;
 29935 }
 29936 
 29937 #endif
 29938 
 29939 /* Open a connection to X display DISPLAY_NAME, and return the
 29940    structure that describes the open display.  If obtaining the XCB
 29941    connection or toolkit-specific display fails, return NULL.  Signal
 29942    an error if opening the display itself failed.  */
 29943 
 29944 struct x_display_info *
 29945 x_term_init (Lisp_Object display_name, char *xrm_option, char *resource_name)
 29946 {
 29947   Display *dpy;
 29948   XKeyboardState keyboard_state;
 29949   struct terminal *terminal;
 29950   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 29951   XrmDatabase xrdb;
 29952   Lisp_Object tem, quit_keysym;
 29953 #ifdef USE_XCB
 29954   xcb_connection_t *xcb_conn;
 29955 #endif
 29956   static char const cm_atom_fmt[] = "_NET_WM_CM_S%d";
 29957   char cm_atom_sprintf[sizeof cm_atom_fmt - 2 + INT_STRLEN_BOUND (int)];
 29958 #ifdef USE_GTK
 29959   GdkDisplay *gdpy;
 29960   GdkScreen *gscr;
 29961 #endif
 29962 #ifdef HAVE_XFIXES
 29963   Lisp_Object lisp_name;
 29964   int num_fast_selections;
 29965   Atom selection_name;
 29966 #ifdef USE_XCB
 29967   xcb_get_selection_owner_cookie_t *selection_cookies;
 29968   xcb_get_selection_owner_reply_t *selection_reply;
 29969   xcb_generic_error_t *selection_error;
 29970 #endif
 29971 #endif
 29972   int i;
 29973 
 29974 #if defined HAVE_XFIXES && defined USE_XCB
 29975   USE_SAFE_ALLOCA;
 29976 #endif
 29977 
 29978   block_input ();
 29979 
 29980   if (!x_initialized)
 29981     {
 29982       x_initialize ();
 29983       ++x_initialized;
 29984     }
 29985 
 29986 #if defined USE_X_TOOLKIT || defined USE_GTK
 29987 
 29988   if (!x_display_ok (SSDATA (display_name)))
 29989     error ("Display %s can't be opened", SSDATA (display_name));
 29990 
 29991 #endif
 29992 
 29993 #ifdef USE_GTK
 29994   {
 29995 #define NUM_ARGV 10
 29996     int argc;
 29997     char *argv[NUM_ARGV];
 29998     char **argv2 = argv;
 29999     guint id;
 30000 
 30001     if (x_initialized++ > 1)
 30002       {
 30003         xg_display_open (SSDATA (display_name), &dpy);
 30004       }
 30005     else
 30006       {
 30007         static char display_opt[] = "--display";
 30008         static char name_opt[] = "--name";
 30009 
 30010         for (argc = 0; argc < NUM_ARGV; ++argc)
 30011           argv[argc] = 0;
 30012 
 30013         argc = 0;
 30014         argv[argc++] = initial_argv[0];
 30015 
 30016         if (! NILP (display_name))
 30017           {
 30018             argv[argc++] = display_opt;
 30019             argv[argc++] = SSDATA (display_name);
 30020           }
 30021 
 30022         argv[argc++] = name_opt;
 30023         argv[argc++] = resource_name;
 30024 
 30025         XSetLocaleModifiers ("");
 30026 
 30027         /* Work around GLib bug that outputs a faulty warning. See
 30028            https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=563627.  */
 30029         id = g_log_set_handler ("GLib", G_LOG_LEVEL_WARNING | G_LOG_FLAG_FATAL
 30030                                   | G_LOG_FLAG_RECURSION, my_log_handler, NULL);
 30031 
 30032         /* NULL window -> events for all windows go to our function.
 30033            Call before gtk_init so Gtk+ event filters comes after our.  */
 30034         gdk_window_add_filter (NULL, event_handler_gdk, NULL);
 30035 
 30036         /* gtk_init does set_locale.  Fix locale before and after.  */
 30037         fixup_locale ();
 30038         unrequest_sigio (); /* See comment in x_display_ok.  */
 30039         gtk_init (&argc, &argv2);
 30040         request_sigio ();
 30041 
 30042         g_log_remove_handler ("GLib", id);
 30043 
 30044         xg_initialize ();
 30045 
 30046         /* Do this after the call to xg_initialize, because when
 30047            Fontconfig is used, xg_initialize calls its initialization
 30048            function which in some versions of Fontconfig calls setlocale.  */
 30049         fixup_locale ();
 30050 
 30051         dpy = DEFAULT_GDK_DISPLAY ();
 30052 
 30053 #ifndef HAVE_GTK3
 30054         /* Load our own gtkrc if it exists.  */
 30055         {
 30056           const char *file = "~/.emacs.d/gtkrc";
 30057           Lisp_Object s, abs_file;
 30058 
 30059           s = build_string (file);
 30060           abs_file = Fexpand_file_name (s, Qnil);
 30061 
 30062           if (! NILP (abs_file) && !NILP (Ffile_readable_p (abs_file)))
 30063             gtk_rc_parse (SSDATA (abs_file));
 30064         }
 30065 #endif
 30066 
 30067         XSetErrorHandler (x_error_handler);
 30068         XSetIOErrorHandler (x_io_error_quitter);
 30069       }
 30070   }
 30071 #else /* not USE_GTK */
 30072 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 30073   /* weiner@footloose.sps.mot.com reports that this causes
 30074      errors with X11R5:
 30075            X protocol error: BadAtom (invalid Atom parameter)
 30076            on protocol request 18skiloaf.
 30077      So let's not use it until R6.  */
 30078 #ifdef HAVE_X11XTR6
 30079   XtSetLanguageProc (NULL, NULL, NULL);
 30080 #endif
 30081 
 30082   {
 30083     int argc = 0;
 30084     char *argv[3];
 30085 
 30086     argv[0] = (char *) "";
 30087     argc = 1;
 30088     if (xrm_option)
 30089       {
 30090         argv[argc++] = (char *) "-xrm";
 30091         argv[argc++] = xrm_option;
 30092       }
 30093     turn_on_atimers (false);
 30094     unrequest_sigio ();  /* See comment in x_display_ok.  */
 30095     dpy = XtOpenDisplay (Xt_app_con, SSDATA (display_name),
 30096                          resource_name, EMACS_CLASS,
 30097                          emacs_options, XtNumber (emacs_options),
 30098                          &argc, argv);
 30099     request_sigio ();
 30100     turn_on_atimers (true);
 30101 
 30102 #ifdef HAVE_X11XTR6
 30103     /* I think this is to compensate for XtSetLanguageProc.  */
 30104     fixup_locale ();
 30105 #endif
 30106   }
 30107 
 30108 #else /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 30109   XSetLocaleModifiers ("");
 30110   unrequest_sigio ();  /* See comment in x_display_ok.  */
 30111   dpy = XOpenDisplay (SSDATA (display_name));
 30112   request_sigio ();
 30113 #endif /* not USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 30114 #endif /* not USE_GTK*/
 30115 
 30116   /* Detect failure.  */
 30117   if (dpy == 0)
 30118     {
 30119 #if !defined USE_X_TOOLKIT && !defined USE_GTK
 30120       /* Avoid opening a display three times (once in dispextern.c
 30121          upon startup, once in x_display_ok, and once above) to
 30122          determine whether or not the display is alive on no toolkit
 30123          builds, where no toolkit initialization happens at all.  */
 30124 
 30125       error ("Display %s can't be opened", SSDATA (display_name));
 30126 #endif
 30127 
 30128       unblock_input ();
 30129 
 30130 #if defined HAVE_XFIXES && defined USE_XCB
 30131       SAFE_FREE ();
 30132 #endif
 30133       return 0;
 30134     }
 30135 
 30136 #ifdef USE_XCB
 30137   xcb_conn = XGetXCBConnection (dpy);
 30138   if (!xcb_conn)
 30139     {
 30140 #ifdef USE_GTK
 30141       xg_display_close (dpy);
 30142 #else
 30143 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 30144       XtCloseDisplay (dpy);
 30145 #else
 30146       XCloseDisplay (dpy);
 30147 #endif
 30148 #endif /* ! USE_GTK */
 30149 
 30150       unblock_input ();
 30151 
 30152 #if defined HAVE_XFIXES && defined USE_XCB
 30153       SAFE_FREE ();
 30154 #endif
 30155       return 0;
 30156     }
 30157 #endif
 30158 
 30159   /* Select for structure events on the root window, since this allows
 30160      us to record changes to the size of the screen.  */
 30161 
 30162   XSelectInput (dpy, DefaultRootWindow (dpy), StructureNotifyMask);
 30163 
 30164   /* We have definitely succeeded.  Record the new connection.  */
 30165 
 30166   dpyinfo = xzalloc (sizeof *dpyinfo);
 30167   terminal = x_create_terminal (dpyinfo);
 30168 
 30169   if (!NILP (Vx_detect_server_trust))
 30170     {
 30171       /* Detect whether or not the X server trusts this client, which
 30172          is done by making a SetKeyboardControl request and checking
 30173          for an Access error.  */
 30174       XGrabServer (dpy);
 30175       XGetKeyboardControl (dpy, &keyboard_state);
 30176 
 30177       x_catch_errors (dpy);
 30178 
 30179       /* At this point, the display is not on x_display_list, so
 30180          x_uncatch_errors won't sync.  However, that's okay because
 30181          x_had_errors_p will.  */
 30182 
 30183       if (keyboard_state.global_auto_repeat
 30184           == AutoRepeatModeOn)
 30185         XAutoRepeatOn (dpy);
 30186       else
 30187         XAutoRepeatOff (dpy);
 30188 
 30189       if (x_had_errors_p (dpy))
 30190         dpyinfo->untrusted = true;
 30191       x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
 30192       XUngrabServer (dpy);
 30193     }
 30194 
 30195   dpyinfo->next_failable_request = dpyinfo->failable_requests;
 30196 
 30197   {
 30198     struct x_display_info *share;
 30199 
 30200     for (share = x_display_list; share; share = share->next)
 30201       if (same_x_server (SSDATA (XCAR (share->name_list_element)),
 30202                          SSDATA (display_name)))
 30203         break;
 30204     if (share)
 30205       terminal->kboard = share->terminal->kboard;
 30206     else
 30207       {
 30208         terminal->kboard = allocate_kboard (Qx);
 30209 
 30210         if (!BASE_EQ (XSYMBOL (Qvendor_specific_keysyms)->u.s.function,
 30211                       Qunbound))
 30212           {
 30213             char *vendor = ServerVendor (dpy);
 30214 
 30215             /* Temporarily hide the partially initialized terminal.
 30216                Use safe_call so that if a signal happens, a partially
 30217                initialized display (and display connection) is not
 30218                kept around.  */
 30219             terminal_list = terminal->next_terminal;
 30220             unblock_input ();
 30221             kset_system_key_alist (terminal->kboard,
 30222                                    safe_call1 (Qvendor_specific_keysyms,
 30223                                                (vendor
 30224                                                 ? build_string (vendor)
 30225                                                 : empty_unibyte_string)));
 30226             block_input ();
 30227             terminal->next_terminal = terminal_list;
 30228             terminal_list = terminal;
 30229           }
 30230 
 30231         /* Don't let the initial kboard remain current longer than necessary.
 30232            That would cause problems if a file loaded on startup tries to
 30233            prompt in the mini-buffer.  */
 30234         if (current_kboard == initial_kboard)
 30235           current_kboard = terminal->kboard;
 30236       }
 30237     terminal->kboard->reference_count++;
 30238   }
 30239 
 30240   /* Now look through Vx_quit_keysym for the quit keysym associated
 30241      with this display.  */
 30242   tem = Vx_quit_keysym;
 30243   FOR_EACH_TAIL_SAFE (tem)
 30244     {
 30245       quit_keysym = XCAR (tem);
 30246 
 30247       /* Check if its car is a string and its cdr a valid keysym.
 30248          Skip if it is not.  */
 30249 
 30250       if (!CONSP (quit_keysym) || !FIXNUMP (XCDR (quit_keysym))
 30251           || !STRINGP (XCAR (quit_keysym)))
 30252         continue;
 30253 
 30254       /* Check if this is the keysym to be used.  */
 30255 
 30256       if (strcmp (SSDATA (XCAR (quit_keysym)), ServerVendor (dpy)))
 30257         continue;
 30258 
 30259       dpyinfo->quit_keysym = XFIXNUM (XCDR (quit_keysym));
 30260     }
 30261 
 30262   /* Put this display on the chain.  */
 30263   dpyinfo->next = x_display_list;
 30264   x_display_list = dpyinfo;
 30265 
 30266   dpyinfo->name_list_element = Fcons (display_name, Qnil);
 30267   dpyinfo->display = dpy;
 30268   dpyinfo->connection = ConnectionNumber (dpyinfo->display);
 30269 #ifdef USE_XCB
 30270   dpyinfo->xcb_connection = xcb_conn;
 30271 #endif
 30272 
 30273   /* https://lists.gnu.org/r/emacs-devel/2015-11/msg00194.html  */
 30274   dpyinfo->smallest_font_height = 1;
 30275   dpyinfo->smallest_char_width = 1;
 30276 
 30277   dpyinfo->color_names_size = 256;
 30278   dpyinfo->color_names = xzalloc (dpyinfo->color_names_size
 30279                                   * sizeof *dpyinfo->color_names);
 30280   dpyinfo->color_names_length = xzalloc (dpyinfo->color_names_size
 30281                                          * sizeof *dpyinfo->color_names_length);
 30282 
 30283   /* Set the name of the terminal. */
 30284   terminal->name = xlispstrdup (display_name);
 30285 
 30286 #if false
 30287   XSetAfterFunction (dpyinfo->display, x_trace_wire);
 30288 #endif
 30289 
 30290   Lisp_Object system_name = Fsystem_name ();
 30291   static char const title[] = "GNU Emacs";
 30292   if (STRINGP (system_name))
 30293     {
 30294       static char const at[] = " at ";
 30295       ptrdiff_t nbytes = sizeof (title) + sizeof (at);
 30296       if (ckd_add (&nbytes, nbytes, SBYTES (system_name)))
 30297         memory_full (SIZE_MAX);
 30298       dpyinfo->x_id_name = xmalloc (nbytes);
 30299       sprintf (dpyinfo->x_id_name, "%s%s%s", title, at, SDATA (system_name));
 30300     }
 30301   else
 30302     {
 30303       dpyinfo->x_id_name = xmalloc (sizeof (title));
 30304       strcpy (dpyinfo->x_id_name, title);
 30305     }
 30306 
 30307   dpyinfo->x_id = ++x_display_id;
 30308 
 30309 #ifndef HAVE_XKB
 30310   /* Figure out which modifier bits mean what.  */
 30311   x_find_modifier_meanings (dpyinfo);
 30312 #endif
 30313 
 30314   /* Get the scroll bar cursor.  */
 30315 #ifdef USE_GTK
 30316   /* We must create a GTK cursor, it is required for GTK widgets.  */
 30317   dpyinfo->xg_cursor = xg_create_default_cursor (dpyinfo->display);
 30318 #endif /* USE_GTK */
 30319 
 30320   dpyinfo->vertical_scroll_bar_cursor
 30321     = XCreateFontCursor (dpyinfo->display, XC_sb_v_double_arrow);
 30322 
 30323   dpyinfo->horizontal_scroll_bar_cursor
 30324     = XCreateFontCursor (dpyinfo->display, XC_sb_h_double_arrow);
 30325 
 30326   xrdb = x_load_resources (dpyinfo->display, xrm_option,
 30327                            resource_name, EMACS_CLASS);
 30328 #ifdef HAVE_XRMSETDATABASE
 30329   XrmSetDatabase (dpyinfo->display, xrdb);
 30330 #else
 30331   dpyinfo->display->db = xrdb;
 30332 #endif
 30333 
 30334 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
 30335   int event_base, error_base;
 30336   dpyinfo->xrender_supported_p
 30337     = XRenderQueryExtension (dpyinfo->display, &event_base, &error_base);
 30338 
 30339   if (dpyinfo->xrender_supported_p)
 30340     dpyinfo->xrender_supported_p
 30341       = XRenderQueryVersion (dpyinfo->display, &dpyinfo->xrender_major,
 30342                              &dpyinfo->xrender_minor);
 30343 #endif
 30344 
 30345   /* This must come after XRenderQueryVersion! */
 30346 #ifdef HAVE_XCOMPOSITE
 30347   int composite_event_base, composite_error_base;
 30348   dpyinfo->composite_supported_p = XCompositeQueryExtension (dpyinfo->display,
 30349                                                              &composite_event_base,
 30350                                                              &composite_error_base);
 30351 
 30352   if (dpyinfo->composite_supported_p)
 30353     dpyinfo->composite_supported_p
 30354       = XCompositeQueryVersion (dpyinfo->display,
 30355                                 &dpyinfo->composite_major,
 30356                                 &dpyinfo->composite_minor);
 30357 #endif
 30358 
 30359 #ifdef HAVE_XSHAPE
 30360   dpyinfo->xshape_supported_p
 30361     = XShapeQueryExtension (dpyinfo->display,
 30362                             &dpyinfo->xshape_event_base,
 30363                             &dpyinfo->xshape_error_base);
 30364 
 30365   if (dpyinfo->xshape_supported_p)
 30366     dpyinfo->xshape_supported_p
 30367       = XShapeQueryVersion (dpyinfo->display,
 30368                             &dpyinfo->xshape_major,
 30369                             &dpyinfo->xshape_minor);
 30370 #endif
 30371 
 30372   /* Put the rdb where we can find it in a way that works on
 30373      all versions.  */
 30374   dpyinfo->rdb = xrdb;
 30375 
 30376   dpyinfo->screen = ScreenOfDisplay (dpyinfo->display,
 30377                                      DefaultScreen (dpyinfo->display));
 30378   select_visual (dpyinfo);
 30379   dpyinfo->cmap = DefaultColormapOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen);
 30380   dpyinfo->root_window = RootWindowOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen);
 30381   dpyinfo->icon_bitmap_id = -1;
 30382   dpyinfo->wm_type = X_WMTYPE_UNKNOWN;
 30383 
 30384   reset_mouse_highlight (&dpyinfo->mouse_highlight);
 30385 
 30386 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
 30387   if (dpyinfo->xrender_supported_p
 30388       /* This could already have been initialized by
 30389          `select_visual'.  */
 30390       && !dpyinfo->pict_format)
 30391     dpyinfo->pict_format = XRenderFindVisualFormat (dpyinfo->display,
 30392                                                     dpyinfo->visual);
 30393 #endif
 30394 
 30395 #ifdef HAVE_XSYNC
 30396   int xsync_event_base, xsync_error_base;
 30397   dpyinfo->xsync_supported_p
 30398     = XSyncQueryExtension (dpyinfo->display,
 30399                            &xsync_event_base,
 30400                            &xsync_error_base);
 30401 
 30402   if (dpyinfo->xsync_supported_p)
 30403     dpyinfo->xsync_supported_p = XSyncInitialize (dpyinfo->display,
 30404                                                   &dpyinfo->xsync_major,
 30405                                                   &dpyinfo->xsync_minor);
 30406 
 30407   {
 30408     AUTO_STRING (synchronizeResize, "synchronizeResize");
 30409     AUTO_STRING (SynchronizeResize, "SynchronizeResize");
 30410 
 30411     Lisp_Object value = gui_display_get_resource (dpyinfo,
 30412                                                   synchronizeResize,
 30413                                                   SynchronizeResize,
 30414                                                   Qnil, Qnil);
 30415 
 30416     if (STRINGP (value)
 30417         && (!strcmp (SSDATA (value), "false")
 30418             || !strcmp (SSDATA (value), "off")))
 30419       dpyinfo->xsync_supported_p = false;
 30420   }
 30421 #endif
 30422 
 30423 #ifdef HAVE_XINERAMA
 30424   int xin_event_base, xin_error_base;
 30425   dpyinfo->xinerama_supported_p
 30426     = XineramaQueryExtension (dpy, &xin_event_base, &xin_error_base);
 30427 #endif
 30428 
 30429   /* See if a private colormap is requested.  */
 30430   if (dpyinfo->visual == DefaultVisualOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen))
 30431     {
 30432       if (dpyinfo->visual_info.class == PseudoColor)
 30433         {
 30434           AUTO_STRING (privateColormap, "privateColormap");
 30435           AUTO_STRING (PrivateColormap, "PrivateColormap");
 30436           Lisp_Object value
 30437             = gui_display_get_resource (dpyinfo, privateColormap,
 30438                                         PrivateColormap, Qnil, Qnil);
 30439           if (STRINGP (value)
 30440               && (!strcmp (SSDATA (value), "true")
 30441                   || !strcmp (SSDATA (value), "on")))
 30442             dpyinfo->cmap = XCopyColormapAndFree (dpyinfo->display, dpyinfo->cmap);
 30443         }
 30444     }
 30445   else
 30446     dpyinfo->cmap = XCreateColormap (dpyinfo->display, dpyinfo->root_window,
 30447                                      dpyinfo->visual, AllocNone);
 30448 
 30449   /* See if we can construct pixel values from RGB values.  */
 30450   if (dpyinfo->visual_info.class == TrueColor)
 30451     {
 30452       get_bits_and_offset (dpyinfo->visual_info.red_mask,
 30453                            &dpyinfo->red_bits, &dpyinfo->red_offset);
 30454       get_bits_and_offset (dpyinfo->visual_info.blue_mask,
 30455                            &dpyinfo->blue_bits, &dpyinfo->blue_offset);
 30456       get_bits_and_offset (dpyinfo->visual_info.green_mask,
 30457                            &dpyinfo->green_bits, &dpyinfo->green_offset);
 30458 
 30459 #ifdef HAVE_XRENDER
 30460       if (dpyinfo->pict_format)
 30461         {
 30462           unsigned long channel_mask
 30463             = ((unsigned long) dpyinfo->pict_format->direct.alphaMask
 30464                << dpyinfo->pict_format->direct.alpha);
 30465 
 30466           if (channel_mask)
 30467             get_bits_and_offset (channel_mask, &dpyinfo->alpha_bits,
 30468                                  &dpyinfo->alpha_offset);
 30469           dpyinfo->alpha_mask = channel_mask;
 30470         }
 30471       else
 30472 #endif
 30473         {
 30474           XColor xc;
 30475           unsigned long alpha_mask;
 30476           xc.red = 65535;
 30477           xc.green = 65535;
 30478           xc.blue = 65535;
 30479 
 30480           if (XAllocColor (dpyinfo->display,
 30481                            dpyinfo->cmap, &xc) != 0)
 30482             {
 30483               alpha_mask = xc.pixel & ~(dpyinfo->visual_info.red_mask
 30484                                         | dpyinfo->visual_info.blue_mask
 30485                                         | dpyinfo->visual_info.green_mask);
 30486 
 30487               if (alpha_mask)
 30488                 get_bits_and_offset (alpha_mask, &dpyinfo->alpha_bits,
 30489                                      &dpyinfo->alpha_offset);
 30490               dpyinfo->alpha_mask = alpha_mask;
 30491             }
 30492         }
 30493     }
 30494 
 30495 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
 30496   dpyinfo->supports_xdbe = false;
 30497   int xdbe_major;
 30498   int xdbe_minor;
 30499   if (XdbeQueryExtension (dpyinfo->display, &xdbe_major, &xdbe_minor))
 30500     dpyinfo->supports_xdbe = true;
 30501 #endif
 30502 
 30503 #ifdef USE_XCB
 30504   xcb_screen_t *xcb_screen = NULL;
 30505   xcb_screen_iterator_t iter;
 30506   xcb_visualid_t wanted = { XVisualIDFromVisual (dpyinfo->visual) };
 30507   xcb_depth_iterator_t depth_iter;
 30508   xcb_visualtype_iterator_t visual_iter;
 30509 
 30510   int screen = DefaultScreen (dpyinfo->display);
 30511 
 30512   iter = xcb_setup_roots_iterator (xcb_get_setup (dpyinfo->xcb_connection));
 30513   for (; iter.rem; --screen, xcb_screen_next (&iter))
 30514     {
 30515       if (!screen)
 30516         xcb_screen = iter.data;
 30517     }
 30518 
 30519   if (xcb_screen)
 30520     {
 30521       depth_iter = xcb_screen_allowed_depths_iterator (xcb_screen);
 30522       for (; depth_iter.rem; xcb_depth_next (&depth_iter))
 30523         {
 30524           visual_iter = xcb_depth_visuals_iterator (depth_iter.data);
 30525           for (; visual_iter.rem; xcb_visualtype_next (&visual_iter))
 30526             {
 30527               if (wanted == visual_iter.data->visual_id)
 30528                 {
 30529                   dpyinfo->xcb_visual = visual_iter.data;
 30530                   break;
 30531                 }
 30532             }
 30533         }
 30534     }
 30535 #endif
 30536 
 30537 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 30538   dpyinfo->supports_xi2 = false;
 30539   int rc;
 30540   int major = 2;
 30541   int xi_first_event, xi_first_error;
 30542 
 30543 #ifndef HAVE_GTK3
 30544   {
 30545     AUTO_STRING (disableInputExtension, "disableInputExtension");
 30546     AUTO_STRING (DisableInputExtension, "DisableInputExtension");
 30547 
 30548     Lisp_Object value = gui_display_get_resource (dpyinfo,
 30549                                                   disableInputExtension,
 30550                                                   DisableInputExtension,
 30551                                                   Qnil, Qnil);
 30552 
 30553     if (STRINGP (value)
 30554         && (!strcmp (SSDATA (value), "on")
 30555             || !strcmp (SSDATA (value), "true")))
 30556       goto skip_xi_setup;
 30557   }
 30558 #endif
 30559 
 30560 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2_4
 30561   int minor = 4;
 30562 #elif defined HAVE_XINPUT2_3 /* XInput 2.3 */
 30563   int minor = 3;
 30564 #elif defined HAVE_XINPUT2_2 /* XInput 2.2 */
 30565   int minor = 2;
 30566 #elif defined HAVE_XINPUT2_1 /* XInput 2.1 */
 30567   int minor = 1;
 30568 #else /* Some old version of XI2 we're not interested in. */
 30569   int minor = 0;
 30570 #endif
 30571 
 30572   dpyinfo->client_pointer_device = -1;
 30573 
 30574 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
 30575   /* GTK gets a chance to request use of the input extension first.
 30576      If we later try to enable it if GDK did not, then GTK will not
 30577      get the resulting extension events.  */
 30578 
 30579   rc = xi_check_toolkit (dpyinfo->display);
 30580 
 30581   if (!rc)
 30582     goto skip_xi_setup;
 30583 #endif
 30584 
 30585   if (XQueryExtension (dpyinfo->display, "XInputExtension",
 30586                        &dpyinfo->xi2_opcode, &xi_first_event,
 30587                        &xi_first_error))
 30588     {
 30589 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
 30590       bool move_backwards = false;
 30591       int original_minor = minor;
 30592 
 30593     query:
 30594 
 30595       /* Catch errors caused by GTK requesting a different version of
 30596          XInput 2 than what Emacs was built with.  Usually, the X
 30597          server tolerates these mistakes, but a BadValue error can
 30598          result if only one of GTK or Emacs wasn't built with support
 30599          for XInput 2.2.
 30600 
 30601          To work around the first, it suffices to increase the minor
 30602          version until the X server is happy if the XIQueryVersion
 30603          request results in an error.  If that doesn't work, however,
 30604          then it's the latter, so decrease the minor until the version
 30605          that GTK requested is found.  */
 30606 #endif
 30607 
 30608       x_catch_errors (dpyinfo->display);
 30609 
 30610       rc = XIQueryVersion (dpyinfo->display, &major, &minor);
 30611 
 30612 #ifdef HAVE_GTK3
 30613       /* Increase the minor version until we find one the X
 30614          server agrees with.  If that didn't work, then
 30615          decrease the version until it either hits zero or
 30616          becomes agreeable to the X server.  */
 30617 
 30618       if (x_had_errors_p (dpyinfo->display))
 30619         {
 30620           x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
 30621 
 30622           /* Since BadValue errors can't be generated if both the
 30623              prior and current requests specify a version of 2.2 or
 30624              later, this means the prior request specified a version
 30625              of the input extension less than 2.2.  */
 30626           if (minor >= 2)
 30627             {
 30628               move_backwards = true;
 30629               minor = original_minor;
 30630 
 30631               if (--minor < 0)
 30632                 rc = BadRequest;
 30633               else
 30634                 goto query;
 30635             }
 30636           else
 30637             {
 30638               if (!move_backwards)
 30639                 {
 30640                   minor++;
 30641                   goto query;
 30642                 }
 30643 
 30644               if (--minor < 0)
 30645                 rc = BadRequest;
 30646               else
 30647                 goto query;
 30648 
 30649             }
 30650         }
 30651       else
 30652         x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
 30653 
 30654       /* But don't delude ourselves into thinking that we can use
 30655          features provided by a version of the input extension that
 30656          libXi itself doesn't support.  */
 30657 
 30658       if (minor > original_minor)
 30659         minor = original_minor;
 30660 #else
 30661       if (x_had_errors_p (dpyinfo->display))
 30662         rc = BadRequest;
 30663 
 30664       x_uncatch_errors_after_check ();
 30665 #endif
 30666 
 30667       if (rc == Success)
 30668         {
 30669           dpyinfo->supports_xi2 = true;
 30670 #ifndef HAVE_GTK3
 30671           /* Select for hierarchy events on the root window.  GTK 3.x
 30672              does this itself.  */
 30673           xi_select_hierarchy_events (dpyinfo);
 30674 #endif
 30675 
 30676           dpyinfo->xi2_version = minor;
 30677           x_cache_xi_devices (dpyinfo);
 30678         }
 30679     }
 30680  skip_xi_setup:
 30681   ;
 30682 #endif
 30683 
 30684 #if defined HAVE_XRANDR || defined USE_GTK
 30685   Lisp_Object term;
 30686 
 30687   XSETTERMINAL (term, terminal);
 30688 #endif
 30689 
 30690 #ifdef HAVE_XRANDR
 30691   dpyinfo->xrandr_supported_p
 30692     = XRRQueryExtension (dpy, &dpyinfo->xrandr_event_base,
 30693                          &dpyinfo->xrandr_error_base);
 30694 
 30695 #ifndef USE_GTK
 30696   dpyinfo->last_monitor_attributes_list = Qnil;
 30697 #endif
 30698 
 30699   if (dpyinfo->xrandr_supported_p)
 30700     {
 30701       XRRQueryVersion (dpy, &dpyinfo->xrandr_major_version,
 30702                        &dpyinfo->xrandr_minor_version);
 30703 
 30704 #ifndef USE_GTK
 30705       if (dpyinfo->xrandr_major_version == 1
 30706           && dpyinfo->xrandr_minor_version >= 2)
 30707         {
 30708           XRRSelectInput (dpyinfo->display,
 30709                           dpyinfo->root_window,
 30710                           (RRScreenChangeNotifyMask
 30711                            | RRCrtcChangeNotifyMask
 30712                            | RROutputChangeNotifyMask
 30713 #ifdef USE_GTK
 30714                            /* Emacs doesn't actually need this, but
 30715                               GTK selects for it when the display is
 30716                               initialized.  */
 30717                            | RROutputPropertyNotifyMask
 30718 #endif
 30719                            ));
 30720 
 30721           dpyinfo->last_monitor_attributes_list
 30722             = Fx_display_monitor_attributes_list (term);
 30723         }
 30724 #endif
 30725     }
 30726 #endif
 30727 
 30728 #ifdef USE_GTK
 30729   dpyinfo->last_monitor_attributes_list
 30730     = Fx_display_monitor_attributes_list (term);
 30731 
 30732   gdpy = gdk_x11_lookup_xdisplay (dpyinfo->display);
 30733   gscr = gdk_display_get_default_screen (gdpy);
 30734 
 30735   g_signal_connect (G_OBJECT (gscr), "monitors-changed",
 30736                     G_CALLBACK (x_monitors_changed_cb),
 30737                     NULL);
 30738 #endif
 30739 
 30740 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 30741   int xkb_major, xkb_minor, xkb_op, xkb_error_code;
 30742   xkb_major = XkbMajorVersion;
 30743   xkb_minor = XkbMinorVersion;
 30744 
 30745   if (XkbLibraryVersion (&xkb_major, &xkb_minor)
 30746       && XkbQueryExtension (dpyinfo->display, &xkb_op, &dpyinfo->xkb_event_type,
 30747                             &xkb_error_code, &xkb_major, &xkb_minor))
 30748     {
 30749       dpyinfo->supports_xkb = true;
 30750       dpyinfo->xkb_desc = XkbGetMap (dpyinfo->display,
 30751                                      (XkbKeySymsMask
 30752                                       | XkbKeyTypesMask
 30753                                       | XkbModifierMapMask
 30754                                       | XkbVirtualModsMask),
 30755                                      XkbUseCoreKbd);
 30756 
 30757       if (dpyinfo->xkb_desc)
 30758         XkbGetNames (dpyinfo->display, XkbAllNamesMask,
 30759                      dpyinfo->xkb_desc);
 30760 
 30761       XkbSelectEvents (dpyinfo->display, XkbUseCoreKbd,
 30762                        XkbNewKeyboardNotifyMask | XkbMapNotifyMask,
 30763                        XkbNewKeyboardNotifyMask | XkbMapNotifyMask);
 30764     }
 30765 #endif
 30766 
 30767 #ifdef HAVE_XFIXES
 30768   int xfixes_error_base;
 30769   dpyinfo->xfixes_supported_p
 30770     = XFixesQueryExtension (dpyinfo->display,
 30771                             &dpyinfo->xfixes_event_base,
 30772                             &xfixes_error_base);
 30773 
 30774   if (dpyinfo->xfixes_supported_p)
 30775     {
 30776       if (!XFixesQueryVersion (dpyinfo->display, &dpyinfo->xfixes_major,
 30777                                &dpyinfo->xfixes_minor))
 30778         dpyinfo->xfixes_supported_p = false;
 30779     }
 30780 #endif
 30781 
 30782 #if defined USE_CAIRO || defined HAVE_XFT
 30783   {
 30784     /* If we are using Xft, the following precautions should be made:
 30785 
 30786        1. Make sure that the Xrender extension is added before the Xft one.
 30787        Otherwise, the close-display hook set by Xft is called after the one
 30788        for Xrender, and the former tries to re-add the latter.  This results
 30789        in inconsistency of internal states and leads to X protocol error when
 30790        one reconnects to the same X server (Bug#1696).
 30791 
 30792        2. Check dpi value in X resources.  It is better we use it as well,
 30793        since Xft will use it, as will all Gnome applications.  If our real DPI
 30794        is smaller or larger than the one Xft uses, our font will look smaller
 30795        or larger than other for other applications, even if it is the same
 30796        font name (monospace-10 for example).  */
 30797 
 30798     char *v = XGetDefault (dpyinfo->display, "Xft", "dpi");
 30799     double d;
 30800     if (v != NULL && sscanf (v, "%lf", &d) == 1)
 30801       dpyinfo->resy = dpyinfo->resx = d;
 30802   }
 30803 #endif
 30804 
 30805   if (dpyinfo->resy < 1)
 30806     {
 30807       int screen_number = XScreenNumberOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen);
 30808       double pixels = DisplayHeight (dpyinfo->display, screen_number);
 30809       double mm = DisplayHeightMM (dpyinfo->display, screen_number);
 30810       /* Mac OS X 10.3's Xserver sometimes reports 0.0mm.  */
 30811       dpyinfo->resy = (mm < 1) ? 100 : pixels * 25.4 / mm;
 30812       pixels = DisplayWidth (dpyinfo->display, screen_number);
 30813       mm = DisplayWidthMM (dpyinfo->display, screen_number);
 30814       /* Mac OS X 10.3's Xserver sometimes reports 0.0mm.  */
 30815       dpyinfo->resx = (mm < 1) ? 100 : pixels * 25.4 / mm;
 30816     }
 30817 
 30818   sprintf (cm_atom_sprintf, cm_atom_fmt,
 30819            XScreenNumberOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen));
 30820 
 30821   {
 30822     enum { atom_count = ARRAYELTS (x_atom_refs) };
 30823     /* 1 for _XSETTINGS_SN.  */
 30824     enum { total_atom_count = 2 + atom_count };
 30825     Atom atoms_return[total_atom_count];
 30826     char *atom_names[total_atom_count];
 30827     static char const xsettings_fmt[] = "_XSETTINGS_S%d";
 30828     char xsettings_atom_name[sizeof xsettings_fmt - 2
 30829                              + INT_STRLEN_BOUND (int)];
 30830 
 30831     for (i = 0; i < atom_count; i++)
 30832       atom_names[i] = (char *) x_atom_refs[i].name;
 30833 
 30834     /* Build _XSETTINGS_SN atom name.  */
 30835     sprintf (xsettings_atom_name, xsettings_fmt,
 30836              XScreenNumberOfScreen (dpyinfo->screen));
 30837     atom_names[i] = xsettings_atom_name;
 30838     atom_names[i + 1] = cm_atom_sprintf;
 30839 
 30840     XInternAtoms (dpyinfo->display, atom_names, total_atom_count,
 30841                   False, atoms_return);
 30842 
 30843     for (i = 0; i < atom_count; i++)
 30844       *(Atom *) ((char *) dpyinfo + x_atom_refs[i].offset) = atoms_return[i];
 30845 
 30846     /* Manually copy last two atoms.  */
 30847     dpyinfo->Xatom_xsettings_sel = atoms_return[i];
 30848     dpyinfo->Xatom_NET_WM_CM_Sn = atoms_return[i + 1];
 30849   }
 30850 
 30851 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 30852   /* Figure out which modifier bits mean what.  */
 30853   x_find_modifier_meanings (dpyinfo);
 30854 #endif
 30855 
 30856   dpyinfo->x_dnd_atoms_size = 16;
 30857   dpyinfo->x_dnd_atoms = xmalloc (sizeof *dpyinfo->x_dnd_atoms
 30858                                   * dpyinfo->x_dnd_atoms_size);
 30859   dpyinfo->gray
 30860     = XCreatePixmapFromBitmapData (dpyinfo->display, dpyinfo->root_window,
 30861                                    gray_bits, gray_width, gray_height,
 30862                                    1, 0, 1);
 30863 
 30864   dpyinfo->invisible_cursor = make_invisible_cursor (dpyinfo);
 30865 #if defined HAVE_XFIXES && XFIXES_VERSION >= 40000
 30866   dpyinfo->fixes_pointer_blanking = (egetenv ("EMACS_XFIXES") != NULL);
 30867 #endif
 30868 
 30869   xsettings_initialize (dpyinfo);
 30870 
 30871   /* This is only needed for distinguishing keyboard and process input.  */
 30872   if (dpyinfo->connection != 0)
 30873     add_keyboard_wait_descriptor (dpyinfo->connection);
 30874 
 30875 #ifdef F_SETOWN
 30876   fcntl (dpyinfo->connection, F_SETOWN, getpid ());
 30877 #endif /* ! defined (F_SETOWN) */
 30878 
 30879   if (interrupt_input)
 30880     init_sigio (dpyinfo->connection);
 30881 
 30882 #ifdef USE_LUCID
 30883   {
 30884     XrmValue d, fr, to;
 30885     Font font;
 30886     XFontStruct *query_result;
 30887 
 30888     dpy = dpyinfo->display;
 30889     d.addr = (XPointer) &dpy;
 30890     d.size = sizeof (Display *);
 30891     fr.addr = (char *) XtDefaultFont;
 30892     fr.size = sizeof (XtDefaultFont);
 30893     to.size = sizeof (Font *);
 30894     to.addr = (XPointer) &font;
 30895     x_catch_errors (dpy);
 30896     if (!XtCallConverter (dpy, XtCvtStringToFont, &d, 1, &fr, &to, NULL))
 30897       emacs_abort ();
 30898     query_result = XQueryFont (dpy, font);
 30899 
 30900     /* Set the dialog font to some fallback (here, 9x15) if the font
 30901        specified is invalid.  */
 30902     if (x_had_errors_p (dpy) || !font)
 30903       XrmPutLineResource (&xrdb, "Emacs.dialog.*.font: 9x15");
 30904 
 30905     /* Do not destroy the font struct returned above with XFreeFont;
 30906        that also destroys the font, leading to X protocol errors at
 30907        XtCloseDisplay.  Just free the font info structure.
 30908        (Bug#18403) */
 30909     XFreeFontInfo (NULL, query_result, 1);
 30910     x_uncatch_errors ();
 30911   }
 30912 #endif
 30913 
 30914   /* See if we should run in synchronous mode.  This is useful
 30915      for debugging X code.  */
 30916   {
 30917     AUTO_STRING (synchronous, "synchronous");
 30918     AUTO_STRING (Synchronous, "Synchronous");
 30919     Lisp_Object value = gui_display_get_resource (dpyinfo, synchronous,
 30920                                                   Synchronous, Qnil, Qnil);
 30921     if (STRINGP (value)
 30922         && (!strcmp (SSDATA (value), "true")
 30923             || !strcmp (SSDATA (value), "on")))
 30924       XSynchronize (dpyinfo->display, True);
 30925   }
 30926 
 30927 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 30928   {
 30929     AUTO_STRING (useXIM, "useXIM");
 30930     AUTO_STRING (UseXIM, "UseXIM");
 30931     Lisp_Object value = gui_display_get_resource (dpyinfo, useXIM, UseXIM,
 30932                                                   Qnil, Qnil);
 30933 
 30934     /* `USE_XIM' controls whether Emacs should use X input methods by
 30935        default, not whether or not XIM is available.  */
 30936 
 30937 #ifdef USE_XIM
 30938     dpyinfo->use_xim = true;
 30939 
 30940     if (STRINGP (value)
 30941         && (!strcmp (SSDATA (value), "false")
 30942             || !strcmp (SSDATA (value), "off")))
 30943       dpyinfo->use_xim = false;
 30944 #else /* !USE_XIM */
 30945     dpyinfo->use_xim = false;
 30946 
 30947     if (STRINGP (value)
 30948         && (!strcmp (SSDATA (value), "true")
 30949             || !strcmp (SSDATA (value), "on")))
 30950       dpyinfo->use_xim = true;
 30951 #endif /* USE_XIM */
 30952   }
 30953 
 30954   {
 30955     AUTO_STRING (inputStyle, "inputStyle");
 30956     AUTO_STRING (InputStyle, "InputStyle");
 30957     Lisp_Object value = gui_display_get_resource (dpyinfo, inputStyle, InputStyle,
 30958                                                   Qnil, Qnil);
 30959 
 30960     if (STRINGP (value))
 30961       {
 30962         if (!strcmp (SSDATA (value), "callback"))
 30963           dpyinfo->preferred_xim_style = STYLE_CALLBACK;
 30964         else if (!strcmp (SSDATA (value), "none"))
 30965           dpyinfo->preferred_xim_style = STYLE_NONE;
 30966         else if (!strcmp (SSDATA (value), "overthespot"))
 30967           dpyinfo->preferred_xim_style = STYLE_OVERTHESPOT;
 30968         else if (!strcmp (SSDATA (value), "offthespot"))
 30969           dpyinfo->preferred_xim_style = STYLE_OFFTHESPOT;
 30970         else if (!strcmp (SSDATA (value), "root"))
 30971           dpyinfo->preferred_xim_style = STYLE_ROOT;
 30972 #ifdef USE_GTK
 30973         else if (!strcmp (SSDATA (value), "native"))
 30974           dpyinfo->prefer_native_input = true;
 30975 #endif /* HAVE_GTK */
 30976       }
 30977   }
 30978 
 30979   /* Now that defaults have been set up, initialize input method
 30980      support.  */
 30981 
 30982   /* Avoid initializing input methods if the X library does not
 30983      support Emacs's locale.  When the current locale is not
 30984      supported, decoding input method strings becomes undefined.  */
 30985   if (XSupportsLocale ())
 30986     xim_initialize (dpyinfo, resource_name);
 30987 #endif /* HAVE_X_I18N */
 30988 
 30989 #ifdef HAVE_X_SM
 30990   /* Only do this for the very first display in the Emacs session.
 30991      Ignore X session management when Emacs was first started on a
 30992      tty or started as a daemon.  */
 30993   if (!dpyinfo->next && ! IS_DAEMON)
 30994     x_session_initialize (dpyinfo);
 30995 #endif
 30996 
 30997 #if defined USE_CAIRO || defined HAVE_XRENDER
 30998   x_extension_initialize (dpyinfo);
 30999 #endif
 31000 
 31001 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 31002   dpyinfo->protected_windows = xmalloc (sizeof (Lisp_Object) * 256);
 31003   dpyinfo->n_protected_windows = 0;
 31004   dpyinfo->protected_windows_max = 256;
 31005 #endif
 31006 
 31007 #ifdef HAVE_XFIXES
 31008   /* Initialize selection tracking for the selections in
 31009      x-fast-selection-list.  */
 31010 
 31011   if (CONSP (Vx_fast_selection_list)
 31012       && dpyinfo->xfixes_supported_p
 31013       && dpyinfo->xfixes_major >= 1)
 31014     {
 31015       num_fast_selections = 0;
 31016       tem = Vx_fast_selection_list;
 31017 
 31018       FOR_EACH_TAIL_SAFE (tem)
 31019         {
 31020           if (!SYMBOLP (XCAR (tem)))
 31021             continue;
 31022 
 31023           num_fast_selections++;
 31024         }
 31025 
 31026       dpyinfo->n_monitored_selections = num_fast_selections;
 31027       dpyinfo->selection_tracking_window
 31028         = x_create_special_window (dpyinfo, dpyinfo->root_window);
 31029       dpyinfo->monitored_selections
 31030         = xmalloc (num_fast_selections
 31031                    * sizeof *dpyinfo->monitored_selections);
 31032 
 31033       num_fast_selections = 0;
 31034       tem = Vx_fast_selection_list;
 31035 
 31036       FOR_EACH_TAIL_SAFE (tem)
 31037         {
 31038           lisp_name = XCAR (tem);
 31039 
 31040           if (!SYMBOLP (lisp_name))
 31041             continue;
 31042 
 31043           selection_name = symbol_to_x_atom (dpyinfo, lisp_name);
 31044           dpyinfo->monitored_selections[num_fast_selections++].name
 31045             = selection_name;
 31046           dpyinfo->monitored_selections[num_fast_selections - 1].owner
 31047             = X_INVALID_WINDOW;
 31048 
 31049           /* Select for selection input.  */
 31050           XFixesSelectSelectionInput (dpyinfo->display,
 31051                                       dpyinfo->selection_tracking_window,
 31052                                       selection_name,
 31053                                       (XFixesSetSelectionOwnerNotifyMask
 31054                                        | XFixesSetSelectionOwnerNotifyMask
 31055                                        | XFixesSelectionClientCloseNotifyMask));
 31056         }
 31057 
 31058 #ifdef USE_XCB
 31059       selection_cookies = SAFE_ALLOCA (sizeof *selection_cookies
 31060                                        * num_fast_selections);
 31061 #endif
 31062 
 31063       /* Now, ask for the current owners of all those selections.  */
 31064       for (i = 0; i < num_fast_selections; ++i)
 31065         {
 31066 #ifdef USE_XCB
 31067           selection_cookies[i]
 31068             = xcb_get_selection_owner (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
 31069                                        dpyinfo->monitored_selections[i].name);
 31070 #else
 31071           dpyinfo->monitored_selections[i].owner
 31072             = XGetSelectionOwner (dpyinfo->display,
 31073                                   dpyinfo->monitored_selections[i].name);
 31074 #endif
 31075         }
 31076 
 31077 #ifdef USE_XCB
 31078       for (i = 0; i < num_fast_selections; ++i)
 31079         {
 31080           selection_reply
 31081             = xcb_get_selection_owner_reply (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
 31082                                              selection_cookies[i],
 31083                                              &selection_error);
 31084 
 31085           if (selection_reply)
 31086             {
 31087               dpyinfo->monitored_selections[i].owner
 31088                 = selection_reply->owner;
 31089               free (selection_reply);
 31090             }
 31091           else if (selection_error)
 31092             free (selection_error);
 31093         }
 31094 #endif
 31095     }
 31096 #endif
 31097 
 31098   unblock_input ();
 31099 
 31100 #if defined HAVE_XFIXES && defined USE_XCB
 31101   SAFE_FREE ();
 31102 #endif
 31103   return dpyinfo;
 31104 }
 31105 
 31106 
 31107 
 31108 /* Remove all the selection input events on the keyboard buffer
 31109    intended for DPYINFO.  */
 31110 
 31111 static void
 31112 x_delete_selection_requests (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 31113 {
 31114   union buffered_input_event *event;
 31115   int moved_events;
 31116 
 31117   for (event = kbd_fetch_ptr; event != kbd_store_ptr;
 31118        event = X_NEXT_KBD_EVENT (event))
 31119     {
 31120       if (event->kind == SELECTION_REQUEST_EVENT
 31121           || event->kind == SELECTION_CLEAR_EVENT)
 31122         {
 31123           if (SELECTION_EVENT_DPYINFO (&event->sie) != dpyinfo)
 31124             continue;
 31125 
 31126           /* Remove the event from the fifo buffer before processing;
 31127              otherwise swallow_events called recursively could see it
 31128              and process it again.  To do this, we move the events
 31129              between kbd_fetch_ptr and EVENT one slot to the right,
 31130              cyclically.  */
 31131 
 31132           if (event < kbd_fetch_ptr)
 31133             {
 31134               memmove (kbd_buffer + 1, kbd_buffer,
 31135                        (event - kbd_buffer) * sizeof *kbd_buffer);
 31136               kbd_buffer[0] = kbd_buffer[KBD_BUFFER_SIZE - 1];
 31137               moved_events = kbd_buffer + KBD_BUFFER_SIZE - 1 - kbd_fetch_ptr;
 31138             }
 31139           else
 31140             moved_events = event - kbd_fetch_ptr;
 31141 
 31142           memmove (kbd_fetch_ptr + 1, kbd_fetch_ptr,
 31143                    moved_events * sizeof *kbd_fetch_ptr);
 31144           kbd_fetch_ptr = X_NEXT_KBD_EVENT (kbd_fetch_ptr);
 31145 
 31146           /* `detect_input_pending' will then recompute whether or not
 31147              pending input events exist.  */
 31148           input_pending = false;
 31149         }
 31150     }
 31151 }
 31152 
 31153 /* Get rid of display DPYINFO, deleting all frames on it,
 31154    and without sending any more commands to the X server.  */
 31155 
 31156 static void
 31157 x_delete_display (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 31158 {
 31159   struct terminal *t;
 31160   struct color_name_cache_entry *color_entry, *next_color_entry;
 31161   int i;
 31162   struct x_selection_request_event *ie, *last, *temp;
 31163 
 31164   /* Close all frames and delete the generic struct terminal for this
 31165      X display.  */
 31166   for (t = terminal_list; t; t = t->next_terminal)
 31167     if (t->type == output_x_window && t->display_info.x == dpyinfo)
 31168       {
 31169 #ifdef HAVE_X_SM
 31170         /* Close X session management when we close its display.  */
 31171         if (t->id == 1 && x_session_have_connection ())
 31172           x_session_close ();
 31173 #endif
 31174         delete_terminal (t);
 31175         break;
 31176       }
 31177 
 31178   /* Find any pending selection requests for this display and unchain
 31179      them.  */
 31180 
 31181   last = NULL;
 31182 
 31183   for (ie = pending_selection_requests; ie; ie = ie->next)
 31184     {
 31185     again:
 31186 
 31187       if (SELECTION_EVENT_DPYINFO (&ie->se) == dpyinfo)
 31188         {
 31189           if (last)
 31190             last->next = ie->next;
 31191 
 31192           temp = ie;
 31193           ie = ie->next;
 31194           xfree (temp);
 31195 
 31196           goto again;
 31197         }
 31198 
 31199       last = ie;
 31200     }
 31201 
 31202   /* Delete selection requests bound for dpyinfo from the keyboard
 31203      buffer.  */
 31204   x_delete_selection_requests (dpyinfo);
 31205 
 31206   /* And remove any outstanding selection transfers.  */
 31207   x_remove_selection_transfers (dpyinfo);
 31208 
 31209   if (next_noop_dpyinfo == dpyinfo)
 31210     next_noop_dpyinfo = dpyinfo->next;
 31211 
 31212   if (mouse_click_timeout_display == dpyinfo)
 31213     mouse_click_timeout_display = NULL;
 31214 
 31215   if (x_display_list == dpyinfo)
 31216     x_display_list = dpyinfo->next;
 31217   else
 31218     {
 31219       struct x_display_info *tail;
 31220 
 31221       for (tail = x_display_list; tail; tail = tail->next)
 31222         if (tail->next == dpyinfo)
 31223           tail->next = tail->next->next;
 31224     }
 31225 
 31226   for (i = 0; i < dpyinfo->color_names_size; ++i)
 31227     {
 31228       for (color_entry = dpyinfo->color_names[i];
 31229            color_entry; color_entry = next_color_entry)
 31230         {
 31231           next_color_entry = color_entry->next;
 31232 
 31233           xfree (color_entry->name);
 31234           xfree (color_entry);
 31235         }
 31236     }
 31237 
 31238   if (dpyinfo->net_supported_atoms)
 31239     XFree (dpyinfo->net_supported_atoms);
 31240 
 31241   xfree (dpyinfo->color_names);
 31242   xfree (dpyinfo->color_names_length);
 31243   xfree (dpyinfo->x_id_name);
 31244   xfree (dpyinfo->x_dnd_atoms);
 31245   xfree (dpyinfo->color_cells);
 31246 #ifdef HAVE_XFIXES
 31247   if (dpyinfo->monitored_selections)
 31248     xfree (dpyinfo->monitored_selections);
 31249 #endif
 31250 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 31251   xfree (dpyinfo->protected_windows);
 31252 #endif
 31253 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 31254   if (dpyinfo->supports_xi2)
 31255     x_free_xi_devices (dpyinfo);
 31256 #endif
 31257   xfree (dpyinfo);
 31258 }
 31259 
 31260 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 31261 
 31262 /* Atimer callback function for TIMER.  Called every 0.1s to process
 31263    Xt timeouts, if needed.  We must avoid calling XtAppPending as
 31264    much as possible because that function does an implicit XFlush
 31265    that slows us down.  */
 31266 
 31267 static void
 31268 x_process_timeouts (struct atimer *timer)
 31269 {
 31270   block_input ();
 31271   x_timeout_atimer_activated_flag = false;
 31272   if (toolkit_scroll_bar_interaction || popup_activated ())
 31273     {
 31274       while (XtAppPending (Xt_app_con) & XtIMTimer)
 31275         XtAppProcessEvent (Xt_app_con, XtIMTimer);
 31276       /* Reactivate the atimer for next time.  */
 31277       x_activate_timeout_atimer ();
 31278     }
 31279   unblock_input ();
 31280 }
 31281 
 31282 /* Install an asynchronous timer that processes Xt timeout events
 31283    every 0.1s as long as either `toolkit_scroll_bar_interaction' or
 31284    `popup_activated_flag' (in xmenu.c) is set.  Make sure to call this
 31285    function whenever these variables are set.  This is necessary
 31286    because some widget sets use timeouts internally, for example the
 31287    LessTif menu bar, or the Xaw3d scroll bar.  When Xt timeouts aren't
 31288    processed, these widgets don't behave normally.  */
 31289 
 31290 void
 31291 x_activate_timeout_atimer (void)
 31292 {
 31293   block_input ();
 31294   if (!x_timeout_atimer_activated_flag)
 31295     {
 31296       struct timespec interval = make_timespec (0, 100 * 1000 * 1000);
 31297       start_atimer (ATIMER_RELATIVE, interval, x_process_timeouts, 0);
 31298       x_timeout_atimer_activated_flag = true;
 31299     }
 31300   unblock_input ();
 31301 }
 31302 
 31303 #endif /* USE_X_TOOLKIT */
 31304 
 31305 
 31306 /* Set up use of X before we make the first connection.  */
 31307 
 31308 extern frame_parm_handler x_frame_parm_handlers[];
 31309 
 31310 static struct redisplay_interface x_redisplay_interface =
 31311   {
 31312     x_frame_parm_handlers,
 31313     gui_produce_glyphs,
 31314     gui_write_glyphs,
 31315     gui_insert_glyphs,
 31316     gui_clear_end_of_line,
 31317     x_scroll_run,
 31318     x_after_update_window_line,
 31319     NULL, /* update_window_begin */
 31320     NULL, /* update_window_end   */
 31321     x_flip_and_flush,
 31322     gui_clear_window_mouse_face,
 31323     gui_get_glyph_overhangs,
 31324     gui_fix_overlapping_area,
 31325     x_draw_fringe_bitmap,
 31326 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
 31327     x_cr_define_fringe_bitmap,
 31328     x_cr_destroy_fringe_bitmap,
 31329 #else
 31330     0, /* define_fringe_bitmap */
 31331     0, /* destroy_fringe_bitmap */
 31332 #endif
 31333     x_compute_glyph_string_overhangs,
 31334     x_draw_glyph_string,
 31335     x_define_frame_cursor,
 31336     x_clear_frame_area,
 31337     x_clear_under_internal_border,
 31338     x_draw_window_cursor,
 31339     x_draw_vertical_window_border,
 31340     x_draw_window_divider,
 31341     x_shift_glyphs_for_insert, /* Never called; see comment in function.  */
 31342     x_show_hourglass,
 31343     x_hide_hourglass,
 31344     x_default_font_parameter
 31345   };
 31346 
 31347 
 31348 /* This function is called when the last frame on a display is deleted. */
 31349 void
 31350 x_delete_terminal (struct terminal *terminal)
 31351 {
 31352   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 31353   struct frame *f;
 31354   Lisp_Object tail, frame;
 31355 
 31356   dpyinfo = terminal->display_info.x;
 31357 
 31358   /* Protect against recursive calls.  delete_frame in
 31359      delete_terminal calls us back when it deletes our last frame.  */
 31360   if (!terminal->name)
 31361     return;
 31362 
 31363   block_input ();
 31364 
 31365   /* Delete all remaining frames on the display that is going away.
 31366      Otherwise, font backends assume the display is still up, and
 31367      xftfont_end_for_frame crashes.  */
 31368   FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 31369     {
 31370       f = XFRAME (frame);
 31371 
 31372       if (FRAME_LIVE_P (f) && f->terminal == terminal)
 31373         /* Pass Qnoelisp rather than Qt.  */
 31374         delete_frame (frame, Qnoelisp);
 31375     }
 31376 
 31377 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 31378   /* We must close our connection to the XIM server before closing the
 31379      X display.  */
 31380   xim_close_dpy (dpyinfo);
 31381 #endif
 31382 
 31383   /* Destroy all bitmap images created on the display.  */
 31384   image_destroy_all_bitmaps (dpyinfo);
 31385 
 31386   /* Free the storage allocated to hold bitmap records.  */
 31387   xfree (dpyinfo->bitmaps);
 31388 
 31389   /* In case someone decides to use `bitmaps' again... */
 31390   dpyinfo->bitmaps = NULL;
 31391   dpyinfo->bitmaps_last = 0;
 31392 
 31393   /* Normally, the display is available...  */
 31394   if (dpyinfo->display)
 31395     {
 31396       XSetCloseDownMode (dpyinfo->display, DestroyAll);
 31397 
 31398       /* Delete the scratch cursor GC, should it exist.  */
 31399       if (dpyinfo->scratch_cursor_gc)
 31400         XFreeGC (dpyinfo->display, dpyinfo->scratch_cursor_gc);
 31401 
 31402       /* Get rid of any drag-and-drop operation that might be in
 31403          progress as well.  */
 31404       if ((x_dnd_in_progress || x_dnd_waiting_for_finish)
 31405           && dpyinfo->display == (x_dnd_waiting_for_finish
 31406                                   ? x_dnd_finish_display
 31407                                   : FRAME_X_DISPLAY (x_dnd_frame)))
 31408         {
 31409           x_dnd_last_seen_window = None;
 31410           x_dnd_last_seen_toplevel = None;
 31411           x_dnd_in_progress = false;
 31412           x_dnd_waiting_for_finish = false;
 31413 
 31414           /* The display is going away, so there's no point in
 31415              de-selecting for input on the DND toplevels.  */
 31416           if (x_dnd_use_toplevels)
 31417             x_dnd_free_toplevels (false);
 31418 
 31419           x_dnd_return_frame_object = NULL;
 31420           x_dnd_movement_frame = NULL;
 31421           x_dnd_wheel_frame = NULL;
 31422           x_dnd_frame = NULL;
 31423         }
 31424 
 31425       /* Whether or not XCloseDisplay destroys the associated resource
 31426          database depends on the version of libX11.  To avoid both
 31427          crash and memory leak, we dissociate the database from the
 31428          display and then destroy dpyinfo->rdb ourselves.
 31429 
 31430          Unfortunately, the above strategy does not work in some
 31431          situations due to a bug in newer versions of libX11: because
 31432          XrmSetDatabase doesn't clear the flag XlibDisplayDfltRMDB if
 31433          dpy->db is NULL, XCloseDisplay destroys the associated
 31434          database whereas it has not been created by XGetDefault
 31435          (Bug#21974 in freedesktop.org Bugzilla).  As a workaround, we
 31436          don't destroy the database here in order to avoid the crash
 31437          in the above situations for now, though that may cause memory
 31438          leaks in other situations.  */
 31439 #if false
 31440 #ifdef HAVE_XRMSETDATABASE
 31441       XrmSetDatabase (dpyinfo->display, NULL);
 31442 #else
 31443       dpyinfo->display->db = NULL;
 31444 #endif
 31445       /* We used to call XrmDestroyDatabase from x_delete_display, but
 31446          some older versions of libX11 crash if we call it after
 31447          closing all the displays.  */
 31448       XrmDestroyDatabase (dpyinfo->rdb);
 31449 #endif
 31450 #ifdef USE_GTK
 31451       xg_display_close (dpyinfo->display);
 31452 #else
 31453 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 31454       XtCloseDisplay (dpyinfo->display);
 31455 #else
 31456       XCloseDisplay (dpyinfo->display);
 31457 #endif
 31458 #endif /* ! USE_GTK */
 31459       /* Do not close the connection here because it's already closed
 31460          by X(t)CloseDisplay (Bug#18403).  */
 31461       dpyinfo->display = NULL;
 31462     }
 31463 
 31464   /* ...but if called from x_connection_closed, the display may already
 31465      be closed and dpyinfo->display was set to 0 to indicate that.  Since
 31466      X server is most likely gone, explicit close is the only reliable
 31467      way to continue and avoid Bug#19147.  */
 31468   else if (dpyinfo->connection >= 0)
 31469     emacs_close (dpyinfo->connection);
 31470 
 31471   /* Free the keyboard and modifier maps here; that is safe to do
 31472      without a display, and not doing so leads to a lot of data being
 31473      leaked upon IO error.  */
 31474 
 31475 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 31476   if (dpyinfo->xkb_desc)
 31477     XkbFreeKeyboard (dpyinfo->xkb_desc, XkbAllComponentsMask, True);
 31478 #endif
 31479 
 31480   if (dpyinfo->modmap)
 31481     XFreeModifiermap (dpyinfo->modmap);
 31482 
 31483   /* No more input on this descriptor.  */
 31484   delete_keyboard_wait_descriptor (dpyinfo->connection);
 31485   /* Mark as dead. */
 31486   dpyinfo->connection = -1;
 31487 
 31488   x_delete_display (dpyinfo);
 31489   unblock_input ();
 31490 }
 31491 
 31492 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 31493 static bool
 31494 x_have_any_grab (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 31495 {
 31496   int i;
 31497 
 31498   if (!dpyinfo->supports_xi2)
 31499     return false;
 31500 
 31501   for (i = 0; i < dpyinfo->num_devices; ++i)
 31502     {
 31503       if (dpyinfo->devices[i].grab)
 31504         return true;
 31505     }
 31506 
 31507   return false;
 31508 }
 31509 #endif
 31510 
 31511 /* Create a struct terminal, initialize it with the X11 specific
 31512    functions and make DISPLAY->TERMINAL point to it.  */
 31513 
 31514 static struct terminal *
 31515 x_create_terminal (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 31516 {
 31517   struct terminal *terminal;
 31518 
 31519   terminal = create_terminal (output_x_window, &x_redisplay_interface);
 31520 
 31521   terminal->display_info.x = dpyinfo;
 31522   dpyinfo->terminal = terminal;
 31523 
 31524   /* kboard is initialized in x_term_init. */
 31525 
 31526   terminal->clear_frame_hook = x_clear_frame;
 31527   terminal->ins_del_lines_hook = x_ins_del_lines;
 31528   terminal->delete_glyphs_hook = x_delete_glyphs;
 31529   terminal->ring_bell_hook = XTring_bell;
 31530   terminal->toggle_invisible_pointer_hook = XTtoggle_invisible_pointer;
 31531   terminal->update_begin_hook = x_update_begin;
 31532   terminal->update_end_hook = x_update_end;
 31533   terminal->read_socket_hook = XTread_socket;
 31534   terminal->frame_up_to_date_hook = XTframe_up_to_date;
 31535 #ifdef HAVE_XDBE
 31536   terminal->buffer_flipping_unblocked_hook = XTbuffer_flipping_unblocked_hook;
 31537 #endif
 31538   terminal->defined_color_hook = x_defined_color;
 31539   terminal->query_frame_background_color = x_query_frame_background_color;
 31540   terminal->query_colors = x_query_colors;
 31541   terminal->mouse_position_hook = XTmouse_position;
 31542   terminal->get_focus_frame = x_get_focus_frame;
 31543   terminal->focus_frame_hook = x_focus_frame;
 31544   terminal->frame_rehighlight_hook = XTframe_rehighlight;
 31545   terminal->frame_raise_lower_hook = XTframe_raise_lower;
 31546   terminal->frame_visible_invisible_hook = x_make_frame_visible_invisible;
 31547   terminal->fullscreen_hook = XTfullscreen_hook;
 31548   terminal->iconify_frame_hook = x_iconify_frame;
 31549   terminal->set_window_size_hook = x_set_window_size;
 31550   terminal->set_frame_offset_hook = x_set_offset;
 31551   terminal->set_frame_alpha_hook = x_set_frame_alpha;
 31552   terminal->set_new_font_hook = x_new_font;
 31553   terminal->set_bitmap_icon_hook = x_bitmap_icon;
 31554   terminal->implicit_set_name_hook = x_implicitly_set_name;
 31555   terminal->menu_show_hook = x_menu_show;
 31556 #ifdef HAVE_EXT_MENU_BAR
 31557   terminal->activate_menubar_hook = x_activate_menubar;
 31558 #endif
 31559 #if defined (USE_X_TOOLKIT) || defined (USE_GTK)
 31560   terminal->popup_dialog_hook = xw_popup_dialog;
 31561 #endif
 31562   terminal->change_tab_bar_height_hook = x_change_tab_bar_height;
 31563 #ifndef HAVE_EXT_TOOL_BAR
 31564   terminal->change_tool_bar_height_hook = x_change_tool_bar_height;
 31565 #endif
 31566   terminal->set_vertical_scroll_bar_hook = XTset_vertical_scroll_bar;
 31567   terminal->set_horizontal_scroll_bar_hook = XTset_horizontal_scroll_bar;
 31568   terminal->set_scroll_bar_default_width_hook = x_set_scroll_bar_default_width;
 31569   terminal->set_scroll_bar_default_height_hook = x_set_scroll_bar_default_height;
 31570   terminal->condemn_scroll_bars_hook = XTcondemn_scroll_bars;
 31571   terminal->redeem_scroll_bar_hook = XTredeem_scroll_bar;
 31572   terminal->judge_scroll_bars_hook = XTjudge_scroll_bars;
 31573   terminal->get_string_resource_hook = x_get_string_resource;
 31574   terminal->free_pixmap = x_free_pixmap;
 31575   terminal->delete_frame_hook = x_destroy_window;
 31576   terminal->delete_terminal_hook = x_delete_terminal;
 31577   terminal->toolkit_position_hook = x_toolkit_position;
 31578 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 31579   terminal->any_grab_hook = x_have_any_grab;
 31580 #endif
 31581   /* Other hooks are NULL by default.  */
 31582 
 31583   return terminal;
 31584 }
 31585 
 31586 static void
 31587 x_initialize (void)
 31588 {
 31589   baud_rate = 19200;
 31590 
 31591   x_noop_count = 0;
 31592   any_help_event_p = false;
 31593   ignore_next_mouse_click_timeout = 0;
 31594   mouse_click_timeout_display = NULL;
 31595 
 31596 #ifdef USE_GTK
 31597   current_count = -1;
 31598 #endif
 31599 
 31600   /* Try to use interrupt input; if we can't, then start polling.  */
 31601   Fset_input_interrupt_mode (Qt);
 31602 
 31603 #if THREADS_ENABLED
 31604   /* This must be called before any other Xlib routines.  */
 31605   if (XInitThreads () == 0)
 31606     fputs ("Warning: An error occurred initializing X11 thread support!\n",
 31607            stderr);
 31608 #endif
 31609 
 31610 #ifdef USE_X_TOOLKIT
 31611   XtToolkitInitialize ();
 31612 
 31613   Xt_app_con = XtCreateApplicationContext ();
 31614 
 31615   /* Register a converter from strings to pixels, which uses
 31616      Emacs' color allocation infrastructure.  */
 31617   XtAppSetTypeConverter (Xt_app_con,
 31618                          XtRString, XtRPixel, cvt_string_to_pixel,
 31619                          cvt_string_to_pixel_args,
 31620                          XtNumber (cvt_string_to_pixel_args),
 31621                          XtCacheByDisplay, cvt_pixel_dtor);
 31622 
 31623   XtAppSetFallbackResources (Xt_app_con, Xt_default_resources);
 31624 #endif
 31625 
 31626 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 31627 #ifndef USE_GTK
 31628   xaw3d_arrow_scroll = False;
 31629   xaw3d_pick_top = True;
 31630 #endif
 31631 #endif
 31632 
 31633 #ifdef USE_CAIRO
 31634   gui_init_fringe (&x_redisplay_interface);
 31635 #endif
 31636 
 31637   /* Note that there is no real way portable across R3/R4 to get the
 31638      original error handler.  */
 31639   XSetErrorHandler (x_error_handler);
 31640   XSetIOErrorHandler (x_io_error_quitter);
 31641 }
 31642 
 31643 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 31644 
 31645 /* Notice that a change has occured on F that requires its input
 31646    method state to be reset.  */
 31647 
 31648 static void
 31649 x_reset_conversion (struct frame *f)
 31650 {
 31651   char *string;
 31652 
 31653   if (FRAME_XIC (f))
 31654     {
 31655       string = XmbResetIC (FRAME_XIC (f));
 31656 
 31657       /* string is actually any string that was being composed at the
 31658          time of the reset.  */
 31659 
 31660       if (string)
 31661         XFree (string);
 31662     }
 31663 }
 31664 
 31665 /* Interface used to control input method ``text conversion''.  */
 31666 
 31667 static struct textconv_interface text_conversion_interface =
 31668   {
 31669     x_reset_conversion,
 31670   };
 31671 
 31672 #endif
 31673 
 31674 void
 31675 init_xterm (void)
 31676 {
 31677 #ifndef HAVE_XINPUT2
 31678   /* Emacs can handle only core input events when built without XI2
 31679      support, so make sure Gtk doesn't use Xinput or Xinput2
 31680      extensions.  */
 31681 #ifndef HAVE_GTK3
 31682   xputenv ("GDK_CORE_DEVICE_EVENTS=1");
 31683 #else
 31684   gdk_disable_multidevice ();
 31685 #endif
 31686 #endif
 31687 
 31688 #ifdef HAVE_X_I18N
 31689   register_textconv_interface (&text_conversion_interface);
 31690 #endif
 31691 }
 31692 
 31693 void
 31694 mark_xterm (void)
 31695 {
 31696   Lisp_Object val;
 31697 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2 || defined USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS \
 31698   || defined HAVE_XRANDR || defined USE_GTK || defined HAVE_X_I18N
 31699   struct x_display_info *dpyinfo;
 31700 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2 || defined USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 31701   int i;
 31702 #endif
 31703 #endif
 31704 
 31705   if (x_dnd_return_frame_object)
 31706     {
 31707       XSETFRAME (val, x_dnd_return_frame_object);
 31708       mark_object (val);
 31709     }
 31710 
 31711   if (x_dnd_movement_frame)
 31712     {
 31713       XSETFRAME (val, x_dnd_movement_frame);
 31714       mark_object (val);
 31715     }
 31716 
 31717   if (x_dnd_wheel_frame)
 31718     {
 31719       XSETFRAME (val, x_dnd_wheel_frame);
 31720       mark_object (val);
 31721     }
 31722 
 31723 #if defined HAVE_XINPUT2 || defined USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS \
 31724   || defined HAVE_XRANDR || defined USE_GTK || defined HAVE_X_I18N
 31725   for (dpyinfo = x_display_list; dpyinfo; dpyinfo = dpyinfo->next)
 31726     {
 31727 #ifdef HAVE_XINPUT2
 31728       for (i = 0; i < dpyinfo->num_devices; ++i)
 31729         mark_object (dpyinfo->devices[i].name);
 31730 #endif
 31731 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 31732       for (i = 0; i < dpyinfo->n_protected_windows; ++i)
 31733         mark_object (dpyinfo->protected_windows[i]);
 31734 #endif
 31735 #if defined HAVE_XRANDR || defined USE_GTK
 31736       mark_object (dpyinfo->last_monitor_attributes_list);
 31737 #endif
 31738 #if defined HAVE_X_I18N
 31739       mark_object (dpyinfo->xim_coding);
 31740 #endif
 31741     }
 31742 #endif
 31743 }
 31744 
 31745 /* Error handling functions for Lisp functions that expose X protocol
 31746    requests.  They are mostly like `x_catch_errors' and friends, but
 31747    respect `x-fast-protocol-requests'.  */
 31748 
 31749 void
 31750 x_catch_errors_for_lisp (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 31751 {
 31752   if (!x_fast_protocol_requests)
 31753     x_catch_errors (dpyinfo->display);
 31754   else
 31755     x_ignore_errors_for_next_request (dpyinfo, 0);
 31756 }
 31757 
 31758 void
 31759 x_check_errors_for_lisp (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo,
 31760                          const char *format)
 31761 {
 31762   if (!x_fast_protocol_requests)
 31763     x_check_errors (dpyinfo->display, format);
 31764 }
 31765 
 31766 void
 31767 x_uncatch_errors_for_lisp (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 31768 {
 31769   if (!x_fast_protocol_requests)
 31770     x_uncatch_errors ();
 31771   else
 31772     x_stop_ignoring_errors (dpyinfo);
 31773 }
 31774 
 31775 /* Preserve the selections in LOST in another frame on DPYINFO.  LOST
 31776    is a list of local selections that were lost, due to their frame
 31777    being deleted.  */
 31778 
 31779 void
 31780 x_preserve_selections (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo, Lisp_Object lost,
 31781                        Lisp_Object current_owner)
 31782 {
 31783   Lisp_Object tail, frame, new_owner;
 31784   Time timestamp;
 31785   Window *owners;
 31786   Atom *names;
 31787   ptrdiff_t nowners, counter;
 31788   struct selection_input_event clear;
 31789 #ifdef USE_XCB
 31790   xcb_get_selection_owner_cookie_t *cookies;
 31791   xcb_generic_error_t *error;
 31792   xcb_get_selection_owner_reply_t *reply;
 31793 #endif
 31794 
 31795   new_owner = Qnil;
 31796 
 31797   FOR_EACH_FRAME (tail, frame)
 31798     {
 31799       if (FRAME_X_P (XFRAME (frame))
 31800           && !EQ (frame, current_owner)
 31801           && FRAME_DISPLAY_INFO (XFRAME (frame)) == dpyinfo)
 31802         {
 31803           new_owner = frame;
 31804           break;
 31805         }
 31806     }
 31807 
 31808   tail = lost;
 31809   nowners = 0;
 31810 
 31811   FOR_EACH_TAIL_SAFE (tail)
 31812     {
 31813       Lisp_Object tem = XCAR (tail);
 31814       ++nowners;
 31815 
 31816       /* The selection is really lost (since we cannot find a new
 31817          owner), so run the appropriate hooks.  */
 31818       if (NILP (new_owner))
 31819         CALLN (Frun_hook_with_args, Qx_lost_selection_functions,
 31820                XCAR (tem));
 31821       else
 31822         {
 31823           CONS_TO_INTEGER (XCAR (XCDR (XCDR (tem))), Time, timestamp);
 31824 
 31825           /* This shouldn't be able to signal any errors, despite the
 31826              call to `x_check_errors' inside.  */
 31827           x_own_selection (XCAR (tem), XCAR (XCDR (tem)),
 31828                            new_owner, XCAR (XCDR (XCDR (XCDR (XCDR (tem))))),
 31829                            timestamp);
 31830         }
 31831     }
 31832 
 31833   if (!NILP (new_owner))
 31834     {
 31835       owners = alloca (sizeof *owners * nowners);
 31836       names = alloca (sizeof *names * nowners);
 31837 #ifdef USE_XCB
 31838       cookies = alloca (sizeof *cookies * nowners);
 31839 #endif
 31840 
 31841       tail = lost;
 31842       nowners = 0;
 31843       counter = 0;
 31844 
 31845       FOR_EACH_TAIL_SAFE (tail)
 31846         {
 31847           Lisp_Object tem = XCAR (tail);
 31848 
 31849           /* Now check if we still don't own that selection, which can
 31850              happen if another program set itself as the owner.  */
 31851           names[counter++] = symbol_to_x_atom (dpyinfo, XCAR (tem));
 31852 
 31853 #ifndef USE_XCB
 31854           owners[nowners++] = XGetSelectionOwner (dpyinfo->display,
 31855                                                   names[counter - 1]);
 31856 #else
 31857           cookies[nowners++]
 31858             = xcb_get_selection_owner (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
 31859                                        names[counter - 1]);
 31860         }
 31861 
 31862       nowners = 0;
 31863       tail = lost;
 31864 
 31865       FOR_EACH_TAIL_SAFE (tail)
 31866         {
 31867           Lisp_Object tem = XCAR (tail);
 31868 
 31869           reply = xcb_get_selection_owner_reply (dpyinfo->xcb_connection,
 31870                                                  cookies[nowners++], &error);
 31871           if (reply)
 31872             owners[nowners - 1] = reply->owner;
 31873           else
 31874             owners[nowners - 1] = None;
 31875 
 31876           free (reply ? (void *) reply : (void *) error);
 31877 #endif
 31878 
 31879           if (owners[nowners - 1] != FRAME_X_WINDOW (XFRAME (new_owner)))
 31880             {
 31881               /* Clear the local selection, since we know we don't own
 31882                  it any longer.  */
 31883               CONS_TO_INTEGER (XCAR (XCDR (XCDR (tem))), Time, timestamp);
 31884 
 31885               clear.kind = SELECTION_CLEAR_EVENT;
 31886 
 31887               SELECTION_EVENT_DPYINFO (&clear) = dpyinfo;
 31888               SELECTION_EVENT_SELECTION (&clear) = names[nowners - 1];
 31889               SELECTION_EVENT_TIME (&clear) = timestamp;
 31890 
 31891               x_handle_selection_event (&clear);
 31892             }
 31893         }
 31894 
 31895       tail = lost;
 31896       nowners = 0;
 31897 
 31898       FOR_EACH_TAIL_SAFE (tail)
 31899         {
 31900           Lisp_Object tem = XCAR (tail);
 31901 
 31902           /* If the selection isn't owned by us anymore, note that the
 31903              selection was lost.  */
 31904           if (owners[nowners++] != FRAME_X_WINDOW (XFRAME (new_owner)))
 31905             CALLN (Frun_hook_with_args, Qx_lost_selection_functions,
 31906                    XCAR (tem));
 31907         }
 31908     }
 31909 }
 31910 
 31911 /* Return a list of the keyboard modifier masks in DPYINFO.
 31912 
 31913    Value is a list of (HYPER SUPER ALT SHIFT-LOCK META), each element
 31914    being the appropriate modifier mask.  */
 31915 
 31916 Lisp_Object
 31917 x_get_keyboard_modifiers (struct x_display_info *dpyinfo)
 31918 {
 31919   /* This sometimes happens when the function is called during display
 31920      initialization, which can happen while obtaining vendor specific
 31921      keysyms.  */
 31922 
 31923 #ifdef HAVE_XKB
 31924   if (!dpyinfo->xkb_desc && !dpyinfo->modmap)
 31925     x_find_modifier_meanings (dpyinfo);
 31926 #else
 31927   if (!dpyinfo->modmap)
 31928     x_find_modifier_meanings (dpyinfo);
 31929 #endif
 31930 
 31931   return list5 (make_uint (dpyinfo->hyper_mod_mask),
 31932                 make_uint (dpyinfo->super_mod_mask),
 31933                 make_uint (dpyinfo->alt_mod_mask),
 31934                 make_uint (dpyinfo->shift_lock_mask),
 31935                 make_uint (dpyinfo->meta_mod_mask));
 31936 }
 31937 
 31938 void
 31939 syms_of_xterm (void)
 31940 {
 31941   x_error_message = NULL;
 31942   PDUMPER_IGNORE (x_error_message);
 31943 
 31944   x_dnd_monitors = Qnil;
 31945   staticpro (&x_dnd_monitors);
 31946 
 31947   x_dnd_action_symbol = Qnil;
 31948   staticpro (&x_dnd_action_symbol);
 31949 
 31950   x_dnd_selection_alias_cell = Fcons (Qnil, Qnil);
 31951   staticpro (&x_dnd_selection_alias_cell);
 31952 
 31953   x_dnd_unsupported_drop_data = Qnil;
 31954   staticpro (&x_dnd_unsupported_drop_data);
 31955 
 31956   /* Used by x_cr_export_frames.  */
 31957   DEFSYM (Qconcat, "concat");
 31958 
 31959   DEFSYM (Qvendor_specific_keysyms, "vendor-specific-keysyms");
 31960   DEFSYM (Qlatin_1, "latin-1");
 31961   DEFSYM (Qnow, "now");
 31962   DEFSYM (Qx_dnd_targets_list, "x-dnd-targets-list");
 31963   DEFSYM (Qx_auto_preserve_selections, "x-auto-preserve-selections");
 31964   DEFSYM (Qexpose, "expose");
