 31965   DEFSYM (Qdont_save, "dont-save");
 31966 
 31967 #ifdef USE_GTK
 31968   xg_default_icon_file = build_pure_c_string ("icons/hicolor/scalable/apps/emacs.svg");
 31969   staticpro (&xg_default_icon_file);
 31970 
 31971   DEFSYM (Qx_gtk_map_stock, "x-gtk-map-stock");
 31972 #endif
 31973 
 31974   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-use-underline-position-properties",
 31975                x_use_underline_position_properties,
 31976      doc: /* Non-nil means make use of UNDERLINE_POSITION font properties.
 31977 A value of nil means ignore them.  If you encounter fonts with bogus
 31978 UNDERLINE_POSITION font properties, set this to nil.  You can also use
 31979 `underline-minimum-offset' to override the font's UNDERLINE_POSITION for
 31980 small font display sizes.  */);
 31981   x_use_underline_position_properties = true;
 31982   DEFSYM (Qx_use_underline_position_properties,
 31983           "x-use-underline-position-properties");
 31984 
 31985   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-underline-at-descent-line",
 31986                x_underline_at_descent_line,
 31987      doc: /* Non-nil means to draw the underline at the same place as the descent line.
 31988 (If `line-spacing' is in effect, that moves the underline lower by
 31989 that many pixels.)
 31990 A value of nil means to draw the underline according to the value of the
 31991 variable `x-use-underline-position-properties', which is usually at the
 31992 baseline level.  The default value is nil.  */);
 31993   x_underline_at_descent_line = false;
 31994   DEFSYM (Qx_underline_at_descent_line, "x-underline-at-descent-line");
 31995 
 31996   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-mouse-click-focus-ignore-position",
 31997                x_mouse_click_focus_ignore_position,
 31998     doc: /* Non-nil means that a mouse click to focus a frame does not move point.
 31999 This variable is used only when the window manager requires that you
 32000 click on a frame to select it (give it focus).  In that case, a value
 32001 of nil, means that the selected window and cursor position changes to
 32002 reflect the mouse click position, while a non-nil value means that the
 32003 selected window or cursor position is preserved.
 32004 
 32005 This option works by ignoring button press events for a given amount
 32006 of time after a frame might've been focused.  If it does not work for
 32007 you, try increasing the value of
 32008 `x-mouse-click-focus-ignore-time'.  */);
 32009   x_mouse_click_focus_ignore_position = false;
 32010 
 32011   DEFVAR_INT ("x-mouse-click-focus-ignore-time", x_mouse_click_focus_ignore_time,
 32012     doc: /* Number of milliseconds for which to ignore buttons after focus change.
 32013 This variable only takes effect if
 32014 `x-mouse-click-focus-ignore-position' is non-nil, and should be
 32015 adjusted if the default value does not work for whatever reason.  */);
 32016   x_mouse_click_focus_ignore_time = 200;
 32017 
 32018   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-toolkit-scroll-bars", Vx_toolkit_scroll_bars,
 32019     doc: /* Which toolkit scroll bars Emacs uses, if any.
 32020 A value of nil means Emacs doesn't use toolkit scroll bars.
 32021 With the X Window system, the value is a symbol describing the
 32022 X toolkit.  Possible values are: gtk, motif, xaw, or xaw3d.
 32023 With MS Windows, Haiku windowing or Nextstep, the value is t.
 32024 With Android, the value is nil, but that is because Emacs on
 32025 Android does not support scroll bars at all.  */);
 32026 #ifdef USE_TOOLKIT_SCROLL_BARS
 32027 #ifdef USE_MOTIF
 32028   Vx_toolkit_scroll_bars = intern_c_string ("motif");
 32029 #elif defined HAVE_XAW3D
 32030   Vx_toolkit_scroll_bars = intern_c_string ("xaw3d");
 32031 #elif USE_GTK
 32032   Vx_toolkit_scroll_bars = intern_c_string ("gtk");
 32033 #else
 32034   Vx_toolkit_scroll_bars = intern_c_string ("xaw");
 32035 #endif
 32036 #else
 32037   Vx_toolkit_scroll_bars = Qnil;
 32038 #endif
 32039 
 32040   DEFSYM (Qmodifier_value, "modifier-value");
 32041   DEFSYM (Qctrl, "ctrl");
 32042   Fput (Qctrl, Qmodifier_value, make_fixnum (ctrl_modifier));
 32043   DEFSYM (Qalt, "alt");
 32044   Fput (Qalt, Qmodifier_value, make_fixnum (alt_modifier));
 32045   DEFSYM (Qhyper, "hyper");
 32046   Fput (Qhyper, Qmodifier_value, make_fixnum (hyper_modifier));
 32047   DEFSYM (Qmeta, "meta");
 32048   Fput (Qmeta, Qmodifier_value, make_fixnum (meta_modifier));
 32049   DEFSYM (Qsuper, "super");
 32050   Fput (Qsuper, Qmodifier_value, make_fixnum (super_modifier));
 32051   DEFSYM (QXdndSelection, "XdndSelection");
 32052   DEFSYM (Qx_selection_alias_alist, "x-selection-alias-alist");
 32053   DEFSYM (Qimitate_pager, "imitate-pager");
 32054   DEFSYM (Qnewer_time, "newer-time");
 32055   DEFSYM (Qraise_and_focus, "raise-and-focus");
 32056   DEFSYM (Qreally_fast, "really-fast");
 32057 
 32058   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-ctrl-keysym", Vx_ctrl_keysym,
 32059     doc: /* Which keys Emacs uses for the ctrl modifier.
 32060 This should be one of the symbols `ctrl', `alt', `hyper', `meta',
 32061 `super'.  For example, `ctrl' means use the Ctrl_L and Ctrl_R keysyms.
 32062 The default is nil, which is the same as `ctrl'.  */);
 32063   Vx_ctrl_keysym = Qnil;
 32064 
 32065   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-alt-keysym", Vx_alt_keysym,
 32066     doc: /* Which keys Emacs uses for the alt modifier.
 32067 This should be one of the symbols `ctrl', `alt', `hyper', `meta',
 32068 `super'.  For example, `alt' means use the Alt_L and Alt_R keysyms.
 32069 The default is nil, which is the same as `alt'.  */);
 32070   Vx_alt_keysym = Qnil;
 32071 
 32072   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-hyper-keysym", Vx_hyper_keysym,
 32073     doc: /* Which keys Emacs uses for the hyper modifier.
 32074 This should be one of the symbols `ctrl', `alt', `hyper', `meta',
 32075 `super'.  For example, `hyper' means use the Hyper_L and Hyper_R
 32076 keysyms.  The default is nil, which is the same as `hyper'.  */);
 32077   Vx_hyper_keysym = Qnil;
 32078 
 32079   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-meta-keysym", Vx_meta_keysym,
 32080     doc: /* Which keys Emacs uses for the meta modifier.
 32081 This should be one of the symbols `ctrl', `alt', `hyper', `meta',
 32082 `super'.  For example, `meta' means use the Meta_L and Meta_R keysyms.
 32083 The default is nil, which is the same as `meta'.  */);
 32084   Vx_meta_keysym = Qnil;
 32085 
 32086   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-super-keysym", Vx_super_keysym,
 32087     doc: /* Which keys Emacs uses for the super modifier.
 32088 This should be one of the symbols `ctrl', `alt', `hyper', `meta',
 32089 `super'.  For example, `super' means use the Super_L and Super_R
 32090 keysyms.  The default is nil, which is the same as `super'.  */);
 32091   Vx_super_keysym = Qnil;
 32092 
 32093   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-wait-for-event-timeout", Vx_wait_for_event_timeout,
 32094     doc: /* How long to wait for X events.
 32095 
 32096 Emacs will wait up to this many seconds to receive X events after
 32097 making changes which affect the state of the graphical interface.
 32098 Under some window managers this can take an indefinite amount of time,
 32099 so it is important to limit the wait.
 32100 
 32101 If set to a non-float value, there will be no wait at all.  */);
 32102   Vx_wait_for_event_timeout = make_float (0.1);
 32103 
 32104   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-keysym-table", Vx_keysym_table,
 32105     doc: /* Hash table of character codes indexed by X keysym codes.  */);
 32106   Vx_keysym_table = make_hash_table (hashtest_eql, 900,
 32107                                      DEFAULT_REHASH_SIZE,
 32108                                      DEFAULT_REHASH_THRESHOLD,
 32109                                      Qnil, false);
 32110 
 32111   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-frame-normalize-before-maximize",
 32112                x_frame_normalize_before_maximize,
 32113     doc: /* Non-nil means normalize frame before maximizing.
 32114 If this variable is t, Emacs first asks the window manager to give the
 32115 frame its normal size, and only then the final state, whenever changing
 32116 from a full-height, full-width or full-both state to the maximized one
 32117 or when changing from the maximized to the full-height or full-width
 32118 state.
 32119 
 32120 Set this variable only if your window manager cannot handle the
 32121 transition between the various maximization states.  */);
 32122   x_frame_normalize_before_maximize = false;
 32123 
 32124   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-gtk-use-window-move", x_gtk_use_window_move,
 32125     doc: /* Non-nil means rely on gtk_window_move to set frame positions.
 32126 If this variable is t (the default), the GTK build uses the function
 32127 gtk_window_move to set or store frame positions and disables some time
 32128 consuming frame position adjustments.  In newer versions of GTK, Emacs
 32129 always uses gtk_window_move and ignores the value of this variable.  */);
 32130   x_gtk_use_window_move = true;
 32131 
 32132   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-scroll-event-delta-factor", Vx_scroll_event_delta_factor,
 32133                doc: /* A scale to apply to pixel deltas reported in scroll events.
 32134 This option is only effective when Emacs is built with XInput 2
 32135 support. */);
 32136   Vx_scroll_event_delta_factor = make_float (1.0);
 32137 
 32138   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-gtk-use-native-input", x_gtk_use_native_input,
 32139                doc: /* Non-nil means to use GTK for input method support.
 32140 This provides better support for some modern input methods, and is
 32141 only effective when Emacs is built with GTK.  */);
 32142   x_gtk_use_native_input = false;
 32143 
 32144   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-set-frame-visibility-more-laxly",
 32145                x_set_frame_visibility_more_laxly,
 32146     doc: /* Non-nil means set frame visibility more laxly.
 32147 If this is nil, Emacs is more strict when marking a frame as visible.
 32148 Since this may cause problems on some window managers, this variable can
 32149 be also set as follows: The value `focus-in' means to mark a frame as
 32150 visible also when a FocusIn event is received for it on GTK builds.  The
 32151 value `expose' means to mark a frame as visible also when an Expose
 32152 event is received for it on any X build.  The value `t' means to mark a
 32153 frame as visible in either of these two cases.
 32154 
 32155 Note that any non-nil setting may cause invisible frames get erroneously
 32156 reported as iconified.  */);
 32157   x_set_frame_visibility_more_laxly = Qnil;
 32158 
 32159   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-input-grab-touch-events", x_input_grab_touch_events,
 32160                doc: /* Non-nil means to actively grab touch events.
 32161 This means touch sequences that started on an Emacs frame will
 32162 reliably continue to receive updates even if the finger moves off the
 32163 frame, but may cause crashes with some window managers and/or external
 32164 programs.  */);
 32165   x_input_grab_touch_events = true;
 32166 
 32167   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-dnd-fix-motif-leave", x_dnd_fix_motif_leave,
 32168                doc: /* Work around Motif bug during drag-and-drop.
 32169 When non-nil, Emacs will send a motion event containing impossible
 32170 coordinates to a Motif drop receiver when the mouse moves outside it
 32171 during a drag-and-drop session, to work around broken implementations
 32172 of Motif.  */);
 32173   x_dnd_fix_motif_leave = true;
 32174 
 32175   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-dnd-disable-motif-drag", x_dnd_disable_motif_drag,
 32176                doc: /* Disable the Motif drag protocol during DND.
 32177 This reduces network usage, but also means you can no longer scroll
 32178 around inside the Motif window underneath the cursor during
 32179 drag-and-drop.  */);
 32180   x_dnd_disable_motif_drag = false;
 32181 
 32182   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-dnd-movement-function", Vx_dnd_movement_function,
 32183     doc: /* Function called upon mouse movement on a frame during drag-and-drop.
 32184 It should either be nil, or accept two arguments FRAME and POSITION,
 32185 where FRAME is the frame the mouse is on top of, and POSITION is a
 32186 mouse position list.  */);
 32187   Vx_dnd_movement_function = Qnil;
 32188 
 32189   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-dnd-wheel-function", Vx_dnd_wheel_function,
 32190     doc: /* Function called upon wheel movement on a frame during drag-and-drop.
 32191 It should either be nil, or accept four arguments POSITION, BUTTON,
 32192 STATE and TIME, where POSITION is a mouse position list describing
 32193 where the wheel moved, BUTTON is the wheel button that was pressed,
 32194 STATE is the X modifier state at the time of the wheel movement, and
 32195 TIME is the X server time at which the wheel moved.  */);
 32196   Vx_dnd_wheel_function = Qnil;
 32197 
 32198   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-dnd-unsupported-drop-function", Vx_dnd_unsupported_drop_function,
 32199     doc: /* Function called when trying to drop on an unsupported window.
 32200 This function is called whenever the user tries to drop something on a
 32201 window that does not support either the XDND or Motif protocols for
 32202 drag-and-drop.  It should return a non-nil value if the drop was
 32203 handled by the function, and nil if it was not.  It should accept
 32204 several arguments TARGETS, X, Y, ACTION, WINDOW-ID, FRAME, TIME and
 32205 LOCAL-SELECTION, where TARGETS is the list of targets that was passed
 32206 to `x-begin-drag', WINDOW-ID is the numeric XID of the window that is
 32207 being dropped on, X and Y are the root window-relative coordinates
 32208 where the drop happened, ACTION is the action that was passed to
 32209 `x-begin-drag', FRAME is the frame which initiated the drag-and-drop
 32210 operation, TIME is the X server time when the drop happened, and
 32211 LOCAL-SELECTION is the contents of the `XdndSelection' when
 32212 `x-begin-drag' was run; its contents can be retrieved by calling the
 32213 function `x-get-local-selection'.
 32214 
 32215 If a symbol is returned, then it will be used as the return value of
 32216 `x-begin-drag'.  */);
 32217   Vx_dnd_unsupported_drop_function = Qnil;
 32218 
 32219   DEFVAR_INT ("x-color-cache-bucket-size", x_color_cache_bucket_size,
 32220     doc: /* Max number of buckets allowed per display in the internal color cache.
 32221 Values less than 1 mean 128.  This option is for debugging only.  */);
 32222   x_color_cache_bucket_size = 128;
 32223 
 32224   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-dnd-targets-list", Vx_dnd_targets_list,
 32225     doc: /* List of drag-and-drop targets.
 32226 This variable contains the list of drag-and-drop selection targets
 32227 during a drag-and-drop operation, in the same format as the TARGET
 32228 argument to `x-begin-drag'.  */);
 32229   Vx_dnd_targets_list = Qnil;
 32230 
 32231   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-dnd-native-test-function", Vx_dnd_native_test_function,
 32232     doc: /* Function that determines return value of drag-and-drop on Emacs frames.
 32233 If the value is a function, `x-begin-drag' will call it with two
 32234 arguments, POS and ACTION, where POS is a mouse position list
 32235 that specifies the location of the drop, and ACTION is the
 32236 action specified by the caller of `x-begin-drag'.  The function
 32237 should return a symbol describing what to return from
 32238 `x-begin-drag' if the drop happens on an Emacs frame.
 32239 
 32240 If the value is nil, or the function returns a value that is not
 32241 a symbol, a drop on an Emacs frame will be canceled.  */);
 32242   Vx_dnd_native_test_function = Qnil;
 32243 
 32244   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-dnd-preserve-selection-data", x_dnd_preserve_selection_data,
 32245     doc: /* Preserve selection data after `x-begin-drag' returns.
 32246 This lets you inspect the contents of `XdndSelection' after a
 32247 drag-and-drop operation, which is useful when writing tests for
 32248 drag-and-drop code.  */);
 32249   x_dnd_preserve_selection_data = false;
 32250 
 32251   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-dnd-disable-motif-protocol", x_dnd_disable_motif_protocol,
 32252     doc: /* Disable the Motif drag-and-drop protocols.
 32253 When non-nil, `x-begin-drag' will not drop onto any window that only
 32254 supports the Motif drag-and-drop protocols.  */);
 32255   x_dnd_disable_motif_protocol = false;
 32256 
 32257   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-dnd-use-unsupported-drop", x_dnd_use_unsupported_drop,
 32258     doc: /* Enable the emulation of drag-and-drop based on the primary selection.
 32259 When nil, do not use the primary selection and synthetic mouse clicks
 32260 to emulate the drag-and-drop of `STRING', `UTF8_STRING',
 32261 `COMPOUND_TEXT' or `TEXT'.  */);
 32262   x_dnd_use_unsupported_drop = true;
 32263 
 32264   DEFVAR_BOOL ("x-fast-protocol-requests", x_fast_protocol_requests,
 32265     doc: /* Whether or not X protocol-related functions should wait for errors.
 32266 When this is nil, functions such as `x-delete-window-property',
 32267 `x-change-window-property' and `x-send-client-message' will wait for a
 32268 reply from the X server, and signal any errors that occurred while
 32269 executing the protocol request.  Otherwise, errors will be silently
 32270 ignored without waiting, which is generally faster.  */);
 32271   x_fast_protocol_requests = false;
 32272 
 32273   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-auto-preserve-selections", Vx_auto_preserve_selections,
 32274     doc: /* Whether or not to transfer selection ownership when deleting a frame.
 32275 When non-nil, deleting a frame that is currently the owner of a
 32276 selection will cause its ownership to be transferred to another frame
 32277 on the same display.
 32278 
 32279 In addition, when this variable is a list, only preserve the
 32280 selections whose names are contained within.  */);
 32281   Vx_auto_preserve_selections = list2 (QCLIPBOARD, QPRIMARY);
 32282 
 32283   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-input-coding-system", Vx_input_coding_system,
 32284     doc: /* Coding system used for input from X input methods.
 32285 If a symbol and non-nil, this is the coding system that will be used
 32286 to decode input from X input methods.  It does not affect input from
 32287 GTK native input methods enabled through `x-gtk-use-native-input'.  */);
 32288   Vx_input_coding_system = Qnil;
 32289 
 32290   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-input-coding-function", Vx_input_coding_function,
 32291     doc: /* Function used to determine the coding system used by input methods.
 32292 It should accept a single argument, a string describing the locale of
 32293 the input method, and return a coding system that can decode keyboard
 32294 input generated by said input method.  */);
 32295   Vx_input_coding_function = Qnil;
 32296 
 32297   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-fast-selection-list", Vx_fast_selection_list,
 32298     doc: /* List of selections for which `x-selection-exists-p' should be fast.
 32299 
 32300 List of selection names as atoms that will be monitored by Emacs for
 32301 ownership changes when the X server supports the XFIXES extension.
 32302 The result of the monitoring is then used by `x-selection-exists-p' to
 32303 avoid a server round trip, which is important as it is called while
 32304 updating the tool bar.  The value of this variable is only read upon
 32305 connection setup.  */);
 32306   /* The default value of this variable is chosen so that updating the
 32307      tool bar does not require a call to _XReply.  */
 32308   Vx_fast_selection_list = list1 (QCLIPBOARD);
 32309 
 32310   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-allow-focus-stealing", Vx_allow_focus_stealing,
 32311     doc: /* How to bypass window manager focus stealing prevention.
 32312 
 32313 Some window managers prevent `x-focus-frame' from activating the given
 32314 frame when Emacs is in the background, which is especially prone to
 32315 cause problems when the Emacs server wants to activate itself.
 32316 
 32317 In addition, when an old-fashioned (pre-EWMH) window manager is being
 32318 run and `x-no-window-manager' is nil, the X server will not let Emacs
 32319 focus itself if another program was focused after the last time Emacs
 32320 obtained the input focus.
 32321 
 32322 This variable specifies the strategy used to activate frames when that
 32323 is the case, and has several valid values (any other value means to
 32324 not bypass window manager focus stealing prevention):
 32325 
 32326   - The symbol `imitate-pager', which means to pretend that Emacs is a
 32327     pager.
 32328 
 32329   - The symbol `newer-time', which means to fetch the current time
 32330     from the X server and use it to activate the frame.
 32331 
 32332   - The symbol `raise-and-focus', which means to raise the window and
 32333     focus it manually.  */);
 32334   Vx_allow_focus_stealing = Qnewer_time;
 32335 
 32336   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-use-fast-mouse-position", Vx_use_fast_mouse_position,
 32337     doc: /* How to make `mouse-position' faster.
 32338 
 32339 `mouse-position' and `mouse-pixel-position' default to querying the X
 32340 server for the window under the mouse pointer.  This results in
 32341 accurate results, but is also very slow when the X connection has
 32342 moderate to high latency.  Setting this variable to a non-nil value
 32343 makes Emacs query only for the position of the pointer, which is
 32344 usually faster.  Doing so improves the performance of dragging to
 32345 select text over slow X connections.
 32346 
 32347 If that is still too slow, setting this variable to the symbol
 32348 `really-fast' will make Emacs return only cached values.  */);
 32349   Vx_use_fast_mouse_position = Qnil;
 32350 
 32351   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-detect-server-trust", Vx_detect_server_trust,
 32352     doc: /* If non-nil, Emacs should detect whether or not it is trusted by X.
 32353 
 32354 If non-nil, Emacs will make an X request at connection startup that is
 32355 prohibited to untrusted clients under the X Security Extension and
 32356 check whether or not a resulting Access error is generated by the X
 32357 server.  If the X server reports the error, Emacs will disable certain
 32358 features that do not work for untrusted clients.  */);
 32359   Vx_detect_server_trust = Qnil;
 32360 
 32361   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-lax-frame-positioning", Vx_lax_frame_positioning,
 32362     doc: /* If non-nil, Emacs won't compensate for WM geometry behavior.
 32363 
 32364 Setting this to non-nil is useful when the compensation proves to be
 32365 too slow, which is usually true when the X server is located over a
 32366 network connection with high latency.  Doing so will make frame
 32367 creation and placement faster at the cost of reducing the accuracy of
 32368 frame placement via frame parameters, `set-frame-position', and
 32369 `set-frame-size', along with the actual state of a frame after
 32370 `x_make_frame_invisible'.  */);
 32371   Vx_lax_frame_positioning = Qnil;
 32372 
 32373   DEFVAR_LISP ("x-quit-keysym", Vx_quit_keysym,
 32374     doc: /* Keysyms which will cause Emacs to quit if rapidly pressed twice.
 32375 
 32376 This is used to support quitting on devices that do not have any kind
 32377 of physical keyboard, or where the physical keyboard is incapable of
 32378 entering `C-g'.  It defaults to `XF86XK_AudioLowerVolume' on XFree86
 32379 and X.Org servers, and is unset.
 32380 
 32381 The value is an alist associating between strings, describing X server
 32382 vendor names, and a single number describing the keysym to use.  The
 32383 keysym to use for each display connection is determined upon
 32384 connection setup, and does not reflect further changes to this
 32385 variable.  */);
 32386   Vx_quit_keysym
 32387     = list2 (Fcons (build_string ("The X.Org Foundation"),
 32388                     make_int (269025041)),
 32389              Fcons (build_string ("The XFree86 Project, Inc."),
 32390                     make_int (269025041)));
 32391 }
/* [<][>][^][v][top][bottom][index][help] */
